name: Oliver
about: Hi!! I'm Oliver. My wife and I are both teachers. I teach piano and my wife teaches Spanish. We enjoy traveling in the summer as my family is from Germany and hers is from Costa Rica. We love staying in unique properties. We are looking forward to sharing our experiences from our travels and offering a welcoming vacation rental. We look forward to hosting you!!

name: Stephanie
about: Great space! I am reliable and trustworthy.

name: Jonn
about: I'm laid back, relaxed. I like things clean and tidy but I'm not a neat freak. You'll find me singing and hosting karaoke, working with power tools in my garage, or running and cycling in the great outdoors.

name: Shannon
about:
I'm a Sinologist and Five Element Acupuncturist in private practice in Portland Oregon, and am married to Brian, who does consulting for local coffee and beer companies. We have a gorgeous son, Kieran, born in October of 2011. We are avid travelers, and love to meet new people. 

Brian is a coffee snob, and loves cooking and wine tasting.  Kieran is obsessed with trains and enjoys music, books, swimming, and eating.

My favorite travel destination is China, and Thailand is a close second. Brian prefers Bali, and would love to eat his way through Italy and France.

name: Jackie
about: Lover of food, swimming, Pilates, travel, and wine!

name: Richard
about:
I am self employed and run my own business.  I love to bike.  I love yoga, though I don't practice as often as I would like.

I'm pretty much an open book.  You can see various aspects of my life on the following websites.

(URL HIDDEN)  - my web hosting and design business
(URL HIDDEN) - where I sometimes write stuff
(URL HIDDEN) - where I sometimes write about my biking adventures

name: Erin
about: Graphic Designer

name: Deborah & Ludger
about:
We love the urban life, and we adore the Northwest's natural beauty. We love to hike, kayak, get to the coast and garden.

Ludger's an engineer, computer consultant and craftsman who makes old houses work better (and can fix just about anything!), and Deborah's a writer, poet and taught college English for a long time. We both work from home but love travel. We met on the way to Khajuraho, India (where you'll find the largest group of Medieval Hindu and Jain temples--famous for their erotic sculptures!) The bus broke down, and there we  sat--two travelers dazed as the locals and their chickens and bags of rice departed.

We enjoy sharing our northeast Portland home, and respect your privacy. With a private entrance to come and go as you please, you can simply enjoy your time alone, or join us on the front porch. We are happy to tell you about our favorite haunts and hikes, answer any questions, or leave you to your romantic getaway. When our garden thrives, we'll share some produce.

name: Bradley
about: My name is Brad! I am young professional living in the pearl that just wants to make additional income off my spare bedroom that I hardly ever use! I can give you great recommendations while you visit or If you'd like, I can leave you all to yourself. I will do anything to help make your stay more enjoyable. Let me know if you would like anything in particular stocked in the fridge or pantry. I am Wisconsin born, California raised and Pennsylvania educated.

name: Craig
about:
Hi. I am a professional, hardworking, person who is full of life. I always see the glass as half full. I've resided in this home for 25 years and grew up in this glorious neighborhood. I have many friends and family who live nearby. I have a natural ability to be a great host and find it easy to help make others lives more pleasant. I hope you and your friends/family enjoy your stay. You can always call me if you have any questions at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).
Thank you,
Craig

name: Foad
about: I've been living in Portland for over 7 years now. After living in Bay Area and the east coast we found ourselves here and think of it as home now. I work as a web developer for a tech company. I am a foodie and have been enjoying all the food and drinks that Portland has to offer.

name: Robert
about: Portland, Or. We tend to plan trips around surfing and skiing.

name: Aaron And Taya
about:
We are a couple of Portlanders who love the Pacific Northwest.  We love to travel, camp, garden, and cook or just hang out at home with our dog, cats, and chickens.  We own the jewelry companies Tasi Designs and Stowaway Shop.  Thanks for checking out our place!
-- Aaron and Taya

name: Holly
about: My life motto is to inspire creativity, healing and a conscious connection to nature. I moved to Portland from the Philadelphia area in 2004. I love animals, plants, traveling, collecting rocks, making ceramics, and spa days. Oh, and I love to laugh.

name: Janet
about: From Portland, Ore.

name: Shalei
about: My job in the skies keeps me away from my adorable and cozy apartment half the month, so glad I can share the space while I am away!

name: Amber&Justin
about:
Amber Jane and Justin believe that life should be filled with fun, good food, art and a bit of adventure. They find pleasure in their community, family and friend's as well as working in the garden, canning, cooking and eating. Fueled by a love of creating arts and crafts, they also enjoy improving their property. When they are not at home making things, Amber Jane and Justin love exploring the outdoors, as well as the happenings in and around Portland, where they have been residents since 1996. They have watched in wonder as their city has grown and blossomed into a dynamic destination filled with hidden treasures, always offering new and unique surprises to discover.

Together, Amber Jane and Justin run Little hen & HARE, an urban micro-farm just five miles from downtown Portland. On their quarter acre property they tend an organic garden and small fruit orchard which stretches to meet the edge of a chicken run where 5 to 10 chickens cluck about. They also raise Flemish Giant and New Zealand Red rabbits, all while chasing after their pre-schooler and running two successful businesses. 

Justin is an old-school sign guy who does hand lettering, gilding, carved signs, and wall jobs. Ever heard of a "Wall Dog", well come meet one. His business, Riede Signs, is in the shop out back. Amber Jane has been a designer for her own women's clothing line, Dress Up Alice, since 2005. Now she is a wellness coach and essential oil educator using doTerra Essential Oils. She has been trained in the Aromatouch Technique. Ask her more or schedule a FREE treatment. Monthly classes are always happening, guest are welcome (ask for schedule). They have an adorable daughter born at home, early in the morning in July 2011. 

Amber Jane and Justin love to travel and have used Airbnb on almost every trip since 2011. They had heard about Airbnb, the experience, meeting new people, seeing into the lives of neighborhoods far and wide. They have found fast friends, unique houses, beautiful decor, perfect locations and great prices. A Home away from Home. This is the experience they have had and now they hope to give the same experience to you.


Enjoy the journey, relish in the destination!

name: Missy
about: I am a native Portlander but lived in France for a bit. I was on a student's budget, so I spent my free time lounging in parks, people watching, eating and getting lost on purpose. This is still my favorite way to travel. I love living in a small vintage apartment in the city. It's so nice being close to everything, but coming home to a tranquil, beautiful space.

name: Vicki
about:
Motto: "Keep Portland Weird," which for me means eclectic, creative and not too conventional.
Favorite cities: Portland, OR, San Francisco,CA; Florence, Italy; Paris, France
Hobbies: gardening, art, writing, reading
Movies: foreign, drama, documentaries
Musicians: Bob Dylan, Leonard Cohen, Judy Collins, Mississippi John Hurt, The Beatles

My partner Woody also lives here. He's a retired chiropractor who now works part time at Home Depot.

name: Emma
about: I have previously worked in property management and have managed another home in Portland

name: Peggi &  Donovan
about: Hi, we are Peggi and Donovan! Peggi is a wardrobe/prop and personal stylist and I work in photo production and love to build stuff. I've done a lot of the work on our beautiful home myself and so take great pride in sharing it with fellow AirBnb travelers. We love to travel ourselves and frequently find ourselves away from home - which is good for you!!! We have tried very hard to think of every little detail to make your stay in Portland absolutely perfect. We've decorated our home with unique artwork and cool touches found on our never ending treasure hunts. We hope you'll love it as much as we do.

name: Van
about: Originally from Mississippi!

name: Julie
about: I love to fly, in dreams and real life.  My favorite objects are clouds.

name: Ken And Spyder
about:
We are Ken and Spyder.  Ken originally from Chicago and Spyder from Milwaukee, WI. We have been Air BnB hosts for over 3 years, but in a home in SW Portland.  We purchased and moved into this sweet 1909 "Four-Square" in July 2014, and are still putting on a few finishing touches. We hope our home reflects our shared warm and whimsical personalities! It is something of a celebration center with lots of dinners, dance lessons, classes, parties and seminars held here.

About Ken: I love Portland.   Our quirky people, our food, the natural environment and the grace with which people easily evolve acquaintances into friendships.

I've traveled widely and speak French, decent German, survival Spanish and the international language of cooking.      If I had a month to go anywhere I'd probably choose Italy for its food and mellow character.     I've lived in Cameroon West Africa while in the Peace Corps, worked and lived in St. Louis and went to graduate school in upstate New York at Cornell. 

My career is in the finance industry and I have a very mainstream background but socially and politically am usually on the liberal side of most social issues.

My passion is the outdoors where I spend a lot of time hiking, camping and cross-country skiing.

I am also passionate about creating and participating in community.   Our home is regularly hosting an event of some sort and guests are always welcome to participate.   Examples have included salsa dancing, champagne tasting, pizza making, movie nights, meditation circles, workshops and seminars.       Since I'm not a musician or artist in any traditional sense, I contribute the art of being the host and see it as a sacred goal to bring people together in grace and comfort.

I'm a regular at ecstatic dance in Portland where on any night of the week you can find a fun, free-form dance to attend.  Am a fan of Burning Man too having attended a few times.

Favorite places in Oregon include Breitenbush Hot Springs, Alvord Dessert, Wallowa Mountains, water falls, our coastline, Sunriver, the Columbia River Gorge and most places where big trees grow.

About Spyder:  I’ve been living in Portland for 7 years, and love the fact that I can enjoy winter snow sports on the mountain, then leave it all behind, come home and hop on my bike to get around (you can't do that in Wisconsin in the winter)!  I love more than anything to be in nature and Oregon lends itself to that in extraordinary ways, from mountains to ocean to desert, rainforests, hot springs, and more. 

My next big adventure is to go scuba diving in a beautiful reef somewhere in this hemisphere.  

I'm the mother of an aerialist/stilt walking circus performer!

All aspects of health and wellness is my passion.  I am a Shiatsu practitioner and transformational coach (feel free to ask me what that is!) Eating well has been a focus since early adulthood and enjoy cooking, gardening and going to the farmer’s market.  I also enjoy making herbal tinctures, tea blends, healing salves and rich body butters.

Boredom is not in my vocabulary.  I'm a bike commuter, rock climber, backpacker, x-country skier, snowboarder, dancer. I love being creative, and making music.  Ken and I met through ecstatic dance here in Portland, and it is a beautiful, heartfelt community.  

Sure, we do this to make a few extra bucks but more importantly, we do it  for the chance to meet new people and to help them find the beauty of the Portland area that we love.   Our style is very low-tech and hands-off.   If you like to chill out on your own, please feel at home doing that.   If you'd like to share a cup of coffee or a glass of wine  - so much the better.

We look forward to meeting you in our home.

name: Justin
about: New Portland resident, via Seattle, Brooklyn, San Francisco.  Designer, carpenter . . . into old houses, biking, swimming and hiking!

name: Erin
about: Happy citizen of beautiful Portland, OR!

name: Carrie
about:
I moved to Portland in 2001, wanting to explore the Pacific NW, & haven't looked back since.  Portland truly has all there is to offer, an incredible outdoor scene as well as one of the best restaurant & bar scenes in the country.  I love hosting friends & family, and give them a glimpse into what it is like to live in Portland.
I've worked in the hospitality industry my entire life & couldn't have picked a better city to land.  I own a small neighborhood cocktail lounge in SE & love making people feel comfortable & happy.  When I travel, I like to feel the same.  My goal with hosting is to make sure you have everything you need while you're enjoying this fabulous town.  I try to make my house comfortable so you can fully relax when you're back after a long day of taking in the sights.
Cheers!

name: Erik
about: Cool dude

name: Taylor
about:
Hi, 

My name is Taylor.  I love being active, traveling, as well as cooking!

name: Eric & Andrea
about: I am a computer nerd originally from out east and now living in Portland, OR.  My wife is a massage therapist originally from Washington. We are both in our mid 30s and very respectful.

name: Vincent
about: My dad was in the US Army so I grew up in place like Germany and the Netherlands. I enjoy gold, bowling and long walks in the beach. I love helping people and enjoy traveling.

name: Scott
about:
I like to think of myself as easy-going, go with the flow kind of guy. 

I am Presentation/Info-graphic Artist (yep that my title), I don't mind explaining what it is what I do, if you ask. Basically I tell stories from illustrating them and using photos. It's pretty cool. 

I can't live without my independents, being creative, going outside, living by lake (or some type of water), friendly people.

I like Airbnb, because you at staying in neighborhoods and you can feel what it is like if you lived there. Can't really do that in a hotel.

name: Steven
about: Originally from upstate New York, I moved to Portland to get involved in the local culinary scene. I've traveled extensively and plan to continue over the next few years. I'm always willing to extend a hand to a weary traveler because too many times it has been my outstretched hand. I am a happy person and it's never a struggle.

name: Brooke
about: I am a modern domestic gal, that loves to cook, garden and entertain.  I enjoy spending time with my husband Luke, our 3 year old and newborn sons and our Bernese Mountain Dog, Olive.  We love Portland and all the wonderful things it has to offer.  We are avid Timbers and Trailblazers fans and will find any reason to host a party.

name: Malia
about:
Life long Oregonian married to a boy from California.  We have two sweet boys that keep us very busy.
We love to be outdoors camping in the summer and skiing in the winter.  And of course filling our passports on adventures.

name: Michelle
about:
5 things I can't live without:
1) good food
2) music
3) scrabble
4) my cat
5) my running shoes

name: Ilana
about:
I've lived in the Pacific Northwest all my life, with about 9 years in Vancouver Washington.  I've been blessed to travel to France, London, Greece, the Caribbean and several states in the US.  I love meeting and talking to people and hearing about their travel experiences.   I purchased my row home in 2008 and love living close to my family, downtown; and the energy of Alberta Arts, Mississippi Historic District and the Pearl.  

I enjoy cooking, but Rodney (my boyfriend) is the chef.  If you love food, you'll love this location, I'm surrounded by amazing restaurants, bistros, and food carts.  I'm self-employed so I work out of my home.  I don't smoke, and don't want smoking in my home.  

I enjoy an occasional glass of wine, good food and close friends.   I think you'll really enjoy your experience here in the city of Roses.

name: Tim
about:
Originally from Alaska, but have lived in Japan for 7 years, 5 years in the Los Angeles area, and 4 months in NW India. My wife is from Japan. She was raised in Miyagi, but lived in Tokyo for 17 Years.

Tons of traveling in-between all of that. Used to be involved in Japan trade after getting a MBA from a Japanese Grad school. I'm involved in commercial / advertising photography now. 

Cheers,
Tim

はじめましてティムです。7年間日本住んでことあります。私の日本語は完璧でわないですがコミュニケーション問題ないです。私の奥さんAchikoは宮城県に生まれ、17年間東京に住んでいました。ハピターン250%と無印良品が大好きです。(ハッピーターンパウダー中毒は2015年暮れに卒業。私はラーメン中毒です。)

私たちの家の近所面白いよ。地ビール工場二つありレストランいっぱい、お土産屋、バス停近い、4ドル映画館あります。

バス停から家まで全然安全です。女性一人大丈夫。前のゲストのレビューを読んで下さい。

【宿泊を検討されてる方へ】
予約リクエストをお送りいただいた際にプロフィール欄の記載がない、簡単な自己紹介がないゲストはお断りする場合があります。短くても結構なのでポートランドに来る理由や好きな事を書いてリクエストいただけると嬉しいです。

※フェイスブックのページもあります。是非見て私達についてもっと知ってください。「ポートランド日本語OKのAirbnb」

name: Isaac
about:
We love this little street we live on with mini gardens tucked here and there, various colors of 4 square, barn style and ranch houses from various areas, lots of families and kids and easy access to everything.

Per AirBnB request, here is our five things we can't live without:
our kids
our fresh fruits and veggies
our bikes
birds, bugs and trees
music and dance

As a host I am available to talk about the city, answer all kids of random questions about food, night life, hikes, etc...or...just as happy to give you all the space and privacy you like.  I know when I travel with loved ones sometimes I like to just escape into a world all our own!

When I travel, I have been using AirBnB and getting guest rooms when I am own my own for work.  Fun to join a household.  When I am with Sandra and/or the kids, a private studio or small house is more our style.

name: Jeffrey
about: The Boly family, Jeff (a retired tax and estate planning attorney), Linda (a Registered Nurse, who works at Portland area hospitals) and Michael (a high school freshman) and our manager Brandi Gray look forward to welcoming you as guests to the Boly House. We are confident that you will find our location, our interior and exterior site improvements, as well as our amenities to be pleasing and reasonably priced.

name: Martin
about:
Widower.  I am starting a new life after living with my late wife for 35 years.  

Grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change,
the courage to change the things I can,
and the wisdom to know the difference.

name: Chuck&Carole
about: we are not too serious, take the world for what it is. semi well traveled. we are english speaking visitors to this planet.

name: Kassie
about: We love the city of Portland and love living here! Airbnb is something I just discovered this year and love hosting people...this is a great way to do it! We are a family of four and spend a lot of time running here and there.

name: Stuart
about: I grew up in England, then lived in the French Alps for 5 winters, worked in the Adirondacks for 12 summers and finally moved to Portland in 2007 and fell in love with this city. I'm rarely home, between weekly surf trips to the Oregon coast, trips to the mountain, teaching Health and PE at a local middle school and running with the best golden retriever in the world, Tobie dogg. My family are still back in England, including my twin sister.

name: Gabriele
about: Hi! My name is Gabriele. I'm quiet, clean, and laid back. I like hiking, camping, and visiting museums. I love to read and wander around new cities.

name: Kathleen
about: I am a Portland-based ecologist and social scientist. My husband Peter and I love meeting new people and traveling, cooking, gardening, hiking, etc. We are new hosts to Airbnb and we look forward to having you next door! We will hope to cross paths with you and share a glass of wine or coffee but we are also happy to give you privacy if that is what you are looking for. We hope you love your stay in Portland.

name: Laura
about: I'm a musician, barista, future nutritionist, and current pinball enthusiast living in Portland Oregon.

name: Matt
about:
I'm a Firefighter in Portland, Oregon. I love living in the city, it really makes the work a little more personal. I'm a big reader and self-taught woodworker, welder, website sculptor and house-fixer. 
Our family travels a lot throughout the year, either to classes and conferences, or camping. We love camping in our 1974 Aristocrat camper, either out near Bend or at the Coast. 
We love Airbnb because it lets us stay in a new city and live with the locals. I always like to spend a few days just acclimating to a new area, finding the grocery stores, coffee shops and gyms. My wife is a little more adventurous and like to see as much as possible (just like at home), so we tend to balance each other out.

name: Rachelle
about:
Hi there! 
My boyfriend Jon and I have both hosted and been the travellers through AirBnb and look forward to hosting you at our sweet little house in Portland. 
We're available via text to answer questions and help however we can.

name: George
about:
I love Northwest Portland!  I bought this home because I couldn't bear to leave my beloved neighborhood with everything imaginable within walking distance.  Now I am thrilled to have the opportunity to share it with family and friends, like you!

After living in San Francisco, New York and Chicago, I found that NW 23rd Ave had not only the amenities of Union St in SF or Armitage Ave in Chicago, but also the small-town feel and quirkiness that is uniquely Portland.  I've lived in the same 3-block radius since 2010 and plan to be here for decades to come.

I am happy to give you recommendations on everything from city hikes and dining, to day trips to the beach, Mt Hood or wine country.  If you're traveling with kiddos in tow, I have all the gadgets and gismos to make you feel right at home.  And if you prefer your space, I'm happy to leave you to explore on your own.  

Make your stay what you want it be in the best location (and cleanest apartment) in Portland!

name: Katie
about:
We're an easy going couple and both work jobs that allow us a pretty flexible schedule so we get to be around the house a lot working on home upgrades and yard improvements. We love meeting people. We couldn't live without our dog, Honey, music, good food, coffee, or wine. 

We love traveling and have had great Airbnb experiences abroad!

name: Janet
about:
I'm a 42 year old Theater/Film/TV Costumer, and not long ago, came home to Portland after touring for 6.5 years with the musical Wicked as one of the Assistant Wardrobe Supervisors. Currently, I am freelancing on a number of projects at any given time here in Portland. 

In my spare time, I love exploring our great Pacific NW, hiking, reading, movies, my pets, and animals in general.

name: Steven
about: Originally from the East Coast, we have been in Oregon for 35 years, Portland for over ten of those. We enjoy Portland's cultural and culinary attractions, as well as hiking in the Northwest, especially with our dog, and traveling. We are happy to serve as hosts that welcome you and bid you farewell, or, because we like meeting people, to assist or guide you during your stay.

name: Sarah
about: My family loves to explore new places using Airbnb.  A home away from home when traveling with kiddos is essential.

name: Lurelle
about:
Hi! My name is Lurelle, I have just returned from 24 days visiting Central America and staying at AIR BNB's.  I hope your stay here in Portland will be as enjoyable as our many hospitable places were.  I may be traveling some in which case you will chat and meet Linda.

I've lived here in Portland for 13 years. I love the culture, food, friendliness, and energy of the city.   I enjoy walking out my front door and in 20 minutes I can be in the forest or in the city center, at the Rose Gardens or sitting in a fine restaurant. It all depends on which way you turn out the front door.

When traveling, I like to visit the beautiful cities across the United States and around the world. I enjoy the livable and walkable neighborhoods, eating in nice restaurants, exploring  and buying chocolate.  My favorite trips include Mexico beaches, The Grand Tetons, a small town BBQ in Texas, Italy, Norway and many others .

My other interests include: walking, hiking, yoga, reading, cooking, and travel .  I have learned some Spanish on the beaches of Mexico and  working in the back of an ambulance along the Mexico/California border.

name: Liz And Jonas
about:
We are both originally from the northeast (Vermont and NYC), but have lived in Portland over a decade now and love our city! Portland has the feel of a small town, but with all the perks of a big city. We adore the quirkiness of this city and its locavore culture. It is also a great place to raise kids. 

Professionally, we are a doctor and a lawyer who work in public health and social justice fields. In our spare time we love to explore all that Portland and the Pacific Northwest have to offer. You might find us biking to local food carts, stand up paddle boarding on the Willamette, or hiking in the Columbia Gorge.  We also love to travel and take opportunities to do so whenever we can. 

We are serious foodies and enjoy most everything food related. From exploring farmer’s markets, to doing our own gardening; from berry picking to visiting orchards on Mt. Hood; from canning to pickling; from preparing elaborate meals to dining at the city’s best restaurants—Portland is known for its fabulous food and we can point you in the right direction.

name: David
about:
We are a young...ish couple who work in the wine industry here in Oregon.  We love to eat and drink our way across the globe while traveling for work and pleasure.  When not out traveling we can usually be found hiking in Forest Park or at the local dive bar eating a huge plate of tater tots.  

After using airbnb everywhere from Africa to Thailand we have decided to also open up our home for others while we are gone.

name: Jonathan
about: Hi this is Jon. I've lived in Portland OR for 15 years and in my neighborhood for 8. I'm married and have two young boys.

name: Eliza
about:
I moved to Portland in 2010 with my husband after spending the previous few years in the Mariana Island researching tropical forest ecology. I really enjoy all that the Pacific NW has to offer. I love to hike, stand up paddle, backpack, bike, snowshoe, seek out hot springs, spend time on the many rivers and at the beaches, and to hop from pub to eatery to music venue around my North Portland neighborhood. 

We live in the basement unit of our home, allowing us to rent the main house out to renters who like to travel as much as we do. Our start up business allows us to stay in AirBnbs around the world, from Boston, to Hong Kong, to The Philippines where our main office located.

name: Susannah
about: Hi! I'm glad you are thinking of staying in inner SE Portland during your visit. Our cozy garden suite will meet all your needs and have you ready to go in the center of Portland. I'm Susannah, I manage the apartment and live just upstairs with my partner, Mike and our dog, Tally, and two cats. We moved here 4 years ago because we wanted a walking lifestyle and to be in a place filled with progressive minds and creative small businesses. We live in our dream location and we look forward to sharing it with you. Though we still love travelling the world (mainly the Spanish speaking world) and get out as much as our busy schedules allow. I'm a massage therapist and Mike is a Software Engineer who has a short commute downtown. When I'm not working or managing the garden suite I'm either hiking with Tally, getting time in the sculpture or painting studio, or exploring the neighborhood with Mike. I'll personally make sure your Portland home away from home is ready for you, fresh and sparkling. I look forward to meeting you and getting you all settled in. Take care ~Susannah

name: Camille
about: I grew up in the bay area, but I've been living in Portland  over 40 years and it's been a great place to raise my kids.   I love hiking  and dancing.  I love passing my time by  doing art and craft projects.  I have 5 wonderful kids and 13 lovely grandchildren.  I  enjoy traveling so I can keep up with them all.  I work as an acupuncturist in private practice and in a chronic disease clinic.

name: Paul
about:
I look forward to helping people discover the best of Portland. 

President of literacy curriculum and education improvement company that uses award winning children's literature to teach reading.

name: Angel & Vikrant
about:
We have been living in Portland since 2007. We took our last big trip in 2012 to see if we want to settle down anywhere else. We returned to Portland after one year of adventures, which took us through 12 countries; we visited Vik's family in India and Angel’s family in Brazil. On this trip, we connected with friends in UK, Finland, Paris and Dubai; we volunteered in Tanzania; we climbed Kilimanjaro and danced in Rio’s Carnival! And at the end of these beautiful and exhausting days, we still missed Portland. We missed our friends and the lovely fiercely creative and compassionate energy of this city. So, we came back.

Now, with two year old baby Leo, our travelling has slowed down. We use AirBnB as an opportunity to meet people from all around the world. Share travel stories and laughter!

We are decent cooks, better hosts and voracious eaters! We fill the house with delicious smells, laughs, and satisfied bellies.

Hafiz has eloquently summarized what we try to be,

Plant
So that your own heart
Will grow.

Love
So God will think,

"Ahhhhhh,
I got kin in that body!
I should start inviting that soul over
For coffee and
Rolls."

Sing
Because this is a food
Our starving world
Needs.

Laugh
Because that is the purest
Sound.

name: Peter & Alea
about: Alea is a florist, and owns two plant shops in Portland. Peter is a Barista. We both love the outdoors, traveling and spending time with old friends and new! You can often find us outside working in our garden, or catch us packing up the car for a day at the river. We have two adorable indoor cats, Dancer and Jude, who hate each other. We still love them anyway.

name: Mary
about: I work in supply chain management for a major sporting goods company in Portland, which keeps me very busy. When I'm not working or traveling for work, I like to hang out with my friends, go out to eat, hike and enjoy spending time hanging out in my backyard.

name: Martin
about: My name is Martin.  I was born in Oregon and I like all kinds of outdoor activities.  I hike, bike, surf, run, rock climb, ski, fish, raft, and camp.  I like working in my garden and on farms.  I live in Portland, Oregon with 5 other people, a cat and 5 chickens.

name: Michael
about:
Born and raised in Wisconsin, I came to Oregon for grad school in 2001 and quickly realized I'd be staying. I love the wealth of outdoor experiences available year-round, the friendliness, and the abundance of good food. In 2014, my wife and I settled into the South Tabor neighborhood with our two kids and dog. We love the relaxed, family vibe of this part of Portland. It's quiet but still close to everything. I enjoy running in Mt. Tabor Park, spending too much time at bakeries and restaurants on Division, and biking around town. 

I'm happy to offer as much or as little interaction with guests as they like.

name: Julie
about: I am an active mom interested in food, nutrition, and health. I am one of the founding members (2011) of the Woodstock Farmers Market, Portland Oregon. I have studied yoga and massage and have worked in a variety of industries. I am a creative cook and enthusiastic gardener.

name: Ildikó
about: Hi, I am a part-time student in computer science, and full time employed at Intel. I love to travel and talk about traveling experiences. I love sports and sunshine. Known by my friends to always answer Yes  to a question that starts with "do you want to go.... " (sometimes even before I know where). I value trust as a virtue above anything else.

name: Jessica
about: I'm a project manager for an independent restaurant group in Portland.  My fiancé Sean is a freelance designer and project manager. We both spend most of our time working, so it's always a nice break when we can get away and travel.  We love food, wine, Bar Method (just me, not Sean!), hot yoga, and our orange cat Jake.

name: Dana
about: Dana - Account Director in Advertising, living in Portland, Oregon. I love my house but travel a lot so wanted to make it available on Airbnb. I live right off of Alberta, the heart of the east side and next to all of the best restaurants and bars, plus a 1 block from a grocery store. A wonderful place to stay for either a couple or a set of 6 people looking to be in a prime location and in a comfortable, hip space for their vacation.

name: Page & Kris
about: We  love good food, beer and wine all of which Portland has plenty. We also enjoy the outdoors and the great activities Portland has to offer. Whether biking along the Columbia River, hiking in the Columbia River Gorge or visiting the Portland Art Museum there is never a shortage of things to do. We are excited to start hosting on Airbnb and want to make our guests' experiences as enjoyable as possible.

name: Brett
about: I'm a conservation photographer and marine biologist who travels extensively for work. So while I'm across the globe tracking down bull sharks you can stay in my place. Win win!

name: Donna
about: I'm from the Midwest, lived in Vermont for 25 years, and now settled on the West Coast (Seattle and now Portland). I am recently retired and looking forward to pursuing my artistic interests. Art is a major love and I enjoy visiting art galleries and museums.  I also love restaurants, movies, walking, reading, music, gardening and, of course, travel.  Portland is a friendly city and enjoyable on many levels - exploring Portland never gets boring!

name: Dosia
about: Outrageously Awesome

name: Kristen
about:
Our little family lives here in my hometown of Portland, where we now have the delightful adventure of exploring our town from the perspective of our newest member. 

I'm a host at heart, always have been and really enjoy providing a comfortable, inviting environment for my guests as well as meeting all the fantastic people traveling through town!

name: Tim And Antonia
about:
Hi,

We have lived in Portland for 8 years. We are both self employed and work from home. We love traveling, eating good food and hanging out with friends. We also enjoy Surfing, Snowboarding, and great furniture. 

Can't wait for you to enjoy our home!

name: John
about:
I grew up in Portland and feel fortunate to live in such a fantastic city and neighborhood, and I'm excited to share it with you.  I'm a very active person and I enjoy all the great activities Portland has to offer, including skiing, snowboarding, surfing, biking, running, you name it.  I would love to make recommendations about what to do during your stay here.  There are many things very close by. You won't be disappointed with the accommodations or the activities that are available to you.
  
I've traveled to France, Germany, and Japan, and truly appreciate the diverse cultures around the world. I feel humbled when I travel because of all the warm and kind people I meet.  I want your experience here in Portland to be great and I'll do what I can to help you enjoy your stay.

name: Amy
about: We love Portland and have been involved in the city’s planning and sustainability community for decades.  We have great suggestions for everything from yoga teachers to local beers if you’re interested.  With two middle school aged boys, we spend much of our time helping them with homework or chauffeuring them to little league or art classes. They’ll give you their take on Portland if you ask.

name: Nikki Kress
about:
Nikki grew up in Texas and claims Austin as her hometown; Gregg grew up in Michigan and claims Detroit as his. We met in Austin and fell in love while traveling together. We've been traveling together (and separately) all over the world and this country for most of our lives. After living together for 7 years in Oakland, CA, we decided to move to Portland, OR because it matched our lifestyle of community building, music loving, hiking, biking, tree loving, gardening and art making. Then we had twins. Having two babies at once sure is a great way to put the breaks on travel plans for a while!

I think it only natural that Gregg and I would eventually transform a large part of our home (where we remain happily held hostage for a period of time) into something that would continue to connect us to those that are in the midsts of their travels. 

We love living here and we love sharing our maps and guide books of the area. As well as portable cribs, highchairs, boardgames, and other supplies to loan you, we also have bicycles, camping gear and other equipment to rent out for a small price.

name: Paul
about: I am a small business owner with 4 children (3 little ones, 1 in high school).  I've lived in SW Portland for many years and love the area.

name: Penelope
about:
I am a professional organizer and co-active coach.   Our current home and abode has been featured in the home decor blog Apartment Therapy.  I love creating a magical and enchanted space for others to enjoy and refuel in..   
  I love leaving a list of our favorite spots here in Portland and enjoy being a host so you can enjoy visiting this sweet town as much as I do living here.

name: Craig
about:
I live in Portland Oregon with my Wife and two kiddos. We just bought our first little 2 bedroom home and love living here in Montivilla. 

We love walking to a local coffee shop on Saturday mornings, having friends over for backyard bbq's and fires and meeting new people in the neighborhood.

name: Joy
about:
Mother of two, homeowner, self-employed. Originally from Thailand, I have called Portland my home away from home for the past 16 years. I love the city and enjoy looking at it from my window everyday.

When I am not busy with work and kids, I treat myself with healthy food, good wine, and massage. I enjoy cooking gourmet meals for my family and friends, hiking/camping with my children on the weekend. I also exercise everyday to maintain good health, both physical and mental.

name: Jaime
about: I love the Pacific Northwest, Portland and the great outdoors!  I love family and friends, meeting new people, and being creative.  I also love trying new things.  Learning to play guitar and hosting Jaime's pdx hideout are a couple of my latest adventures. :)

name: Matt
about: An easy going Portland native and world explorer (somewhat), with a lifelong knowledge of the city and the best ways to get around in it. Happy to host you!

name: Colleen
about:
I enjoying working at my home: in the garden, the kitchen or on creative projects; traveling, yoga, dancing, eating out with friends and I love meeting people, which is why opening my home to travelers is such a great opportunity.

In my previous life, I taught nutrition and a culinary arts program in local high school, enjoyed being at "at home mom" raising 3 wonderful children (and now I have a beautiful grand daughter ;-) and subbed K-12 for 10 years.

These days I fill my hours with remodeling projects, teaching dance classes 2 nights a week, leading occasional workshops as a life coach, maintaining rental spaces, and dreaming of my next trip. Mostly I ENJOY life as I count my blessings.

My life motto for the last 10 years has been: 
"I live my life with grace, elegance and ease, gratitude and awe and with eyes to see the Providential serendipities."  It's been a pretty fun way to live life.

On my morning walk today, I was thinking that maybe I should create a new motto for the next 10 years. When I do, I'll let you know.

name: Alex & Ida
about: We are a young couple in inner NE Portland. Alex is an urban planner and Ida is a graduate student of French Literature at Portland State University. We have been airbnb hosts for 2 years now and we love providing a warm and beautiful space for guests who want to explore and enjoy Portland. We love the city and the great outdoors and can provide lots of recommendations when it comes to experiencing our city and its incredible surroundings!

name: Dana
about: We are Dana and Misha from Portland Oregon. We are friendly outgoing folks who love living in Portland. We take full advantage of the amazing food and art in our city. We also love the easy access to the outdoors living here provides us. We love hiking, skiing, camping and traveling.

name: Juliet
about: Hi, I'm a Colombian living in  Portlan, OR. I love the land scape of the pacIfic North West, but travel in general is one of my passions. I'm  like to bike, paint, cook and read.

name: Aaron
about:
As a life long globetrotter, I understand the needs of travelers and explorers, and welcome those to my fantastic city of Portland. I've been a Portland resident for 15 years and really love to share all the special places and 'have to see' attractions Rose City has to offer. When you Airbnb with me you'll get a warm refuge and loads of insider tips.

Things I love about my city: music scene, food carts, local bars, bicycle riding, spontaneous community events.

name: Yves-Lise
about: I am a black woman in my early sixties.  I have been living in Portland for the past 42 years.  I am an artist and watch small children outside of my home whenever I can. I surround myself with wonderful decent people and things.  I love to be outdoors, so gardening is one of my favorite hobbies.

name: Patty
about:
I have been/am a public school teacher for the past 30+ years. I teach young (5 & 6 year-olds) children to read & write.   I LOVE my work!!!
I am also a distance runner who is finally slowing down to truly enjoy (URL HIDDEN) more marathons, 13.1 or less for me.

Portland is currently my home.  It is a beautiful, gentle, yet active starting point for  incredible nature discovery. The Pacific Northwest provides such contrasts and yet,  such consistent natural wonders!

I love to travel and really enjoy interfacing with fellow world-inhabitants.  Exposure to new people, ideas, life-styles fascinates me.

name: Jessie
about:
"You pass through places, and places pass through you" - Jolie Holland 

I travel a lot for work and have the pleasure of meeting so many new and interesting people along the way. It's always a nice change of pace to stay in someone's home rather than a hotel because you get to embrace a moment of authentic living.

Any questions just ask!

name: DeeDee
about: DeeDee and Tim are your contacts during your stay. In addition to the website communication, you can call or text (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).

name: Christopher & Greta
about:
We are a couple in our mid-thirties enjoying life and all that Southeast Portland has to offer. Greta runs her own graphic design business, Thrive, and Chris records music and manages a small music venue in the Alberta Arts District. We spend far too much of our free time and income on the extensive food options available in the city, and we'd love to share our experiences with you. We actually went a little overboard with our reviews and recommendations, so if you stay with us don't be intimidated by the giant folder on the table - it's just there to help!

We also love wine, being outdoors, camping, music, movies, donkeys (well, mostly Greta), and being big dorks. Travel would be one of our favorite things to do if we had some time... so instead we dream about it constantly. Greta completed the entire Camino de Santiago (a 500 mile walking pilgrimage across northern Spain) in the summer of 2013, we try to go someplace tropical every winter and we're planning a sojourn to China or Peru in the next year!

Cooking is a favorite pastime for both of us, and Greta loves to keep things clean and sweet smelling around the home. Chris plays guitar and sings silly songs about our cats, and every once in a while we like to have a game of street badminton. It's a real hard life in Portland, Oregon.

Our other house is a mere 10 minute drive from the property, so we're often available in person should you need us! If you have any questions, please get in touch - we'd love to chat with you.

name: Sam
about: With my partner, Jane, I like to explore the hiking trails, bike ways, parks and restaurants of Portland and the NW . Having grown up in Portland and having traveled to a few places in the world, I have come to appreciate all that is here and nearby.  When I am not out hiking or riding my bike, I enjoy working as an elementary school teacher . I also like spending time with my three grown children, when they are free. Gardening, woodworking, reading and painting are my main hobbies.

name: Carrie And Brian
about:
Hi! I am a mother of 3, grandmother of 5, big sister to one sister, adorning daughter to my mom & dad and wife to my best friend Brian. We have a small dog we love named Lulu that goes everywhere with us.
I have been a Waldorf teacher for over 20 years. I now own my own Waldorf preschool in a great home and neighborhood.  My husband Brian, is artistic and a skilled wood worker and flips Vintage trailers. He loves the outdoors and repurposing items found. 
We love crafting, movies, cooking and road trips. I'm a lover of life and all it offers! Wine, art, books, the ocean, my friends and family. All important to me.  
We are tidy and respectful guests. We strive to be thoughtful hosts.

name: Gina
about: Portland is home and I delight in helping visitors feel at home - and finding the best this town has to offer.  I'm into yoga, music, art, food, coffee, cocktails, and biking. I'm also into getting out to the wild areas of this gorgeous state, as much as I love this little city.

name: Chitralekha
about:
I am from India and am a US citizen living in Portland OR.

I have 3 grown up children, 2 sons and a daughter

I worked as a High school Teacher for 20 years, taught Math and Physics to 9th and 10th Grades.

I was also the Principal incharge and Vice Principal of a Residential ( Private Boarding) school for 6 years. Many of my students work all over the world now and most of them stay in touch with me through (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN).

My favorite past times are  listening to music, go to Basket ball games, go for long walks if the weather permits, Reading and watching TV

I love to listen to all kinds of music, my favorite group is Beetles. I can't live without music. i also like Sting, Eagles, Elvis, Michael Jackson, Nora Jones.. not in that particular order, it depends o9n the mood and time of the day :-)

I am a great fan of our NBA Team, the Portland Trail Blazers.

My all time favorite movies are Sound Of Music and Mary Poppins. Loved the recent movie 'Avatar'

On rainy winter evenings I watch TV, my favorite TV shows are Jeapardy, NCIS, Frasier, Golden Girls, 24, Desperate House wives, Drop dead Diva.

My Motto is "live and let live"

finally I would like to say... "Yesterday is gone and Tomorrow is unpredictable.. today is with you, enjoy it from Sunrise to Sunset and beyond"

name: Paula
about: Yoga, hiking, and gardening are among my favorite things to do.  Just returned to living back in Portland after 5 years in S.E. Asia.  Hoping to make this a retreat like setting for you with lots of opportunities to soak in the Pacific Northwest vibe.

name: Brooke
about:
Hi there:) My husband Taran and I are a very relaxed easy going couple. We have two boys and we enjoy hiking and camping in the Great Northwest!!
We have faith in Jesus Christ, are into natural healing and foods and love gaming of all types! Overall, a relaxed couple who loves to socialize, explore this wonderful city and meet & learn from people. One of our '"mottos"' is 
~Bloom where you're planted~

name: Megan & Jenny
about: I'm a farmer, chef, and artist living in Portland, OR.

name: Jacob
about: Music loving, easy going, exercising foodie :) originally from upstate NY, relocated to Portland OR in 2007.  Will be here till the next adventure. Proud papa of 14 yr old Chocolate Lab named Herman.

name: Tian
about: Friendly and humble traveler. I am a healthcare professional in Portland OR and Craig is an IT consultant. Food and travel are our passion. We enjoy meeting people from all over the world.

name: Ian & Sharmil
about:
Hi there!  

We are Tiger & Peacock (also known as Ian & Sharmil). Ian and I are both Desire-based life coaches and we work in the areas of relationships, intimacy, connection and communication etc, and work from home.  

We are happy to offer each of our guests one free introductory session (on any topic of interest) with either of us.  You can speak with us about it during your stay, message us via the app, or email us: (EMAIL HIDDEN) (Ian) or (EMAIL HIDDEN) (Sharmil) to set up an appointment.  

Sessions are up to an hour long and can be done in person during your stay, or via phone/video chat if we don't have an opportunity to meet with you while you are in town. 

And if you are interested but want to know more about what we do, we are happy to answer any questions. 

A little about us...
Ian and I find that community is an essential part of our way of life. I jokingly (and kind of seriously) say "Now that you're here, you are family. Now that you know this, are you sure you want to stay?" ;-) That's because this is our home, the home of our community (chosen family) and everyone we invite into it is done with love and we don't hide anything. We are real people who live real lives under this big beautiful roof. 

Our goal and desire is for our home to be your home-away-from-home and perhaps you will come to love it (in all it's quarks) as much as we do. 

*And we love greetings and farewells with hugs*

Meet the other member of our little team:
"Mom" aka Sharon (Sharmil's mom) and house mom is the on-site host for our NE Broadway location and runs the day-to-day operations there. She's great for the warm motherly touch or sometimes the swift kick in the butt, when needed. ;-)

If you have the privilege to meet this wonderful soul, know that she is our trusted partner and please treat her as you would or better than your own mother.

name: Caroline
about: I am a creative, open minded individual with an opinion on just about everything!  I love to laugh!  I love my family, my friends, my Portland!  My favorite travel destination so far is the U.S. Virgin Islands.

name: Brian
about:
40 years old, love sports and my dog - Go Timbers, Go Green Bay Packers, Go Blazers!! 

I like travel adventures, but haven't had much opportunity to explore as much as I would like to lately. I am single and spend a lot of time with my best four legged friend Nagbe the amazingly friendly, loving and energetic Red Heeler.

I also have roommates who are rarely here.

name: Gina
about:
I LOVE to travel and meet new people.  I travel as much as I possibly can and have been focusing lately on only international travel.

I strive to be pescetarian, love juicing fresh organic veggies as well as making smoothies with organic fruits. That said, I don't judge others for the food choices they make. What others consume does not bother me in the least. I also don't deprive my body what it craves, I just try to make better choices. 

I have an active and busy lifestyle so depending on the time of year, there is a chance you  will have the house to yourself quite a bit.

Former foster mom:  I now use her old bedroom to host airbnb guests in hopes to  help with the debt I incurred from being a foster parent.  I can't think of a better way to incur debt and believe that if everyone foster cared a child or a dog even if only for emergency placement, society would be so different.

I am religious about recycling to the point where I don't have garbage service, only recycling. 

I work for a great company from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. five days a week; so, I enjoy my weekends by surrounding myself with good friends, good times and as much adventure as possible. I have a great group of close friends I call family.  

I have minimal complaints about my life - minus the significant recent loss of my amazing co-host the senior resident chocolate lab, Leroy Brown.

name: Leigh
about: I'm a Physician Assistant and my husband is an IT consultant. We love to travel, experience other cultures, listen to great music, hike beautiful trails, eat new foods and drink good wine (and beer).  Our dog Bella, is our only child and we enjoy life even more with her friendly company.  We have had such a fabulous time exploring new places with the help of airbnb and look forward to each upcoming adventure!

name: Abigail And Lawton
about: Professor of Art History, Willamette University, Oregon

name: Kaya And Wayne
about:
Hi and  welcome!  We live in Portland and we also lived in New Zealand for 12 years, enjoy community and meeting new people. Kaya is an entrepreneur and Wayne is an artist and  social worker.  

We are both into health and wellness and enjoy riding our bikes around our folksy neighborhood as well as hiking in the Oregon forests.  We are both gardeners and artists. 
You will see Wayne's painted furniture and other art in nooks and crannies when you visit our home.  Wayne's paintings adorn the living room and your room. We look forward to meeting you.

name: Joan
about: I am a native of Portland, Oregon.  I own a small tiny house company called Portland Alternative Dwellings, LLC ((URL HIDDEN)   I like strong coffee, long bike rides, cold beer, and a good view.

name: Kelly
about:
Hi! I am the mother of 3 lovely little boys! We spend a lot of time outdoors, whether it is hiking for the day or having fun by the pool! 
We love to cook and eat great food

name: Mitch
about: I'm a retired educator and coach, a father to three wonderful grown sons, an avid tennis player, and a longtime Portland resident. My personality is laid back, easygoing and fun.  I love to cook (and eat), like watching movies and traveling to new places and meeting new people. I love chai tea and cinnamon raisin cookies!

name: Cynthia
about: We have lived in Portland for over 35 years in the hawthorne neighborhood. When we aren't traveling, we enjoy eating and drinking in the many Portland neighborhood restaurants. We enjoy sharing our knowledge of the city with travelers and think this is one of the best cities to live in and visit.

name: Laura
about: I am an Airbnb host and traveler.  I travel for art shows and business meetings (meet with companies and non-profits to help them with their digital strategies).  I've lived on my own since college.  I tend to like to be out and about enjoying a city.  I'm a non-smoker, like to leave a place as clean as I found it, and I'm quiet.  Oh, and I tend to need good working wifi.  :-)

name: Marie
about: I grew up in Portland, relocated to the Bay Area for 11 years and recently returned to Portland.  I love exploring every corner of this area, discovering new dining wonders, delicious coffee, craft beers, artisan ice cream and breath-taking view points, which are endless.  Travel is a regular routine and my favorite part is experiencing life as a local wherever I go.

name: Surah
about: Multi cultural household; East Coast transplant since 1979 (Chiropractor since 1984), Husband, Cuban transplant (2004).  We Love Portland and surrounding areas and would enjoy sharing tips on everything; Restaurants, Theatre, Shops, Parks, Bike Routes, movie Theaters and more.

name: Alex
about: My wife, Kristen, and I bought a duplex in mid-2014 in the lovely Brooklyn neighborhood in Southeast Portland. After moving into the rear unit, we soon began making plans to turn the front space into an Airbnb. With Kristen's background in fashion design, she was excited for the opportunity to turn her eye towards interior design! We're both quiet and gracious hosts, seeking to replicate the excellent experiences we've had as guests in other Airbnb's. We're always happy to give advice on the best spots to eat, nearby hikes, upcoming concerts, and places to get out of the rain!

name: Marco
about: Currently live, work and play in Portland Or. Started a company called The Good Flock. I do Yoga to keep my mind clear.

name: Mary M.
about:
I come from a big family of 8 children! And now, I have 4 grown children.  My husband is from Switzerland and I am from the Philippines.  So what we enjoy the most are entertaining people and traveling the world.  We are grateful that we have been able to instill the sense of adventure to our children. 

We are very appreciative of the hospitality that has been shown to us from all our travels.  Our commitment is to show that same hospitality to our guests.  

Thank you for choosing our little cottage.

name: Jeff
about: 30 year resident of Portland with my wife Susan hailing from Chicago. Me: General contractor (I built the home) Her: City Planner and former Chair of the neighborhood organization. Specifically built our guest room for maximum privacy but will welcome you into our home and help you with your visit to Portland. We built the homes surrounding this one and have an intimate micro-community. We like camping, crossword puzzles, movies and travel.

name: Jana, Michael, And Audrey
about: We are a small family.  Jana is a musician/composer and Massage Therapist with a beautiful new office in downtown Portland.  Michael is a hip hop and spoken word artist, teacher, and station manager at our local non-profit community radio KBOO.  Audrey is a very busy 4 year old who likes painting, jumping, music, and theater.  Casi is our best pal, and lives on the property as well.  Our schedules are crazy at times, but we look forward to meeting and hosting new people from everywhere!

name: Michael
about: John and I live in the vibrant NW neighborhood in Portland, OR and love meeting new people, sharing new experiences and exploring new places.

name: Andreas
about: Easy going guy, accommodating and just an all around nice person. Feel free to ask me any questions.

name: Nancy
about:
Fun, social, foodie type- love the creature comforts and the great outdoors. 
My goal is to ensure you have a comfortable and fun stay in Portland. I am more than happy to provide tips on great hiking,bike routes, sight seeing, restaurants and  anything else you might want to do in the area. Friends and I might be grilling out back or enjoying the fire pit during your stay, we'll keep it low key and welcome you to join us!

name: Chiaoli
about: Chiaoli Lu ND. LAc. is licensed as a primary care naturopathic practitioner and acupuncturist in the state of Oregon. Dr. Lu is passionate about helping patients seek the underlying cause of their health problems. Her goal is to help people achieve health through natural modalities and by honoring the healing power of Mother Nature and love. She also has a master's degree in Hospitality management. Chiaoli loves nature, animals and people... Just loves to share !!

name: Cynthia
about: I work out of my home. I have a company that produces Printable clothing and I work at the market downtown from March to December on weekends. I also do other festivals around the area as well as travel for my wholesale business. My office and studio are on the property. I will be available to you when ever you need me, to answer any questions, directions, or "how to get where you want to go".  I have lived in Portland for 32 years, have traveled extensively through out Oregon as a sales rep so I know every nook and cranny of the state. I can suggest places to go and i have provided loads of information in your suite. If you need more information, I'll help you it... Always willing to help you out!

name: David
about:
I love to travel and I love meeting and hosting travelers.  I've been an Airbnb host since 2010.

My neighborhood is a very pleasant place to stay, whether it's getting coffee or a drink/microbrew nearby, sushi, trying the new Lebanese brunch at Ya Hala, or walking/running around Mt. Tabor park.

A few of my favorite things are bike commuting year-round, hiking, yoga, cooking, and eating my way around Portland. Whenever possible I'm out the door to visit a farmer's market, mountain, the Columbia River Gorge, or the coast.  I love to travel as well, in the last few years I've been spending time in Maui, Cozumel, Tulum, and Thailand.  I also visit my family in Seattle, NYC, Maine, and San Diego as much as possible.

I enthusiastically welcome diversity in my guests!

name: Martin
about: Former culinary entrepreneur turned marketing director and hospitality professional. Passionate about "traveling deeper" and about curating unique, personalized, insider experiences for travelers to Oregon.

name: Mark
about: Photographer…and lover of this fair city. So thankful to live in Portland!

name: Jennifer
about:
I've lived in the PNW all my life but I love traveling to new places. 
And I love animals.

name: Adam
about: Im transgender Female to Male very active in the LGBTQ Community. I am a native to Oregon grew up in Portland. I have been hosting folks since 2010 on (website hidden) I just recently heard about this community so Im pretty excited! Good thing about me being a host is I listen! I'm very easy going and attentive I can accommodate my guests needs or special requests if needed. Love to share travel experiences and life lessons. Learning is a passion of mine i am a life learner and I am always curious and accepting of others. My life motto is dont worry be happy!

name: Patricia
about: Portland OR, Regional Consultant & Health Care Educator  Kaiser Permanente, Certified Coach, Founding Partner, TraceFind Technologies.

name: Charles
about: I am an Oregonian with deep roots. My wife and I are long-time Waverly Heights residents. We enjoy using our bikes to visit friends, shop, and take in cultural events.  With our three daughters we've travelled the Northwest extensively, camping on the coast and in the Cascades. As the girls grew up we set out in an RV each spring to explore some corner of the Northwest. These travels provide some of our most cherished memories. In 2014 we extensively remodeled our home throughout and converted the basement to living space.

name: Lisa
about: I'm a writer living in the beautiful hills of Portland, Oregon, where my kids and I love to hike the trails of Forest Park, along with our golden retriever, Hudson.  I have three kids aged 8 to 28 and they're all involved in the arts, including comedy, music and acting. My youngest is a book lover who reviews books on YouTube and helps me write children's books. I love healthy food, theater, comedy, hiking, swimming, reading and traveling.  I write about environmental issues (especially clean energy), parenting and youth sports.  We try to be as environmentally friendly as possible at home; I drive an electric car, use eco-friendly cleaning products and purchase green power. As a host, I'm friendly, open, and outgoing. Because I work from home, I'm available and eager to give you advice and help ensure you make the most of your visit to Portland.

name: Michele
about: I'm a social worker/therapist, wife, and mom to two young boys. We love to travel any chance we get! Now that our kids are getting older we are looking forward to more international travel with them.

name: Megan
about:
Hi there, I am Megan and I will be your future host.

I'll keep it short and sweet..

I am a freelance website designer with an AAS degree in computer science.
I'm a free spirit that loves to travel.
I love good food, good music, and good company.

If you want to know anything, please just let me know!

name: John
about:
Quiet man who doesn't drink, do drugs or smoke. Eats mostly organic, including meat. Can embrace a vegetarian or vegan guest.
Work from home and on the phone a lot. Need a low level of background noise during business hours, roughly 8AM to 6PM Pacific Time. 
"Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before."
–Mae West

name: Stephen
about:
Hi! I'm Stephen and I live in San Diego, CA. My wonderful wife and I met dancing (jazz and ballet) and I even had the privilege to perform in Portland (Joffrey) ages ago. My wife and I have four wonderful daughters. 

My daughter, Marina, works and goes to school in Orange County, CA. One of my other daughters, Marchesa, has finished up school and is currently working in Los Angeles. We are native Portlanders and love Portland! We visit often and have many family and friends living there as well. We own a 'father-daughter' duplex in Portland, OR and it is our 'home away from home'! The neighborhood is so healthy with a sense of community and kindness. We hope you enjoy our super clean and simple home!

name: Jodie
about:
Hi. I am Jodie! I love my neighborhood. Everyday I feel thankful to live here. There are so many kind hearted people, tons of families, and lots of pets! 
I have lived in the Woodstock neighborhood for five years. 
I thrive when connecting people with ways in which we can rely on one another. Currently, I organize weekly nanny shares, routine kid swaps and meal swaps, so none of us feel like we are raising kids without support.  
Our house is filled with love and relaxation! I hope you enjoy your stay.

name: Kit
about: The house is a 1912 Bungalow,  clean and peaceful, and you will get the best of Portland here.  Walking distance to restaurants, shops, movies, Powells (on Hawthorne.) The neighborhood is super safe, and quiet. The house is quiet, but comfortable, as well.   I've had a variety of different roomates over the years, but currently I just want to enjoy guests like yourself. (No roomates).  The room is on the main floor, near a bathroom.   I live upstairs and have my own bathroom.  I come down to use the kitchen,  and take my little dog outside.  I work 3-4 days or eves a week (RN). My job is just a mile away.  I'm pretty easy going, and  I don't set out a breakfast, as New Seasons and Fred Meyer are a block away, but I share my Olive oil.  You can smoke on the front porch if you like.   I'm glad to go have a beer with you , or a cup of Joe if you like!

name: Jennifer
about:
My life is all about food! Which makes Portland, OR, a great place to call home! I also love the bridges, biking, mountains, and the neighborhood cats that ask for belly petting when I'm out walking around. 

If I could live anywhere else it'd be Kauai, because Portland doesn't offer snorkeling with sea turtles.

name: Genie And George
about: George and I live in a lovely 1907 Queen Anne provincial in the Portland, OR Mississipi neighborhood.    I love good books, good music, the occasional HBO drama, leopard print, bracelets, and scarves.  Mostly scarves.  Surprisingly, I pack light.  George is a hybrid Brit-American who marvels every day at his luck in living in such a vibrant neighborhood.

name: Quan
about: Hello my name is Quan. Im currently occupied school and work. I recently moved into a new home in the heart of Portland. Its a 3 beds room home with 2.5 bath. The home was recently remodel so everything is pretty much brand new. Im friendly, out going and love to meet new people from different places.

name: Stephanie & Matthew
about:
The key to happiness is a firm foundation of good food, better drink, and the great outdoors. What better way to do so than in beautiful Portland, Oregon!  We moved here from Vermont a few years back and since then have been busy exploring the great food, hikes, and activities that this city has to offer.  We love to eat and often plan our travels around trying new food.  We also love the outdoors and exploring new trails with our two dogs. We're avid mountain bikers as well and one of our favorite things to do is to travel around Oregon exploring new mountain bike trails.

We want our guests to have a great time while in Portland and so we're always available for questions or recommendations on food, city events and outdoor activities in the area.  We're friendly and approachable but we won't bug you unless you want us to! We're as hands on or off as our guests want us to be.

name: Christina & Robert
about:
We recently relocated to another vibrant SE Portland neighborhood after years in our Central Eastside condo. Robert is a journalist and writes about the US electricity markets and I split my days playing with our preschool son and studying for my MSW.  

Walking is a favorite pastime. We love to explore our neighborhoods. We enjoy cooking, eating out, traveling, drinking wine and visiting with friends. 

We have been staying at vacation rental homes for many years all around the world and have so enjoyed the experience of meeting hosts and living a little closer to the culture we visit. Now we're thrilled become hosts to those who want to see what an amazing little city Portland truly is.

name: Anastasia
about: Welcome to Portlandia, I live in a old house in NE Portland with a couple of roommates and two chihuahuas. I have chickens in my back yard, a garden in the front yard, I go to the dog park every afternoon, I make jewelry in my living room, and .............. I have an airbnb  ;o)

name: Chayo
about: I am From the SF Bay Area now living in Portland Oregon near my children and Grandchild. I am a Ceramic artist with a home studio. I teach private ceramic classes in my studio. I enjoy gardening and have a large lush back yard for my visitors to enjoy. I also enjoy cooking so there will be treats for the travelers also. I love living in the Mt Tabor Neighborhood near walking trails and the 60th Max line.

name: Jack
about: Quiet, Friendly, Respectful

name: Deborah
about:
I'm a child of the 60's and 70's, born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin and graduated from the University of Wisconsin at Madison with my bachelor's degree in Occupational Therapy.  I've made Portland, Oregon my home since January 1981 and have actively loved this place ever since!  I started my professional practice here and raised my family while squeezing in plenty of Oregon recreation: skiing, hiking, kayaking, beach bumming.
I traveled extensively in Europe and Turkey for 9 months in 1975.  But, I have been stateside since then, busy with all of the above.
I look forward to travel in the future, when my post professional life settles into place.
As a host you'll find me welcoming and friendly and my home tidy, organized and relaxed.  I've lived in my home for 25 years, dearly love my neighborhood and city and love to help others get to experience it too.

name: Jessie
about: Hi! We are teachers/gardeners/homebuilders.  We live in the main house on the property and built this tiny house.  We share an edible garden that covers both the front and back yard.  The Tiny House has a separate entrance through the back yard.  Please feel free to enjoy the fire pit.  We may join you for a brew and a chat! We have both lived here for about 10 years and are happy to share some local wisdom on fun places to see and do around Portland and beyond.

name: Amber
about: Hello!  I'm a Montana native so being in nature is definitely my happy place but I love adventures of all kinds.  My husband and I have flexible jobs that allow us to travel frequently, and we are happy to share our home and our city with others while we're away.

name: Tanya
about: I have traveled the world and lived as an au pair, in co-housing and as host daughter with families in Australia, Sweden, Denmark, Iceland and Mexico.  I love accepting new people into my space and making them comfortable.  I'm an outgoing, friendly, mature entrepreneur with an open mind.

name: Kyra Anastasia
about: Welcome! Please do visit my Zen properties in LA and Portland. I really enjoy sharing my homes with others and giving you an opportunity to explore a new place. I have traveled extensively throughout the world and on several occasions have stayed with other airbnb hosts. Most recently, I traveled to Bhutan and Nepal and stayed with a lovely family in Kathmandu. To me, staying in private homes, in different parts of the world, enhances a trip and is a wonderful way to make new friends. Please feel free to contact me and do let me know if there is anything I can do to help you with your visit!

name: Ivy
about: I'm a settled-down traveler who found a gem of hidden land on the edge of the city--land that wants to be shared. I raise my family, tend the land and work in the community. Artist, herbalist, permaculturist, teacher and writer.

name: Lindsey
about: I'm originally from Philadelphia but now live in Southeast Portland with my boyfriend, Michael. I'm a disability support worker and nanny. I'm into hot yoga, hiking, eating great food, drinking good beer and enjoying life.

name: Charles & Sulma
about: We love running trails and hiking (anything woodsy!). We're into healthy living.   We love to eat, walk, sleep.  We're easy going and neat.  Very respectful of others' privacy/space and property.

name: Lori
about: Mother-Daughter team. We  Love Portland and Oregon--- Very happy to share our rental in the wonderful and exciting Pearl District! We live near the airbnb and manage it ourselves.  We hope your stay is perfect!  Lori and Julie

name: Kelsey
about: Interior Designer living in Portland, Oregon. Loves adventuring outdoors, good cocktails, and exploring new places.

name: Chris & Adelle
about:
I am a retired teacher and my husband is retired from PSU.  We are fun and friendly.  We have a new guest suite in our 1890 Victorian near PSU just on the outside of downtown Portland.  We four blocks from the new Yellow Max line, so close to anything downtown.  The #8 bus stop is within a block.  Our suite has a kitchnette, full bath, comfortable living space and separate bedroom.  A washer and dryer are available.  There is cable TV in the bedroom and high-speed WiFi.
We live downstairs and are here to help with anything our guests need.

name: Dave & Robyn
about: We first came to Portland while working in the art department on the film Mr. Holland’s Opus in 1995. A few years later we decided to come back and stay.   We are loving every minute of it. It's a great city that we have no doubt you will also fall in love with. We are thrilled to have the opportunity to make our space available to other adventurous travelers!

name: Luca
about: I enjoy global travel when the opportunity lends itself and when at home in Oregon he prefers road biking, collecting jazz records, hiking/backpacking in the Cascades mountains, drinking strong coffee, Italian rustic cooking.

name: Alison
about:
I have lived in Portland all my life (sixth generation!) and enjoy sharing my city with visitors.  I have traveled enough myself to appreciate how much a personal connection can add to a visit; its the difference between being a tourist and a traveler.

I live with my husband and teenage son.

name: David
about:
Hello everyone.  My name is David.  I'm a 34 yr old artist currently living in Portland OR.  I have been with my husband Nick for almost 10 years now.  He's a bartender at Mississippi Studios and Revolution Hall.  We own our home near St. Johns/Kenton and care for two wonderful dogs.  We have been working on a live project since 2006, Billygoat.  It involves stop motion animation and music.  We play around town and tour whenever we can. I also carve lighted woodcuts from my shop at home.  Part-time I work as a cleaner for many different AirBnb properties in Portland, so I have a pretty decent sense of what owners and guests expect from their rentals.  

Come & stay in our lovely home.  Or maybe you host us?

name: Erica & Tim
about:
Native East Coasters, we've traveled the world and are now excited to call Portland, Oregon home. We love exploring new places, cuisines, music, and cultures when we're traveling. At home, we like to lounge on the weekends, eat sushi, watch movies, spend too much time at the nearby health food store, and romp around in the gorge and on the coast. 

As guests, we're tidy and low key. Sometimes we sleep in, but usually we're out and about exploring whatever place we're in.

As hosts, we strive to create a space cozier than a hotel but more private than a bed and breakfast. (In other words, we won't expect a full report of what you've seen and done all day :-) We love our house, and feel blessed to be able to share our space with you.

name: LeeAnne
about: With a background in fine arts and several years as an art teacher, I've always been eager to spend my summer vacations exploring new cultures and learning more about the artwork of various regions around the world. I am eager to share my Portland home with you when I'm out of town traveling and hope you enjoy yourself in my favorite city in the world!

name: Kindra
about: I'm a workaholic animal loving travel enthusiast!

name: Daniel
about: Daniel is from Detroit, but has lived in NYC, San Francisco, Oakland, and Vancouver BC. Bridget is a life-long Portlander. We love to be outdoors: in the forest, the beach, or the Gorge. Together we have 5 kids (only 1 still at home), Tucker our dog, and Milo the cat.

name: Adrienne
about: I'm an East Coast gal who fell in love with the Pacific Northwest and decided to put down roots! Probably because I'm a huge fan of outdoor activities like hiking, soccer (Go Timbers!) and skiing and when I'm not working hard as a DBA/Developer at Nike, you can find me traveling and spending quality time with my boyfriend!

name: Karen
about:
I live in Portland, OR.  Here I own a couple health food restaurants and a yoga studio.  I love the outdoors, traveling, dining, exploring, photography and practicing yoga.  

(URL HIDDEN)
(URL HIDDEN)
(URL HIDDEN)

name: Tiffany
about:
I am a teacher in Portland, OR.  I love my cozy house and have enjoyed upgrading it in the past 4 years.  My neighborhood is definitely growing and I am loving every minute of it!  So many new things are popping up nearby.  

I spend my free time working in my garden, hiking with my dog, and reading.  

Cheers!

name: Kevin
about: Self employed, active. Live & let live.

name: Keiran
about: A long-time collector of treasure and maker of home, curating a comfortable and lovely place to lay my head, gather, entertain and create has always been a priority for me.  Though I have lived in Portland, OR for 9 years and love it here, I am a bit of a nomad myself.  I was raised in the Midwest , went to school on the East Coast and have lived in 6 different cities since.  I own an antiques and curiosities shop in the Pearl district downtown and travel quite a lot for work and for pleasure.
