When away from home, as much as possible, I like to stay with family and friends, preferring the comforts of home to those of a hotel.  I hope you will enjoy your stay in my house, my neighborhood and my city.  Welcome!

name: Leslie
about:
I love having people stay with me!  It's so great to meet new folks and hear about the travel adventures of others.
I absolutely love to travel.  There are so many wonderful places to visit in the world.  I have done different styles of travel from relaxing vacations (sitting on the beach) to humanitarian projects in developing countries (building a school in Guatemala).  I am outgoing and enjoy meeting people from all over the world.  My great art is cooking.  I love preparing artful meals that are yummy and beautiful.  Also love trying new foods from other cultures.  It's great fun to host people in my home.  I will welcome you warmly and help you find the Portland experience you are looking for.

name: Lourds
about: My name is Lourds, you are welcome to call me Lurds.  I am a freelance Cinematographer and a Film Production Consultant.  I love Movies, Music and Architecture.  Like being with people who inspire me with wisdom and simplicity.  My favorite travel destination is Italy and my favorite food is Indian and French.  I love to share my knowledge with upcoming film makers.

name: Jennifer
about: My husband and I have our own businesses and work in education. We've really enjoyed staying in AirBnBs all over the world and are excited to host people coming to Portland. We like having dinner with friends, listening to crazy jazz, taking our cat for walks, and doing tai chi. We're vegetarian and love to cook but also love living in such a vegetarian friendly city as Portland!

name: Will, Holly, Matt & Snacks
about:
We are three friends from the Midwest who are very active in the community and love living the Pacific Northwest. Matt loves to work with plants, adventure and build. Will is the athletic one who helps people reach their fitness goals! Holly works as a publicist, event producer, and main lady behind a Portland-based magazine, EYES + EDGE. Snacks is the fluffy and ferocious guard of the premises.

We are all here to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We share the responsibilities of the space and will be just a knock or a phone call away if you need anything. Please communicate any concerns to us immediately.

name: Darlene & Dan
about:
Love to travel - love to be outside - love to garden - love people - love life!
A former tour guide in Europe, I'm looking forward to sharing the Pacific NW with visitors - you've just gotta come to Portland!

Grew up in Denver Colorado as a kid was lucky to travel throughout the West - mostly camping adventures.  As an adult, lived in Europe, on Guam and seven different states. Traveled A LOT, but the bucket list just keeps getting longer! My favorite cities (besides Portland): New York, San Francisco, Denver - and any place with great Museums. 

I love to eat at places I haven't been to - Portland is a foodie town, let me help you plan your trip and places to EAT! Oh yeah, it's also a brew pub town and a happy hour town!!! 

We love to have guests, your apartment is private, but we love to host you on our back yard patio - our neighbors even want to meet you! We've had great conversations under the stars or next to the firepit!

"Live in a state of uninterrupted marvel" - Jack Gilbert, poet

name: Verelle
about:
I am a graphic designer and Oregon native. My husband, Cory, is an electrical engineer, originally from the South, having lived in Florida, North Carolina, Virginia, Texas and Washington, and has chosen to make his home in Oregon. We live in SE Portland with our baby Juniper, and two cats, Aussie and Roo.
I love to ride bikes, cook, practice calligraphy, and make things with my hands. Cory fishes, golfs, and enjoys eating anything his wife makes.

name: Jonathan
about: I love to travel, hike and enjoy the  outdoors. I have had the good fortune of experiencing many parts of the world with local hosts. I want to extend my space to fellow travelers in the city I love, and share the knowledge I've gained from living here the last 15 years. This is my first listing on this page but I have over two years experience hosting on airbnb through my girlfriend's page and have been a thankful guest in many different cities.

name: Kayla + Megan
about: Hi there! I'm Kayla and I am an Interior Designer living and working in Portland, OR. My partner Megan is a counselor at a local nonprofit. We live with our two old pugs, Cookie and Fiona, and our tiny orange cat, June. We have been in Portland for 7 years and in our current home for 3. We love to travel, hike, garden, cook, and meet new people! We are both very tidy and keep our space as comfortable and homey as possible and we hope you can do the same! We look forward to meeting you!

name: Allison & Pam
about:
Allison and Pam are co-owners of Tiny Digs Tiny House Hotel in Portland.

Allison has held leadership roles in operations and administration in various industries including finance, healthcare and manufacturing. Her personal interest in the culinary arts and hospitality evolved through extensive travel throughout the US and Europe.  It has been a long-held dream to own a hospitality business and the idea of a tiny house hotel charmed her into taking the plunge.

Pam was a masters-educated special ed teacher before transitioning to Executive Director of Westra Wellness Center in Michigan, which she owned with her husband Bruce.  After selling the practice several years ago, they traveled the country in their RV and evenutally landed in Portland to be near their adult children, hearts set on chasing their passion for tiny houses.

name: Janet
about: I'm a DIY, craft, garden, travel and food obsessed mother of two young girls, wife, and teacher. I've stayed in a few lovely Airbnb accommodations and now I'm thrilled to host my own. I look forward to having guests in our sweet little Alberta Guest House.

name: Matt & Meredith
about: I'm a Creative Director. My wife is a school teacher and we're thankful for life in Portland with our two young girls.

name: Michelle
about:
I am an adventure seeker. I love to see how people in other cities and countries live, and embrace the unknown. I travel domestically on a near weekly basis and have had the pleasure of visiting Thailand, Dubai, The Maldives, Amsterdam, Italy, and Brazil - specifically Rio, Salvador and the Amazon jungle in recent years. 

5 things I can't live without:

1. Friends and Family
2. Traveling
3. Indoor Spinning Classes
4. Chef Tasting Menus
5. Being near water

name: Jane
about: I'm a psychotherapist, money-coach and artist.  Presently considering a move to Asheville, NC.

name: Misty
about: I own a health/nutrition company that does custom juices and cleanses.  Snowboard and outside a lot.  Small dog by my side, hes always cold.  We just moved back to Portland in August from Surf City- Huntington Beach CA.

name: Avery
about: Hi I'm Avery! I love to be busy and also love living in the heart of downtown Portland. Please feel free to ask me any questions you might have about my home. I look forward to hosting you!

name: Elaine
about:
As a former hostel owner, I enjoy meeting new people, hearing about their lives and travels, and sharing my knowledge of the area with newcomers. 
  
Born and raised in California, I moved to Portland Oregon four years ago to live close to my family.  I enjoy cycling, hiking, and thrift shops.  

I've traveled extensively and always prefer staying in private homes, sometimes through couch (URL HIDDEN) but mostly through airbnb.

name: Kara
about: I'm a life-long Oregonian who loves camping, crafting, and exploring Portland.

name: Roberta
about: Small business owner, local community member, family focused, friendly and former world traveler. I love meeting new people.

name: Dh
about: I am an urban and regional planner here in Portland; my wife, Jennie, is an organic farmer. I love this region and the countless beautiful outdoor destinations it offers. Always trying to balance work and adventure! I am a musician and avid life-long learner. I love people, and if you stay at our apartment on Airbnb, please don't hesitate to stop in and say hello if you wish!

name: Allison And David
about: We are a middle school teacher and a non-profit director. We love to enjoy our wonderful neighborhood, garden, travel, and be outdoors. We look forward to welcoming guests to Portland and sharing our home!

name: Lauren
about: As a Returned Peace Corps Volunteer and seasoned traveler, I know the restorative power of a comfortable bed, homemade food, and good conversation. I created this space for travelers in a spirit of gratitude for the warm hospitality that I've experienced all over the world. My intention is to provide nourishment and sweet memories to all who pass through our doors. Can't wait to meet you!

name: Janet
about: My husband and I are from Portland, Oregon in the United States.  We have three kids, one dog, and love spending time outside, on our bikes. We love great wine, and love spending time with friends and family.  We also love to travel, and spent more than two weeks traveling with our kids in Europe in 2014! We stayed exclusively in places we booked through Airbnb.  After having so many great Airbnb experiences in the US and abroad, we decided to open up our home to fellow Airbnb'ers.  We look forward to providing the same great experience to guests as we have had at other Airbnb listings!

name: Jesse
about: I love guests and have a desire to share the world with my children. A background in event planning, hospitality, journalism and education has given me the opportunity to host in many venues--but my favorite is here at home. As a childbirth educator/doula, I spend my spare time in the garden, hiking and reading about sustainability or meeting the flower fairies in the woods. I love local food feasts, storytelling, yoga, gardening and meeting new people.

name: Erin
about:
Almost everybody who lives in Portland is not from Portland. I have lived in many different neighborhoods throughout Portland over the last 15 years. Portland is like a bubble. No place is like Portland. It is special. You will know what I mean once you get here. 
My passion is to travel, and see and experience new places and cultures. I get antsy if I haven't gone somewhere after 6 months.  It is hard to sit still but for now, I will, because my husband and I have two small children. We will sit still for a short time, but not for long. 
 We feel so grateful to so many people who have been kind to us throughout our travels.  It is now our turn to share the city that we love, to fellow travelers.  
FYI-  I daydream about Central America all the time.  It could be Belize or Costa Rica. Doesn't matter, all I have to do is shut my eyes and I am back there.  Watching a toucan fly by as we are white water rafting down the Parque River, snuggling a sloth, or questioning the sticky floors at a $6 hostel.  Take me back.  I am there all the time in my mind. 
 My favorite city is Amsterdam.  I smile when I think of riding my bike around the canals.  I would have to say that my favorite travel trip of all time is when I drove a loop around USA with my best friend. It was unforgettable.  

My husband and I welcome you to our space and city.

name: Christine
about: I have traveled all over the world during my career and have recently moved to Portland, Oregon.  I live in Portland with my sister, Maria, a retired Oregon public health nurse.  We come from a large family and learned from an early age, growing up in Hawaii and California, the meaning of welcome and hospitality from our parents whose house was always open for family and friends from around the US and the globe.

name: Dan And Elise
about: My wife and I love to cook, travel and eat! We know lots of great places around town to explore Portland's vibrant food, wine, beer and farmers market scenes, and love to share our favorite picks

name: Lance And Nicole
about: Greetings! We are Lance and Nicole and we enjoy the adventure of being air bnb hosts.  Lance is a Portland native and Nicole is from Southwest Colorado. We are excited to offer travelers a locals experience of what Portland has to offer! We really love all the good food and brews located within close proximity to where we are.  We love this city and are happy to offer any suggestions for places to visit and things to do.  We look forward to hosting you and hope you'll love Portland as much as we do!

name: Colin And Medina
about: The Guest House was inspired by many years of traveling and living in different parts of the world with a backpack or in a camper van. I wanted to create something that reminded me of a bungalow in Bali or a bamboo hut in Thailand and also design a small space that functions well. We still travel often and are currently restoring a  cottage in France

name: Liz
about: Hi there! I am a Portland real estate broker. I travel often and would love for you to be able to enjoy my space while I'm gone. I have a great love of Portland for it's culture, food, and access to nature. Please feel free to contact me with any questions you might have about the area!

name: Andrew
about:
I am 23 years old. I live with my partner, Lindsey, and our little dog, Dotti. We recently got married and moved into a beautiful home in Portland, Oregon, where we decided to remodel the basement apartment to be a comfy space for travelers and family. I am a barista at Heart Coffee Roasters as well as a composer/musician for film and media. I take customer service very seriously and enjoy meeting new people! Lindsey works as a Family Intervention Specialist with Youth Villages. She loves to work with children and families to provide resources and give hope to those in need. 

We love to travel by road trip in our trusty 1980 VW Westfalia Vanagon. Our most recent trip was from Waco, TX to Portland, OR (our honeymoon!). We love living in Portland and showing others what this town has to offer. More than anything, we love to provide a comfy space for travelers to relax, explore and enjoy good things!

name: Emanuele
about:
Hello, World! 

We're the Tozzato-Dias! Currently stationed in the pacific wonderland, enjoying the good life Portland has to offer! We're an Italian - Portuguese household, doing illustration (Christine Elizabeth) and software (Emanuele) for a living. 

When we're not running after our two kids, E & e, you may find us eating pizza,  backyard-ing*, cooking, discussing technology, drinking wine, roller-skating,  taking pictures, exploring Portland or collecting miles for our next flight!

name: Melanie & Dirk
about: Melanie and Dirk are two thirty-something professionals living in Portland, Oregon. We are caring and compassionate and a little bit silly. We enjoy good times with good friends and we've never met a stranger.

name: Jill
about: I'm from the wonderful city of Portland and I love to get out for adventures!

name: Gary
about: Retired scientist and business owner.  I enjoy river rafting, skiing, hiking, music and traveling.  I've been an AirBnB host since the fall of 2015.  At home I like to cook, entertain and watch movies.  I love living in Portland and Multnomah Village in particular.

name: Susan
about: I'm an East Coast transplant to PDX and loving the small town feel of this big city. With a background in photography and the natural food industry, I have worked to connect with art and food in Portland. NOT at all hard to do! My work is at Blue Sky Gallery and I volunteer at People's Coop for two examples. Theater in Portland is fantastic, with big houses and small. Love outdoors and rowing on the Willamette.

name: John
about: Retired business professional. Active member of the Portland LGBT & Q community. Live for diversity in life and experiences. Love people and I enjoy being a host.

name: Martha And Tim
about: We are Portland natives and have been in our North Portland home for almost 20 years.  We are both from large boisterous extended families that mostly live in the area and enjoy hosting family meals.  We have two teenage daughters (one away to college, one in high school).  We enjoy hiking and biking (both road and mountain) in and around Portland and Oregon.  We also huge fans of all the great food and drink that the area has to offer, local cheese, berries, produce and craft beer, especially IPA.  Looking forward to sharing Portland with our Northberry Guests.

name: Travis
about: Hiya! I'm audio / visual artist, who fell in love with Portland on my first visit and made it home. The outdoors call to me, as well as well as popcorn, bicycles and climbing tress.

name: Stephanie
about: We are a small family who loves travel, culture, and nice food.  We like to treat others the way we like to be treated: with tolerance, respect, generosity and above all a great welcome!

name: Mark
about:
Hi there!  Welcome to the Portland!  I hope you have a great time here.  Oregon is a wonderfully beautiful and gorgeous state.  There's so much to do, from the fabulous restaurants, to the live music, festivals, skiiing, rafting, biking, kayaking, hiking and parks.  Such great wine and beer as well!

The former, wine, brought me to Oregon as a tourist, and soon I found myself attending wine school in Salem, just south of Portland 45 mintues.  I began my winery while attending enology/viticulture classes and have been making wine since 2006.  

I spent 11 years in the Air Force as a pilot, program manager and astroanutical engineer.  My two master's degrees are in Environmental Studies and International Relations.  I enjoy the outdoors immensely--hiking, biking, running, kayaking, etc.  I am more grounded and at peace in a place of natural beauty.  Thankfully Oregon and Hawaii have plenty of those places!  

An engineering job opened up on the island of Kauai as I was finishing school and I took this as a sign to begin making tropical wines.  I lived in Hawaii for almost three years and the second label, Island Mana Wines, was born during that time.  Mana means energy or spirit in Hawaiian.

The tasting room in downtown Portland features both my Oregon and Hawaiian wines, decorated in a relaxing island cottage plantation style.  The tasting room has a great vibe and energy.   I hope you can stop by and Taste the Spirit of Aloha with us during your stay.

I have hosted over 200 people at 4 different properties with over a 100 positive reviews.  While my location may change with time, the quality of hosting will continue to be welcoming and inviting.

I look forward to meeting you and hope you enjoy your stay in Portland!

Cheers,
Mark

name: Rose
about:
I am thrilled to welcome new friends to my home. I have been in the travel/tourism business for  years. I lived in Santa Fe, NM; Phoenix and Scottsdale, Arizona; San Diego and Los Angeles California; Racine, Wisconsin and Pensacola, Florida. I found a home in Oregon and moved here in 1997 discovering all of what I enjoyed in other places I've lived. I am an advocate for Oregon through my work and my hobbies. I enjoy seeing others discover the beauties of Oregon, especially of my 
friendly neighborhood. Sellwood is a great place to walk and discover the quaint Portland antique shops or to dine Al fresco at the neighborhood food carts and a variety of wonderful restaurants. 

Since I love to travel. I am always looking for great places to visit and I have traveled to many countries over the years. Another reason I welcome people from near and far.

name: Megan
about: We are pleased that you are considering our studio for your trip to Portland and want to do everything we can to make you feel at home.  A little bit about us (Megan and Neil), we met online and got married on a downtown Portland rooftop in 2013.  We now have a little baby girl who makes us very happy but keeps us very busy.  The studio that you are staying in was originally Megan's massage studio but with Neil's handy work has now been transformed into this wonderful bnb.  In our spare time we have game night, go out to some live music, take the boat out on the river, ride our scooters or head out to eat at one of Portland's many wonderful restaurants.  We both share the same passion of finding the ultimate relaxation and hope you enjoy!

name: Nicholas
about:
Im a friendly, easy going person.  I love to meet new people and find joy in sharing. Im a lover of all things creative! I spend a lot of time in the kitchen whipping up meals and experimenting with something Ive never made before.  I Have a studio outside my home that I am at frequently, currently designing porcelain cups for a client and designing other objects to reproduce and share with the world.  I Im a collector of odd and interesting objects. Collecting a listen to music is a favorite past time.  Back in Iowa I learned how to garden on an organic farm for a few seasons.  When I have the beds I enjoy growing vegetables.  I get out of town a few times a month to go on adventures, be it hiking, camping or some new town. I love to explore!  Rolling into summer you will find me biking around the city and hitting up the swimming spots, or on a home made bike powered raft my friends and I built.

I love to hear peoples stories, Im a great listener and compassionate soul.  I read people well and am very adaptive so I can be the most engaged host or hands off depending on your needs.

name: Cris & Michelle
about: We've traveled to many places (New York, Mexico & Italy are favorites), but the beautiful Pacific Northwest is home.  We thrive in the fresh air (and, yes, the rain) of Oregon. We bought an old Portland home, fixed it up, and have been part of our neighborhood for 25 years.  We value community, family and also privacy.  We are eager to meet our guests & guide them as much (or little) as they ask.

name: Laurel & Josh
about:
We love living in Portland, OR and think it's one of the greatest cities in the world. We love to travel too - the joy of peeking in and soaking up the good stuff of other places is an amazing privilege. We also LOVE hosting people and do it regularly as a rhythm of life - with friends, neighbors or passers-thru. The pleasure of helping someone enjoy life is second to none! So we'd love to point you our neighborhood's best spots like Extracto Coffee, the Kennedy School soaking pool, Red Fox Vintage flea market...Not to mention the art, the grit, the event that is Alberta Street. 

As for us, we love to laugh, live intentionally and we think no life should be without: impromptu dance parties, honest conversation, a daily walk or bike ride, something sweet to eat, and a good pillow.

name: Rachel, Dave & Sam
about: Our household of three humans (Dave, Rachel & Sam) and three animals (Captain, Banjo & Ellie) love to garden, craft, ride bikes, watch movies with friends, play boardgames, cook, read...you name it! We love having guests, we've had people stay from all over and we love getting a chance to learn about our guests, or just providing a cozy spot to crash for our guests on the go.

name: Dave
about: I'm a family man who loves the outdoors, adventures, and travel.

name: Kima
about: I love to travel, especially to countries where I can practice my Spanish and get some sun! Also love to meet fellow travelers and hear about their favorite destinations and travel vicariously through them....Summers in Portland can't be beat, and I spend as much time outside as possible: gardening, backpacking, or going to music festivals. Permaculture projects are a passion of mine--try out the solar oven on a sunny day--it really works!!

name: Sheilah
about: I own a small business that specializes in Danish and American Mid Century furniture, housewares and lighting. I have traveled to Japan, India, Central America, Indonesia, Asia and Eastern Europe. During these travels I traveled by plane, train, car, bike and one time on an elephant. Love discovering new places and cultures and have learned over the years to be flexible.

name: Bob And Karen
about:
We are both born and raised here in Oregon, working class, athletic, from big families. Artists on the side, we have restored and enhanced this old house to its original historic character. 

We travel whenever we get a chance, and love our life here in Portland. Several of our open-to-the-public art shows have been held here in our basement studio. That same space is now on Airbnb for guests to visit.

We're having a blast with Airbnb. The guests are always complimenting us, and nothing makes us feel better. What a great idea Airbnb is for everyone involved. As hosts, running an Airbnb is like traveling without leaving home.

Everywhere we go we meet locals who love nothing better than to open their lives and their homes to others. This is one of the best parts about travel. We hope you will get the same feeling when you stay here.

You won't forget this artistic one-of-a-kind historic place. We're glad to be your host on Airbnb.  We try hard to make sure you'll enjoy every minute of your visit. We're good at this. You'll be glad you stayed here.

name: Amy
about: My partner (Chie) and I are young professionals in healthcare. We recently moved to PDX from the Midwest and we've loved getting to know this city. We are happy to share recommendations of our favorite restaurants, coffee shops and bars. Let me know if you have any questions, would like to know more about the listing or moving to Portland :)

name: Simone And Jeremy
about:
We are both globetrotters who have made our way to Portland to find the forest, good wine and coffee, fresh food, and amazing community.  We love going on camping trips, dancing, doing yoga, growing and making our own food, BBQing in our backyard, and meeting other likeminded travelers.  

We've stayed on beaches, in backyards, hostels, huts, hammocks, hotels, motels, couches, floors, woods, boats, and beds.  We are stoked to provide a space for you to land and explore our town.  

Laughter is our medicine of choice...that coupled with adventure.

name: Jennifer
about: A Minnesota girl now living in Portland Oregon, raising two great kids. I am the program director for a large synagogue and my husband is the good kind of geek and is part of a software company (or two).I like canoeing, gardening and enjoying life. We have a charming family property here in Portland that we manage. I have watched my children grow up in it during family dinners and holidays. It is quaint and special.  Please consider it for when you come to town!

name: John
about: I am a native Oregonian and a small business owner. I enjoy doing yoga, playing electric bass and playing soccer in my spare time. I appreciate language and culture and love to travel. Islands and beaches and jungles are my favorite. I am happy to share my extra space at home and set you up for a great visit to my city!

name: Lolly
about:
I'm Lolly and my partner's name is Brice.  We are an easy going, quiet couple that enjoys traveling together.  We have two support dogs named Jack and Elfy. We enjoy trail running, board and video games, Netflix and exploring new cities. We are vegan.

Lolly uses they/them pronouns

name: Michelle
about: Happy, clean and dependable young adult. Lover of animals, travel and the outdoors. Thank you for considering me as a guest!

name: Anastasia
about:
I leave and have a cafe in Oakland, CA. 
I love to be happy. 
Clean, responsible, easy going.

name: Andrea
about:
It took me seven years to convince my family to sell our home in San Francisco and move to Portland, and I am thrilled to be living here! We purchased our home in 2014. 

I love gardening, writing fiction, reading, spontaneously bursting into song, and acting silly with my teenage daughter.

I'm also enthusiastic about learning, growing, & sharing what I've learned. Connect with me on Instagram: @portlandgenerocity

name: Jesse
about: Family, friends, hand-made food and drink, music

name: Joan
about: I am an environmental scientist and my partner is a photojournalist. We travel around the world documenting the science of climate change and the impact of our changing climate on our environment, animal habitat and people's lives, health  and their communities

name: Ruby
about:
Portland residents since 1997

Homeowners of an 1892 Victorian in the Eliot neighborhood 

My fiance and I live here too along with our dog

Creative, Gardener, Legal Beagle, Bicyclist, Fiber Artist  and Cook

name: Adelaide
about: I currently work as a teacher in outdoor education.  I have spent the last decade traveling around the world to nearly 50 countries (but I have been primarily based in Latin America) and in the search of my dream place to live, I finally found Portland! And I absolutely love it here!  Like most people, I enjoy great food and wonderful company.  I love time in nature, am a permaculturalist, and like foraging for, and fermenting, wild and cultivated veggies.

name: Irma
about: Transplanted to the great city of PDX almost 20 years ago.  Love it here!   Portland offers a livable city, great restaurants, friendly people, proximity to the mountains, ocean and a wealth of outdoor activities.

name: Erin
about:
I am an environmentalist who loves hiking, gardening, rafting, hunting for edible mushrooms, eating good food, drinking good wine, and curling up with a book. My husband, Alex, and I met while working for an environmental non-profit; he now runs an organization dedicated to the protection and restoration of Mt. Hood National Forest (one of the many wonderful places to visit during a trip to Portland - and we know all the good spots!). 

We also love to travel and enjoy meeting new people along the way. We have traveled extensively throughout the western United States with a focus on National Parks, Wilderness areas and whitewater. We have also traveled a good bit internationally, including to Costa Rica, Nicaragua, Thailand, Greece, Italy, England, British Columbia, Nepal, Mexico, Belgium, France, Germany, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Ireland.

name: Tamara
about: I like bikes of all flavors, music, and the sun, and I teach political theory at Reed College. I travel often, especially during fall, spring and summer breaks and like sharing my house with fellow travelers.

name: Simon
about:
I grew up in Portland and love the parks, bike paths and non-stop fun and adventure of the Pacific Northwest.  

When I'm not working, I mountain bike, kayak, ski and explore Portland.  I have a niece and nephew that visit frequently, so one of the rooms in my house is set-up for kids.

name: Alison
about:
Having worked the Portland culinary scene for many years, I'm slightly obsessed with eating, drinking, cooking, and posting up at many a bar and restaurant around town. With the other 25% of my time, I do things around my apartment, sorta like Pinterest but less mason jars and more dirt and power tools. I love interior design and think of my apartment as a proving ground for my next life as a designer. 

As a fellow traveler, I love traveling solo. I could go anywhere and be happy with the destination because when you travel alone, you're forced out of your comfort zone - you have to meet new people and share experiences. 

Ten years ago I worked on a fishing boat in Alaska. Today, I work as a marketing and product development consultant.

name: MocA & RyAn
about:
Ryan, Moca, and three adopted cats are living together in SE Portland since July 2012. Solar system was installed in March 2014. Ryan works a lot as a graphic designer/programmer (working at home office) and math/Photoshop tutor. Moca is the CFO of the household who is originally from Japan. :) Ryan and Moca now enjoy raising their first son who was born in September 2015.

We both love pasta, Ramen, dim sum and seafood. Ryan loves music and he has tons of digital music files in his computer as well as some records. We're truly in love with our former foster kittens. (They're not kittens anymore. Just young at heart.)

We're trying our best to maintain our house clean/neat although we have three cats & a baby. Our secret is to spend a few minutes every day to clean.

name: Scot
about:
I'm a freelanced video editor.   I'm friendly, but respectful of a person's private space.   I'm very into walking (I hike in Mt. Tabor park every morning), photography, racquetball, reading, movies, and craft breweries, of which there seem to be no end around here.  I know just enough spanish to embarrass myself, but I enjoy speaking it.  I like people, animals, and living in this amazing city.  

I can give you lots of ideas about pubs, restaurants, hikes, things to do while you are in Portland, but I am also fine leaving you alone to explore on your own, if you would prefer that.  There are a TON of different food types and styles within walking distance of here.

I believe the best of life really happens when you're outside.  But if the weather sucks, this great house at least allows one to sit in front of a cozy fireplace and watch the world go by. 

As may be apparent, I'm new to this hosting adventure, so I don't have many reviews yet.  But I think it is worth a small leap of faith, to stumble across a great place like this!

name: Amanda
about: I work in the digital department of an advertising agency by day and occasionally moonlight as a DJ by night. I love travelling and experiencing new places in an authentic way. Let me know if you have any questions!

name: Kaffka
about:
I am a cold water surfer and dedicated yoga practitioner with a very close knit extended family nearby. We often get together for meals and holidays. This a very family friendly home. 

We are excited to meet travelers from different places and am happy to give guidance about Portlands many offerings.

name: Gary
about: I live in Portland, Oregon, USA, where I design and build wood furniture. I also teach furniture making classes and write for several woodworking magazines. My writing is for both profit and fun, non-fiction and fiction. I garden almost year round and in December am still eating tomatoes from the garden. It has been great meeting folks during their stay here in Portland.

name: Ed & Ann
about: Hi, we're Ed and Ann.  We've lived in Portland a long time and love our city!  We're excited to help people experience all it has to offer.  We enjoy the many eclectic neighborhoods, fantastic restaurants, and independent shops.  We both work in the field of education - Ann as a success coach to college students, Ed as chief electrician for a large public school district.

name: James
about:
I'm an experienced marketing professional, writer, and seven-continent world traveler who enjoys calling Portland, Oregon home. 

My partner Robby and I enjoy cooking, the great outdoors, the coast, a good book, time with his family and nephews, and good friends.   Originally from Wyoming and New Jersey, you'll find us to be down-to-earth -- with a keen appreciation for cities and taxidermy. (Don't worry -- there is no taxidermy in the apartment rental and no animals have been hurt in this posting.)

We support and champion arts and culture in Oregon by serving on the Board of Directors of the Oregon Symphony and the Foundation Board of the Portland Japanese Garden.

Life Motto -- Breathe deeply and never turn down an adventure.

name: Trystan And Biff
about: Trystan is a fundraiser for a youth-serving nonprofit, based here in Portland. Biff is a social worker and full-time parent to Hailey and Riley, ages 5 and 8. We love live music, reading stories, and going to the park. We also LOVE traveling, and intend to use Air BnB to allow others to make use of our home whenever we're out of town!

name: Susie (With David)
about: We are a warm, welcoming couple.  We love great conversation, hiking, reading, and great food.  We enjoy keeping life simple and appreciating each day.  Encountering new and interesting people is one of life's many great joys.

name: Steve
about: I'm a married father of two young girls, a former middle/high school teacher, banker, and startup entrepreneur, and a current co-founder of (URL HIDDEN)  I'm also an outdoor enthusiast, an avid reader and a youth soccer coach.  I have lived primarily in the Portland area since I was 8 years old, but I have also lived in and/or traveled throughout North America, Europe and East Asia.  My favorite pastimes involve my family and good Italian food, a drizzly fall day playing soccer at the local park, or a cup of coffee and a magazine or a good novel.

name: Kate
about: Originally from San Luis Obispo, CA, I moved to Portland in 1994 to experience life in a larger town.  It's grown considerably since then, but Portland still feels like a collection of small towns within city limits.  Tripping around our city's districts to explore the vibrant arts scene, top-notch restaurants, and intelligent urban planning makes Portland an exciting place to visit.  I work as a pre-school teacher at a bilingual Montessori school and run a Spanish language program for children.  I lived in Barcelona, Catalonia from (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) where I developed language programs and taught English through the arts + hand-on activities.  My family owned and operated an international youth hostel in California, which cultivated an intrigue in all walks of life and an appreciation for travel. I speak English, Spanish, Catalan, and a handful of Turkish.

name: Lorraine & Ray
about:
Hi. We're a couple in our 40s and empty nesters.  Our boys are grown (21 and 22) and both have moved away.  As both are no longer "kids", we hope to do more extended traveling.  Both of us work in technology and sometimes have the luxury of working remotely.....maybe from your town one of these days :)    

We're very active folks and love playing outdoors.  We also love food.  So if you have any great recommendations for outdoor recreation and great dining, we'd love to hear them!

We're Airbnb hosts in our hometown of Portland OR.  Great place for outdoor play and dining!

name: Greg
about: Hi. I'm a California transplant but I've lived in Portland for over 13 years. I love the Pacific Northwest; it feels like home to me. I enjoy meeting new people and sharing stories. I'm looking forward to hearing yours.

name: Charlie
about: I work downtown so if you have any questions or want places to check out, just ask!

name: Manuel
about: Young very active individual that loves trying new things. I've been described as an eclectic individual. I've competed  in kickboxing,MMA(cage fight) and I also moonlight as a  partner dance instructor to give you an idea of my range. I like going to concerts, comedy shows, or any form of entertainment. My dream place to travel to would be Cuba.

name: Francis
about: Student, World Traveler, Soccer player, pc gamer

name: Jennifer
about:
My husband and I have 2 young boys and love our neighborhood. We have been living in our home since 2007 and built this studio guest home in 2008 when I was pregnant with my first son.  And yes, when I say we built it...I mean we physically built it ourselves with some very generous friends.

We love doing home projects and spending time with our boys camping, hiking, etc...

Please let us share our wonderful city and neighborhood with you. :)

name: Megan
about:
I’m a young musician living the dream in the city I love. Since I enjoy eating out I stay current on all the hip new restaurants, bars, and Portland attractions. I love connecting with people over a good meal, helping people discover my beautiful city, sharing travel stories, and making new friends.
My favorite things to do are dancing Argentine tango, playing music with friends, and exploring all of Portland’s wonderful restaurants.

name: Sarah
about: I live in Portland, OR, originally from the Midwest. I have a 10 year old great dane/lab mix named Yogi and he is so great. I love running and just signed up for my fifth marathon. I love traveling, especially to warm and sunny places and meeting new people.

name: Roger
about: My partner Josh and I are a same-sex couple who have been together for 26 years.  We relocated to Portland, Oregon from Vermont in 2010 and love it here.  We are both professionals who work full-time.  We enjoy local restaurants, theater events, hiking and cycling.

name: Garrett
about:
We fit Portland stereotypes pretty well. I bike, hike, play board games, and love exploring the urban environment. I work as a renewable energy marketing manager and photographer. Though I'm an engineer by training, more recent vocations include bartending, political campaigns, and nonprofit direction. 

My partner Amanda (who co-manages our listing) is an advocate for sustainable land use. You’ll be lucky to meet our roommate Matt if he’s not on the road in his role as Executive Director of a national civic engagement nonprofit.

I'm a proud Oregonian, but I grew up overseas, which helped inspire wanderlust... I've done a fair bit of shoestring global vagabonding, and I love traveling vicariously by chatting with others on the road.

name: Randy
about: I am a Airbnb host in Portland, Oregon starting July 2016 and love it. I am an avid scuba diver and have been in the hospitality business for 30 years. More to follow.

name: Rachel & Doug
about: We love to travel and recently just got back from a month in Mexico volunteering. Loved that my daughters hitchhiked, attempted Spanglish with strangers and volunteered of their time. Meeting new people is a dying art!

name: Kurtis
about:
A Seattle native, I love Portland for its weirdness, great outdoors, and incredible beer and food. 

I love traveling, especially to the tropics where I can scuba dive.

The Mariners, Seahawks, Huskies, Blazers, and Timbers are all really important to me, and hit me up for some sports statistics anytime.

Sometimes you can find me skiing Mount Hood, camping with my wife and kids, canoeing the Willamette, sipping a local craft beer while listening to live music, or hanging out in our glorious backyard.
Sometimes you can't find me, because I'm off on another adventure, like the time we camped in Baja with the baby and then kept driving  to Belize...
Ask me about it sometime, I love to swap travel stories!

name: Linda
about: I'm a self employed artist, author and art instructor. I have an 8 year old lab mix named Jack and I love to be out in nature with him. Originally from Hawaii, I'm a pretty laid back and love to meet new people.

name: Mary
about: middle aged fiber artist.loves to travel.

name: Alexandra
about:
Hi. We are a couple living in Portland. 
We have lived in New York and Portland. We like to travel and discover interesting places and people. We are honest, responsible and caring. We often had friends staying at our place, when they traveled to NYC and now Portland and treat them with respect and care. We know what it means to be a good host and a good guest, at the same time.

name: Rachel And Joe
about: writer/musician originally from los angeles.  building a cozy haven here in portland oregon with husband joe (from minnesota, who builds fabric structures in the sky), his little girl joy, our new baby willy cosmo, and our big orange kitten maximoose.

name: Malia
about: I'm an artist and designer capable of finding amusement is most anything analog. I recently restored my home of 22 years after spending ten years in NYC. I enjoy meeting people and will be happy to tell you where the great spots are for coffee or a beer. I work at home in a studio separate from the house and enjoy time working on the yard or throwing sticks for my cats.

name: Marisa
about: I'm a New Yorker, transplanted to Portland. I run a math education non-profit, focusing on exceptionally talented high school students. When I'm not chatting math with smart & cool teenagers, I spend my time brewing pourover coffee, mixing modern and classic cocktails, doing the crossword, playing music, and visiting my favorite cities worldwide.

name: Michael
about:
About Michael:
I am a full time student studying Environmental Science duel enrolled at Portland State University and PCC. When I am not studying I love to go hiking with my girlfriend (Marissa, as seen in photo), rock climbing, play board games, and road tripping any chance I get. 

About Anna:
I absolutely love spending time with people and exploring Portland. I'm currently a student at PSU as an Environmental Studies major, and plan to become an advisor or teacher at some point in my life. I'm also an avid hiker, I bike any chance I get, and I enjoy listening to music, reading, and dancing among many other things. My work consists of many different avenues, but I won't bore you with the details. 

Enjoy your stay in Portland and thanks for checking out our place!

name: Deborah
about: Children's book illustrator living in Portland, OR.

name: Laurie
about:
I am a boomer era professional and I've lived in Portland for 30 plus years. I love Portland's older architecture and the feel of the inner east side neighborhoods that cluster from the river to Mt. Tabor and beyond. I moved into the Buckman neighborhood in the Hawthorne area in 1983 because it felt like home. It was still known as "little bohemia", where progressive and "quirky" "alternative" types were working to connect and increase the community feeling of the area. Way back when the cool cafes followed the community oriented people into these now trendy neighborhoods. Most of the rough edges have been polished off now and new urban shifts are taking their place for better or worse, but you can still feel the roots of the area, thank goodness. 
I'm an animal person, mostly vegan, gluten free, and happy to be a resource for healthy dining possibilities in the area. I host a folk music radio program on the local community radio station, KBOO, 90.7fm, kboo dot fm on the web, and usually feature live folkies from here and traveling through on my show. 
I have been a green, progressive, and gay friendly realtor for the past 28 years, specializing in homes with character, woodsy retreats, and small plexes, on the inner east side and all around Portland and certain outer areas.  If you're considering a move here, I'm happy to talk with you about Portland or about real estate.
My husband is a jazz, Afro Cuban, and Latin jazz drummer who leads a fiery hot, Latin, salsa and jazz band, Pa'lante. 
Music is a big part of our lives.

name: Gwen
about:
Active mostly retired couple from Portland, Oregon.
Gwen grew up in Portland and Randy has lived here since 1973.
We enjoy the outdoors both urban and wilderness, hiking and kayaking.
Randy is an avid birder and bird photographer and we usually have many feeders out.  We will try to make your stay as enjoyable and relaxing as possible.

name: Syrrah
about:
Hello~ 
I love traveling and facing the randomness.

name: Michelle
about: My life is a delicate balance of family, work, and fun. Our two little girls keep us on our toes. I design children's playscapes for a living and run the families rental properties. You might see me around the neighborhood riding my bike, at Hop Works Urban Brewery (HUB) or hiking with the girls. We love Portland and all the amazing things it has to offer.

name: Andrea
about:
Hi! My name is Andrea and I'm from Portland, Oregon. I'm looking forward to sharing my home with you! I've traveled through a handful of countries, with Santorini, Greece being my favorite location. 
Happy to provide info on the local places to try in Portland!

name: Dryden
about: I'm an avid rock hound, vinyl collector, wine drinker, crafter, and connoisseur of Portland quirk.  Originally from the South, am known to be chatty and would love to give you food, shopping, and exploring recommendations.

name: Alex
about: I travel a lot for work and it seems I'm back in Portland only around half the time lately.  Most of my travel is to Asia which is fun but I wish I had more time for sightseeing.

name: JP And Elke
about:
My wife Elke and I have been married for 10 years! We have many shared interests including music, travel, outdoor recreation, urban farming and gardening, animals, and craft beer. We love living in the Pacific Northwest, and Portland is where we have called home since 2009. We met in LA when we were both students in college studying music. 

I grew up in the suburbs of Portland but orginally transplanted from California, and Elke is a transplant from British Columbia, Canada. We are currently both professional musicans and spend most of our time recording, rehearsing, and performing locally and nationally. 

My favorite things include: playing bass, traveling, podcasts, live comedy, and enjoying a craft beer on a nice patio. Favorite travel destination: Costa Rica. Would most like to visit: Amsterdam

Elke's favorite things include: singing and playing acoustic guitar, traveling, yoga, gardening, urban farming, dancing, and wine tasting. Favorite travel destination: Germany. Would most like to visit: Thailand

We are generally quite social, but also appreciate quiet down time. We respect the privacy of our guests and want them to feel comfortable in our space. If we are relaxing in a communal space such as the livng room, patio, or garden, we invite you to feel welcome to join us. Otherwise, we are typically quite busy, so our paths may only cross from time to time during your stay as a guest.

name: Tim  + Susie
about:
Tim: Father, designer, artist, doodler, traveler, kind heart and busy hands. I work as a graphic designer during the day and a tinkererer in the evening.

Susie: Mother, banker, and lover of travel.

name: Emma
about:
Currently i teach ballet, Pilates, yoga, and write nonfiction (don't need to make stuff up when life's o-so-interesting already). Dirk, my husband, is an electric guitarist, and though he's more of a rocker, he's been playing ambient music live for my yoga classes and recently finished a yoga CD. In other words: we're artists, and living in Portland--land of roses and rivers and a vibrant cultural scene--which is about as good as it gets. Dirk is a foodie and the first time he cooked for me i announced, "That's it. You're cooking from now on." Baking is my thing. 
Years ago i ran a B&B in Newport, RI, so i'm well-versed on hosting guests. We look forward to meeting you!

name: Tracy
about: I live in Portland OR. I work in the travel industry. Married with two teenage sons.  Travel is my passion

name: Laurie
about: I am a Wisconsin native but have been living in Portland for the past 8 years and love calling it home.  I own CrossFit PE in SE Portland and lead  a very active and healthy lifestyle. I love to travel and have spent time in India, Nepal, Thailand and New Zealand.  I have used Airbnb myself and prefer to share people's homes when doing so to meet new people and have the opportunity to find out more about the place I am visiting.

name: Maria
about: I've lived and traveled all over the world.  I love people...and most importantly, I love to make people feel taken care of.  That's just who I am.  I truly want you to have everything you need to have an easy and memorable time in our beautiful city of Portland, Oregon.

name: Fernando
about: Hello!  I am a flight attendant based out of PDX (Portland Airport)  So Cal born and raised.  My place is available while I am out of town on layovers or traveling.  When I am home I love to explore Portland.  I walk or ride my bike everywhere and my place is in the perfect location for it!  Mi casa es su casa! :)

name: Susan
about: I've lived in Portland's Ladd's Addition neighborhood for over 23 years originally hailing from L.A. and living for a few years each in NYC, Maui and the eastern Sierra Mountains. Hospitality is in my DNA, having previously managed vacation rentals in Nicaragua and on Maui. I'm a passionate backpacker, fly fisher and cyclist and gardener, growing perennials and organic vegetables.  I love to eat and seek out new fine dining opportunities as well as unique food trucks and I'm happy to share them with you. During your stay, I can lay low, offering privacy or be a resource for your intro to Portland's many interesting offerings. For inspiration, these evocative words speak volumes to me. " Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray"......Rumi

name: Gerald
about: I like to meet new peoples go to new places. I have worked hard my whole life to enjoy life and the people I meet in it.

name: Evolve Vacation Rental
about: Evolve Vacation Rental Network is redefining vacation rental management by eliminating hassle, guesswork and frustration for homeowners and travelers. Our team is available 7 days a week and we look forward to providing you with exceptional customer service during every interaction. Please tell us how we can help with your upcoming trip.

name: Tracy
about:
Hi there travelers!  My name is Tracy and I am new to hosting on Air B and B.  I am a musician, singer/songwriter.  I own a mobile DJ/KJ company and perform at weddings, events, clubs etc.  I love all types of music, but when performing, I usually sing R and B, blues, classic rock!  I also dabble in Real Estate.  

I am a people person with good communication skills.  I love everything about entertaining people and thought air b and b would be another way to share!

name: Caroline
about:
I am a progressive easy going responsible woman who loves to travel, eat, laugh, spend time with friends, family and explore the outdoors. Like most Portlanders, I thrive on living a vibrant life and I love sharing our great state with others! 

You can be assured that you will be well taken care of here. My extensive travels throughout the world and my experience hosting guests at one of the wests premiere hunting and fishing lodges can assure you an enjoyable and comfortable stay in Portland. Community is important to our city, for my neighborhood and myself. I am lucky to be in a neighborhood filled with wonderful small businesses and great people of all colors and professions.  In Portland, our community is your community. You just may end your travel wanting to stay right here and become a Portlandian. 

HOSTING/TRAVEL: I search to find those who point me in a safe direction and allow me to create my own adventure. I strive to do the same for others.

LIFE MOTTO:  While I don't live by one motto I do keep close the following advice I've been lucky to receive...
1. Life is always grey - don't live in the black and white..
2. Being compassionate, generous and open will move the world in wondrous ways.
3. Rules are meant to be blurred.
4. Keep your word. Authenticity is a rare and valued quality. Get it and keep it. 
5. Wear horizontal stripes and crazy socks. A natural mood elevator, they make people smile. 
There are so many more but these come to mind.

name: Judith
about: love adventures and travel, but also love my home base. Im pretty solitary and introverted but love to chat sometimes with folks. Overall I love life and the stillness of its beauty.
city: all over but call my home base between NY

name: Tiffany
about:
My husband Marshall Johnson and I have a three year old daughter, Pearl Valentine and she has a big personality in a tiny body.  We love the Richmond neighborhood and appreciate the fact we can walk and ride bikes to amazing shops and restaurants.  My favorite spot is Mt. Tabor, a forest oasis with parks and trails. 

I love to garden and can regularly be found digging in the dirt.  Pearl is a world class worm collector and is right by my side.  I also love a good book and am very proud of myself I figured out my technology to get the Library mobile app so I can take it wherever I go!

We have two cats and a great dog we like to take to the park.  We are laid back and easy to communicate with and would love to share our favorite things about this city with you!

name: Arian
about:
I am a 42 year old professional working in software sales downtown Portland. As an English and German major in college, I spent ten years living in Germany where I did everything from being a pizza chef, shoe sales, bartender, Mercedes Benz builder, to ultimately running my own business as a teacher and translator for tech companies and the city ballet. In all of my travels and experience I have loved the interaction with people from all cultures and walks of life. 

I personally love modern, minimalist spaces, mid-century modern design, guitars, music of all kinds, as well as interesting, creative people and places. Very easy going, clean, respectful, and looking forward to my stay with you. Or hosting you in Portland!

If you stay at my home I assure you I will do everything I can to make your visit comfortable and fun, helping you enjoy this wonderful city during your stay. 

Thanks!
Arian

name: Cristina
about:
Hi, 
I'm a Spanish teacher here in Portland, OR and have been exploring this fine city for the last 5 years. I love my neighborhood and all the amazing things that Portland has to offer (especially in the summer and fall) so I'm always excited when people come explore this place. Originally from Romania, I've traveled and continue to travel the world with friends and family. Life feels so short with the millions of sights and songs and smiles out there to experience. 
I love taking photos, cooking for friends and coming up with creative little projects (of which I actually finish maaaaybe 20%). I once decorated my fridge like a crystal palace with rabbit-fur lined egg bowl and 24k gilded goose eggs, etc.... one of my AirBnB guests took a photo of some of the items, photoshopped her face into the egg bowl and printed it out it for me. BEST THANK YOU NOTE EVER! No pressure :)
While I probably won't be in town during your stay, I'm happy to share recommendations for my favorite dining, wining, hiking, music, dancing, celebrating, picnicking spots (you name it). My typewriter will be ready to go with paper for you to leave me your own recommendations, a poem, a story, whatever made your visit special. 
Enjoy!
Cristina

name: Mana
about: The Blue Heron Ohana is directly behind our home. We are across from the restored Westmoreland Park. You can walk in the park and enjoy native plants, peaceful paths and NW birds and wild life. Within walking distance there are excellent restaurants, pubs, grocery stories, theatre and the best antique resource in Portland, The new Orange MAX line is just across the park. The deck of the Ohana is directly above our gardens. Relax and enjoy the calm and peaceful space as you explore Portland life.

name: Tara
about: Originally from Ireland, I returned to Portland a couple of years ago after a decade in New York.  I had forgotten how beautiful it is here and it's good to be back.   My main interest is food - cooking it, eating it, growing it, reading about it! After that is's music, sunshine, yoga, swimming in the ocean, riding my bike, and a lot of tomfoolery with my kids - 11 and 3. We try to make our home a peaceful and relaxing place.

name: Shareshten
about:
I am a hippie, there is no TV, there are short tables, throw pillows and two large desks, as this is usually my office.  There is a meditation, practice, massage space up stairs which can be converted to another bedroom with full closet.

I love light & creativity & people makind magic in my space, enjoying life, each other, creativity, spirit! Live on!!!

name: Emily
about: Fitness professional and business owner who travels for work and play!   I am easygoing and have been in Portland for 10 years and LOVE this place.  Would be happy to help point you in the right direction to make your stay here awesome ;).

name: Sam
about: Hi my name is Sam and my wife's name is Maureen. We are originally from Fiji Island but now live here in Portland Oregon. We are a family that enjoys the simple things in life such as spending time outdoors and traveling to see new places. We are eager to provide a space that you can enjoy and leave feeling refreshed.

name: David
about:
I'm as easy and chill as they come, a career professional who has worked corporate for nearly twenty years and one who believes in Karma - please come and enjoy my nest of a home during your travels to Portland. 
Airbnb is built on relationships so I hope to build one with you during your stay. 
Thank you for visiting and considering my home as your nest while in Oregon.

name: Judy
about: I base this apartment on my Mom, Hattie, who was the most resilient, tough, and loving person I know.  Her beauty is reflected in all I do.  Together we bought this 4-plex in the 90's and it's a testament to her faith in me that I continue with it and share not only the apartment as I continue to upgrade it, but her favorite and the most beautiful Rose garden in the park directly across the street.

name: John
about:
When I travel I like to enjoy the communities I visit.   Rather than a Hotel, I find homes much more inviting and welcome the knowledge from the Host of the area.

I enjoy cycling, swimming, dance and yoga.   Many of my travels as of late are a low key with visiting cafes and reading.  Being from Portland, seeing the sunshine is also very important.  That will be a big draw where ever I go.

I travel lite, and have fun while I go.  I am not picky at all, and like diversity.  

My best to you!

name: Dave
about:
Hi, I'm your host, Dave. I currently work as Systems Business Analyst for Portland Parks & Recreation.  My family consists of one young son, Walker, and my partner, Roland, who's an engineer for the Bonneville Power Administration. We have been together since 1991 and are both originally from Southern Idaho and graduates of the University of Idaho.

We love to travel and have been all over North America, we hope to go further when our son is older. Roland has made several trips to Europe. We can appreciate that when you travel it is essential that you have a clean, private, and comfortable place to stay. 

We are very low-key hosts and are very happy to advise you or leave you alone. We have Portland visitors guides and local recommendations at the ready. We look forward to your visit.

name: Ginger
about:
I'm a Pacific NW girl with a zest for travel who recently returned (back) to Portland after time abroad.  I travel a lot for work and pleasure and believe that getting tips and tricks from locals is the best way to explore!  

I've used airbnb for years as a guest and always had positive experiences, which is why I want to return the favor to fellow travelers looking to explore Portland.  Prior to my time away  I spent several years in Portland, so I have lots of local tips and tricks for exploring the city in whatever way works best for you (happy hour expert).   As a guest, I tend to be an independent and respectful traveler who always appreciates a bit of local insight.  

I rarely meet a place I don't find a bit of magic in but Spain, Portugal, Italy and Thailand are places that instantly come to mind when I start dreaming of my next adventure.   

"I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list"

name: Kundai & Brenda
about: We love and live in Portland, OR. One of us is an academic; the other is a licensed professional counselor. We love the outdoors, live jazz, and exploring the many wonderful culinary options available to us in Portland.

name: Colony
about: A mid-century icon

name: Sue
about: I am an east coast girl who made my way west. I have been living in Portland for almost 10 years and feel lucky to call it my home.  I love to cook, travel and snowboard.  I play second base on a competitive kickball team and I can't get enough live music in my life.

name: Skye
about: We enjoy biking, running, hanging out with friends and dogs. Five things we can't live without? Our spunky dog, nice weather, clean house, good beer and friends.

name: Julio
about:
Hi! This is Julio, avid traveler and longtime Portland resident! I love hosting travelers via Airbnb! And also Ariel Wilsey-Gopp helps me with all communication and reservations.

A little bit about me: 
Julio is self-employed as a General Contractor, and very active in the Argentine Tango and Salsa dance communities here in Portland. He scuba dives, sky dives, and is active with Capoeira as well. He loves to travel and meet new people, is very social and outgoing, but appreciates a quiet place to call home.


As an experienced traveler, I know the importance of finding the right spot to call home while you're away from home. Recently in Puerto Rico I used Airbnb ourselves to locate a charming 2nd story apartment with a lovely host to call home for a week! I explored the "real" Puerto Rico - from food to nightlife and community. That's my style; yours may be different.

Every listing on Airbnb holds value for different people via the host, location, and amenities. During your stay I will ensure that we communicate as to what is important to you. Do you want help finding classically Portland things to do? Do you want to be led off the beaten path a bit? Do you want to a key and nothing more? We have lived in Portland for over a decade. I am very active in the community, and know a diverse cross-section of the city. I am more than happy to point you in the direction you'd like to go.

Come visit my beautiful city and have a cup of coffee with me on my patio!
Julio 

    Ariel Wilsey-Gopp also helps me with all communication.

name: Laurie
about: I'm the principal of Lumin Communication & Design in Portland, Oregon. I love spending time with my family; being in the outdoors in general, skiing, hiking. I am a big fan of playing and watching tennis; traveling; a chill happy hour; a delicious dinner; the list goes on!

name: Gwen
about: We are Gwen and Reg Sylvester, a young married couple living in awesome Northeast Portland with our 10 year old Alaskan Malamute. We love the foodie lifestyle of Portland - please ask us for restaurant or bar recommendations when you come to stay with us!

name: Deborah
about: I have been in Portland so long that I consider myself a native and raised all four of my children in this house. I work as a nurse practitioner, but I love to travel and use AirBnB almost exclusively for my accomodations. I have found it a wonderful way to stay in a warm, cozy environment and meet new friends!

name: Peter And Lila
about:
Greetings! I am a born New Englander now proud Oregonian. Prior to residence in the Pacific Northwest I lived in North Carolina for 10 years. Love traveling and experiencing new people, places, landscapes and food. In addition to my varied adventures within the States, I've sojourned throughout Europe, both coasts of Mexico, Jamaica, Russia and Canada. Would like to eventually visit Pacific Island(s) and New Zealand. Recently secured dual Irish citizenship via Foreign Births Registration process. Éirinn go Brách!!! My wonderful parents still live in Maine so I return to the east coast usually once a year. Lila and I share our  townhouse here in Portland with our two eclectic felines Schroeder and Lucy. Looking forward to hosting and visiting some new friends within Airbnb Community.

Hi I'm Lila. I'm originally from Alaska and have lived in Portland for eight years.  I'm presently a student and a bartender with the ultimate goal of working as a social worker for the elderly. 

I enjoy reading, traveling, bocce ball, beaches, parks, music, camping, road trips, swimming, going to festivals, cocktails with friends and at least a couple other things  :)

I'm a huge advocate for airbnb.  Peter and I earn a few extra bucks and more importantly meet new, amazing people.  We have hosted musicians, actors, world travelers, authors, fellow residents of Portland and other unique and interesting individuals.

name: Jenny
about: Hello! I am a native Portlander who loves rom-coms, singing to Top 40 hits, bibimbap, creating stuff, and ignoring my lactose intolerance. I'm generally an introvert with extrovert tendencies but love to share with folks the things I love most about my hometown, including my lovely oasis of a home! I can't wait to host you in your exploration of our unique city!

name: Steve
about: Steve moved with his wife to Portland in 2004 from Alaska, where they had lived for about 30 years.  He loves the endless outdoor activities available in the surrounding areas as well as being closer to his family in Oregon. He and his wife love to host people in their own AirBnB and welcome the opportunity to share ideas on how to enjoy the area with others.

name: Audrey
about:
I arrived in Portland June 3rd to be closer to my children.
I am from Brooklyn Heights New York where I had  a lovely studio apartment with views of lower Manhattan. I am a recent NYC retiree. I worked as a communications specialist/editor for the New York City Employees' Retirement System.  My professional background was in nonprofit organizations until the financial crash in 2008.  I am a fan of Jane Austen novels, BBC productions, indie music, movies and theater. Though I speak only English, I have  traveled to Italy, Portugal, London, Greece, prewar Yugoslavia, Bath, Glasgow and way back when, to Morocco. I have a son who lives in Denver with his wife and 2 dogs. He is a copywriter and gourmet chef. My daughter lives in Portland and just graduated from Lewis and Clarke University, She  is an actor and director of  plays and founder of 'Anon It Moves' a Portland theatre company, and she is the coordinator of Portland's first upcoming Shakespeare Festival (2014-2016). She recently performed  Portland's first female Hamlet early summer.

name: Anne
about: I love living in the Pacific Northwest, outdoor adventures and travel!

name: Shawn
about:
Fun, energetic, adventuresome female.  I've been a neonatal intensive care nurse for almost 20 years.  Very creative, artsy, love the outdoors, and animals.
I'm very excited to start my journey as an Airbnb host.  I know how much I appreciate a clean, cozy place to stay when I travel, and I'm looking forward to providing that same environment to my future guests!

Love fresh food, ethnic, (read, "spicy") food, Zion, Paris are my favorite spots.  Play guitar/sing.  Favorite book is Lonesome Dove, love movies, just saw, "Saving Mr. Banks," and I loved it so much...guess it reminded me of my childhood watching Disney.

I'm quiet and respectful as a guest....very self-sufficient...but welcome input from the "natives."

name: Jamie
about: I'm an active 30-something, living in Portland, Oregon, US.  I own my own business, play soccer, am an avid reader and love a good adventure.

name: Meggie
about: Originally from NY, moved to Portland in 2005 and haven't been able to leave since!

name: Lisa
about: I love the outdoors, road trips, camping, cycling, skiing, fishing...

name: Mikalina
about:
I've lived all over the US but for the last 20 years Oregon has been my home. Portland is a great little city with plenty of rain, coffee, tea and good food to keep me happy.

I'm currently finishing my bachelor's degree at Portland State University.  I am a writer and my husband Marshall is a writer and entrepreneur. We have lived in Portland for 10 years, we love our city and love sharing it with others. 

We've stayed in AirBnB's around the US and also in France, and we are excited to host folks from out of town.  I love a good road trip. So far I've traveled outside the US to Canada, Mexico, Ireland, Amsterdam, Brazil, and France. I would love to go to Vietnam and Bali, next, and to explore more of Europe.  

When I travel I love to find little out of the way places that the locals visit. I also love to visit parks and grocery stores in new countries.

name: Katherine
about: I love receiving house guests, and enjoy orienting them to the city. My shelf and file of visitor information is a good start, and I often discover new things when I have guests. I grew up in the San Francisco area and have lived in Kiel, Köln, Chicago, New York City, São Paulo, Fort Lauderdale and the Bahamas.

name: Hal
about: I am a musician and college professor with a lifelong love of learning and growing.  I love theater and live music, and perform regularly in the Northwest.  My favorite travel destinations include Italy and Hawaii.  I am an easygoing person who values honesty and integrity, and have lived in Portland since 1999.  I share my life with my wife and two cats, my 100 year old father, and many lifelong friends.  I look forward to meeting new people through Airbnb.

name: Leo
about:
Howdy Do! 
Big Fan of people here, glad to meet and have at least brief interactions and cerebral interludes with the whole sh'bang and gamut of characters this planet provides.  Travel feeds me well.  Another way to get that vitamin supplement from life in the times between travelings is to be part of another's adventure in some small way.  Hence, my own fondness for travel and the moments of feeling at home in the most remote stretches of the world is what brings me to AirBnB.  

I have warm, inviting space to spare, as well as energy and ideas about this pretty city that I dug so much I had to buy a little plot in it for myself and to SHARE with YOU!  Portland is beautiful.  I hope to make your travel far more enjoyable with a relaxing home base to replenish in between forays into the wild fray!
My darling, trusty, sweetheart William is my able co-host (though not pictured, he's shy...) and a sweet addition to the casa's general goodness!
He is a fine horticulturalist and hobbyist filmmaker..
Also as of May 27, 2015 we have a newborn son who is an awesome component of the tapestry around here. Our resting space is separate from the rest of the house for the most part, but we do share common space daily as well.
I do a little work from the home a couple days a week, but it ought never interfere with your autonomous fun having whilst here.  Let me know if I can help you with anything.

Personally~
 I'm an easy-moving, joyful, well-adjusted, silly critter, musician, painter, cook, writerly sort, interested in health and wholeness, Chinese herbal medicine (the eternal study continues!) and Acupuncture. I'm a traveler, an explorer, innate documentarian and story gatherer.  I'm handy, oft DIY-style, prefer  repurposing and re-using things and building materials in my projects.  
 I appreciate, to the point of deep reverence, the natural world's offerings and feel compelled to protect it with conscious consumption and recycling etc. I love clever design, architecture and texture in living/ working/ growing spaces as well.  Fond of dirt, making food and flora in it.  
Plenty to do in the loosely sketched canvas that a new piece of land provides. If it suits your fancy, feel free to join me gardening during your stay. It's always fun to putter about in the yard with folks!

See you soon, with any luck!
-Leo

PS~ Incase you've wondered: I think I've got a good lead on what the meaning of life is. 
Wanna hear it?
To Give Exchange and Explore Loving Energy as Earnestly, Thoroughly and Frequently as Possible is Why We are Here.
Feels about right to me, so I figure we may as well move about the cabin in kindness, gathering recipes, hugs, soul food, stories and songs along the way!

name: Charlena
about: Writer

name: Nancy
about:
I teach middle school band at Oregon Episcopal School and teach flute and music education at Lewis & Clark College - both in Portland Oregon. I'm a triathlete and a mom of two teenagers. My husband works at Reed College, also in Portland. He is into woodworking, and has recently finished hand-building an entire house on the Oregon coast. 

Our house is a one-minute walk from the city busses - number 44 and 45. Check (URL HIDDEN) for schedules (we live in Multnomah Village and you can use that as a reference - the bus stop is at the corner of SW 35th and SW Capitol Highway).

I speak passable French and Spanish, our son and daughter are fluent in Spanish and Mike is fluent in German.

name: Luz
about: Hi! I'm Luz! I'm a video editor and live in Portland, Oregon but I'm originally from Sevilla, Spain.  I love traveling and I've lived in different countries like Germany, Thailand and now USA. I also love to surf, hike, do yoga and learn new cultures and languages.

name: Susan
about:
Originally from So. Calif. I have been in Portland for about 35 years. I am retired and don't know how I managed to find time to work! I like re-modeling (less as my body gets older!) and gardening. I spend a lot of time involved with musical activities playing cello - orchestras and chamber music, and both singing and choral directing. I also very much like meeting new people and people from different places, and love to travel myself.
I am, also very lucky to have both of  my children living in Portland.

name: Kat
about:
I am the one on the left in the photo.  I love maps, running, and dragon boating. My fiancee, Dana is opening Float North, loves to cook, and is always reading a book or two or three. We are kind, friendly, and respectful people.

We are happy to open our home to travelers of all kinds and make your Portland experience enjoyable and interesting.

name: Max & Sam
about:
We're just an easy-going young international couple who loves meeting new people, trying new things and visiting new places.  

Demanding work schedules keep us preoccupied most of the time but our "Work-Hard / Play-Hard" mentality helps us balance it all out in the off-hours.  We started hosting on Airbnb a few years ago and have absolutely loved the experience.  We look forward to sharing our space and getting to be a part of the Airbnb community. 

Born in Calcutta India, Sam developed an absolute love of flavorful foods and is a "Foodie" thru-and-thru.  Spicy food is her specialty and she's known for carrying around a packet of red-pepper flakes in her purse as a "just-in-case" precaution against bland meals.  Max is a Portland native with a love of languages, sports and anything active.

name: Kelda Van Patten &
about: Joe is originally from Pennsylvania and lived in NYC for 10 years before moving to Portland. He's a graphic designer and enjoys being part of the Portland design community. Kelda is originally from the San Francisco Bay Area. She is a middle school art teacher. We enjoy cycling, hiking, visiting local cafes, shopping at estate sales and vintage shops, and eating! We've lived in this awesome neighborhood since 2012 and we think it's the best neighborhood in Portland. We love this house, the Alberta Arts district, and the city of Portland. We hope you too will fall in love with Portland. We strive to give our guests privacy, however we are available to offer local tips. Just ask! Dixie, our french bull dog, is almost always available for friendly company. She especially loves belly rubs.

name: Sam
about:
Dark chocolate makes me smile, Rain makes me chillax, Travel makes me happy. For Linh, it's Strawberries, Anthony Bourdain, and our little guys, Dash and Max. 

Dash is 5. He's got big eyes and an open heart. Max is 2.  He's a clown and has an awesome laugh. They've travelled extensively but their favorite part of any trip is the shuttle from the parking garage to the airport.
