I run a travel business that customizes programs to Asia, Africa and Latin America for educational institutions. I also lead walking tours in our neighborhood once in a while. I also used to be the Community Manager for Airbnb in Portland.

name: Mark
about: I am a married father of 3. My older son and daughter are in college. My younger son is a freshman in high school. I have a Masters degree in physical therapy. I have worked as a physical therapist for over 20 years. My wife Hayley recently sold her home staging business to pursue a Masters degree in nutrition from the National College of Naturopathic Medicine here in Portland.

name: Gillian
about:
Originally from the UK.  Like meeting new folks.  Hosted an Airbnb rental in San Francisco for several successful years.  Moved to the next happening place a year or so ago. Artist, grandma, reader.
I do my best to make my visitors comfortable, and feel at home.

name: David
about: Hi my name is David and I'm excited to host you! I am a dad to Ezra, age 10, and a clothing designer for the label Bright Volumes. In my free time I like to make and look at art, eat berries, swim in the river, ride bikes, go to the dog park with my dog Levy, dance and share meals with friends.

name: Michael
about:
Hi, I'm Michael. I live in northeast Portland with my girlfriend Amanda, our Jack Russell named Emma, our cat named Bang Bang, and three Indian Runner ducks.

We have been using Airbnb to travel since 2011 and hosting since summer of 2014. It's been a great way to meet people from all over the world and to get out of the usual neighborhoods when we visit other cities.

Our best trip so far was a quick jaunt into the Scottish Highlands. We centered around Glencoe and Glen Nevis and spent as much time as possible hiking around and climbing Ben Nevis. We also had a great trip to Yosemite to meet up with family, swinging through Sonoma and San Francisco on the way, and then Reno, National Caves Monument and Crater Lake on the way home. 


P.S. - We mostly speak English, but we both know a little Spanish. Amanda knows way more than me! I can also read a little French and Italian, just enough to Rue means street and buono means good....

name: Carolyn
about:
I love living in my NE Portland, Alberta District neighborhood.  The artful, eclectic and down-to-earth feel of Alberta is quite unique. 

I love traveling and working and have done so in Africa, Indonesia, SE Asia and Canada.  Most recently, I've been exploring rivers and coves outside of Portland.  When I travel, I appreciate a good bed, in a quite, private home-like setting.  And that's what I offer my guest.  As a new host it's been fascinating to hear people's stories and help them navigate their way around Portland.

I've lived in my house for about 15 years and have slowly created this lovely urban oasis.  I enjoy gardening, re-vintaging and creating cozy spaces where you can curl up and relax, or hang out and enjoy the gentle sounds of the city.

 Here in town,  I enjoy the many amenities of my local neighborhood: Zumba and meditation; great local libraries and book stores; the Columbia River; Downtown; cafes galore, galleries and hidden gems like the bathtub museum. I love the arts and culture that a city has to offer, especially modern dance, unusual places, and eclectic healing modalities. 

My motto: Walk in the the world the way you want the world to be.  Be with others so that we can more gently and greatly see ourselves.  And laugh.

name: Danny
about: My wife, Maria and I teach Pilates and yoga respectively. We enjoy hiking, dining, meditation, sports, movies and the arts.  We have a Boston Terrier named Posey.  We like clean well lighted places and a welcoming atmosphere which we strive to provide in our Portland Airbnb.  We like to meet people from many places and countries.  My wife is from Italy and speaks Italian, French and some Spanish.

name: Megan
about: I love to ride horses and try to as much as possible. I'm also a businesswoman and keep very busy with work. I travel all over the country and internationally on a regular basis. I can't wait to host you and here your stories!

name: Dorsey
about: I am an ecological landscape designer, and adventure lover. I love to travel near and far. When I'm home I love to putter around in my garden, and host dinner parties with plenty of delicious food and wine!

name: Chris
about:
My husband Mike and I most recently traveled to Belgium, Netherlands, Denmark and Germany. We loved getting to know our  AirBnB hosts and appreciated their advice on local attractions from and having a delicious home-prepped breakfast everyday! We look forward to meeting people from around the US and the world who stay with us in Portland. 

I am a personal chef, my husband is a technical writer. We have two children, ages 8 and 11. They may be here during your visit, though often they stay with their grandparents or friends when we have guests. 

I have traveled the US and Canada, Mike attended grade school in Ireland and university in Germany and traveled throughout Europe. 

We enjoy traveling light and by rail as much as possible, staying in quiet neighborhoods with a nearby grocery or market for picking up food for picnic lunches and restaurants/cafes frequented by locals. 

Five things I cannot live without, especially when traveling: good food, comfortable shoes, quiet time alone, wi-fi, something interesting to read.

name: Saadi
about:
For us it's a tale of two cities! We spend our time between Portland, OR and Phoenix, AZ because we enjoy so much of what each offers. The seasons allow us to Hike, Bike & take advantage of the outdoors year round.
We would love to share this with you as well as provide you with the comfort of a place you can call home. We are true believers of a Sharing Economy!

name: Lisa
about: Single female homeowner.  Moved back home to Portland from 40 years stay in San Francisco/Silicon Valley and loving it!  I love to garden, vintage/thrift shop, fix up my 107 year old home, read, watch documentaries, walk my dog, Roo and meet people.  My favorite spot to hike is the Lief Erikson Trail off Germantown Road in Forest Park.  I like to eat new things, hear new voices and see new places.

name: Donna
about: I love sharing our beautiful city of Portland with Airbnb guests.  There are so many delightful aspects to explore in this sweet spot on our bountiful planet.

name: Joanna
about: Traveling is a great love of mine and I have been so impressed by the gracious hosts & guests on Airbnb. Thank you for making this community a welcoming and friendly place!

name: Justin
about: I love traveling, hiking, biking, traveling, wildlife, plants, biology, science, games, and did I mention traveling? I like to spend a long time in a country when I visit... a month or more when possible.  Many of my trips have been over half a year.  I'm a considerate guest and host, I love to help out and make it a fun experience for everybody. I live by the golden rule.

name: Lilly
about: I am a mother to two fabulously fun to be with kids, a sweet and excitable dog, and a talented, knowledgeable and exceptional husband.  I teach art in a local public high school where I spend my days with students I feel lucky to work with. Art making and apprecaiting is an integrated part of our world. Travel is  essential as extended family are far away in other states and we like to get together often! We love life through laughter and exploring new directions of places, people, foods, music and artwork.

name: Michelle
about: I'm from Portland! I love the outdoors and drinking craft beer. We have a great space in the heart of NE Portland, great bars and restaurants right in walking distance.

name: Leah & David
about: We are Leah and David, two queerdos who like to pick our noses (while we tidy). Our interests include food, animals, crafting, human bodies, liberation, hiking, board games, exploring, laughing and connecting. We're using Airbnb to pay the bills while we start our business, a queer/body-positive barbell gym & movement space called HEALTH CLUB!

name: Aron
about: Mid-30s Oregon transplants with a toddler and baby on the way! We love live music, camping, hiking, snow sports and adventures and would love to help you experience all that Portland has to offer.

name: Becca
about: Married to Ethan with two elementary aged boys. We spend a lot of our free time river rafting and in the woods. Vassar college grad and medical school at the University of Michigan.

name: Jennyb
about:
international lighting designer.
be free live free , respect yourself and others with love.

name: Mia
about:
I arrived in Portland 26 years ago to attend graduate school.  In 1993 I rented this home and purchased it in 1997.  Between 1999 and 2002 it was fully remodeled and an addition was built.  In the summer of 2014 the garage that housed the tools for the remodel was converted to my new lovely studio.
I am an art teacher in the Portland Public School district.  This is my 23rd year!  My two biggest hobbies are creating art and gardening.  I have had chickens for 13 years.  I also enjoy hiking on weekends and getting near water, whether it be the coast, lake, ocean or river.

name: Lark
about: I enjoy having company.  For fun I sing, dance, play pool, play Scrabble, and go spelunking at estate sales to find my next vintage treasure. My motto is Live a Little! I do enjoy a quiet night's sleep...

name: Silvana & David
about:
Hi,

We are David, a born and raised Oregonian loves and Silvana, from all over Europe love to travel and experience new cultures. We met in Portland and recently moved to the Netherlands. 

Our growing family regularly embarks on a journey to either explore a new destination or visit our relatives and friends that are spread across the globe.

During our trips we prefer to stay with Airbnb, our experiences have always been positive. In fact, we've enjoyed it so much, that once we had space available, we decided to list our space too. Having stayed at multiple Airbnb places we put a lot of thought of what we liked and what we would have liked. We hope you enjoy your stay with us. And if we are the ones visiting you, we thank you for opening your home up to us!

name: Tanja
about: Hi- Myself and my boyfriend Noel, lead a pretty active lifestyle- tennis, biking, walking/running, hiking, and (for me) yoga.  Noel is an avid gardener and we have our own little urban farm, along with an abundant number of fruit trees and berry bushes in our yard.  We love growing our own food and our garden allows us fresh fruits/veggies in the summer and then canned and dried items in the winter.  Noel is also a huge beer geek and would relish the chance to talk anything beer.  We both work from home: I have my own decorative water fountain business and work with some non-profits and Noel does internet marketing and manages some vacation rentals at the WA coast.  I have followed a vegan diet for the last few years and Noel is flexitarian.  I grew up in NY and Noel in NJ and WI, but we've also lived in NM, CA, and WA. I can speak a little Spanish (but not understand it) and Noel can understand it (but not speak it).  My parents are from Germany and Sweden and Noels' heritage is German and Norwegian. We are both animal lovers and currently share our home with a couple fun-loving cats and, at times, a foster dog. We love living in Portland, as it is a great city.  We also love to travel....but Portland is so cool, we never want to leave :)

name: Sophie
about: I'm a 33 year old woman from Portland Oregon.  I work for a documentary film production company, own my own home and love to travel.

name: Marty
about:
Just like most everyone else in Portland, I am a transplant.  Just like most of us transplants, I truly love everything this city has to offer.  I love showing off the city and recommending my favorite places, quirks and activities.

I came to Portland do a year of community service with the Jesuit Volunteer Corps (JVC) and ended up sticking around.  The values I have acquired from my volunteer experience is that of simplicity.  I don't have cable or dish, I hand wash all my dishes, I ride my bike more than I drive and I try to grow my own veggies during the summer.  

I have worked at the University of Portland, a private Catholic university, for 15 years.  I bought my house here in North Portland (aka NoPo) in April of 2011 and enjoy sharing my space.

I'm active and athletic,  I've been immersed into the world of soccer/football since I was a kid and am currently a season ticket holder for the Portland Timbers (MLS).  There is hardly an activity I haven't enjoyed included running marathons, basketball, baseball, utlimate frisbee, disc golf,and especially hiking, backpacking.  This is an incredible part of the county!

I don't watch much TV, but I do love movies.  Guests are welcome to use Netflix during their stay.  The house is great for chilling out, reading a novel in the back yard, the Sunday NY Times on Sunday morning with a cup of coffee, or sharing a glass of wine while prepping for dinner.

I hope you will consider my as your host and my house as your place to stay.  I look forward to hearing from you.

Marty

name: Courtney
about: Hi!  I'm an easy going lady who love to garden, hike, do yoga and travel.  I'm flight attendant and a new mom.  I love meeting new people, exploring new places, and helping people.  I have lots of travel recommendations on the Portland area (if wanted) and thoroughly enjoy our fun Mississippi street neighborhood. I've traveled and worked in Greece, parts of western Europe, the USA (especially the national parks), Central America, and New Zealand.  While I normally camp, I look forward to meeting a variety of people through AirBnB.  As a host, I'll welcome you to the place answer any questions. We have a shared yard/ BBQ space that we can mingle if desired, but basically your on your own with full privacy once you get here!

name: Katrina
about: Originally from Austin, TX, Sam and I just bought this house after living in and falling in love with Portland for about a year and a half. We've been travelling using Airbnb for many years now, and are thrilled to finally have a space to give back to such an awesome community of travellers. There are so many things that make Portland and the Pacific Northwest our home. The sense of community here is strong and we eagerly support locally owned and operated businesses - from coffee roasters, craft breweries, local organic farms and food co-ops to local music and arts programs that inspire and encourage creativity. Beyond the city, you can find us hiking the waterfalls of the Gorge, carving up the slopes of our beloved Mt. Hood, or dancing all night at music festivals across the west coast!

name: Sue And Bob
about:
We live in a historic home in Laurelhurst, in Portland.  Sue is a retired principal and Bob retired from the big aerospace company in Seattle (Boeing).  Sue has a passion for decorating and gardening (is very creative and good at both), Bob is into art and also enjoys and appreciates creating and living in a tasteful environment.  We both enjoy entertaining, hosting frequent social gatherings in our home  in our English garden or just  having  friends over for a "glass" of wine.  We also have a house on the Oregon Coast that we love and enjoy sharing with family and friends and that is also available for short term rental.  We stay constantly busy with our "projects" spending time with the grandchildren,  try to fit some time in for a little golf and getting away for a few days from time to time.  Now that we have joined "airbnb" we might just find an excuse to getaway a little more.

As hosts we would be happy to invite our guests for a tour of our historic home, sit with us and enjoy a glass of wine in front of the inglenook fireplace or on the patio in the garden.  If our guests prefer to left alone we are sensitive to that as well.  Our goal is to provide a welcoming, comfortable, and tasteful environment for our guests, and possibly develop new friendships.

As guests we appreciate friendly, but sensitive to our privacy, hosts that provides a clean, comfortable environment that makes us feel at home.  We also appreciate hosts that provide recommendations and insight into places to visit and things to do.

As to a life motto we both think that,  Live, Love, Laugh and Learn is how we approach life.

name: Renae
about: I’m a Wisconsin native who fell in love with the Pacific Northwest and made it my home 16 years ago. I enjoy snowboarding, surfing, cycling, camping, cooking and gardening.  I have explored much of the PNW and can offer suggestions on ways to make the most of your stay.  I look forward to offering you my home so you can check out the city I love so much.

name: Michael
about:
I am a Bay Area native but have been living in the Pacific NW for the last 20 years. I divide my time between Seattle and Portland
I love to bike, snowboard, and play acoustic bass.

name: Ben And Kathleen
about: We live in Portland, Oregon.  We enjoy great food, great coffee, great books, and the great outdoors.  What more could you ask for?

name: Shannon
about: Female artist traveling the country and the world and renting out my guest room and bedroom from time to time.

name: John
about: I am born and raised in Oregon, I have lived at my current place for the past three years. I love getting outdoors and adventuring. On weekends I am usually at the beach or mountain depending on the season. I like to be social and tried to create a place that can accommodate that as well as be a sanctuary for the times you want to be alone.

name: Kalyn
about: Hi!  My name is Kalyn, I'm 30, I was born and raised in Portland and love the opportunity to share my apartment with people traveling in the Portland area! We have a lot of great shopping and food places that are all within walking distance!

name: Sarah
about: Hi!  I'm a long time Portland resident.  I love this town, its people and its culture.  I have spent a lot of time making my house a place where family, friends and guests can feel happy and comfortable.  I love cooking and canning and I have a garden that helps support my culinary endeavors. I've also been known to prepare cocktails on hot afternoons.  On Saturday morning at my house, you can hear old Loretta Lynn albums and smell the locally roasted coffee steeping in the French Press. I love my little dog, Meryl Streep, and sweet cat, Tucy.  Live music and eating out are some of my favorite pass times and I love sharing whatever information and knowledge I have about both.  My friends characterize me as a positive and fun person and sometimes as "the Mayor of Portland" because I know so many people around town.  While I'm interested in having more European travel adventures, I satisfy my travel bug on a more frequent basis with trips to San Francisco, Los Angeles and Seattle.

name: Mojo
about:
Our names are Mojo and Linda and we own Hedonisia Hawaii, a sustainable community retreat in the Hawaiian rain forest. At our community we offer ecofriendly lodgings two of which are featured in the Airbnb website.

Hedonisia is a sustainable community practicing "green tourism" in Hawaii. 

As a social enterprise community we also manage websites that deal with women's reproductive rights and gender equality in the world. We may live "out here" in the middle of the Pacific but we are very much engaged in what is happening "out there" in the world!

Every year we travel to Europe and the East Coast of the US to visit our families and also to network, research and write for our web projects. So we are also open to Home Exchanges!

To sum us up in a nutshell. We really enjoy making a living from business activities that also serve environmental or social goals. It allows us to truly live according to our ideals instead of just working some job to pay the bills!

At our community we offer a Community and Feminist Enterprise workshops as well as a Community Manager Internship where others can learn how to do the same!

name: Jan
about: Living in Portland, OR with my Peruvian husband. We occasionally use our apartment in Cusco to visit family, but would love to share it with you when we are not around. Feel free to ask us questions if you would like to get in touch with some of our Peruvian friends and relatives if you are looking for a cultural experience!

name: Mark
about:
Hi there, 
I'm mildly energetic and dare I say a rather gregarious type. I'm an artist, builder, yogi and shop/coop-owner at Forage Homewares and Gifts in the great Historic Mississippi District in North Portland.
I am in the company of an amazing and curious 11 year old named Gus and wonderfully talented finance' Susan, co-owner of our shop and brilliant designer.
We love Portland-the people, the huge variety of things to do, the food, the vibe and, yes, the rain. Why? Because it allows such splendid spring, summers and falls....and winters.  There is definitely something magical here.

name: Tara
about: I'm a former modern dancer now working as a fashion stylist. I'm a long time resident of the Lower east side of Manhattan. Now a transplant to Beautiful Portland, Oregon.

name: Mary
about: Runner, hiker, biker, happy homeowner, and unofficial ambassador to Portland.

name: Adam
about:
I live with my girlfriend and we have a small dog and a cat. They are well behaved and don't mind furry friends(pets). 

We are  quiet, and easy going. We treat people and their property with respect.

name: B&E
about: Hi, we are Brenna and Eddie.  We love to travel and when we aren't traveling we love hosting in Portland, one of the coolest cities in the states, nothing like embracing the adventure! We truly enjoy experiencing, appreciating and learning from other areas and cultures. Because of Airbnb, we were lucky to get engaged on the Seine River in Paris (which also happened during our first Airbnb experience).

name: Sarah
about:
I am a freelance wardrobe stylist and art director. I am based out of Portland, Or and Santa Cruz, CA. I love cycling, thrifting, eating, making art and adventuring. 

As a guest, I like to cook, read, take walks, explore and watch the occasional movie.

name: Gary & Mary
about: We are a married couple who enjoy people, traveling and sharing stories. Mary grew up in Ladd's Addition and still loves the ambience and convenience of living here. We have this space as our pied e terre and are now willing to share it with other travelers. We love to travel and have stayed in Airbnb's from Chico to Milan and have loved the experience and feeling of a home away from home. We love to cook, read, garden, listen to great music, dance (Mary),entertain and watch good movies. We own a small Real Estate company in Portland and own a small farm near Mt Hood where we grow our own organic food. Life is full and gets better when you share it with friends, old and new. We hope to make many new friends through Airbnb! We live the life we love and love the life we live!

name: Pamela
about:
My life is quiet as a semi-retired professional living in a lovely neighborhood in North Portland.  My passion is teaching and facilitating lively discussions. Taking walks/hikes into the northwest hiking trails is a favorite. Gardening is my hobby as you will see if you stay. My specialty is good wholesome fresh food which Portland is noted for. I have two kitties who are friendly and not pesky. 
I like meeting interesting intelligent people and love to share travel stories. 
My life motto is "Create the life you truly want now".

name: Alanna
about: I'm a native Oregonian who has lived most of her life overseas and in Washington, DC. I'm an international development professional and entrepreneur who enjoys the outdoors, arts, photography, travel, and culture.

name: Michael
about: I enjoyed travelling to other nations and learning about the culture, history, and  most importantly -- the food.  My knowledge of Spanish is not as good as it was many years ago, but is still functional.  I read and write better than I hear and speak.  Will be visiting a friend in Monterrey, but making a side trip to explore and learn Guadalajara.  Specifically like to be in the middle of things and I am quick to learn my way around and use public transportation.  I am quiet, have a good sense of humor, and very respectful of other people's homes and property.  This will be my first AirBnB, so I don't have history references.

name: Linda
about: I live in a lovely area near downtown Portland.  I am a watercolor artist and enjoy shape and color and how it lights up my life.  I have the world's best dog, Stormy, who is a standard poodle.  I've lived in Canada and Germany as well as several places in the United States.  I love to travel and look forward to meeting people from around the world.  When the wall came down in Germany, I loved to travel into the eastern zone and listen to conversations of people in the cusp of transition.  I recently saw the movie, The Butler, and loved it.  Foreign movies, reading, especially those set in areas of the world that are unfamiliar to me, are my favorites.  I love to cook, so come join me around my table and in my cozy home.

name: Melissa
about: Free spirited people person who loves to travel the Pacific Northwest. I thrive on simplicity and nature.

name: Julia
about:
Marine Layer is based in San Francisco, and we're opening the Loft as a fun experience and place to stay when you visit Portland.  Are we looking to open up a Marine Layer B&B? Nope. Are we looking for a rad place for PDX visitors and the occasional stray ML employee to stay for a night or four? Absolutely. 

I'm Julia, and ML employee working downstairs (literally, right below you) in our store on NW 23rd. Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Deborah
about: We are native Oregonians who love our little cabins in the woods. Being next to the Sandy river & Minikahda creek is enchanting and calming. We invite you to spend time at our cabins to get away, reconnect with family, or hang your touk after a day of skiing & snowboarding. The hiking trails are amazing! Our vintage cabins have many amenities and we are dog and child friendly.  Welcome!

name: Mark
about:
I'm a returning student in the Computer Science field and will be diving in to the guts of that degree. I will eventually continue on for a Biomedical graduate degree in the hopes of starting my own company by the end of my undergrad degree. I look forward to building relationships in the biomedical research community in order to change my life so that I am helping researchers but also living my life in my ideal way. 
I was formerly a GIS/survey person. I got to do some incredibly cool projects but felt that I wanted something different. I wanted to stay in the Portland area as I've been here 14 years now and enjoy it. There's so much to see and eat here! Just about anything you can imagine (still haven't found an Azerbaijani or proper Basque cidery!) is here in our little town. As a former mapper I can point you in many directions and can make you a custom (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) map to access in town. 
I am inbetween three bus lines (77, 71, 19) and two MAX stations (60th & 82nd stations) so getting into town is easy. 
I am often studying or at school but am more than willing to help people find something in town. It's a passion of mine is connecting people with places in town. I love playing tour guide. I'm just looking for help while in school and always enjoy meeting new people! I hope to meet you!
"I'd rather die doing something fun than having a heart attack in a cubicle"

name: David
about: I am a teacher turned business person providing onsite English language and communication classes to non-native English speakers in workplace and corporate settings.   With my free time, I like gardening, playing guitar, doing projects around the house and traveling.  We like music and in better weather, we invite people over and jam in the backyard.

name: Kathy
about:
I am a freelance writer and work from my home office and also have a day job.  I live with a cat and a dog who love people, but not other animals, so no pets. Smoking is allowed outside only. 

I love Portland and look forward to sharing it with you.

name: Hannah & Cameron
about:
I was raised in the South and have fallen in love with the Pacific Northwest. My husband is from Portland. We  love camping and traveling simply. We are artists and create together all of the time. Cameron is a painter and I am a leatherworker. 

We love hosting and sharing what we have.

name: Sandra
about: Academic turned business owner. Loves Portland's creative communities - literary, culinary, arts, and start-up dreamers.... Revels in living in a bicycle loving city ... laments PDX's increasing lack of affordability for the communities that make PDX dynamically fantastic. Wishes the city were more culturally diverse and embracing.

name: Elliott
about: Hi, I am Elliott.  I am a Latin American history professor at Lewis & Clark College in Portland.  My research is on late nineteenth century borderlands history, and more recently about Chinese migration in the Americas.   My partner, Reiko, is also a history professor at Lewis & Clark.  She studies the built environment and the US South in the 19th century.  We both love to bike in the city, and eat great food in the neighborhood.  We have a 13-year old daughter who likes making movies and playing volleyball.

name: Melissa
about: Hello,  So far I am loving doing the BnB.  Being a hostess has been a wonderful experience for me.  I really see this as a great way for folks like me who need a little help supporting themselves and I am extremely grateful for the Air BnB website and for all you wonderful travelers who I get to meet on a regular basis.   So I am 38 year old woman living in Portland Oregon where I was born.  I am a retired dancer and currently work as a nanny as well as hostess a room in my place.  I also sew and do alterations and I do hair extensions as well.   I have a lot of hobbies including piano and and singing though I'm not gonna brag about the singing part cause it's nothing to brag about really but I enjoy it.

name: Kirsten
about: My beloved Karl and I love nature, growing our own food, hiking, camping, rock climbing and expanding our consciousness. A favorite quote "The greatest wisdom is in simplicity. Love, respect, tolerance, sharing, gratitude, forgiveness. It's not complex or elaborate. The real knowledge is  encoded in your DNA. All you need is within you. Great teacher's have said from the beginning, find your heart and you will find your way. "

name: Nate
about:
We’re thrilled to make our space available to you and yours! Southeast Portland has been an ideal place to live, work, play and raise our little family. Rachael is a labor and delivery nurse at a local hospital and Nate manages a nonprofit program to support our public schools.

We love biking and walking in our friendly neighborhood, spending time in nearby Mt. Tabor Park, hiking, traveling, reading, cooking, hanging out with family and friends, and curling up to watch the next great series on Netflix or HBO.

We strive to provide a warm and welcoming experience for every one of our guests.

name: Emily
about: I am a middle-aged woman who stays home to take care of her adorable young son and sweet husband.  We moved to Portland from New Orleans a couple of years ago and absolutely love it.  I have traveled from Rio to Amsterdam to Adelaide and beyond and am very excited to meet amazing folks from all over the world.  I love sharing my home with others and making them feel welcome and comfortable.

name: David
about: I am a software developer in Portland and love to spend time in the great outdoors. As a guest I am laid back, easy to please, and respectful of the house and house rules.

name: Nikki
about: I am a photographer my husband an artist and production designer. We love art and many of our friends are artists so our home is an ode to self expression and ideas. We love great food, music, nature and good times.

name: Elise
about:
I am a working artist living in Portland, Oregon. I work and teach painting classes in my studio behind my house. A transplant from the New York area for 30 years, I've been watching Portland grow up from every quadrant; Southeast, Northeast, Southwest and Northwest.  I will never get used to being seven minutes from the woods of Forest Park or 90 minutes from the ocean, desert and Mt. Hood. I enjoy food, making art, music, wine, time with friends, hiking, yoga, writing and my pets.

I love living in Portland.  Mine is a lifestyle of having a warm, comfy art filled house, making good food and being surrounded by the warmth and energy of all who pass through here. I dwell lightly and quietly in general and as a guest.  I'm an early riser, not loud and respect people's space. As a traveler, I'm efficient and good at navigating myself and I plan loosely to allow for spontaneity.  As a host I get to have fun sharing stories and suggesting places for my guests to go in Portland.

name: Nicci
about:
Who I am: friendly, funny, foodie, appropriately sarcastic, loves her friends, loves her dogs and loves this city. 

What I do: I am a healthcare practitioner. I have been in Portland 20 years and have had numerous job titles that eventually lead me to the best one of all. I get to help people on their healing journey and I am humbled by my patients' bravery every day. 

What I love: family, food, furry-fourleggeds (and three-leggeds too!), reading, traveling, lounging, cultivating, running, biking, anything that reminds me to breathe deeply.

name: Anna
about: Our family has lived in SE Portland for the last 6 years and love our neighborhood. I am a working artist-- I work from a home studio and own a store on Division Street. We love to cook, travel and play outside with our kids. We are excited to share our home and neighborhood!

name: Larry
about: Retired couple from Portland, Oregon.

name: Betty
about: Hello!  We have a very cozy home and are open to sharing our space.  We are family oriented, quiet, healthy-some vegetarians in the house.  We do not have any pets in the house.

name: Alfred
about:
I am a licensed plumber/professional musician from New York and I have lived in Portland, Oregon from 1978 to 1995 and subsequently from 2003 to the present. My wife, Eileen and I were married on Oct. 1st, 2015 at our "flash wedding" in Pioneer Courthouse Square. 
  Cutie's Boulder is our most fun project and we enjoy constantly improving the amenities there. Cutie is a former ballerina, model, and home restoration entrepreneur and our experience is informed by that and my musical compositions/performances. She has introduced me to the Paleo diet and I have lost weight besides other medical benefits because of it. Sometimes we do plumbing jobs together, and we are happy to get along so well.
   If you stay with us at Cutie's Boulder, we will be very attentive if not downright doting, to provide you with a great experience. We are very much into the common good as our way of life. Live long and prosper!! :)

name: Marie
about:
Hello!

I love meeting and greeting people from all walks of life. I've done a fair amount of travel having been to 38 US states and so far 10 countries and lots of islands.

When I travel I find it nice to have a line on someone who knows the area and can help me find healthy food, great unhealthy food and great hang outs. I feel quite at home in Portland with its diversity and unsurpassed progressiveness. Let me help you find many reasons to love it too!

When I'm home in Portland I play music, teach adults to sing better, work in my own body, voice and skin care studio and love and take care of my three cats and my house. I also like dining out and checking out new places.

Marie

name: Heather & Topher
about:
Hi, 

We are self described lovers of life, music, fun, travel, art, music, gardening, food, wine, bikes & adventure!  Together with our daughters Stella & Maddi, we try to live each day to its fullest with the understanding that life is short, so enjoy it!

We have extensively traveled in South America, Central America, North America & Europe & we have toured as percussionists with MarchFourth Marching Band in many of those places as well.  We love that we have been able to create a place now that we are settling in as a family where travelers can come visit us & share their vacations with us.  We truly love hosting & our dream is to build more cottages in Portland, the city we love, call home & we always come back to, no matter how far away we range.

We have been told we are laid back, generous hosts & we will be able to give you many spot on recommendations in the city or in the region as we have lived in & explored this area for over 20 years.  We love to share our insider knowledge of the quirky, community spirited, eco-minded "Portlandia" that everyone is talking about.

We absolutely love where we are located in the city directly across from Peninsula park with easy access to I-5, public transportation, bike routes & the trendy Mississippi & Alberta Arts districts.  We hope you will join us & share the space we have created for your enjoyment.

Best,

Heather, Topher, Stella & Maddi (& Inigo ~ the dog)

name: Jennifer
about: I've just moved to Portland after five years in Europe and I'm excited to explore this city and get to know all that it has to offer. I live in Alberta, an awesome area, with my boyfriend, Grant who has lived in Portland for 7 years and can definitely show you around. We also have a sweet kitty, Bisous, and pup, Kobe. We'd love to host you and help you get to know Portland!

name: Larry
about:
I am a retired administrative law judge who travels often for a month or two.  I've been to Mali, West Africa, four times (a good friend in Portland is from there and I visit his family with him), Chile, India, and Spain/France.  

I have lived in my home over 20 years and during that time, I watched my neighborhood of East Buckman blossom, with many restaurants and brew pubs within walking distance and a great park, Laurelhurst, one-half mile east on Ankeny.  Many of my friends are artists; and their art is in my home.  You'll probably also notice that I really like film and music from my records and CDs and DVDs.

I decided to become Airbnb host because I have been an Airbnb guest and had such good experiences with it when I travel. I offer my home in the hopes that guests get a similar, "real Portland" experience when they visit. My first guest was Thanksgiving of 2013. So far, the guests have been great.

name: Alex And Hanisi
about: We are just a normal middle class family - our house will have lots of kids games and entertainment options (though no fancy cable so if you're a sports junkie you'll have to just take what basic cable gives you).  We love having a great view and windows so that we can see just what we need to wear to get outside.

name: Erin
about: Married, mother of two kids who works outside the home.  I love the outdoors and travel, so feel free to hit us up with any questions about the area.

name: Jennifer
about: I love living in Portland and the Pacific Northwest with my husband and my dog.  It has been so great exploring this area over the last 15 years. We spend majority of our time mountain biking and running around this great state. While we are home we like to cook, garden and read.

name: Lucy
about: Hi, my name is Lucy. I am an active non-profit professional living in Portland, OR with my middle-school aged daughter and sweet, energetic nordic spitz dog. We are outdoor enthusiasts, in love with the Pacific Northwest's great places to hike, ski, backpack and swim. We bike quite a bit around Portland, being the great biking city it is, and also enjoy reading, traveling and spending time with family and friends. My life motto is how I was taught to ski: point downhill and lean forward.

name: Louise
about:
"The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." 
   -St. Augustine

name: Joelle
about: Hello everyone! Thank you for checking out my listing. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to me.

name: Rebecca
about: I love meeting new people, experiencing new places, and gaining new perspective.  I've lived in Portland since 2002 and owned my 1922 Craftsman since 2009.  I take full advantage of all the outdoor recreation opportunities around my awesome city and have difficulty not spending all of my extra money on the great food Portland has to offer. I'm easy going, friendly and full of fun ideas.  Cheers!

name: Greg & Beth
about: We believe in Portland and are passionate about sustainability. Greg helps create livable streets for the city and Beth is a teacher. In our spare time, we like to learn about earth-friendly solutions, garden, spend time with friends, cook and drink lots of tasty Portland micro-brews.

name: Sandy
about: I am from Ohio and have been in Portland for 15 years. I spent my early working years in Atlanta, Georgia before starting over in the Northwest. I enjoy dancing, walking the neighborhoods and trails, and, for the past year, following Bitcoin. If you're interested in learning more about this cryptocurrency stuff, I can bring you up to speed during your stay. I also love hearing about people's travels and whole-heartedly welcome all travelers of every background, personality, religion, orientation and anything else you can think of. I've had roommates a lot over the years and am comfortable with having others around my house. You will feel at home. My name, Sandy, means "helper" and that describes my personality well.  It's OK to ask me for what you need and I'm happy to try to accommodate. I'm not a chef, but I am enjoying trying to come up with breakfasts that please; most are just simple foods your mom would fix you, some manage to be restaurant worthy, some do not always go as planned and some are standard continental fare. I follow safe food handling procedures and have an Oregon food handler's card. I buy healthy, organic and whole grain ingredients half the time but also go mainstream half the time. Usually I have dairy free options available. It's OK to let me know what your preferences are. I want you to feel at home.

name: Diana Louise
about: Diana is a midwife, nurse practitioner, and enthusiastic new home owner. She was born and raised in the Rockies and has lived in Portland, San Francisco, Albuquerque, New York, Spain, Mexico and Argentina. Diana loves to travel and carries this passion into hosting her AirBnB. She's a fan of people! She is interested in expanding her horizons through reading, travel, art, conversation, painting, meditation and the outdoors.

name: Angela
about:
My home (and favorite city) is Portland, OR. I am the director of a nonprofit legislative advocacy organization. One reason I prefer to stay in private residences versus hotels is the opportunity to be in a neighborhood. I like to visit the local market, make my own dinner and explore a new neighborhood on my morning runs. Too often when I stay in a hotel I end up running next to a business park or busy freeway - not very scenic, safe or enjoyable. 

I've stayed with many great Airbnb hosts and now I'm looking forward to hosting guests in my house.

name: Mark
about:
Born in Guayaquil, Ecuador to a Spanish father and a Washington(Vancouver) born and raised mother, I grew up in Oakland, California. I own and operate 3 businesses in Phoenix, AZ and I have a wife and 3 kids.

I love coffee, wine, beer, food, free markets, my family, friends!

I love PDX. It's my favorite city in the world....come stay with us! I hope you love it as much as I do!

name: Kristy
about: Raised in Australia, I moved to Portland in 2006 and love it! I enjoy traveling and many other outdoor activities.

name: Gordon & Terry
about: Mature professional (data processing)

name: Deborah
about: I am an artist and my partner and I work together creating and showing at art shows around the country.  Love travelling and seeing new places.  Fond of the outdoors, good food, reading, movies, art, music. Favorite recent travel destination: Prague and the Czech Republic.  Especially loved the bone church or ostuary in Kutna Hora.  Loved the movie Birdman: The unexpected Virtue of Ignorance.  Like Eliza Gylkinson and other Austin musicians.  Also like jazz.  Most music, really.  Favorite people to spend time with:  my two granddaughters, 6 and 9 years old (and my partner, Richard).  We make art, go on adventures, watch movies, cook, sew, all fun.  Also love time with friends and time alone, yoga and meditation.

name: Jeannette
about: Yoga Instructor, massage therapist, body worker.  Also own a unique rental venue in Portland, OR called The Little Church.  We host events, weddings, workshops, etc.   42 years old, Married and have a 6 year-old boy.

name: Emily And Adam
about:
Hello!

We are a Macrame teacher/Instagram lover/artist/creative director/foodie and a screenprinter/musician/sports fan/best friend/designer super thrilled to travel and host wonderful guests in our favorite place.

We are avid thrift-shoppers and have amazing luck when it comes to discovering treasures and parking spaces. With this special knack, we create beauty in our space, and consider the atmosphere to be a very important part of the day.

Recently our home was featured in the beautiful Japanese lifestyle magazine Ku:nel, and also on Portlandia. The home is also featured in a beautiful new book called THE NEW BOHEMIANS, which is on the NYT's best seller list! We are excited that our love of interior spaces has allowed us to create an intentional and plant filled space to host you. 

Emily loves to cook, read, make art, eat at the best restaurants, get out into nature, and spend time with friends playing music, feasting, and enjoying the good life that the Northwest has to offer. She is pretty into Instagram and would love if you tag the photos of our house with @Emily_Katz and @Goldenruledesign, so we can see what you post! Also our home has a hashtag: #Woodboxpdx

Adam owns his own screenprinting business, he loves the outdoors, can school you on basketball trivia, and loves to eat as much as Emily loves to cook. 

We look forward to hosting you and sharing our favorite places with you!

name: Kerry
about:
My hobbies vary greatly, but include hiking, camping, juggling, watching both art-house films and really bad action/adventure flicks, eating ice cream, bicycling, singing, dancing, playing with kids, roughhousing with the dogs, BBQs, reading, eating yummy things, traveling, writing, and going on adventures. I am at peace when surrounded by trees, mountains, and water. 

Below is an excerpt from my travel journal. To read more of my adventures, visit (URL HIDDEN) 

We are Indiana Jones! We are National Geographic! We are fearless explorers! A hike through the jungle and then we are swimming (swimming!) into the vast maw of a cave, helmets and headlamps, absolute darkness with the lights off. No difference between eyes open and eyes closed. We splash along an underground river, sometimes knee deep, sometimes treading across deep pools, squeezing under boulders, into fissures, over rockslides, the stalactites sometimes brushing the tops of our heads, sometimes towering ninety feet above. Crystaline rock flows, sparkling in the glow of our tiny lights, shadows and browns and greys and greens. 

We are travelers in Xibalba, the ancient Mayan underworld. 

After an hour we climb a rock face, steeper steeper higher higher onto a plateau, cavernous, winding, bats, space, darkness, the headlamps barely piercing the depth of the darkness. And then, and then! There is a jug, half buried in the calcite. And there is a metate, and a plate and a bowl and they are impeccable and painted and carved and 1200 YEARS OLD, all just resting on the ground, not behind glass, no railings, no ropes, no signs. The archeologists left everything just as they found it, untouched, a living breathing museum, and I am imagining the elite Mayans with their bloodletting and sacrifices and ceremonies and everyone is whispering because this is a sacred place, a place of desperation for a failing civilization, a place of last hope for rain, please Chuc, rain. 

We traverse the flats amongst a hundred hundred artifacts, and then there is a ladder, which brings us to a deep alcove, high within the cave. Ten steps and there she is, the Crystal Maiden, a young woman, sacrficied to the gods, her bones crystalized and perfect. She lies with her legs straight but her arms splayed. Her mouth is wide open. She was strangled to death. And she is still there in her dark and cool and cavernous tomb, and we are there, breathing softly, averting our eyes out of respect for the dead, but also longing to watch the bones, watch their stillness. We turn back and she is once more plunged into darkness and I tremble as I descend the ladder.

name: Adam And Arthur
about:
Hey there!  I'm Adam.  I'm 34, an artist and avid soccer player.  I've lived in Portland on and off for eight years now and love this city more every day.  With a background in the creative non-profit world, I also focus quite a bit on my own artwork - printmaking and mixed-media collage.  In addition, I work part-time at the amazing Deschutes Brewery, love to canoe, play soccer/tennis, hike, cook, drink wine/cider, have fires and travel. I was a foreign exchange student in Spain, have lived in Alaska and Hawaii, and have frequently traveled to Mexico, Central America and Cuba.

Arthur here!  I'm 30 and moved about two years ago from LA to Portland. Loving this city and don't miss the traffic!  I have a background in film and television production and I'm working as a Real Estate Agent helping people find their dream homes in PDX.  I'm into music/dancing, reading, exploring the culinary delights of the many different neighborhoods in Portland, and traveling when I get the chance.  I've spent a good amount of time in Europe, China, Mexico and NYC.

All in all, we love meeting new people and can give lots of pointers about discovering the unique spirit of Portland.

name: Becca
about:
I'm a friendly, active, fit health professional. Easy going, neat (not obsessive), with a strong emphasis on sustainability. All organic environment (food, soil, composting, recycling, no smoking). Dog and cat free environment since January. I am a nutritionist, so appreciate a commitment to organic, local, non GMO foods. I sleep easily, so varied schedules work fine for me. I have a love of music,  dance, reading, metaphysics, gardening, edible landscaping &  travel, along with having a # of eclectic interests. I can make do using Spanish, & a little French. I enjoy meeting people from all over, am known to be a good host by friends & am a pretty good chicken farmer. I welcome you in!
Happy trails to you, until we meet!

name: Nora
about:
Below are some of my interests to give you more of a sense of who I am. 

Interests: Languages. Hiking. Scrabble. Education for the sake of education. Cooking. Browsing farmer's markets. Technology. Ice skating. 

Movies: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly, The Eighth Day, W;t,

Music: 65 Days of Static, Explosions in the Sky, Maybeshewill, Queen, Nina Simone, 

Unique things that I've done during my travels: hiked Machu Picchu, caught and ate a red-bellied piranha in the Amazon, went scuba diving in the Galapagos Islands, 

TRAVELED: Argentina, Austria, Canada, Costa Rica, England, France, Germany, Italy, Mexico, Peru, Poland, Puerto Rico, Slovakia, Honduras, Belize, Guatemala, Nicaragua, China, Ecuador,

name: Elodie
about:
I am a french native, living and working in Portland Or for the past 12 years. 
I grew up in Paris, France and I am an artist and healer. 
I have 2 children, who are 9 and 10 and live with me every other week.
I really enjoy being an Airbnb host and also at times a guest, as it allows me to meet very interesting people and feel at home even away from home!
This is what I try to offer when hosting people.

name: Ryan
about:
I am a professional photographer and Pacific Northwest native with a deep love of this region's mountains, forests and deserts, and the myriad adventures they offer. Although I love calling the Northwest home, I'm always up for venturing to new and exciting places.

When not photographing people, I can be found spending time with my wife and our two boys, skiing, hiking, running, gardening or lounging in a hammock or by a fire.

name: Cyndy
about:
Hi! I'm Cyndy -
When I started hosting in 2014 I rented the entire house; then I moved back in and listed private rooms. After a little remodel in winter 2016, the front third of my 1961 Ranch is now a separate apartment providing an inviting, comfortable, efficient space to call home-base or home-away-from-home.
The place is set-up for guests to be as self-sufficient as they want and I let guests set the tone for interactions.  I greet you and give a brief tour so we get to know each other a little and I answer questions to make sure you have the best stay possible.  I get a vicarious thrill from sharing my experience and knowledge with guests and sometimes that's the only time we see each other! 
My creative energy is home-focused, so I'm grateful to at home and still meet fascinating people from all over the world!*  When I'm not nesting,, I read and follow to baseball, eat with friends and family, bike .....

* Aruba, Australia, Canada, England, Germany, Japan, the Netherlands, New Zealand, and the United States ...
city: Born in San Francisco; grew up in Santa Cruz. Went to college in New York and lived in Poughkeepsie and New Paltz for a few years. Returned to Santa Cruz after the Loma Prieta earthquake and then moved to Oakland and the East Bay at the height of the dot.

name: Jesse
about: Have spent nearly my whole in Oregon. Grew up in Portland, and graduated from U of O in 2015, Sco Ducks! In my free time, you can find me playing soccer, music, or going on adventures with my dog. I have done a bit of traveling in Europe, West Africa, and will be working this summer in South Africa, but I mostly just travel up and down I5. My boyfriend lives in Vancouver BC so I spend a lot of time up there too. On nights-in, we love cooking, drinking wine, board games, and you will likely hear some Erykah Badu, D'angelo, Anderson .Paak, or something similar in the background. I'm very excited to begin hosting so I can meet interesting people from across the globe and share our stories with one another.

name: Keenan
about: Hi, I am Kristin, the Marketing Director for Realty Management Advisors Oregon, Inc.  The owner of this condo, Keenan, prefers to rent it out to people who are staying for a minimum of 1 month.  The fully furnished condo is located in beautiful Irvington Neighborhood, which is a great base location for exploring Portland.  Whenever I am hosting guests from out of town, I always make sure to take them to Powell's Book Store, The Rose Test Garden, and Portland City Grill.  I love to travel and truly believe that staying in someone's home is much preferable to a hotel.

name: Sam
about: I love to play soccer, working out and going out with friends for drinks. I know Portland very well and can tell you about all the fun places to go. I am from Jordan and grew up in Africa and Switzerland as well. I also speak French and Arabic.

name: Debbie
about: My husband Todd, our labrador Bebe and I enjoy living in our cozy nest in Portland. We also love to travel and see the world and spend a lot of time on the Oregon coast. We can often be found surfing, paddleboarding, running and camping. We are both self-employed and enjoy a pretty flexible schedule which lets us open up our home to you. When we are home we enjoy cooking meals, gardening and spending time with friends. We also love collecting art and other interesting stuff, especially when it means supporting our artist friends, so you'll find lots of unique and original touches in our home.

name: Joe
about: We are professional readers, writers, publishers, bicyclists, and activists whose professional life requires extensive travel, leaving our beautiful, sunny house empty for others to enjoy!

name: Amanda
about: Hi there. I am a traveler myself and love utilizing airbnb. When my fiance and I purchased this home we were so excited to have a great apartment to offer fellow travelers.  A passion of ours is cooking and eating and we have loved coming up with a "favorites" list that you will find in the apartment. We have included favorite restaurants and bars broken down into many categories. We enjoy fitness which is another perk of the location. Forest park has amazing running trails and you can run 1 mile from our house to the start of the Wildwood trail.

name: Omar & Amanda
about: Amanda is a Special Ed teacher who enjoys sports, a good read, and exploring new places. She is a California native, but reside in the beautiful city of Portland. Omar is a realtor who came to the states from Peru about 15 years ago. The two met while Amanda was out salsa dancing or playing soccer. We can't quite remember all the details since it was years ago. We got hitched in 2014 and are expecting our first child in November 2016. We get along with almost anyone and love getting to know new people. We are sensitive to others' needs and have easy going personalities... so I think that would make good house guests or hosts. Hope to connect with you soon!

name: Jakob
about: I am currently traveling to different cities for work so airbnb makes sense for me. I work long hours and generally don't like staying in hotels because they are very impersonal. I live quietly and when I'm not working I'm training for marathons. Also I eat lots of oatmeal.

name: Mingus
about:
I am a middle aged, African American guy.  

Also, I am a political scientist and professor.  (Mostly, I teach and write on American politics.)   I did my undergraduate work at Reed College and received my PhD from Cornell University.  Due to the nature of my work, I tend to split my time between Boston, MA and Portland, OR.

On the West Coast, I live is a lovely historic Victorian house in Portland's Buckman neighborhood with my wife and two young children.  My wife is also a political scientist.  (Like me, she studies American politics.)  My boys are 3 and 5 years old.  They are adorable and rambunctious.   

Our lives are fairly typical of professional families with young children.  Balancing work, parenting and chores is a constant challenge.  But our house is also filled with lots of love and laughter. 

The adults in the house-- Mingus and Kim-- are laid back and liberal.    We appreciate microbrews, bikes, hikes and gardening. 

We are new to Airbnb.   Starting in July 2014, we will rent the basement apartment in the Victorian we live in.  The basement apartment is fully self-contained, with a private entrance, kitchen, bathroom, etc.

We hope to be friendly, but largely hands-off hosts.

name: Nathan
about:
Heyya, I am a art director/graphic designer and art curator who has been living in SE Portland for 9 years now. I lived in NYC for 10 years, and Hong Kong for 2.
I am into most things encountered at Comic Con, and am also a 90s hip hop fiend, who would rather spend a day antiquing than hiking. I love art books, baseball, mid-century design. I have never smoked a cigarette (but don't judge). I have a good sense humor, and am pretty tidy!

name: Dennis
about: I am an architect, born, raised, and educated in California.  My entire professional career has been in Portland.  I have owned my home since 1983.  I spend 4 months per year living in other countries, and I speak a few foreign languages at various levels of proficiency .

name: Jamilee
about:
"Work like you don't need the money, love like you've never been hurt, learn like there is no tomorrow, and dance like nobody's watching"
-unknown Scottish man-

Hi! I'm tidy, considerate, and kindly communicative. A sense of humor is one of my most valued traits in my friends and family. I will most certainly leave your home cleaner than I found it...that's just my style:). 

xo

name: Nikola
about:
Thank you for considering a stay at my home!  I love Portland and my neighborhood and look forward to sharing both with travelers.  I work in the natural resource management field and was drawn to the area for its proximity to beautiful places as well as its vibrant communities.  I am happy to share information with guests about many options for great food, art, music, outdoor experiences and relaxation in and near Portland.  

I love travel and have been fortunate to live, work and study in the U.S., Africa and South Asia.  I also travel for work throughout the Pacific Northwest and am happy to share ideas for weekend getaways as well as nearby adventures.  I look forward to hearing your travel stories.

I understand that guests have a variety of needs depending on their reason for travel.  I would like to make your visit as positive as possible and can share information from a resident's perspective or a vacationer's perspective.  I also understand the need for a refuge at the end of a busy day and will give guests as much space as they'd like. 

I look forward to interacting with Airbnb guests!  Please be in touch with questions or requests to customize your visit.

name: Joe
about:
I am an environmental planner at a public transit agency.  I have a graduate degree in urban and regional planning.  I enjoy gardening, reading, walking around and exploring, bicycling, history, architecture, transit, and nature, among other things.  

I am well rounded, respectful, thoughtful and easy going.  :-)

name: Mireille
about: I am a proud Portland resident involved community betterment efforts and pro-social efforts. I am an active member of several healthcare committees and believe that Oregon's greatest resource is it's people and it's communities. I am an avid traveler and each place I visit remains with me. My hope is that Portland's unique spirit remains with you too and that offering my home gives you a unique opportunity to experience Portland as a true Portlander.

name: Carmen
about:
Hi, we're Carmen and Dan and we love living in Portland.  I am a full time artist, working from my basement studio and Dan is a business consultant working from his upstairs office. 

Here in beautiful Oregon we love biking, hiking, and camping. Portland has an incredible food scene, and we take advantage of that.

  We both love travel, experiencing new places and meeting new people. I would describe us as independent, low maintenance guests who are grateful for our host's suggestions, advice, and even friendship, but are also fine on our own.

As hosts we want our guests to feel welcomed and relaxed. We hope to help facilitate a fantastic experience of our weird and wonderful Portland.

name: Oana
about:
Young couple from Portland, Oregon with a couple of goldendoodles named Clyde and Noodle =)

Mario plays a lot of music and is in the manufacturing industry. Oana is a couple and marriage therapist and reads too much. They hike and camp around Oregon and the NW.

name: Jen
about: I'm from Portland, Oregon. I like hiking, kayaking, eating, writing and reading. I am a Research Informatics Project Manager at Oregon Health & Sciences University.

name: James
about:
I'm a transplant from the East Coast - a Tar Heel born and bred. I grew up with a close albeit dysfunctional family and received a BS in Mathematics from a major liberal arts college in the region. I moved to Oregon to adventure in a new environment and to get more schooling. I like any art that comes from the heart and reflects the soul. I consider myself friendly, open, considerate, honest, and curious.

As a host I will be involved if you have questions and want to spend time together or out of your way if you already have a busy schedule. I look forward to meeting you and ensuring you enjoy your stay. I have previously co-hosted through Airbnb although it was not with this account. 

Find me on Couchsurfing under the handle saulsjet.

name: Elsie
about: This is a family property, your hosts may be Caroline or Imran or Elsie. We are all friends, Elsie is partially retired, working as a substitute school teacher. Imran and Caroline are working parents with two small kids and a Black Lab named Zoh. Caroline speaks Greek.

name: Tom
about: From Portland, Oregon. I love photography, the outdoors, traveling, all kinds of music, dogs. bikes, good food, good people, and building things from wood.

name: Danielle
about: I am a licensed Acupuncturist and active single Mom.  My 16 year old son and i enjoy skiing in the Winter up on the amazing Mt Hood.  Biking within the neighborhood and beyond is easy and super fun. Hiking in the Gorge and our local Forest Park take us to magical waterfalls and lush green forests in the Spring.  Summer months we are busy building sandcastles and boogie boarding at the Oregon coast or Sauvies Island.  A paddle or float on a nearby river is a great way to spend a summer day here in Portland.  We love lazy rainy Sundays at home in front of the fire with our cats and walking to the carts for a late afternoon ice cream treat.  You will be able to do all this and more from our cozy home in NoPo.

name: Heath & John
about: Hello!  We're Heath and John.  A little about us:  Heath works in Public Relations and John works in Marketing.  When we aren't working, we love to travel and to meet new and interesting people.  When in Portland, we love to explore the unique neighborhoods the city has to offer, while enjoying a great meal, drinks, or catching a show with fantastic friends.  It is one of our great pleasures in life to play "great hosts" and Airbnb allows us the opportunity to do so, in addition to meeting wonderful people along their travels.

name: Sarah
about: We're the Breezendalls! We've lived in SE Portland for the last 12 years and love to share our knowledge of the area with friends, family, and guests. We both work in the health care industry and in our free time we love to cook, garden, and hike the PNW.

name: Zoe And Sibyl
about: We are mother and daughter living together in our old family house in the West Hills. We were originally a six-person Brady Bunch—Bob and his two daughters and Sibyl and her two kids respectively. Now we’re down to two and looking forward to opening our home for others to share!

name: Jennifer
about:
CURRENT MISSION

to become who I was meant to be

ABOUT ME

I want to grow, learn and share as much as I can on this earth.

My career is in the field of international education, so I have worked as an administrator at a community college and at a corporate language center with international students from all over the world, both as an academic advisor and as a housing coordinator. 

I am also a lifelong learner who dabbles in freelance journalism, hot springs, photography, jewelry design and dance (of all kinds but especially salsa, bachata and tango).

I have an adorable Siamese cat named Hachi who is my sidekick. :)

I think everyone has a story to tell and would love to hear yours!

PHILOSOPHY

The highest aim of humanity is to know and love God and then know and love others.

*

WHY I'M ON AIR BNB

I'm always excited to meet fellow nomads and share travel wisdom! I want to share what I have.

Even if I could afford five star hotels every night I would choose couchsurfing or Air BNB over that any day because of the profound authenticity, unforgettable memories and friendships that form through this mode of travel.

INTERESTS

Photography, writing, singing, Latin dance, trying exotic foods, nature walks, jewelry-making, idioms, cultural exchange, drawing people out of their shells and connecting with humanity

MUSIC, MOVIES & BOOKS

Amelie. Life Is Beautiful. Born Into Brothels. Wasteland. Mostly Martha. Rainman. Grease. Winged Migration. The Story of the Weeping Camel. Unmistaken Child. Mao's Last Dancer. Wasteland.

Celtic. Indian sitar. Oldies. Flamenco. Classical. Putumayo. Salsa. Merengue. Bachata. Anything that isn't heavy metal. :)

"El hombre viejo con las alas enormes" and "El ahogado más hermoso del mundo" - Gabriel Garcia Marquez. The Missing Piece Meets the Big O - Shel Silverstein. Eloise - Kay Thompson. Madeleine L'Engle's fiction and non-fiction. Simplify Your Life - Elaine St. James. Memoirs of a Geisha. Mountains Beyond Mountains. Travel guide books. :)

AMAZING THINGS I'VE DONE

I´ve been charged by a yearling cow in a Mexican bullring (on purpose). And I've ridden in a hot air balloon at dawn over the mystical landscape of Capadoccia in Turkey.

TEACH, LEARN, SHARE

I can write communal poetry with you, or we can indulge in a chocolate facial or a bout of laughter yoga, and I would be delighted to give you Spanish and/or Latin dance lessons. I will also sing with you and teach you how to see the silver lining. :)

WHAT I CAN SHARE WITH HOSTS

My splendiforous and fantastic self!

COUNTRIES I'VE VISITED

Austria, Canada, Denmark, France, Mexico, Morocco, Spain, Turkey, Ireland

COUNTRIES I'VE LIVED IN

Spain, United States

name: Rick & Lara
about: Our description will go here.

name: Stephani
about: I am an avid travler! Experiencing new cultures is a passion of mine.  When I'm not traveling I love having people over, eating, drinking, and doing lots of Yoga!

name: Autumn
about:
I am a freelance videographer/photographer under the moniker of Photosphere and a moonlighting music journalist. 
Liberal, bit shy, believe in karma and science, Nordicphile, acrophile, animal lover, trying to be vegan.

Have been on the travel bug ever since I spent my sophomore year during my first degree in Rome, Italy. I am bit of a germ-freak and make a horrible camper as I need the modern plumbing. I've endured $5 bed in Hungary, 4-star hotel in Sweden, botel in Holland, apartment in Iceland, uncomfortable train sleeper from Munich to Prague, and recently been educated on Korean shower. With these experiences, I try to have my rental house as I would like it and hopefully you will too!

name: Diana
about: Researcher and nurse, grandmother, gardner - I'm interested in a lot things - have traveled alot, but not lately because I've wanted to be a well known 'Gram'.  Now that my elder granson is 10 I'm eager to hit the road again!  I read the New Yorker magazine from cover to cover at breakfast...listen to books on tape while I'm in the kitchen and read a few pages of a book before going to sleep.  Read/listen to fiction andnon-fiction with minimal interest in mysteries or romance... I like historical novels - Geraldine Brooks! Retired scientist... PhD in infectious disease epidemiology specializing in tuberculosis control.  Also led research focused on the impact of hospital noise.  Don't play music like I used to, but music is important to me - classical/ethnic, rock and roll from my era.  Played in a Balinese gamelan for 8+ years when I lived in Baltimore, MD.   Have a great fondness for textiles....Don't know a lot, but like them....Same with rocks.    Love to garden -- my favorite combination of an activity  -  static qualities you can count on... somethings always changing, usually for the better, it feels good, it's fun to show off and it feels like I'm making a contribution to the greater universe.  I'm chatty - but fundamentally an introvert so I need alone time or I get grumpy.  Have always enjoyed meeting new people and learning new things.  I tend to say what's on my mind - both what I like and don't like... Have gotten pretty diplomatic as I've gotten older.

name: Jennifer
about: Certified lover of all things home, especially the family, food and friends part. And I move the furniture around a lot too.

name: Julie
about: Greetings!  How to describe me......I'm a quiet, respectful, nurturing, musical, academic type who loves the outdoors, hiking, gardening, and communing with nature in general.  My musical tastes tend to be eclectic - more Joni Mitchell than B-52s.....with a heavy dose of classical and world music thrown in.  I don't watch TV, but do enjoy AppleTV and Netflix in my private sitting room.  I LOVE to cook and take pride in using local organic produce - from my garden and from local farmers' markets.  That's what Portland is all about - and I'd love to introduce you to the best parts of Portland!

name: Amanda
about:
I share my home with my handy husband and lovingly spoiled rescue dog. An architect by trade, I enjoy creating bright clean modern space for people who enjoy equal parts form and function. 

I love Portland and Oregon, I am so happy I live here. I think you'll love it too.

name: Amy
about:
Hello!  I am a native New Yorker, a NY, Hawaii, and now Oregon State Licensed Massage Therapist and Acupuncturist/Practitioner of Oriental Medicine.  I love travel and am very thankful to the Airbnb community.  I have used the site numerous times for my own trips and have never been disappointed.  Thank you to all the hosts for making the way safe, interesting, and adding to my understanding of life and living beyond the city.

Naike and I are happy to open our most recent home (as of Jan 2016) to fellow travelers visiting PDX and maybe even those considering moving here - we can give you the low down. We are considerate housemates and so is our well-behaved Catahoula, Una.  

Happy Airbnb-ing!
Amy

name: Shera
about:
I have lived in Portland for 26 years. I am a harpist and a elementary school music teacher,  My husband Andrew is a violinist and teacher as well. I love to garden and spend time hiking in the beautiful Cascades. 

We have greatly enjoyed hosting and meeting new people through Airbnb.

name: Matt
about: Born and raised in Portland.  But, I've lived all over the west coast.  I love the mountains and the beach.  Most weekends, I'm busy getting lost in the woods.  I do love the city as well.   My favorite fried chicken spot - Reel 'M Inn  and favorite Honky Tonk bar (live music 7 nights a week) - Landmark Saloon are both on SE Division Street.  A short jaunt from my place.

name: David
about: I am a non-profit director who works from a home office.  I am politically progressive but not dogmatic.  I am an outdoors enthusiast and enjoy the region's wine and beer culture.  I live in NE Portland, two blocks from direct bus service to downtown and the Portland Airport.  Walking distance to Asian restaurants and groceries.

name: Katie
about: A 20-something returned to Portland and loving living in the heart of the city!

name: Page
about:
I come from a long line of believers in the sacred art of hospitality. My grandparents owned a beautiful bed and breakfast where I have my fondest memories from childhood. I take extra care with the little finishing touches to make the home well welcome and comfortable. 
I have lived in Portland for 14 years and love to offer suggestions of places to go and what to see. 
As a world traveller, I love meeting new people who are curious about new cultures and like to try new things. 
Love: gardening, hiking and experiencing the cultures of the world.

name: Anna
about: I adore living in the northwest because of the outstanding water (drinking, fishing, swimming) and abundant high quality agricultural products available in the stores or in the fields - you choose!  When I'm not cooking, I'm reading - travel, history, and biography for the most part.  I've had the honor to travel the world and my favorite places to visit tend to be in Asia (I speak a tiny bit of Japanese).  Mostly, though, I  just enjoy travelling wherever I can including in the USA.   By day:  I've been a small business owner for 24 years specializing in housing and community development.  Our firm has 20+ employees and we've helped develop housing all over Oregon, so I'm somewhat familiar with the beautiful and friendly small communities throughout this state.   At several of our housing developments,  we run Summer Food and Fun programs for children - providing free school lunches and creative activities when school is out.  One of our building locations also works in partnership with the area Food Bank to bring fresh fruits and vegetables to our site as a sort of free farmer's market, giving our local lower income families in the neighborhood better access to healthy fresh foods.

name: Jodi
about: I'm from Portland Oregon.  Im an Oregon Native.  I love traveling and camping.  I work for the Family Business. I have a small family 1 child, 1 husband,LOL & 2 dogs.  I love Portland, The food here!!  I can't stop eating!!!

name: Phiamma
about: I'm a filmmaker, non-cigarette smoker, artist, Mum, lover of animals and an ecologist. Easy going, nonjudgmental. Believe in goodness. Can hang pretty much with anyone anywhere. LGQBT welcoming. As a renter and a host I appreciate common courtesy, taking care of the space, and being a good neighbor.

name: Richard
about: I'm a teacher that also works in the craft brewing industry. Grew up in Houston and have been living in Portland for the last 12 years. I like to live like a local when travelling. I'm interested in food, drinks, and outdoor adventures.

name: Steve
about:
I was born and raised in a smallish town in NJ, and went to college in Boston.  I now live in Portland, OR, which feels like home.

I enjoy playing tennis, making art, selling on Amazon & eBay, and reading, among other things.  One of my favorite books is Infinite Jest and I'm a big Simpsons & Seinfeld fan.  Currently I've been watching all the reruns of Shark Tank.

I am an adaptable traveler - at ease in both simple and sophisticated settings.

One of the sayings I (try to) live by is "The only absolute is there is no absolute."

name: Siena
about: Originally from Evanston, IL, I live in Portland, OR now with my wonderful partner Eric and our golden retriever Skye. We spend our time restoring and tending to our mid century home in east Portland, where we recently hosted guests on the 2016 Restore Oregon's Mid-Century Modern Tour.  We both love to connect with new people and enjoy traveling ourselves.  We're avid photographers (on Flickr: Unsettler and SBendixenPark). Whether you need a comfortable room for an evening or longer stay, we look forward to welcoming you into our home.

name: Kim And Carl
about:
We love to ride bikes, golf and  go on urban walks.
Carl works as a bike and ski tech and I work as a nurse.
Our most recent air bnb was in Iceland.

name: Travis
about: Like travelling, snowboarding, old motorcycles, tasty food, scotch whisky, playing hockey, love my dog Lucy and my wife Cassie!

name: Lori
about:
I am someone who tries to live life full! I believe it is a gift that should be cherished through respect of others and myself. I would not want to live without great friends, great food, worthy projects that stimulate my creativity, my health and my home. 
I have traveled fairly extensively in Mexico and speak simple Spanish. I was there a year ago in May to visit a dear friend in Oaxaca. I've also been to Europe, Canada and Alaska.
