The kinds of movies I like most are human stories, especially when about interesting, quirky personalities, like Harold and Maude. My music collection is very eclectic with everything from blues, to jazz, to rock, to Latin, to blue grass and most genres in between. 
I love to cook and most meals are made at home with fresh meat and vegetables (some from my garden) and keep processed packaged food at a minimum. I'm often accused of having only ingredients in my pantry and frig, but I also keep some healthier snacks on hand.
I love meeting people from other countries and have been a "homestay" host to students from Japan and Saudi Arabia. I also had a lovely Persian woman renting my spare room for about a year. I like showing people around the city and state, taking them to the coast, Multnomah Falls, downtown, outdoor concerts and to the many great festivals Portland hosts throughout the year. I have always done my best to make my guests feel a part of the family and give them the opportunity to experience the best of American life.
When I travel I usually go by public transit and would say I keep it on the cheap in general. I like to be close to the center of the action, but also enjoy going to the countryside.
I have just started hosting on Airbnb, so I'm looking forward to meeting some new and interesting travelers.
My life motto is, "life is too short to be dull, so embrace it with excellence and make as many memories as possible!"

name: Deborah
about: Hi! I'm a graphic designer and artist and live in what I think is the best part of Portland! I've lived here just two years but love the laid-back, friendly vibe and the many things this city has to offer. I love meeting new people and making sure you have a great stay while you're here. Aside from art and design, I love food and cooking, and am interested in music, films, literature, health and being outdoors.

name: Sam
about: I'm living the dream (or at least my dream). I get to tour the world with rock bands for a living and help bring happiness to strangers. I also get to live in one of my favorite places when I'm not workin.

name: Aaron
about: Longtime Portland resident who enjoys sharing his place with travelers from all over the world. I strive to offer a clean, comfortable place and I am happy to offer advice on where to go and what to do in this fun city!

name: Courtney & Jordan
about:
5 Things I can't live without : Courtney Lovell, Family, Golf, Fruit, Music

As a guest we are very respectable, clean, safe, reliable.  We are interested in learning about the culture we are visiting at that time.  We are a very laid back couple and love to make the most of our traveling experience.

name: Timothy
about: I am a passionate Portlander.   I grew up in the midwest and spent a number of years on the East coast before moving to Portland 26 years ago.    I love the creativity and quality of life that Portland offers.   I hope that  I have been able to put a little bit of  "Portlandia" into the this Airbnb experience for those who do not yet know The City of Roses.

name: Tyler
about: I am a sales rep in the printing industry and Melissa works in the ad/PR business. We are your stereotypical Portland couple; we have a 10yo, a dog, backyard vegetables and used to have chickens.

name: Kira
about: I'm a mom of two littles who loves owning our family business, playing tennis and beach time with my brood.  I have lived in Oregon for 15 years and have watched it bloomed.  Because of our close relationship to the East Side of Portland and watching it grow we are privy to much of the inside scoop, just ask!

name: Evolve Vacation Rental
about: Evolve Vacation Rental Network is redefining vacation rental management by eliminating hassle, guesswork and frustration for homeowners and travelers. Our team is available 7 days a week and we look forward to providing you with exceptional customer service during every interaction. Please tell us how we can help with your upcoming trip.

name: Beth
about: I'm a nurse, an RN BSN, working at different healthcare places as an independent contractor. I own a 2 bedroom craftsman cottage in the SE Montavilla neighborhood of Portland, OR. I travel out of town periodically for different nursing contracts and outdoor  adventure trips.

name: Jessica
about: I am a freelance illustrator and teacher living in Portland, OR in the winters and on the coast of Maine in the summers with my husband and family. My husband, Tim, is a journalist, screenwriter and independent filmmaker who founded MovieMaker Magazine. We live with our toddler and infant sons. We have two very good dogs, a happy border collie mutt and a sweet little terrier mutt, who also go back and forth from OR to Maine every year. We own homes in both OR  and Maine and have rented out our own properties as vacation rentals many times for many years through some websites you may have heard of, and more recently on airbnb. We like reading, movies, cooking, gardening and traveling.

name: Maximilian
about:
I am a passionate adventurer, avid reader and efficiency nut. I live for meeting people and traveling, and I am especially drawn to the outdoors, design, yoga and food; I indulge in all of them with unabashed relish.

Hope to see you soon!
Max

name: Tushar
about: I'm a maker at heart, with a passion for remodeling homes. My main gig: owner of a killer B2B web marketing agency serving Silicon Valley tech companies since 1996. I currently have 6 Airbnb listings. I treat my guests well, and I love their stories!

name: Peter
about: I am a professor of Economics and love Portland!  We have a long hair chihuahua Ritz who will guard you during your stay!  There are so many food options in the neighborhood including several food cart pods that Portland is famous for. We re a short distance from Portland airport via MAX (subway), Uber, Lyft or taxi!  By car we are in north Portland very close to the border with Washington State just off I-5.  Come explore this amazing neighborhood and city!

name: Rose
about: Originally from NYC, Rose has been in Portland for 20+ years. She is involved in the Portland Improv Comedy scene as well as the aerial arts and she enjoys sharing her knowledge of Portland with visiting guests.

name: Brandon
about: I first experienced Airbnb overseas and it was great fun. I'm excited to embark on this journey as a host and making your stay as comfortable as possible.

name: Nan
about: I'm a professional singer and voice teacher. My studio is in the front house where I live, so if you need anything, I'm close for convenience but not in your space! Gardening is obviously an addiction: I keep planting more bulbs every year, so I might need an intervention on that. I'm an Air Force Brat so I love meeting new folks and traveling. I can muddle through in several European languages and I sing in a bunch of them, but I'm most comfortable in German. I love riding my bike (not so much in the rain, I'm a fair weather biker). A Sci-Fi & Mystery book reader, and have now added regular Cross-training/Bootcamp to my life. Don't wait so late in life to do that is my advice, but I'm doing it! Must haves: Good coffee, good chocolate, good books, good kitties, and music of all kinds. I mostly sing classical for the dough-re-mi, but I love all kinds and teach all kinds. My motto: If it's not in writing, it doesn't exist!

name: Abraham
about: I am a small business owner, native Oregonian and have been living in Portland for the past 15 years.  A few of my favorite things are music, cooking, motorcycling, world travel, and film-making.  I've explored high and low in my years of Portland living and am happy to share my insight on all that Portland has to offer.  I am a fairly clean, respectful, kind, easy-going and fun-loving person and am hoping you are as well. Please let me know if you have any questions.  Thank you for considering my listing.

name: Cecilia
about:
Love adventure and travel to new places, I like to feel welcomed wherever I go, for that reason, I like to welcome other travelers and ensure they leave with good experiences to share with others. 
Travel open our eyes to other things that we may not experience in other ways.

name: Suja
about:
I'm a Bay Area native, and have lived in Portland since 2010.  I work in affordable housing finance, love to travel, cook delicious food, dance, spend time outdoors, and with friends and family.  I train acrobatics in my spare time, run, and dance contact improvisation.  My favorite foods are Thai, Mexican, and Indian, all spicy cuisines.  

For many years I traveled the world, and had the joy of being hosted by many wonderful people and establishments of varying kinds.  I am now very excited to be hosting travelers from all over the world.  I am passionate about travel and now I am passionate about hosting.  I strive to consistently improve the experience my guests are having.  I love AirBnb!

name: Kristin
about: So you are visiting Portland huh?  Well you've come to the right place.  More than just a place to stay, we are committed to helping everyone get the most of their time here.  We have made a full time cause of learning and experiencing the best of Portland's culture, be it food, nightlife outdoors or any of the myriad of "quirky" events that "keep Portland weird".  Seriously, whether here for business or vacation, Portland is too much fun to miss out by staying in a hotel and not knowing what to do or where to go.  We like biking, drinking beer, listening to local bands/DJs, going dancing, watching soccer, exploring the wilderness and participating in anything that is new and sounds fun!  We enjoy our city every day and want to share that with you.

name: Bryan
about: Raised in the Midwest, I've been living in Portland since 2007, working in technology and consulting. Before that, I taught English in France & Thailand, and was a bike tour guide in Berlin. In my free time, I like to run, hike, bike, cook, read, and travel.

name: Mallary
about: I've been living in Portland, Oregon for 16 years, but I was born and raised in Northern California.  I enjoy anything to do with arts and culture ... music, film, writing, art and food ... and treasure hunting for antiques and collectibles.  I am retired and work independently selling a few things on eBay for the fun of it and to raise money for worthy causes.  I love animals and Family and Friends are my top priority in life.

name: Claire
about:
Hi!
I am a native Portlander, born and breed. Us locals have a lot of hometown pride, and really love our city and want other people to love it to! I work as an Event Planner in the city, and my boyfriend is an Architect. We love traveling, and have used air B&B a few times as guests- and figured hey why not be a host! 
Please let us know if you have any questions about the listing, or if you need more information! 

Thanks, and we hope you come and enjoy our beautiful city :)

name: Ali And Mike
about: We are Portland transplants that chose to start our family in the great Pacific Northwest. Our favorite things to do in Portland: play and eat! Traveling is a passion for our family and conquering Europe is our current goal. When hosting or traveling we believe that it should be easy, clean, and classy.

name: Bobby
about:
I am a computer engineer in my 40's.  I currently work at NVIDIA and live in Portland, Oregon.  

I lived in my listed condo for 6 years before moving to a house in N Portland and listing my condo on AirBnB.     I have met a lot of great people through AirBnB, both as a host and a guest.   As a host, I strive to do everything possible to ensure you have a great visit to Portland.   It truly is a uniquely amazing place.   

Interests include hiking, snowboarding, surfing, world travel.

name: Dina
about: Hi there! Frenchy living in Portland and loving the american dream. Citizen of the world I love Airbnb for bringing all of us closer. Love music, travels, idealists, skiing and cards against humanity.

name: Cheryl
about:
I'm from Portland, Oregon, but have been teaching abroad at 10 different international schools for the past 25 years.  Now I am semi-retired, and living half the year in La Ceiba, Honduras.   I'm in the process of buying land on Cayos Cochinos, an amazing coral reef paradise - where I can go snorkeling off my front porch   Between living in the Caribbean and wonderfully weird Portland, life is good...... 

 My motto is "live your passion."  I'm friendly, helpful, and like to get to know my guests.  But I also respect people's need for privacy, and leave it to guests to socialize or be alone as much as they would  like.  If guests suggest preparing a shared meal, I'm always pleased to take part.  Having lived many places in the world, I enjoy having the world come to me these days.  I enjoy learning people's ideas, insights, opinions, and having a stimulating conversation over a glass of pinot grigio.  I love exploring:  places, people, ideas, and new talents and skills.  

Like most people in Portland, I'm an avid gardener, conservationist, and a recycler.  If you are not interested in recycling and composting your garbage, this would not be the best choice of a place for you to stay.  

My feline buddy, Pepino, is a shy fellow who you will rarely see.  He's a 12 year old rescue cat who I absolutely adore.  If he checks you out and allows you to pet him, consider it a high compliment!!!

name: Krista
about:
Hey I'm Krista!  I've been traveling with Airbnb for a year and a half and I really love this community.  I own my home in beautiful Portland, OR and rent out the studio that I have listed on Airbnb.  I've lived in northern Idaho and Southern Florida, but I'm happy to call Portland my home.  I thrive in this city full of art, music, delicious and unique food and the wonderful (and typically quirky) people. 

I'm an 'artist type" who loves to try my hand at new methods and materials of art and craft.  I love to be in the out-of-doors as much as possible.  I also love pets - two cats.

One of my favorite things to do is ride my scooter around town, exploring all of the different neighborhoods Portland has to offer.

name: Judith
about:
I am presently consulting to philanthropy, nonprofits and community groups across the country, working from home.  It allows me to work at night and garden during the day.  

I think that travel should result in interesting stories and photos to share with the folks back home, and a recipe or two.  I am always on the search for the best Indian food in every city I visit.  I've had it in Paris, Vienna, Prague and Budapest (as well as around the US).  I have to say that New York, Greenville (NC) and Vienna were fantastic.  Paris, not so much.  But I love Paris for so much more than food.

I'm mom to a teenager, active in school choir and track -- lots of chauffeuring around town and handing cash to him on a regular basis.  Despite that, I love being a mom and showing him how to be open to the world.  I encourage (and take) him traveling and meeting new people.  Our next trip is hopefully Spain in 2017 for the World Pride Festival.  

I like coffee, great food (but not pretentious), walking, taking new forms of transportation (as in ferries, pedicabs, bullet trains), talking to cab drivers and gardening.  My favorite book of all time is a tie:  Their Eyes Were Watching God by Zora Neale Hurston, Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen, and Beach Music by Pat Conroy.  All for different reasons.  Love to read but I wish people would stop writing new books, I'll never get through them all!

name: Ed & Mary
about:
Mary and I welcome you to Portland!  We love this area of the city, right between the Historic Mississippi District and the bustling Williams Corridor!

We moved to Portland from San Francisco several years ago and love it...while still missing SF...if that makes sense...:)  

Our aim is to make you very comfortable and take care of any needs you might have.  We have a second home right across the river in downtown Portland less than 5 minutes so it's easy for us to drop by should you need us.  Otherwise you won't see us as your privacy and comfort is our first priority!
Thanks and welcome!

name: Halley
about:
Hello! I am a building designer and drafter living in beautiful Portland, Oregon. I love all of the stereotypical Portland things: bikes, camping, good food and dogs. I volunteer at the local Humane Society and am on a local amateur cycling team. 

My goal when I travel is to spend enough time in a place to get to know it and the people living there. Too many of my trips end-up being fast and shallow. I would love to change that.

name: Janice
about: I am from Portland, Oregon, the west coast of the USA, where I work as a doctor of Chinese medicine and practice acupuncture and herbal medicine.  I love to explore the quiet back roads and simple places in my travels around the world, to meet new and interesting people and lose myself in unfamiliar cultures.  I love music & dance, walking & hiking, chatting with strangers, and appreciating new environments.

name: William & Anastasia
about: Phone number is (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

name: Marcia
about: Ray and I feel fortunate to live in a home that we love—and enjoy sharing—in a city where so much is happening. Having traveled the world, we find ourselves in heaven right here. We spend a lot of time together in our upstairs office. We like to cook, garden, take walks, watch movies, read, write, and do the New York Times crossword puzzle. Foodies and wordies welcome. Best cup of coffee in Portland: right here.

name: Rachel
about: I spend most of my time teaching English, learning Spanish, taking care of my family and participating in community events. I love to share my beautiful city and neighborhood, as well as travel. Travel to Mexico and Canada are top destinations.

name: Holly Jo
about: Born and raised Portlander.  Could not be more local if I tried.  We have been living communally since 89'.  Truly know about sharing and caring.  I was a preschool teacher for 8 years and small business owner prior to that.  I've owned a coffee shop, thrift shop, and local artist shop.  The house represents each stage of those times.  I've been told it's magical and I also marry folks in love.

name: Loren
about: I'm a Ruby on Rails (web developer) working for a startup in Silicon Valley. I work remotely so often travel while still on the job.

name: Monica
about: Hi! I'm Monica and I live in Portland, OR.  I'm a yogi, a foodie and a world traveler.  I love exploring new places and have backpacked long-term through Europe and Southeast Asia.  I have spent many nights in both hostels and 5 star hotels and strongly believe in the solace of a good place to sleep.  My favorite way to explore a new place is to take a long walk, get lost, and be surprised by where I end up.  I've traveled to every continent except Antarctica, but also believe that sometimes the best part of travel is coming home.

name: Elizabeth
about:
A well-developed sense of humor is the pole that adds balance to your steps as you walk the tightrope of life.
--William Arthur Ward

name: Adrian
about: Sam and Adrian are an engaged couple in our early 30's.  We are both professionals and are working our way through the Harry Potter books at Adrian's behest.

name: Louise
about:
We have lived in our beautiful Northeast Portland home for 20 years. 
We are both physicians and enjoy our busy work lives. When not working, we love to putter around in our house and garden, read, follow the Portland Trail Blazers, watch British TV, travel, visit our two grown kids, and go for walks. We love to try new restaurants as well as visit old neighborhood favorites.
When we travel, we most value being able to slow down with few responsibilities to take care of.  As hosts, we want to provide you with that same experience. We hope you'll let us know if there is anything we can do to help you enjoy your stay and leave feeling refreshed and renewed.

name: Rachel
about:
My glorious roommates, Laurel, Malena, and I moved to Portland from Petaluma, CA (bay area) to attend school about a year ago.
We are extremely laid back kind of lazy people, but we have fun with life!

We would like to say we are familiar with Portland as we have had time to explore and learn the ins and outs of it, and we are more than happy to share all the knowledge we do have.
*However, Laurel has lived here for three+ years, Malena and I only about 11 months. 

We love love love traveling and learning about it through others personal experiences. 
We are fairly new with airbnb, especially on the hosting end of it, but chances are, we would love to host you!


UPDATE: We also just got an awesome new roommate named Laurel whom is very much similar to us! So now there is three of us.

Please do keep in mind we are all fairly busy as we go to school and work 90% of the time. We are constantly going in and out of the house, and there often may be no one home.

name: Deborah
about: I am a born and raised Oregonian, interior designer, hiker, local wine and food lover and traveler. Our home reflects our style, our cookbook shelf reflects our love of food.  We live in a region with great food, wine, coffee shops, Forest Park and indie shopping and I wouldn't live anywhere else.

name: Cora
about: My fiance Dave and I are both freelancers working in the film industry living up and down the west coast. We live mostly in LA, part-time in Portland, and welcome you to our lovely home there while we're traveling

name: Kenan
about:
We are an active family of 4 (5 if you include the pooch!) on the go.  We have lived in the Sellwood neighborhood of SE Portland for 15 years and absolutely love it.  It is a friendly neighborhood where you can experience the feel of the city while being incredibly close to quiet and natural surroundings of the river and forest.  We love to escape to the coast or the mountains as well, but are always are so happy to be back home.  
When in town, we like to run, ride and walk, and then sit down for good food and drinks. If there's a Timbers or Thorns game on or at Providence Park, one of us will probably be there.

name: Shamara
about: I'm a school psychologist, traveler, nature enthusiast and yogi :-)

name: Lotus And Brandon
about:
Lotus is a massage therapist, yoga instructor and essential oil educator.  Brandon is a massage therapist as well and a massage continuing education instructor.

We both enjoy movies.  Brandon's favorite is Dead Poet's Society and Lotus's favorite is the Notebook.  

The Matrix and Lord of the Rings are pretty dang cool, too.  However, any inspirational movie is always a plus.  

Brandon is an avid reader and writer.  He's had a children's book published, "Penguins on Pluto", and short stories and articles published in magazines. He is writing a Young Adult novel series!

Lotus loves singing and has a voice (this is Brandon writing) that is beautiful beyond words.  You just have to catch her singing when she thinks she's alone.  

And, when you stay with us, you'll enjoy your privacy.  We simply leave you alone unless you would like to have conversations, which we love as well.  You have the best of both worlds with us. 

Our life motto? "Akuna Matata!"  It means "No worries for the rest of your days."  

Happy Travels!

name: Adrienne & Josh
about: Hi there!  We are a professional couple. We have lived in Portland Oregon for over 7 years. We speak English/Spanish.  We love to travel and to host.  Learning about and meeting different people is a passion of ours. We love our town and can't wait for you to see it!

name: Gregory
about: I'm a professor at a local university (working in environmental studies, sustainability and mathematics) but also am president of an environmental non-profit that sponsors an amazing land trust in the Columbia River Gorge.  As an avid traveler, I spend about 4 months of the year in Europe - for work and pleasure, but also travel to Asia quite often.   I know Portland very well and love living here!  As a host I really enjoy connecting my guests with places, activities and people who fit their interests.  I'm a big fan of local food and wine - you can expect a welcoming example when you arrive.  As a frequent hiker and fisher I can recommend lots of local options for enjoying the fabulous outdoor opportunities we have in the region.  I think my house is perfectly suited to hosting - you have the first floor and I have the second, with the kitchen as our shared space.  This gives me the ability to give my guests as much privacy as they want, but also offer the opportunity to socialize too!  Several former guests have moved to Portland (not because of me!) and we have remained friends since.

name: Ayumi
about: Portlander since 2003, I will be happy to share recommendations for restaurants, wine and shopping in Portland.

name: Jasmine
about: Born and raised in Oregon. We live and we work in the area and can recommend lots of great spots in and around the city. We hosted with Air B and B last summer and met so many great people. Looking forward to meeting you.

name: Sherold
about: I'm married to John and we are both outdoor enthusiasts and love world travel. I help women entrepreneurs build businesses online and make consistent income. I'm in Kundalini yoga teacher training, I love gardening, reading, hiking, snow shoeing, camping and being outside.  My two favorite trips have been Africa and Bhutan.

name: Adam
about:
We love all things outdoor.  In the Summer there isn't a better place to hike, bike and run than Portland.  And after a day of exploring the Columbia River Gorge or running through the scenic neighborhoods, there is nothing better than stopping by the Brewery District for a hand crafted beer or Distillery Row for a whiskey tasting.  

Winter is an excellent time to be here as well.  We love skiing and relaxing at the historic Timberline Lodge on Mt. Hood along with eating at some of the most recognized and awarded restaurants in the US.  Portland boasts one of the most diverse food scenes in any city, which is one of the reasons we love it here so much.  And of course Portland wouldn't be complete without a compilation of fantastic coffee shops, which we frequent often. 

We love this house on Mt. Tabor because of its location to the park and amenities, plus it has everything we need to share our space with guests.  Elissa and I have travelled all over the world and stayed at a lot of places so we strive to make your stay here as comfortable as possible.  

We'll be available if you have any questions or needs but we also are all about respecting privacy, we want you to have an excellent time while you stay in Portland.

name: Alex
about:
(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) 
THIS IS A TEST ACCOUNT - DO NOT BOOK ANY LISTINGS, AND DO NOT SUSPEND THE ACCOUNT.

name: Leticia
about:
From Portland, Oregon.
Lover of Art, Architecture, Good Food, New Cities and Adventures.

name: Dani
about:
We have traveled to some incredible places in the world. Among some all-time favorite destinations are Iceland and Tanzania. Some other places we are hoping to visit in the not-so-distant future include Southeast Asia and Australia/NZ. We are both lifelong lovers of travel and excited to host on Airbnb where we will have the opportunity to meet, learn from, and provide hospitality for other travelers.

We travel light when possible and we prefer unbounded itineraries where we have the freedom to change our plans on the fly. We frequently travel to the east coast of the United States, but we love getting the opportunity to explore new destinations. We are organized hosts with many suggestions on the best attractions, most popular restaurants, and everything the great outdoors has to offer in the great Pacific Northwest.

name: Tai
about: Hi, my name is Tai, I am 42, an artist and a professional jeweler. I live in Portland, Oregon with my husband and our two teenagers. I was born in Europe but I grew up in Santa Cruz, California. I enjoy nature, art and traveling. I am mellow, friendly,  responsible, easy going and independent.  I travel a lot on business doing various art shows around the country and I use AirBnb mainly for that reason, though every once in a while I will treat myself to a vacation! I have listed my home on Airbnb for when I'm away on business trips.

name: Danna
about: I am from Asuncion,Paraguay. Live in Portand,Oregon since 6 years ago. I am very laid back, love traveling and like to keep myself busy enjoying this amazing city!  I work from 9-5 ish and i love enjoying a movie or shows by the fire place, once in a while :)

name: Victoria
about: My partner Joshua and I have put a lot of hard work and love into finishing The Clay Hut. We enjoy spending time with family and friends, cooking, gardening, and hosting guests. I hope you have a lovely stay with us, and please feel free to ask if you need anything that you can’t find in the room or bathroom.

name: Trevor
about: I am currently a medical student at OHSU, my partner a physician, and the little time we have off we enjoy traveling.  We follow the wine, beer and restaurant scene very closely in Portland and would love to offer our recommendations to make your trip that much more enjoyable.  We are happy to answer whatever questions that you may have and hope you enjoy Portland as much as we do.

name: Jen
about: I'm an avid motorcycle enthusiast (street and dirt), love traveling and going out...or staying in. You can usually find me on an outdoor adventure when I'm not busy in the garden or working on my latest project. I'm a rare Oregon native and would love to share some hidden gems of Portland with you that aren't in the guide books. I look forward to connecting with fellow travelers and giving each guest a heartfelt welcome and experience that'll have them feeling like a local (minus the hipster jeans and waxed mustache!).

name: Catherine
about:
Single professional in the integrative health field.
I enjoy good quality food, wine and travel.
My hobbies include creative writing, dance, movies, reading and travel.
If you are interested in a stay please tell me a little about yourself.
 Cheers!

name: Juli
about:
Hello!
I am a long-time resident of Portland, Oregon and a lover of the outdoors. The home my husband and I have made for ourselves here means the world to me and I love sharing our upstairs apartment Airbnb with travelers from near and far.

Vacation to me is the great outdoors away from noise and people, but I love the city life I have found in many places local and abroad. My favorite trips are road trips especially with a good friend and the perfect Pandora station. 

I've been in marketing for more than 16 years, but my heart is in my hobby of animal volunteering and rescue. I work at one of our amazing local shelters here in Portland but also belong to national animal rescue teams and have been on multiple call-outs. It's the work that really feeds my soul.

I look forward to meeting you at either my house or yours!

name: Jewel
about: I'm a photographer by passion and startup founder by trade: (Workfrom) I come from a big family and surround myself with excellent friends who make my favorite music and art. A traveler, free spirit, maker, and student of life I love above all things getting lost on roads less traveled and thoughts. And I'll try most things at least once: climbing waterfalls, swimming in caves, surfing, snow boarding, cycling centuries and running half of a marathon.

name: Jordana
about: Enjoying the great outdoors from the mountains to the oceans with family and friends is where you will find me the happiest!  I love exploring with my husband, dog and two young children whether it is in our backyard or far from home.  Traveling, hiking, camping, yoga and snowsports are some of my favorite activities.  I like to live by the motto of "treat people the way you like to be treated."  Dreaming Tree Rentals is proud to book with Airbnb and I am passionate about designing accommodations that make the average stay extraordinary. Dreaming Tree Rentals is rooted in an unconditional love for memorable travel experiences.

name: Gary
about: I am originallty from Indiana.  I have lived in Portland 15 years.  I enjoy cooking, preparing gourmet dishes, traveling, Latin dancing and hiking.  I love to take my guests on tours of the Portland area and show them all the great things this area has to offer.

name: Beth
about: I'm an Oregonian who likes to travel, but wishes I had more time to do it! I like to learn about the history of the places I visit, see the touristy sites, and get to know the locals. And eat!

name: Justin
about: Originally from Colorado, I'm a music teacher & performer based in Portland, OR. I love the outdoors and fall more and more in love with the Northwest every day. I enjoy a nice cup of coffee and all stringed instruments.

name: Pamela & Niko
about:
Hi there.  
As co-hosts we’ve been airbnb-ing for a while now and are still excited each time someone chooses one of spots.  

We've been in Portland for over 18 years.  I'm from San Francisco and Niko is originally from Greece by way of Germany.  He speaks many languages … I barely get by on the one.  

We love to eat, to cook, to entertain and sometimes to just loaf around.

We're excited about the prospect of meeting new people and hearing about your adventures in Portland; if you want to share.  

Come, relax, walk, eat, drink and breath in a little of the beauty and charm that is Portland.

name: Edwin
about: A plant scientist by training, I have traveled the world for work.  Providing hospitality to fellow travelers is something I enjoy, having welcomed many people into my home through the Couchsurfing network (references provided on request) and more recently her on Airbnb.

name: R Roland
about: Nice old retired guy who feels and acts less than my age. Easy to deal with.

name: Meredith
about:
I am an artist living in a cozy artist bungalow with my little pooch near the beautiful walk trails of Glendoveer golf course.  I am  happily in my artist studio  digs out back where I have a beautiful art studio.

I have an MFA, done commissions and art residencies worldwide, and love to welcome visitors from far and near to my humble abode.  Soon, I  hope to present a little fresh baked pie maybe, as I have a pretty healthy rhubarb patch out back, where I spend time nurturing all my garden plants and flowers as well as fruit trees.  I play kazoo/blues and backup harmony in a local music group, and give programs throughout Portland to fragile younger and older adult communities in world music, arts and crafts and ceramics.  I live simply, close to the earth, and listen carefully to my muse---sometimes write prose, and always keep a smile on my face no matter what! 
I am learning that to do less is more----sometimes wisdom of the ages filters down thru----!!!! I seem to be accomplishing quite a bit this (URL HIDDEN) motto:  Don't look back and don't sit still for too long---move, shake and wiggle to some good music----whenever possible!

name: Patrice
about: I am a fun loving person living in Portland, Or. I love camping, hiking, gardening and hanging with my dog, Sunny. I do love to travel so I am opening my home to fellow travelers to meet new people and offer them some comforts while they are in this great city. I work full time as an RN in the area but I will try to meet you when you arrive. I have lived in Portland for 10 years and know the area well so anything you might need I would be able to help. Also if there is something you forgot to bring just ask and I will most likely be able to accommodate. Come share my little "Sunny Cottage" in SE Portland and explore the area to your heart's content!

name: Natalie
about: I love people. I love music. I love creating spaces for people to feel comfortable and loved. Grew up in Chicago, it will always hold a huge space in my heart. My current city of Portland has given me lots of love and lots of lessons. Thankful for both.

name: Amanda
about: Fun, outgoing, dog lover who likes to meet new people and share stories about new places!

name: Steffen & Hannah
about: We have lived in portland almost 5 years now and love being here. Any chance we get, we like to go hike or camp.  We both enjoy exploring all the amazing food in Portland and would be happy to offer recommendations!Steffen is an audio engineer, and Hannah does custom woodwork and design work through our company and also drives for Uber/Lyft.

name: Alain
about:
Hi, I'm Alain 

I'm just another Cuban "keeping Portland weird!'. 
Enjoy travelling, camping and making friends.

name: Brent And Cassie
about:
Vibrant community, global awareness, and building positive relationships with everyone I meet are passions of mine and core to my being. 

I get to share life with my beautiful wife Cassie. Together we enjoy outdoor adventures, trips abroad, and really exploration of any kind. She is a teacher at the International School. 

I am a training coordinator with Carpe Diem Education. There I have the honor of preparing educators to take college age students on semester long trips all across the globe. Our goal is to facilitate experiences in which students learn about social equity, culture, and community.

name: Rob
about: Life is an adventure, its always good to have a nice place to stay when you get tired of exploring.

name: Felicia
about: Born in the NE but raised in the South, I made my way out to Portland 10 years ago, and haven't looked back.  I'm inspired by the magnificent landscape out here, and as a trained chef, revel in all the amazing food, wines, craft brews and local spirits available in the greater Portland area.   I have spent a good deal of time traveling both in the U.S. and abroad & always welcome the opportunity to meet people from different places and share good conversation and stories.

name: Saumya
about:
I am a Portland native who discovered my love of travel when I was 20 years old by traveling SE Asia on a shoe string. I have been traveling on and off ever since. For the last 10 years I have been working 3 months a year in Paris where I teach workshops in the Movement and Healing Arts. When I am not working I am tending to this 100+ year old house, hiking in the beautiful nature around Portland, dancing, cooking or playing with friends !

I very much enjoy welcoming fellow travelers to my upstairs apartment. I know what it is like to be in a strange new city and how a friendly and helpful host can make a difference. At the same time I know that we all need our privacy and downtime so I am sensitive to giving people their own space.

I also enjoy using airbnb for my own travel plans. I am heart warmed by the friendly hospitality I have received from my airbnb hosts in Paris. 

Together with airbnb we are making the world a friendlier place and I think that is awesome.

name: Margo
about:
Carpenter, Artist, Traveler, Free Spirit.  From the Boston area.  Currently living in Portland, OR.  I love the Cape so much!

I built this, my dream home, on the last sliver of my grandfathers property.  I grew up going to the cape every summer.  This is truly a magical and peaceful place and I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.

name: Johnathan
about:
When traveling I want to go exploring; whether it is a city, the coast or the mountains, I want to experience the fragrances of the region, the taste of the air, the rhythms of the music and the flavor of the fare. 

When hosting I look to offer a pleasant experience to my guest(s). You will probably find me cooking with my girlfriend, strumming the guitar or practicing yoga. 

I enjoy live music, craft beer, reading, hiking, chess and travel as frequently as possible. If you want to chat about this awesome city or any of my interests, just let me know. Otherwise I will let you explore this great city and discover the hidden gems all on your own.

name: Jessica!
about: I live in Portland, Oregon, work in advertising, love riding my bike, making art and exploring!

name: Sarah
about:
Alex is from Portland, Oregon.  He is a structural integrator and teacher.  Alex enjoys swimming, gardening, kayaking, and spending time at the beach.

Sarah is from Phoenix, Arizona.  She is a case worker.  Sarah enjoys sunshine, reading books, chocolate, and traveling.

Caitlin is in grade school and loves school.  She enjoys ballet, gymnastics, violin and playing with her friends.

name: Brendon
about: Born and raised in Portland, Oregon. I love the outdoors, travel, hiking, camping, fly fishing. I also coach high school baseball in the spring and summer. Love music, and going to live shows.

name: Dana
about: We are a family run vacation rental. Dana is a licensed massage therapist and Eric is a professional actor/writer. Our daughters can often be found chasing dragons in the back yard.

name: Sir Pho
about:
Graduated from The School of The Arts. 
Now living and working in Portland.
Likes: traveling and experiencing new people and cultures. 
Life motto: Never leave an opportunity unturned

name: Laura
about: I love the outdoors and I love city life so I find Portland to be the perfect place to live. I enjoy camping, cooking, hiking, skiing, working out, traveling, watching old movie musicals, listening to music  like Beatles, Harry Connick Jr., Ella Fitzgerald, and Meaghan Trainer. I especially treasure hanging out with friends and family. I'm super active, love people and work in a middle school. :)

name: Elie
about:
I was born with a camera in my hand, and never tired of taking pictures.  After years of travel, I made Portland, Oregon my home in 1994.  Nowadays I can usually be found shooting portraits in my studio and around the Portland metro area.  I have a fascination with old abandoned cars and nearly tumbled barns, and I'm  happiest when my four wheeler is covered in mud. I live my life following a few principles:
* People are amazing
* We learn something new every day
* Tremendous beauty is everywhere
* A man without tea in him is incapable of appreciating beauty
* It's about the journey

name: Lisa
about: My husband and I enjoy the outdoors, gardening, good food, music and our friends and family.  We think our little slice of Portland is very special and want to share it!

name: Jeni
about:
I collect people & experiences - and I love to travel! 

Whether it's sharing a meal, a bottle of wine or stories around a campfire, I love to get to know others and hear about their travels.  I love making people feel at home and included in what is going on. Seeing other people happy brings me joy.

I'm a self-employed costume designer and professional knitter! (seriously). I live on the property with my husband Tim who works in IT, and we have a small dog named Spruce who is amazing. Spruce is super friendly and loves to snuggle. 

I believe the best kind of travel is when you can stay with locals and really get a grasp of how they live. Best travel experiences include: a Myanmar local taking us on a 4 hour trek into the mountains to crash a village wedding; a last minute flight & 1 night stay in Ushuaia to see where my dad commuted to Antarctica a lifetime ago; and having a family open their home, hearts and lives to me in a small town in an amazing country that will remain unnamed. 

Actually it is hard to stop there.  I have been very fortunate to see so much of the world.  I am humbled and honored to have met the people I have met.  I can't wait for my next experience - whether it be host or guest.  Give me my best friend and my dog, a pair of knitting needles and a bit of yarn, a travel pack, some flip flops & a ticket to anywhere.... I'll be the happiest girl in the world.

name: Ron And Misti
about: We are creative professionals who enjoy traveling, eating good food, and sharing experiences with friends and family.  Misti is an Oregon native, and Ron moved to Portland over 15 years ago.  We love our city and we're excited to share it with you!

name: Frances
about: I do PR for restaurants in Portland, Oregon so needless to say one of my favorite parts of traveling to a new city is exploring the local food scene!

name: Scott And Denice
about:
We are both native Oregonians having grown up in 2 different small rural towns in the Willamette valley south of Portland.  My wife, Denice, and I have lived in our current home for 25 years raising our 2 children.  Traveling has been a part of our life for many years.  We both worked in the airline industry and used to travel the world.  Scott worked for over 20 years for a software company and took many international as well as domestic business trips.  Denice has been a massage therapist for more than 30 years and maintains a loyal clientele.  If you would  like a massage while staying with us (women only) please feel free to ask her.  

Food is big with us as well.  We're fortunate to live in a city that has become a foodie center with restaurants that have some of the most creative chefs in the country.  One of our favorite weekend things to do is to head to the Oregon or Washington wine country, find a little place to stay and take in as many wineries and restaurants as possible.

name: Evan
about:
I am an Activist and a Computer Hacker. 
My favorite things are 
-My Kids
-My Sweetheart
-My Community
-Computer
-Coffee

name: Ariel
about:
I'm a mid-level Portlander. For example, I bike commute but don't ride a fixie.

I love, love, love the PNW and have bounced around this little corner most of my life, with a few jaunts to other climes.  I spend my days working at a large institution, managing a very productive department, daydreaming about gardening.  I have taken to gardening at night by headlamp, to fit it all in.  

I'm a voracious reader, or can be when there is time, and tend toward starting crafting projects and abandoning them about 3/4 of the way through.

name: Laura
about:
My husband and I met in Austin, TX where I performed as an aerial dancer and he performed in a rock band and ran a small record label. We moved to Portland six years ago and have two kids ages 5 and 1. After years of travel around the country and globe, we find ourselves happy in Portland, but travel with kids is harder and we miss meeting new people.

My husband loves literature, and our guest room is filled with many of his favorite classic novels. I have a passion for fabric art, and have hand made many of the curtains and pillows in our home, including the guest room.

Our guests are afforded a good deal of privacy. They have their own bathroom, connected to the guest room, that has both a shower and an oversized clawfoot tub.

More than anything, we want our guests to feel comfortable. We love our neighborhood with restaurants, bars, yoga and tons of shopping all within blocks. We're happy to share our favorite spots and stories about the area or leave you to explore on your own.

name: Juli
about: I love where I live, not just Portland but the Richmond Neighborhood and The Northwest. I love that people here know that they are somewhere special. I love sharing this place with my husband and son. I spend my free time gardening my yard and also enjoy being an 18-year participant in Portland's amazing community garden program. I love to cook but I also love kitchen science! Fermenting pickles, brewing kombucha, making jam from my own berries and making decadent caramels are the things I thrive on. I am really enjoying being an Airbnb host and created and built my space just for that!

name: Thalia
about:
My husband Mike and I are homeowners in Portland, Oregon. 

I have traveled extensively worldwide and published a couple of travel books a few years ago. For most of my life I have done political work full-time-- for the past several years I have been working to legalize marriage for same-sex couples in the United States.

Mike works in a school, enjoys motorcycle road trips, and together we have traveled to Spain, Greece, Morocco, Mexico, as well as other places.

name: Keith
about:
I am a scientist and my wife, Erica, is an artist. We live in Portland, Oregon, USA. 

We enjoy exploring both wilderness and cities. We love good music, delicious food and drinks, and meeting new people. We are very respectful travelers and guests. We strongly believe in leaving no trace, whether we are camping in the wilderness or staying in a guest room or house. In general, we are adventurous, fun-loving, and easy going.

name: Chris
about: Urban Zen Master

name: Cami
about:
I love my home and like to share it's charm with others. I am a hospitable hostess and will do my utmost to make your stay enjoyable.

My partner and I have a well-behaved 3.5 month old baby girl. She takes up most of my time. I am managing our spare room through Airbnb so I can work from home and take care of her. By booking our room you are supporting a local family! I'll give you the 411 and leave you to your adventure but still be reachable by phone should you need anything during your stay.

We look forward to sharing our home with you.

name: Kim
about: I own a small salon in Portland and have a daughter going to college in NYC!

name: Rachel
about: I am renting two of my upstairs bedrooms. I live in the SE area of Portland with the MAX on one end of my street and the bus line 20 on the other.  I have plenty of parking. My home is a pet friendly home, pets under 50 lbs please. There is no private entrance.  The bedrooms; however have locks on their doors.  There is a fully stocked kitchen for preparing meals, television in the common area,hot tub in the fenced in back yard, with a doggy door.  I am very laid back, love good conversation around the fire pit and working in my garden. I have a day job, but am looking forward to retiring soon and spend more time doing the hobbies that I love.  The rest will work out as I go along.  My back yard is wonderful to hang out and meet up with nature. Lots of bird and squirrel watching. I love a glass of red wine with friendly conversation. I don't like loud parties with a ton of booze and loud music. Moderation in all things. I love working on my property to make it a more relaxing environment. I think you will have a very relaxing time should you choose to book a room with me and there is convenient transportation at both ends of my street to the downtown area so you can enjoy all that Portland offers. Hope to see you soon!!  Life is what happens while you are making plans.

name: Cassandra
about:
I like to think of myself as friendly, outgoing, adventurous, and warm-hearted. Meeting new people and traveling have been an inspiration for me to become an ever-changing and more welcoming person with every trip. 

It's been so great to live in the Northwest for the past 4 years. I love to run, bike around town, practice yoga, and do just about anything in the sun. Food is also a passion of mine in every sense of the word. Cooking, growing vegetables, tasting beer and wine, you name it :)

name: Carly
about: Foodie, traveler, fun-haver!

name: Kristen
about: My fiance and I are excited to host guests in our home and help them explore the city we love.  I have been a sommelier in town for 10 years and am happy to offer tips for dining as well as Willamette Valley Wine Country.  My fiance is a realtor and a long distance runner who can help you if you are looking to move here or if you would like some running recommendations.  We have a very sweet 9-yr-old Great Dane who is sometimes shy but warms up very quickly.  You must love dogs to stay with us!

name: Emily
about: Eating and exploring is what I'm about.  Achieving true immersion in travel is an opportunity I've long worked for.  Air BnB has made this possible for my boys and myself in a new way.  It brings me great pleasure to extend the same opportunity and share our Compound, and the experience of Portland it allows, to those interested in it's goodness.  I will be away, your local host is a permanent tenant living in a separate area of the house.  They be available by text or phone for immediate inquiries and in person if needed.  I am pleased to prepare things for your stay to the best of my ability and can accommodate in the ways of local wines/wineries, public trans, restaurant & activity recommendations, etc. The house and neighborhood are CHILL, super close-in pocket that's not quite obnoxious yet.  Enjoy yourself.

name: Alicia
about: We are Alicia and Janna, we love our home and we love Portland!  We got married last year and are loving our full life.  Community is important to us, we value all around us.  We are both social workers and committed to social justice issues.  We have a very friendly and loving golden-doodle, he will be happy to meet you!  We look forward to hosting you in our home and sharing this beautiful city with you-

name: Rick
about: Krista and I enjoy exploring the outdoors, traveling, playing tennis, reading, gardening, and spending time with family and friends. I work from home creating educational resources and websites through my company Engaging Press, and recently launched (URL HIDDEN) as a way for the community to share the best of Oregon. Krista is an academic librarian.

name: Jake
about:
Hello!

I live in beautiful Portland, Oregon, where I spend a lot of time enjoying the local breweries and restaurants.  I love to explore the pacific north west and take advantage of everything this region has to offer.

name: Dmitry
about:
Football(Soccer), Travelling, Music
Barcelona, New Orleans

name: Elena
about:
Design studio owner and enjoyer of art, mushroom hunting, building stuff, gluten-free meals, puppies, and middday Americanos. Oregon native in love with her home state. Decidedly queer. Lucky to call Portland home even after living in many lovely places such as Australia, Papua New Guinea, Montana, and Washington. 

I intentionally seek the company of people who are very similar to and utterly different from me. I believe in interdependence as a counterpoint to America's mythology of rugged individualism. I think travel is one way to create that interdependence. Here's to building community, sharing (wealth, talent, skills stories), breaking down walls, respecting nature, having meaningful dialog, listening, taking care of our elders, talking to strangers, and creating together.

name: Tamara
about:
I am an artsy gal living in awesome Portland, OR, where I own a small boutique/gallery called REDUX. The shop specializes in jewelry and gifts made from recycled materials, and features over 300 local artisans in the shop along with my own work.  I like to cook, bike to work, peruse vintage stores, see live music and check out art galleries. We have about 2-months of summer in the NW, so I know how to savor every minute of our fleeting sunshine.
I'm originally from SLC, Utah, but have lived in the NW now for over 20 years so this is where I call home. I now live in a duplex I recently renovated from an old Baptist church, and am looking to rent the apartment in the back to travelers. I am looking forward to more travel and to utilizing this site more!

A note about hosting in my home: 
AirBNB is based on trust and for it to work at its best, communication is paramount. I have acceptance requirements before I allow travelers to stay in my home.
 I require either a personal reference or a rental reference and a fully filled out profile. 
Here is a link to some tips and reasonings behind filling out your profile: 
https://www.airbnb.com/support/article/67
If you do not yet have any travel reviews or experience using airBNB, that's ok! Here's a tutorial on how to get a personal reference to add to your profile in lieu of travel reviews: https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/173/how-do-references-work
A little communication & reassurance goes a long way! Please make sure you have satisfied these requirements first before submitting an inquiry.
Cheers
Tamara

name: Cynthia
about: I cannot live without: bubbly, bubble baths, books, and my baby

name: Paola
about:
I've lived in Portland for over 20 years but originally come from Canada where my family still lives.  

I absolutely love the outdoors, I'm passionate about healthy living, and Portland is a great city for both. 

My favorite travel destination is Peru, where I spent 2 month earlier in 2015, and stayed with many excellent airbnb hosts. 

I really love hosting and one of my goals is to help my guests start there day off with an uber-healthy breakfast so that they have clean energy to explore our fabulous city. Everything I serve is organic which is important to me and the way I personally live my life.

name: Dan
about: I'm originally from Chicago and have lived in Portland for about eight years. I've always had a passion for travel and have been lucky enough to visit about 40 countries, most recently Vietnam, Cambodia and Taiwan. Closer to home, funky, big city neighborhoods are my favorite places to explore. The natural beauty and mild climate are what drew me to the Pacific NW, but I return often to Chicago where I maintain business interests.

name: Fran & Seth
about:
Hello! We are Fran and Seth, proud owners of Venture Inn PDX, a one-bedroom basement apartment that could be your next home away from home. 

Traveling has taught us how important curiosity, positivity and patience are to personal growth. It has brought us to some of the most amazing places on this earth and introduced us to unforgettable friends in the process.

As an Airbnb host, our goal is to make all guests feel as though they are staying among friends. As a fellow traveler, we understand how precious the time you spend in a new place is and want to ensure that you enjoy it to the fullest. We would love to share a meal while you are here, but are equally happy to give you privacy to soak in the experience on your own terms.

Venture Inn, so you can venture out!

name: Jodi
about: I am a Northwest native and in Portland since 2005. I am frequently outdoors hiking and skiing.  I love living in Portland!  It's easy to get around by bike, bus and MAX to all the great parks, restaurants and diverse neighborhoods.  Lucky for me, my family lives nearby so I get to see them frequently.  I work full time as a legal assistant at a local government where I get to work on projects near and dear to my heart.

name: Steven Susan
about: Our 1904 home is located close to the city in southeast Portland.  Giant Sequoias tower over us making our home a true tree house.  We love to introduce our city to guests.  Relaxing at home includes cooking, gardening, movies, music and strolling in the neighborhood.  It's a good life!

name: Derek
about: Norway, Spain, Mexico, Czech Republic, China, Viet Nam, Australia, Canada, U.K., (URL HIDDEN) particular order.  Portlander since 2000.  Still on the move...always curious. Reader and bike rider.

name: Natasha
about: I moved to Portland from New York state after college and love it here, especially in North Portland, where I've lived for nine of my ten years in town. I am an editor, singer/songwriter and yoga instructor with passions for personal creative practices, cultivating loving presence with my community, eating like an organic queen and connecting with people. I'm a pretty quiet and gentle soul and I give my guests as much space as they like. I'm well versed in local bike routes, bike shops, yoga studios, cafes and restaurants and I'm happy to share my local knowledge.

name: Olivia
about:
Outgoing and friendly - I thrive around people! Perhaps one of the reasons I love hosting travelers. I've lived in Portland for 5 years and love this beautiful city. Trained in economics but left the industry to work in a more creative field - I now work for a local furniture design company. 

Food and coffee are some of the more important things in my life. I'm a little obsessed with coffee... My boyfriend, Seneca, and I love to explore new eats/bars, cook all the time and love sharing our favorite places. We're usually cooking or baking something everyday! We eat pretty seasonal so we go crazy when Spring/Summer come around - Hood Strawberries anyone??

name: Lara
about: I'm a woman with a lot of mundo. My greatest passions are music, traveling and helping others. You can find me at a concert, volunteering or at the airport heading to my next desired destination!

name: Liz+Nick
about: We are a married couple living in NE Portland with our kids and two dogs. We have lived in Portland for over 9 years and both work in the health field. Travel, camping and eating are what you will find us doing when not working :). We are happy to share our home, neighborhood and city with visitors, family and friends. We look forward to your visit with us!

name: Andrea
about:
Originally from New Hampshire, I moved to Portland, OR with my now husband after he quit his job in Colorado and moved to Ecuador to be with me as I finished my Peace Corps service. We started calling Portland home in 2010 and absolutely love it!

We are both avid travelers and love sharing our city with others. We have used Air BnB to stay all over the country (mostly for friends' weddings) and recently remodeled our basement to a full apartment so that we can host family, friends and travelers.

name: Nick
about:
I enjoy traveling and getting to know other places, cultures, and people.  My hobbies include snowboarding, hiking/camping, gardening and bicycling.

I am an architect for work and co-own the firm Propel Studio Architecture here in Portland.

name: Shea
about: My husband and I love to travel, meet new people, and explore new places.  We have been to over 30 countries together, and hope to continue traveling in the future.  We have a young daughter (and another kiddo due April 2017!) and forward to showing her (them) the world as well! We enjoy vegan food (I am a vegan recipe creator and blogger), spending time outside, and a good craft beer.

name: Nathan
about: Be human first.

name: Erin
about: I used to travel extensively, and now am happy to travel vicariously by talking to guests about their experiences, or leave them in peace as they wish. I've worked as a flight attendant and in special education. I'm now a mid-life student hoping to enter the nursing field. J'ai passé deux ans en France and would love to brush up my French with Francophones. My Spanish is pretty rusty, but I love speaking and listening to other languages. I leave often for days at a time, so why not share my condo and help with my tuition while giving you an affordable and comfortable space that you sometimes will have all to yourself for the price of a room? I'm fairly busy with school and work, but if I'm not home and you have questions, I'm a phone call or text away.

name: Ben
about:
Born & raised in Portland, OR, I was in the Peace Corps (Honduras, '02 - '04) and met my wife there. We have two beautiful sons - one born in 2007 and the other in 2011. We'd love to play host some day, but until then we're pretty tight on space - we only rent when we're out of town.
We love taking road trips - we drove to Michigan and back a few years ago and plan to hit the southwest in a loop this summer (2015). 
We're big music fans - all genres.

name: David
about:
Mid-30's working professional.
Lived in the city since 2000.
Love living, working and playing in Portland

name: Jameson
about: I am a North Portland Realtor.  My wife and I are active participants in the North Portland community.  We have lived in/near Portland our entire lives and love everything the Northwest has to offer.  We love remodeling our little house and meeting new people.  Please come and visit our home and have an awesome stay in Portland!

name: Kyle
about:
Hey everyone! I'm Kyle and the beautiful woman next to me in my picture is my girlfriend Aimee-Jane. We are both college aged and in tune with the go-to spots in Portland. We are both life-long Oregonians, as I grew up just over the west hills in Portland and her in the heart of South Salem. We are very adventurous and know some of the best spots to enjoy the beauty this area has to offer. Our pup Louis is a year and half and a big lover (don't be afraid to push his off haha). In our little free time we love heading the couple block to Alberta park and enjoying the scenery as well as people watching. 

We are new to Airbnb hosting but nowhere near new to traveling. I have played baseball competitively my entire life, the game has taken me to 28 states so I have lot of experience in what to do to make a stay comfortable for you. A.J. has experience traveling as well as she is even applying for flight attendant training. We are very respectful hosts, please feel free to treat this home as your own home (in a respectful way). Anything and everything we can do to make this trip perfect is what we are here for! Hope to see you soon :)

name: Allen
about: My wife and I love traveling and meeting people.  We have a passion for pets and have a rescue dog and cat. I’m a career artist, creating in photography and video; you can check out my (EMAIL HIDDEN)  My wife is a writer. We look forward to sharing what we love about Portland and why we moved to the Pacific Northwest from NYC. Hint - my show at Blue Sky Gallery ((URL HIDDEN)  had something to do with it.  There is so much to explore in the Portland area. When we are not out in our VW camper van, we grow our own food, play guitar and actively pursue a healthy lifestyle.

name: Arika
about:
After living abroad in England for over a decade, I have come to settle for the last several years in Portland, and most recently, in this lovely house where I live with my housemate Andréa, and my sweet dog Mollie. 
My housemate and I are both kind and considerate people who welcome all sorts of different kinds of people. We are queer friendly and  we aim to create a space where people feel comfortable.

name: Eugene
about: I strongly believe in customer service, and am willing to go the extra step in ensuring that my guests are having a wonderful tim

name: Rob
about:
My mom thinks I'm pretty awesome. I'd have to agree.

I'm 31 and currently live in Dublin, Ireland.  I am obsessed with travel and living abroad.  I've almost hit every continent (damn you Antarctica!) and plan to see more of the world at every chance I get.

I used to live in SEA (Thailand, Indonesia and Malaysia) teaching English and working in a Dive Shop as a DIve Master.

I spent a couple years back in the USA to see the family, enjoy life stateside and plan my next adventure out into the world.  That took me to Dublin, Ireland for a year before coming back to Portland to set up shop and fall in love with the city all over again. Where's next? Believe me, my mother would like to know!

name: Jake
about: A native Oregonian who has been all over the world and couldn't be happier to live here.  I work in real estate and when I have the time I am either hanging out with my young daughter, surfing, skating, or snowboarding.  I would be a pretty hands off host, but happy to share info about the city and state, or even hang out a little if its organic...

name: Heather
about: I live in Portland, Oregon in the Pacific northwest of the USA. It's a foodie, counter-culture, leftist, environmental and bike capital, and just an incredibly vibrant great small city. I enjoy the amenities of my local neighborhood: it's super walkable; there is yoga and meditation; there are many bike groups and group rides leaving from this area; local libraries and book stores are within a mile or so; a 30-acre park just six blocks away; and many cafes, galleries and hang-outs. I work in public health and transportation policy and am busy now so just taking short holidays when I can, as opposed to the longer explorations of earlier days (sad). I used to live in India and led India and Nepal trips for Intrepid, and love the fact that Airbnb exposes me to people from all over the world.

name: Adam
about: I am an artist, musician, and bird biologist living a happy life here in Portland. My girlfriend, dog and I would love to share our carefully crafted home with you.

name: Kristi
about: I have had such a great time being an AirBnb host.  It's like opening my home to family or old friends.  I have met such great people from all over the globe.  One overnight guest from Germany ended up staying 4 months and is now an 'adopted little brother'.  I love living in the northwest.  Portland is such a fun, eclectic (URL HIDDEN) much to do!  I love to play outdoors whether it be hiking, biking, rafting, gardening, or exploring the different neighborhoods on foot with my Labrador or a friend.  Listening to live music is a favorite pastime whether it be at a small venue like Mississippi Studios or getting sun baked at the Waterfront Blues Festival with thousands of others.  And food!!!  So many great restaurants to choose from!

name: Kathleen
about:
Hey there Travelers!
I'm fun-loving, very social and love meeting new people.  I embrace diversity and value people's differences as much as I enjoy sharing common interests with them.  
I am fascinated with other cultures and traditions and always seek ways to broaden my world. I figured opening my home to travelers would be a fine way to nurture that goal.

I love to garden, cook, read and I am an aspiring writer.  I love art in every form.  My music interests include almost every genre. Speaking of art, I'm something of an artist at putting my feet up in my garden with a glass of wine at the end of a hard day's work and you are welcome to join when you're here!

I wish I could travel more, but lead a very busy life helping manage a local restaurant. A busy fine dining/ live music venue featuring fantastic local musicians. 
Being in the restaurant/bar industry allows me to appreciate people from all walks of life.  Everyone has a story.  I look forward to hearing yours if you're in a sharing mood.
No pressure!  :)

I love animals as much as I love people.  My beloved Boxer, Mugsy died at the ripe old age of ten.  He went deaf in his last years, but since I have a background in special education, working with deaf and hard of hearing children, I had the foresight to teach  him sign language as a puppy, so we didn't have any trouble communicating in his last years!  It took me a long time to grieve for him.  My latest Boxer is Watson. He is a handsome, playful, very joyful companion and is also learning to understand sign language. Come meet Watson!

Being a Boxer owner might tell you a little about me.  Boxers are smart, loyal, full of energy, fun loving, and maintain their playful  "puppy-like" attitude their whole life!  They can also be rather stubborn and determined at times!   People who choose the breed appreciate those qualities, most likely because they themselves exhibit the same traits!   :) 
I'm humbled when friends have described me with these traits and surely aspire to live my life as large and loving as a boxer!  

I look forward to hosting you during your stay here in beautiful, Portland, Oregon!  Welcome!

name: Rob
about:
Hi, 

I have lived and worked in Northwest Portland or the past 25 years. I have raised my family here along with having a retail business on NW 23rd Ave.for 20 years. 
Now I travel to Bali and Italy often where I have property.

I hope you enjoy my home!

(URL HIDDEN)

Rob

name: Sarah
about: Cycling, family, spoken word, vegan treats.  these are a few of my favorite things.

name: Melissa
about: Melissa & Bill are native Oregonians who love Portland. They live with their brilliant teenage son, William, and their entertaining cats, Kenny & Halēe.

name: Christopher
about: Living in Portland OR, while working in the restaurant industry. I enjoy designing, biking, and traveling.

name: Emiliano
about: Boom!

name: Jessica
about: Chicago native meets Peruvian Portlander and 7 years later we have a sweet space we are so happy to call home.  Jessica teaches yoga as her profession at a local community yoga center and Jackomo is a specialist in all things Mac.  With the addition of Luna, our family is full of life and we look forward to sharing our garden surplus with our guests.

name: Ashley
about:
I love living in Portland. I feel so fortunate to be part of a vibrant community. I'm currently working on a political campaign focused on securing more funding for affordable housing.

I'm so fortunate to live in a really fun neighborhood -- Clinton/Division (also called Richmond) -- the home of some of Portland's greatest restaurants including Nuestra Cocina, Pok Pok, Whiskey Soda Lounge and more!  Do not miss the SE Wine Collective on SE 35th/Division! 

As a single woman living with a dog and cat, I tend to spend a lot of evenings out on the town with friends or hosting friends on my back patio.  I'm a very warm and kind person and love sharing information about my city (as well as nearby hiking trails) with folks who are new to town.  If you're looking to move to Portland, I have a great network of folks you can meet either for job hunting or real estate options.

name: Sacha
about:
I live in the heart of Portland. I run, surf and play soccer. I love good food and love cooking it, though I rarely, if ever use a recipe. I rarely drink, I don't smoke and I try to lay off of the sugar, but I do have a sweet tooth. Being considerate (considering how my actions effect others) is important to me. I read books and play music. I have a big beautiful shaggy Standard Poodle named Charlie.

As a guest, I leave things as I found them and I'm respectful of the hard work that people have put into their home and thusly treat it well. 

As a host, I want for guests to enjoy themselves and have what they need to be comfortable eg: clean towels set aside, current local newspapers, chocolate; the essentials. It's also my goal to be very clear about how things work in the house, while not overwhelming a guest with information.

name: Tara And Laurel
about: We are Bay Area transplants to Portland (yes, we're those people) who love nothing more than to be in the middle of it all AND have access to private, homey space. Our favorite ways to spend our time include sampling new (and re-visiting our favorite) restaurants, taking short drives to beautiful places, and spoiling our sweet dog.

name: Emily & Noah
about: We are a young couple- still newly-weds with 2 dogs and a few fishes!  We will be renting out home while we are away for both business and pleasure but we think the fish will be great hosts in our stead. We both work in the neighborhood and love our community!

name: Alexander
about: get busy living or get busy dying

name: Daniel
about: Hi, I'm Daniel.  I love to travel, and explore new countries and cultures.   Overseas adventures, photography, and gardening are some of my hobbies.  I lived in Spain for a few years and speak Spanish.  I've lived in Portland since 2007 and for work I help people buy and sell residential real estate specializing in relocation and older vintage homes.

name: Enrique
about: I am the Tuvan throat singer/ performance ritual artist known as Soriah. I travel the globe extensively in the Summer months. I'm very dedicated to my craft, so I regularly travel to the Central Asian Republic of Tuva which is literally "outer Mongolia" to study, perform and compete. When I'm in town, I'm a performer, Radio Cab driver and local scenester. I love breaking new ground, I love exploring new cuisine, which makes me a true Portlander. I take the simple pleasures in life and make them offerings to the sacred. I'm no stranger to hosting friends and friends of friends. I have an AMAZING place and my way of expressing gratitude for the many people who have hosted me on my wanderings in the past is to do the same for others. You're more than welcome!

name: Darren& Eugene
about:
To Dear Travelers,
we are warm and easy-going couple living in SE Portland.
we are kinda young and new to airbnb. launched at june 2016.
right now we have accepted a lot of travelers from all around the world in the house so far. 95% of them are wonderful experience. 
we like to keep my home a peaceful but fun place to live in. 
we are willing to take good care of my guest. so if you need help, i will do what i can to help you. so please ask!
i will try my best to provide you 5 star experience during your stay.

however, i do need to say something upfront!
this is not a 150 dollar per night hotel room! what you see on the pictures is what you will have. if you need anything, you are welcomed to ask. if you are uncomfortable caused by something in the house, you are more than welcome to let us know and fix it right away for you.  we will try our best to make your experience better. 
sometimes, the guest did not say anything, and give us bad review which is not fair because :
1. we are not mind-reader! if you do not speak, no one will know!
2. this is a shared environment. it is not a 100% private 150 bucks hotel room. you only paid less than 1/3 of market price per night . so you can't expect everything here are perfect for you!
but we will listen!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and try our best to make you feel right and comfortable!

and please help us by talking to us and making suggestion!
thank you very very much!

name: Brendan
about:
Textile artist: I love designing fabrics, especially using my drawings for screen printing and in my spare time I am an avid knitter.  My artist statement is that I like to make useful things beautiful!

Fairly fluent in German, need to brush up on my French and have Arabic on my list.

Autumn is consumed with football.

I have lived in Ireland, England, Germany and Canada, and both the East and West Coasts of the U.S.

When I travel I love to establish a base "home" from which I can adventure out, usually to art galleries, museums and restaurants!

Although I frequently go to the movies, I usually don't do that on vacation.

I have three adult children with whom I have  a close relationship and, happily, they all live in Oregon, my home state. Oregon is a beautiful state to visit and, while I love to travel, I am always happy to return home to Oregon.

name: Kate
about: My husband and I have lived in North Portland for 30 plus years. We have two beautiful children Sophia, and Riker. As a family we love to spend time in the outdoors, camping, hiking and boating.

name: Peter
about: I'm a designer from Hanover, New Hampshire, originally. I moved to Portland in 2006 and spend most of my time either cooking or adventuring outside year round in this wonderful city of ours! I love working on creative construction projects, and preparing my guest house out back of my regular house for AirBNB'ing was a fun way to get my creative juices flowing and I look forward to meeting and hosting AirBNB'ers from all over :)

name: Jade
about:
Thank you for your interest in my upstairs suite (the Gilded Lily). It is a lovely, inviting space with its own entrance to offer you all of the privacy you desire in your personal oasis.

I love hosting with airbnb and use this platform myself when traveling! It is such a joy to meet the wonderful people who stay in the Gilded Lily... Thank you for considering making the Gilded Lily your home away from home during your visit to Portland... I look forward to meeting you!
