I moved to Portland in June and love it here! I spent much of my life in Southern California (13 years in San Diego) but have always wanted to live in the Pacific Northwest, so I am thrilled to be here! :)

My professional background is in Animal welfare. I have been the Executive Director of several animal non-profits in Southern California. I was the Director of Development of an animal shelter during our time in Northern California. I have a passion for helping make the World a better place for people and animals alike, which is probably why I've been so involved in non-profit management most of my life. I am currently focused on growing an online business.

Personally, I enjoy living a happy, centered, peaceful life. I approach every new situation with enthusiasm and a positive outlook, no matter what appears to being going on. I thoroughly enjoy meeting new people and always strive to make every encounter rewarding for everyone involved. I love practicing yoga, experiencing the serenity of nature (which is easy to do here surrounded by the forest with miles of hiking trails running through the trees, just a block from my home), playing with my two small dogs (Sophie and Finley), cat (Lily)... and of course enjoying quality time with my fiance, Ben.

I look forward to hosting you! I really believe that the "Gilded Lily" Suite will be a welcomed gift for individuals and couples visiting Portland; especially those people who will be going to OHSU (walking distance) or exploring downtown (short bus ride). The forest trails that are woven throughout the neighborhood are breathtaking and a great way to start or wind down your day.

Warmest Regards,

Jade

name: Leigh
about:
I am a single woman, who teaches piano for a living. I also drive for Uberr and Lyft so I'm rarely at home in the early mornings. I am fun loving, easy going and open minded.  I love interacting with my guests and helping them when they want it. However, I will not intrude.  When not teaching piano, I drive and do gardening and explore Portland. There are many neat neighborhoods and places to eat and drink here. 
Occasionally I travel to visit family in Illinois, California and England.
If you come and stay here, I will be able to point you in the right direction of many different places to have fun in Portland.  I have lived here for over 8 years and continue to find it fascinating.  Before living here I lived in southern California for 13 years and before that in Wisconsin for 15 years. I am one of six kids and have 2 grown children of my own and 2 young granddaughters who are one of the lights of my life.  I was born and raised in Evanston, IL and am a Midwesterner at heart.

name: Jason
about:
Laid back, out going, energetic guy from Hawaii.  My feet are usually in Hawaii, Portland, and New York throughout the year.  

5 Things I can't live without:  Exercise, coffee, family, friends and hope.  

My motto:  "Go For Broke!"  442nd Battalion made up of Japanese American young men who served during WWII

name: Bill
about: I am a journalist and have traveled the world for work. I'm also an avid cyclist and cross-country skier.

name: Hilary
about:
I'm a traveler at heart. Therefore, I strive to provide for my guests the comfortable, secure, well-situated space that I appreciate when I'm on the road. When staying with me you'll have a private room, a cozy and comfortable bed, good pillows, reading lamps, a place to hang your clothes, a lock on your door, and wifi. 

An Eastcoaster both by birth and inclination, I love to entertain, converse, and keep everything neat and tidy (which, let me tell you, is not easy!). I strive always to optimize your experience in my home. Need a fluffier pillow or a shoulder to cry on? I'm your go-to-girl. Want to sit down with a pleasant conversationalist over a cup of coffee or a glass of wine? That's my favorite activity! Want to be left to your own devices while you're staying with me? I've got your back. 

Believe it or not, The household's fairly quiet except, sometimes, between the hours of 4pm and 11pm. I love sleep and prioritize yours as well. As for privacy, the door to your room has a key lock.

name: Tim & Sarah
about: We have lived in this neighborhood for nearly 20 years and we love it! Tim is a musician, who works in construction. Sarah owns a children's boutique, Black Wagon, on Mississippi Ave. We have 2 awesome kids. We love to share our favorite restaurants and places to go in Portland. We do like to give our guests space, so please let us know if you would like recommendations!

name: Tijana
about: We are avid travelers ourselves. We love staying in this type of accommodation and are excited to host others.

name: David
about: Photographer/Filmmaker/Outdoors Enthusiast. Seven-year military veteran. Lover of art, food, music, people and travel.

name: Alexandra
about:
We live in Portland since 1986. Me and my husband enjoy reading, exercising, traveling.
We both work. But we also enjoy to meet new people.

name: Adam
about:
Adam Roper. 32. From Denver, Colorado.  Has lived in NYC since 2001.  Has a BFA in theatre, owns a Bikram Yoga studio in upper Manhattan and volunteers for the Trevor Project.

Adam now lives in Portland, Oregon.

name: Mary
about: Hi, I recently moved back to Portland a few months ago, been gone 25 years. So much has changed, Portland has grown up :)  I have been in real estate and property mgt many years, Semi retired now, but still go back  to Orange county CA. for business and fun. I have family/friends in Portland also. I try to enjoy myself where ever I go!! Love to travel--Europe again next year. I have no pets now, allergic to cats, so please don't bring any :)

name: Lisa
about:
I am a retired clinical social worker ~ I worked for 20 years in local hospitals and live with my husband Tom (who is a soon to be retired RN).   We also have a "Schnodle" rescue doggie Davy-Jones, who monitors the neighborhood from his perch a top the couch.  Our two young adult sons (Zane & Max) live at home too, and are busy attending college, and doing all the stuff youthful persons do ~lol! And we also took in a charming young man who is seeking asylum in this country, one of thousands of kids who fled the violence in Central America- seeking asylum here.  We've lived two decades here in the South Tabor neighborhood of Portland.   Tom and I met twenty some ago while attending the University of Puerto Rico, and we love traveling, as well as opening up our backyard cottage & meeting new people!  There are some great walking trails - a couple of my favorites are walking on nearby Mt. Tabor park with views of the whole city.  I also enjoy the trail next to the Columbia River.  There are also plenty of fantastic places to eat in Portland including my own home cooked meals (breakfast is included in your stay) but I also offer home cooked meals to the public:  (URL HIDDEN)  I have coupons in the cottage for a free dinner or brunch for you to surprise your Portland friends with as an unexpected freebie!!! Fun & yummy!

My hero is Eleanor Roosevelt, I can't seem to get enough of the color RED.  In everything.  I live for my art journaling group: aka:  a bunch of sassy women who meet once a week to do fabulous art & then go out to happy hour afterwards~lol!  
My husband is my best friend on earth, followed closely by my dad & fabulously unique sister who (unlike me) mows her lawn in high heels and mini skirts!  My folks and siblings all live close by, many generations Oregonians are we all & are happy to welcome you to this great state!!!
Years ago my parents used to own a popular local restaurant with lunch and dinner lines going out the door.  I suppose it's how I'm hardwired.... Some people do yoga to relax, I cook write & paint to relax, LOVE it!!!  I'm excited to welcome you to South Tabor Cottage as part of your awesome adventures in traveling!!!

name: Cole & Zara
about:
Join us and Olive (the wire haired pointer) in our home in Portland. We love a good cup of coffee, being outdoors (skiing, running, biking, gardening, and hiking), a tasty Pacific Northwest microbrew, DIY home remodeling projects, and traveling.  We enjoy opening up our home to those in town for a conference, passing through on their way to another Oregon locale, or individuals looking to get to know Portland more.  

As longtime residents and lovers of the Pacific Northwest, we hope to offer a relaxing and convenient stay and can point out some of the great things that the Portland area has to offer.

name: Gabriella
about:
:-D.

My days are quite full so every minute counts... 

You'll find me to be organized, outspoken, energetic, healthy and passionate about most of the things I enjoy which include, my home, my family,  the outdoors, garden, entertaining, fitness, healthy eating, and animals including my dogs, Beau and Izzy and Lyla.  My home truly is my castle :-)).

I consider my Airbnb a professional establishment, I enjoy entertaining and spending time, laughing and sharing ideas and worldviews with mature guests of all backgrounds, ages, and cultures .  

I was born and raised in Portland so I am very familiar with city and a good resource.  Happy Hour, Coffee houses and locally owned business are places I frequent so please don't hesitate to ask for my input or opinion of where to go for great eats of all origins, coffee and artisan drinks.  There are always venues for music close by as well.  Just ask....

I'm an early riser, up at 5:30/6 and out to walk with my dogs.  I try to hike, bike and kayak weekly in the summer months, being outdoors is what I currently live for.  Winter is weekday trips up to Mt Hood skiing, with weekends on my snowshoes.  You're welcome to join me, just ask ahead of time what I've got on my calendar for the days you're here.....

name: Katie
about: Born and raised in Portland, Oregon, I am an avid traveler and adventure seeker!  I have been to over 15 countries in Asia, North American and Europe.  I am very excited to use Airbnb for my accommodations and look forward to meeting new people.

name: Michael + Carmen
about:
We're a young couple that's excited to extend a piece of our home to travelers and adventurers kind enough to visit our beloved hometown of Portland, Oregon. We love a good meal, an ambitious cocktail, and time spent with friends. 

As your hosts, we're fairly hands off in hopes of providing a relaxing space for you. However, we happily provide plenty of recommendations for food, nightlife, and activities. We're also very reachable in case of an emergency. 

This AirBNB is in our basement, so we appreciate your consideration and ask you to limit noise after dark.

name: Alissa
about:
We're a busy young family, working and traveling full-time, and spending time together running, biking, skiing or any other outdoor activity when time permits. We also have an affinity for wine and the art of creating and understanding the complexity of such an amazing product.

We hope to share some of what we love so much about Portland with all of our guests.

name: Omid
about: portland Oregon

name: Jeff
about: I am a self-employed technical writer living in Portland, Oregon, USA. I have degrees in architecture and environmental planning, play fingerstyle acoustic guitar, and am an avid Lindy-hopper. In college, I spent a school year in Copenhagen, and traveled extensively during that year--France, Germany, Holland, Norway, Finland, and Russia. I didn't travel overseas again until 2013 when I gave myself a trip to Italy and Barcelona for my 60th birthday.

name: Clarissa
about:
I am an active upbeat person who has lived in Portland for 18 years.  Whenever I travel, some of the best times I have had, is when I can stay with the locals.  It's always relaxed and informative and i come away with a flavor for the place much richer than had I been a hovering tourist.   So I a happy to share my home and neighborhood, as well as my love for Portland with travelers. 

I love my home and am always working to make it more comfortable and beautiful .  I am a reader, a lover of music (so much good music here in PDX) , and an active outdoors person (hiking and biking).  I am a cook and  healthy eater, so having a good kitchen is important to me, as is trying many of the great restaurants we have here.  From March to October our garden is a bounty of fresh organic vegetables and fruit. 
 For work , I am a self employed acupuncturist and own a clinic in northwest Portland. 
My dog Louie,(6)  and cat, Shadow Mae(19) both love people and will do their best to show you a comfortable stay as well.

name: Robin
about: I am originally a Kentucky girl, drawn to the wild green forests and creative energy of the pacific northwest, and now happily settled in Portland with my family.  I am the mama of three beautiful and creative children, ages 11, 9, and 6, with whom I spend my time exploring, playing, and constantly learning.  I love hostessing, singing and dancing, connecting with and being of service to people, and playing with my kids and husband, who tours the country with his band The Motet.

name: Jonathan
about: I enjoy travel, cooking and friends!

name: Ben
about:
Accountant, world traveler, socialite. 

I recently took a year long sabbatical before setting back down in my hometown of Portland, Oregon. One of my favorite joys about traveling was meeting other interesting people from around the world, and that is also one of the joys about hosting an airbnb. 

Countries visited: Canada (cerca (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN), and 2014), Italy (2003), Mexico (2005), China (2007/8), Hong Kong (2008), Japan (2009, 2010), Vietnam (2009), Philippines (2009), Poland (2011), Israel (2011), India (2012), Sri Lanka (2012), Thailand (2012), England (2013), Spain (2013), Morocco (2013), Turkey (2013), Singapore (2014),  Malaysia (2014), Cambodia (2014), Laos (2014), Peru (2014), Bolivia (2014), Ecuador (2014), Colombia (2014). 

States visited: Washington, Oregon, California, Nevada, Idaho, Montana, Utah, Texas, Arizona, Oklahoma, Ohio, Illinois, New York, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Maine, Rhode Island, New Jersey, Maryland, DC, Florida, Hawaii.

name: Misha + Cade
about:
We enjoy hosting and sharing our love of Portland, where we have lived together for 12+ years. Misha spent her childhood in New Orleans and has lived in the Pacific Northwest since her teens, while Cade is an Oregon Native, born and raised.

My eRated username is mishaashton

name: Donna & Philip
about: We are a writer/stylist/photographer/filmmakers, working for interior design magazines,  and co-owners of the recently launched Film Fest Finder. Having stayed in hotels around the world for travel and business, we want our airbnb to be a place of beauty, restfulness,and  serenity. It features a beautiful garden, a great bed and brand-new walk-in shower bathroom, fans, heater, 120 volt outlet for charging car.

name: Susan
about:
We are Sheryl and Susan and we have lived in the heart of Portland for over 12 years now; we have two kids in local schools here and a daughter and her family in Hawaii.  We are the typical family with work, school, activities, and we do what we can to spend time with family across the US.

We wanted to convert this garage apartment into a place where we could host families and friends as well as create opportunities for others to experience our vibrant neighborhood up close and personal. 

We love to travel and spend time exploring and hope this awesome apartment can be an opportunity for you to do the same.

name: Jamie
about:
Husband, Father, Homeowner, Portland Timbers fan.

I am a CPA who does not get to travel as much as I would like anymore.  So I am hoping to travel vicariously through you!  In the past, Libby and I have traveled all across the US, as well as many destinations abroad - including Thailand, Ecuador, Spain, Greece, Morocco, Panama and more.  We welcome you to come enjoy the comforts of our apartment, and look forward to sharing with you all that Portland has to offer.  In general, once you are set up, we will default to staying out of your hair.  However, we are open to being as involved as you like in your stay while you are here - from offering restaurant and activity suggestions, to helping you navigate the city's public transit system, to swapping travel stories.

Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Danielle
about: I have lived in Portland, OR for 18 years now and love it's charm and quirks. My house is full of small stories and visual treats and is a comfortable retreat for me. I am a traveler and a curious spirit. I always look forward to experiencing new places, cultures and traditions. The people i have met along the way have allowed me to grow and learn and giggle too.

name: Carl
about: My wife Karen and I have a son, Dillon (3.5 y/o) and daughter, Kaelin(1 y/o).  I work in consulting and Karen works as a counselor.  We have lived in Portland for 9 years.  We love to hike, wine taste and enjoy the beauty Portland has to offer!

name: Dana
about: Dana is a Portland, Oregon native & has climbed to the summit of mountains in the Cascade Range including Mt. Hood, Mt. Adams and Mt Saint Helens.  She spends time with friends and family exploring the wonderland of the Pacific Northwest through hiking and some bicycling and enjoys time spent within Portland parks and wildlife areas.  Dana also loves the city lights and has made a hobby of viewing Industrial Art throughout beautiful Portland.

name: Shanna
about: Queer, musician, traveling, writing, drums, feminism, gardening, soccer

name: Phong And Krista
about: We are a family born and raised in the Portland Metro area. I have a beautiful wife Krista, our 2 year old Jett, and our senior canine, Kila.

name: Fiona
about:
I was born in Guyana and have  traveled to 22 countries. 
Speak French and German pretty fluently. 
Love to meet international people and all types of personalities. 
Hope you enjoy Portland - truly the greatest city on earth!  But shh it's a secret that you are in on!

name: Ivy
about:
I moved to Portland nearly 3 years ago with my husband and son. My kiddo is now 4 years old, and I currently work as an English and writing tutor in the Portland area. In addition to being a mom, a tutor, and an Airbnb host, I am also developing my own tutoring startup business that will serve students and families in the Portland area.

I am originally from Rupert, Idaho, and I've lived all over the Northwest, including Seattle, Eugene, and Moscow, ID. When I'm not busy chasing my kiddo around, I enjoy practicing yoga, fixing up my house, patronizing local restaurants/bars, and working on my many DIY projects!

I have always had this dream of owning my own bed and breakfast or running my own inn. I am a fantastic cook who enjoys entertaining, so hosting guests comes very natural to me. I love making cozy spaces to chill out in, and I enjoy having company in my house! Becoming a host on Airbnb has been an excellent opportunity for me to live part of my dream.

I joined AirBnb in December 2015, and I've been hosting guests ever since.

name: Shane
about:
Hello, I'm Shane! Sharing my home, the Villa is a great passion of mine! Marching on City Hall in support of Airbnb was a great experience that I'm proud to be a part of. Having hosted over 500 guests, I am very pleased to be part of the process of transforming Portland's sharing economy! Shared experiences, shared recourses, shared lives!

I'm an outgoing health & fitness enthusiast! I own 503-MASSAGE as an LMT and I'm also a CPT Certified Personal Trainer, 'changing people lives one rep at a time!' Graduating from PSU with a minor in Dance, and I've been dancing ever since!

I'm well travelled and respectful all the many different & amazing cultures. I am very appreciative of the hospitality received from people I've met all over the world! This year I hope to explore my 6th continent!

With so much travel experience, it's only natural to offer other travelers a safe and stylish place to stay while they explore the wonderful city of Portland and it's surrounding beauty.

I am grateful to be doing something I love and grateful to see like minded people share my home and city. I was lucky enough to grow up in Portland so I know a lot about the city. I moved away to Hawaii to go to massage school and returned home with a greater feeling of appreciation for this city and I never plan to leave again! Soo if you need a massage... Feel free to contact me with any questions :)

'Do what you love and always make time to dance!'  cheers, Shane

name: Zoe And Jonathan
about:
We have spent most of our lives moving around and visiting various places around the world until finally joining forces in 2010 for a cross country road trip in search of a new place to settle. The natural beauty and local culture is what drew us to Portland and now that we've been living here for a few years, we're sure we made the right choice!

We love photography, movies, dogs, bike riding, road trips, camping, canoeing, snowboarding, and rummaging through estate sales for odd things to put in our house.

name: Katherine
about: Once a restless traveler myself, the tables have turned and I can delight in hosting others.  I have come back to roost in my home town and have learned to love it in a new way, despite its growing unaffordability.  I am not a die-hard capitalist, rather I see Airbnb as an opportunity for mutual benefit.  I can offer an economic way to experience the wonderful parts of this region (so you can save your money for great food, drink, art, music, and outdoor adventures) and boost quality of life for my son and I.  Welcome to my city!

name: Amy
about:
Hi! I'm a lover of  natural and simple living and an appreciator of the urban landscape.  I get the best of both worlds in Portland Oregon!  I do love to travel but don't get to as much as I'd like.  I am mom to two bright, inquisitive and beautiful children whom I am not ashamed to admit my world revolves around.  I am fun, adventurous and in severe need of much more time to enjoy even more life!!  

I've recently become a licensed esthetician which means if you'd like to book a facial or some other indulgent skin/body treatment while on vacation at my place, let me know!   I can provide services onsite, too!  Feel free to contact me for more information!

Looking forward to meeting!

name: Trevor
about: I consider myself a nomad. Spent last year traveling in Peru, Southeast Asia, Northern England and Latvia. Enjoy living in Portland and like sharing my knowledge of the town with guests.

name: Tatiana
about: I'm a young professional and travel for work. I love cooking and enjoying a nice bottle of wine.

name: Jennifer
about: Thinker, Designer, Writer & Entrepreneur.

name: Victoria
about:
Professional, active female. Longtime Portland resident. I rent out my 1 bedroom apartment when I am not in town. 

Thank you for your inquiry, please contact me with any questions, I am quite flexible with arrangements and can possibly provide transportation from airport, train station, and more.

name: Karen
about:
We are native to Portland Oregon, have been in the real estate industry around town forever, and love hosting new friends on Airbnb! 

Hosting is fun! The place is pretty self-explanatory, and unless you need something I'm inclined to leave you to it. We know this town very well, if you are looking for a certain style/genre/scene I may be able to point you in a direction.

My travel style is usually pretty spontaneous, booking a flight and finding a place a day or 2 before leaving is perfect for me, and some trips get planned out, depends on the mood.

name: Ashlee
about: I am a medical student at NCNM. I enjoy hiking, photography, knitting, reading, craft beer, and good company.

name: Karen
about: Karen Hery is 49 from Portland, OR.  My partner, Walker, is 66.  We love Portland and spend lots of time in the out of doors.  We are foodies and have sampled many of the restaurants around town at all price points.

name: Deborah
about:
Your hosts are Deborah and Eric along with their children Zoe and Owen. Most often you'll be communicating with me, Deborah. I've spent most of my professional life working on food and agriculture issues. I am always, always thinking about my next meal. Eric is a nurse at OHSU. In a previous life he was a landscape architect. Zoe is a busy 10th grader, and Owen is an equally active 7th grader. Our dog Eddy is named after a river eddy. People hear "Eddie" and assume she's a he. Now you are in the know on that one. 

This is the third (and final!) Portland home we've renovated. We're completely done on the inside, but the outside is still a work in progress. Eric is on it!

name: Aaron & Jess
about: Enjoy BBQ's, spending time with family and friends, enjoy craft beers, working on a collection of funny t shirts, I wear flip flops all year round. A ping pong fan, tennis and golf. I share my home with my wife, we both regular office jobs. Julio and Penny also live with us Julio is our fiesty chihuahua mix and Penny is our precious mini pincher.

name: Ron
about:
Hello,
My name is Ron.  I am an exercise physiologist and work in cardiopulmonary rehab helping people to improve their health.  To keep myself fit, I walk, exercise, kayak, hike, bike, x-country ski, snow shoe,  and swing dance.  I enjoy completing small house projects and spending time with my family.

name: Ryan & Lorelei
about: As an active family that often travels for work and fun (both with and without our kids), we've become real fans of AirBnB as guests. We're now very happy as AirBnB hosts to share the beautiful guest apartment that we furnished in our house for our family and friends. We've lived in Idaho, Chicago, up and down the I-5 corridor (Seattle to Eugene), with stints in Ecuador and Trinidad. We're now very happily settled out in Portland. We love traveling, especially here in the Pacific Northwest, but also throughout the country and internationally. When we travel, we appreciate the serendipitous experiences that find us when we act as humble guests in the local scene, and we try to avoid the culture-consumer tourist mode. When we do, we happily find what the place would like to share with us, rather than looking for what we would like to take from it. And an important part of why we travel and host: We love to meet people of all faiths, cultures, identities and orientations. We are safe, welcoming hosts and gracious guests - not regardless of, but because of who you are.

name: Rob
about: I'm a touring musician, and environmental consultant. Traveling is a regular part of my routine, and so my home is often available for rental. Similarly, I'm often looking for places to stay for a week or more at a time.

name: Patricia
about: I am outgoing, responsible and fun.  We have really enjoyed getting to know everyone through Airbnb (all our guests have been so wonderful!).  The cottage is so private, that while we are steps away in the main house we sometimes don't connect with everyone.  (Work, travel, and raising a family sometimes does that.)  We have brought in Sydney Mead from Habitate to help manage our airbnb and one of us can always be reached via text or phone if questions come up.

name: Ivy, Azure & Hisayuki
about:
We are a couple with a 4-year old daughter that rules.  Together we have lived in San Francisco, Honolulu, and now Portland.  Hisayuki is an engineer originally from Japan, Ivy is an herbal mixologist  born in New Jersey to Taiwanese parents. Ivy owns a natural cosmetics store in NE Portland where she makes soaps, lotions, and other personal care products. Azure is a mutt who is into interpretive dancing, gardening, and running laps in our kitchen. 

We opened our home to AirBnB guests in 2014, and loved the experience! We took a break in 2015, to do some big home renovation projects, and are excited to be able to welcome guests again this year.

name: Skye
about: I own and operate a home based sewing and design business. In my spare time, I run a produce gleaning program for the needy. I enjoy backpacking and bikepacking on long trips into the remote wilderness.

name: Kristy
about: I'm a nature lover who loves hiking to waterfalls, relaxing on a tranquil lake and camping by a river. I love music, good food and wine and enjoying the company of friends. A perfect day for me starts with a paddle board float with my dog and my kid followed by an afternoon of lounging in my backyard with a refreshing beverage while my husband is cooking on the grill.

name: E.B.
about: I am a retired software  engineer. I live in the Pacific NW and travel a lot. I love Portland and I love exploring new cities and countries.

name: Clare & Peter
about: After a visit to Portland a number of years ago, Peter and Clare, both retired teachers, fell in love with the area and decided to make it their home. The city itself and nearby ocean and mountains more than satisfy their many cultural and outdoor interests. They are especially passionate about music and travel. Having really enjoyed connecting with their airbnb hosts, they decided to start their own and look forward to hosting folks from all over the globe.

name: Nancy
about:
I am an educator who has worked for years as a teacher, administrator and currently on State-wide projects. Joe is a management consultant with a company called "Solid Ground Consulting" (check him out on-line).
Joe and I celebrate 25 years of marriage this summer (2013), and love travel, films, books, food, learning, and each other.  Our four kids are involved in careers all over the globe:  Thailand, Boston, New York and even one in Portland with a one-year old sweet, sweet baby! 
We love hosting guests and socializing in general, but have a quiet, very separate space for our Airbnb guests and only see them when we all make the effort.

name: Lathen & Anne-Marie
about: Lathen is a real estate agent and Anne-Marie is a CPA. We absolutely enjoy living in Portland!  We LOVE food, travel, the outdoors, and enjoying the city.  We've been at our house in West Hills/Hillsdale for about a year and we're grateful for Airbnb for giving us the opportunity to meet people from all over the world!

name: Zanetta
about: I am a 62 year old open minded lady that has lived in Portland since 1964.  I am originally from Minneapolis Minnesota.  I enjoy gardening, walking, reading, live theater and family.  I am friendly and will make you feel at home.

name: Meghan
about: I am a lover of historic architecture and I enjoy living in my 1889 Queen Anne Victorian. I work in the health field and teach at several local universities. I am also a painter and work in my studio in my house. My dog,Ananda, and cat, Kitty Mao Mao also share the space.  I love just sitting out on the back porch with a cup of French Roast and enjoying the  garden. And Portland Oregon is a great place to live!!

name: Morgan
about:
I’m a jazz musician and former Californian. And I am happy to be living in smart and politically-progressive Portland, Oregon.  I enjoy crossword puzzling, keeping up with Portland's exciting food and drink scene and taking regional road trips with my dog, Cooper.

My home, Ivon Street Studio, was designed and built for creative activity. It's a laboratory for music and architecture.  I host and record music workshops and house performances for local jazz musicians and spoken word artists.  And my housemate, Michelle, operates a sustainable-architecture firm on the ground floor here as well.

Michelle and I are warm and friendly people, eager to share both our home and knowledge of Portland’s best places to eat, drink, and play.

name: Nile
about:
I am a lifelong Portland resident, born and raised here with a couple of years spent living in France to break things up.  I graduated from Portland State and today I run a bookstore with my Father and am a photographer.  I love to travel and have had some great experiences with airbnb so far.

As for traveling, I am very independent and, while I enjoy getting to know new people, most of my favorite experiences are exploring new areas without a real agenda and my camera in hand.

name: Tanya
about: I practice medicine at an Urgent Care in Portland, Oregon, and Dave owns a successful gym in our neighborhood. We have lived in Portland for over 13 years and enjoy being Oregonians for its beauty, adventure, simplicity, green, organic, and innovative ways. We love to travel, take road trips, hike, camp, do trail runs and explore off-roading trails with our Rubicon and Xterra. We appreciate the food culture and Mecca of breweries and fine cocktails that Portland is known for. We are excited to share our home and hope you can see the sites and wonders that has put Portland on the map as best city in the U.S.

name: Joel
about:
I am a retired physician who has been active in hosting and an experienced landlord.  I have rented out parts of my house for 30 years, which has been a very positive experience.  I get very energized by meeting new people and in maintaining connection with community.
I am partnered with Kelly for the last 20 yrs.  He works for the airlines so I get to fly a lot using his benefit. It also means that he occasionally has very early mornings, so we tend to go to bed between 10 and 11 and get up early.   The 3rd floor is right above us, so we appreciate people being quiet after that time.
The 3rd floor also has very dramatic windows but with unusually low window sills and I am very uncomfortable having younger kids up there. We love having kids in the house otherwise.
I have lived in Europe for a number of years, mainly in Sweden. I am passionate about choral music and sing in a number of really good choirs.
Our house is smoke free. We prefer more than a one night stay.
I do give preference to people with a more complete profile and to those with more references.

name: Deanna
about: I was born in San Diego, and moved to Kona, Hawaii with my family when I was 10. I came to Oregon for college in 1997 and have lived here off and on since then, most recently since 2006. I like to do a lot of things- outdoors, concerts, eating good food etc. I am vegan and a bit of an environmentalist. I am into recycling and creating as minimal waste as possible. I am progressive and open to change and new experiences.

name: Jennifer
about: I am a 3rd generation Portland native who loves to travel and host other travelers. My goal is to provide a comfortable and cozy home away from home for my guests.

name: Michael
about: We live in Portland, Oregon-- we enjoy classical and jazz music, the museums, hiking and the fabulous restaurants. I am a retired pharmacist and my wife is a health care writer with her own web based journal. We have travelled all over the world in the 20 years of our marriage with our favorite countries being Peru, Iran, India and Myanmar and try to use Airbnb hosts whenever we can.

name: Diana
about:
From Boise, Idaho and own two rentals on SW 11th (Mosaic and Benson) in Portland. 
(URL HIDDEN)
Blazer and Ducks enthusiasts along with lover of cats and motorcycles.

name: R.J.
about:
I'm a professional Fine Art & Commercial Photographer, and a published author. I have traveled and or photographed in 35 countries. I cook several cuisines. I feel food  is a remarkable culture exchange.  Many of the ingredients come from a bountiful organic garden behind my my studio.

 I spend a lot of time hiking, canoeing, kayaking and photographing nature. The doggie love of my life Duncan NotaBeast is my constant companion.  
When time permits I enjoy preforming arts.   I'm currently working on my 3rd and 4th Fine Art Books.

name: Beryl
about:
Like to travel, go to the cheap movies, camp and ski/snowboard.
I work in the solar industry, mostly from home.

name: Blaire
about: Living in portland is the jam! I love traveling, yoga, cooking, art and ramen bowls.

name: Alichae
about: Thanks for considering our cottage retreat.  We're a small family that loves Portland.  7 years ago, we built our dream cottage. It's amazing!  The things you can do with natural materials are endless.  Built by natural builder, it was tons of fun and is a work of art. We live right next door,  so we get to see it every day and it still amazes us!  We hope you enjoy it as much as we have during your stay.

name: Bryan+Jen
about:
we are artists, travelers and makers.
we are offering our space to rent so that others can travel and experience portland the same way we like to experience places foreign to us- as the locals do!

name: Megan
about: I am a mid 30s professor of Urban Studies and Planning at Portland State University (dream job!). My husband Christian was the Sustainability Coordinator at North Seattle Community College, and now is building a basement apartment in our house. We moved to Portland from Seattle in summer 2015 and are enjoying getting to know our new home city. (But I am originally from Wisconsin.) We both have done some traveling - I spent 2 plus years in Honduras as a Peace Corps Volunteer and 6 months as an au pair in Denmark. Christian worked for 1.5 years in the Marshall Islands as a marina manager. We like to get to know people from all over! We both love bicycling, gardening, cooking, DIY projects, and adventures.

name: John
about:
John - retired homeowner, environmentalist; bicycle, softball, volleyball, ping-pong, board games, card games, sci fi/fantasy.
Katy - live-in cook/cleaner/house manager

Life motto: Be positive!

name: Morgan
about:
My family and I live in Portland because we love being in nature and around people who care about others. 

My wife is a middle school teacher (bless her heart!), my son is in 8th grade and loves soccer and riding his bike all over town, and my daughter is in 6th grade and is an avid reader, loves kayaking, and is into design. 

Like my wife, I work with teenagers, holding space for them to explore and figure out how to make their one life count. We go hiking, play at the park, create celebrations for important transitions, and more. I also help the parents be part of the team that their teens rely on for stability and success.   

Like my son, I bike everywhere also. Unlike my son, I have a committed and dynamic yoga practice - I'd be happy to take you to the best yoga studio in Portland! 

We love having visitors and learning about different places in the world. We've hosted teens from South Central LA, San Diego, and Portland, and are now opening our extra living space to you! If you come during the week, we'll likely be working to get ready for our intense work days and won't have the bandwidth to be social, but I'll definitely help you find your way to the cool places in our neighborhood and around town so you have an awesome visit to Portland!  We'll be available more on the weekends.

name: Jill
about: Living part time in San Juan Islands, WA, part time in Portland

name: Duane
about:
Hi, I'm Duane. I'm a footwear designer now living in Oakland, California. I spent 10 years in Portland so I'm pretty familiar with the city and the NW in general. Aside from designing shoes for some of the NBA's biggest stars, I've learned to snowboard here, discovered get food, and met some amazing people. I launched a tiny music career in this city so I can recommend some great venues as well. As a host, I welcome responsible travelers who appreciate well kept surroundings. As a guest, I treat your place as my own. Mi casa su casa. Su casa mi casa.
duanealawrence(URL HIDDEN)
champagneduane(URL HIDDEN)
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1242928

name: Sally K.
about: Hospitality comes naturally to us. We've come to learn that our most enjoyable guests enjoy taking care of themselves--and cleaning up after themselves. We love the simplicity, comfort and beauty of our home place, and we welcome you to find magic in the ordinary.  The guest rooms are on a separate floor from our living spaces, with 3 entrances to the garden. The garden is large & lush, with meandering paths and private places to be alone or together.  It's quiet here; the air is fragrant and full, with bird songs, creek sound, and honey bees. He is a farmer and I'm a psychotherapist. I see possibility and he likes hard work. We've been a good team; having found this crooked old house on a trash dump creek 20 years ago; we've cared for and cultivated what has become a very special place. We thrive on good conversation, food, music, books, art, wine, dance, & laughter. We also like our privacy, and the structure of the house provides plenty of room to choose that. You can choose solitude or conviviality here as you like. It's a beautiful place to gather with a small group of friends if they like to talk softly or go away by 10 pm. Sound carries through the floors, so there's headphones to wear if you want to blast the stereo or watch a movie late. The TV isn't hooked up; it's good for DVDs and maybe Netflix. There's some real food in the kitchen, fresh sheets on the beds, good towels, toiletries, espresso & tea.  Namaste.

name: Ingrid
about:
We are an architect and a retired teacher of students with reading disabilities. I'm from England and my husband Dick is a native Oregonian. We greatly value activities with our large family. I look after my one year old grandson two afternoons a week. Our small mountain farm by Mount Adams brings a lot of peace, joy and much needed agricultural practice. We have a career changed guide dog who is a light of my life. Dick loves to design buildings, some we live in. He knows how to build almost anything. I love to draw and paint. Dick volunteers for historic preservation of Timberline Lodge, in planning for the needs of emotionally disturbed children and for the school district. The Ducks football team is a passion for him. I volunteer with my dog in the area of pet therapy at the local hospital, and for Guide Dogs for the Blind. Sometimes, I tutor people with learning differences. After finding I had some French left from my childhood, I began French lessons which I continue to enjoy.

Throughout my life I have traveled a lot. Although I grew up in England,  my grandmother's farm was in the North of Norway, near the Arctic Circle so I went there quite a bit as a child. Subsequently, I spent a year as a teaching volunteer in East Africa, a place always in my heart and which has inspired me to be involved in international volunteerism. Over the years, I have been to Costa Rica, Mexico, El Salvador, Guatemala, Hawaii, Australia, Greece, back to England, France and Switzerland. We often travel to meet with my brothers who live in Australia and New Zealand. My brothers are very skilled at organizing and researching for vacations and always know a lot about transportation and housing options, local history and culture. 

Dick and I like to travel for as full a cultural experience as we can. We tend to avoid tours and hotels and like to have home stays. We fly often, but some of our best times have been had on canal barges in France and England, and, for me, on the chicken buses in Central America.

An avid reader, I've recently enjoyed Alice Munro, Anne Patchett and Barbara Kingsolver. A favorite book was Cutting for Stone by Abraham Verghese. With a view to understanding my parent's lives, recently I've been reading histories concerning the Great Wars of the last century, including the works of Winston Churchill. Dick and I differ in our movie tastes mostly because I don't like to watch violence and bad language which eliminates a huge percentage!. He chooses films like the Bourne movies whereas I went to see Iron Lady, Philomena and Saving Mr. Banks  this year. In the past, we have had season tickets to the local repertory theater. With two career musicians in the family, we listen to a lot of jazz and rock music. I like classical music, too, and the opera. 

Our family is 'foodie'. We have a lot of good cooks, including nearly all the men. Luckily, we live in a part of the country where there is a lot of interest catered to by amazing farmer's markets, restaurants and talented home chefs.

When traveling, we hope we are good guests. We have a great interest in our hosts and try to be culturally sensitive, responsive and responsible to each environment. As hosts of friends and family from all around the world, we have the goal of 'mi casa es su casa' and 'let's make it fun.'

A recently acquired life motto is: It takes a long time to grow young. - Picasso

name: Justin
about:
From Portland, Oregon

I like the outdoors, active sports and nice beverage from time to time ;-).

What else do you need to know?  Ask away!

name: Kurt & Nathalie
about: Originally from Baltimore and Biarritz, we put down roots in Portland in the late 1990's.  While Myrna is a native Portlander from the early 2014s, she'll tell you that she has Netherlands lineage to the 15th century. We enjoy the outdoors, yoga, cycling, ayurvedic cuisine, pets, poetry, our 1908 craftsman and new studio, and always look forward to amazing Portland weather and socializing with the great people it brings.

name: Cibyl
about:
Cibyl: I am an artist (I mainly work with handmade recycled paper, natural inks, and textiles) and a Montessori teacher. I was born in Paris and raised in England, Malta and Greece before moving to the United States. Part of my childhood was spent hosting guests on a 72 foot schooner in the Mediterranean.

Ed: I am an IT professional, unicycler and Dharma Holder with the Zen Community of Oregon. Portland has been home since 1991 and I love it here: the organic, locally grown food, the books (Yay! Powells!), the adventurous, outside-the-box culture, the focus on sustainability and the incredible natural beauty. My family fostered children and hosted a family of Vietnamese refugees when I was a child.

Cibyl and Ed: Hospitality is something woven into the very fabric our of being! In 2013 we decided to move the studio into the house and convert the studio into a guest cottage. We wanted to create a special, magical, secluded, intimate, welcoming space for people to enjoy for a weekend or for longer creative/meditation retreats, visiting family or simply vacationing . We are excited to share what we've created as well as our fabulous city and bioregion. 

Our cottage is located in a highly desireable, close to everything neighborhood in Portland. We take public transportation or walk to the cinema, restaurants, grocery stores, music or theater events, art galleries, bookstores, public gardens and much more.

name: Kati
about: I'm outgoing, enjoy reading, hiking, gardening and photography. I have a great community here and enjoy chatting with friends as well. I work downtown Monday-Friday so I am up early.  I have also lived in Phoenix and Denver, and love helping people see Portland and random fun things to do. I bike everywhere and grow mostly my own food, its a great place! Look forward to connecting soon. =)

name: Kelly And Mike
about: We're kind, fun, friendly, love to travel.  We love eating out, meeting new friends, architecture and sightseeing, camping and hiking.  We've traveled lots in Western Europe, SE Asia, Mexico.  We are generally quiet, mellow, and easy going, but enjoy socializing and meeting locals while we're traveling.

name: Emily
about: Hey, I'm Emily!

name: Molly
about: Hi!  I love being an Air BnB host and guest.  I love animals and spent my 40th birthday volunteering at a primate rescue in Cameroon.  Can't live without my cats and dogs.  I'm kind of proud of founding a nonprofit that builds community connections between people with and without disabilities ((URL HIDDEN)  Right now I am a free lance writer-- kind of:) and doing short term work projects while enjoying my creative side-- especially song writing.

name: Cindy
about: Cindy and Alan are avid road cyclists. In addition to riding our bikes, we like to hike, run, entertain, read, watch movies, and spend time with our family. We have 7 children and 7 grandchildren who keep us pretty busy. We can recommend bike routes, hiking trails, "must see" sights, and amazing restaurants in and around the Portland area.

name: Enrique
about:
Reading, traveling, writing. 
Teaching literature for living. 
Someday, I would like to make movies.

name: June
about: Traveler who enjoys welcoming other travelers. I'll try to suggest as many current travel and activity options as I can to help you enjoy your time in Portland. However, I suggest you glance ahead of time at websites like travelportland

name: Kristien
about: Self-employed landscape designer.  Mother of two beautiful girls.  Living in Portland, OR originally from the coast of SC.  I love yoga, running, live music, community, travel, and the outdoors.

name: Raquel & Troy
about:
We are a family who loves to travel all over the world, and we seek out fun adventures anytime we have free time. We have family in both Mexico and Canada, so we often cruise our way up and down the west coast visiting new places and learning all we can as we go.
We welcome visitors from all over the globe, and look forward to sharing our wonderful city.

name: Shoshana
about: A solid Midwesterner at heart (born and raised in Madison, WI), I moved to the Bay Area for Stanford and relocated to Portland this year after falling in love with this city. I love the local food scene especially and will be happy to provide recommendations. I've stayed at many Airbnbs myself, as well as hotels all over the world, and tried to create a space I'd be thrilled to spend time in myself. It's a little peace of heaven meant to be enjoyed

name: Tal
about:
Hi! My name is Tal. I've lived on both the East and West Coasts, but I currently call Oregon home. I am a 31 year old professional photographer who loves to travel, long board, bike, and hike.
I am super into cooking, especially Italian, and also love movies.

name: Kathryn
about: Musician/Instructor, health advocate, animal lover (though I have no pets!).

name: Kara
about:
Hi I'm Kara (Care-uh)!  We are four roommates in my quiet house in the best neighborhood in Portland.  We have three little dogs that take a moment to warm up to new people but will likely end up on your lap very soon.  

We are walkers/bikers/bussers who enjoy fresh veggies from our garden, meeting new people and enjoying the local restaurant fare.  We often have people visiting from out of town so we're excited to have you here too!  Our home is LGBTQ friendly, laid back and low maintenance.

name: Candice
about: I love the outdoors!...camping, canoeing, gardening, hiking, you name it. i'm also into reading, food, beer/wine, good music, and travel.

name: Magnus And Jenny
about: Jenny is a full time artist. Magnus a sometime photographer and long term patron of the arts. We play, travel and try to enjoy life as best we can.

name: Donna
about:
We are a long time couple with a small dog and a big house.  We decided to convert part of our daylight basement into an accessory dwelling unit (ADU) and we are glad we did!  We now enjoy sharing the space with visitors to our delightful city.

We are recently retired, and enjoy every minute of it!  We love traveling in our little RV, hiking, photography, hanging with friends and roaming around Portland.

name: Bridget
about: Frank and Bridget have been married for 27 years. We have three children - Matt, Zac and Anna - all graduates of the University of Oregon (hooray!). We like to do stuff with our kids. We love our garden, a good red blend, St. Rose of Lima, chocolate, Mama Leos (gluten free :-), House of Cards and Dave Matthews. We want our guests to enjoy their stay, but they should really get out and see Portland. It's awesome!

name: Nicole
about: Friendly , outgoing  retired teacher , Healthy and into outdoor activities of all kinds.....hiking, kayaking, skiing and backpacking.  Home reflects love of animals, art and personal relationships world wide .  I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and often have houseguests from other countries. I hold a monthly " soup night " for our neighborhood  and we end up singing and joking around the piano ,    Relaxed and comfy home with one cat and one older, mellow dog who sleeps 18 hours a day !!    My favorite countries to visit are France, New Zealand, Australia and Baja, Mexico.

name: Martha
about:
I am a creative type and have loved calling Portland my home for almost 15 years. I have 2 kids, in middle and high school, and we keep busy enjoying all that Portland has to offer, from open air concerts, art festivals and street fairs, to simple walks around the beautiful tree-lined neighborhood with our little dog, Benjamin.

We love to kick about, take hikes, go bike riding, and play tennis. I have a small business in the creative industry and work for an advertising agency too. We have had au pairs stay with our family over the years, when the kids were younger, and miss having that interaction. We are very in to having travelers stay in our new lovely guest house, whether from nearby towns, across the country, or from another continent. We look forward to helping your stay be a relaxing and wonderful adventure and are happy to help out with recommendations for restaurants, entertainment, gardens, museums, and day trips.

name: Bay And Mike
about: My husband, Mike and I are in love with Oregon, both natives.  We currently split time between Mosier Oregon (Columbia Gorge) to work in our garden and Portland Oregon.  In Mosier we attend to a garden that we sell locally to farmers markets and a couple restaurants. We love traveling, hiking, cycling, gardening, and meeting other travelers.  We find a real joy in hosting.

name: Daniel And Katie
about: We are a recently married couple.  Katie was born and raised in Portland, and I have been in Portland since 2001.  We love enjoying the outdoors, exploring the great restaurants of Portland, and traveling when we can find the time.  You may see our cat Gracie running around the property outside (she does not have access to the Airbnb space)  and she is the only pet we have.  We are excited to share our apartment with  guests, and will be sure that all of our guests know how to get the most out of their time in Portland!

name: Angela
about:
I am a stay home Mom and proud business owner. I enjoy reading, Tai Chi, Yoga, hiking, cooking, watching Netflix, spending time with my daughter, music and the active life. I have three degrees: one AA, AS and a BA specializing in teaching and English. 

My husband and I are into the arts and keep a happy and positive home. He is a Record Producer and works for a software company. We are both in bands and you might hear us on the radio at 94.7 here in Portland.

name: Tina
about: My husband and I love to entertain and meet new people - we are proud of this eclectic area of our town and are eager to share this rare jewel with folks new to Portland.  We enjoy wine and beer tastings and continually explore new culinary delights so we can inform guests while staying with us.  We look forward to meeting you and sharing "the Portland" experience!

name: Teresa
about: I am very mellow but also friendly and outgoing. I like to develop relationships with people of all walks of life. I keep busy but also like to make time to get to know house mates. I have traveled in India, Mexico, Thailand, Canada, and the US. I have lived in Portland and this neighborhood for a long time and have many great suggestions.

name: Jov
about: Musician / videographer / photographer / gardner / builder

name: Carson
about:
Hi! Thanks for looking at my room. I live with one other female roommate, Alicia. I have lived in Portland for ten years and love it here. I'm open minded, considerate, and active in my neighborhood and city. I serve on my neighborhood association board. I love to go see shows and eat out when I'm not busy with work. 
Please contact me with questions I can answer. I look forward to having you stay in my home!

name: Natasha
about: We're just some nature-loving folks living the Portland dream! We love tromping around the woods, playing music, going to endless potlucks, practicing acroyoga, eating a wide variety of amazing food, and introducing people to our wonderful city.

name: Jay & Soo
about: We are from Portland, OR.  We love to be outdoors, either doing adventure things, skiing, biking, hiking, camping, or just kicking around some new town, checking out museums and stuff.  We are 2 very clean, low-maintenance, easy-going people with our 2 1/2 year old toddler!

name: Greg & Mallory
about: Mallory and Greg met in 2009, married in 2011 and welcomed Willa to the family in 2014. Mallory grew up in North Portland giving her a unique perspective on the North and Northeast Portland neighborhoods. Greg grew up in Alabama and fell in love with the West after completing a bike tour from Canada to Southern California. Both Greg and Mallory love the outdoors, have tons of experience backpacking, running trails unknown and have raced bikes competitively. Greg is a college science instructor and Mallory works for a non-profit supporting a local children's hospital. We have a wide variety of hobbies--Greg brews beer (mostly Belgian style beers), enjoys bird watching, collects rare and unusual plants and rides bikes. Mallory rides bikes, goes on walks in the neighborhood and occasionally gets crafty.

name: Courtaney
about: food enthusiast, caregiver by trade, momma to small human and fur-child.

name: Judd
about:
We are a family of three, Judd, Monica and our daughter, Amelia.  We live in Portland, Oregon, in the southeast neighborhood of Sellwood. Our neighborhood is located close to the Willamette River that is within walking distance to parks, restaurants, coffee shops, antique stores, galleries, bike shops, library, etc. The Springwater trail is very close by that is a bike corridor to the downtown area and beyond, both east and west. As previously mentioned, we have two bike shops that rent bikes for the day, whether you want to meander or put on serious milage on a high end bike. The food choices available include two Italian restaurants, Vietnamese, Asian fusion, sushi, Greek/Mediterranean, plus pizza and bar grub all within short walking distance. 

As hosts, we have a detached private, studio dwelling with a pull down Murphy bed that features a Tempur-pedic mattress, kitchenette with stovetop and microwave, full bath with glassed in shower and heated floors. HDTV with Blu-ray player with surround sound. Other amenities include outdoor seating for summer dining in the patio/garden. 

As guests, we enjoy exploring local life and interests, especially dining, bicycling, swimming, shopping, art galleries, and my own personal interest: nearby coffee shops. I love my coffee and always find out something new from visiting with the local clientele. We love to travel with our daughter to new places around the world, whether it is Asia or Europe or the backroads of the United States. Our daughter is well traveled and gets along with everyone. We are easy going and will always pick up after ourselves, as we feel it is our obligation not to leave a mess behind us.

name: Robyn
about:
I love to travel and be a hostess. I am married, mother of two young boys, entrepreneur who loves the flexible life style of the self-employed to fit into my busy life with children. 

In my small amounts of spare time I love to read, learn new things, be out in nature, camp, bicycle, and neurotically knit :) I must have my morning cup of imported Temi tea (that I always bring with me). I love to have quiet time and time with friends and family. 

Things I can't live without - my favorite tea, iPhone, nice glass of red wine, my knitting, and the opportunity to learn something new in life. 

As a guest, you can expect me to be respectful, kind, and a great guest. As a host, you can expect the same with as much conversation you want about my beautiful city of Portland, OR and what you should do while you are visiting here.

name: Andrew+Jeanne
about: Andrew and Jeanne are a semi-retired couple with interests in jazz, travel and photography.  Jeanne speaks some French and German.  We can advise you on skiing, hiking in the Columbia Gorge, biking, walking and sightseeing.  We live upstairs and are available to share our tips on enjoying Portland but also can give you all the privacy you would like.

name: Kathleen
about:
I'm an active and outdoorsy physical therapist who loves biking, hiking, skiing and reading.  
I also enjoy traveling, camping and trying new and different foods.

name: Karen
about: mail carrier

name: Stacey
about:
Athens, Ga. native that has lived all over the U.S. (SF, Portland, Washington, Atlanta, Mississippi (true)) and loves to travel. I work for Nike which takes me to interesting destinations, but I truly love living in the NW!

My husband is from Oklahoma and we love enjoying a city in it's "natural habitat" and tend to avoid hotels when possible. Plus, I see plenty of those when I travel for work. We're both adventurous and love good food and being outdoors. While we don't have kids, we do have a Frenchie that totally acts like a kid -- only because we treat her as such!

name: Kelly
about:
I am a mom and a sculpture artist.
My husband is a musician and web developer.
We love to travel and we love to eat delicious food and we're really nice and pretty cool. ;)

name: Alexi
about: I am a born and raised Oregonian. I am proud to call Portland my home and share it with others.  I love animals, good food, good friends, walks, and Oregon Duck Football.

name: Chris
about: I've lived in this neighborhood for the last 18 years and it is a great place to visit. Guests to the Blueberry Farm may notice that I love nature. The yard is either a native forest or a food producing orchard. I am friends with all of my neighbors and all of their feline friends who come to visit each day. I also like to visit one of the many taprooms and cider houses within an easy walk. My favorite things are watermelon, cheese and turtles.

name: Karina
about:
H! I'm Karina, an enthusiastic native Portlander and journalist. I love travel, running in the woods, reading and hanging with friends.

I've explored Central and South America and Europe, and am hoping to make it to Asia soon!

Come visit, I'd love to meet you!

name: Jim & Sue
about:
We are native Portlanders, with enormous pride in our beautiful city and historic home. Jim has owned and operated his own business in the neighborhood  for 30 years. Sue works as a consumer products sales manager. We love to ride our bikes, hike the many trails in the area and boat on the  Willamette and Columbia rivers. We are early to bed and early to rise people.  We love to cook and drink good wine. Dining out in one of the many local restaurants is how we treat ourselves to a diverse selection of fantastic foods and support our local economy. We treat our house quests like family. With that, we respectfully ask that before you send a reservation request that you have a current profile and picture along with a few details pertaining to your visit. Lastly, we do accept one small pet (under 15 lb)  the pet must be crate trained and house broken. The pet must stay with the quest at all times. Thank you and we hope to see you soon! 
Jim & Sue

name: Andrea
about: What I like: traveling, the outdoors, egg sandwiches, social entrepreneurship, good coffee, the NPR Music app, connecting people.

name: Peggy
about:
I'm native Californian who fell in love with Portland when visiting my daughter  five years ago.  A week later, I bought my home and never looked back!  I am passionate about the lush green landscape and the rain as well as the Portland art and music scene.  As an artist and illustrator, I find continuous inspiration here.  I love to travel, entertain friends, am a voracious reader. 
   I enjoy meeting new people and I celebrate both our similarities and differences.  I am a hands off host - respectful of your privacy, but am also happy to suggest great local restaurants and fun things to do in Portland.

name: Huma
about: Born and raised in Los Gatos, Ca. I love good food, great company and exploring new cities. I spent the last 10 years living in England, Washington, and Oregon and returned to CA just a couple years ago to attend law school.

name: Scott
about: I'm a work from home health professional that recently moved to Portland. Originally from the West Coast, I am happy to have a new condo for myself and my pets and enjoy hosting guests in the lovely extra room. So far, I've had great experience with Airbnb guests and it's been fun getting to know folks who have been short term residents. I'm a laid back person, who doesn't take life too seriously and I try to find humor in all the right places.

name: A.E.
about:
I'm a technologist based out of Portland who travels a ton. I'm thrilled to be able to share my delightful space and my lovely cat with you, and he'll be happy to see you too.  

Things I love: The intersection of technology and fashion. Great food, great wine and great company. Cycling! Portland's a great city for all these things. 

Life rocks every day of the week.

name: Gabe
about: Hello world! My name is Gabe and I am a recent graduate from the University of Oregon. I grew up in Portland, OR and currently split time between living in Portland and Europe for my job. As a host I love answering questions to give visitors a local perspective of Oregon. I work in music production for a company based in Paris. Outside of concerts/music I really just love anything that keeps me active or gets me outside, hence why I love the Pacific Northwest. I am looking forward to using Airbnb more as a guest and as a host.

name: Michael And Jenna
about:
Hello,

We are a newly married couple living in Joshua Tree, California and Portland, Oregon. Michael has musician roots. Jenna hails from the SF tech world. We first began designing/building together in 2012 when we created the Rustic Modern Tiny House in Portland, Oregon. While building we were surprised to realize that we can make beautiful-awesome stuff together, and we love the process!  The Rustic Modern has been such a gift of creation, and we are so happy to be able to share it. 

Joshua Tree was our first weekend away together and we always loved it here, so we said "Let's move to the desert so we can create more amazingness!"  Our most recent project was restoring a 1950s homesteader cabin. Just a little under 500SF but surrounded by huge open skies.  We never dreamed of having this much space. What we love most about the Home Sweet Homesteader is the view from the patio.  We, of course, have nothing to do with the sunsets you will see from here… but they are some of the best we have seen anywhere. 

Perhaps we shall cross paths - in Portland or Joshua Tree, or perhaps somewhere in between!

Cheers, 
Michael and Jenna

name: Tomala
about: This is public so I'm not crazy about entering information here.

name: Sheila
about: I'm a northwest native who loves my special Sanctuary in the city... and I love to travel elsewhere on a regular basis!  It is my pleasure to offer my home to you.  Even when I am away, you will find me responsive to any questions or needs you have about my property.

name: Becky
about:
I am a stay at home mom of two children (we live in the downstairs home).  Our parents, when they visit us, stay the upstairs unit that we have available on airbnb.  My husband works in the field of early childhood education and I teach art classes.

We love gardening and spending time outdoors, camping, hiking and playing with our kids. We enjoy spending time in our neighborhood, walking to our organic grocery store, restaurants and coffee shops.

name: Travelers' House
about: Travelers' House is an independent shared living environment where travelers, adventurers, and seekers naturally connect.  Grant, the owner started it in 2014 near the fun and funky Alberta Arts, Williams, and Mississippi Districts. We offer a unique communal experience in a renovated house featuring private rooms, and dorm-style rooms all with shared facilities. We are also a LGBTQ friendly establishment.

name: Beth
about: I am easy going, quiet and an easy keeper. When I travel I'm usually gone most of the day. I'm friendly and social but not a partier. I'm respectful, clean and a nonsmoker.

name: Kiah
about: From the Pacific Northwest. I like being outdoors, reading, baking, going out for food and drinks, and going to see music. I love where I live but I love to travel too! I speak English as well as some Spanish and French.

name: Eli
about:
I am a Lewis & Clark graduate. I enjoyed traveling to the east coast to visit my daughter when she was in college (Vassar '08) and I am now offering part of my home to parents visiting Lewis & Clark College or Law School.  

As an aside, I wish Airbnb had been available when I was in Italy, Germany, Austria, India and Bali.  I like to stay close to the ground when I travel and would have enjoyed the chance to stay in private homes along the way.  I have looked back and there are now Airbnb hosts along the routes I traveled.  I look forward to using Airbnb when I travel next.

As for day-to-day life in Portland, I lead an active and fit lifestyle and eat a mostly vegetarian diet, with a seafood exception.  I paddle board in the summer and cross-county ski in the winter, and cycle year around.  I have lived in this area for 27 years and in this home for 20 years.  

Good luck to you in your travels!

Eli

name: Nik
about:
56 and semi-retired, I come from New York but my residence is in Portland, Oregon.

Though I have had little experience with airbnb, I have hosted and stayed with many people throughout my long traveling life. I enjoy meeting people and have always treated others and their property with great respect.

name: Michelle
about:
Hello!
My name is Michelle and I've been happy to call Portland home for a decade. I own a fantastic yoga studio here in town named The Peoples Yoga. I am pretty busy with that but happy when our paths cross and look forward to sharing my passion of the city with you!

name: Ixel And Lori
about: We are both veteran public school teachers that love their work. Ixel was born and raised in Portland, and Lori is a native Washingtonian. We have a daughter, Ahvi, that is pursuing her PhD in Evolutionary Biology at the U of Arizona. We love to travel, especially to locals that have warm water swimming and tropical breezes. We love home cooked food especially when shared with family and friends.

name: Matt
about: My wife and I are both early childhood teachers in the Portland area. We grew up in the Midwest and have been in Portland for 20 some years.

name: Tyler
about: Born and raised in Texas. Looking for the next adventure. *UPDATE* I've found my next adventure in Portland, OR!

name: Craig
about: Outdoor enthusiast

name: Beata & Michael
about:
We love the outdoors and experiencing culture and the arts.  We work in the alternative health field.  We are largely vegetarian and a health conscious eaters.  5 things Beata cannot live without:
Love, laughter, nature, friendships, faith.  
 5 things Michhael cannot live without:
Beata'sLove, laughing at my own jokes, nature, friendships, hope.
We are an experienced travellers, independent and will ask for what we need.  We appreciate good tips and information.  We like the option of quiet/solitude or socializing.  Beata speaks decent Spanish.  Michael speaks decent English with an Australian/Scottish accent!

Beata's Life Moto:  Do to others as you would have them do to (URL HIDDEN) what you say and say what you do.  That about sums it up.  :)

Michael's Life Motto: Hope is a verb with it's sleeves rolled up!

name: Colette
about: We are currently adventuring around Alaska and hope to be official "digital nomads" by this time next year. Let us know if you'd like us to help you build your next website!

name: Megan
about: Great family of 4 with two kids in college.  Love to travel and have been many places in the USA, Europe and Central America.  We love to explore and see the sites and experience the culture of where we are.  Thank you :)

name: Brent
about: Chocolate-addicted Portlander who loves riding bikes, foosball, and inventing things.

name: Kelly
about:
Portland/NYC musician. 

I lived in NY for the last 11 years, but am now living primarily in Portland, Or.

name: Reatha
about: Sing, Dance, Floss, Travel

name: Jodi
about: We are an active Portland family who loves to be outdoors adventuring in the gorgeous Pacific NW! We've lived in Portland for the past 12 years, and our  favorite things about living here are all of the opportunities to ride, climb, hike, play, eat, and be outside romping in the rain, sun and snow with our children and friends.  We love connecting visitors to exceptional experiences in Portland and Oregon, and look forward to hosting you!  As a bike-first family, we get super excited about guests who want to experience Portland by bike, foot, or cargo bike, too, and are always happy to help you plan a route by bike or foot! Welcome!!!

name: Maren
about: Maren is a Nevada native and Kevin is a Colorado native. We both moved to Oregon 10 years ago. We like calling Portland our home, but we love to get out and travel too, whether it's a day hike in the Cascades or a week in Havana.

name: Tracy
about: My husband, Rick, and I have lived in Portland for 40 years.  We met each other while teaching at a Portland middle school.  We both love living in Portland, enjoying its urban advantages as well as the outdoors which is extremely accessible to our house.   We both bicycle through the city as we are a 1/2 block from a major city bike route.

name: Kristen
about:
I am a graduate of the University of Oregon and home owner in Eugene. I have spent the last decade working with international non-profit organizations involved with humanitarian aid and assistance.  My work has taken me to Viet Nam, Cambodia, Nepal and Afghanistan where I have developed and lead programs to help landmine and bomb survivors and children denied their basic rights to education, due to poverty. My home in Eugene is my sanctuary, which I share with special individuals.  I'm currently working in Portland, OR and offering my home for short- to medium-term rental. 

 I enjoy spending time with friends, teaching ZUMBA, hiking, meeting new people, live music, bargain shopping, spontaneity, being home when I'm not out-and-about in the world, and entrepreneurial opportunities.  I live a dynamic life and also enjoy the simplicity of maintaining an uncluttered and balanced home and life.

name: Kristen
about: Kristen

name: Kathryn
about:
I moved to Portland six years ago from the midwest and continue to find reasons why this is a wonderful place to be. So much beauty, whether viewed from my back yard or from any of limitless perspectives in town and nearby. The neighborhoods are so fun to walk and explore. I do like seeing them on foot so that I can savor each step and what it reveals.

The past decade has been a time of significant transition for me, and I have come to see the re-creation of my home as a metaphor for the transformation of my life. I spend time helping others deal with the challenges of ending relationship and becoming a single person. Personal reflection is important to me, and the spaces I inhabit are designed to accommodate that. 

The garden is my renewed experimentation with growing food and inviting color. I am learning a lot! This year I hope to extend the growing season by trying out cold frames. 

I have traveled around the US and especially enjoy large cities where there is a different flavor in each section of town. I spent several months in central Africa a couple of years back; that experience shifted some perspectives for me about form and space. I made a few friends I hope to keep for life. It's been a pleasure to carry those things forward. If I am lucky, the day will again arrive when I can return and spend more time there.

Hosting for me means being attuned to what my guests desire. When you need suggestions, engagement, and connection... I am delighted to share what I have found. I also understand that sometimes you just want to be left alone. The space here accommodates that well. 

I am a fan of jazz, funk, and soul music. Yoga, dance, delicious healthy food, good drink, and coffee each have a place in my life and heart! I read for pleasure and learning. I really enjoy getting to know people and their perspectives on life. We are all so unique! I'd love to meet and get to know you.

name: Samira
about: I am Life Coach, a Moth Story enthusiast, and a lover of artisan food. I'm also very passionate about social justice and do what I can to leave the world better than I found it.  I've lived in multiple countries and states but have never felt more at home than I do in Portland.  In my spare time I tell stories, write & give occasional talks.

name: Maria & Kenyon
about:
What's on your bucket list? Reaching the summit of Mt Kilimanjaro and stepping foot in all 7 continents filled my bucket.

As avid travelers, we have made the study of people, food, and cultures the thesis of our wanderlust. From cycling to surfing and from yoga to meditation, our interests are as diverse as there are cultures.

We believe a successful lifestyle is about balancing work, play, and rest. This means work that is intellectually stimulating, creative, and meaningful and down time is more than sleep.

We love meeting new people and introducing visitors to Portland and especially Multnomah Village. We'll be glad to share our favorite hike, restaurant, and shops with you. 

By working downtown Maria stays on top of the food cart and restaurant scene. To counter this appetite for good food she commutes by bike each day over Terwilliger Blvd. Portland is bike friendly (mostly).

Kenyon is in charge of the garden and as a flower farmer he knows horticulture. His garden was featured recently by Janet Eastman of the Oregonian. Search the web for "Sleeping in Portland - Master bedroom conversion in Multnomah Village".

"Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind." -- Dr. Seuss

name: Ed & Kyle
about:
We are avid travelers who also love our hometown. 
We value adventure, friendship, good food, and a long run.
Whether exploring or hosting fellow explorers, we appreciate variety, simplicity, and obsessed detail & design.

name: Andersen
about: How's it?  I'm a body worker, yoga teacher and ayurvedic practitioner currently working on my doctorate in Naturopathic Medicine at NCNM in Portland, OR.  I love to meet unique and innovative people offering sweet places to stay when I travel, or when they travel to stay with me at the Organic EcOasis here in Stumptown! Loving airbnb!!

name: Natalie
about: I am a full time working mom. I love nature and the outdoors, reading, and music.

name: Tope
about:
Hello!

Welcome to Portland! I am Tope. Located in the  "Alberta Arts District," our house is the perfect location for families and road trippers alike.  Parking is free outside the house, and there are 6 restaurants, bars, a breakfast spot, and a coffee shop within 3 blocks of the location.
