You will also find Art Galleries, Bars with great food that stay open late, Coffee Shops, some of the best restaurants in the nation , book stores, organic food, hand made portland crafted goods, street festivals, all within walking distance. There is a Thai restaurant and 2 late night bars within 100 feet. 


Style of Hosting:
Helpful and friendly. We love to educate people in general, and to have conversations if time allows. 


Of Note:
We do not discriminate based on age, sex, religion, race, nationality, or otherwise. We feel strongly about this. 

If you have any other questions, just ask! 

Cheers,
Tope & Sosanya Family

name: Nick
about: I'm originally from Colorado and I'm an ad guy and a reluctant handyman. My wife Shelley is a rare native Portlander and Physical Therapist. We love the water, the outdoors, delicious beer and good food – all that great Pacific Northwest stuff. We have a precocious toddler and a dog named Baxter who just wants to catch Frisbees all day.

name: Danny
about: active, spontaneous, friendly and very respectful. I love to travel and I understand hospitality for a modern traveler

name: Kristi
about: I'm an elementary teacher taking a year's leave starting this fall (I'm here during the summer) to travel, explore and reflect.  I just started doing Airbnb the weekend of July 9th, and am loving meeting the friendly and conscientious travelers who are coming through! I live with my dear companion, Steven, a 9-yr-old greyhound.  I love to read, spend time with friends, take photos and watch classy films and cheesy Korean dramas.

name: Rich & Patsy
about:
Rich & Patsy are your hosts. Rich is owner of NW Mobile kitchens, a Food Truck Design/build company.  We're always happy to recommend our favorite Portland Food Carts to visitors and friends. Patsy works at Portland State University.
My wife Patsy & I love Oregon wines and local restaurants - a big part of what makes Portland such a fun destination. Hiking local trails, biking in the neighborhood and gardening are all reasons why we live here.

name: Aleksey
about: We live in Dallas, just visiting for a few nights for business...

name: Maggie
about:
I am a very happy, healthy, positive and retired woman.  I also an extremely happy Nana and I have three wonderful grand children - so YES I am in heaven!!!!  Right now I am taking care of my daughter's beautiful Golden Retriever - her name is Lua and she is the most precious beautiful girl ever!!  She is a big part of our family and is very friendly.  Normally I allow dogs but while I am taking care of Lua - I am not accepting pets.  Sorry but this will change in October of this year.

I love to cook and share it with my family and friends so my "Outdoor Party Room" is used often and always a great time to be had by all!!!  I love all kinds of music and play it loud and often - of course will always respect my guests and their space!!  Always loved dancing but now I mostly do it in the privacy of my own home, which is just fine - it's good exercise.  

I live five short blocks to the fun & funky Alberta Arts District. There are many fun places to visit in Portland & this area is one of them - for sure - anything you may want for your child, your pet(s) or YOU!!  Lots of great restaurants, bars, shops, the best Ice Cream shop ever (Salt & Straw), galleries - you will love walking up & down this street & I'm sure make many stops along the way.

I absolutely love living in the Northwest but love to travel to the Southwest and do it as often as I can, at least once or twice a year. Now that I am retired one of my desires is to see more of what this beautiful country has to offer and hopefully I have many years to fulfill that dream and will definitely be using Airbnb to make my travels that much sweeter.  I'm a really friendly person and just like my father & most of my family - we love to chat and smile and live life to the fullest as life is way too short to be grouchy for too long.  ENJOY Today as it is a present and there isn't any guarantee we have tomorrow.  So I choose to be Happy!!! 

Hope you choose to share my space, have a chat, share a healthy smoothie & or coffee in the morning, share a glass of wine (or juice) and chat about beautiful Portland Oregon.

Cheers, Maggie

name: Mark
about:
Our kids have moved out of the house now so we have a couple of extra rooms in the heart of an exciting neighborhood. I'm a writer (on football, palindromes, Daoism, health and science) and standup comedian; my wife is a theater director currently getting her PhD. 

We enjoy conversation and are happy to offer advice, but have also stayed in houses (mostly B and Bs) where the host was a little too eager to talk, if you know what I mean. And we both have plenty to work on.

So we're aiming for that perfect balance, giving you all the privacy you want but available too.

name: Jess, Steve, And Clem
about:
This is actually a combined profile for my wife Jess and I.

I'm a computer engineer who quits my job every three years to travel around the world. Along the way I keep trying to write that elusive novel.

Jess is an artist who takes inspiration from her travels and daily life. She sometimes mixes cocktails to pay the rent.

We recently (July 2015) had a baby girl named Clementine!  She enjoys eating chopped up avocado and pointing at the cat.

name: Veronica
about:
Hello! My name is Veronica. My partner, Mike, and I live in beautiful Portland, Oregon. We love to hike, camp, and truly appreciate nature. The Pacific NW has so much to offer and we try to spend as much time as we can out in the woods. But we also love city life as well! Portland is such a fun place to explore, with great food, music, and culture. 

I work as a counselor, mainly providing therapy for children. Mike works as an engineer in the green energy sector. Both of us come from all over...Myself growing up in Germany and Florida, while Mike is from Missouri. All very different places which probably is telling of how we ended up in the Pacific NW!

We also really enjoy meeting new people! We use Airbnb regularly as guests, and are really excited to host folks. We hope you get to experience a bit of where we call home :)

name: Yvonne
about: I love to travel, especially where there is sun and warm water. Mother of three almost grown girls, love to garden or go to shows when I can find the time. Books, music, cycling, and the outdoors. Yum.

name: Leah
about: Friendly, older, nonsmoking professional, upbeat but a bit on the private side. When traveling, I try to avoid hotels, preferring to explore places by staying in residential neighborhoods and chatting with my hosts and neighbors. I've had wonderful experiences through airbnb, and hope I can match the graciousness of some lovely hosts. I'm a distance runner, and would appreciate your help finding good routes around your home. And for you runners, cyclists and cross-country skiiers out there: I've got guidebooks and tips galore for you, just ask. I like to try out new restaurants, especially neighborhood places that are not especially glamorous, but where the food is good. I'll recommend my favorites when you stay at my place, and I hope you'll share yours, too. Finally, I work a lot. So I may not be around much during your stay, and when I'm traveling it may be that I just hole up in the cosy space you've provided and focus on getting my stuff done.

name: Nick
about:
Im from Portland, but grew up down in Salinas, CA. I moved up to Oregon to escape the Hustle and Bustle of the Bay Area. As Portlandia would say, "I can here to retire". 

I love the outdoors, music, food, and beer. 

My style of hosting is: let you be if you want to do your own thing or bring you along for the ride if you want to see the city from the local perspective. I can also give you tons of recommendations on things to do, see and eat. 

Motto: I love the smell of radical self reliance in the morning.

name: Matt
about: I work as a designer for a remodeling company.  In my off time I love to hunt mushrooms and enjoy the amazing pacific northwest.  I've been training my dog, Boletus, to find truffles for a few years but he hasn't quite got the hang of it yet.  When I am at home I usually like to cook and watch a movie on Netflix or play music with my wife Emily.  She teaches 7th and 8th graders in the Art of Language.

name: Kalen
about:
Hello fellow travelers! I'm a long term Portland resident. I've lived in Oregon since 1984 and Portland since 1993 and have watched it morph from a sweet smaller city into a thriving metropolis. I started hosting about a year ago and have had a lot of fun with airbnb both as a host and as a guest.

My work as a naturopathic doctor & massage therapist keeps me very busy. I also love spending time with friends and loved ones, playing in the garden, playing music, yoga, hiking, traveling and cooking.

For my own travels, I love every thing from camping to Paris to Thailand. But having a home that feels like a sanctuary is the most important :-)

name: Margot
about:
Margot returned to her Portland roots in the Fall of 2009, after spending time in both Chicago & San Francisco.  With experience in marketing & events and a passion for travel and exploring, her entrepreneurial spirit opened Opal 28, an event space, accommodations and commercial kitchen.   Margot has a keen sense of customer service, knowledge about Portland's must sees, and a cheerful demeanor. You are guaranteed a comfortable experience when you stay at Opal 28.  
When Margot is not  perfecting her business plans she enjoys playing around town with her niece & nephew, heading to the mountain to ski and cozying up at a coffee shop to read the latest magazines.
Enjoy!

name: Mary-Margaret & Greg
about:
We moved to this house about three years ago but have lived in the neighborhood for about 14 years. We're both from Portland, Oregon originally and love sharing what we know about our hometown and neighborhood. 

We consider ourselves lucky to live in one of the most diverse neighborhoods in Portland, and strive to be strong LBGTQ allies. Between us, we have lived in San Francisco, Massachusetts and Ann Arbor, Michigan before happily returning home. Mary-Margaret is addicted to periodicals. Greg is addicted to baseball.

We've always loved hosting parties and houseguests, and Mary-Margaret has been a landlady for 14 years. We see AirBnB as the perfect way of combining these things. We want people to have a great time, and we love thinking of everything someone might want to be comfortable, but we also really respect your privacy and value your safety. We're both respectful, curious, and love to laugh - but not so loudly that it keeps you up at night. :)

name: Abby
about: I am a fun loving, free-spirit, who loves to play in the outdoors.  The Pacific NW is a great place for adventure and I love to call it home.

name: Amy
about: Aside from being an Airbnb (super)host, I am also an adventurous traveler -- sometimes with my school-aged daughter and husband in tow and sometimes solo! Favorite hobbies include hiking, xc skiing and scuba diving. An absolute avid reader, even the backs of shampoo bottles are not safe! Professionally, I'm a German-English translator and editor. Languages are one of my greatest passions. I consider myself to be honest and considerate and kind, and I always try to leave a light footprint.  I am grateful when my guests do their best to reciprocate.

name: Rachel
about: I am working professional who enjoys traveling all over the world. My house is a reflection of my journeys and international passions and interests. I enjoy all kinds of music and dance including Latin, MiddleEastern and Indian. I also love the nature and the outdoors and my home is filled with lush green plants and big windows that connect me to nature's beauty.

name: Marvin And Shaun
about: We are located in North Portland, near the MAX, which is our train line system, we are 1 block from a historical park, Peninsula.  It is the most beautiful park in the city, I think.  We are near a bike boulevard, dedicated to bicyclist.  We are 10 minutes on bike to downtown and have neighborhoods very close that are fun to walk or bike.  Mississippi district is one of them and Alberta is the other.  We have a great neighborhood and like to think of ourselves as open-minded, fun people.

name: Maha
about: Young professional traveling as much possible for work and leisure :)

name: Nick
about: Portland-Love to travel, the outdoors, great food and good people!

name: Stacey
about: This girl loves to have fun, hang out with really good people and do weird things in strange clothes—just doing my part!  Music is my main passion and right now I am the drummer and co-vocalist for a post-apocalyptic punk band with a strong drive to start another, more upbeat and danceable band where I sing my own lyrics.  Acting and art are also in my general area of likes!  For the last two years, I have played Maude in a Pedalpalooza version of The Big Lebowski—the whole audience rides bikes from one location to the next and we perform a couple scenes from the movie at each spot!  A novice painter, I have a studio in the basement and am learning how to combine colors and make marks.  Travel has played a big roll in my life—that’s why I love hosting travelers!  I have been all over the world and most recently spent a couple weeks in Jamaica—gorgeous.  My elderly and very sweet dog, Miss Abbey Zora Kuhn will most likely greet you with a song when you come home.  She is my best and most loyal friend—everyday with her is a blessing.  Sorry, hosting other dogs is more stress than she needs—at this point she is the queen and her quality of life dominates, as it should!  I believe in the Golden Rule: treat others as you would like to be treated!  That said, welcome to my home!

name: Brooke & Rudy
about: Brooke is a meditating, rock-climbing, chicken-raising Naturopathic Doctor. Rudy is a skiing, world traveling photographer and landscape designer. They like good food, good whiskey and kind folks. Together they can conquer the world.

name: Martin And Grace
about: We enjoy living in our Richmond neighborhood home in SE Portland, being very close to work, and within easy walking distance to much of the best and most popular shops, restaurants, parks, and amenities of Portland. We have lived in the Portland area for about 25 years (her) and 15 years, (him), respectively. She grew up in Los Angeles and San Francisco; he grew up in upstate South Carolina. We are professionals working full time. Grace speaks some Spanish. We enjoy relaxing with our friends and family and traveling. In particular: gardening, biking, yoga/jogging/gym, walking the neighborhood and area streets, home improvements, attending shows, the Portland Art Museum, camping, hiking in the Columbia Gorge area, eating out, having backyard barbecues and hanging out on the rear covered deck or around the fire pit, and summer and winter (skiing) outdoor activities. We love spending time at the Mt Hood/Columbia Gorge and Oregon Coast areas that are about 1 or 2 hours drive away, respectively. The Hawaiian islands, Ft Collins Colorado, and the Asheville NC area are our favorite long distance travel destinations.

name: Linda
about:
As a frequent traveler I know the amenities you are looking for, and this space provides them. I know and love Portland and am happy to help you find everything you need. As a designer for an iconic lifestyle retailer, my home is a reflection of my love for creating inviting spaces. Because Portland is a culinary adventure I eat most of my meals out and am happy to recommend restaurants. 

When I started as an airbnb host I could never have imagined the fun, and the friendships, that would come with this experience. I am delighted to have hosted some wonderful guests; those who visited Portland for a couple of days, and others who have stayed for over a month.

name: Jordan
about: Beaverton, Oregon, United States

name: Chris + Adria
about:
We live in Portland Oregon but love to travel and experience the wonder of this beautiful green world.

At home we enjoy Portland’s great food, art and music scene but we get out of town to hike, climb, surf, kayak and snowshoe whenever possible. If you are staying with us we would be happy to make suggestions on things to do and see both in the city or out.

We enjoy community and meeting new folks from around the world but we also understand that sometimes people need their own private space and time. We are always respectful both as hosts and as guests.

name: Eric
about:
Hi-I'm from Portland but have lived around the US in Boston, Phoenix, and San Diego.  Like to ski, go boating, bouldering, wine tasting. I've travelled a lot in Asia and a few times in Europe. My favorite destination is Thailand, but I'm happy with just a west coast road trip. I feel like I have a good balance in my life with friends, career and fun. 

Im a frequent user of AirBnB, and actually lived on a property that had an AirBnB'd room, so Im familiar and enjoy hosting. Im very easygoing, and am the only resident of my house. (there aren't any pets here either)

Excited about all the future AirBnB possibilities- I hope to meet even more cool people through hosting as well as being a guest.

name: Maggie
about: I live in Portland, OR with my husband, our dog, and our lovely cat. We love running, coffee, wine, family and friends.  I enjoy traveling to favorite spots around the country, and of course, exploring new areas! I grew up in Denver, so I love the outdoors and craft beer.

name: Nikolai And Evita
about:
We're a family with two new little girls and we love to share this fantastic city with fellow travelers. 

We both enjoy to riding around town by bicycle, waiting artisanal food and sampling local ales. We love cooking, the arts, reading and spending time outdoors.
 
Finally, we love traveling and meeting new and interesting people.

name: Serron & Rich
about: I am a naturopathic physician and acupuncturist and love people and plants.  I have a love of tending to our abundance of gardens with many medicinals and edibles.  My husband is also a naturopathic physician and professor.  He teaches and does research in natural medicine.  He is a woodworker in his spare time and has masterfully restored our 1912 Craftsman home.  We are foodies - frequenting the farmers market and cooking great tasting healthy food. We love the outdoors, traveling, music and DIG Southeast Portland in all that it offers in character and style.

name: Charles  And Maggie
about: We are avid travelers. We traveled to Norway, Costa Rica, England, Hawaii, Egypt, the Netherlands, Alaska, Israel, Jordan, Mexico and many towns and cities within the unites states. We stayed at different hotels and B&B's. Airbnb has made it possible for us to do what we truly love. We truly understand what travelers needs are and we enjoy being hospitable to others. We work in the health care industry but our hearts are in the hospitality industry. As hosts, we are friendly, helpful, and love sharing this amazing part of the world with you!

name: Philippe
about: Bay area native living in Portland. I'm a web developer who's passionate about backpacking, good food, and good drink.

name: Michele
about: Michele Miller and Robert Schlichting live and teach in Portland, Oregon.  Michele is an avid vegetable gardner and runs The Gardens Noise Preschool and Robert plays the cello and teaches physics at Cleveland High School. We have 2 daughters:  Marley plays the bluegrass fiddle and attends high school.  Taylor attends Colby College in Maine.  Our family loves to hike with our dog Cooper, garden,cross country ski, play music together, cook, backpack, and travel.  We love Portland… it's microbreweries, awesome restaurant scene, farmers markets, and book stores.  We also love how close it is to Mt. Hood and hiking trails in the Columbia River Gorge.  We respect your privacy but we are also available for any questions you may have.  We love this city and we can be a great resource for information about hiking trails nearby and places to see in and around Portland.

name: Ani
about: From Massachusetts, undergrad education in upstate New York, life education in Portland, Oregon. Creative in the creative sense of the word. A born producer. Race car driver. Your guide to Portland spots!

name: Jessica
about:
About me: I have a long history of being a "do-gooder" (aka I've worked in non-profits for quite some time).  I'm originally from Syracuse, NY and spent a decade living and loving Brooklyn.  I am pretty mellow but the east-coaster in me re-surfaces on occasion (which is a good thing!).  I love the water, adore the sunshine and appreciate it even more now that I live in Portland (absence makes the heart grow fonder, right?  And summers here are spectacular -- they almost make you forget about the drizzle.).  

About the other guy that lives here: My fiance, Ethan, is a chef and restauranteur.  He co-owns two restaurants in Portland:  Eat: An Oyster Bar in N Portland and The Parish located in the Pearl District.  He is a southern gentleman from Arkansas and he is obsessed with college football (Go Hogs!).

About us:  We are a laid back couple that enjoys life and loves to entertain.

name: Julie
about:
Hi there .  I really enjoy fancy drinks and organic food.  I work a lot so in my free time, I spend time doing aerial yoga, going to see live music,and planning adventures.  My job is RAD and gives me access to a plethora of outdoor activities- camping, skiing, hiking, kayaking and SUP yoga.  

These days I am keeping it simple/drama free/Fun

Just a little note about me. Oh yeah : I hope your day is great and I look forward to meeting you!!

name: Ruby
about: I am a massage therapist, artist, a mother, a gardner...i love to cook and chant and do yoga of the body and mind...i love Portland and all it offers! close to the sea and the mountains and a quaint feeling city. i feel lucky!

name: Tiffany
about:
I currently live in Portland, OR, with my partner Matheas though I'm originally from California and have lived in Western China, Beijing, and Vancouver, Canada and done some traveling on the North American continent, Asia and Europe. I love the experience of being in a new place and connecting with people who make their homes there.

I love cycling, trail running and being outdoors in general, and I also love being a respectful guest and host!

name: Amanda
about: The beach is my happy place. I enjoy the fun, peace, and relaxation it has to offer.

name: Gail
about: I am a 53-year-old self-employed real estate investor and property manager. My three children have grown up and moved away, so I have this beautiful 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom house all to myself. I lead a busy life of remodeling old houses and taking care of my clients' houses. I enjoy sharing meals with friends, running along the Wildwood Trail, and spending time with my mother, who lives nearby in Hillsboro. I also enjoy reading, movies, dining out, and listening to public radio. I have lived in Ohio, Texas, Minnesota, Rhode Island, San Francisco, New York City, North Carolina and 3 different neighborhoods in Portland. I have traveled to many European countries and to South Africa and Senegal. I enjoy hosting travelers who come to Portland for a variety of reasons.

name: Donna
about: I'm from Portland OR.  I am a dance teacher, performer, and choreographer. Lately I just want to travel.

name: Carrie
about: Based in Portland, Oregon, I'm a sustainability professional passionate about sustainable transportation, clean energy, social equity, outdoor adventures, photography, good food and the simple joys of life.

name: Allison
about: Native Oregonian who loves animals (special affinity for pugs), travel, running, yoga, cooking and inevitably eating, meeting people and learning their stories.

name: Kate
about:
I am a lawyer. I have two listings: a basement apartment in my 1927 tudor style home in Portland that I have owned over 20 years. I also have a 1926 utterly adorable vacation cottage just 90 minutes away at the coast in Seaside.  I enjoy hosting and helping to make a comfortable, fun and private environment for my guests at my Portland home's apartment and my cottage at the coast.  
I also own the Worldmark Timeshare so I often list opportunities at their prime locations. I have been a Worldmark owner since 2002.

name: Morgan
about:
Portland has been my home since 1993. Born and raised in Colorado, I lived in upstate NY and Maine before settling in the NW. I'm an avid hiker, skier, and outdoor lover. I volunteer with a number of local environmental organizations and work in advertising. 

If you're looking for recommendations for restaurants, bars, hikes, yoga or pilates studios I can provide you with more recommendations than you'll probably need!

name: Breanne
about:
My mantra: "I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list."
I prefer to travel through a city experiencing the fullness of its authentic culture. I've used airbnb many times and every experience has been uniquely awesome. Whether the hosts are an active part of my stay or a mere friendly phone call, it's become my favorite way to roam the world.

name: Jaynie
about:
My name is Jaynie Farnsworth and 5 things that I can't live without are as follows: music, international travel, being in the outdoors, chocolate, and community. My favorite countries that I have visited are Indonesia, Brazil, and Cuba. I absolutely love Afro/ Cuban music! I have traveled to 36 countries and most recently came back from Colombia. I am a professional swimmer and own a swim school and have a private acupressure healing practice. 

My life motto is follow the drum beat of your heart! My home is a healing sanctuary and perfect for someone who wants to be in a tranquil environment arm's length from the excitement of a city. I live with my partner Mark and we are happy to welcome people into our home.

name: Brianna
about:
Born and raised in Portland, love my hometown- but never thought I would still be here, I travel and love coming back to the beautiful Pacific Northwest! 
Raised by hippie artists, I am a lover of books, live music, sandy beaches, sunshine, camping, fashion, cat videos, hammocks and snarky comments. 
I have been working in HR for ten years and continue to do Stylist work on the side, Hair and Make-up Styling.

name: N A
about: Newly retired from education I am friendly, creative, helpful and have traveled enough to get a sense of what will help make a traveler comfortable. My style of travel has been researching to find out-of-the way places that require interactions with locals. Finding our way to an ancient fortress just outside of Istanbul was an incredible, memorable experience! I enjoy helping visitors to Portland also find out-of-the-way unique beautiful places, and have favorite eating spots to suggest. And because preparing your own meals with friends and family can be a special joy, you will find the refridge stocked with bacon and eggs, bagels, bread and butter for toast, orange juice, coffee and tea plus other things guests have left or "surprises" to try.  A NW kitchen is incomplete without a regional cookbook to peruse and try out!!

name: Maia
about: My partner Jake and I are Airbnb hosts and we love it.  We love anything outdoors from skiing, hiking, and swimming, to walking around parks and drinking coffee in the sunshine.  We love hosting people in our airbnb and are happy to be able to share our amazing home with Portland visitors.

name: Claire
about:
Hello!  My name's Claire and I am a payroll specialist originally from NW Washington.  I've lived in Portland for 3 years and love being so close to the oceans, the mountain, great music and the best food.  Life is sweet!

As a guest, I love exploring new places so am generally rather hands off.  I love going for runs around neighborhoods and am a foodie, so enjoy exploring new cuisine and funky restaurants.  I love good music, good people, art, and the outdoors so any recommendations are always enjoyed when visiting a new spot.

As a host, I am happy to be as involved or not involved in your stay in Portland as you would like. I can provide recommendations for food, local activities, and the best tourist spots if you are new to Portland.  My kitchen is your's so feel free to enjoy whatever you find, though I will generally leave the fridge empty except for condiments so you can have the run of it.  I want you to enjoy your stay as much as possible, so please don't hesitate to let me know how much you want me around or if you need any help or recommendations.

name: Anna
about: Lane and Anna are two friends living in SE Portland who love an array of the delights that Portland has to offer. We take great care of our house and would love to have you stay for a visit in our cozy abode!

name: Victoria
about: I am a retired school counselor. I live above the apartment you are renting so I am super available. I am pretty quiet. However, sometimes my cats race around and when that happens you may hear their paws! I love animals and kids, art and museums, making art, movies, friends and conversation.

name: Ali And David
about: We enjoy cooking, singing, hiking, bicycles, tabby cats, libraries and parlor guitars. We love meeting travelers and hearing their stories; can't wait to hear yours.

name: Jen
about: I'm a friendly, creative-type who is high energy. I enjoy singing, playing my ukulele, knitting, crochet, sewing, running, kettlebelling and hanging out with my friends over cocktails. I have a son who is 16 and a loving husband,  who both live with me, but I'm the one managing the Airbnb rooms.

name: Nancy
about: Greetings!  An Oregon native, I love outdoor pursuits, camping, fishing, skiing, hiking and jogging.  I can't live without my family, friends and my morning latte.  I am well traveled, mostly SE Asia where I lived for a few years in the mid 90s.

name: Erin
about: I like to ride my bicycle, spend time with friends, and read. I also like to get out of town, either for a hike or camping, a longer bike ride, or for sight-seeing. I love exploring new foods and learning about new and different ways of living.

name: Rosalee
about:
Hello,
I design baby clothing and also run a small online shop. I tend to read a lot and occupy my free time by cooking and then eating, writing, playing my bass and running (what better way to see Portland but running around in the cold, wet rain?)

name: Lee
about: I'm a children's book illustrator from Portland Oregon. You can view my work at (URL HIDDEN)

name: Michael
about:
Actor, host, professional corporate American, world traveller, Classical pianist, personal chef, Author.  I love to cook, give tips about the town I love and the only city in America in which I could live.  I love Portland and welcome you to share it with me! 

My Credo: Life is short so you had better make it fun.  

5 Things I cannot live without:
My Dog 
My Piano 
Acting 
Dark Chocolate 
Cooking

name: Joy
about: I founded the first craft beer bottle shop in Portland, Belmont Station, in 1997. I have two grown daughters who live nearby, and have had this house, which was built in 1900, for 25 years. I'm retired but keeping busy with family, friends, oil painting and drawing – and since June 2016, my new Airbnb. I would love to welcome you to Portland, Oregon - one of the most wonderful cities in America and definitely my favorite!

name: Ashley
about: I'm a Sr. Designer for Nike here in beautiful Portland, OR. I am a lifetime west coast girl, born in Vancouver, Canada.  I paint. I make. I love old houses, modern design, cycling, travel and fashion. I love this city and that you can walk to  all of its best restaurants, coffee shops, bars, bridges and boutique shops from here. It's beautiful, fun, and bustling.

name: Lena + Shey
about: Designer, Chef, Mom and wife.  I work for Nike full time and I am also a private chef and I throw underground dinners at my place and serve amazing food and amazing wine. Enjoy outdoors. Good music and good company is always a great plus. Love to dance. Enjoys life to fullest.

name: Amy
about: I am a small business owner living in Portland Oregon.  I enjoy traveling domestically and abroad.  I enjoy running, hanging out with my animals, trying new food and hanging out with my community of friends.  I also enjoy meeting new people and hearing about their lives and travel adventures.

name: Mark
about: Mark works for (URL HIDDEN) writes science fiction and herds chickens. Janell is a midwife and catches babies.

name: Debbie
about:
I work for a local hospital and have been there for the past 15 years.  My experience is  in Mental Health and Geriatrics.  I am a quilter and Long-Arm quilt for other quilters.   I am recovering from breast cancer and am feeling so much better!  My husband is the County Archivist and has a wealth of knowledge about the Portland area.  We have 7 children, 2 son-in-laws, and 1 grand-baby! 
We love to run to the beach and stay at our Beach Cottage, which is also listed with AirBNB,  Shepherd's Cottage in Gleneden Beach Oregon!

name: Donna
about: Love life in the Pacific Northwest and the great outdoors! Passionate about Portland and all it has to offer and enjoy meeting like-minded travelers.

name: Haben
about: My name is Haben but you can use my nickname "Habi". I am a 35 accountant professional who resides in Portland, OR.  I like to read, go to plays, try different restaurants, and travel. I work at an advertising agency called Wieden and Kennedy. I love my family, love my friends, love my profession, and love my job! I believe in living your life to the fullest, loving your hardest, and laughing till tears run on your face.

name: Sona (& Jeffrey)
about:
Hello! 
Since we'll be traveling as a family I want to introduce all of us!
We are a family of three. Jeffrey grew up in Portland and has family with businesses here. He has been doing nonprofit work including consumer & environmental protection, and is currently in a leadership role with a public health and safety advocacy organization. Sona was born and raised in Armenia - pretty much the other side of the world. She has a master’s degree in oriental studies, speaks multiple languages, and currently does marketing for an international company. We have a wonderful and adventurous five-year-old daughter, Zoë (in the profile picture), who loves swimming, biking, drawing, dancing and singing. We all really enjoy exploring new places & countries -- and meeting new people.

I LOVE fresh baked artisan bread, being outdoors, cooking different ethnic food (mostly vegan) and exploring the world!

I'm a gracious hostess (Armenians are known for their hospitality) and courteous and appreciative guest. Besides English  I also speak Armenian, Russian & Farsi.

Our lives these days have a strong orientation towards things our daughter will enjoy doing, and fortunately she has pretty broad interests.

name: Annie
about: I am a native to the NW. Extensive travel and I have lived and worked in Norway, Denmark and New York City. I have been here in Portland in the same hood for 20 years. Love to garden and entertain my friends with my cooking. Lifes feels good and complete. When we are able to schedule around school we love to travel and explore the outdoors.

name: Nancy
about: I'm a retired elementary school teacher with a strong, incurable traveling bug.  I've been a pleased and happy Aribnb guest so often that I've decided to become a host.  Happy travels!

name: Vacasa
about:
Vacasa is a vacation rental management company headquartered in Portland, OR. The team at Vacasa has made it our top priority to make the world of vacation rentals a simple, stress-free experience for both owners and guests. Vacasa offers professional rental management for more than 3,000 vacation homes in some of the most desirable vacation destinations in the U.S., as well as Central and South America. From laid-back beach cottages along the Oregon Coast to luxury ski chalets in Vail to tropical getaways in Belize, Vacasa offers just the right retreat for any guest.

In today's busy world, a vacation is a precious opportunity to relax and reconnect with loved ones. Spending that valuable time in a real live home can be especially rewarding, from cooking breakfast together each morning to relaxing by the fireplace every night. Our mission is simple: to make vacation rentals easy.

Vacasa offers the unique combination of professional management in privately-owned homes, making it possible for our guests to enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience without compromising on service and convenience. Our team of passionate hospitality professionals is the finest in the industry, with each Vacasa team member (from housekeepers to reservations agents to local managers) working hard to ensure that each home and every guest is well cared for.

Vacasa is also committed to giving back to the local communities where we manage vacation homes. Our community efforts range from providing academic scholarships for local students to sponsoring special events, and we're always looking for new ways to support the wonderful people and places that make our success possible.

Have a question about Vacasa or any of our vacation homes? Contact us today, or visit our FAQ page for more information!

name: James
about: James and Clarissa have lived in Portland since 1999. Clarissa is in education and James is a designer and they are originally from Texas. They have lived in North Portland for the last 4 years and have been hosting Airbnb guests for over a year.

name: Ryan
about:
As a profession, I am an educator. When I am not teaching, I am an outdoor and activity enthusiast. I love traveling, especially with great people, to great places, involving some form of outdoor athleticism.
I train for triathlons year round, along with skiing/snowboarding, mountain climbing/hiking/biking, river rafting, fishing in oceans and rivers, traveling and meeting new people, attempt to try every IPA that has ever been made, and most of all; live life to the fullest.

name: Carey
about: I’m into cycling for transportation, electric vehicles, solar power, reduce/reuse/recycling principles, and singing (a cappella, pop/rock, folk, bluegrass). I came to Portland for college, left for grad school in Aberdeen, Scotland and then San Diego, but couldn't wait to come back. I've enjoyed using Airbnb in Vina del Mar, Chile and Prague, Czech Republic where my daughters were studying abroad. My daughters are grown, and their cozy basement space is ready for guests.

name: Emma
about: My husband Mark and I have lived in Portland for 8 years now with our two girls ages 18 and 12 (and 1 dog, 2 cats).  A few years ago we moved into a wonderful large house in inner-SE Portland and completed major renovations to add a first level apartment for my mom to move in with us.  However, mom is fully embracing retirement by spending about 1/3 of the year down-under with my brother in Australia - so we have decided to make the space available in her absence to friendly travelers.

name: Susanne
about: Portland has been my "Home away from Home" for the past 24 years & will be for the remaining years ahead. I've traveled extensively throughout the world & can't think of a city as friendly, entertaining, environmentally conscious & visually beautiful as this one. I enjoy sharing what I love about Portland & Oregon.

name: Noel & Patrick
about:
We're from Portland, Oregon. I manage finances for an alternative school. I used to be a dancer and I still choreograph but as I move into my 40's I'm moving away from dance and back into the environment and society; I'm starting graduate school in the Fall! Patrick is a filmmaker and multimedia designer. We're both hoping to move to the country at some point, as long as we can stay close enough to Portland to remain part of the arts and design community.

There are so many things to love about Portland and the food and beer are two of our favorite qualities of this place.  Another is the general craftsmanship in all things Portland. There is so much love, detail and perfection applied to everything here, from locally farmed organic vegetables and pasture-raised meats to the design of furniture, clothing and interiors. We're proud to live here and call this place our home.

name: Suzanne
about:
Welcome to Portland!
I've lived here for about 4 years after living in San Diego, Colorado and abroad. I love Portland and the Pacific NW and I live here with my new baby and border/lab mix. We have a beautifully restored house originally built in 1926 in the South Tabor neighborhood. We are next to Mt. Tabor and close to many restaurants, bars, and coffee shops down Division and Hawthorne streets. I love the eclectic city of Portland and the proximity to the mountains, natural rivers, and lakes. I'm into photography, camping, hiking, biking, and eating out. I'm happy to provide any suggestions for eating out, getting outdoors, good photography spots, or anything else you're interested in to enjoy the most of your stay here.

name: Rhonda And Doug
about:
Rhonda is a residential designer, originally from Iowa. Doug is a freelance writer and hails from New York, NY. We both work from home.

Both of us landed here in Portland in the late 1980s, back when it was transitioning from a sleepy little logging town, so we've seen monumental changes, most of them pretty good. We're tuned into the restaurant and performing arts scenes, so we're happy to give our guests recommendations and advice.

name: Zac
about: Hi! My name is Zac, and I love creating relaxing, enjoyable experiences.  I've worked hard to renovate my home and design a great Air B&B experience. I look forward to meeting you soon!

name: Jessie
about:
I'm an engineer and work in the construction industry.  In my spare time, I teach salsa dancing, play volleyball & kickball, ski, bike, hike, etc etc.  I'm from Fairbanks, Alaska and love the pacific NW.

I travel often and have been to England, France, Colombia, Australia, Mexico, Hungary, Austria, Czech Republic, Costa Rica, Canada, and several Caribbean islands.  I've driven across the US several times and have been to most states.

name: Torrance
about: I am a chef, husband, father and backpacker.  With two young boys, we don't get into the backcountry as often as we would like. But, we do get to enjoy teaching the family about the Pacific NW.  Most weekends (in good weather), we will be in the backyard in the garden and with the BBQ.  Spring has hit Portland and everything is in bloom. Our fava beans are taller than our kids and strawberries are just starting to turn light pink. I love cycling around town. My wife will say I'm a bit of a SciFi geek.

name: Oliver
about: We are Oliver & Erin Olson.  Born and raised in Portland Oregon we love to explore all that this beautiful city has to offer.  When we aren't busy chasing after our 2 little girls you will find us out in the garden, cooking and thinking up new places to travel too.  Erin is an RN and Oliver runs a design build company.

name: Monique
about: From Portland, Oregon, early 30s, habitat restoration professional.

name: Kathie
about: I am a retired nurse midwife who is embarking on new adventures. My husband and I have been married for twenty five years and have raised three children, multiple animals and numerous other strays. We love our Sellwood neighborhood and hope to share a little piece of it with you.

name: Jooyoung
about:
I am an experienced host and traveler of many years. I am originally from Seoul Korea and lived and traveled many different cities and finally found a home here in Portland. I am all about setting a good intention and taking opportunities to explore. I travel frequently for work and fun and you are welcome to experience the amazing set up I have here in Portland. Just like many other areas, beautiful, neighborhood. I love coming home and you will too!  

I meditate, practice yoga, study process work, work as a design researcher, service designer, and UX researcher. I love tea, alone time in nature, and music and dancing.  I would especially love to international travelers!

name: Renee
about:
As a native Oregonian, I love helping others explore my city and region.  Need to know the best place to get a strong cup of coffee?  Closest place to get donuts? Nearby hiking trail?  Just ask, I'm happy to offer suggestions.
5 things I can't live without:
Coffee, first thing in the morning.
Back yard grilling or fire pit.
Friends to share a pint, a story and a laugh.
Walking my doggie Ursa.
Engaging my inner science geek.

Most recent trip: Honolulu, HI to visit family.  It's a great place to have a brother with a spare room!

name: Zachary
about:
I'm pretty easy going. I am well traveled and enjoy helping out fellow travelers. I have been to 20+ countries and enjoy sharing stories and experiences.

I enjoy watching movies and reading a good book. I am also a music fanatic. My favorite food is probably Thai food, but it's tough to decide.

My favorite place I've been out of the country so far is Finland. There's just a pleasant wildness about the place that I enjoyed. My favorite place within the country is, of course, Portland! The Northwest is a wonderful area to visit.

I believe in living life, so that when I pass on, I can look back on my life and have great memories and as little regret as possible. That's one of the reasons I've tried to travel so much.

I hope to provide people with a pleasant stay and an opportunity to get the most out of their visit to Portland.

Happy traveling!

name: Karin
about: We've been happily married for 25 years and have lived in Denver, CO and Portland, OR.  We love to cook and we love all the bounty that the Northwest has to offer.  After moving to the Sellwood area, we planted our first garden, bought a couple of bikes and enjoy life very much.  Our neighborhood and neighbors are absolutely AMAZING!  We feel very fortunate.  We both love to hike, travel and hang out with friends and meet new and interesting people.  In other words, we like to live our life.

name: Bethany
about: I am an entrepreneur and consultant always traveling around! I love the outdoors, being able to walk places, working out, and meeting new people!

name: Michael And Jodi
about:
Born and raised on a farm in northern Idaho, I met Jodi (a snappy city girl) in Seattle which was home for a few years before we headed out on a series of moves taking us throughout the Pacific Northwest: Alaska, Idaho and settling in Oregon in 2000. 

We enjoy camping and traveling with our three boys, taking in a good meal at home or in NoPo and hanging out with a great circle of friends. I am lucky enough to travel western Oregon extensively for work, so if your travels will take you elsewhere around the region and you're looking for that special spot, I am happy to help as needed.

name: Irina
about:
I believe life should be lived fully but responsibly. I love my husband and our wonderful little baby. I believe in Jesus and it defines me. I can't live without music, movies, crafts, salsa dancing, and chocolate. I am pro-organic food and local sustainable farming. I eat meat and desire all animals to be treated properly. My favorite place I've traveled to has been Paris, because of the art and patisseries on every block!

One of my favorite things is to snuggle into a bed of fresh linens. I've gone thru Europe using Airbnb and I understand how detrimental it is to stay with the right people when traveling.  I will do my utmost best to make sure your experience in Portland is phenomenal.

name: Chrissie And Su
about: From Portland OR- love a travel adventure!

name: Meg
about:
Oh hi!  

I like shiny objects, I find it cathartic to paint things gold, and I absolutely love Portland and this neighborhood.  It’s my mission to provide people in all stages of travel, transition, and transformation with a soft and friendly place to land in-between where you came from and where you’re going. For some, change, travel, and uncertainty are thrilling; for others it takes more courage. Either way, it helps to be surrounded by shiny objects, colored lights, and soft blankets.  I’ve created a grown-up playhouse for you – my vision of an idealized 1970’s childhood. This is a safe and private place where you can be yourself.

I try to create more than just a place to sleep and sit - there's a warmth and a silent light-hearted narrative in the spaces that I hope you will enjoy and appreciate.  And if you're at all interested in 50's - 70's vintage, this might be even more suited to your style.  

By day I'm a software engineer - specializing in Oracle ERP B2B and A2A XML integrations.  So if you wanna nerd out and talk about tech, yes!  If you wanna talk about rainbows and puppy dogs instead, yes!  

That's all for now I guess!

Bye!

Meg

(URL HIDDEN)

name: Katherine
about: I am a working professional and Portland native. I have a Master's degree in Education and currently help students enroll in programs at Harvard's Extension School. I usually work from home or nearby coffee shops, so I'm readily available when guests have questions or needs. I love to walk, explore the city and discover new restaurants with my lively and eclectic friends. I'm an avid reader and other favorite hobbies include writing, gardening, cooking and listening to music and podcasts. I love to meet new people and have a welcoming, laid-back hosting style.

name: Rita
about: A Portland Artist living with my Husband and seven year old son in beautiful NE Portland OR.

name: Melanie
about:
I am a New Zealand native who has made Portland her home for the past decade. I run my creative business from home and the Portland Saturday Market (one of Portland's largest attractions for locals and visitors). 
My passion for creating beautiful spaces is reflected in my henna parlor and the entire house in general- it made sense to be able to share it even more via Air BnB! 
My love for old Portland means that I know a lot of out-of-the-way places that I can point my visitors to- from private tea ceremonies and temple spaces, to the best bath houses and massage therapists in town. I am also tapped into some of the alternative events for those interested in Kirtan, sound healing and burning man style shows. 
If you are interested in receiving 5 star henna body art during your visit, you can easily make an appointment with me in the Parlor Mon-Fri.

name: Julia
about: An east coast transplant, I came to grad-school out West and couldn't bear leaving.  We moved to Portland from San Francisco in 2013 and love it here.

name: Kris
about:
We are from Portland, Oregon. We are a woodworker and a cook and we pour a lot of creativity into our home, our work and our adventures. Bren grew up in California and loves bouldering, backpacking and reading the New Yorker. Kris loves knitting, running, and misses her family in Bali, Indonesia.

Our motto is "Find what you love, love what you find"

name: Marie
about: Life lover!

name: Sarah
about:
Welcome to my home, the Woodlawn Neighborhood Guest House!

This is my 10th year hosting. I have set up my guest house according to what I look for when traveling: safe, clean, comfortable, and inexpensive. I don't like to blow my travel budget on hotels because I like to eat out and visit the attractions when traveling. Of course I want to have a comfortable place to rest and bathe, but I don't need the Ritz. 

I work as a private tour guide showing people around Portland. I love my city and am very knowledgeable about it. I spent 15 years as a spokesperson for the State of Oregon and City of Portland (including for three mayors). As my AirBnB guest I will be happy to answer questions and share information, directions, and tips with you.

I grew up in Hawaii on the island of Maui. I attended the University of Hawaii and American University in Washington, DC. I spent six years with the Peace Corps, and enjoy traveling and meeting people from around the world.

name: Debra
about: Hi I am a vegan and have cats and dogs

name: Will
about: Professional with a room to spare.  Excited to help share Portland with new people in a comfortable and welcoming home.  I enjoy the sense of community my neighborhood has and the ability to walk just about anywhere.  As a host, I'm happy to inform or help, and just as happy to stay out of the way and ensure privacy and serenity.  Totally flexible depending on the preference of the guest.

name: Anna
about: From Portland, Oregon originally, I spent a decade on the east coast, first in Maine first and later New York, before returning to my city.  I now live with my significant other, Kyle, and our two dogs, Samson and Finlay. I love exploring new cities and lead a fairly active life.  Some of my favorite activities include hiking, yoga, swimming, grabbing a cocktail with friends, and exploring new cuisines.

name: Cee
about:
I moved to Portland in 2010 from Bangkok, where I was living for 5 years. I'm originally from New York/Massachusetts. 

I'm an avid traveler. I've spent 6 years abroad and visited over 50 countries. I speak Thai (and can cook Thai food too!)

I'm a web developer and a computer geek. I have a wide variety of interests which include gardening, being outside, trying new things, technology, science, languages, and nature.

name: Meredith
about: I am a Foreign English teacher with a background in tv/reality/film/documentary. I am living back in Portland for the fall and when I don't have foreign English students staying with me, I enjoy meeting new travelers.  I will either offer you my entire home or share one room depending on your travel needs.

name: Rose
about:
I never saw myself as an "inn-keeper", but I LOVE hosting for Airbnb. We have had the most wonderful people from all over-- and I am honored to have them in my home. 

I am a life-long learner. I love to laugh. And, I love to dance. And, I love the Portland breweries, pubs, and coffee shops. If you love dance, music, food, or drink, I would certainly love to share my favorite places. Many are within walking distance.

name: Kirk
about: If I am not traveling for work, you can find me wrenching on my bike collection, playing with my 3 yr old daughter, or in the kitchen making another batch of Sgattie or Macaroni & cheese, or . .  at the playground.

name: Bruce
about: I am a local pediatrician with a nice house and great family. We have a basement apartment which was lived in by a family friend for years but she is gone it is ready for use by others!

name: Stephan / David
about: We both live in Portland, OR and travel often. We own our home (1908 Duplex) as well as an adjoining AIRBNB / vacation rental. We're very respectful guests and appreciate good accommodations. As AirBnB hosts, we strive to provide the same experience for our guests.

name: Marguerite
about: I am a Portland native who works in education and a mom to two wonderful kids. We enjoy hiking, playing board games, and sharing Sunday brunch with friends.

name: Benjamin
about:
I am a multidisciplinary film photographer, stylist and art director. 
-
Born overseas but pacific northwest grown. Red is my least favorite color. I have never broken a bone. I'm an introverted extrovert. I can make a mean grilled cheese.
-
ENFJ

name: Lily
about: I'm an acupuncturist, herbalist, and RN!

name: Katherine
about: I'm an adventure seeker who loves to travel, seek out new experiences and learn new things. Originally from California, I've made my home in Portland, OR, where I enjoy the incredible food, the city, the surrounding forests and trails, and the proximity to wine country!

name: Andrée
about:
I  love music, dancing, gardening, and eating yummy meals with friends....maybe not at the same time though. My sense of humor is slightly warped but I do enjoy making people laugh. 
I, too love to travel and have enjoyed being a tidy, respectful guest in Rome, Paris, Halifax, Vancouver, B.C., Oaxaca, Ghana, Johannesburg, Harare, and many U.S cities too! Hoping to see Cuba soon!
My Life Motto: As you Believe, you Perceive and eventually you Receive.
What I really enjoy about this platform is how it allows us to go beyond our barricades, whether it be actual walls or our cell phones, and return to the art of talking to people we didn't know before and befriending great people that we would have never met otherwise.

name: Taralyn
about: Hi I'm Taralyn, 30,  going to school for music and working full time. I'm friendly, responsible, I love to sing and play guitar, cast birth charts and do astrological readings for anyone who asks, see music, eat food, drink beer. I'm a great host and will make your stay as comfy as possible.

name: Peter Elizabeth
about: We enjoy traveling and have Grandkids in Portland that keep us coming back!

name: Mia
about:
I am a fashion designer and my husband is working at PSU. We are a couple with a 5 year old boy based in Portland Oregon and part time in the beautiful Catskill Mountains in NY. 

I love designing, crafting, enjoying nature, developing healthy food recipes.

name: Tom
about: I am a transplant from Tucson, AZ but have been in Portland long enough to call it home.  I work on a small vineyard south of the city, and spend weekends gardening and knocking about Portland.

name: Ada & Jim
about:
…think about new and creative ways to engage young people in science and engineering... that encourage young people to create, build, and invent — to be makers of things, not just consumers of things - B. Obama

Jim and I are midwestern transplants from Columbus, Ohio who love our adopted hometown of Portland and work in IT. We have an amazing daughter who brings love and laughter into our lives every day. She is 6 and would particularly love to have Spanish- or Slovak-speaking friends join us. We are a pet-free home, although we have the Portland-mandated chickens.

name: Emily
about:
Hi!
I reside in the beautiful pacific northwest and consider myself lucky to have such easy access to camping and hiking! I love our mountains, forests, and oceans! Portland is loads of fun, and you can frequently find me riding my bike, singing karaoke, dancing, volunteering at a local animal adoption agency, watching films and making arty crafty things. 
I am super reliable and respectful and would be honored to stay in your home!

name: Pasha
about:
Born Oregonian. Mother to a grown daughter who is out adventuring on her own now. I'm a photographer in Portland and work with a wide variety of people. I Love Yoga, Art, Dirt Biking, Kayaking, Paddle Boarding, Peddle Biking, Snowboarding, Camping, Hiking, Food, People, Dancing, Animals and Traveling.
As a host I am very available to answer questions and turn you on to all that Portland has to offer.

name: Scott
about: That's my partner and myself and our two kids. The oldest now lives in San Diego. We have lived in New York City then San Francisco and finally Portland, OR and love the city and love our neighborhood. We are both professional and very active (running, hiking, etc). If you are visiting Portland for the first time, try to fit in a visit to the Gorge. It's beautiful and only 30 minutes away.

name: Alex
about: Writer, yogi, runner, and cook from Portland, Oregon.

name: Phil
about: I work as a writer and filmmaker, and seem to not stay in one place too long.

name: Ashton
about: I am a visual display artist who has been living and working in Portland for the past year! I love to Host and am happy to give tips that will help you enjoy your stay and get the most out of this beautiful corner of the world.

name: Tree Marie
about:
My husband and I love to travel, when we aren't we treat our city as if we are on an adventure. We thrive on building relationships. So we are happy to open our home to travelers and also seek out Hosts in other countries!

Can't live with out: my Man, wine, good laughs, loved ones, water and a good book.

name: Jessica & Scott
about: Scott is a native Portlander and I am a originally from Texas.  We have a son who keeps us busy, but we always make room for getting to know new places & people.

name: Ed And Sari
about:
Ed was born in Eastern Europe, former Czechoslovakia. Defected in 1985 before "The WALL came DOWN". Lived in Austria for few months, immigrated to Vancouver, Canada just in time for EXPO86 and settled in Portland, Oregon in 1992. 
I am very social and always interested in people and their stories, pushing limits and try to live life to my fullest potential. "Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go."
I have visited many countries around the world and hitchhiked in Europe. Portland is home and I have lived in the same location for over 15 years with my wife Sari who is from Canada and is a counselor at and Open Adoption Agency. We have two daughters who go to the local schools and have lots of friends in the neighborhood. 
 It has been great in the last 20 years to be part of Portland's transformation to an awesome Best City and a Culinary Mecca.
Always had an Entrepreneurial Spirit, like Architecture, Real Estate, 80's music and love movies.

name: Peter
about:
Im an outgoing Oregon native (Oregonian:) who loves the outdoors.  
Ive traveled extensively and worked for 5 years as a tour guide all over N America.  
I lived on the road out of backpacks for years and so I know how things go jet setting all over the place.   
One thing you can expect when you decide to come visit the St Johns area of Portland is how convenient everything is.  Plus you can relax knowing that your Tour Guide host will have plenty of the details you'll want to know sorted out.  
Outdoors, Music, Nightlife, Food, Culture and Portland style Weirdness - We've got it all!
Feel free to contact me anytime in advance with questions about what going on, what is available to do, generally what to expect.

name: Janet
about:
I am a stylish urbanite who loves the comforts of my cozy, clean and inviting home, and it's proximity to all  of the many amenities Portland has to offer from beautiful tree lined neighborhoods, to lush parks, fabulous eateries, theater, dance, art galleries, world class shopping, bicycling the back roads of the Willamette Valley, west side wineries, close proximity to ocean beaches, mountain hikes and snow adventures. 

I'm a both a home body and world traveller having spent the better part of a summer renting my home to a woman visiting family in Portland while I sublet an apartment in the West Village of New York City. A few summers ago was spent studying Italian in Perugia Italy! I'm happily home for the duration with a companion: my Lhasa Aphso Charley... the sweetest, calmest (and no longer sight impaired) friend a girl could have!

name: Terri
about:
As a traveler, I've always enjoyed meeting locals who love to share the joys of their immediate area and their country. I'm flexible and would rather not be tied to a planned itinerary. I like to take advantage of the unexpected adventure and enjoy opportunities I didn't know existed. 

As a host, I look forward to getting to know people from around the world and sharing what I love about my home and Portland, Oregon.

name: Inge
about:
I love to travel. I grew up partly in Germany, and back in the day, we'd stay in Pensionen in Vienna. In China and Nepal, in Guatemala and Colombia, I have always most enjoyed staying with families. These days, my kids and I host foreign exchange students, but would love to give back to travelers of all sorts. 
Portland is a great town and we can point out our favorite haunts. Though very urban, we are also lots of small neighborhoods, and here, we know all the neighbors.  
We have been keeping bees and chickens and goats for more than 5 years now and we grow as much as we can within this little space. You will likely get to sample some of our cheeses, eggs and vegetables if you stay here.
My two children are both 14. They love children, animals, sports, travel, good food, and hearing about the world. If you want a pick up soccer or basketball challenge because you are sitting too much, they will be happy to oblige.
As a family we hike and bike and go to all sorts of games (mostly theirs). My son loves baking and my daughter loves eating his baked goods.
Apart from spending any and all time with my children, my animals and my plant friends, I love dancing tango, painting, hunting for mushrooms, sipping tea and learning languages. I also love my work, which is doctoring.

name: Ronda
about: Single mom of grown twin boys. I babysit a lot, and haven't had a job in 3 years due to auto accident. I can't use my left arm to it's fullest capacity, and I do my best to make ends meet. Airbnb is helping me with that. My favorite color is blue, my football team is the Cowboys, I listen to country music mostly, but enjoy some classic rock, and r&b. I'm a Harry Potter Fan, Star Wars fan, and I plan on traveling to see my brother in Ecuador. Since I've been through a lot in the last 3 years, my motto is, "You have to go through the hard times to appreciate the good times" .

name: Urban
about: My name is in fact Urban. AKA.. The host with the most.... Myself and my staff are here to make your stay perfect just ask... We can accommodate!

name: Bekka And Antoine
about: We are Bekka and Antoine and family. We love to cook, read, travel and create!

name: Sarah
about:
I love to meet people from all over the world and learn customs and traditions. Just last week, I met some Brazilian girls who told me that it is good luck to cut your hair on a full moon. I love learning things like that!
I like to do the sights and touristy things but also get some exercise and do what locals do. I am as happy having a 3 hour lunch with a family as I am on a tour with other tourists. 
Originally from Northern California, I now live in Portland, OR. Which I love.

I studied abroad in Chile in 2006 and taught English in Spain in 2010 before going back to nursing school.

I look for sun, good food, good drinks, and good people when traveling. :)

name: Holly
about: Matt and I are a fun-loving couple who work passionately to improve our energy systems and built environment in the Pacific NW for greater sustainability. Our house is home to 4 delightful, towheaded lads, half the time. We love reveling in Portland's food/drink/natural goodness almost as much as the sun, beaches and exotic destinations. Perhaps posting our home will help us sneak away more often :) I am adamant that one's surroundings should bring joy and a sense of peace. I hope you feel super at home in our house!

name: Dyche
about:
I'm a lifelong Pacifc Northwesterner and a have been local to Portland for the last 20 years, where I live above our rental with my lovely wife and our two cats. I am a self-employed artist and self-identified nerd. My interests include comics, animation, craft beer and gastronomy of all sorts. I am also an avid pedestrian, bicyclist, and skier, but am presently on the bench due to an injury. 
  I became interested in being a host after renting apartments abroad and having many enjoyable experiences. I love to settle down in a place and try it on for size with the locals, and I hope we can provide you with the Portland version of that experience.
  By the way, a little help with pronunciation, Dyche Alsaker is pronounced 'dike all-sack-ur".

name: Lee
about: Lives in Hood River OR.  Love the outdoors, tennis, hiking, yoga and surfing.

name: Ben
about: I love meeting new people and visiting new places. I run a small web development company and work from home. I love the freedom and room for creativity this offers me.  I love living in Portland, Oregon.

name: Christine
about: Nerdy musician and writer who loves her house and neighborhood!

name: Jessica
about: I love to travel, which is the main reason I decided to host! Being outdoors when it's nice out is a must whether it's to soak up the sun at the beach or go hiking on the local trails.  I also love to eat, so exploring new restaurants and cooking is something I really enjoy.  I also enjoy growing my own vegetables and fruit, going to the movies, and watching basketball games.  There really isn't anything I wouldn't try.

name: Sam
about:
A rare Portland native- I enjoy good food, summer nights and interesting conversations. 

Wherever you might find yourself, I probably have a good restaurant or bar recommendation in the area.

name: Kristen
about: Life gets sweeter with good company, good food and a good night's sleep. After living in Portland for 16 years, I still occasionally get chills when I drive across Portland's bridges and think how beautiful this place is and how I get to live here! I am learning Spanish so I delight to host Spanish speakers and I aim to travel to more places where I can practice.

name: Carie
about: I am a mediator/facilitator living in Portland, Oregon. I am on the tipping point between extrovert and introvert. Whether as a guest or host I like to stop and chat, get or give local advice and will hope to see you again... but on the other hand I am fairly self-sufficient as a guest and not particularly clingy as a host!

name: Matt
about:
I'm a lawyer turned furniture maker. I also drive a VW Van. It's just that they are practical. I'm not trying to look like I rolled off the set of Portlandia. 

I've had my house for 16 years. I've travelled to Europe and South America often over that time. Before that, I lived in Japan almost 3 years.

name: John
about:
I'm a health professional, interested in living a healthy, happy, long life.
At this point, i'm vegan, simple eating, but i love a place with a kitchen i can use. And the ideal place has a bathtub!
I also host my home in Portland, and have met some incredible people.
I currently am the CEO of the All About Health Network, an e-commerce business dedicated to promoting the benefits of massage and body rolling.
i was an avid rock climber until i realized it was beginning to jeopardize my dancing career (post modern). I teach yoga, yamuna body rolling, soul motion, all easy forms of moving your body and staying healthy.
I've taught everything from 6th grade Earth Science to College Health Science to Couples Massage.

name: Jingzi
about: I live in Portland with my husband and our daughter.  I'm a photographer, an avid traveler and tango dancer.

name: Franz And Teresa
about:
We are a retired couple, and we enjoy traveling. I was born and raised in Karlsruhe, Germany my wife was born and raised in Lima, Peru. Our family consists of multiple language speakers. Our kids are grown and moved so we have quite a lot of space. We hope to make this space as comfortable and accommodating as possible for our guests. 
Bienvenidos, Willkommen, Welcome,
Franz and Teresa

name: Kevin
about: Hello I'm a full time skydiving instructor and my girlfriend is a preschool teacher.   We would love to make your stay as comfortable as possibly either by helping you out with directions and ideas or just leaving you alone and letting you do your own thing.  Come stay with us!

name: Bella
about:
Hi. I am a long time property manager and landlord, and also now for many years, a short term rental owner and operator. Guests versus tenants have different needs, from the most obvious to the nuanced. Turns out, I love making spaces as useful and good looking as possible. 
My vacation rentals are like I like to have when I vacation, which isn't that often as I have two 3 year olds. In that case. I try to make my places as memorable, as if this is your only vacation for a long time!

name: Gary And Debra
about:
Deb and I are both from Brooklyn, NY.  She grew up in Long Island.  I grew up in Brooklyn and Westchester County, NY.  We met in college (in the computer center).  I know; "How romantic!".  :-)  But it was, really!  We just celebrated our 36th anniversary.  We have two grown kids and a lovely daughter-in-law.

We moved from the Boston area to Portland 20 years ago.  We love our neighborhood so much we're still in the same spot all these years later. Both of us worked for many years in high tech although we're both doing other things now.

We are long-time BMW motorcycle enthusiasts, we love the great Oregon outdoors, and have spent many vacations riding and camping all over Oregon, the Pacific Northwest, and beyond.  

Deb and I look forward to meeting new people and to our roles as Airbnb hosts.

name: Greg & Dwayne
about: We love to travel the world and meet new people.

name: Sam
about:
Friendly and likable guy with very good communication skills. I run a small tech startup for a career. I love traveling and the outdoors (fly fishing, snowboarding, golf) and enjoy eating out constantly. 

As a guest: I am super low maintenance, as long as your descriptions and accommodations are accurate there will never be any issue! 

As a host: I try to be as available as possible, but also respect peoples privacy. If you want to know something from me, just go ahead and ask!

name: Deborah & Martin
about:
I am a somatic therapist, specializing in biodynamic cranial therapy and the Rubenfeld Synergy Method. My husband, Martin, is retired and plays at writing fiction and finger-picking his guitars. We love living in Portland. 

In 2013 my husband and I spent a month traveling in Europe and stayed  with several AirBnB hosts. Each place we stayed in was unique and wonderful, as were the hosts. We came home excited to become hosts ourselves.

name: Kirby
about:
I'm originally from Portland, Maine and opted to see what Oregon's Portland had to offer in 2008.  After a 6 month trip around the US and Canada I landed in Portland, began an engineering career and haven't looked back.  The city is wonderful; it's my base camp for trail running in the Columbia River Gorge, mountain biking & skiing on Mt. Hood, road biking in wine country, and getting lost in the city's eclectic neighborhoods.  

My wanderings have taken me across the US of A, the eastern reaches of Canada, through Central America, and around Europe, yet, Portland and Oregon keep enticing me to bring my adventures back home.

name: Adam
about:
I'm an engineer and an artist and love the city of Portland.  I hike and backpack and can offer suggestions on places to go and things to do.  The food you'll find in this city is second to none so I recommend you try something new.

Let me know how I can help you have the perfect visit!  I know my location is new to this site, so please let me know how I can put your mind at ease with booking with a newbie.

name: Lisa
about: We are a family of four and have lived in this house since 2001 when we bought a real fixer-upper. We love to share our love of Oregon with visitors — especially its natural beauty and opportunities for outdoor exploration.

name: Riko
about:
Hi there !  Thanks for checking my profile.  My name is Riko and I am originally from Kyoto Japan.  Living in this loveliest town in Portland for 17 years.  I work for Portland' Regional Goverment called Metro.  I am a diversity practitioner working on equity issue through public contracting.  My passion are traveling, 4 legged animals and culinary .  I'm well travelled.  So, I know what travellers' needs are and I know Portland very well.  I can give you a ton of great recommendation about the city.  Thanks for reading this and look forwrad to meeting you all! 

はじめまして!フロンマイヤー理子と申します。京都出身でポートランドには1997年から住んでいます。
仕事はアメリカ政府関連の機関で公務員をしています。
ポートランドには精通しているのでどしどしおすすめ情報をお伝えしますね!
是非ポートランドっぽい生活をこのゲストハウスに滞在されて垣間見てください。
立地条件もとても便利ですよ~。

name: Jen
about: We are a small family of four that enjoys the outdoors, music, gardening, and exploring our beloved city of Portland. We recently acquired this long standing and well loved Air BnB property (though we are long time residents of Portland). We are excited to start this journey as hosts in our amazing city.

name: Cooper
about:
Hi, Cooper here. I am a 40+ year old professional guy who moved to Portland from Boston in 2008. I moved here for the same reasons most people do - access to the outdoors, great quality of life, it's clean and it's green.

Feel free to ask me anything and I look forward to hosting you.

name: Rhianna
about:
I am outgoing and goofy. 
I like to attend music events (especially indie rock but I love all types of music), hike, bike, brew beer, and am up for almost any adventure!

Things I can't live without:
Music
Water
Laughter
Baseball- Go Giants
A Good Cry

I am new to Airbnb as a host. I think it's going to be a great deal of fun. I am a very detailed oriented person so I thought of every big and little comfort. From soaps, great linens, frisbees, extra coolers, beach towels, to the stress relieving coloring books that are the talk of the town; I am determined to make my guests comfortable.
I am a very flexible and patient person and will be the same way as a host!. If guests want to interact, then I will make myself available for them- tell them all of the secret places to go etc etc. The other option is to take the hands-off approach. I don't mind either way, guests just need to let me know what they would prefer.

name: Dina
about:
I'm a creative professional and the mother of two fun-loving kids who has been living in Portland since 1995. After spending a decade in New York CIty, pursuing a film and video career, I was lured to this city by the natural beauty, lifestyle, arts & culture and the other like-minded folks who've made Portland their home. 

My time is spent juggling the joys and demands of work, my kids, my dog and good friends. I'm a creative and inquisitive soul who loves art and culture, outdoor adventure, good conversation and great friends. I adore this great city and look forward to sharing my intimate knowledge of Portland with airbnb travelers.

name: Tyler
about: Adventurous traveler who is always eager to explore and try new things. I live in Portland, Oregon and work as a Project Manager for a veterinary company, that requires extensive travel mainly throughout the U.S. Most of my free time consists of hiking, camping, biking or most other things that involve the outdoors. You will find that I am a quiet, clean, and respectful guest in your home.

name: Rupert And Scott
about:
We, Rupert Kinnard and Scott Stapley, have been the proud owners of The Kinley Manor Coach House since it's construction and official opening in June of 2006. Scott has a background as a mental health therapist and I, Rupert, am a writer/illustrator/cartoonist/graphic designer. I am also a Motown fanatic. I grew up in Chicago, IL and Scott hails from Redding, CA. 

During our years as guesthouse owners, Scott and I have enjoyed welcoming people from as close as down the street to people from as far away as Saudi Arabia and Australia. When asked is our place is a Bed & Breakfast Inn, we are fond of responding, "We provide you a bed but if you would like to offer us breakfast, we would consider it."

We are both avid film lovers, frequent live theater, truly enjoy living in Portland and are very active in our community. We absolutely honor all of our guests...especially all of our return visitors.

If we had a motto I would say that it would be: "We don't look at life as having ups and downs. We see it as a series of adventures and challenges."

name: Candace
about:
