Portland OR I am a designer/broker who enjoys architecture and NW food and wine!
Check out my blog- downsizemyspace Cheers!

name: Jules
about: I am a photographer who loves to travel!

name: Amy And Frank
about: We are a tiny (we’re only three inches tall!), modern (post-nuclear), 21st century family living in an big old turn of the century farm house. Amy has spent her adult life as a serial entrepreneur, starting more businesses than we care to bore you with. Frank studied architecture in New Orleans and has spent years in the design industry. Together, we are enthusiastically taking on this city farm project. Our little farm sits on a ½ acre close in to Portland’s downtown. We are living closer to our food source and building a stronger community. Here’s to building an awesome community and taking social deficits by storm….yay Airbnb!

name: Jeff And Katie
about: Jeff and Katie have lived in Portland for approximately twelve years, transplanted from Alaska and Chicago, respectively. Jeff works in Natural Resources, Katie as a Speech Pathologist, and Nina (three years old) and Leo (six months) as bringers of joy to the world. Our priority at home is to maximize outdoor living, so we are out in the yard and garden a lot.  Our priority as hosts is to respect your space and privacy.  We feel so lucky to be part of the AirBnB community and are always open to questions and feedback. We so hope you enjoy your stay with us!

name: Lora
about:
I love art. I love business. I love design. And bacon. I can never get enough bacon. When I was 21, I started a house cleaning and errand service and this is where my love for the hospitality industry started and grew. A set of fresh sheets, beautiful pops of color and all of the finishing touches can make or break a space. 

My goal is to travel more. There is so much to be seen in this world. I want to see the good, the bad and in that I hope to make the world a better place.

name: Ben And Kim
about: When we aren't enjoying our home in Portland we love to go to our little house on the Oregon coast. Ben is an artist and loves spending time in the studio painting, drawing and drinking pilsners from one of our local breweries. Kim loves to read, which is handy since there's a wonderful Powell's Bookstore a few blocks from their house. She's teaches writing at the local university and also is working on her second novel. She loves to cook from the vast garden they planted in the parking strip at their house. Together Ben and Kim put up a freezer full of heirloom tomatoes and pints of homemade fig jam every year.

name: Lisa
about:
I have lived in the Portland South Waterfront area for 12+ years.  I absolutely love that it's quiet and a simple walk away from so many things.  The neighborhood is quickly expanding with new shops and yummy restaurants with Under Armour moving in and the Tillicum bridge completion.   

I love and could not live without dogs in my life, wine, music, great food and great friends to share all of this with.  My backyard is a great place to spend time reading or relaxing after a long day, maybe even in a hammock - my wine glass sits on the bench next to my hammock - it's blissful!

I decided to be a host so others can enjoy my neighborhood - it's great to walk along the waterfront to the many festivals and a few more months of the amazing Veritable Quandary (VQ) before it closes in Sept 2016.  

If you like to hike, just walk out the door and explore the 4T trails of Portland's Marcum Hill or maybe a long hike up to Council Crest.  

Cycling is so much easier now that the Gibbs Street Bridge is complete and easy access to the waterfront / spring water corridor.  

Come explore Portland and relax in my home!

name: Kate
about: We are a family of four who love to travel and explore. Portland is an amazing place to live and visit. We moved here 20 years ago this spring and still feel completely smitten with the Pacific Northwest. Cheers!

name: Kate
about: Born and raised in upstate New York, I came to Portland in 1977 and a few years later moved to SW Washington where I raised my son. I happily gardened on my property there and hiked the backcountry of the National forests and parks of Washington. I recently moved back to Portland and into this beautiful historic home owned and remodeled by my son. At his suggestion I am now hosting Airbnb guests! I hope you will enjoy your stay here, relax and take in the creative energy of Portland and the artistic talent involved in preserving this historic home!

name: Christopher
about: I am a freelance  graphic designer & toy designer living in Portland for the last 4 years. In my free time I enjoy exploring with my friends, drinking good coffee, going to live shows, decorating my house and traveling. I love meeting new people and learning about new places and things to do, I'm always asking locals what to do in different areas.

name: Ben
about:
I am a 38 year old self employed musician / music teacher.  Father to one amazing 4 year old boy.  Avid outdoorsman, yogi, traveler.  Genuinely nice guy.

I'd be happy to help you get to know Portland.  Or I can just stay out of your way so you can find all this wonderful city has to offer on your own!

name: Jennifer
about:
I tutor children with dyslexia and my husband is a Salmon Biologist.  We have lived in Portland Oregon for over 10 years and love it.  We love to travel, and are big foodies.  I am a Nourishing Traditions follower, so there will be lots of bone broth on hand!  We roast our own coffee, make our own goat cheese grow our own hops and make our own beer. We have a fruited backyard and raise 2 chickens and a duck.  Oh, we also have 2 beautiful boys age 15 and 17.
Our motto is "Have no regrets!"

name: Emily
about: I live in the Alberta Arts district in Portland. I am a full-time mother, who is a social worker by training and hope to one day return to the world one day as a psychotherapist. My partner is a primary care physician. We have a little boy who is 3, a 6mo baby girl and a cat named Milo. Our family loves swimming, gardening, and dancing together... Our family couldn't live without music, smoothies, cuddles, or walks around the neighborhood. We love grilling (we grill all year, even in the rain) and riding our bikes (also all year round, even in the rain!). We moved to Portland from San Francisco, where we lived for the last decade, though we are both originally from the east coast.

name: Laura
about: I am an adventurous woman who loves to be outdoors and explore the world. Always planning my next trip abroad!

name: The Arias Clan
about:
The Arias Clan are farmers, artists, independent thinkers and dreamers. We are currently on sabbatical in Canada blowing glass, chasing wild horses and writing manifestos. Our Gnome helpers are happy to assist you while we are away and are only a phone call away!

We love cooking and gardening and run a small farm-school called Tierra Soul. We help global villagers who want to live more sustainable lives. We are also avid seekers and ceremony leaders.

We have other accommodations available, so if one is booked for your dates, contact us about our other options!

name: Ted
about: Ruth and I are both instructors at local community colleges.  We are declared foodies and happy to offer numerous suggestions on where to eat.  We make it out to the Gorge for some hiking at least a few times a year!  When we aren't catching up on our favorite shows we like reading fantasy/science fiction.  Our style of hosting is service oriented.  You are the customer we are here to serve to the best of our ability.  We like to provide the best customer service experience possible.

name: Kelly &
about: Kelly from Santa Barbara California and Lee from Plymouth England. Lee is a graphic designer and illustrator, Kelly partakes in many creative pursuits. We are a friendly, nice couple that enjoy traveling and adventure. After going back and forth from the US & England we are happy to now call Portland our home. We are an easy going pair who enjoy meeting new people from all parts of the world. When visiting a new place we enjoy finding those cool vibe, candle lit, refurbished feel coffee shops, wine & food spots, lighting is key! We are now happy to be able to share our space with cool folks from various parts, when we are off on our own adventure! "Our casa is su casa!"

name: Patrick
about: My family and I live in this beautiful East Moreland home. We enjoy exploring Portland and the nearby attractions of Mt. Hood, the Oregon coast, and hiking and biking areas along the way. Not only do we love cooking at home, but also exploring the amazing restaurants of Portland.

name: Stephanie
about: I am a big animal lover and work with animals for a living. I love going out to eat, drinking wine, and hanging out with friends. I love spending time at home and enjoy gardening, walking my dogs, and reading a good book. I enjoy meeting new people and sharing my knowledge of the city with others!

name: Happy & Erin
about:
Hello fellow travelers! We are a couple living life to its fullest in Portland, OR.  We are world travelers and excited to be hosting our newly renovated garden level apartment to fellow adventurers.  We respectively hail from Chicago, IL and Staunton, VA. We love traveling, hiking, gardening, snuggling on the couch while watching a good movie, wine, and going to see live music. We are also foodies who love to try new cuisine both by dining out and by cooking in our own kitchen.  We look forward to meeting new people both as hosts and guests! 
Cheers,
Happy & Erin

name: Stephanie
about:
Hello!  I'm a mom of a UO college student (Go Ducks!), an IT professional, and a yoga teacher!  I'm very excited to open an airbnb room and open my home to visitors to the beautiful Rose City.  I've lived in several states but love P-town.  Please feel free to ask me about the city and things to do.  

I work bankers hours so off evenings/weekends.  However, I'm fairly social, teach yoga, and volunteer.  So, I'm gone quite frequently but always a quick text/call away.  I'm a bit of a night owl but quiet time is from 11pm-7am.  

I do recycle and believe in conserving resources.  I'm moderately eco-friendly.  You will find biodegradable products more than not and a compost bin for food scraps. Nobody is perfect but I do try!

I hope you find my home welcoming and comfortable.  My cat Licorice will greet you and probably beg you to love on him.  I do keep the bedroom closed off so there is no cat dander in the room.  

Hope to see you soon!

name: Claire And Tom
about: I live in Oregon with my husband Tom and baby girl. We love to travel and have stayed in many Air BNB's around the world.

name: Kate
about:
I'm originally from the east coast and have lived in Portland for many years. Art is important to me. I greatly enjoy music and dancing.  
My most recent trips were to NY State and Florida where we stayed in several lovely airbnb homes. Last year I visited England and Northern Ireland and I look forward to returning there soon.

name: Andrew
about:
I'm a long-time radio producer of, and host for, news and public affairs content doing freelance work while aspiring to convince more organizations and businesses to incorporate audio into their marketing plans. Aside from that, I'm an avid organic gardener (vegetables, fruit and native 'ornamentals') who likes to scratch cook / bake, knit and read. I also currently work in a Head Start classroom in Portland Public Schools.

I've lived in Portland for almost 25 years and am happy to suggest destinations and navigation tips if you like. I have a bunch of printed local guide materials for you to use if desired in addition to the guidebook of my neighborhood that I've created in here.

name: Taylor
about:
Hey, I'm Taylor! 

I have numerous hobbies that I try to give enough time to, including music, climbing, snowboarding, home improvement projects, and coffee. I also own a software company, that consumes the remainder of time available :)

Thanks for reading!

name: Sandi
about: Outgoing and friendly.

name: Leopoldo
about: I am originally from Argentina and have lived in Mexico, Cyprus and Turkey. I love to take hikes in the forest to look for mushrooms, or walk on the wide beaches of the Oregon Coast any time of the year. My favorite past times include natural building, reading and gardening. I spend a lot of time with my son, playing or reading or building together.

name: Patricia
about:
61 year old Registered Nurse mother of four two girls and two boys.
Hobbies
Gardening
Running
Golf
I have a 16 year old Jack Russell who is almost blind and deaf but still has a great nose and tons of personality.
I can't live without Bikram Yoga it keeps me fit and my mind at peace.
I have belonged to United Church of Christ for past 30 years

name: Matt
about:
Hello! 

My name is Matt. I grew up in Massachusetts but moved to Portland in 2012 after graduating from college. I have been loving the Northwest since!

I am always seeking exciting new adventures and I love to travel! My other hobbies include enjoying nature, hiking, micro-brews, cooking, live music, and I'm a politics nerd. If traveling to a city, one of my favorite activities is to simply walk around and observe the different neighborhoods. When possible, my girlfriend and I love to bring our Corgi with us on our travels!

I have a lot of experience staying in hostels and Airbnb arrangements. I am a friendly, responsible, and respectful traveler. I spend most of my time out of the room exploring my destination.

That's me. I look forward to meeting you!

name: Sara
about: Give me fresh, local produce, a garden to sit in, a stack of books & magazines to peruse, a bottle of wine to share with friends, and a bonfire to sit around. Ah, perfection.

name: Indra & Ralph
about:
Ralph and Indra have lived in Southeast Portland for nearly twenty years.   We love the rivers, mountains, wild animals and people here in the Pacific Northwest.

We love the rain, because it means clean water for fish, for us and keeps Oregon green.  We love to paddle the rivers, ski and climb on our volcanoes, pick wild mushrooms and hike Old growth forests. We enjoy to travel and visit with our family and look forward to greeting visitors from around the world.

name: Brent
about: Father, traveller, student, on our way back to PDX..

name: Jocelyn
about:
I've been in Portland for 7+ years and love living and adventuring both locally and throughout the Pacific Northwest. I share my home with my fiance Danny, roommate Eric and fluffball feline Birdie. I love gardening and just finished a big re-landscaping project to turn our front yard into a native xeriscape environment. The fruit and veggie garden in the backyard is an ongoing project. I'm an active cyclist who loves to commute, mountain bike and bikepack - I can talk about bikes for hours. 

I enjoying hosting guests and look forward to making your visit to Portland a comfortable one!

name: Ari & Steph
about:
We are super laid back creative artists! We love traveling and music! 

We work in entertainment and run an entertainment company in Portland.

We have lived and traveled all over the world and love our Portland tribe...

name: Jillian
about:
Originally from Portland, Oregon (USA), I moved to Amsterdam a few months ago for a new job...and to explore all of Europe! My favorite thing to do is travel...and I especially like meeting "the locals" wherever I go. And now, I like to think of myself as a "local" here in Amsterdam...and I'm excited to share what I know about this city with you!  

My favorite activities are hiking, mountaineering, yoga, cycling, rock climbing, running, gardening, crafting, going to see live music, dining out, baking, and just hanging out with my friends. 

I've always dreamed of running a hostel or a B&B....but since I still like my "day job" of working for a fundraising event company, renting my apartment on Air B&B will have to do for now! I look forward to making my apartment your "home away from home" in Amsterdam!

name: Liz And Damon
about: We are a fun creative family with 2 children, a cat and three chickens.  We try to appreciate  the usefulness of things and the blossoming share economy.  We enjoy children and artists and encourage playfulness and adventure.

name: Katie
about: My husband and I are Portland natives. We love our home in Portland and traveling with our son! We enjoy spending time together in the outdoors, cooking and gardening.

name: Nick
about:
I've spent a number of years traveling for work and play, and have planted some roots in the wonderful city of Portland, OR.  I recently moved down to Corvallis, OR for an exciting new job opportunity, so have converted my Portland home into a space for travelers and guests.

I work in international education, so have had the opportunity to meet a lot of amazing people and see some pretty fantastic places along my journey (5 continents, 30+ countries). On the road, I pack light and require very low maintenance. At home, I strive to create a space that is comfortable and serene.  

I enjoy adventure and exploration, both in the city or out in the wilderness.  I thrive in almost any social environment, but also value those quiet moments of solitude that can be found on the road or at home.  

I look forward to sharing my home with fellow travelers looking for a comfortable and quiet space in Portland.

name: Elizabeth
about:
I live in Portland and am a midwife.  I love cooking and reading.  I have two grown children and live with my wife Maria in NE Portland.

I can't live without good food, close companions, dreams of travel, a comfy bed and good stories.

name: Kristen
about: I'm a wife, mother of two and psychiatric nurse living in Portland, Oregon. I love skiing, traveling, any activity outdoors and great food and wine.

name: Frank
about: Originally from Chicago, looking to explore the Northwest!

name: Esther
about: My husband and I  moved out to Portland about 10 years ago. Growing up on the east coat, we never dreamed of a beautiful place like Portland.  We love the calm feeling that you can experience in Oregon and we would love our guests to experience that as well.

name: Andrew
about: Originally from the scenic maritime community of Port Townsend, WA on the north coast of the Olympic Peninsula but I've lived in the keep it weird City of Portland, OR for over ten years now.  I'm into water sports, guitar, building stuff and my giant dog named Whale.

name: Jorge
about: I love my house and I'm looking forward to sharing it with you. I split my time between Mexico and Portland--love the beach and the mountains; Mezcal and Whiskey. Friends and Family.

name: Rimpal
about: Professional female.

name: Andrew
about:
Hi!  I love living in Portland, the city has changed so much since I moved here in 1994.  We spend a lot of time exploring the food scene, The Firehouse, Tamale Boy, and the Piedmont Foodcarts are our neighborhood favorites.  I play soccer on the weekends and work hard as an architect during the week.  I have 3 awesome kids, the oldest is away at college for the year.  I'm an avid bicyclist, a glam camper, and when able, I love to travel to warm, sunny, beach destinations. 
As your AirBnB host, you can expect privacy and trust.  Our home is a couple of blocks from the Woodlawn Saturday Farmers' market, Safeway, Walgreens, Starbucks, Woodlawn Movement and Healing Arts (yoga), The Oregon Public House, Peninsula Pool, Alberta Street, Woodlawn Park...this list goes on.  We love our City and our neighborhood, and we hope to give you the keys to our home and the keys to our city-
Let us know what your interests are and we'll be sure to provide resources and ideas to make your stay in Portland amazing.

name: Jean
about: Just living it up in Portland keeping it weird with a touch of class ;) On the serious note I am a pretty laid back type of person who is always interested in meeting friendly ppl and hear what brings them to our amazing city.

name: Kerry
about: My two daughters are in college and graduate school. It is too quiet here! Since I don't have much time to travel, I thought I'd bring travelers to me. I recently moved to this neighborhood after being in SW Portland. I love the restaurants, walking to New Seasons, riding my bike to work, and planting flowers and vegetables in the front yard.

name: Adam
about: I have lived in Portland since 1997.  A year later, I opened a recording studio called Type Foundry Recording which is still in full operation.  I've worked with such bands as M. Ward, REM, Decemberists, She & Him, Blind Pilot, and many more.  I'm very happy to recommend places to go during your stay in Portland.... Thank You!

name: Anna
about:
A little about me: I'm a 33 year old woman currently residing in Portland, Oregon. I have a true passion for all things vintage. I work for myself full time dealing vintage. I especially love refinishing old furniture (my therapy), big funky jewelry from the (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)'s (I have a getting-out-of-control personal collection of it), vintage pieces of original artwork (one of my flea market friends is convinced he sold me an original Worhal), any type of woven, colorful basket. (my current obsession), and anything Art Deco. I spend most days "treasure hunting" and sell my finds online, in a shop in Portland called Monticello,  and at local antique/vintage shows. One day soon- I hope to have a little vintage shop to call my own.
 In July 2014, a longterm tiny home owning dream of mine came to fruition when I purchased my current property, which came with a tiny cottage in the yard. I rent that out to longer stay travelers (30 days+), and when it has a few days open in between travelers, I invite my friends and family to come and stay in it. 

At this moment in time, my main focus is growing my businesses-Experimental Vintage,  and putting love into my almost 100 year old tiny house. I feel truly lucky to be able to do the things I love to earn a living! In my free time I enjoy meditation, photography, cooking and eating good food, drinking good wine, exercising, practicing yoga, and listening to live music. I have done some traveling- including a semester in Australia during my undergrad, a summer backpacking around Europe, as well as leisurely travel to parts of Indonesia and Costa Rica. I am hoping that a month in Thailand will be my next big adventure. I like to explore various hobbies and have dabbled in darkroom photography, jewelry smithing, furniture reupholstering, and other creative ventures.

name: Daniel
about: I work as an academic software developer at Reed College. I like many of the good things that people are known to like: books, music, food, mountains, swimming. I enjoy meeting people but know when to stop asking questions.

name: Brenda & Dave
about: For us, the outdoors of the Pacific Northwest is without comparison when it comes to recreation. We enjoy hiking, mountaineering, cycling, snow sports, white water rafting, and so much more in nature's playground.

name: Suzanne
about: 53 (really 39) year old female, married to the talented and funny Derek Cummings.  We have an amazing 12 year old son, Sutter and a feisty poodle mix named Luna.  Derek and I are the directors of *I**AM YOGA, Portland's premier home for traditional hot yoga.  Come on in and take a free class during your stay!  Both Derek and I love music, travel with purpose, fabulous food and being outdoors.  Hands down favorite book is Geek Love by Katherine Dunn.

name: Michelle
about: I like to run, camp, hike and spend time with family and friends.

name: Ed
about:
Hello, 
My name is Ed. Along with my wife and son we have lived in the Richmond/Division neighborhood for the past 17 years. My wife and I are native Oregonians and we love living in Portland! 
We also love to travel..
Europe, Asia, Central America, U.S., Canada... We have enjoyed staying in many Airbnb's around the world. I just retired and can now fully dedicate my time to raising our son, running my coffee roasting business, hosting our guest house, cycling...  If you have questions or would like any recommendations while your here, don't hesitate to ask. And by the way my son speaks Japanese in case you are traveling from Japan. Enjoy exploring Portland and the picturesque surrounding area!

name: Ian
about:
I was born and grew up in Portland, and then left it for school and my 20s. When I returned, I found my little hometown had blossomed. I love living here and all the city has to offer--especially the abundance of good coffee, good beer, and bookstores.  

I’ve enjoyed restoring and living in this little bungalow for about 7 years now. I’ve put a lot of work and love into it (though there are still many projects on the list). I'm excited to share its charm with guests.

I am making the room available because I believe that opening my home to strangers opens my world. I started hosting last summer and so far have met many wonderful people. I am deepening my appreciation of the concept: "A stranger is a friend you haven't met yet."

I am inspired to put the funds earned from hosting into travel so that I can stay with other airbnb hosts in places I’ve never been able to see.

name: Lindsay & Josh
about:
We were both born and raised in Hawaii, where we met and were married in 2003. We moved to Portland in 2008. Yes, on purpose. We love the cool weather, great food, friendliness, quirkiness, authenticity and how people pursue their passions.

Lindsay is a former architect with a background in hotel design. She currently channels her creative energy into dancing, crafting, chalkboard menu creation, hand-painted signage, retail window displays, furniture rehab and now creating a fun place for you to stay. Lindsay works part-time as an admin assistant at a local church and will be the primary innkeeper for you.

Josh works as a wine rep and at an Italian food cart. He also co-owns a web design and photography company. In addition, he is a sound engineer and loves music. Josh is the man behind PDXploration (Instagram), an exploration of all things fun, cool, unique, and delicious in and around Portland. 

We both love to travel. Our travel style is like jazz, enough structure so we can improvise along the way. We also love our amazing dog Madison, good food (cooking and eating), authentic relationships, board games, Game of Thrones, Joss Whedon, Christopher Nolan, David Fincher, Pixar, The Walking Dead, Top Chef, The Amazing Race, Jesus and so much more.

name: Teresa
about:
Just a learner…
A Jill of most trades…master of few! Passionate about the environment and being/living outdoors and have created this space to reflect that vision! I love to host and am intent on respecting the privacy offered to my guests during their stay.  Some of my passions/pursuits/pastimes include: World championship dragon boat paddler, surfer, native Oregonian/PNW, mama of curly-haired children, former back country, raft and sea kayak guide, permaculture garden designer, foodie and reignited gardener, ecotherapist, washtub bass player and singer,  world traveler, archer, floraphiliac, and chicken lover…to name a few. And, above all…humor and sarcasm are the language of my people!

name: Megan
about: I am originally from Portland, but lived in California for 8 years. I recently moved back to Portland and bought my first house. I love to travel, particularly internationally. As a teacher, I take full advantage of my summers to travel. When I visit a new place, I love to really engage in the culture of the location and do things the locals do.

name: Amy
about: I am a mom of 2, wife of 1, and Founder and CEO of the only parental leave consultancy in the country. And I LOVE houses. I especially love finding the oldest, most dilapidated, neglected diamonds in the rough and fixing them up with the help of my hubby, brother (best carpenter/contractor ever!), and a crew of brilliant artisans. Mostly I just work and work, hug my people, and try to find time to sleep. I also spend a lot of time thinking about how lucky I am to have all of the support I have to chase my many (and often conflicting) dreams. My husband and I have been landlords for a long time, but this is our first airbnb hosting. He said to me recently, "Do you remember 24 years ago when you got back from Europe and said you wanted to run a youth hostel?" and I said "No" (because thank god his memory is better than mine) so he said, "Well, I feel like this is finally making that dream come true." And he was right. So, apparently I have been waiting 24 years to welcome YOU! Very exciting!

name: Anna
about: I am a registered dietitian managing the employee wellness program at Oregon Health Sciences University. I live with my fiance and our adorable boxer dog, Doug.

name: Eecole
about:
I am a foodie and farmers market fan, massage therapist and nutritionist. I love to dance and sing, share amazingly delicious and healthy food and play with friends as often as possible. I also work hard and LOVE my job helping hospitals increase their purchases of local and consciously grown food.  

I have an abundant garden that I look forward to sharing with you! And, i'm kind of an ambassador of Portland. I LOVE this city and happy to share my favorite spots with you.

name: Nate
about:
We like to read, watch movies, play games, eat food, make music, & have adventures. We love traveling and have been all over the world.  

We've hosted people from all 7 continents (yes, all SEVEN). 

My girlfriend Sarah & I are excited to welcome you into our home!

name: Ivy
about:
My husband and I are both native Oregonians. I have a background in Training & Development before becoming an independent consultant and real estate investor. We now own 2 rental properties in Oregon and have enjoyed expanding into travel and hospitality real estate. James works in public utility service at Portland General Electric.

We enjoy mountain biking, running, hiking, urban gardening and all the joys of being in the beautiful Pacific Northwest and we know you will too!

name: Beth
about:
Hi Airbnb's,

My name is Beth, and I am an Interior Designer who was born and raised in Oregon, and my husband Sook, is an Advertising Producer who was born in Laos, and raised in Oregon.  We are College sweethearts and have been together now for 16 years!  We have a passion for movies, art/design, animals, and traveling to learn about cultures and experience new foods.  So far, we have been to multiple parts of the world including: Most regions of North America, Europe, and Asia.  And, we are always looking forward to planning our next trips!

name: Linda
about:
I am from Phoenix, Arizona. I own niche magazines for the manufacturing industry. 

I love animals, swimming, taking walks, and cooking.

name: Lota
about:
We are from Portland, Oregon. We like to travel, ride bicycles, cook and eat great food, explore and meet new people.

We own a bicycle tour company, Pedal Bike Tours. We and our guides have a ball showing people around our fantastic city and we have free bike rental at our shop for our airbnb guests.

name: Melissa
about: My husband, Kevin, and I are typical Portland people who like to get out and travel with our young son.  Kevin's an elementary school teacher and I work as a software tester.  I'm an avid skateboarder and my husband and I like to play poker when we are on vacation, especially since we met in a bar poker league years ago.

name: Juliet
about:
I have lived in Northwest Portland since 1984.  I know the area, the city and the transit system thoroughly.  I love Portland's pedestrian and bike access, parks and political climate.  My hobbies are hiking, cycling, reading and neighborhood activism.

I enjoy being an airbnb host.  I will give you complete privacy while you're here, unless you need something from me.

name: Ronald
about: I am an electrical engineer and entrepreneur who owns his own consulting business and has recently moved to Portland with my partner Paul and we own a restored victorian home in the historic Mississippi District.  I have extensively traveled the world and stayed in home swaps, upscale resorts, timeshares, personal rentals worldwide.

name: James
about:
To say I'm fond of traveling, is to put it mildly, as I've had a wealth of chance encounters and spontaneous explorations to fill a lifetime. As a host I'm thrilled to get to return the favor, and provide guests and opportunity to explore a little piece of Portland.

I'm curious at heart, so if you would like to get to know me, please don't be shy. I'm always interested in other people's experiences and perspectives from another side of the world.

Some things I like: All things design, horticulture, history, architecture, fine art, ceramics, food, cooking, philosophy, conversation, mindfulness, music, comedy, traveling, fly fishing, adventure, and most importantly....laughter.

name: Brian
about: We are empty nesters of three kids and have lived in Portland since 1995.  I work in commercial real estate and my wife is in visual design and event planning.  When in Portland, we love to hangout in the city, enjoy Portland restaurants and live music, bike on the waterfront, hike in the Gorge, and explore Mt. Hood or the Oregon Coast.

name: Carol
about: We love the outdoors and also enjoy our back yard. We love to swim, then warm up around the fire pit or jump in the jaccuzzi. We also enjoy heading out to the beautiful mountains and beach since they are so close.

name: Shane
about:
I love living in Portland. I get to ride my bike around town most days or work on house or yard projects. I usually do a range of sports during the week depending on the time of year--including basketball, soccer, ultimate frisbee, running and cycling. 
However, my biggest sports passions are rock climbing and slacklining. I've been climbing for over 20 years and have put up many new climbing routes around Portland over the years. Depending on the time of year, I will have a slackline set up in the backyard. If you've never tried it, it's unlike any other balance sport...basically a single line trampoline that feels impossible at first, but is actually quite manageable after a bit of practice.
I like gardening and have spent the last five years or so transplanting and cultivating trees, shrubs and sedums at the house. There are all sorts of perennial edibles here--cherry, plum, persimmon, fig, currant, blueberry, huckleberry, gogi berry, strawberry, pear, grape, asparagus, kiwi and raspberry.
I lived in Bolivia for a couple of years while I was in the Peace Corps and have traveled to about 30 countries. I like being an adventure traveler and enjoy hosting other travelers and visitors as well. 
I bought this house back in 2006 and it was practically unlivable. Then once I decided to replace all the plumbing, it was unlivable for about 3 months. doh! But that was years ago. These days, I continue to work on smallish projects around the house, whether it's shuffling around my bamboo planters, planning a new raised garden bed, building a shed out of recycled materials or adding a utility sink to the laundry room (on the list!).

name: Bryan And Jessica
about:
We are a hardworking, yet easy going husband and wife team.  We have put a lot of work into a few old houses and are excited to see how well Airbnb has gone for our place in NE!

We hope to delight our guests with great local recommendations (we love this city!) and a clean and comfortable home all to yourselves.  

Our Bright and Modern Cabin is a three bedroom, two bath with tons of skylights and windows, insulation, and coziness, complete with the best restaurants in town within walking distance.

We encourage you to play in the garden - plant, harvest, weed ... don't miss the fall, we will have tomatoes, beans, peas, squash ... !!

We look forward to meeting you and welcome your feedback and ideas!  

We look forward to utilizing Airbnb for all our travels!! What a great service!

Cheers ~

Jessica & Bryan

name: Jennifer
about: I was born and raised in Rose City! I have lived in the Pacific Northwest my entire life. I love the people and the food too much to leave. I am using Airbnb more, as I have seen my son (please see profile photo) use it all over the world! I love the whole concept of new experiences, you can't get anywhere else.

name: Elise
about: I am a die hard foodie. Also very athletic and like to be outdoors playing sports or hiking. If I didn't have to work I'd travel all the time!

name: Amy
about:
I am an artist/designer in Portland. Along with my husband, Marshall, we love sharing our space with others who enjoy traveling, and the sharing community. We enjoy meeting people and exchanging stories, often over a cup of coffee, tea or a glass of wine. 

We are active and try to spend a lot of time enjoying the outdoors. Hiking, biking, and running are choice outdoor activities. I am also very interested in photography, art, and design - it is my profession after all. And my favorite indoor activity involves cooking and eating. I love to share my creations, so pop in the kitchen and say hello!

name: Ryan And Meagan
about:
We have lived in this neighborhood for eight years, and we have watched Williams St. and the neighborhood go through big changes in that time. We are proud of our house and our neighborhood and want to share them with others. We live our lives in a small radius, and have close personal relationships with many people who live and work in the area. Experience the small town feel of our big city!
Ryan is an independent woodworker and luthier, and Meagan is a clothing and interior designer and a bookeeper. Come stay with us!

name: Oceana
about:
PLEASE NOTE:



We love living in Portland! This is a great city with more greenspace and good food, coffee and beer than just about anywhere in the world. Our goal is to offer a beautiful little home away from home in order for you to be able to experience this great city. We love to garden, hike, and ride our vintage tandem Schwinn all over North Portland.

name: Lasse And Jillian
about: Jillian and I are fun-loving, active types with a love of good food and drink.

name: Tom
about:
Hi, I'm Tom.
I've lived in Portland all of my life, and although I love to travel, it's always wonderful to be back in the Pacific Northwest.

Some of my hobbies are event photography, dancing, hiking, and sharing a heartfelt conversation over dinner with good friends.

name: Christy
about: I am an artist of all sorts...I make a living Tattooing at a licensed shop in Portland oregon..ive been doing that for 6 years now..before that I was a Drug and Alchohol Case worker at a local non profit. When I had my little girl...i decided to leave the 9-5...work less and do more of what I love....spending time with my kid...gardening and making art! I own this house and live in it with my kid and my boyfriend and cat.

name: Emilio
about: I am originally from New York City.  I moved out to Portland, OR just over 6 years ago after going to grad school.  Five things I love about Portland: 1 - The fresh produce--it makes it easy to eat healthy; 2 - The temperate weather--rarely is it ever extremely hot or cold like New York; 3 - The close proximity of the mountains, beach, city--it's easy to find something to do outdoors; 4 - The beauty of it--it has numerous little neighborhoods and communities, plenty of parks, restaurants, pubs, etc.; 5 - The space--it's nowhere near as crowded as New York. You can walk around most places without dodging people or bumping shoulders consistently.

name: Matthew
about: I love food and cycling, music and the outdoors, and travel and fun. I've lived in Portland long enough to remember when it wasn't cool, and will probably live here well past when ceases to be.

name: Adam
about: We love living in Portland and traveling the northwest. But maybe the one thing we like more than traveling is hearing other peoples' stories about their travels. Cheers!

name: Elaine
about: I live in Portland, OR with my husband and two sons.  I am very athletic, love to cook, travel and meet new people.

name: Benjamin And Kristi
about:
Ben reads lots of magazines, drinks coffee every day, sometimes rides an old moped, wears his hair messy before work then uses some sort of a clay to tame it and get professional, acts like his front porch is a stoop in New Orleans, and gets to work with teenagers in the margins.

Kristi laughs a lot, styles peoples' hairs, loves throwback onion dip, is still looking for the perfect pair of overalls, used to be your flight attendant, has a dad who really lost his thumb in a bull-roping accident and won't let you sip from a beverage without an authentic-eye-contact "cheers".

It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance!

name: Jon & Kassandra
about: Originally from a small town in Missouri, we first moved to Portland together in 2002 and are happy to call this beautiful city our home. We love gardening and exploring the Northwest. Whether hiking, camping or soaking in the natural hot spring pools, we try to spend as much time in nature as we possibly can.

name: Spencer And Erika
about:
Hello! We are a husband and wife team who very much enjoy making our home available to people visiting Portland. We love to travel and love nothing more than staying with a great Airbnb host. We like the way it makes you feel right at home in a new location.  Plus, it is a really fun way to meet new people.

We have been quite a few places, such as Mexico, Costa Rica, Colombia, Spain, France, Switzerland, Sweden, Hungary, Croatia, Belgium, Germany and of course Canada. 
 
Living in Portland, we love all types of food, and great local beer.  Spencer likes IPA's, and I love Sour Beers.  We also both love live music, and enjoy going to festivals such as Music Fest NW in the Fall, and Bumbershoot in Seattle.

We enjoy being around positive, fun people, and simply doing the things that makes us happy :-)

name: Elizabeth
about: I live in Portland and work for a tech startup. I'm married with 2 kiddos. when I travel by myself (which is super rare), I like to enjoy the place - walk around, sip coffee and  eat good food.

name: Claudia
about: I am an artist and designer by trade. I design print and pattern and love to do crafts like macrame and jewelry.  I am also mom to a super sweet boisterous 3 year old boy. I enjoy working on my house, gardening and decorating for maximum comfort and enjoyment!

name: Anjali
about:
I have such a great time  hosting people from all over the world. It's like traveling while staying at home! 

 What's important to me as a host  is that people get the most out of their stay here.  Having lived here quite awhile, I am a font of info in a wide array of interests.   

I love it when people feel at-home, playful and relaxed.  And to see it in action, what more could a host want?  For example, a guest wrote in chalk on the sidewalk in front of the house a little road map to my house and pointed to house "Paradise"   How fun is that? 

As a nano-bio,I am an artist, performer, RN-PhD, investor, entrepreneur, published author, host.  mother, and GRAND mother.   I love life and love creative expression. 

Currently, my focus is upon multi-month leases,  though short term stays are also graciously invited!  

My property, "Mississippi Fun District", is great place to be in Portland  with eats, treats and beats right around the corner. Home is secluded, yet in the middle of it all.  Easy to zip around town via walk, bike, bus, light-rail, car.

My rentals are in a duplex, therefore in same building. Same address.  When I am not traveling, I spend much of my time in the sunroom attached to the back end of the house  and in the art studio at the back end of the property. 

My raised beds grow food year around.  I am part of collective that share crops. 50% of produce is shared with volunteers and a local Soup Kitchen. You may meet volunteer gardeners and pick up some gardening tips for your own garden!

I look forward to your stay here for your future travel plans to Portland!

Enjoy!
Anjali.LeBoeuf

name: Rebecca & Kevin
about: We're a newly married couple that has been basking together in Portland for more than 10 years. Rebecca is a native Portlander who works in the non-profit arts sector. She can provide endless recommendations for happy hour spots, art viewing, and navigating local mass transit. Kevin is a painter and media artist. You can count on him for conversation about politics, punk rock and getting around Portland by bike.

name: Courtney
about: I am excited to share my home with good people! I am a teacher and love to travel and have new experiences.   I enjoy hiking, biking, running and exploring.  I love listening to music and drinking coffee on the deck.  I love a good lass of wine!

name: Tom & Crystal
about: Tom and Crystal were both professional musicians in their previous lives but now work in the helping professions.  We love people, reading books, art (high, low, Avant, and outside), philosophy, and learning about the experiences and cultures of the world.

name: Annalisa
about:
We are a young family with some space to spare!

Our household is quite busy these days (Read- you may not see much of us) with two young children and two dogs.  When we're not working, we try to get outside to show our kiddos (all four of them)  the splendor of life in Oregon!  We enjoy hiking, biking, and just generally walking around and stopping to play in parks (many near our house).  

In our life before kids- Brandon and I traveled around the globe on the cheap.  So while we are on hiatus from far off travels, we would love to host people from far off lands, and live a little vicariously.  We know we'll be back to it before long and would like to grab some hosting Karma while we can!

name: Michael
about:
My family and I live in SW Portland, and we love it here because of the city's appreciation for nature and knowledge. We frequently visit libraries, museums, and natural areas across the city and beyond. 

I studied the history of science in school, and now I love being a stay-at-home dad. I do what I can to get my kids outside and connected to nature as much as possible, and love encouraging other parents to do so. I blog about this at Exploring Portland's Natural Areas.

My wife, Catherine is a librarian, a gardener and a gleaner. She speaks Spanish. Mi esposa habla español. Our book-loving son is in elementary school, and our daughter is a happy and very active toddler.

When you stay with us, we'll be happy to share our favorite natural areas to explore and things to do in Portland and our nearby neighborhoods.

name: Scott & Cliff
about: We just got the kids off to college and we’re ready to host visitors to this great city. We love to eat and drink all over Portland, hike, play tennis and hang out with good friends. We've traveled a lot over the years and we look forward to having guests in our beautiful home.

name: Rebecca
about: I'm a nurse in Portland, OR.  I love having Portland as a home-base, it's a wonderful city.  My husband and I are humanitarians at heart, so we find ourselves traveling nationally and internationally quite a bit.  We also enjoy hosting, as we've been hosted by so many and had such wonderful experiences.  Happy traveling folks!

name: Tommy & Courtney
about: We're a young couple living in the city and welcoming guests into our condo. We live nearby, so please don't hesitate to reach out for recommendations as you look to enjoy beautiful Portland. We're adventurous, outdoor enthusiasts who also enjoy fun nights on the town as well. We've equipped our condo with every amenity we could think of to ensure you feel at home while away, so we hope you enjoy your time on the water!

name: Megan
about:
Midwestern transplants from Michigan via Chicago that love meeting new people and sharing the great city of Portland. Everything from living on a bike biway, spotting the occasional Portlandia filming, fantastic food and drinks, this place will not disappoint. 
We love kids, dogs, riding our bikes (of course, this is Portland after all), walking to restaurants and cheering on the Timbers. 

My life motto: Be a fountailn, not a drain!

name: Yonatan
about: Long time resident of Portland, OR. Nice, responsible person

name: Wendi
about: I moved to Portland 20 years ago and I've completely fallen in love with the city and all it's fun quirks - but that doesn't keep me from exploring new places and meeting new people every chance I get. My favorite cities (so far) include Buenos Aires and Barcelona. Most interesting adventures include Chitwan Jungle (Nepal), Jomson (Nepal), sailboat/swim in caves (Spain), kayaking Zaton Bay Croatia. Vacation time is best when it's spent with my family and incredible friends, both new and old.

name: Mel And Ry
about:
Ryan and I are awesome. Can I say that? No, we truly are. Most people like him a bit more than me, but only because he can drink more than I can and says things like "Let's get AWESOME!" and "Who's having SHOTS WITH ME!?". 

While we used to host in rooms in our houses, we now are able to offer four full houses - one in San Francisco, two in Portland, and one in our favorite Southern city, New Orleans - for your traveling pleasure. We take great liberties to make sure our homes are more comfortable than any hotel will ever be, focusing on Temperpedic beds, fully-stocked kitchens, local artwork, outdoor areas and fluffy bath linens. We have been doing this for a while now, and have a grip on what our guests are looking for: luxury while still being local. Our reviews speak for themselves - read them and feel confident in your decision to stay with us!  

Cheers, 

Mel and Ryan

OUR LISTINGS: 

Hip Mission Flat in San Francisco:
https://airbnb.com/rooms/1030352?s=8 

Atomic Ranch in Portland:
https://airbnb.com/rooms/2552957?s=8  

Pop Art PDX in Portland:
https://airbnb.com/rooms/4137047?s=8.

name: Delona
about: Portland OR Arist -- Writer -- Musician

name: Jodi
about: A native to the Pacific Northwest, I have a deep love for the great outdoors and adventures. I have called Portland home for 13 years and every time I describe Portland to people from somewhere else I fall in love with this city all over again.  I enjoy the simple pleasures we have here like a great cup of coffee or an urban hike along the waterfront. I enjoy helping find the gems that Portland has to offer for visitors!

name: Sandi
about:
Hi, I'm excited about being an AirBNB host!  I like providing a comfortable respite from the road, and I definitely enjoy meeting people from all over.  I live across from a beautiful neighborhood park that has tennis courts just steps away, and provides a serene setting, yet is close to all the great activities in neighborhoods downtown, in Mississippi, Alberta Arts, and Piedmont, to name a few.  The house is half of a duplex.  It is a 1500sf unit with 3 bedrms, 2.5 baths, hardwood floors in the "great room" which is one big room including fully loaded kitchen, living room, and dining room.  People love the openness of the main floor.  French doors to small front yard provide an open, friendly area for morning coffee or regrouping over wine in the evening.  Other amenities include laundry room, full service refrigerator, and ample street parking.  Conveniently located just a half block to bus, 6 blocks to light rail, I-5, and New Seasons whole foods store, 10 minutes to downtown (unless you want to take the bike trail, which makes it more like 20 minutes).  

I am a writer and singer, and I have a lot in common with artistic types, but love to get to know all types of people.  I'm definitely open and somewhat savvy about the world, though haven't traveled much (that's about to change, thanks to AirBNB!).  Come enjoy a weekend, a week, or a month in the hidden Arbor Lodge neighborhood.  I live here because it's close to everything, and yet feels like I'm in the country.  A second park is only a block away, and the University of Portland and Adidas campus are just a few blocks away, along the bluffs overlooking downtown .  I can help you get to know our completely amazing jewel of a city!  My life mission is to "make a difference."  This is my hosting style too.  Welcome.

Sandi

name: Valarie & Steve
about: We are recently retired educators who love to travel, entertain, hear live music and enjoy the lovely city where we live.  We love to meet new people and embrace the local culture when we travel.  Life is good!

name: Heather
about:
I have enjoyed using AirBnB so much when traveling and want to return the experience and have travelers enjoy the comfort of staying in a warm and welcoming home instead of a hotel. 

I love adventure and spend most of my free time ice climbing, mountaineering, and shimmying up rock. I recently started learning to surf and have discovered that wet suits actually keep you warm! I also love international travel and have been exploring the world through climbing and yoga over the past several years. 

I have decorated my home with art, photos, and crafts from my travels and from the local community. Every piece has a story. I hope to share the joy these things bring me along with their beauty and uniqueness with my guests.

Please make yourself at home.

name: Becky
about: Come stay in our lovely 1911 Arts and Crafts home! We love restoring old things and making them new again. To share this historic home with guests is what it's all about. We look forward to meeting you!

name: Evermore
about:
We love hosting!  Our Guesthouse opened in 2011 and are excited to now partner with Airbnb.  I am a life-long traveler and always have appreciated finding kind and happy people wherever I go, and I know from first hand experience that hospitality can be the difference between a so-so experience and a wonderful one. 

When I opened the Evermore Guesthouse it was a dream to get to provide a unique, comfortable space for others visiting Southeast Portland, and I modeled it after all the best aspects of my experiences along the way.  Hosting is our passion we really want you to have the best visit possible.

During the 1990's I lived in a ski town in Colorado and worked in hotels and vacation rentals while living the life of a snowboarder.  I don't get to the mountain quite as much anymore - these days as an urbanite I play soccer and bicycle - but I found my calling in innkeeping.  When I first moved to Portland I worked my way through college as a host at a traveler's hostel, and after graduating I ended up managing it for 6 years.  Now my wife, staff and I run 2 guesthouses in the Division / Clinton Neighborhood, and I hope you have a chance to stay with us!

~ Chris

name: Scott
about: I am a musician and teacher.  I live in Portland, Ore but I love to travel.

name: Norbert
about:
I am a full time engineer that understands that there is more to life than work. I lived in New Orleans for a couple of years but have since moved back to Portland, which has been my home for over 25 years. I live with my born-and-raised Oregonian girlfriend, Kate, whom helps with managing this B&B and is mainly responsible for all of the awesome landscaping you will see surrounding the house.

I was born in Transylvania (located in modern-day Romania) and moved to the states when I was six years old with my parents and older brother. I speak Hungarian fluently and often daydream about moving back to the small villages of Berete & Nagyfalu.

We keep busy improving my home as well as finding the nearest mountain peaks to summit.

name: Kathleen Diane
about: I am a public health nurse.  My husband, Bill, has been in the field of affordable housing construction most of his adult life.  We love music, serving dinner to friends and just being part of a diverse community.

name: Sionainn
about: Portland has been our chosen home since 2007 and I love showing it off to friends and family. After living in San Francisco, Boston and New York, I love the intimacy of our smaller city. It is a city and offers plenty of options (within and outside of the city limits) but it's small enough to wrap your arms around. And lots of great options are just a walk away from here. I'm happy to give recommendations if you need help planning your adventure. I'm especially familiar with some great options if children are in tow. My travel now includes kids and they are great travelers. We can make an escapade out of our trips on public transit and all of the stops in between.  And it's pronounced "Shannon"....just looks funky with the Gaelic spelling.

name: Anna
about:
Michigan-native but now rooted in Portland. For work, I design community engagement strategies and solutions to help people connect to the relationships most crucial for their organizations. For play, I hike, bike, run, and generally stay active and outside. 

I look forward to hosting you after being hosted in many amazing places across the globe!

name: Spencer
about: Software engineer, foodie and fly fisherman from Portland, OR.

name: Marion
Sarah
about: Willie and Sarah Gore...the carpenter and the gardener.  We are your hosts!  We have lived in the Concordia neighborhood for 15 years. Sarah is a native Oregonian and Willie has been here for over 25 years, originally from Arizona.  We are world travelers but love coming home to our beautiful NW home. Willie is the man behind the construction of both our home and new cottage.  Sarah is the gardener and interior planner for both abodes.  We love working together to create unique indoor and outdoor spaces for ourselves and Air B&B guests.  Sarah enjoys cooking and currently works part time as a private chef.  She enjoys baking so be prepared to sample some delicious fares!  The garden provides many seasonal fruits and berries that she uses in her baked goods.  Both Willie and Sarah enjoy outdoor activities; walking, hiking, biking the neighborhood and golf.  Sarah is an avid reader and is happy to share her books.  Both know the the NW well and can recommend many sights to visit and good places to eat and drink.  We look forward to hosting you soon!

name: Kara
about: I live in Portland, Oregon and work as a designer for a letterpress greeting card company and print shop. I love food and treasure hunting in second-hand stores. I often scour for mid-century items and gifts for friends. For exercise I jog year round and cross country ski in the winter.

name: Jennifer
about: My Husband, Mike, and I bought our duplex in 2003 in the lovely Brooklyn neighborhood in Southeast Portland. After moving into the upstairs unit, we then began living in the downstairs. We're both quiet and gracious hosts, seeking to replicate the charm that our neighborhood brings to our lives. We're always happy to give advice on the best spots to eat, nearby hikes, upcoming concerts, and places to get out of the rain! As we don't mind the rain as it keeps our space green and clean.

name: Louis, Stephanie, And Braylon
about: We have been married for 5 years and have an awesome 5 year old little boy. We have been living in Portland for 1.5 years. We have a pleasantly plump french bulldog named Patchouli, who might I add is a couch potato. Weekends are usually reserved for family time, and catching up on sleep.

name: Jennifer
about:
I am a young at heart lady who has travelled the world and now call Portland home. When I travel I like to go off the beaten path and connect with the locals. Throughout my travels, I was fortunate to meet kind, friendly folks who showed me around, and in some cases invited me to stay in their homes. These experiences provided a connection like no other and created lasting memories. As a fellow traveller and host, I hope to offer you a comfortable place to lay your head, and an opportunity to really connect with Portland and all it has to offer. I am foodie, love live music, wine and the outdoors. Ask for a recommendation and I'll give you many! 
I hope to provide a clean, comfortable place to stay with as much or as little interaction as you want.

name: Jeremy
about: My name is Jeremy Fershleiser, I studied painting and relocated from the northeastern portion of the United States in 1999. I quickly came to call Portland home. I live in inner NE Portland, and am a single dad to two young children, Vaeya and Iraja. As a local resident, I  encourage you to feel free to ask me for ideas or tips during your stay. I can’t promise that I'll always have a suggestion, but I do know a great deal about the city, and would be happy to share what I know with you.

name: Stay Alfred
about:
Stay Alfred was created based on the idea of offering short term rentals at an unbelievable price while making the booking process easy and problem free. Stay Alfred acquires properties in high-end buildings and condominiums in the best locations to ensure your stay is satisfying and you want to come back. Since we value your return business, we always offer discounts to those who stay in any of our units time after time. We want you to feel at home when you stay with us and that’s why you will always be greeted with a professionally cleaned unit and quality furnishings. We welcome feedback in any kind of way to ensure we are meeting the needs of everyone!

best,
Jordan Allen
Owner

We cater to:

Urban Vacations
Family Travel
Corporate Housing
Extended stay In Denver, Seattle, and Portland
Insurance and Job Relocation
Events and Weddings 
Military Training and PCS
Government Workers
Pet Friendly Vacationers

name: Vicky
about: I am fairly new to Portland and enjoy being near my children.  The city has many things to offer in the performing and visual arts along with  outdoor and sports activities.  It is nice to take advantage of this unique environment and I do!  I will be delighted to share my newly acquired knowledge in Portland.

name: Laurie
about:
At home, I enjoy gardening, reading and playing with my two cats. As I work a busy job, I balance out with enjoying nature, here in the Pacific NW. My motto is to live life with zest and gratitude.  

 As a hostess, I look forward to meeting many new people from different parts of the world. I welcome the opportunity of learning from each of my guests. 

As a guest, I feel the same way when I travel as when I host. I enjoy learning about different cultures and building my language skills, as I speak Spanish fluently, and hope to learn more languages.

name: Jeff
about:
I am 31.  I've lived abroad in Spain, and now in Portland, OR.  I grew up in Colorado, and love to travel all over the world.  I really enjoy new experiences, and have had great luck with AirBnB in both the US and abroad all over the world.

I am a very responsible traveler, I like AirBnB because it is more real, and you can get great recommendations for local hot spots, it's been a very fun way to travel.

name: Shelly
about: We are native Portlanders who love our city!

name: Ashley And Benjamin
about:
We grew up on the Oregon Coast and truly love the Pacific Northwest! 
We've lived in several different places, including Japan, Italy, and (kind of random) El Paso, Texas. Japan and Italy were amazing, and Texas, too hot. Our hearts belongs here, where trees grow tall, and the grass grows green! 

We want you to enjoy your stay and come to love this place as much as I do. If you wish, We can point you in the direction of many fun places and must have experiences during your stay in Portland. 

Ashley is currently teaching full time as a middle school special education teacher and Benjamin works for the Army here in Portland. 

We greatly enjoy dining out, catching a movie, traveling, or just relaxing with some Netflix.

As hosts we strive for relaxed professionalism :-).  We do our best to provide our guests with a completely self-sufficient unit that they can enjoy as they explore our wonderful city.  We are happy to interact and get to know our guests or allow them their space and privacy, we let you decide what level of interaction you are comfortable with.

Our motto is: By improving oneself you improve ones community. :-)

name: Katie
about: Portland coffee shop owner with a heart for travel!

name: The Society Hotel
about:
Inspired by their amazing experience as AirBnB hosts at home, our owners Jessie and Jonathan, along with friends Matt and Gabe, took the plunge to create an AirBnB-themed hotel!  The result is The Society Hotel, an unique boutique hotel with hostel component that has been serving adventurous travelers since 1881!   

We are a group of travelers, having collectively been to the corners of the world, and we wanted to share our love for exploration and our adopted hometown of Portland, Oregon.  Come stay with us in our historic sailor's lodge and we'll help you have an authentic Portland Experience!

name: Tracy
about: We have lived in our neighborhood for 10 years.  Talk to me about our neighborhood, native plants, birds, mount hood, hiking trails, waterfalls, game of thrones, star trek: next gen.

name: David
about: I have recently relocated to Portland from Maui and love living in the city and especially the Hawthorne neighborhood. I enjoy biking, walking, music and the rich art community and events available in Portland. I work as a renewable energy and energy efficiency consultant to business and industry in the Pacific Northwest.

name: Adrienne
about:
I moved to Portland 10 years ago from Wash DC/Maryland area...worked and
retired from United Airlines.  My two grown childen live in Portland and Seattle and we wanted to be around our grandchildren early on, which is why we moved.
I love Bruce Springsteen, NPR,  movies, the beach and my grandchildren!
My favorite vacation spots are Rehoboth Beach De, Pacific City Or and Mexico, in the Yucatan....

name: Marissa And Scotty
about: Scotty is a lifelong Oregonian and Marissa has called Portland home for well over a decade.  We love this city for its amazing restaurants, art, music, unique movie theaters and proximity to some of the country's most beautiful places.  Travel is a passion of ours and right now we are focused on exploring Latin America.  Staying in locals' homes when traveling is always a treat and we are so happy to share the home we built with fellow travelers.

name: Logan
about:
5 Things I Can't Do Without (in no particular order): Great Food, Well Made Movies, Travel to Exotic Places, My Sons and A Healthy Dose of Exercise. 

I've been to my fair share of places around the world and am always looking for more travel. I've been to Korea, Sweden, Germany, Italy, France and England and Scotland. At some point, South Africa is a must do along with New Zealand.

name: Fonda & Dan
about:
We're so glad you've decided to visit the beautiful Pacific Northwest! Originally from California, my husband Dan and I have both lived in Portland for 5 1/2 and 10 years, respectively. Our dog, Zedd, is a spry little 3 year-old Frenchie whom we cannot live without. We recently purchased our first home---a charming, quaint bungalow built in 1925---in the Montavilla (say it with your best Spanish accent:) neighborhood. 

Dan works for a local aerospace engineering company. He enjoys strumming the guitar, cooking bomb-ass meals, drinking a smooth glass of whiskey, and sitting by the side of a campfire. 

As for myself, I recently established a nonprofit organization to support girls' secondary education in rural India. I love travelling, especially if it's to a sunny beach, gardening and getting dirty, and eating an endless amount of sweets. Oh, and I know all the local hot spots for karaoke, just sayin'.

Oh, and how could I forget Zedd. He's a burst of energy that will forever change your life. He is the epitome of "the life of the party" and seeks to entertain. Though he may seem exaggerated in his persona, he can be quiet and calm after getting used to a visitor. As his parents we have no problem with our guests and friends giving him a firm command. But never fear, he is full of kisses! 

With our powers united we become a stellar force that is relentless! But we're also pretty chill and like to kick back. 

We hope you decide that our spot is the place for you!

name: Garett
about: Originally from Utah. But I've called Portland, OR home since the late 90's. I dig back country skiing, fresh snow, mountain/cross biking, live music and sharing good food. I also play a ton of music up and down the west coast with my two bands pigWar (psychadelic soul) and The Great Salt Licks (folk roots)...

name: Danielle And Joel
about: Transplanted from the Midwest, we're eager to share our portion of Portland with you. We're just a couple art school nerds who get geeky over data and grammar during the workday. Otherwise, we spend our time thinking about sports, old houses, and social/environmental responsibility. We like brunch, bikes, books and beer, are friendly and low-key---just like the neighborhood.

name: Dorothy
about: I love the Pacific NW and all it has to offer, especially the amazing outdoors; mountain biking, fly fishing, camping, skiing and hiking . Having gone to school and lived in Philly and NYC - I knew I wanted a bit more elbow room. I made Oregon home in 2001 and never looked back.  I split time between Portland and the Gorge, and most weekends you'll find me and my dog Bean out in the woods and sleeping in our camper van, so someone might as well enjoy our place while we're away.

name: Vernell And Wanda
about:
Vernell enjoys learning foreign languages, studying cultures, listening to music, playing the flute, singing, working out and writing. Many years ago he studied in Mexico, Italy and France. During study breaks he traveled to Finland, Spain and England. Also, recently he published a couple of small books (Reflections: Getting a Glimpse of Life's Lyrics, and Revelations: One Family's Journey Through Hardships). Wanda is a New Jersey transplant who enjoys sewing and crafts, singing, playing guitar, reading and gardening. Much of the bedroom (fabric) decor is her handiwork. We married in 1984 and did a lot of travelling across the states with our children when they were at home. Our travels have also taken us to Canada and the Caribbean. We have lived in this same neighborhood since 1989 and are glad to be able to invite others to enjoy it too.   We strive to meet or exceed the expectations of each guest by improving with the feedback given to us from the preceding guests. 

NOW THAT YOU KNOW SOMETHING ABOUT US AND CAN SEE US ON SCREEN TELL US SOMETHING ABOUT YOU. (This is important to us.)

1) Does your profile include a current picture of you? 
2) If you are new to AirBnB, have you created a profile? 
3) Will your trip be for vacation, work or other? 
4) Will you be driving or flying or commuting in by train or bus? 
5) What is your approximate arrival time? 
6) Are you (or your guest) allergic to any plants or foods? 
7) What are your favorite foods? 
8) What are some of your hobbies?

Please add anything else that you’d like to tell us about yourself (personally or professionally). The information that you give will help us make your stay as pleasant as possible beginning with the coordination of your arrival. 

We are pleased to offer you accommodations in our private access only space, A Cozy Patch of Blue or  Sundown Suite.

************************************************************************************* 
Welcome! ¡Bienvenido! Benvenuto! Bienvenu! 
*************************************************************************************
LATE ARRIVALS - For guests scheduled to arrive after 8pm by air we ask that you provide us with the name of your airline and flight #. This information will help us accommodate any schedule changes dictated by the flight schedule. Those arriving by road or rail after 8pm we ask that you update us as your anticipated scheduled arrival changes by ½ hour or more.

name: Poz
about:
I am a Co-Founder of The World Flag Project:  Focused on Sharing and Celebrating Cultural Diversity through education; (URL HIDDEN)
I am also a designer/builder here in Portland, Oregon focused on small housing and Universal Design. (UDU Design LLC) My most recent project is one of my airbnb listings. It was built from the ground up and is know as an ADU, (accessory dwelling unit), or Urban Dwelling Unit as we like to call them. Most of the interior finishes are recycled and or reclaimed building materials. 
I am a bit of a foodie and appreciate fine wine. I have lots of recommendations here in Portland, currently a mecca in the scene.
I also love the great outdoors and can recommend good hikes in the Gorge or at the coast, where to camp and which beaches to explore. I Love meeting people from around the world and across the country. Hosting is something I thoroughly enjoy, (maybe it's the Italian in me). Connecting with others and creating community locally and globally is one of the most powerful things we can do to help shape our world and create a sense of belonging.
Saludos! Hope to share with you soon! Poz

name: Dana
about:
I'm a naturopathic medical student in Portland, Oregon, with one year of school left.  

I love to cook and garden, and I'm addicted to succulents. I love being outside, and in the summer you'll find me hanging out on the river, camping, hiking, or working in the garden.

name: Jak
about: I am a change maker, building community, respecting the earth and all that lives in it. I work at dismantling the chains of shame that our culture has been built upon reclaiming traditions of sustainability and ritual that brings us back into harmony with nature.  I am a healer by profession, love to travel and explore different cultures a true student of the world.  On a more intimate note I love a good cup of coffee.

name: Taralyn
about: Hi! My husband Aaron and I are creatives who double duty as avid hikers, flea market lovers, and foodies. Oh...and I may have an addiction to plants.... Come visit us and get a slice of our lovely little home and our lovely little city.

name: Samantha
about: I am a physician that owns a few health/wellness centers. I love to travel and live to surf! I live in PDX and the Oregon coast.

name: Jill
about: I love to spend time outdoors everyday.  Whether its walking my dog around the neighborhood, hiking, bike commuting, or skiing, a few hours in the sun or rain keep me happy.  I also love to spend time with my family and to travel anywhere and everywhere. Of course, I always love to come home to Portland and it's creative artsy vibe, healthy delicious food, and awesome craft beverages.

name: Robin
about: Easy-going individual, enjoys gardening, tasty homebrew, local food, and espresso.  Love meeting folks from around the globe.  And job-wise a local realtor specializing in inner SE and NE and downtown Portland properties.

name: Joe
about:
Greetings! I'm a Portland native and a first-time homeowner and AirBNB host. I'm excited about giving guests a cozy home base and some ideas for exploring the town.

I've lived in California and China for a few years, but I'm glad to be back in my hometown and near my extended family. I do environmental work for a living, and love being an all-weather bike commuter and getting outside for hikes and trail runs. If you're new to town, my girlfriend's "Portland Recruitment Tour" (her intro to Portland when her friends and family visit) might have some good ideas for you.

name: Scott
about: I live in Portland, OR and am a physician at Oregon Health Sciences University.  My partner, Suzi, and I enjoy traveling, cycling tours, hiking, kayaking and camping. Her favorite trips include urban exploration, languages and the arts. My favorites include adrenaline adventure. We also find plenty of common ground. We enjoy hosting others and attempting to provide some of the great hospitality we've experienced in our own travels.

name: Christi
about:
I'm a Montana native living in Portland, Oregon.  I love traveling and my goal is to visit all 7 continents in my lifetime (I've only got South America and Antarctica left!). I love to have adventures and explore all a place has to offer, but I like to balance my adventures with relaxation and a good book.

I love hosting guests in my tiny North Portland home and that has helped me to become a kind and conscientious guest myself. Getting to know new people is one of my favorite things and I pride myself in my ability to make connections with just about anyone.

name: Arlene
about: Graduate of Portland State University in Graphic Design, 2 sons Wade and Wyatt, and a self employed Soft Sculpture Artist. You can check my work at Lexington Bear Co. on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN).  I have lived in Portland, Oregon since 1973, and lived in Baltimore, Maryland for 10 years.  I love the blues, and NFL football. That would be the Baltimore "Ravens".  My house is an expression of my personality.  Whimsical, kozy, colorful, friendly, some of that friendly is on all fours.2 kitties and a very friendly Schnauzer.

name: Maya
about: I am a local business owner who loves my city. Born and raised in Portland, let me show you why I love it.  A lover of traveling, I have traveled extensively through India, Europe and Central America and I am familiar with the ups and downs of life on the road. I work hard to make your stay comfortable and pleasant.

name: Eric
about: Creative Director and Architect with Atelier Ace (Ace Hotels) based in Portland, OR.

name: Rebecca
about:
Hello! My name is Rebecca, and my man Caleb and I are musicians that tour and perform for a living. This is why we are gone at times, and can offer our home to guests. It is our primary home, so when you are here, we are off somewhere across the world, playing music for people. It is an interesting life that is full of beautiful connections with others, and we have a saying, " the places old time music takes you!" because we sometimes find ourselves in the most random or amazing places thanks to our music. I like that it offers one a lot of perspective about life and culture in other parts of our country, and across the world. 
We love our home though, and always look forward to returning here and enjoying the garden, having friends over for a nice meal, sitting by the fire, or coffee on the back porch in the mornings. 
So we hope you will enjoy it as much as we do! For us it is a little haven in the city.

name: Angela
about:
I'm originally from Idaho. I moved to Portland 15 years ago for college and fell in love with the area. I love the people and the places here! I now own 2 Hot Yoga studios in West Linn and Happy Valley and have a wonderful life with my fiance, his son & our two dogs.
Life is good!

name: Justin
about:
I love to travel, and explore the world around me.  That being said, It doesn't seem like I get to do enough of it.   I enjoy discovering a new city both locally and far away.  I enjoy getting to know the people, the culture, the food and the drink.  

In terms of local destinations, I am often just looking for a place to get away for the city and enjoy and long weekend.

name: Jennifer
about: I am a Native Oregonian, born and raised in a small town! I moved to Portland 9 years ago, after having served in the Peace Corps, worked as a Park Ranger at Mt.
