Rainier National Park and then working for the State of OR for 8 years. I have lived in the Alberta Arts district for 7 of those. I love my two boys and my dog, music and food. I miss traveling, so I live vicariously through all of you!

name: Michael
about: Hi! Im a 53-year old professional musician who has lived in Portland Oregon my whole life. An accomplished singer, keyboardist and accordion player, I make my living performing, teaching, and recording all styles of music - jazz, rock, country, etc. Besides my love of music, I also enjoy movies (all-time favorite: Charlie Chaplin's "City Lights"), books (just read "True Grit" and loved it), and pretty much any passionate artistic endeavor - theater, painting, architecture - you name it. Having grown up in the Pacific Northwest, I'm a lover of the outdoors, especially hiking trips to Mt Hood and the Columbia Gorge, and camping trips to the Oregon Coast.

name: Amber
about: Welcome to Portland! :) I love art, traveling, family, animals, and great restaurants. I also love decorating and making guests feel comfortable. I've been hosting for 2 years and have had such great success at it, my family and friends have asked me to manage their spaces now too. I hope to make your stay in Portland the best it possibly can be!  :)

name: Jonathan
about: I am professional musician. I enjoy performing both jazz and classical music. I enjoy working out and living a healthy lifestyle.

name: Carolyn
about: Portland Native who Lived in Mexico for several years.( Hablo Espanol Bien)  I am a  Nurse and Ayurvedic wellness practitioner. Lately I have been really into being creative with my home and enjoying my guests. You can catch me out dancing often - or out in the garden or hiking and Kayaking when the weather is good.

name: Dave And Early
about: My wife and I are both Portland natives. We currently divide our time between Alaska and Oregon, sticking to our Northwest roots. When we're not busy with our architecture firm, we like to hike and spend time with our family.

name: Kate And Kev
about: My husband, Kev, and I are teachers based in Portland. We love traveling and getting to know cities through locals' tips. We are in our 30s and have been using AirBnB for years, both as travelers and hosts (check it out- we're Superhosts!).  Kev is an elementary teacher and I am an Art teacher. We love Portland and bet you will, too!

name: Jessica
about: Lives in Portland. Loves travel, hiking, cycling, good food & wine, dim lighting, puppies and amenities.

name: Jenny
about:
My name is Jenny, and I live in Portland, OR. In my free time, I love to garden, cook vegetarian, bike, and spend time outdoors hiking or camping. I'm totally passionate about any and all animals.

I love AirBnb. I have  I lived with other people in co-op type settings and am mindful and respectful of other people's living spaces.  I am an adaptable and low maintenance traveler and promise to bring positive and clean energy to your abode!

name: Donna
about: We bought this Condo to view the River every day to live in the Prestigious Pearl District Downtown in the walkable neighborhood.   We moved out since we had a child and the condo is not at all safe for small children with  2-3 story easily climbable decks it is dangerous for children, now it is our vacation home and romantic getaway.

name: Danny And Alan
about:
We are happy you would like to know about us. We also want to know our guests. So please, before you inquire, write a short profile on AIRBNB and tell us something about yourself. Thank you!

Danny and Alan met in Mexico City in 2012. In 2015, Danny moved to Portland, where Alan has lived since 1997. Danny has also lived in Los Angeles. Alan grew up in Williamsburg, Virginia and has lived in North and South Carolina. 

Together they've traveled extensively within Mexico and spent the entire summer of 2013 with Eurail passes, visiting 14 countries. In 2014, they returned to Germany and the Czech Republic before continuing to Japan. Most recently, they visited Singapore, Thailand, Hong Kong, Bali, and Myanmar. Alan has also traveled in Central America and South Africa.
 
Alan and Danny love Mexican, Thai, and Korean food. They like to go dancing and to see live music.

Danny hosted many happy AIRBNB guests during his final year in Mexico City and achieved Superhost status. They look forward to your visit in their new Portland home.

name: Maka
about: Hi, my name is Maka and I am from the Republic of Georgia. I have a wonderful husband who helps me with the airbnb guests. We have animals and a beautiful farm, and we love each other and love having visitors.

name: The Huxley
about:
Beautiful spaces, your home away from home in Portland. 
The Huxley is all about creating an environment of peace and beauty where people can slow down and remember to be human. We strive to infuse light into all things, and welcome you to come enjoy our hospitality.

Run by a couple who are in love with life, the Huxley currently offers 2 spaces in the heart of NW Portland 

We love our city and our goal is to help you do the same. Any recommendations you need, please ask!
We look forward to welcoming you soon!

name: Anthony
about: I have Canadian roots, traveled Europe, lived in the Czech Republic and went to college a couple hours South of Portland.  Most of my life, however, has been lived here in this humble zip code in SE Portland.  Not just a townie that is stuck where he grew up, but rather I really like it here and I like to tell people about Portland and hope that I represent our city well.

name: Benjamin
about: I've lived in Portland for 13 years. My wife and I have a four year old boy, and are expecting another soon! We love to hit the local parks, enjoy Portland's tasty food and beverages, and are always on the lookout for the next great HBO series. Suzanne and I are both native Montanans and have big Montana love. We are happy to chat about our favorite Portland spots and want your stay to be the best it can be. Please let us know if there's anything we can do maximize your enjoyment!

name: Rachel
about: I currently teach high school English, and I love my summers off because I love to travel! Airbnb has been a great way to find nice places to stay, at great prices, with great people. I love city trips with museums and art galleries as well as the outdoors--hiking, camping, swimming. My favorite part of traveling is food and drink. Local breweries, hole-in-the-wall diners, fancy food...I'll try it all!

name: Yanna
about: My greatest joy is welcoming people to my home.  Portland is such a wonderful place to visit, it would be a waste to stay in a hotel and miss the warm hospitality of someone who wants nothing more than to make your stay exactly what you desire.  Welcome!

name: Martin
about:
I'm a long-time Portland resident who's worked as a forest ecologist, a writer, and a stay-at-home dad.  I'm an aficionado of what might be called "practical architecture" or "low design" -- stuff that really works, as opposed to just looking good.  Of course it's nice if it looks good too. :)

As a host, my goal is to make you comfortable then kinda get out of the way.  However, I do live right next door, so if you want, I'm easily available to chat about stuff to do in Portland, the architecture of houses tiny and large, places to eat, hikes to take, etc. 

Hope to see you soon!

name: Duston & Genevieve
about:
We are a family of three plus one dog (a very friendly yellow lab mix) living in Northeast Portland. We love all that the city has to offer: bicycle commuting, backyard vegetable gardening and chicken keeping,  good breweries, quality coffee, Portland Timbers soccer games and restaurants offering locally sourced dishes. We certainly couldn't live without the art and music community here in Portland. We also enjoy exploring the outdoors backpacking, camping and canoeing in the Mt Hood National Forest. 

Hosting through Airbnb has been a really fun and rewarding experience for us. We like to know that people can feel at home and have what they need for a comfortable and relaxing stay. We personally enjoy that our neighborhood is so walk-able and unique. The surrounding area allows for an  ideal experience for those who are visiting Portland for the first time or those who are familiar with the city and looking for a "home away from home".

name: Scott
about:
Creator and eater of foods.

Love exploring my "new hometown" of 10 years in Portland, Oregon after growing up on the East Coast.

I run analytics and marketing for a vacation rental management firm.

My wife and I rent out the basement apartment of our home to guests from all over the world, when our family and friends are not using it themselves.

name: Karen
about:
I am an artist and lover of nature, animals, and the sun. I also enjoy gardening, hiking, biking, river rafting,  and exploring new places, healthy eating, recycling, buying my food locally, and gardening. The basement space is accessed through my backyard, where you will see lots of plants and work in progress on permaculture, some of it specifically for the birds and bees. 
I value open communication, so please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns as your stay nears or when you are here.
While my place is not lavish, I pride myself in keeping it clean and comfortable for you to enjoy.

name: Kari
about:
Hi~ 
I consider myself a friendly, polite, funny, 40-somethingerother  that loves to travel the world in my free time. Currently I live in Portland Oregon and work as a youth & young adult therapist. I look forward to meeting you. Cheers!

name: Katrina And Tom
about:
I'm from Flint, Michigan and I've lived all over from New York, NY, to Squamish, BC, Canada.  I love to travel and recently my husband and I bought an old VW Bus. We love to take the bus to the coast and camp under the trees. 

My husband and I bought the house last summer, and we are remodeling it to fit our many dreams. While being as eco-friendly as possible, wherever possible we use recycled or reclaimed material for our remodeling projects.
We are both entrepreneurs and our many endeavors keep us pretty busy! I have a clothing company (Bob knits), in which I hand knit accessories, home decor items and even baby blankets.  
I am also the founder of Apples to Applesauce a non-profit dedicated to ending child hunger by ending food waste.  My husband Tom makes furniture and does custom metal fabrication.  During the week he is a tig-welder and builds brew tanks for breweries. For our wedding he made 35 benches, 12 tables and even his ring.   

We remodeled our lower level into a private apartment so that our friends, family,  and Portland visitors could have a home away from home.

name: Jules
about: Traveling the World...treating everywhere we stay like home and making new friends is something we bring where ever we go!  In life, I'm in the process of building a global community called HowYouLove, my son Michael is a computer programmer in Portland Oregon and my son Kylor is a film maker with a flair for outdoor adventure. We took an around the world trip when Ky was 6 months old and we just keep circling the globe. We look forward to becoming friends with you and hope you can come to visit us one day! ;-)

name: Marlène & Jean
about:
We are two post-doctoral researcher in neuroscience, from Paris and living now in Portland, Oregon.

We like to drink wine and eat cheese ;). We play a little bit of music too!

name: Neha
about:
I love (URL HIDDEN) the new kitchen is a treat for me! Location of an apt has always been very important for me no matter which city I travel to. I love to walk, so if the location is great, it makes it easier to explore! 

My mom always taught me growing up...to take care of another person's place better than I would even take care of my own! So I have tried to live by that motto when I'm a guest.

name: Polly
about:
Hello! I am a woman in my mid twenties. After a few years on the road, post-college I recently moved back to my hometown of Portland, and I work in the Real Estate realm. As a native, I have tons of tips and secrets to offer guests and really enjoy helping people see Portland from a local's perspective. As a foodie, I have endless restaurant recommendations and as a nature enthusiast I love to share my favorite spots to soak in the beauty of Oregon. 

I have both hosted and been a guest through Air Bnb. I love what this site has to offer, and use it whenever I travel. As a host, I want to be as helpful and accommodating as possible!

name: Lenore And Mateo
about:
Welcome, my name is Lenore , my partner Mateo and I take a lot of pride in our living environment. It has lots of open space, decorated with exotic items from around the world, and lots of light.
We love to travel and meet other travelers to share stories about this amazing world! 
We both study natural medicine and want our home to have a healing peaceful vibe!

name: Ashe
about: I'm a creative girl from Portland, OR, who loves to travel. When at home I adore gardening and making food for friends. Anything else, just ask!

name: Krista
about: Thanks so much for considering to stay with us! There's three of us at the house: myself, Dan and Zoe. We've been in Portland for three amazing years. Originally from the East coast, we love the vibe of this city and the incredible hiking and camping it has minutes from downtown. We love to share what we know, so feel free to ask away, we're more than happy to make suggestions. But we also respect your privacy, so unless you're contacting us with questions, you'll only get the one text asking if you need anything else during your stay, and that's it :-) We also have a 3 year old miniature Australian Shepherd named Annie, 19 year old cat Raz, and two new "foster fail" kittens Cocoa & Fudge.

name: Maria+Dino
about:
good food + good design = happy life. 

Enjoy surfing, yoga, cycling, traveling, entertaining & foodies by DNA. I am an operating room nurse and love delicious culinary, my husband is a celebrity chef + renaissance biz man and our lovely daughter is a high school student pursuing her love in the performing arts. Our family has been in the hospitality/restaurant business for many years both in America and in Italy. It is important to us that you have an amazing experience here in Portland and its an honor to have to stay with us.

name: Jennifer
about:
I am a Neonatal and Pediatric Physical Therapist and I love my job! 
Given a choice, I would rather be outside than inside, but I can be a homebody too. 
It might be nerdy, but I like to read books about the brain. I also like historical fiction above other types.
I stay busy with my singing group Choral Arts Ensemble which pushes me to learn great music with great people. 
I love to travel and have done many house trades all around the world. 
Attitude, awareness, appreciation.

name: Reggie
about: Married with loving family

name: Constance
about: I, Connie, am from Portland.   I was an urban planner and project manager for Portland's development agency, helping develop housing near transit stations.  I love to bike, kayak, do yoga, cook and explore cities.  I travel a lot and have used Air Bnb to find cozy lodging in Amsterdam, Barcelona, England, Port Townsend, and throughout Ireland.  I always appreciated the personal connection with the hosts, who helped me get oriented and taught me about their cities.  I'd like to pass on some of that good kharma to visitors in Portland.

name: Riikka
about:
Booking a vacation rental can sometimes be a gamble. When booking with Riikka you can rest assured that all of our properties adhere to the same meticulous standards. 

- Professionally cleaned after every stay
- Freshly washed sheets, comforters and towels
- High-speed WiFi and Cable
- Host available at all times to provide assistance

Come stay with us!

name: Elora
about: I am originally from the Pacific NW. I grew up all along the West Coast (Portland in the 70's, Los Angles in the 80's, Seattle in the 90's). I lived NYC for 15 years and miss it daily and still call it home. I am an Interior Designer by trade and passion. My personal interests are traveling, sailing - and all things nautical, literature, film, jazz, good food and a good storytelling.

name: Kristin
about: I'm a writer and author who lives in inner southeast Portland. I like reading, gardening, hiking and biking.

name: Timothy
about: CEO of The Miller Associates and real estate investor.  My dog is SaSha the furry truffle hound. The Cedar Chalet is a space built over years as it revealed itself and a design style we now call JapaCubano.  I've had multiple BnBs over the past 5 years.  The Chalet is my favorite because it is amazingly private.  Thank you for your interest.

name: Jacob
about:
From San Francisco. A Canadian and US citizen thanks to my dad from Winnipeg, MB! Just moved to Portland and love it....
Love the outdoors, skiing, hiking, backpacking, SCUBA, river rafting, etc...
Love to travel and have been to Australia, Bali, Thailand, Honduras, Mexico, Canada, most of the Caribbean Islands, UK, France, Germany, The Netherlands, Iceland...
Work as a registered nurse at Kaiser Permanente...Anything else, just ask!!

name: Nell
about: Flexible, accommodating, friendly. I enjoy having guests in my house, and I love sharing Portland. It's the best city in the world. The dog is a Sheltie named Jack. He's very friendly. The cat is Minouche, and also a cream puff. I hike a lot, so I can share my experiences and recommendations. Also, I'm well-versed in the Alberta Street scene...bars, restaurants, shops, yoga, coffee, etc. It's all here!

name: Cole
about:
Traveler/Entrepreneur  
Love life, travel, active life 
I work in an extremely creative sector and thoroughly enjoy all that brings 
I travel a lot with work and spend 3/4 of the year living between Taiwan, Thailand and Oregon and spend the summers in Oregon and try not to get on a plane for three entire months! 
I am low key and flexible.

name: Joey
about: 29. Traveler. Jiu-jitsu practitioner. Strength Coach. Adventurer.

name: Traci
about: We're a family of native Oregonians with two rescue pups and a Lynx Point Siamese. When we're not working, our favorite activities include traveling, whitewater rafting, renovating old homes, restoring the family’s farmhouse in the country, and trying as many new restaurants as is physically possible. After 15+ years in the neighborhood, we were lucky enough to be able to build our dream home in our dream location, and included an apartment to be able to share our love of Sellwood with others.

name: Carl
about:
I'm a writer and designer, originally from California, grew up in Colorado, and worked as a Peace Corps volunteer in Tanzania and a high school teacher in New York City before coming to Portland nine years ago.

My girlfriend Melea and I live here in Portland, Oregon, with our baby boy, Isador, who just arrived last spring. Both of us are originally from the west coast (she's from Seattle) but have spent a lot of time in different parts the country, and around the world -- for school (Pennsylvania, San Diego, Scotland, New York City) and for work (India, Kenya, England, Singapore). We've also traveled a lot in Asia and Latin America, separately and together -- and still agree that Portland is our favorite city overall.

At the moment, we're pretty tied to home, raising our son and working on the house and garden. As travelers, we're looking forward to exploring as a trio rather than a pair; as hosts, we're excited to introduce folks to this wonderful part of the world.

name: Larry
about: I'm a quiet but curious and well-traveled guy, with lots of long-term friendships from the various permutations of my life. I travel most winters to Asia, where I shop for my small textile import business. Art and creative endeavors have always been a big part of my life, both as an appreciator and a creator. I enjoy people who are adventurous enough to get off the beaten path, who take time to appreciate the details, and who realize they are not the center of the universe.

name: Tom
about: Portland resident 20 years, retired the last 10. Like to hike, ride my bike and cross country ski. Hope to do some travelling soon.

name: Casey
about: I'm a Portland native, who likes to travel and paint whenever i get the chance to get away from work or school. New to Air BnB, not sure what to expect!

name: Pallavi
about:
Hey there! 

I am a 32 year old attorney living in Portland, OR.  I just moved here from Baltimore, MD and enjoy my new time on the west coast.  I love traveling and meeting new people.

As a guest you'll have the comfort of a furnished large one bedroom apartment walking distance from tons of fun!
I hope to hear from you soon!

name: Carolina
about: Real Estate broker and Married.  Manage two Farmers Markets, life time Portland resident and world traveler.  We have a shy bengal cat named cookie who is not allowed in the guest room area, kitchen and/or can be isolated as she has her own living space for those guests who have cat allergies.  Please let us know in advance if you are allergic so we can accomodate you.  Thank you

name: Jessica & Drew
about: We're an easy going, outdoor loving couple who enjoy meeting new people, sharing the city we love, and traveling as much as we can .

name: Jessica
about:
I am a crafty maven who enjoys using my green thumb to the best of my ability.  I seek out creativity and beauty in my daily life and try to make my home a relfection of that.

Loves: pho, Ruby - my bicycle, coffee, sharing laughs with folks, and time in the park

name: Richard
about: Cheryl and I are experienced  international travelers preferring to drive ourselves and see where our instincts take us. We've explored and experienced a great deal of what the world has to offer and can't wait for more! We own a Bistro and love new and exciting food as well as the classics. Film, reading,and music are a large part of our lives. We love to meet new people so if you wish come around the corner to the Lair Hill Bistro and say hi.

name: Dee
about: .I am an east coast transplant to the Pacific Northwest. When I travel I like simplicity and comfort so the space we share with our guests is a reflection of that.

name: Jill
about:
I love the idea of meeting local folks and making new friends on our travels. Some of my best friends came from chance meetings on trips. My husband and I love to travel but haven't done much lately. We are easy guests, quiet and accommodating and live by the motto "leave a place better then you found it."  

We liked staying in AirBNB residences so much we decided to offer our extra rooms to fellow travelers looking for an alternative to the uninspired, impersonal and expensive hotel fare. We've been delighted to meet and host some really lovely people thus far. AirBNB is a pretty genius idea. We are happy to be a part of it.

Michael is an acupuncture doc and I work out of our home as a business coach. Our son is off at college, so things are pretty quiet around here. 

We look forward to making your acquaintance soon.

name: Vicki
about: I am a single 64 year old woman who lived in Honolulu for 29 years.  I have traveled to 73 countries, many of them several times for extended periods.  For me it's always the people, food and weather that make my experiences memorable and  I pride myself in being Portland's good will ambassador.   I really want my guests to love this area and want to come back so I try by best to deliver the experience they are aiming for.

name: Anthony
about: Born and raised in New York City. Currently calling Portland, Oregon, USA home.

name: Chafic
about: We love Portland and we love to host and travel!

name: Rosie + Torry
about: I Love Black Tea, Seahorses and Tiny Little Elephants, I love  to Dance to Disco but often just rock out to whatever is playing on my playlist.  Clutter and I, don't get along too well. I'm obsessed with nature, and often go on Epic walks to connect to the important things in life. I love the ocean, or just being close to large bodies of water. I grew up in Los Angeles. I am a Yoga Teacher, Life Coach and Meditation Guide. Often I write, but mostly I read. Torry is a designer and photographer.  We have been together for over a decade.

name: Gianna
about: I'm am American/Italian, I enjoy cooking, hiking, traveling and visiting with friends and family. I enjoy treating others to a an experience I'd like to have. Looking forward to meeting you.

name: Todd
about:
We love living near Laurelhurst and Mt Tabor Parks. We love our urban location and walk to great food, beer and music all right around the corner. 
Traveling is a priority to our family, but when we are home, we enjoy kayaking, reading, hiking, running and relaxing in the spacious yard.  Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Julie
about:
A DIY/sustainability enthusiast, from growing food to making soap to fixing the dryer when it breaks to making food, etc. 
A functional-aholic.  Happily married, conservative with resources, obsessed with efficiency of action.
Can't live without activity, motion.  Telemark, alpine, cross country skiing, yoga, running, rock climbing.  
I'm a hands-off Airbnb host.  People are usually coming with an agenda, not to visit with me.  There are only 24 hours in a day; mine are full.  If a guest needs anything, I thrive on facilitating their visit.  Once they are settled, if they need anything I can be found tending chickens or bees, making noodles or mustard, or some other endeavor.

name: Paola
about: I am an east coast transplant. Originally from NY but with Argentine roots, i consider myself more of a nomad (having lived in Washington DC, Arizona, Seattle in addition to NY and Argentina). I am grateful to have had the experience of travel, and a bilingual upbringing but equally happy to have most recently settled my roots in Portland. I have 2 young kids who are the apples of my eye, but really what parent does not feel that? When i am not working or raising kids, i love LOVE to explore the dining experience of whatever town i am in.

name: Ami
about:
Hello! Portland is my city and I am here to share all that it offers with visiting Airbnbers. By day, I work on the digital marketing team for an incredible company that provides student educational travel. When I'm not helping students discover the world, I love to get my hands dirty gardening, to cook, to feed my family and neighbors. So far we have about 2,000 square feet of gardens and it's expanding every year. I call our urban farm 'Tiny Food Grid' and we've been at it for seven years now. 

My children Ben (15) and Olivia (13) are my Airbnb partners and 10% of all Airbnb proceeds go into their global travel funds. They will be visiting Dominical Republic and Cambodia for community service and nature preservation programs this summer!

After four decades in Portland, I know this city inside and out. Ask me for recommendations that aren't in the guidebooks!

name: Claire
about: Irish Mom of two girls and wife of Caesar.  We moved to Brooklyn NY from London in 2009 until 2014 and then headed West to Portland Or where we plan to settle for foreseeable future.

name: Rachael
about:
I am married and have twin daughters. I love to travel, cook, make art, discover new music, explore....

I am an artist/photographer/maker - I print my original fine art photography onto silk scarves, silk pocket squares, and other fine goods via my business, Luxe & Lens.

name: Danny
about: I am a 30 something marketer who loves to run, cycle and take in life's journeys. I hail out of Portland, Oregon where it's always wild and fun.

name: Nina
about:
I love HOME! Having a tranquil place to call HOME offers me the ability to enjoy the world (near and far) and always have a place to return to so I can recharge. Travel is a passion of mine. I love to soak in different cultures, peoples' points of view, beauty, sights, sounds and flavors. I have traveled and lived extensively in Asia. I found that my richest and most memorable experiences were those shared with "locals" in residential areas, doing average daily activities.
I am now in the stage of life where I can travel to locations and have adventures that are on my "bucket list". I feel very blessed to meet people from all over and make life long friends.
When I am home in Portland, I enjoy teaching Pilates and Yoga in my private boutique studio and creative ballet to little ones! Connecting with people of ALL AGES is a love of mine!
I must admit that sometimes I feel like a "tourist" in my own home town. Living in Irvington for the past 25 years, I have not needed to venture very far. (quite ironic; I love to travel far and wide, but love to stay close to home when I am in Portland) Recently I have started to explore my own wonderful city! I love discovering new eateries, wineries, galleries, boutiques, movement studios, dance groups and the fun quirky things that Portland is so good at! 
I find daily activities and their simple blessings the best way to enjoy a full, rich and satisfying life. I enjoy getting to know people everywhere I go.
 I hope to offer you a private, safe and tranquil HOME away from HOME while you enjoy the wonderful daily blessings Portland and its surrounding areas have to offer.

name: Mary & Jason
about:
Jason and I have been partners for 26 years and have a 9 year old son who is a kind and gentle soul. We are passionate about cooking together and leading a healthy lifestyle built on community and sustainability. We are engaged in active transportation and adore Portland for affording us a lifestyle that allows us to engage thoughtfully. We are avid gardeners and pet enthusiasts. 

We have traveled throughout Europe and Paris is a special place for Mary. 

We enjoy sharing our home and opening it for others to enjoy! We look forward to you enjoying your trip to our amazing city.

name: Ryan
about: I'm originally from Portland Oregon.  After graduating from Oregon State, I've done a lot of traveling which brought me to this site.  As a guest, I'd love any recommendation about where the best spots for good eats are. As a host, and native Portlander I'll look forward to pointing you in a good direction so you can get the most out of your stay.

name: Tim
about: I am a super nice, down to earth, sigle gay guy living in Portland, Oregon. I work at the local Science Museum (OMSI) and travel often to other museums for work. I just bought a house this past March and have been having fun fixing the place up and bringing a 1920's Portland bungalow back to it's original charm. I am excited to share my new home with others passing through Portland.

name: Natalie
about: I'm a writer and teacher of creative writing. I love to travel, hike, cook (& eat!) and I'm an avid reader.

name: Ketzel
about: Journalist, animal lover, gardener, hiker, reader, vegan!

name: Tamara And Geoff
about:
Geoff and I, Tamara, are early 40-somethings with a zest for adventure and all things natural. Whether connecting with trees, rivers, starry skies or free-range meat, we enjoy keeping life simple, and remaining connected to what really matters--which for us, these days, is our relationship with our daughter, our friends, and the beautiful region in which we live. While we share a love of travel, and have numerous experiences from our younger days, we find we enjoy hanging closer to home these (URL HIDDEN) we never thought we'd say! That's not to say that we don't love the random far-away trip, and look forward to those like the next guy or gal...but heading out to local rivers for hiking, backpacking, and swimming hole exploration makes as happy as can be.

We also enjoy sharing our home with others. We love it here and want others to do the same.  While we'll eagerly share the highlights of our city, point you in the right direction, and chat over a beer or glass of wine, our lives our pretty full and we may not be as available to hang out as we once were. 

As one might guess, along with our passion for the outdoors comes a yearning desire to make a difference to curb climate change and create a stable world for us all. This is where much of Tamara's energy goes, after parenting, partnering, and doing what she can to find peace and connection with others. Geoff loves photography and mt.biking, and aiming for world records on word games.

name: Joshua
about: Portland native and an outdoor enthusiast living an active life.  You'll find me on a mountain in the winter and in water over summer.  I love IPA's, moscow mules, documentaries, themed-parties, and making my friends laugh.  I prefer Tahoe or Whistler over Vegas and have been to considerably more countries than domestic states.  Professionally, I'm a commercial real estate broker.

name: Mike
about:
Hello, my name is Mike. 
I  just retired after a long career in the Tech industry. Today  is the first day of posting this wonderful home. 9/21/2016 I now spend most of my time at the Oregon coast and enjoy fishing and the great outdoors. You will adore the variety of shops and restaurants in Multnomah Village, just a short distance from my front door. My favorite shop is Annie Blooms book store.  So many wonderful restaurants are close by like  Journeys, a perfect place to sit outside and drink local beers, ciders, and wines while eating delicious tapas, and Verde Cucina, an excellent  Mexican restaurant where the soft tortillas are made fresh while you wait, and the margarita's are delicious too.
Come and visit and let me share this perfect place with you!

name: Pelican
about: Furnished Vacation Corporate Apartments in New York Miami Toronto Mississauga - New Jersey Fully Furnished Apartments Facing Manhattan Skyline

name: Nicole
about: Your Host, Nicole, loves people, fresh tomatoes from the garden, zumba and Portland.  Along with husband, Howard, and three kids, she transplanted from Maryland for an opportunity at a French immersion school for her kids and a greener lifestyle including access to amazing outdoor hiking, mountain views, incredible biking infrastructure and plentiful backyard gardens.  As Nicole quickly fell in love with all Portland has to offer, she is eager for you to experience it too.  Nicole can be involved in helping you navigate your stay here or give you complete privacy, as you wish.   Nicole is also a massage therapist and available for in bnb massage.

name: Peter
about:
I'm originally from Chicago and have lived in Portland since 2006.  After traveling the world and teaching skiing to kids I decided to settle down in the Pacific Northwest.  I love it here!  It's truly home.  

I am a counselor and massage therapist-two completely separate private practices.  I love the variety that wearing two professional hats affords me.  It was the master plan years ago and has come to a beautiful fruition.

Staying in sweet Airbnb spots and hosting guests in my little modern English cottage is truly a delight.

name: Nicci
about:
Hi, I'm Nicci ( Nicol ). I have been here in Portland for 16 years and love it. I am originally from New Jersey. I have two small children ( Lili 7 and Monty 5 ) I have a little massage business and teach yoga ( living the Portland dream ). We are always on the move in this beautiful little city. Come stay with us! 
Favorite books:
Raymond Carver-What we talk about when we talk about love
Wallace Stegnar-Crossing to safety
Doris Lessing-Mara and Dann
Favorite Movies:
Barbarian Invasions w Remy Gerard
City of God
Children of Men
Tootsie
Favorite Music:
All things Jazz. 
Bruce Springsteen

name: Steve & Rebecca
about: Steve sells sports apparel online , is a tennis enthusiast and aspiring artist. Rebecca is a biological science researcher, soccer player, and avid hiker. Steve grew up in New Jersey and Rebecca in the countryside of Oregon. We both love doing anything outdoors. We also love eating exotic foods, traveling and interacting with the strange/unique people of Portland/the world. We go every spring to Florida so Steve can volunteer at the Miami Open and to camp and canoe in the Everglades and the Keys. Our traveling style is camping or hostels or Airbnb with lots of hiking, but also a few trips into cities to see art galleries and try local cuisine.

name: David
about:
I'm from from Minneapolis, Minnesota. My first out of state experience was out west, Bozeman MT Big Sky project on a family working vacation. 

It wasn't long before a neighborhood friend and I set our compass for a Bozeman Jun - Aug '74 commitment. He stayed started a family and craft printing business. I return to MN and started a Cook-Chef one year program at Hennipen County Tech and decided to enlist in the AF late '75 after my culinary tech school & food service work experience.

After an Air Force Germany overseas discharge, I was picked up as an AF Commissary Produce Department Manager '80 to '85.  

I experienced being an one year tenant in Ramstein Village, separate living areas shared hall main entrance. It was my first single family house shared experience. The living and community experience was pretty grand. It was the start of my quality of life education.

I completed a 21 year AF Reserve career in 2001 in the Medical Service Corps.  I finished my civilian federal career '10 and lived in the D.C. area. 

After attending my niece's undergrad '12 OU commencement and first time non work related Portland visit. I decided to take a Multnomah County Master Gardeners class Jan-Mar 2012. I rented a (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) room share while attending.

After the three month experience I decided to move to OR. 

I sold all my belongings except for what would fit in an Outback and seven Fedex ground boxes and four bicycles one packed road bicycle. Rented my Arlington SFH.

I landed Bend for a two month (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) room share Aug Sep '12 stay. One of my best shared living experiences. 

Discovered a great Portland (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) Room share near 20th Lincoln SE. 

Purchased 359 late '12.

PGI opened Nov '14.

I cohabit the second level w Milo & Poco, litter mates happy content outdoor male cats.

name: Aysha
about: I first came to Portland thinking I would only stay for a few months.  20 years later  I am still here and loving every minute of it.  It's a great city that I have no doubt you will also fall in love with.

name: Greg & Cheri
about: Hi! We're Greg and Cheri Holly, long time Portland residents excited to share our home and city with the airbnb community. We have lived in our Richmond neighborhood for almost 30 years, raising two children and watching this area of town grow and evolve into the celebrated residential, foodie and arts district that it is today. We enjoy the short walk to Clinton, Division or Hawthorne streets for morning coffee, casual dining at the food carts or a world-renowned restaurant, or for a drink at one of the many local bars and brew pubs. Greg is a graphic designer whose clients include two of Portland's iconic brands in Stash Tea and Kombucha Wonder Drink. Cheri is an RN and ceramic artist who creates beautiful handbuilt pottery featuring impressions of the many leaves and flowers from our yard and garden. We both love to travel, and love to hear stories about the adventures of our family and friends, whether a local road trip or international destination. We can't wait to hear your story!

name: Raquel
about:
Hello Everyone.   

Thanks for visiting.  A little about me.   I am originally from Los Angeles, California, lived in Minnesota for 4 years, and have a B.A. in Communications from a college there.   I am am somewhat tall (subjective, I suppose), and belong to a tall group.

I have traveled to Costa Rica, Puerto Rico, and have cruised both the east and west coast of the United States.    I like meeting people from different cultures, and learning what it is like living in other parts of the world.

I love movies - especially drama, or comedy, many types of food, and visiting new places, and making new friends.  I speak Spanish, too.

My life motto - live life to it's fullest; and enjoy everything you do, big or small.   And if you don't enjoy it; look for other opportunities, and possibilities.

name: Marc
about: Despite all the hats I've worn: actor, waiter, teacher, mortician ... Did he say mortician? Yep - just hung that hat up and am on to learning hair (even scarier)... Portland has been a constant, ever-changing, always cozy place to call home.  I love our four seasons, the art scene(s), eating my way through town and poking my nose into other people's gardens.

name: Dreya And Jessie
about: A landscape designer and massage therapist. We love anything outdoors, good food, music and travel.

name: Eric
about: I am an artist and musician who moved to Portland in the late 90s from upstate NY. I also enjoy screen printing, oil painting, publishing, experimental video, comedy and travel.

name: Anatol
about: Friendly, well-traveled host. Enjoy hosting/meeting travelers from all over and playing a small role in helping them have a positive travel experience.

name: Julie
about: I'm a creative, fun-loving designer excited to share my guesthouse and my little slice of Portland paradise with you!

name: Jennifer
about:
Portland has been my home for 20 years.  I am a sales rep in the outdoor industry and travel often for work renting homes and unique places to stay in my travels. This inspired me to offer my home to others who prefer the comfort and charm of a home rather than a hotel. 
Enjoy your stay!

name: Anna
about:
I'm a West Coast gal through and through, born and raised in the Bay Area and living here in Oregon since 2000. I've found the perfect home for myself in Portland with so much to do outdoors as well as the great food and entertainment this city has to offer. I love getting out of town camping or to the coast with my amazing friends as well as sticking close to home to catch a show or Blazers game. 

I'm new to the Airbnb world, but believe me when I say that my job in the music industry has armed me with the skills to be prepared for and successfully tackle just about any adventure in my path. Just please don't ask me to pick out all the brown M&Ms for you...

I'm very excited to do everything I can to make sure you enjoy every aspect of your stay in this wonderful city and keep you coming back for more. Don't hesitate to check in for advice on places to go, things to see and if you're a music nerd like myself, fill me in on what you're into as I know a thing or two about live music happening in town!

name: Ann
about: We have lived in Portland for 25 years and have restored this 1906  shingled four square as well five other homes. We love to travel around the Northwest (the beach or the mountains) and in Nuevo Vallarta, Mexico and Jackson, Wyoming. We like all sorts of outdoor activities, enjoy going sports events, sitting out with family and friends and sharing wine, a microbrew and a delicious dessert.  We enjoy our 3 boys and Bernese Mountain Dog and all of the activities that come with keeping them entertained.  Our family's favorite teams are the Boston Red Sox, Portland Trailblazers and Hillsboro Hops (baseball).  If we had time we would love to catch up on movies and good books.   We want to share our home and city with our guests and make them feel at home and  provide recommendations for activities, brewpubs, restaurants as needed.

name: Meghan
about:
East Coasters turned West Coasters loving the beauty that is Oregon. Nature, food, and good vibes were what brought us here and have kept us here. 

In our spare time we love to explore, camp, and work with our hands. Repairing bikes and soap- making are some hobbies of ours.

Sharing our love of Portland is also a passion of ours. We are exited to take our hand at hosting!

name: Joseph
about: I am from Manchester, UK and my wife Sarah is from New York. We have four children and love spending time with our family :-)

name: Stephane
about:
Hi! My name is Stephane and I am originally from NYC, but have I've in Portland a long time.  I am a Registered Dietitian at a local hospital and an avid traveller and user of my passport.  

I lived in Portland many moons ago decided to return 3 years ago. I am a new homeowner and am looking forward to sharing my place with others. I love to cook and I hope all those that come stay take advantage of my professional set up. 

Happy Traveling!

name: Katherine And Mike
about: We have lived in Portland over ten years and love this city!  We enjoy bike riding, tasting our way around the city's restaurants and food carts, and the interesting people.  Although admittedly a bit biased, Alberta Arts and NE Portland is the best place to be.  It has a thriving and diverse community and is still only ten minutes to downtown.  There is so much to walk and bike to from my home. We are happy to share our home with kind, thoughtful visitors interested in exploring Portland from our home base in a quintessential neighborhood.  Our most recent travels were to Mexico City, Vancouver BC and Costa Rica. We also to explore Oregon through camping and day trips.

name: Atalya
about: I love Portland! I love Dance! and I love to Travel!

name: Chris
about: I'm originally from the Northeast, but moved to Portland after living in Montana.  Over the last six years I've fallen for the Pacific Northwest, enjoying all of the great things this area has to offer.  Some of my favorite activities are mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, and music.

name: Laura & Vince
about: Vince and Laura are 2 outdoorsy, laid-back nurses in their mid-30s.

name: Jonathan
about:
I run a theatre company (Hand2Mouth) and when I'm not directing shows, I love to hike, travel and work in foreign countries. 

I live in Portland with my wife, Faith, and our son, Waylon. We only recently moved to the great, old school neighborhood of St. Johns. We love to have visitors, guest artists, friends and family members come to stay with us.  We try to host parties when we can, and keep the house buzzing and doors open.

I've had the great joy of traveling and doing theatre/artistic work in Eastern/Central Europe, Mexico, the Balkans and Turkey.  We've also camped across as much of the US as we can, even crossing coast-to-coast via Amtrak on a loooong trip.  And we've begun to steadily try and see every mountain range on the west coast in summer camping trips from the Canadian border down to California.

Favorite trips have been the times we stayed for a month or more with our friends in their homes (Mexico City, Szamocin Poland) and got to know their real way of life, meet their families and friends, and eventually take part in festivals, birthdays, celebrations, road trips, adventures and family dinners.

My favorite way to travel is to show up without much of a plan and learn from the people I meet where we should really go, and what to see, and the best ways to travel and the foods I've never heard of... to really discover something different than I ever knew before I left.

I am always interested in sitting with anyone who has been busy getting out and seeing the world, and learning more from them.

name: Rowan
about: We're a fun loving family of three with a fourth on the way. We love Portland and we love to travel too! Our home is a beautiful 100 year-old Portland Bungalow that we've just finished updating. We look forward to hosting your next trip to Portland and helping you enjoy the home and city we love.

name: John
about:
We have loved meeting people from all over the world through AirBnB.  We have lived all over the US (NYC, DC, Chicago, LA, SF, etc.), but Portland is my home.  We love the food, people and even the weather (well, especially the food and the people)!  

We spend much of our time outdoors, hiking and kayaking, and mountain biking from time to time.

name: Steve
about: I'm from Portland Oregon, formerly from Northern California by way of the metro New York City area. I have my own business in the Vitamin industry and love music, travel, nature, comedy, spending time with friends .i just got married (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) wife is from the Philippines  so shes with me now :)

name: Karri
about:
Ciao People!

I love traveling and I LOVE even more being a host of travelers - whatever brings you on your journey, work or love or experience!

I started traveling by myself when I was 18 in 1989. Long before there was email and all of the cool things to support backpackers today, I had traveled many places; I survived and thrived because people gave me food, took me around, gave me lodging, rides to the airport and took care of me when I got sick. So, I am always looking for the opportunity to help people out on their journeys!

My greatest travel passion is visiting national parks in eastern and southern Africa - so far I have been to 17 parks and I am in love with African wildlife and cultures.

But besides Africa, I love SE Asia culture - especially the food; I love Italian culture - especially the language; and, more than anything, I want to go to Mongolia, Bhutan, Khazakstan and Wales.

I am very much into the Slow philosophy as a lifestyle - I am an avid gardener and adventurously good cook.  

My biggest dream is to travel the world via dirigible.

As your host at PandaFaerie House here in Portland on Mt. Tabor, you will always find local roasted micro lot organic fair trade coffee or organic hand picked tea, a nearly complete Charles Bukowski collection for your reading voyeurism and a totally friendly greeting committee comprised of my dog, Bunny aka TACO.

name: Nathan
about:
Now that I'm working overseas, I'm renting out my condo to help pay the mortgage. I've made the unit as user friendly as possible. The space is very neat (not a lot of clutter) and is professionally cleaned after every guest. I hope you enjoy my home as much as I have. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Nathan

name: Jose Luis
about:
I live and work in Portland-Oregon.
This is a condo where my partner and I live and is rented occasionally.

We love pottery, woodwork, building, designing and creating things as well as traveling.

Great places visited:
*Charleston (beautiful architecture ).
*San Francisco ( Impressive Palace of Fine Arts )
*Miami ( Stunning Art Deco Buildings )

If you  are visiting, working or relocating to Portland, I will try my best  to accommodate you and make sure you  experience it like a local; depending on your needs, interests  and what you really want to do.

What is great about Portland:

-Friendly people.
-No need to drive.......(bikes everywhere! The MAX / Light Rail is 2 blocks away)
-Tons of restaurants and AMAZING food as well as service.
-There is always something on theaters, or something fun going on.
-Powell 's books (a whole block - 3 to 4 floors of books to see, read or buy)
-Do you love Vintage? Clothes, accessories, furniture .........
-And we are TAX FREE , yes: TAX FREE! ...the price you see is the price you pay.

Any questions, please contact me.

Thanks!

name: Topher
about: I'm a wallpaper designer, visual artist and plant-nerd with a love of interiors (and exteriors). I live and work between New Orleans, Louisiana and Portland, Oregon - mainly so I can garden year-round (chase summer) and eat great food.

name: Lisa & Kevin
about: Designer, Non- Profit Filmaker, Cyclist, Sailor, Adventurer, Gardener, Portland.

name: Northwest Portland
about: We are NW Portland International Hostel and Guesthouse.  The apartment is in the historic Elliston building in the beautiful Itanianate style popular in the late 1800s.  We are a friendly staff, knowledgeable about what to do and see in Portland and how to get there.  We enjoy meeting travelers and showing them the best of Portland.

name: Shawn And Tami
about: Tami's a graphic designer working out of a home office, Shawn helps out and does renovation work p/t as well. Her favorite travel country so far, is Italy, his Belgium. We enjoy exploring the Portland area on a tandem road bike. and love to ride road and mountain bikes as well. There's a couple of guitars laying around in case anyone wants to jam. We don't have children or pets. We're easy going and hospitable so you're are welcome to ask for anything. The room is part of our house and we'd love to get to know you but with its own entrance you can be as private as you'd like.

name: Anastasiya
about: Hi! We are Anastasiya and Taylor Fielden.  We live and play in Portland, OR. We will do everything to make you feel at home during your stay.  Can't wait to meet you!

name: Joanna
about: Love the Pacific NW, enjoy the Oregon beaches where I have a little cottage, hike in my free time and I practice Chinese medicine and sports acupuncture in NE Portland.  I'm active and healthy and enjoy organic foods.  I live with my partner and our two cats.  I've hosted and been a guest with Airbnb.  I'm respectful and very clean and a good communicator.

name: Charlie
about:
Professional Chef, owner of multiple businesses throughout the Southeast, Southwest, and most recently Northwest portions of the United States.  French-born and raised, I now always travel with my lovely fiancee Ali, and often with our two pet-friends Papo the dog and Coco the bird :
Photography is my first love, real-estate and property management my first major career, and now exploring the food and hospitality fields professionally.  Just finished building, operating, and successfully selling our first restaurant this past July 2014!
Essentially, we are hippies with a very strong work ethic :)

name: Siobhan
about:
We are an American and a South African, who love travel, books, cooking, camping and hiking. 
We've lived in the Portland area for 4 years and still find something new and fun to do all the time.
We love exploring restaurants, wineries and breweries as well as the local literary and art scene, and we'll happily provide recommendations.
Five things we can't live without? Coffee, friends, music, books and travel.
We look forward to hosting you in our home, in a separate space that ensures your privacy.

name: Kim Huong
about: I have been living in Portland since the seventies and have seen Portland changing and growing over the years. Portland  has become a culturally rich city, and in recent years Portland is also a popular travel destination. I enjoy traveling, going places, meeting new people and sharing experiences.

name: Zoe
about:
I am originally from Sun Valley, Idaho but after moving around quite a bit, I have settled in the best neighborhood in Portland, OR... the NW/ Pearl District. I travel quite a bit for work (and play), enough where the TSA agents at the airport know me by name! 
Thought it would be fun to rent out my place while I am gone and meet some other people while traveling.

name: Dawn
about: I'm the office manager for Mandala Medicine wellness center--located upstairs of the apartment :)

name: Eddy
about:
I am a 26 year old male. I graduated from Lane Community college with a Criminal Justice degree, and from the University of Oregon with a Political Science degree. For the last two years, I have been living in Portland. Currently I am a security supervisor for a health care company in downtown Portland.

I work M-F throughout the day. And when I get off work I am usually pretty relaxed around the apartment, or I am out and about in the city.

I enjoy camping, river activities, BBQ's, hanging out and watching shows, playing basketball, enjoying the local breweries and eateries of the neighborhood. And also spending time with my occasionally shy, and tiny, cat Cassie.



(also, I have one review that was meant for my mom. She stayed in the area, but did not have an airbnb account. So I helped her out!)

name: Doug & Cindy
about:
We have lived in our great, old Portland style house for almost 30 years. We are excited to have our guests experience the wonderful diversity, rejuvenation of many old buildings (including the Bagdad theater) and incredible eating experience our neighborhood has to offer! We are close to one of Portland's most beautiful parks (Laurelhurst) that is just a short walk away!
We love to travel and have also stayed in many Airbnb locations.

name: Brooklyn B&B
about:
Erin works in hospitality and enjoys cooking, crafts, and music.

Darin likes playing and watching football (soccer), traveling, good food/wine/beer, most anything you can do outdoors.

We are both excited to be a part of the AirBnB community - to explore new destinations and friendships, as well as to share what we love most about our "big town" of Portland, Oregon.

We're very respectful and curious of other cultures and love to learn new about new places, people, and languages.

Our life mottoes are never be afraid and everything in moderation.

name: Eric
about: Friendly and laid back healthcare professional living the good life in Portland, Oregon. :)

name: Mollie &   Jake
about:
Our family of 4  just moved into our home that we anxiously watched being built all summer and now we want to share it with you! We are so excited to live in this neighborhood that certainly is a close community. We have met most of our neighbors and they have all lived here for years. 

As your hosts we want to make sure your experience here is relaxing and comfortable. We would love to tell you about all the amazing places to visit in Portland and in our hood. Also if the night allows for it, we would love to sit on the porch with you and chat.

name: Jenny
about:
I have two adult children and a wonderfully active husband, Dean. My son was born in Japan and my daughter in Australia during our adventure years when my husband and I were working overseas in the '80's. I am originally from Colorado, but moved to Hawaii as a teenager. I came to Oregon in 1971 and fell in love with Portland and my husband, Dean, (who is a Sacramento, California transplant). Although we have also lived in Ohio and Arizona we always return to Oregon where it just feels ‘right’ here. 
My husband, and I are both recently retired and love the options of airbnb.

name: Jason
about: I've lived in Portland for over 20 years and have loved this city and beautiful state ever since I was a young child visiting family on summer vacations. Enjoy spending time with my family and friends exploring new places.

name: Catherine
about: I'm a retired musician (25 years with the Oregon Symphony) and still teach violin and piano and play in a string quartet for fun.  I was born in Oregon and explored the country after graduating from college.  Then when the time came to marry and have a family, Portland drew me back as the ideal place for children.  I love jazz, bridge and gardening and especially I love my grandson, Lucas!

name: Melanie
about:
Our family of four (three adults & one teen) sometimes speak Japanese in our home as two of us are studying the language. Low German is also an owner's first language, and one of us is pursuing an ESL Certification to teach.

Music:  all styles are appreciated (well, almost all)
Movies:  Friday night pizza, movie, popcorn night
Art:  designers and painters reside here
Garden: We like flowers and have some organic canned and dried food for the winter
Books, Coffee, Conversation:  all habitual
Exercise:  treadmill, stationary bike, sit-up board, weights... a very small workout room used daily
Technology:  we depend on it
Mechanics:  Handyman (owner)
KIS:  Keep it Simple is something we support each other with in our lives.

Need a ride? We can drive you places for a fee.

We love living 4 doors down from a park and two blocks from our church.

When we vacation, we enjoy camping, hotels with hot tubs, B&B, and sleeping in the back of our pickup!

name: Kurt & Ginger
about:
Kurt, a commercial photographer, is a famously hospitable midwesterner. Ginger, an advertising copywriter, is from Seattle. Both of us are passionate about sharing the wonders of the Pacific Northwest with friends and visitors. We've lived in Alberta Arts for more than a decade, and we've enjoyed watching it become the mecca of food, drink, coffee, shopping and relaxing that it is today.

We purchased this adorable home in 2013 thinking we would love to have a larger space for in-laws to stay when they visit. The house was full of potential for comfortable, modern living and a full-year renovation later, ta-da. Handsome Hideaway was born. We are now thrilled to share it with visitors from all over the world.

name: Robin
about: I am a hairstylist and painter in Portland Oregon. I enjoy nature and food and laughing and making art.

name: Alison
about: I am a freelance writer, attorney (don't let that scare you) and mother of three young kids. My husband and I love exploring Portland with our children, and can give you lots of great ideas for Portland-based adventures.

name: Ryan
about:
We've lived in Portland for 14 years and are grateful to call it home. Sellwood neighborhood is a great place to live for many reasons including the sense of community, the proximity to parks, hiking trails and bike paths in addition to being very walkable.

I'm a yoga instructor and my husband is a fine woodworker. Eric's 600 square foot studio is on the same property as Sellwood Garden Home. He loves Japanese design, pre- Columbian art and builds boats and bikes in his spare time (although he'll tell you there's no such thing). I love strong coffee, caesar salads, ginger cookies and red wine. Lucky for me I can walk down the street and find all of the above most anytime of the day.

We are travelers and try to getaway whenever we can. We love Mexico, Central America and would love to do more exploring in South America. Ecuador and Italy are two of our favorite places. 
 
Family and friends are a priority and spending time with them was one reason we decided to host through Airbnb as we wanted to have a comfortable, nearby place for them to stay when they're in town. Our property is kid-friendly, complete with a swing on the old apple tree.

In addition to Eric and me being around to help out and answer questions; our manager, Evelyn, who lives on site, is also available. We trust your stay with us will be all that you hope for (and maybe just a little more!). 

Free Sunday Yoga classes!

For more info about us please visit (URL HIDDEN) or (URL HIDDEN)

name: Sarah
about: I'm an easy-going, fun girl who loves to travel!! I've been to 18 countries and counting...  Meeting people is one of the best things about traveling. Therefore, I am really excited to be hosting on Airbnb to help other travelers to make the most of their adventures!! I've been a massage therapist for 12 years now, and I feel privileged to assist my clients in their well being. I typically practice my own style of intuitive slow deep pressure massage combined with relaxing transition stokes and some Thai type stretches. Of course I customize the massage to accommodate your needs on that day.   Always relaxing, always therapeutic...I give the massage I want to receive!! So come unwind, get a massage, and revive in a beautiful setting in the best city in the world!!

name: Edward
about:
Live life!

There is so much to do and see in this amazing world. Life is short so experience as much as you can. 

My goal is to have at least one international trip a year. I love to cook, hike, ski, golf, and kiteboard. Music is an extremely important aspect of my life. 

I love introducing people to the wonderful restaurants we have in Oregon. So if you need a suggestion, feel free to ask!

name: Karen
about: from Portland, love to walk, bike, snorkel, meet people from throughout the planet.

name: Victoria
about:
Greetings!
I would love to welcome you to my little sweet home. Portland is awesome. I have been her for almost 40 years. I am a transplant from an Iowa farm. For that reason, you'll find fresh vegetables in the backyard garden (seasonally, of course) and a very friendly retreat in the city.
I lived in this home for six years and totally enjoyed my walk every day to Pennisular Park where you will find one of the most beautiful Rose gardens and pools in the city.

As a Real Estate agent, I understand transitions. If you have sold your home and/or are waiting for a closing on your new home or even coming from another state and need a short term rental, this home will provide you with every comfort you need while waiting for your new home to close or visiting you college kids (University of Portland is very close by) or just checking out Portland as a possibility for you.

I have lots of experience in property management and understand the need for accessibility. No matter where I am, I can be reached via email, text or an old fashioned phone call to take care of your emergencies should there be any.

Let me know if I can welcome you to my Bungalow!  Victoria

name: Luke & Rachael
about: We are musicians living in Portland. We hope to share our space and our love of this city with others traveling through!

name: Heidi
about: Hi Airbnb! I am a local, born & raised Oregonian. I love living in Portland, where I have raised my two boys for over 20 years now. I run my own ad agency, which focuses on clients across the nation. I feel very blessed everyday to serve my clients! When I am not working long hours with my business partner, I enjoy my down time with my family. I take one trip every year to Hawaii! I am looking forward to traveling more in 2016.

name: Lisa
about: I love to travel, host and meet people.  I am married with two teenagers, and I am a Northeast city girl transplanted to the Pacific northwest.  When I can't be in a big city, I enjoy hiking, kayaking, swimming and stand up paddle boarding (though I spend more time in the water than upright!).  I love to cook and have friends over for dinner.  As a guest, I am considerate, quiet and I like to leave things as I found them.  I love to get inside tips about and area from a local as I generally prefer an authentic experience somewhere rather that the view as a tourist.  As a host, I am friendly and helpful.  I will respect your privacy or visit with you if you prefer.  I'm excited to use Airbnb to travel myself and welcome travelers into my home.

name: Laura
about: I have taken the year off of College to do as much traveling as I can. Almost always traveling with my best friend Brooke. We are always looking for our next adventure!

name: Bonita
about: We are a couple who met at a performing arts college. We love to travel and enjoy meeting new people. David is an actor who has appeared in film, TV and many local theatrical productions. Bonita is a gardener and a volunteer with the SMART (Start Making a Reader Today) program in the local elementary schools where she reads with elementary school children. Is it a joyful experience!

name: Lisa & Joe
about: We are East Coast transplants living in Portland for the past 13 years. We are a family of 4 - journalist (Joe) and a photographer and events co-ordinator (Lisa). with 1 teen and a college student in NYC.  Music, art, books, edible gardening, and travel take up our free time. We know Portland well and are available to make suggestions for the best things to do in the area depending on your interests, both local and for excursions out of the city for couples, singles and families with children.

name: Rick
about:
hello,
my name is rick. 

I live here in portland, oregon.
i work in the medical field.
i enjoy traveling, live music, working on and improving the pad, and  getting some wind in my face on two wheels.

r

name: William
about: Med Scientist, Baking Nerd, Nia and Yoga teacher, Computer Geek, Dad.

name: Cheryl
about:
I'm a mama of Leo. I'm active in the local community, instigating all sorts of projects geared toward local economy and connection to neighbors. There's never a dull moment, and when there is, it's time to rest, relax and/or garden!

Motto: Rosebud, the best is yet to come.

name: Daniel
about: Fun loving person who cannot be outdoors enough. I am blessed to have a loving wife and healthy baby boy.

name: Jennifer
about: We are Jennifer Love and Jonathan Brinkley. We have been blessed with a child, Luca in January 2015. We have been offering B&B space for many years now and enjoy a separate studio to sleep in at night while our guests stay in the main house. I am Jennifer from Portland, Oregon via Salt Lake City, Utah. I am a ceramic artist by day and work in a local Southern Italian restaurant in the evenings. I love being a Mommy and I love music, dancing and cooking. I enjoy gardening and am currently growing winter greens and cover crop. One of my life mottos is to work hard and play big. Five things I can't live without: fine dark chocolate, kale, music, dance, and sunshine. My favorite traveling destinations so far are Sicily and Todos Santos, Mexico. Oh, how I love the desert, cactus and the gentle sound of palm trees rustling in the wind! I have a dream to run a large Bed and Breakfast, Hacienda style with warm desert colors, lots of tacos and homemade ice cream! Jonathan is a musician and voice teacher. Together we have traveled all over Europe sharing Jonathan's music via concerts in peoples' living rooms! We love to host and share all of our favorite spots in Portland.

name: Paula
about:
Hi, my name is Paula and I would love to have you as a guest at my cottage. I am down to earth and very easy to talk to. All my guests are respected and treated equally. I keep to myself and do not monitor or distract my guests, but I am very easy to get a hold of if anyone ever needs anything.

:)

name: Mike
about: Portland based Photographer and musician. I love to surf and travel, and make every effort to mix the two.

name: Lucy
about:
Hi there! We are Lucy and Ian, and we enjoy meeting interesting people, hearing about travels, and learning about where to see great art, cultural traditions and enjoy the local cuisine.

About Lucy
I love to travel, and had an amazing time on a shoestring trip around the world in '09-'10. Since then, we did an amazing Malaysia/Thailand trip, and hope to do a longer trip when work schedules allow. Getting outdoors is always great (when it's not raining too hard around here). Summer will find us hiking, backpacking, and camping as often as we can. I pack the essentials and Ian invariably adds a bottle of wine. 

About Ian 
I love to eat, and enjoy hearing about great places to have a meal – from the humblest of food stalls to a Michelin-starred restaurants. I also enjoy local performance and art, and here at home you'll often find us at art galleries, the Oregon Shakespeare Festival and Portland's Time-Based Art Festival.

name: Puji
about:
Originally from the Midwest, I now call the quirky and creative city of Portland my home.  I may be biased but I think my neighborhood of St Johns is one of the most beautiful places in the city- from the landmark bridge to sweeping Cathedral Park- there is so much to see and do in this little North Portland pocket.  I would love for you to come and see for yourself and let me know if you agree!  A little bit about me:  I work for a local eco-friendly paint company during the day, make handmade ceramics in my spare time, and grow vegetables when the sun is shining at my local community garden.
My cell numb(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)!

name: Jana
about: Wish airbnb had existed back in the day when I had more time to travel! Staying in someone's home is a much better way to authentically experience a city and meet interesting people. My favorite things to do when traveling are to walk around, take in the sites and people, and enjoy the local cuisine and culture. I've lived in Berlin, London, Brussels, Washington DC, Baltimore, and now call Portland home.  I love spending time in Europe, on the East Coast visiting friends, exploring my backyard in the Pacific NW, and am hoping to visit SE Asia soon. I recently returned from a trip to Turkey and Italy. I rent my house on Airbnb while I'm traveling and enjoy using Airbnb whenever I can. I work for the Oregon wine industry and am a food and wine aficionado.

name: Jacque
about: We all live in Portland Oregon. A very hip place to be. You should try it sometime.

name: Carrie
about: Hi, I am from Portland, Oregon.  I like to ride my road bike, mountain bike, ski, kite board and make clothing from previously worn then discarded garments.  I am a technical outerwear and sportswear designer and I work from home 3 days a week.  I enjoy talking to others about their creative pursuits and fun outdoor stuff.  I enjoy learning about our guests home place, and their individual adventures.  Dan is an engineer who also loves outdoor sports.  We can answer questions about the city or where to go for a run, a bike ride or some favorite spots for a beer.  Otherwise we will leave you alone to create the adventure you are seeking.

name: Barbara
about: I am and wife and mother of two awesome boys.  We found an acre in the city, something almost unheard of, and are working to farm and cultivate a beautiful landscape and gardens.

name: Erica
about: I came to Portland about two years ago from Bakersfield, California and have never looked back! I love my new adopted city and all the food, outdoors activities and eccentricities it has to offer. When I'm not hosting I'm a Child and Family Therapist but my training is in Art Therapy. The rest of my household includes my partner Jason and our two cats Harold and Sebastian. In general I love cooking, creative projects, swimming, hiking, reading books and hanging out with friends. I enjoy hosting because of all of the very cool and interesting people I get to meet and I like sharing my love of Portland with others.

name: Rod And Kathy
about:
We are new to the Portland Oregon area and excited about the new future awaiting us. We love hosting people in our house and have had people living with us most of our married life. We are getting ready to become first time grandparents to twins and are very excited. 
We like watching home improvement shows and some cooking competitions, throw in a mystery or two and we are happy for hours. 
We have 2 dogs that have a special place in our heart. They are gentle and they like people just like us.
We are HUGE football fans, we love the Denver Bronco's and the Arizona Cardinals. Football is on in our house every weekend during the season.

name: Kathy
about:
I enjoy travel and have been to India, England, Wales, Germany, Greece, Hawaii, Mexico and lots of other places in the US.  I walked 580 miles of the Camino de Santiago (in France and Spain) in the summer of 2013.  I love walking (as you can tell), photography, awesome plant-based whole food meals and being in nature or visiting new places. 

I am "very Portland" with a vegan diet, being eco-conscious, loving all the great food we offer and embracing creativity and diversity as a good thing.  I am a retired RN manager, now gone blogger, who's exploring minimalism and creating a life well lived!

I am responsible, respectful and am easy to get along with.  I am new to airbnb and at first I was a guest and liked it so much I am now a host!

name: Sue
about: Avid dancer, hemi-vegetarian foodie who also teaches qigong. Loving life here in the Pacific Northwest, but always on the lookout for some healthy doses of sunshine!

name: Shirley
about: I'm from Portland, OR and I work in the wine industry so that is a passion of mine but also enjoy the great outdoors for hiking, water play and just getting back in nature. I travel quite a bit for work but am hoping to do more of that for pleasure!

name: L
about:
Hi. I have a love for experience; culture, humans, fashion, art and music. Good vibes always 

I've both hosted and traveled on airbnb and I can say that after my European excursion I'm a pro.

name: Paul
about: My wife and i both grew up in the Midwest but met each other in Portland 10 years ago and now have a two year old son. This city is definitely our home now and we love all that Portland has to offer. We'd be more than happy to give some local recommendations to anyone coming to Portland for a visit.

name: Rodney
about:
I love music and any type will do, depending on my mood.  I am a pretty good singer, so I hear ;).  I love travelling in all of its forms: road trips, foreign, camping, hiking, train, walking, etc.  Adventure and learning is what makes me tick.  I love movies that evoke emotion and those that make people think about new ideas:  The Fountain, Inception, Braveheart, most comedies, Twilight Zone, etc.  I also love good vampire flicks.

Having me as a host is easy-peasy.  The place is clean, comfortable, and set up for you to enjoy.  I am always quick to reply to messages and am usually home or nearby at the medical school.

I hope to make your acquaintance one of these days!

name: Elizabeth
about: Happily married couple from groovy Portland! We're native Oregonians so we can help make your experience really special. We keep up on the food and music scene and are avid outdoors people. And as you can see, we're big readers so enjoy our personal library while you're visiting!

name: Koesmanto
about: My name is Koes Bong and I am a Software Engineer Manager at Upsight.  I live in the beautiful Portland, OR with my wife and 2 young kids.

name: Venessa & Cory
about: Some of my favorite things are gardening and pottery. With the help of my husband who is a koi keeper, we have a beautiful koi pond and waterfall. We spend a lot of our time just enjoying our garden. We also love the outdoors and all that Oregon has to offer like great food, breweries, etc.

name: Chris
about:
I moved to Portland in 1996 after living "east of the Mississippi River" for 28 years.  Having moved around a lot while growing up, Portland is the first place that has ever felt like home! I have a wonderful family - two kids, a wife and a dog. We are a pretty easy going crew, enjoy being outside, cooking healthy food and reading.

I love to travel - although these days, we mostly camp. I sailed around the world years ago and still have some dream destinations on my list - including Africa, Iceland and Greece.

I can't live without good friends, books, chocolate, music and plants!

name: Katie
about: We are Katie, Andrew, and Juniper. We have spent the last 3 months traveling in India and Thailand. Now we are getting settled in Portland. We love to play games! Andrew invents board and card games. Katie is an herbalist and yoga teacher. Juniper enjoys board books and long walks on the beach.

name: Nick And Monique
about:
I am a Portland native and my wife, Monique, is a long time Oregonian.  I am a woodworker and Monique is a Speech Pathologist. We love enjoying all the things Oregon has to offer.  We are avid snowboarders, and also enjoy rock climbing, hiking with our daughter, drinking good beer, wine and coffee.  We also love all the amazing food that Portland prides itself on.  Hedonism comes easy in our household:). We love meeting travelers and learning more about where they are from, and have made some great friends with past guests!  We are glad to point you in the right direction of where to go and what to do during your visits to Portland, and are always available for recommendations.
Look forward to meeting you!

name: Patricia
