about: We love international and domestic travel and love meeting new people.

name: Jill
about: My partner Donnella and I own the studio, which is adjacent to our home. We enjoy having AirBnb guests from around the country and world. We both love travel, the outdoors and spending time in our garden. We also enjoy dining in Portland, where there are tons of great restaurants and breweries.

name: Mini House
about:
Hi, I love traveling and art. I also travel around the world.
Really love to share our traveling experience with you.

name: Mira
about:
Originally from Europe I have been in Portland, OR for 25 years. I enjoy Portland cultural (galleries, theaters, piano concerts, etc...) and culinary attraction.
On regular basic I am going for a walk, pilates, etc...
I am glad to serve as a host because I like meeting people and assist them during the stay.

name: Tricia
about:
I moved to Oregon 15 years ago and love living in the Pacific Northwest. 
When not working at a gardening lifestyle store, I enjoy trail running, puzzles, and reading.

name: Jenifer
about: Cali native, Portland mom.  Love the outdoors, fresh air, active lifestyle and the best tasting water in the country that Portland Oregon offers.

name: Eric
about: I'm just an average guy married to a wonderful woman.  I manage many rental properties around Portland (most are long term rentals) and have just begun to dabble in AirBnB listings.  I love outdoor activities, trying out the abundance of good restaurants in town and I like to cook.  I'm also an aspiring photographer.    I have 4 children - all adults now (legally at least!) and two dogs.  I've traveled all over the globe using AirBnB and love the service.  I enjoy talking about all the great things Portland has to offer and making suggestions for visitors and locals alike.

name: Santha And Michael
about:
We are a family of three: Michael is an independent business person and local wine merchant. He loves bike riding, live music, and Everything New Orleans. Santha is a high school educator and gourmet chef. She loves to run on an almost daily basis, knit, cook, and is a voracious reader. Our son is a bright and very socially adept 11th grader. He enjoys playing sports and procrastinating on his homework assignments. We are also the proud owners of a Pug named Juno. She is very sweet, adorable, and loving.

All of us enjoy life inside this bubble that we call Portland! We are outdoor people with busy social lives. We exercise, eat well, and enjoy going out to a show or the movies on occasion. Much of our home life revolves around our lovely kitchen where Santha's culinary skills have become legendary in our community! Most of the food that we eat is locally sourced and we also like to enjoy a nice bottle of wine and lively conversation with dinner.

name: Kathy
about: We are Portland locals with a love for our city and hospitality. We love roasting coffee, mentoring young creatives and hanging out with our grandkids. We have been working with University students from around the world for 25 years.

name: Co Co
about: i work in the interior design business.  we own many vacation rentals and live in california oregon and europe.

name: Christopher
about: Currently in Portland, ex Brooklyn NY and Boston MA. Experienced traveler and host dedicated to being awesome to everyone, all the time.

name: Dwan
about:
I'm a seasoned world traveler with destinations typically in India & SE Asia.  I also enjoy road trips in the USA and when doing so I often visit national parks and music festivals: taking scenic routes. I usually travel solo.  
I do not smoke or use drugs.  I am quiet and very respectful (observer of the "golden rule").  
When at home I enjoy preparing green smoothies, juicing and crock pot dishes made from organic ingredients.  
I watch a lot of movies, mostly old classics, documentaries and comedies.
I've lived in Portland for over 20 years and in the house I own for all that time.  I know this city pretty well and have an insider view on lots of great things going on here.  I host 2 different rooms in my house via Airbnb.
I'm happy to share with guests some of the fun and amazing events and destinations going on here in the Portland area.  My style of hosting is flexible and based on guests' preferences I can be available or give space for quiet solitude during a stay at my home.

name: Beth
about:
I am a kind, fun and adventurous person. I am married to a super kind and wonderful man, and we have two lovely guys that we've raised. My dogs–Shadow and Baxter–are the sweetest boys on earth. I am certain of this. 
Here are a few fun facts about me:
1- I love to travel pretty much more than anything
2-I've been a vegetarian for 32 years
3-I write murder mysteries. My third book takes place in Portland
4-Some day I want to live in Paris
5- I am a big believer in the Golden Rule

When I travel, I am never in my room. I'm neat and don't smoke cigarettes or  wear heavy perfume. 

When I host, I let the guest make the rules about how much of us they want to see. We have lots of knowledge about food and drink and fun things to do and are happy to share if asked. I will text you each morning when I make coffee to offer you some unless you ask me not to.

name: Nicole
about:
Hello, I'm Nicole, I'm originally from New York, although I've lived in Portland for nine years.  I love living here, witnessing the beauty of the Pacific NW everyday.  My favorite thing about Portland is the trees - called "the Standing People" by the First Nations.  I also love the abundance of crows, hummingbirds, other birds, butterflies and wildlife.  The skyline is very pretty. 

I'm mother to three wonderful dogs, Lola, Rémy and Wren.  They eat home cooked meals, and their favorite things are walks and petting. 

I'm a Prop Master and Set Dresser for local theatre although I hope to write, direct and act sometime soon. 

I enjoy books, movies and shows.  You can often find me gardening at home, feeding the crows and hummingbirds, or sitting on my back porch.  Biking and walking around town is fun too.  

My spiritual practice is largely made up of kindness, forgiveness and not taking things too seriously.

name: Greg And Jen
about: Greg and Jen have lived in Portland for decades.  We love it, and can offer you many suggestions for local and regional adventures.  We have two teens, so we can also advise parents on Portland kid places to go/things to do.  Greg is a software engineer and avid cyclist.  Jen is an environmental activist and urban farmer.   You will have complete privacy, but please feel free to ask us about hikes, bike trails, breweries, farmers' markets, events, etc.

name: Bina
about:
I am a relative newcomer to Portland, and moved here from the Bay Area in January 2015.  Prior to that, I've also lived in Chicago, Boston, London.  I love to travel and so have enjoyed traveling all over the world, often staying in homes with hosts such as airbnb.  My special interests are good food (especially vegetarian), hiking the outdoors, running, yoga and meditation.  I'm super excited to now have enough space to host other travelers and "give back" to the hosting community. 
Tambien se habla español, entonces puede escribirme en español si este mejor para usted.

name: Sonia
about:
Designer, Rehabber, Salvager.
I like to create beautiful spaces for people to enjoy.

my life/design motto is: 
if you cant fix it....feature it.

name: Yasmeen
about: We are  easygoing, quiet, clean, and organized professionals with lots of interests and hobbies. We're into travel, dance, meditation, yoga, riding bicycles, and reading lots of books, among many other things. Most of all we love community building and spending time with friends and family.

name: Kerry
about:
I'm an east coast girl who's been living on the west coast since 1998, so perhaps that makes me a west coast girl now! 

By day I work for the Northwest Earth Institute, a small nonprofit doing big things to inspire a more sustainable future. The rest of the time I'm kept on my toes by my two little ones, and planning adventures with my partner in life, Mark. 

We just finished our guest house/tiny house and are looking forward to meeting new people as we venture into hosting. We love to travel, and while life and our kiddos keep us relatively local at the moment, we're more than happy to help guests enjoy everything Portland has to offer! 

I'm a runner, hiker, gardener, cyclist, whiskey lover, and food enthusiast too :-)

name: Annie
about: We love hosting visitors to beautiful Portland and love to travel as well. It is a joy to meet people from around the world and welcome you into our home. I am a nurse at the teaching hospital here in Portland. We enjoy the beauty of our surrounding wilderness, mountains, and ocean, as well as the diversity and energy of our vibrant city. We look forward to meeting you!

name: Anne
about: I grew up in a large rural Washington family in the foothills of the North Cascade Mountains. Our vacations were camping trips to places like Lake Chelan, Alta Lake, Lake Wenatchee and on the train to Glacier National Park. We moved to Portland in the late 1960's. I love the natural world, birds, gardens, outdoor music festivals, dancing, playing my autoharp, fiddle and singing bluegrass and old time songs. I cook, take long walks, and create beautiful indoor and outdoor spaces with my Feng Shui business. I have painted quite a few intricate mandalas with gouache paint and enjoy drawing portraits and other sketches. I have a simple eclectic spiritual practice and view of the world. Teachers include Eknath Easwaren, Pema Chodron, Ekhart Tolle, Mooji, Gangaji, Adyashanti, Jesus and Thich Nhat Hanh. I love to practice healthy communication and I am a part-time counselor in private practice. I've traveled a lot and have lived in Mexico and England/Wales. I love having travelers come to my Airbnb guest room. It's almost as good as traveling myself! I'm happy to share my sweet home.

name: Jennifer
about:
About me: I'm an outgoing, friendly, upbeat, active, (golf/tennis/bicycling /swimming/design consultant), 50's professional female. I look forward to hosting those who want to experience this beautiful city of ours! Coming to Portland to settle down, visit family & friends or maybe on work-related assignments. I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life. I am also interested in hearing pieces of your journey as it relates to Culture/Cuisine/Successes and Challenges in life. I relate well with all ages. Listening to & hearing stories from others' experience is a wonderful way of connecting and one of the best ways of learning, growing and enriching our paths My home is open to those visiting Portland for longer month long stay and possibly shorter stays.     

Just an FYI: My home is going on the real estate market! At this time, there are projects being worked on.  Yet, still am accepting reservations for rooms that are unaffected by the updates. Please note: Once listed, the house will be shown to interested parties. Viewing appointments will be set with guests needs in mind, as much as possible. These appointments may last for up to 30-minutes, typically scheduled in the mid-afternoon. A Broker will always accompany a buyer through the house and while viewing any Occupied bedroom/bath. I hope this does not discourage you from inquiring about Stay. Please let me know of any concerns. I will do my best to make your stay as enjoyable and as pleasant as possible. Thank you.

name: Michael
about: I am lucky to have been borne and raised in Portland. If it's here I know about it. if you need ideas for things to do or have an emergency situation or need directions or anything else just ask.

name: Art
about:
Bettina has owned the property for 18 years. 
Bettina and I met through cycling. 
We have a black lab, Tucker. As of January 2016 he is 19 months and about 85 lbs. 
I play competitive racquetball, enjoy squash, and am an avid cyclist. 
Bettina enjoys yoga, motorcyling, skiing, and cycling. 
We enjoy Portland and the food it has to offer.

name: Michiel
about:
Michiel: originally from the Netherlands, chief technology officer for a software start-up company.

Maricela: originally from Mexico, a full-time mathematics student at Portland State University.

Both: tango dancers, foodies, board gamers.

name: Amy
about:
Hi, I love Oregon and we've lived here for 17 years.  My husband, two teenaged sons and I live in Tigard, about 12 miles from downtown Portland, and we have another vacation rental on the Oregon Coast called LincolnCityBeachHouse  
We love to provide a great experience for our guests! Having traveled the world and stayed in all sorts of places from thatched huts to resorts, I know I'd be happy to land in one of my rental houses.

name: Yerachmiel
about:
Being raised in the Midwest, it was my dream to relocate out of New York where I had been living for 10 years.  That dream came true about two years ago when the opportunity to teach in a Portland Day School came up.  My wife was raised in Queens, New York and has learned to enjoy all that the Pacific Northwest has to offer.  
When traveling we love to be pampered, and we think no different of any guests of ours.  That is why you can expect comfort and luxury, coupled with great service at our home.

name: Mitch
about:
I like to dabble and explore.  It's kind of why I like this house and 'hood so much.  It's a great mix of 'away' and 'near stuff.'  The attic can be completely away from the world, but get on a bike (I have loaners) and you're 10 minutes from some of the cooler parts of Portland [Alberta, Mississippi, Peninsula Park].  Pizza's on the other corner of this very block, while Thai and Ethiopian are 4 blocks the other way.  I'm happy to give suggestions, or you can just grab a map and go.  Come and go as you like, stop and chat, or just keep running...

As for me, I go for everything from ecology to baking to history to writing.  Just picked up a kayak.  I suppose in some ways I'm stereotypically Portland:  I bike to work, I'm clearing space for raised beds, and I like rain.  I read pretty widely, and travel when I can.  But I love to hear what other folks are doing and finding in Portland:  it seems like such a natural place to visit.   

Also, as a sidenote, I can't always get to my phone in this job(/life?), so my response may not always be within 10 seconds.  But I WILL get back to you.

And don't forget Maggie the Cat.  Super-sweet, although she can be a little shy.  A lapcat that loves running:  who knew?

name: Ed
about:
I am a Video producer.
Our family built a 'mother-in-law' apartment on the side of our house. Complete 800 sqft , full kitchen and bath.  Our 96 year old mother in law needed more help so had to move into our home. Hence we have an available one bedroom apt.
My wife Cheryl and I have lived here for the past 30 years. We enjoy ggod wine, movies and food as well as have interests in green technologies. I am also have the hobby of Ham Radio.

name: Renata
about:
I am a creative fun people person.  I have a home here in beautiful Portland Oregon and also a condo in West Hollywood CA and  travel frequently between both places.

I've spent a lot of time gardening and truly cultivating a beautiful outdoor environment on my property. Each year brings new challenges and opportunities for me to learn more as I continue to plant new things.

name: Luke
about: Hi! I live in Portland, Oregon (USA) and enjoy the food, outdoors, friendly people, and generally slower pace of life in this lovely city along with my wife, Joy, and son, Sebastian. We love to travel and meet new people from a wide variety of life experiences.

name: Ed
about: Ed is a retired Amtrak engineer who loves to golf. Need a tee time? Just ask! Kym works in fashion and can tell you the best places to shop for fabric.

name: Hannah
about: My husband Don and I are from Portland, Oregon. I'm a freelance journalist who writes about food, agriculture, integrative medicine, and travel. Don is also a journalist, but his focus is labor issues and politics.  We love to explore new cultures, hike, dance, read, and cook and eat yummy local food. My favorite destination so far is Slovenia; Don's is either Cuba or Latvia. But we also love exploring our corner of the U.S.: the Olympic Peninsula, the Wallowas, Seattle, and the Oregon Coast.

name: Sally
about: I am a grade school teacher in Portland. We like traveling during summer breaks and have had great experiences renting through airbnb as guests. We live in one of the best parts of Portland for many of the things that I enjoy, such as the great restaurants in NW Portland and exploring the trails of Forest Park. We look forward to sharing our beautiful home with guests!

name: Kathy & Andrew
about: We are a teacher and journalist who enjoy the outdoors and spending time with friends and family.  We love living in Portland and hope our guests love the city as much as we do!  Privacy and comfort are our top priorities for our guests.  We look forward to your stay!  - Kathy & Andrew

name: Miriam
about:
I'm a native New Yorker but have lived in Portland for the last 20 years. I've also lived in Berlin (nearly 12 years) and Paris (about two years). I've traveled a lot in Europe and have also visited the Middle East, Asia and Central America. 

I can give you tips about Portland and Oregon in English, French, German and Spanish. I'm currently learning Arabic, but can't say much at the moment. 

I'm vegetarian and a foodie (as well as a hobby cook) and can tell you where to find the best craft beers, Pilsners, wine bars, coffee and the city's most outstanding chocolate croissant (in walking distance from my house).

After all that eating you gotta move. I'm an avid triathlete -- albeit a slow one, as in I never win anything -- but I can tell you where to swim, bike and run. I also like to ski, hike and watch professional soccer. I am a Timbers and Hertha fan, but with some effort I can tolerate Sounders and Bayern München fans. I love Die Mannschaft.

My home is super modern -- designed by a European architect - and has lots of steel and wood. The room has one queen bed, some storage space and a desk and chair. It looks out onto my backyard garden.

My 20 y.o. son lives with me but he is hardly around. He can talk your ear off about motorcycles.

Panda, our 9 y.o. Pug-Terrier mix, is a family member. Your well behaved, friendly dog is quite welcome. Sorry no cats. 

I really enjoy meeting new people  - especially folks who have backgrounds different than my own, but New Yorkers are of course always welcome!

name: Wojtek & Trey
about: We love to travel, food and Portland. We are excited to open up our home to folks visiting the Rose City. We are new to hosting but have had some of the most amazing experiences as Airbnb travelers. We hope to make your stay here relaxing and memorable.

name: Joyce
about: I enjoy providing a comfortable, relaxing space for my guests. I have a lifelong interest in native plants and herbs, some of which you will see in my garden. Currently, I'm working on providing food for bees and other pollinators by increasing the number and variety of native plants.

name: Chris
about:
I have worked with youth for the past 15 years.  I am currently working in the Portland Public School system.  I work directly with youths and their families.  I am originally from East Lansing Michigan.  I lived in South Korea for  two and a half years teaching English and traveled around Southeast Asia during that time.  

I perform improv on the weekends and am an ensemble member with a local theater company.  I enjoy staying active and traveling.  I'm not a big drinker but enjoy dancing and seeing live music or theater.   I also enjoy watching movies and going for long walks around the city. 

The space I host is warm and accepting of other peoples culture, ethnicity, race, religion, sexual orientations and identities. I value diversity and consider myself to be open-minded.  I am available to help if you want advice about where to go or what to eat but I will not impose on your vacation or trip.  I understand the value of giving people space.  I'm very busy but you can always reach me by phone if I'm not at the house.  When I travel and stay as a guest I am clean and respectful of other peoples spaces.  I am a seasoned traveler and I don't require much assistance in most cases.

name: Susan
about: I'm a prop stylist and set designer, and my home reflects my love of collecting and travel.  I lived in San Francisco for 12 years, and NYC for 7, but as a 6th generation Oregonian, I'm glad to be back in my home state. My travels have taken me to the Middle East, China and Europe, but lately, I've enjoyed exploring closer to home.

name: Arlene
about: Social, outgoing woman dedicated to community and family.  I love gardening, cooking, traveling and most outdoor sports.

name: Paul
about:
I'm a web designer, Internet entrepreneur, business consultant and guitar player. I work from home, so I'm usually here to guide and serve. I love to cook, play music, and spend time with my daughter. I'm an East Coaster originally, and spent most of my earlier days in Maine, Boston and New York City. I'm enjoying watching Portland grow into an international city while refining it's amazing food, tech and geek culture. 

I look forward to meeting you, and showing you a fun and memorable stay in the Funky Pad.

name: Kat & Matt
about: From Portland Oregon.  We are easy going and like to travel and meet new people.  Matt likes to work with his hands and do carpentry work.  Kat is an aspiring writer and loves to design and decorate.  When its not raining in portland we like to be outdoors.  Days lounging and reading books in the park or going on an adventure, and evenings with friends sharing a drink or having a backyard Barbeque are how we would spend an ideal day.

name: Allyson And Jose'
about:
Love to travel with our family and friends, people watch, drink cappuccino.  Enjoy music, design, spa/wellness and the arts. We are quality of life junkies and enjoy meeting fellow members of the Airbnb community.
The Danish word "hygge" is loosely translated to mean coziness or feeling content.  We hope our guests feel hygge when they stay with us.

name: Jeanine
about:
My family and I have been privileged to have been welcomed and hosted by  amazing people all over the world- living and working in, volunteering and visiting so many beautiful places...we have tried to reflect  that gift of hospitality we have received  in our own home throughout the years. We want to welcome you to Emerson House and Portland! 
We hope we can make your time in Portland relaxing and memorable. We are happy to give you tips on what to do and see in our beautiful, artsy, fun city while giving you the space you need at our Emerson House, which is both urban and restful.  Mississippi District, bike lanes, PCC Cascade, award winning restaurants, Peninsula Park, ALberta Arts are all within reach from our home. Come and see.

name: Jeremy
about:
I am an attorney, live music fan, skiier, beer geek, foodie, and traveler. I love to eat it all, drink it all (in moderation of course), and see it all wherever I go.

Going on safari in Botswana and seeing the 2010 World Cup in South Africa are among my all-time favorite vacations.

name: Cameron
about: Engineer, music lover, beer lover, dog lover

name: Heather
about: I live in Portland, OR and am the mom to a 10-year-old little girl. I love to travel and experience different cultures. Volunteer with Child Life at OHSU/Doernbecher.

name: Jess And Mark
about: Family of four who loves to spend every possible moment outdoors.

name: Kat
about: I am a performer and an educator.  My background is in theater and dance & media arts.  I teach yoga and voice as well as Butoh dance here in Portland.  I've lived in Los Angeles, New York City, Barcelona Spain, Mexico, London and Northern California... I love to travel and especially like to sink in to a culture and stay awhile.  I practice and study Indian Classical music and am learning Hindi.  I'm a fluent Spanish speaker.  I enjoy garden fresh food, coming together in community for ceremony and sharing songs from different parts of the world.  I am a mom of an amazing 11 year old!

name: Jon And Seth
about:
We are two single gay men.   Jon is 48 and Seth is 57.  We love to entertain and meet new people.  You can come and go as you please, or join us as we explore area restaurants, night life and movies/theater. 
Jon is an arborist, and would like to open a restaurant soon. He is a great cook, and normally is the cook in the house when he is not out exploring all the area restaurants.   He is a native of the area, and is very knowledgeable about how to navigate Portland.  He leaves very early in the morning and returns at dinner time.
Seth is a non-profit executive and also is a marketer of food, gifts and artisan products from across Oregon and Washington.  In addition to running the Oregon State Parks Foundation, he runs an online marketplace called Best From The Cascades.  Seth is an east coast (DC) transplant, but has been in Portland now for 13 years.
There is a people friendly Cat named Dexter, but he is not so tolerant of all kinds of other animals, so additional pets would have to be discussed.
We both love meeting new people and can give lots of pointers about discovering the unique spirit of Portland.

name: Mazen
about:
To sum myself up in three words, I would say "adventurous", "positive", and "passionate" best fit the bill.

My name is Mazen. I was born in Homs, Syria, a major trading city on the west side of Syria, near Lebanon. In 1997, at the age of four, my mother and I moved to Portland. After two months of living with a relative, we got our first apartment on 30th and Belmont. There, we settled in for a short while before moving out toward SE Portland. 

By the time I started first grade, my mother and I found a great apartment near SE Portland.  There, we stayed for nearly 17 years before my mother re-married and moved out and I settled into a condominium in downtown Portland, where I currently reside. In my life, 

I've traveled to Jordan, Lebanon, countless cities in Syria, southern Turkey, Amsterdam, San Francisco, and, most commonly, Seattle. I laugh when I share my list of travels as I have never been Vancouver, Washington (a mere fifteen minute drive from Portland), Bend (a three hour drive), or Eugene (another three hour drive). There are many places in the world that I wish to travel to. The top on my list include Ireland, Germany, and Norway.

I finished a trip through Iceland, Paris, Amsterdam, and Berlin in September of 2016. I have always wanted to travel to Germany because I took four years of German language courses in high school and two terms in college. I thoroughly enjoyed the trip and am excited to (maybe) move to Amsterdam in the future.

When I travel, I travel light. One suitcase is what I limit myself to. I leave a little space for gifts and souvenirs I know I will bring back. It is almost embarrassing how much of my travel expenses go toward food. On my five-day, four-night trip to San Francisco, I flew back home with a brain full of awesome memories... and a keychain with a decorative Golden gate Bridge image printed on it that I found in a restaurant. The rest was spent on amazing food.

Life is about the journey. It is not about where you end up.

name: Marley
about: Hello all, Marley here. I'm a young professional traveling between Portland and L.A. Adventuring to new places, music, and family are my life. We love having people come to visit us and hope they leave feeling well rested and inspired by the space we've created.

name: Emily & Chad
about: Chad and I are an adventurous couple from Portland, OR who love backpacking, kayaking, and exploring Portland. We got married in summer 2014. Chad hails from Phoenix and is a huge AZ Cardinals fan. He also loves rock climbing, animals, and eating thai food. Emily hails from Sonoma County, California and is an urban planner who loves adventurous baking, gardening, and eating pie. Emily studied abroad in Denmark in high school and again in Germany in college. She loves meeting people from other parts of the US and from other countries and pointing them to the best things Portland has to offer.

name: Emily & Derek
about: We are a high energy couple - we like to hike, run, work out, paint, do home projects, explore and learn! We have a modest but beloved library ranging from political science and economy to comparative mythology and world history, with a smattering of the classics. We try to think of the little things - a vase of flowers, or a homemade candle - that will make the space inviting.

name: Carol
about: I am a seamstress and mother of two boys under three years old. I have a passion for sharing my home and city with others. I travel often to see family and for my husband's music; we value highly the family friendly comforts when we're on the road and we would love to provide those for you. Thanks for stopping by!

name: Nancy
about:
We love travelling, particularly in Latin America (we're both working on our Spanish), and this, in part, is why we chose to do AirBnB; it allows us travel even more:-)

Food of all kinds is another love- we eat out a fair amount, and often get our best ideas for cooking at home that way.

We've both worked as high school teachers, in alternative education, for close to 20 years. The joy we feel watching young people begin to discover themselves- and their own talents and skills- is incalculable.

The Gandhi quote, "[You must] Be the change you wish to see in the world" resonates- it's a good reminder, especially on those days when the line at the grocery store is taking forever, or the paperwork required just to get through life seems unendurable . . .

name: Jeffrey
about: I am a garden designer and stone mosaic artist from Portland, Oregon, USA.  Its a wonderful city with so much to offer.  I am clean, responsible, and courteous.  I travel a great deal in search of beauty.

name: Sean & Shea
about: We are a married couple, both creative professionals, Shea is an architect, and Sean is a commercial photographer.  Since August 2015, we have been renovating and repurposing an old service station in St. Johns. We pride ourselves on contributing to and preserving the architectural richness of the northwest, and invite you to enjoy our craftsman home, full of art and beauty to inspire you.  We thrive when interacting with other traveller's and explorers and offering a one- of-a-kind place of sanctity between adventures.  We welcome you to Portland, and hope you fall in love with it like we did.

name: Donald
about:
My friend, Julia, and I decided to purchase a house in Montavilla, not only to experience the adventures of homeownership, but also to have the opportunity to meet interesting people from all over the country and world.

We both enjoy a wide range of activities, both indoors and out. We love to play board games (Dominion, Cards Against Humanity), stream TV shows (Downton Abbey, Orange is the New Black), read (trashy young adult novels to Ursula Le Guin to Patrick Rothfuss), go on bike rides around the city, hike trails both in the city (Mt Tabor & Forest Park) as well as out (Silver Star, Beacon Rock, Neahkahnie).

name: The
about: Hello I am Toney, 40 years old, owner of this property. I moved here from Michigan 7 years ago and have decided to stay a while. I enjoy bringing old or neglected buildings back to life... It is nice to facilitate spaces and situations where people can enjoy life and appreciate each other's company.

name: Val
about:
I am a host with a buzzing schedule, yet when it is in the flow I enjoy connecting and making sure guests are comfortable and happy.  Sharing a conversation over tea is a lovely treat and I have been truly inspired by all the wonderful stories, cross pollenating of knowledge, and large doses of laughter!:) 

Traveling is a huge part of my life.  One of my very favorite countries is India...hence the colors and themes in my house:)  I also loved my journeys through Western and Eastern Europe, Southern Japan, Belize, Mexico, Bali, Sri Lanka, and Thailand, to name a few! Next stop, Iceland!:)

My other interests are too many to list but some are practicing yoga, dancing, hiking, swimming, stargazing, storytelling, camping, performance art, self-empowerment through lifestyle and diet, sustainable living, slow food, photography, beautifulizing spaces, making up words, laughing, sharing food with family and friends, and hanging out with Sunny our handsome tabby cat.:)

name: Benjamin
about:
London native living in Portland , designer and artist. 
Owner and host of Casa alameda , a beautiful restored, Spanish revival home in the Beaumont / alameda area of Portland. I live here with Jack, the calmest, sweetest little terrier you've ever met !

name: Evan
about: My name is Evan. I'm a native Portlander who has lived, worked and traveled elsewhere but now feel fortunate to be living in my beautiful home town. I recently spent two years leading the complete renovation of this 1902-built house, and very much learning how to do it on the job. I enjoy playing music and going to local live shows, chatting on porches and taking walks in the neighborhood. I used to be a journalist and lived/worked as a writer in Lima, Peru several years ago. Now, running 1234 House is my primary focus.

name: Cynthia
about: We're a small mother-daughter family. We pride ourselves on being mobile and adventurous but we also love our roots and routines. While we're away, we want to share our home because we believe that's the best way to travel–experiencing the little moments as a citizen rather than just a tourist.

name: Julius
about: I enjoy hosting visitors from out of town. Professional, entrepreneur. Outdoor enthusiast, beer enthusiast. I enjoy golfing, snowboarding and surfing.

name: Melanie And Peter
about:
We are longtime Portland residents who love the Northwest! We love camping and hiking, and have tons of outdoorsy recommendations for exploring beyond Portland, because what's outside Portland is kind of the most magical thing about Portland. 

We play music, write, draw, tattoo (one of us does, anyway) . We love cats (especially orange ones), our fabulous garden, and our wonderful friends. When we travel, we want to feel what it's like to live in a place, and that's one of the things we love about airbnb. When we host we're accessible, super friendly, and BRIMMING with awesome recommendations for this super place. 

Melanie speaks Spanish and loves the opportunity to chat with Spanish-speaking guests/hosts!

name: Kim
about:
I'm a design/builder with my partner in business, love and crime.  I also teach yoga and live in Portland, Oregon.  I'm easy going, crafty, fun loving and looking for adventure. I am in love with a beautiful and creative man, Brian.  Together we share an adorable dog named Stew and a small remodel and build  business called KB Handyworks Co.

We love to hike, build stuff, play games with friends, do crossfit, practice yoga, adventure outside, watch movies, cook food, and sit fireside.  We aspire to play music, but haven't booked any gigs lately ;)  We love surrounding ourselves with mindful and inspiring people.

We're easy going and love to share our spaces with people who can appreciate a well crafted room.  

We believe:
Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
-John Muir

name: Anna & Jeremy
about:
We are creators and crafters. A designer and a musician. 
Our love for travel has encouraged us to open our extra living space to others and help save for our own adventures.
We both love Paris and a good last minute roadtrip.
 
As travelers we like to explore on our own but also love to get tips on where to go and what to see from the locals. Tell us about your favorite bar or thrift shop. Know where a good show is gonna be going on? - Awesome!
As hosts we have the same style. We are excited to let you know our favorite places in our amazing city but we will also respect your privacy and will be hands off. 
We live in the main house of our Airbnb rental but have respect for others. We wont be banging around on the drums or keeping you up late with shenanigans. Portland has plenty of places to cause shenanigans, home shouldn't be one of them,

name: Victor & Laurel
about:
I, Victor,  am a reliable, yet chill guy. In my free time I love playing the sax and listening to jazz music, working in the yard or running through one of Portland's great neighborhoods, and eating or cooking fantastic local foods. By day I am an electrician, which means that I actually became the person my seven-year-old self said I wanted to be when I "grew up".

I, Laurel, am a young and healthy senior woman in my 7th decade. I work (often from home) as a writer/editor and communications consultant. I have a background in psychology and also do some performing/presenting of my own creative work. I am currently cultivating my talents as a visual artist and intend to cultivate an organic vegetable garden. I moved to Portland from Santa Monica to Portland last fall to be close to my two young grandchildren. I am excited to host guests in my home because I love interacting with all sorts of people.

name: Cha-Cha
about:
I am a Portland native. 

I grew up in a very Italian American Family. 

I am a free spirited Bohemian. Beauty, Truth, Freedom and Love are my mottos!

 I am always an artist at heart-I love any and every medium no matter how unique and unorthodox it is...

I am a Sagittarian...a warm blooded Italian and expansive thinking Jupitarian…

I always create space and make a welcoming place for "all creature great and small, the good, bad and the ugly, and for all who are stunning and beautifully ordinary…all walks of people in life is what makes the world be and spin forward!

I am a lover of any thing that sings soulfully and dances freely to the beautiful unique beat of their own drummer...

I am Unique and Quirky...Funny, goofy and dorky and like to clown around, laugh and giggle and be merry…...

I am a visionary…

I work hard and play hard...

I have a blessed tribe of amazing, down to earth friends and beloveds..

I sensually imbibe with all my senses...

I love to cook…

I am a good and loyal friend…a musketeer always...I practice the code of "palabra de lobo" "word of wolf" guilty at times of being way too (URL HIDDEN) a material world; those with heart-driven aspirations mean the world to me...

I am more aboriginal than I am techno and cyber, though I am fairly savvy in the latter realm…

I am sometimes a stubborn and fierce activist...

I am a holder of contradictions...people have a hard time defining or pinning me down in an easy all-inclusive bundle--just when they think they know me--they are completely surprised by some new facet.

I am a true romantic at heart…yet anything that even hints at being uber-trite or a bad cliché makes me a bit "cringy" and "crawly".

I believe in timing and synchronicity…

I absolutely love the things that defy...the irrationals as I call them.

I have a huge replenishing well of "joie de vivre" and I am a completely self-professed existentialist~paradox~ (awe the beautiful contradictions) though I view the angst as just an element of life's ironies and an inseparable part of being given a mortal coil and an earthly existence...though wings should be arriving soon...even with the courageous acceptance of irony and angst I am a full-blooded optimist…

I get heavy hearted when I read or watch the news too much, lose a client, or feel my heart is not being cared for properly--but I am also very resilient by nature...

I tend to pass through my funks rather quickly...and if I don't my host of comrades will pull my head out of my ass for me...they are such a blessing...

I think imagination and curiosity and reciprocity and generosity are extremely important qualities to embody to be the best, most fully realized human being possible...

I march to the poly-rhythmic beats of my own drummer…I have been told that I am both graceful in spirit and guileless...

I love adventure and I find great beauty in the mundane.

I love the combination of fire and metal, thus love anything combustible and incendiary

I always try to stay in the present in both mind, body and spirit, with eyes always gazing into the future or towards whatever my heart is calling to my attention to in the moment.

I am a work in progress...And my home is too...

My mission is to create an open, inspiring, creative, and welcoming space for all who enter!

name: Amanda
about: I am an RN living in Portland, OR. I enjoy recreating outside, reading, and spending time with my dog.

name: Paige
about:
Hello! Providing a friendly, inspirational and peaceful environment to guests is something I truly enjoy. I have been sharing my home with housemates and guests since 2004 and get great feedback. AirBnB is a new site for me to use this summer.

I am a friendly, active, happy woman in mid-40s. While raised near Boston, MA, I have lived in New York and San Francisco and traveled a little to Europe, Asia and Middle East, India and Northern Africa. Happy to share and trade travel or life stories over a cup of tea or coffee.

My career is in sustainable community economic development and creative strategy consulting and projects. I also study healing practices and spirituality. 

I enjoy healthy lifestyle with good exercise like yoga, gym, hiking and good vegetarian and organic meats. I am living alcohol-free and enjoying its benefits. This happened as a result of traveling to other countries where there is less focus on alcohol as part of the social life. This may not be everyone's choice which is okay!

My boyfriend is Hugh who is also in his mid-forties. Born in the Native Alaskan Inupiaq Tribe, he is a carver, woodworker, builder and medicinal plant teacher.

We are naturally hospitable, diplomatic, open-minded and respectful of others opinions. 

Pets: The household four-leggeds are:
- Shadow and Spirit, two young boarder collie-german shepard dogs (brother and sister). They are both well-trained and calm.
- Star and Scarab- two independent and friendly cats

We all look forward to meeting you and providing a happy home base for you during your time in Portland.

name: Stephen
about:
Hi! I'm Stephen

I am a life long avid sailor who grew up sailing and racing on the Great Lakes. At 12 years old I had the great good fortune of getting aboard a famous old 1938 racing sailboat: the 12 meter US 14 "The Northern Light", and pretty much spent my summers aboard cruising and racing all around the lakes. I love being on the water and under sail... After having had a blast working for years in film and television as a "Props guy" I am getting back to a deeper passion: teaching sailing again. (I am a USCG Licensed Captain and an American Sailing Association Certified Instructor). You can find me most evenings (or join me if you wish! Be sure to check out Agwe' Sailing on line) out sailing my vintage 1978 sailboat in the most amazing summer breezes on the mighty Columbia river... Wanna go for a sunset sail?!

I also lived in Germany for many years (my family is from a small village there) those were incredible times... ask me about Berlin in the early 90's...

I went to school at the University of Oregon and from there found my way to Alaska and before I knew it I was a commercial fisherman for some years and worked throughout the waters of Alaska - experiences I will treasure all my life.
(Umm, after my first very successful season fishing I never really went back to school... I think I'm still owing some fantastic professors a few papers on European intellectual history...)

I fell head over heals in love with Portland in the 80's when my travels and education brought me to this part of the world. I settled here year round in the mid 90's feeling still as I do today that Portland is an absolutely wonderful "town".
I've owned and managed rental property here in Portland for years now and have really enjoyed it. I am so looking forward to creating great experiences serving and helping my future guests have a great stay here at the Historic Gustave Bartman House!

name: Dona
about:
We are a Finnish-American couple with three grown children. We currently divide our time between Portland, Oregon, and the San Francisco Bay Area where Clyde's job takes him frequently. 

Clyde is a West Coast native; he hikes, backpacks, does fly fishing throughout the Pacific Northwest. His other hobby is the bass guitar. 
I am originally from Helsinki, and I return frequently to Finland to visit family and friends. I enjoy art and fine pottery, and I am always on the lookout for art galleries and quaint coffee shops, which are both readily available in Portland. 

We had a very positive experience with Airbnb last summer while traveling in Finland. Since our work and family responsibilities take us out of town often we decided to give Airbnb hosting a try! As guests, we are responsible, quiet, and clean (non-smokers)...and, as hosts, we welcome anyone who is equally considerate of our space.  Our goal is to provide our guests a welcoming, warm and inviting home away from home.

name: Shayda
about:
Stylist and designer in Portland, OR. I love food, dinner parties, and art. 
I like thrifting, adventure, and creating things with my hands. 

I cherish my friends and lil' family above all else.  

If you would like to know more about me:

You can see a snapshot of my daily life on instagram- 
shaydam

...Or by visiting my website-
(URL HIDDEN)

name: Sara
about:
I like people. I like meeting new people. I consider myself outgoing and friendly. I enjoy arts and making things, and inviting people along to fun activities. 
I like traveling and seeing new places, adventures, biking, movies and helping people explore Portland.

name: Melinda
about: My BF and I live in the area and enjoy spending time down town when time allows! We want others to enjoy the space as we do.

name: Amy
about:
I am a part-time law student focused on the intersection of food law and media and am active in sustainable food issues. Hosting helps me pay my school expenses and focus on public interest work. I enjoy traveling, photography, cooking, reading, writing, wild-foraging, snowboarding, hiking, badminton, film, entertaining and hosting. I like living the quintessential Pacific North West lifestyle--with periodic forays to warm weather or new locales. 

Stints as a travel writer and living in Asia, Europe and Canada at points in my life have honed my instincts for what travelers want and need whether they are staying in luxury hotels or are camped out in beach bungalows. I have strived to implement such small traveler touches in my home--you'll find organic towels, bath products, coffee, milk and sugar. And ping pong to boot!

name: Amber&Ted
about:
Hi from Amber and Ted!
Wanna know our 5 things we can't live without?
Trees
Oceans
Kale
Hugs
Sun+the Moon
…okay that was 6. :)

name: Robert
about: Enjoy interesting people, new food, dive bars and funky music.  Oh, and travel... That's fun too.

name: Tammie
about:
Hi Guests! 
We are a three-person family, with additional family members of Buttercup the cat, Polly the dog, and Tardis the fish.

We enjoy reading, gardening, bike rides, and travel! We love our neighborhood, our tight-knit community,  and our proximity to Mt. Tabor Park, which we visit often, but never often enough!

There are usually neighborhood kids in the front or back yard, but we value peace and quiet, so the kids are kept to a dull roar. ;-)

We think you will enjoy staying in the private studio, and wandering around the neighborhood to check our restaurants, parks, cafes, and Portland, in general. See you soon!

-Tammie, Matthew, and Sophie

name: Tom
about: I am a professional businessman here in Portland. In the travel industry.  I am a fifth generation Oregonian and I love this state and the City of Portland,  I have been working in the travel industry for 37 years and know what hospitality means.  I have been to over 80 countries on 6 continents.    I am a  full time travel agent and work from my office at home. I am a Virtuoso travel agent and so that means when I am not rowing my raft down the Rogue River I am staying at an Orient Express hotel somewhere in the world.    I speak English, French (so-so) and Spanish. I am an avid outdoorsman and ski, hike, bike, kayak and climb. I live in beautiful Washington Park.  My home is next to the Japanese Gardens and just above the world famous Rose Gardens.  Please get me to ride my bike with you or play tennis on the tennis courts across the street!  My place is so close to the Zoo,  Hoyt Arboretum,  Japanese Gardens and the Rose Gardens. I am right here.....steps away from the Washington Park Shuttle Bus stop at Kingston and Fairview Blvd.

name: Onder & Allison
about:
We are a traveller couple and we love to meet nice, modest people from all over the world. Just moved to Portland we lived in China, Germany and Turkey before Portland, Or. Runner, Volleyball Player, Photograher and a little musicians.

Allison is a student at Medical School so she is mostly studying in the evening, thats why we have pretty quite place.

Onder is mostly home as he is working from home. He is a Transportation & Logistics Manager. Engineer.

name: Fred
about: Thanks for checking out my vacation rental properties. I would be pleased to answer any questions. Just let me know.

name: Betsy
about: I'm a portland native, and love this city.  As a long time bicyclist, I know a lot about it.  Please ask me any questions, I definitely welcome them.

name: Kimberly
about: I am a working artist and art broker. My studio/office is in the building with the Airbnb unit. My husband and I have 2 children ages 34 and 14 and 2 darling grandsons ages 2 and 4. We love art, music and travel.

name: Nova
about: I grew up in wine country (McMinnville) and have lived in this NE house since 2001. I love Portland and have a lot of travel advice. Greg has lived in  the midwest (IL, WI, MN, KS) but has lived here for well over a decade so I consider him a true Portlander as well.

name: Louise
about: My husband and I are both 61. He works at the local bank and I work part-time for a local classified paper, and sew slip-covers. We've lived in Vermont for almost 40 years and love it here.  I like to take walks with my dog Raney, swim, garden, read, sew and do house projects.  My husband is a fan of  fishing, kayaking, tennis, golf, gardening and community work.   We now have our own little condo in Portland, Oregon where our only son lives with his wife and their new baby.  It is available for stays of 30 days or more.

name: Tamara
about:
Hi There, 
 I am a full time Organic Salon owner in Portland Oregon and once a year i would vacation in Palm Springs and I fell in love with the 500 West condos. We made an offer and now we are pleased to be able to share our home with you.

We love the convience and serentiy of the location so much and the mountain views and walking distance to downtown. In our opionon this is the best in the valley. We can walk 2 blks find ourselves downtown Palm Springs, the 7 min drive to the airport, plus the various hiking, biking and walking trails nearby. 

I write and enjoy art galleries and seeing whats new everyplace I go to.
Love history and learning new things.
I hope you enjoy your time in Palm Springs and come and see us.
Best Wishes, 
Tamara and Adrienne

name: Geoff
about: We are a family of 5 living our dream in a house we love surrounded by neighbors we love even more. Our three kids are 8 and 6 (Twins).

name: Brad & Laurel
about: My girlfriend and I are a software engineering and design power couple.  Formerly of Silicon Valley, but presently enjoying life in Portland.

name: Rachael
about:
Nature, travel and animal enthusiast. Vegetarian for 20+ years, but not snobby about it! ;)

I currently live in Northern California but love coming back to the amazing city that is Portland and our cozy and cheerful home.  I love wandering the streets of Portland on summer nights and enjoying the food and drink, which are world class and affordable!

name: Mary And Gebhard
about: Gebhard is from Germany, living 23 years in the United States. Mary lived in Florida before moving to Portland in 2010. We like the outdoors, Gebhard teaches Ashtanga Yoga out of our studio in our home. Mary is a massage therapist. We love to garden and our front yard is beautiful vegetable and flower garden.

name: Phil & Jill
about: We enjoy a cold beer or a glass of wine with our friends.  We also enjoy anytime we get to travel and experience new places. The time we get for ourselves is also a precious commodity. Our outdoor space is the perfect place for that and we hope our guests will be able to appreciate too. We do not subscribe to having "high maintenance" people around us because we pretty much go with the flow. At the same time we take a lot of pride in our home, our family and our careers. We love our sports too! Our kids are all out of college, married and just getting started with their careers. We have three grandkids. We have both carved out niche's in our careers, Phil as a college basketball resource and Jill as a VP of a home healthcare company.  Jill is also seeking her second masters degree, this one in Healthcare Management from OHSU. Phil has been competing in Xterra off-road triathlons over the last seven years since his basketball playing days are over and has even talked Jill into doing an occasional open water swim series with him.

name: Carolina
about: Portland resident, love to travel, and spend time with my crafts

name: Renae
about: Stay here for a week or a month & experience Portland as the locals do. This single bedroom is 130 sq ft with freshly cleaned carpets, new paint, a queen size bed with cute, comfortable bedding. :-) I love to travel and have lived in various places throughout the US. Airbnb is such a cool way to both pay the mortgage & open my home to fellow travelers. I hope you have an enjoyable time in my beloved Portland!

name: Elizabeth
about: Love to travel, meeting new people, share experiences. Would love to hear your recommendation of interesting places to visit.

name: Villa Serena
about: Locally owned and operated building with direct access to the owner.  Quick, polite, responsive and dedicated to making sure everyone has the best stay possible.

name: Sally
about:
I'm a semi retired mental health professional working for a large teaching university as well as an artist and art therapist.  I love living in Portland an tending to my garden and my airbnb rental, meeting new people, managing my two large orange cats, walking, reading, dining out frequently, movies, catching up with friends!  I also love to cook for friends!  I love seeing new places, but sure don't like to fly!  I've been on airbnb hosting in 2016 and it's great.  I look forward to continued
 hosting and also being a guest in other cities!  
I'm an easy guest to host, require little and am quiet, clean, non smoking, non drinking, no drugs or parties for me.  I respect others space and property as I'm a home owner and airbnb host myself.  If I do travel, I generally will fly and then like to do alot of walking about in my destination.

name: Marnie
about: I am originally from Bellingham, WA. I currently live and work in Portland, OR. I am an RN specializing in hemodialysis. In my spare time I love to travel, make soap, bicycle, practice yoga, rollerskate, canoe and camp.

name: Chris
about:
Greetings! 

I'm Chris. I'm from Portland, Oregon in the beautiful Pacific Northwest. It's my home but I love to travel. I lived in Prague, Czech Republic for four years, traveling extensively and staying in hostels and couches. Having outgrown couches, I now happily use airbnb while I travel. 

I work primarily as an Energy consultant, but I also own a textile company called Stitch & Loom and we work with Native American weavers in Oaxaca, Mexico.  

I love meeting new people and seeing new places. It helps me uncover the mysteries of this world.  

Insta: mr_christopher_pdx

name: Kalei
about:
I am a Portland expert, so ask me anything about places to eat, yoga classes, food carts, local coffee shops, places to go dancing, etc.
I enjoy traveling(recently to Asia), cooking healthy food and exploring Oregon (by hiking, climbing, camping, or skiing).

name: Denise
about: I'm originally a native of San Francisco, and moved to Portland with my family 10 years ago. I have close friends and family all over the world  (Europe, Mexico, Australia) , and am super excited to be a host and a host destination for travelers! I love gardening, cooking, dancing, rollerskating, hiking, film, music, and raising my 11 year old daughter. I work in the world of media, and also natural health. I volunteer running the school gardening program at the local elementary school. We try to grow a lot of the food we love to eat, and love our relaxing neighborhood. Our home is on 1/3 acre lot, and it's like country living in the city, basically the best of both worlds! We like to walk out the front door over to Mt Tabor a couple times a week for a healthy 1-2 hour hike.

name: Bruce
about:
Greetings! 

I am excited to share my beautiful home, some local favorite restaurants and neighborhood highlights with travelers and guests to my home here in Portland! 

For 25 years I worked as a Creative Director in media/broadcasting. I've always had a passion for the arts, design, photography and take pride in remodeling my 1915 Craftsman home. Wine, cooking and traveling are my other passions. 

Portlandia has definitely put us on the map. An amazing amount of culture abound here. I love to travel and the best experience is feeling comfortable and welcome wherever you end up. Having lived abroad in New Zealand, Australia, Bali, Mexico, Hawaii and France I've gained a fondness for guest houses, seeking out creative stays all along the adventure. 

         ...where have your travels taken you?


       Dream  +  Believe  +  Create  + Inspire

name: Yaana
about: I am a young professional who loves spending time with friends on my free time. I work as a Credit Manager for a Footwear company and love what I do. When home I am very organized and clean and love to cook. In any given evening you will find me cooking in my lovely spacious kitchen, listening to Sade and enjoying a glass of wine. More often than not I have a friend or two over for dinner. Moving around, Internationally, growing up certainly got me used to having people from all walks/cultures of life around me. Italy is my ideal vacation destination and who doesn't love a hardy bowl of Pasta Puttanesca..YUM.

name: Barbara And Tim
about: We have lived in Portland for nearly a decade, and love it here.  We especially love the food and music scene, as well as the outdoors (hiking, skiing), and would be happy to make recommendations.  We look forward to meeting you.

name: Steve
about: Chef,musician and world traveler I guess I am just always making friends and creating a good vibe. Playing music in my spare time and having fun. I also run a small recording/lesson space in Portland, Or....Simple.I have been using this site to travel with friends who work there forever I figured I might as well join haha. Hopefully I will see you on the road cheers!

name: Reenie
about:
I love Portland and have lived  here for 25 years. I am happy to share my home and knowledge of the city with my guests.  My interests are varied, among them are making art, yoga, reading, gardening, music and designing homes and gardens, these interests are expressed in my home. 
My life is full and enjoyable and I look forward to meeting people from different places and sharing stories and experiences.

name: Terese
about: My partner Wes and I have lived in Portland for more than twenty years and we delight in its people and culture. We especially like our Cully neighborhood, which has a rural feel to it yet is still reasonably close to amenities. I am an English as a Second Language teacher for Portland Public Schools and Wes has his own IT business. We're avid bike commuters, outdoor enthusiasts and gardeners. As of late August, 2016 we are new to Airbnb as hosts but have loved using the service as guests.

name: Nannette
about:
I enjoy sharing my home with travelers from near and far. I've lived in Portland since 1978 and have seen it grow and change in good ways. I'm happy to share information about the neighborhood as well as cool and interesting places all around the city, from the Rose Test Gardens (one of my favorite sightseeing recommendations) to our wonderful local Mt Tabor Park. You won't see me around too much during the week as I work full time including some evenings. I'm a city planner and work on community development projects. I see our city from a different lens than many, and enjoy sharing information about local architecture and movements.
I love music of all kinds - it feeds my soul. My bike is my primary mode of transportation. I love running in my local mini-mountain and all around the city. Nature is a spiritual experience. My 5- and 8-year old grandchildren are the most amazing people I've ever known!

name: Jacque And Dustin
about: My husband and I are born and raised Oregonians. I'm from Eugene and he's from Bend. We found each other in the magical land of Portland and just bought our first home in July '15. We were married in our backyard in October '15. We love our city, the outdoors, and adventuring as much as you! We look forward to hosting you!

name: Mette
about: I am original from Denmark, but have been living in Portland for about 23 years.   I Have two growing up daughters, my older daughter is a teacher and my younger daughter is still in school.  I am just starting a scrub business mettescrubs.  I am a very active person, and like to go for long walks.  I also like to travel a lot and have been to many places around the world.  I discovered airbnb about a year ago when I had to go to New York.  I had a great experience with airbnb and think it is a great way to travel.  I keep my place nice and clean and always think about what it would be like if I were the guest.  I have enjoyed all my guests and hope to enjoy many more.

name: Ryan
about:
My wife and I live with our two wonderful cats in SE Portland.  We love Portland's diverse array of entertainment options, outdoor activities, and its pleasant disposition.  

NOTE: I have used my profile to rent units for staff in relation to events I have coordinated.  As such, some of my reviews refer to staff who have stayed in rentals I've booked on their behalf.

name: Natalie + Erik
about:
We are a family of three + a dog. We are laid back, fun and spontaneous. Erik loves to show everyone a good time, regardless of age or interests. He loves to chat and learn about everything.  I like to chat or am quite happy in silence as well. We love to travel and have been fortunate to have had many opportunities to do so.  We welcome anyone into our home, regardless of age, religion or sexual orientation. Only rule - no smoking or drugs! 

What can you expect at our home? Good organic food and a very welcoming environment. You're welcome to workout with our equipment, play tennis, ride bikes, meditate in the treehouse, join Erik on a trail run, light the fire-pit and relax on the back patio, play pingpong/table tennis or just say hello and enjoy your stay with privacy. We’re here if you need us!

We live next to a park, within walking distance of cafes, pubs, restaurants, Whole Foods, public transport and the max line. We are minutes to the Pearl District, Alberta Arts, Mississippi, Forest Park and Down Town.

We live in historic Irvington.  The Irvington neighborhood is located in the northeast section of Portland, Oregon. The neighborhood traces its history to 1851.  Irvington contains the largest, most diverse, and intact collections of Queen Anne, Arts and Crafts, and Colonial Revival style residences in the City of Portland as well as the State of Oregon. In 2010, Irvington was designated an historic district and added to the National Register of Historic Places.

A light breakfast of coffee / tea and oatmeal is included for the first two days  - The space does have a kitchenette which contains a convection toaster oven, mini fridge, sink, and coffee pot. kitchen time may also be arranged for other meal preparation, or if like, you may join the family for dinner for an additional fee.

A mini crib, highchair or carseat is available if needed
We do have a dog - he is AMAZING with people, but no other pets please.

We want you to feel welcome - so welcome home!

name: Sean
about:
Civil Engineer, semi-retired, long term traveler. Have worked professionally or volunteered in four countries overseas for 8 years and traveled to another 50.

I own a home in Portland, Oregon which I lease out on a yearly basis.
 
I don't smoke and am low key when indoors, spending my time reading and on the internet.

name: Amy
about:
Hi, I'm Amy and I work in leadership development, love being outside, exploring Pinterest ideas, and hanging with my dog Charlie Brown. 

I make a respectful, quiet, and personable guest and host. When I travel I take care of myself fully but welcome advice on local travel, food/restaurants, destinations, etc. I also look for a more personal experience when staying with  hosts and enjoy sharing a meal or coffee and exchanging stories and experiences. I had a phenomenal trip to Spain in 2014, staying entirely with Airbnb hosts...I was hooked, and had to give hosting a try!

As a host, I am quiet and low-key, and happy to interact when you have questions or need Portland advice. I want you to have the most fantastic experience possible and absolutely welcome your feedback to anything that could make it better.

name: John
about:
Hello! We are Lisa, Lori and John, the lucky owners of The Perfect Place in Sellwood. We began visiting Portland on a regular basis in 2003 when our relatives moved here. We fell in love with the city and specifically, Sellwood. We have had great fun preparing the condo for our guests and hope you will enjoy it as much as we do.

We chose this neighborhood and condo due to the Walk-ability! We absolutely love that we are 54 steps (yes we counted them) to Either/Or Coffee and few hundred more steps to everything else that Sellwood-Moreland has to offer! Five minutes to Grand Central Bakery, Jade Cafe, or the Food Carts at 13th and Lexington as well as the Antique shops! If we feel like spending time outdoors, that same five minutes take us to the Spring Water Corridor which is a beautiful walk through wetlands, buttes, agricultural fields and pastures. Ten minutes of walking take us to the Sellwood Riverfront park for canoeing and a picnic. Finally, if we need to get down town, we just 25 steps to 13th and catch the #70 bus to Division, change to the #4 bus and we are there!

name: Kathy
about:
We are always excited to share our home and this great city with visitors to Portland. David and I, and our son Kalle, moved here from Ann Arbor, Michigan in 1981. We all fell in love with the Pacific Northwest. We have a furniture maker, an artist, and a writer in our family.
We love hiking and exploring the wilderness trails within the city, the Columbia River Gorge, Mt. Hood and the endless number of trails in Oregon and Washington's National Forests. And of course the Pacific Ocean and Oregon Coastline are pretty amazing.

There are so many things I wouldn't want to live without and I will name a few:
my family and friends
my dogs
the sunrise behind the Cascade Mountain Range each morning
ferns, moss, forests and waterfalls
adventure and travel
artists, writers, musicians, singers, dancers, actors and comedians
great food and wine
top chefs and cool restaurants

name: Joe
about:
I like to travel & experience different places & cultures. I'm Australian, & have spent most of my life in Melbourne but have recently re-located to Portland, Oregon for work & look forward to experiencing all that the US has to offer!

My favourite places I've been are Nepal, Japan, Berlin, Peru & Argentina. I currently have a long list of places in the states that I plan to travel to & will likely host people here in Portland once I get settled.

I'm a very relaxed & chilled out guy. I'm very respectful & tidy as well. I like to experience all different types of traveling & different parts of places I go.

I'm always more than willing to interact & have a chat but more than happy for guests/hosts to do their own thing as well. I look forward to meeting you!

name: Victoria
about: Hello guests! I am very happy to host you in our fair city! Portland is a beautiful place with attractions near and far, a delicious food culture, live music, and craft cocktails scene. I am happy to help guests consider outings for day trips, restaurants and attractions to visit, and make suggestions for guests traveling with children. Feel free to ask.

name: Kevin
about: I am a nurse in Portland, Oregon and my wife is an attorney. We have a 13 year old son who loves soccer.  We live in a great neighborhood in Southeast Portland within walking distance to shopping, movies, and a great park.  We love to bike, do yoga, go running, hiking, skiing and rafting.

name: Tim And Pru
about:
We are a retired couple who married a few years ago. We have 5 grown children between us and 4 grandchildren (2 in college, 2 toddlers) so built this space primarily for their visits. We just recently decided to list it.  We are, we think, friendly and sociable but do not impose on our guests.

We are active with hiking on Mt Hood, kayaking, Zumba, yoga, etc.  Tim is a lifelong alpine skier trying to decide whether to follow his doctor's advice to give it up.  In 2014, we spent 2 weeks hiking the Swiss Alps portion of The trans-Europe Via Alpina trail (see Wikipedia entry). We're members (subscribers) of the Oregon Shakespeare Festival and travel to Ashland each spring and fall for a series of plays. We both do volunteer work, especially Pru at a social service agency and the Oregon Food Bank and Tim in the recovery community (he's a longtime "friend of Bill W."). We enjoy dining out and can recommend some superb restaurants at all price points, from food carts to James Beard finalist chefs, in this city known for superb dining. Some are even within an easy 10-minute walk of our home. 

Tim keeps a beehive and Pru is known throughout the neighborhood for her street-side garden's vegetables, blueberries, raspberries and figs, as well as lots of blooming plants.

name: Thubten
about:
I am a lama in the Buddhist tradition of Tibet. Our home, and our guest room are decorated with Tibetan art. 

I am deeply involved in the local startup & tech communities in Portland, and am very active on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) and Instagram: @Thubten.

I love to travel, and am falling in love with Airbnb. I live with my partner, Daniel, and our two dogs, Phoebe & Felix.

Daniel works from home and watches the dogs, and will be available should you require anything during your stay.

We look forward to getting to know you!

name: Jefna
about: I'm a mother of two and a part time public school teacher. My husband and I love staying in homes when we travel and we decided to offer up our home while we are away. We love Portland and are happy to help you enjoy your visit to this wonderful town.

name: Devin & Stacia
about: My wife and I have a private basement apartment that is fully furnished that we would love to host to you while visiting Portland!

name: Ben
about: Private, quiet person.

name: Robert
about: I am from Portland, OR (USA) and I am well educated and I have been a mortgage broker for over 26 years.

name: Jack And Cris
about: We have lived in our beautiful Old Portland home for nearly 25 years now. As artists, musicians, and coffee shop owners, we’ve been a part of Portland’s transformation into one of the most dynamic and colorful cities in America. Our SE Portland  neighborhood was voted one of the most livable in the country a couple years back- I guess if you stick around long enough something interesting is bound to happen… we are fortunate to have a double lot complete with a large koi pond stocked exclusively with goldfish, keeping the raccoons, herons, and our four cats well fed and entertained.

name: Jessica & Daniel
about: Originally from Hawaii and England, currently residing in Portland, Oregon. Enjoy travel, music, art, mid-century design, surfing, fashion, vintage, interior design & architecture.

name: Anthony
about:
Alyona and Anthony are transplants to the Portland area. Alyona (originally born in Russia) spent the last 15 years of her life in Eugene. She currently works as an Area Manager for Amazon. Anthony is an Oregon local, born and raised. He is a real estate broker in Portland.

We love going to local shows, and exploring all of the unique history Portland has to offer. We enjoy wine, food, beer, our cats, music, fitness, and most of all-personal well-being.

Thank you for viewing our listing, we hope to meet you soon!

name: Erica
about: Erica

name: Julia And Connor
about: We are a young married couple who travel between Portland and LA for work. Connor is in a band called Con Bro Chill (check out their video's on youtube for a good laugh) and Julia is an exercise instructor at Industrial Barre. We love taking advantage of what Portland has to offer, especially the outdoors and amazing food options. We love people, music and animals and are excited to meet you and have you stay in our home. We take great care of it and hope that you will too.

name: Glenna
about:
Recently stopped working full time and moved my favorite city,  which I've been visiting for decades - Portland,  OR. I'm not sure if I'm really retired or just taking a break and regrouping.  I love to travel, eat and taste wine (but not beer)!  Portland is the perfect city for a foodie like me. I bike regularly but not competitively and love flat water kayaking. I'm a fan of public transportation and libraries, which Portland does a great job supporting both. 
I'm frequently a solo traveler and pretty self directed and relaxed about situations.  I figure it will all work out in the end! However,  I do love to talk and find out people's story.  That is the best part of hosting and travel. 

Life motto from Ben &  Jerry's ice cream -  "If it's not fun,  why do it?"

name: Rochelle
about:
(URL HIDDEN) “Take only memories, leave only footprints.” – Chief Seattle

I've lived all over Portland, but once I landed in the Alberta Arts district that was it. Even in a city known for 'different', Alberta pushed the free- and forward-thinking envelope just a little bit further.

I've worn a lot of different hats over the years, but right now I'm drawn to the intersection where art, activism and the cooperative movement meet. I think the Alberta neighborhood is a great template where we might develop and model sustainable local urban living--I'd love to see food planted up and down the alleys, Alberta Street turned into a permanent walking/shopping boulevard. Cottage industry coops of all stripes, art everywhere!

I'm happy to open our house to the fabulous folk who find their way to us. What's your passion?

name: Andrew
about: Originally from Connecticut, I moved to Portland after stops in Virginia and Washington, DC. I'm currently a teacher who enjoys all that Portland has to offer including an incredible food scene, fantastic parks, and access to some of the most beautiful parts of the country. I recently bought this house and remodeled the basement to make it an inviting and comfortable space. I'm looking forward to sharing this with fellow travelers.

name: Julie
about:
Hello fellow travelers!  

My husband and I live in Philly but spend a lot of time in Portland Oregon with our family. When we're not in Portland we welcome you to share our home and treat it as if it were your very own. 

It's a special light-filled happy place. Walking distance to charming coffee shops, a great bakery, restaurants, and stores. A short drive or Max ride takes you into downtown. A public golf course is minutes away. Easy access to all over Portland makes our location ideal. 

We have traveled extensively around the world and have learned a lot about what makes for a great rental experience; quality beds, pillows and linens/comfortable places to sit/nice dining area/throw blankets/good shower water pressure/well equipped kitchen. You will find all of these things in our home. 

We love so much about Portland and hope you will enjoy your time here!

Keep exploring the world,  
Julie and Bob

name: Sophie
about: Writer/Yoga teacher/Social Worker

name: Lisa
about:
I am a yoga instructor at Yoga Union Community Wellness Center on SE 50th.  I'm born and raised in Flint, Michigan and found my way out to Oregon after several stops in states all around the west.  Portland is forever for me.  
I enjoy growing plants and you'll see the house is decorated with tons of house plants to make it feel like a cozy place to kick back.
There is something meditative about cleaning so the house is pretty well taken care of.  Breakfast is my favorite meal and I like sharing that with anyone and everyone.

name: Samantha
about: I have lived in Portland for 16 years and I love it! My husband and I love the outdoors and you can find us out exploring with our 7 and 4 year old.

name: Daniel And Tori
about:
Daniel is a professional photographer and runs the adventure biking website Benedicto. He is a world traveler and fluent in Italian.

Tori is the owner and operator of Gracie's Wrench, an education and consulting service that offers classes in bicycle riding and repairs as well as workshops for businesses that want to encourage people to commute by bike. She also is a freelance writer and the author of "Bicycling Magazine’s Big Book of Cycling for Beginners".

Both love food (cooking, growing and harvesting), travel, bicycles and their sweet little white dog, Memphis.

name: Kate And Joel
about:
We live on our little urban farm in outer SE Portland with our wonderful sons (a baby and a 3-year-old).  Kate owns a yoga studio in a close-by neighborhood, and Joel works in bicycle education and advocacy.  Kate has done theater in Portland for the last 12 years and Joel has been a musician in several bands, so we can fill you in on some of the best culture in the area.  When it comes to food we have "champagne taste on a beer budget"-we love eating local, organic, artisan and delicious, but we are also very conscious of value, so we can guide you to the most amazing places to eat that are budget friendly.
