We love being Air bnb hosts--its fun to meet people from all over the world, especially since we can't travel much at the moment with our two little ones.  We are super busy so we are in and out a lot, but we really enjoy getting to know our guests when we have the chance.

name: Lindsey
about: Sean (my partner) and I are very kind-hearted, curious people.  We are musicians and love yoga, cooking good food and being outdoors.  As Airbnb hosts, we are grateful to have such a sweet space in Portland and enjoy sharing it with like-minded folks.   When we travel to visit family or play music, we rent our entire home.  Thank you so much and feel free to be in touch with us.

name: Skyberry Farm
about:
Hey there! 

We're Skyberry Farm. An all organic poultry and vegetable farm located 10 miles north from the heart of Portland, Oregon. Skyberry Farm's "Feed the Need Program" uses all funds from the BnB space to fund our farming operation, allowing Skyberry to donate all its produce to hunger relief agencies in the metro area. Each year we contribute to roughly 33,000 meals served in Portland. Our farm is 3 acres, featuring a 12,000 sq ft garden, a 1,500 sq ft garden, a chicken coup, a creek and pond and much more! We've been hosting travelers and volunteer farm interns on our farm for the past three years and are opening up our space to Airbnb travelers looking for a pleasant farm-stay 20 minutes from downtown.  

At Skyberry we enjoy a very laid back atmosphere. We play music, dabble in our ceramic studio, and we're constantly finding ourselves out and about either farming or enjoying Portland and its surrounding wonders. For more specific details check out our listing pages, and if you have any questions, feel free to message us before booking!

name: Elise
about: I enjoy traveling and providing a great place for travelers to stay. I picture what I would like in a vacation rental and try to provide it. I have lived in Portland for many years and still enjoy exploring the diverse area with all its diverse activities. Feel free to let me know what you need and I will do my best!

name: Mj
about: From Portland, Ore. Work in energy efficiency. Hobbies include biking, yoga, knitting, travel.

name: Amy
about: From Portland, Oregon - love the outdoors, including running, hiking, biking, etc.  Also love wine - drinking it, making it, and traveling to taste it! I use Airbnb both as a guest and a host and enjoy meeting people from all over the world through this platform.

name: Rachel And Bob
about:
Having lived in Portland since 1976, we think it's absolutely the BEST city around and we are always excited to share it with others! Don't just take our word for it: Portland was the ONLY U.S. City to be voted in 2015 as one of the top 25 most livable cities around the world. 

While we just started hosting through Airbnb in May, we are so deeply touched and humbled by the amazing guests we've met so far and look forward to those of you we've yet to meet.  We absolutely love entertaining and sharing the many treasures of Portland and the great Pacific NW with others.  

As fairly seasoned travelers ourselves, we also know what makes for a great stay and are invested in providing that for YOU as our guests.  

Now that we're newly retired from being public servants for years, we have lots more time for our hobbies and travels. You'll often find us being "groupies" for The Rad Trads; our son's band. The Rad Trads play energetic standards and originals that blend New Orleans Jazz, Delta Blues and Rock and Roll.  My latest favorite is "Vada Via" that Alden wrote. Check out the YouTube video of them singing it at the London Blues Kitchen or one of their fun music videos: "Keith Richards and I." They play concerts and festivals all over the world and may even be near your city.   Who knows?!  One day you might be able to say "I slept in the Portland Home of The Rad Trads!" 

Portland's own musical treasures, The Norman Sylvester Band, keeps us dancing (we're teaching ourselves swing dance from youtube) to the blues around Portland.

Want to learn how to make wine?  Be a guest next Fall and go wine picking at a picture perfect u-pick farm; Z Farm-Hubbard. In September we picked over 1300 pounds of Pinot Noir grapes and always make it quite a party.  We've made wine for the last seven years.  Bob also makes some of the best beer around from our homegrown hops.

Enough about our adventures; here's to YOUR NEW ADVENTURES!

name: Bridget
about: From Portland, OR. Small business owner. Mom of two wonderful daughters.

name: Paul & Mandie
about:
Personally:
We love to travel! Most recently we went to London, Amsterdam and plan on going to Germany next.  Paul works for an airline, so we are always planning our next trip.  

We love homes!  We both watch quite a bit of HGTV and love looking at homes even if we aren't purchasing.  We enjoy making houses into homes.  We also believe in community and leveraging your biggest asset which is why we are on Airbnb.

We love family!  We live 5 blocks from where Paul grew up and where his parents still reside.  Our family is large and so we joke that we don't have many friends outside the family and those friends we do have outside blood relatives have been adopted into the family because we value it so deeply.

As Landlords:
We have rented to long term tenants for nearly 10 years.  We enjoy sharing our home, wherever that may be.  We have just started short term rentals, and are very excited because we get to wear our hospitality hat.  We hope that each of our guests feels as comfortable as any family or friend that stays with us.  We are aiming to try to introduce people to the area by providing a book of what to do, where to go, what to see, etc.  We also want to provide each guest with a unique experience, thus plan to give them samples of local goods while staying in our home.   We love history, so if and when possible we will also introduce our guests to the history of the area.

From our Posting:
We are a couple who takes pride in our home and neighborhood.  We treat our rental space as a business and will go out of our way to make your stay as comfortable as possible.  Due to our work schedules one of us is usually available most hours of the day and will make ourselves available if needed.  We will be living in the other unit of the home unless rented, and when rented will be only blocks away to assure the best possible stay. This space is truly your home away from home, and our goal is to welcome you as such by going the extra mile, so please don’t hesitate to ask any questions or vocalize any feedback you may have.  We ask you treat our home with the same care we do, please see our house rules.

name: Lori
about:
This life I live is" full" and "filled"... with a wonderful loving family, my husband, two healthy happy teenagers and a lazy mountain dog. 
"Filled"with over 25 year career in the airline industry. "Filled" with adventure and I, too love to travel.
"Full"as traveling is part of my DNA (a wanderlust gene inherited from my dear mother). 
"Filled" with family//friends either in Central Oregon or on a beach, on the water, onboard our sailboat, a paddle board, kayak, etc...

Full and complete and evermore grateful...this life, fulfilled!

name: Ann & Jerry
about: We are long time residents of the Richmond area and we love our neighborhood and all that is has to offer.  Jerry has served on the neighborhood board for many years and we both participate in activities supporting the neighborhood.  We both enjoy out door activities including biking, hiking, cross country skiing and kayaking.  Our international travels can be seen in the various items displayed throughout our house.  Life motto:  Coffee first.

name: Katie
about:
photographer and mother to four. 

our family cares for others and enjoys an active life in the pacific northwest. we love exploring the natural wonders of the PNW as much as walking to the local movie theater, coffee shop, or the brewery when we leave the kids at home. ;)

name: Grey
about: Architect and Designer I split my time between Portland and Los Angeles

name: Dayna
about: From Staten Island, live in Portland OR I like to eat and own 4 restaurants.

name: Armon
about: My biggest passions in life would include listening to music, going to concerts, talking to friends, meeting new people, laughing, boxing, training muay thai, business, and of course traveling. I believe life is short and should be cherished every moment with an open mind and an open heart!

name: Katya
about:
I am an Artist and an Acupuncturist. I have a daughter who is also an artist. We also have a housemate in the house and also have 2 cats, 3 beehives and 3 chickens. 

Our house is from 1890 and we call it the Mallory Homestead. We have fresh eggs and fresh artwork: ceramics, drawings, prints and paintings made with the wax from the beehives. 
My daughter and I love to travel...we went to the big island and to yelapa in mexico, italy and montenegro and  someday soon we want to go to Bali.

We love meeting new people  when we travel and also through visitors at our house. Our goal is to make our house a magnetic attractor to super interesting people. To make more friends and bring the world to our house.

name: Brittany And Khanh
about: We are a couple who loves to travel, hike, love on our doggies, explore the city, and meet new people. Khanh is a CPA and Brittany is a Nanny. We have stayed in many airbnb locations, which inspired us to offer the same service. We enjoy the area we live in and know you will too!

name: Rick
about: Rick & Kristin- we're from Portland, Oregon. Both into the local theater & ecstatic dance scene. Kristin is a success coach for college students and Rick is a kids entertainer.

name: Nancy
about: Hi Im Nancy, I'm originalIy from Los Angeles,CA but now I call beautiful Portland,OR home. I love to travel and hope that one day i could visit every state and country. I enjoy the outdoors and a great brunch. My dogs and friends are very important to me. A night out on the town is fun especially if it turns into a random spontaneous night. For me Portland is one of the best cities in the country. As part of the LGBTQ community I always feel safe while walking around Portland.

name: Sarah
about: Born in Kentucky, formally educated in Arizona & California... Currently raising children in Oregon... I love huge trees, oceans (warm or cold) hiking, making smoothies & juice, fermenting things & playing yoga. My kids are 3 & 9 years old & a 7 lb dog. I work in Mexico & Hawaii often & I am living my dream. We don't have TV but really love music, Devendra Banhart, Souls of Mischief & Bob Marley rank high. My local favorites are extracto coffee, dar salam, bamboo sushi & the hop & vine. As hosts, we like to stay out of peoples experience unless they need something, then we are happy to give ideas, hang or help in whatever way is needed. My life motto... live the life you love.

name: Lucas
about: I'm a designer, an entrepreneur, and a world traveler. I love great food, great friends and the great outdoors. I've lived in lots of cities in many countries including Albany, Montreal, Bangkok, Shanghai, Eugene, Berlin and now Portland.

name: Laura
about: I am 43 years old and I am a personal trainer and life coach.  I have been a teacher/coach for 10 years, an Indianapolis firefighter for 7 years and now I have my own personal training and life coaching business.  My partner and I live in Portland, OR and we have an amazing house in one of the nicest neighborhoods in Portland,  We just completed a 900 sq ft. apartment in our basement and we want to share it with people traveling around the world.  We love Portland and we want to share all it has to offer with our guests.

name: Clay
about: We have lived in Portland for 10 years and love it!    There is so much to do from hiking the Gorge, biking to farmer's markets, and great choice of restaurants.    There is always something going on from a concert to salmon fishing on the Willamette.    Come enjoy!

name: Tom
about:
Hi.

As much as I love to travel and experience new places, I always look forward to returning to Portland. It's a gorgeous, friendly and vibrant city, and I enjoy showing it off to new visitors. Upon booking this apartment, I will arm you with an insider's knowledge to the city -- good eats, places to shop, microbreweries, great bike rides.

Thanks for looking.

name: Paula
about: I live in Portland, Oregon and have lived in the Mississippi neighborhood for about 15 years. I enjoy travel, meeting people, cultures, politics, languages and working toward my longer term goal of paring down all that I own to fit into a single travel bag.

name: Gina And Andy
about:
We love Portland and our Sellwood neighborhood.  We met at a party in 1993, started dating in 2000 and married in 2004. Gina moved into the house after the wedding and has endured many construction projects!

We joined Airbnb in 2012 and wondered "Why would people want to stay here?" We've rented to parents helping their kids move from college, grandparents visiting grandkids, foodies, ferry boat captains and others... It's been a lot of fun and really gratifying when people ask if they can move in permanently!

Our work weeks are spent in high tech and healthcare. We are the parents of a Schipperke named Chava. She is very friendly and enjoys meeting our visitors.

Our favorite travel destination is Hawaii and anywhere our family lives. Season ticket holders to Portland Timbers and Portland Thorns soccer teams!

name: Sarah
about: I teach college and love hanging out with my kids, friends and pets. I try to be helpful but non-intrusive – I leave keys in a lock-box and am always available for questions but don't personally greet or interact with guests that much.

name: Lynne
about:
I'm a native mid-westerner. After a few years in the bay area, and bouncing to Boston via Colorado for a spell, I landed in Portland in 1999 and have been here since.

My life is a creative, joyful and sometimes messy balancing act between parenting an amazing kid, designing spaces, places + instructional things, and filled with as much climbing (inside or out) as possible. 

Somewhere in the spaces between, I am also renovating my 100+ year old home - a sweet old girl with great bones - which was once dilapidated and on the verge of ruin. We've giving her some lovin' with the hopes she'll see another 100 years of life and living under her (new...and fully insulated!) roof. 

Life is an interesting journey - and we only get one. I am always amazed and grateful for the wonderful people that cross my path. Maybe the next will be you!

name: Kristi
about: Lawyer, work between San Fransisco and Portland, love the PNW, still trying to fully transition up here.

name: Kym And Fred
about:
Fred and I are happily married; it will be five years in August 2015.  I have 4 adult children and 3 grandchildren; and Fred has one son in college.  
In my past I was a former Medical Assistant/Receptionist for Oregon Health Sciences University (15 years at Richmond Family Medicine), Home birth Midwife, Starbucks barista, childbirth educator, and ceremonial drummer. 
Now I help women in divorce and after divorce create a life they love through the  tools of Reiki,  Professional Coaching, Mindfulness, Laughter Yoga and SoulCollage.  
Fred is a director of Energy Conservation, gardener, and flute/Tenor Saxophone Jazz Musician.  
Both Fred and I have lived in Portland over 30 years and have watched the growth, transitions, and changes.  
We enjoy Jazz,  Blues, Bluegrass, and ethnic music.  My favorite wines are Pinot Gris and Sauvignon Blanc ; Fred's are Syrah and Pinot Noir.
Our favorite places near or in Portland are: Mt. Tabor Park, Sauvie's Island, Forest Park, and the Portland Saturday Market.
We love to wine taste at small hard to get to wineries, camp, kayak, bike, explore local gardens, and Gluten-Free restaurants and breweries.  
We also enjoy barbecuing on the back porch, watching the birds, drink wine, and marvel at the beauty that surrounds us. 
We love Bend, Ashland, and Breitenbush Hot springs all in Oregon. 
Fred and I practice Non-Violent Communication imperfectly and we are always in motion.

name: Lindsay
about:
Hello there! 
I love to host gatherings and am excited to share my house with airbnb.

name: Maggie
about: I am a retired HS English teacher/librarian.  I have lived in Portland near kids and grandkids for six years.  I love the outdoors and am an avid dragon boat paddler, hiker, gardener.

name: Gwynne
about: from Portland

name: Jory
about:
Hello!  I'm Jory.  I enjoy travel, particularly cruising, and enjoy working in and around my home (gardening, home projects, etc.).  Most of all I love spending time with my daughters and my grandchildren!  I work in the Human Resources field.  

I have met many people through my 20+ cruise travels (12 of them as hosted singles cruises) and have branched out, coordinating travel (cruises and excursions) for small groups of people, a majority that I have met along the way.  A cruise trip through Panama Canal is on my calendar 2017 and I just returned from a trip to Europe where I stayed in Airbnb's in Rome and Venice.  

For the past 3+ years I have rented 2-3 rooms in my home as long term rentals and plan to continue to do so as I enjoy the company of others and have space that would otherwise remain empty.  I have converted the family room into a private entry efficiency studio, fondly referred to as the "Lil' Travel Depot".

name: Taylor
about:
Hey, I'm Taylor

I moved to Portland in fall of 2008 from Connecticut and have been much happier ever since. I love the easy access to outdoor activities and great food/drink/music/culture in town.

Most of my time is spent getting out in nature: rock climbing, mtn. biking, surfing, skiing, hiking, camping, etc. I also enjoy going out in town to see live music, get some great food and/or drinks with friends. 

If you're here on a Wednesday, you might get to meet my awesome little brother/mentee. During the weekday I work at a financial gig that pays for my toys (mt. bike, climbing gear, etc) When I want to take it easy, I very easily could be on the couch catching up on some HBO shows.

I still have a travel bug from my time abroad in Barcelona/Central America and look forward to exploring more of the world. My dream is to take an extended trip all around South America in a Sprinter Van. 

I love meeting new people so I'd love to share a drink and trade stories but I'm also happy to let you do your own thing, whichever you prefer.

name: Hisham
about: 45 year old male.  I am a world traveler who documents and self- publishes films and music.  I have a beautiful home here in Portland Oregon and have lived in the NW for the last 18 years.  I have lived on the west coast of the USA for the last 28 years...

name: Cynthia
about:
Before having a family and settling in Portland, my most valuable possession was my passport. Traveling was indeed a passion of mine and as I remodeled the basement I had fellow travelers as well as family visits in mind.

Over the years, I've lived in three continents and have consulted for governments and businesses before settling in Portland. Portland is a great little city to retire to motherhood because of the great appreciation for the slow food movement, the sharing economy, and a supportive vibe around children and family diversity.

Thinkers/Authors I like B. McKibbens, T. Greco, D. Korten, J. Stiglitz, J. Perkins

Magazines to which we subscribe:  The Atlantic, Mother Jones, Bitch, Yes!, the New Yorker

name: Christine With My Husband, Ellis
about: Originating in the Bay Area, we've lived in Portland for the last eight years and don't look back! We love our urban farm and our close-knit neighborhood. We enjoy sharing company with friends and family and all that the Portland-metro area has to offer. It's a good life!

name: Andrea
about: I am from Liverpool, England. I sing English, Irish, Welsh and Scottish folk music. We have children in our family so we are lively and very sociable. We love to meet new people from all walks of life. We enjoy visitors from overseas and love an opportunity to show people around!

name: Jodi
about:
In 2002, I left Canada to travel the world as a documentary photographer. In 2008, I met the love of my life in Abu Dhabi. In 2013, we moved to Portland, Oregon where I can't seem to get enough of the innovative food scene, creative culture, and natural beauty of Oregon.

We are quite particular when it comes to travel accommodation. We want to be surrounded by a simple beauty that represents the culture of where we are, with seemingly effortless luxury and comforts.

Some of our favourite boutique hotels from around the world are: 
Talaa 12 in Marrakech, Morocco
Costa Lanta in Koh Lanta, Thailand
Riva Lofts in Florence, Italy
Sumahan on the Water in Istanbul, Turkey
Bab Al Shams in the middle of the desert, UAE
La Sacristia in Tarifa, Spain

name: Amy
about:
I'm a native Oregonian, enticed by adventure; tall trees, road trips, a nice bottle of wine and scouring vintage houseware and clothing stores wherever I may find myself. 

It would be hard to keep living if living didn't include books, toothbrush, music, brie and Jameson. 

Switching gears recently from a career in non-profit and social work to internet music start up company has been a grand adventure and has taken me to corners of the country I never thought I'd see!

name: Nina And Tobin
about:
Hello!  My name is Tobin and my lovely assistant to your left is Nina.  Nina helps me with reservations and making sure your stay is comfortable and enjoyable. A little bit about me: I was lucky enough to have been born and raised here in wonderful Portland, Oregon.  As a northwest native when I get out to play it's either to the great outdoors or exploring this eclectic city.  In the winter I love Mt. Hood and playing in the snow, in the summer the rivers take me rafting, the lakes and beaches are always fun to camp and explore.  
I guess I am kind of a foodie (hard not to be in this city!)  When I am not cooking meals at home there are so many amazing restaurants serving locally sourced ingredients. 
I've had the great fortune of world travel and I bring a few of those places and experiences back to this house in the form of decorations, and photography, I hope you enjoy!
I look forward to being your host and sharing this great city that I love with people from around the world.  I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Rose
about:
We are fun and enjoyable. We make friends with everyone we meet, many are lifelong friendships from Germany, Ireland, New Zealand and many others throughout the United States. We love many types of pets, dogs especially! 
Thought I'm not fluent, I can understand Spanish and German.

name: Jean
about: Jean is all about thrifty sustainable living and local/seasonal food. She is a food historian, author, teaches cooking classes, and grows a four-season organic kitchen garden. Her mantra: We don't have to be gourmet to eat well--or affluent to travel well.

name: Isil
about: I am a working professional who is also social in life. I enjoy cooking in my available time, and spend time with family and friends most of the weekends. With the luck of the nature of Portland, I like to hike, walk in downtown and by Willamette River, go to the Cannon Beach and surf, and snowboarding in Mt. Hood whenever I can.

name: Joseph
about: Portland native and engineer who enjoys gardening and working on the house with his boyfriend.  We share our home with two loving kitties and seven chickens in the back.

name: Danielle
about: My husband and I are true Portlanders, born and raised! I work in the event planning industry and he works at Nike. We recently purchased this beautiful home that has been in my family for over 100 years. The home was lived in by my father and his father, when the neighborhood used to be all Italian immigrants in the 1950's. We can't wait to share with you our many restaurant, bar and coffee shop recommendations, along with must-see Portland traveling tips;  only people born and raised in Portland know :). We are conscientious roommates, who are active, respectful and who welcome all types of travelers to our home.

name: White Spider
about:
We are White Spider, a Portland-based, full-service rental concierge focused on helping our clients enjoy the perks of being an Airbnb host without the hassle of the everyday stress, and our guests have the most enjoyable vacation, ever. Our homeowners get to relax, knowing they're in the hands of five-year Airbnb veterans and Super Hosts, and our guests can rest assured that we are available 7 days a week, and have a response time of less than an hour - go ahead, try us! I've made the mistakes so you don't have to, and our company is built upon trust, communication, commitment, attention to detail, and a big ol' dash of OCD for good measure. 

Have a rental in the Portland area? Ready to become a host and don't know where to start? I can help, and it would be my pleasure to do so. 

We look forward to working with you!

name: Johnny & Alicia
about:
We are a young, active couple who enjoy all that Portland has to offer.  We've been here almost 10 years and in the Pacific Northwest all our lives, so feel free to ask any questions regarding the area!  Both of us work nearby and Alicia also attends graduate school at Lewis & Clark College. 

Our two dogs, Gus and Uncle Buck, are a couple of goofs.  Gus is a quite gregarious while Buckley is the sweetest/most mellow dog ever.  Gus may greet you at the window, but fear not, he's super friendly despite the occasional bark.  

Having visitors from all over the world is a wonderful experience and our goal is to help everyone fall in love with Portland the way we have!

name: Jade & Alex
about: Alex and I have lived at the Yellow Couch since the summer of 2013. It is a classic 1920's bungalow in a fantastic neighborhood. We are both laid back and work regular hours: I am a physician and Alex is a transportation engineer. We also love to travel - especially bike touring!

name: Joy & Josh
about:
Hi, 
Josh and I love to travel by bicycle and enjoy hosting to fellow travelers. We spend a majority of our free time, Mt. biking, road biking, white water kayaking, gardening, getting artsy, and cooking.

name: Mike & Anne
about: Anne is a teacher with the Portland Public School District and is writing a memoir.  Mike is a Digital Producer and Photo Editor at The Oregonian/OregonLive who loves taking photos with whatever camera is available.

name: Justin
about: Once a carpentry now a student.  I have bought a house in portland that is located near a few blocks from sell wood water front park and oaks bottom wildlife refuge.

name: Lindsey
about: I'm a busy, self-employed apparel designer.  I'm originally from South Dakota, but have been living in Portland for the past 13 years.

name: Jamie
about: funny girl. quick witted. swears a lot. liked by (most) dogs and babies. makes art. laughs.

name: Erica
about: I love experiencing travel through staying as a "local" with Airbnb hosts, exploring the local neighborhoods and hidden gems. I've lived in Portland for nearly 15 years and look forward to sharing my beautiful city with you. I love hiking, paddle boarding, cooking and enjoying all the amazing restaurants and food carts we have in Portland.

name: Atha
about: Originally from Wilimington, DE, I now live in Portland, OR. I'm a lover of the the mountains, the ocean, and all things beer- and food-related!

name: Carolyn
about: I am a single woman. You can see by the photo I'm no spring chicken, but still working when I feel like it, as a substitute teacher. I worked overseas for 15 years, and traveled a lot. Loved it! And I like to open my house to guests. Last summer for example I invited a houseful of Chinese middle and elementary school students and 5 adults (12 in all).  It was lively and lots of fun. I can't live without flowers and trees, art on the walls, morning coffee, friends and last but not least, my kids. Music: Pandora is playing salsa, folk, doo-wop, Etta James, and Mozart. Mostly remember: Korea, Japan, Istanbul, Paris, Nice. I love biographies and history, gardening books and cookbooks.  I think I have a weird sense of humor cause my favorite films are Bananas and Take the Money and Run, Marx Brothers films, and The Big Lebowsky. Anyway, I'm a laid-back host and I will stay invisible unless you want to interact. The saying you'll hear most from me is "It'll work out!"

name: Patrick
about: I love to travel and to meet other travelers! However, my job has made it very difficult for me to travel lately so I thought i'd bring the travelers to me. I'm a certified nutritionalist and a personal trainer. I'm a foodie and I like good wine and beer every so often, because i'm surrounded by delicious food, vineyards, and craft breweries. I also love anything outdoors, music, history, and foreign languages.

name: Haley
about: I grew up in a small town outside of NYC and now live in Portland, Oregon with my husband, cat and dog.

name: Amy
about: I sell vintage kitchenware in beautiful Portland Oregon. It only makes sense as I grew up in the restaurant industry and it has always felt right to buy second hand. My love for the outdoors keeps me inspired in design and responsible to our earth. I am married to a trauma nurse and we have a big old golden dog named Arthur! I love eating all types of food, experiencing art, hiking and skiing in the mountains and laughing with my friends and family!

name: Vctr+Mimi+Luna
about:
We are two professionals and a rescued Jack Russell terrier named Luna, who enjoy the sun like every other Portlander! 
We are friendly, relaxed, and are happy to provide suggestions on where to go and not go. We are sure you’ll have a blast exploring Portland and its surroundings.
 
We hope to make your stay with us enjoyable and comfortable.

name: Amy
about: I love living in Oregon and all the beautiful parks and nature.  I enjoy playing chess, watching movies, going on hikes, eating yummy food, and warm herbal tea.

name: Ann
about: My husband, Lee, and I are retired and semi-retired. Lee was the finance manager for one of our large local food co-ops and I am teaching English to speakers of other languages. We are both interested in building local economies rooted in sustainability and community. We have 3 cats and neither of us smoke. We enjoy the outdoors, live theater, movies, and the monthly national newsletter "Funny Times."  We look forward to meeting you.

name: Lindsay
about: Busy family loving life in SE Portland!

name: Chuck And Annika
about: We are a fun-loving, professional couple with a passion for our town! I (Chuck) am a Director for a Software Company, Photographer, Home Cook, Self-proclaimed Mixologist and Runner. Annika is a Dietitian, Baker, Knitter and Purveyor of Portland’s Boutiques. I came to the Rose City 16 years ago via Santa Cruz, CA and NYC. Annika moved from Idaho to Portland over 8 ago and we married in March of 2014 surrounded by friends, family and a marching band! We are long-time residents of the quiet, yet vibrant Richmond neighborhood owning and extensively remodeling our home for over 10 years. Portland is where we love to staycation and we dig exploring everything from our town, to the coast, to the Gorge and high-desert beyond.

name: Chris
about: I am a native Portlander who enjoys helping folks explore this great city and surrounds. In my free time my kids and I travel with the goal of seeing all the National Parks.

name: Sandy
about:
My husband, our pup Nina and I feel very fortunate to live in SE Portland. We've been in our home for over 10 years and in Portland for longer and love it here. We also enjoy traveling and take our pup with us whenever we can and thought we could offer this same option to others. We've put a ton of love into our home and want to share it with others and hope this will also help us with getting to see more of this amazing world and what it offers. 

In addition to world travel, we enjoy hiking, swimming, snorkeling/scuba, great cities with equally great art, restaurants and unique individuals. We love all animals and incorporate travel with our pup whenever we can. We look forward to hosting you and hope you enjoy your stay in our own personal home!

name: Jesse & Jeff
about:
By day, Jesse works at a foundation focused on health. Jeff is a speech-language pathologist for our public schools.

We spend our free time cooking, gardening, traveling, doting on our honeybees, and enjoying the marvelous food, drinks, friends, and sights Portland has to offer.

name: Anna
about: Born and raised in Portland, Oregon I am a true native with roots and family abound! I attended Reed College, a small liberal arts school here in town and am now in process of earning a graduate degree in counseling psychology at Lewis & Clark College (also in Portland). I love to sail, ski, climb, garden, read, and cook which you will see expressions of throughout the house. Cheers!

name: Curt
about: Social Worker and all around nerd. Just bought this house a year ago with my partner Chris, who works in Higher Ed and is starting on his doctorate in the Fall. We share our home with our dog Lana, and cat Spiral. While that can be plenty at times, we still have an extra room and love meeting new people. Its a coffee, beer, and NPR kind of household. Plenty of board games and video games as well. I'm working on my garden, so there may be some fresh veggies to share.

name: Jessie
about: Love hanging out on couches, hiking, gardens, and snow-everything. Reading a good book is just as good as an adventure sometimes. I am an art-student graduate from Boulder, Colorado. I moved to Portland, Oregon 8 years ago. I love swimming in rivers, hiking, and everything that has to do with animals. Usually very quiet, relaxed and enjoy little things.

name: Sarah + Duane
about:
We love meeting people, drinking wine, & chilling hard. 
We shoot weddings, play music and build things...But mostly we adventure. So come join the party! 
Our life motto:  make art, make friends

Check out who we are more on our website. (or meet us in real life). 
 :)
(URL HIDDEN)

name: Rob & Cole
about: Hi and welcome! We are Rob & Cole. I'm a fairly new transplant to Portland, having just moved from Seattle after 20 years where I was also an AirBnB host for many years while Cole hails from the Central Valley in California. We like to ride our bikes on urban adventures, eat, drink, and be merry.

name: Kathleen
about:
Friendly, self-employed professional. I have lived in Oregon for 43 years, and love to travel. I speak Spanish and have studied French and Mandarin.

Portlanders are informal and friendly people who love our beautiful city.

You're renting a 1908 foursquare on Clinton Street, which is an east-west greenway and bike route, one mile south of Hawthorne. Walkscore 88; easy transit access.

name: Ann
about: I am an active, outdoor-loving, middle-aged woman.  My home reflects that I'm a master gardener.  I'm often cycling, hiking, or bird-watching.  A native Northwesterner, I have been to nearly all the fabulous locales of Oregon and Washington.  I'm from a family of Portlanders, and take part in film, literary, music, and arts events.

name: Josh
about:
Me, Ralu and the baby: Team JRC
On our travels we like to avoid the confines of hotels and such--and find more freedom to roam.

name: Ioan
about:
My Airbnb motto is:
"Be not inhospitable to strangers, lest they be angels in disguise"
Yeats, courtesy of George Whitman.

I  grew up in Romania, then lived in Paris, Santa Cruz and Oakland until I chose Portland as my home back in 2002 when it wasn't nearly as cool as it is nowadays.

My inspiration for hosting people comes from a few different sources. One is that when I grew up in Romania under a dictatorship, we were supposed to report to the police any guests we had in our home that were from outside the country. My parents hosted people we met while traveling anyway and it felt cool, subversive and somewhat dangerous.

The other inspiration is that while I lived and went to school in Paris in my 20s I met some of the most influential people in my life while hanging out at the famous bookstore Shakespeare & Co. 

George Whitman, had a decades long tradition of hosting artists, writers and other weary travelers in exchange for work in the bookstore and the story of their lives. 

I see Portland having a little bit of the Paris spirit that I enjoyed in my 20s.


I have a background in quantum physics but I spent the last 13 years running a software and ecommerce business.

We tried to feature local artists in the house in case you might feel inspired to buy some of it while you are in Portland.

We have become coffee and beer snobs in the last decade as our neighborhood has been filling up with wonderful small coffee roasters and breweries.

name: Michael
about: Fairly eclectic couple that realize life is short. So, make it count!  We are avid hikers. We nurture relationships, family and community. We ride bikes often in Portland and love living in Cascadia,  We love our 2001 Audi allroad (gets you where you need to go), electric pressure cooker, fresh eggs, food carts, arts, Pacific Northwest culture and the Sonoran Desert; We can live probably without anything, besides love and nature. We are not strangers to hosting or boarding, we have an easy on open casual style when it comes to  traveling, but we do cherish, quiet, and cleanliness of course.

name: Stephanie
about: Originally a mid-westerner, Oregon has been my home for 30 years. I live in Portland and love to do all the Portland things like eating out, theater, movies! Also enjoy day hiking, biking and kayaking during the gorgeous summer and fall months. I'm currently a Principal Real Estate Broker, working under my own company Back Home Real Estate LCC.  I love my dog, a 7-pound Maltese who goes everywhere with me.

name: Kathy
about:
Doug is originally from Colorado and moved to the northwest in 1993. He practices law, brews his own beer and has been collecting Pez since he was a young boy. 

Kathy is a reading tutor and originally from Vancouver, WA. She loves vintage paper, traveling, meeting new people and trying different foods. 

Together they have a middle schooler who loves to read and play video games and an elementary aged son who loves playing soccer and socializing with his friends.

name: Kai
about:
I was born and raised in the beautiful city of Portland, OR. For most of my 20s I lived on a permaculture farm in Hawaii in an intentional community. I  also lived for 2 years in Uganda working as an art teacher at a deaf school. I returned to Portland 12 years ago, excited to be home, and with a renewed appreciation for all that this city has to offer. I am an artist by passion and an art therapist by profession. I love traveling-locally and abroad-and connecting with diverse people and cultures. I am excited to share my knowledge and experience of Portland and the surrounding areas.
Ioan (Ewon), my partner, is originally from Romania and runs his own software company here in Portland.  We both love dance, meditation and hiking and exploring the many gorgeous parks and trails here and outside Portland. We live in SE Portland with our two girls, our two dogs, and Chelsea, our magical cat.

name: Doug
about: Co-Owner and CEO - (URL HIDDEN)

name: Justin
about:
I am a mechanical engineer who likes to cook and travel. When not working on robotics, I'm usually building something, learning new international recipes, or working on my motorcycles. I love seeing the world, experiencing different cultures primarily through food but also by getting to know the local residents, their history, and finding out that which is truly unique to the area. I also really enjoy learning how to make my own things, and have tried everything from soda and drinking vinegar to beef jerky.

Since my travels were so much better after switching to AirB&B, I've decided to open my home in Portland to guests, to let more people venture away from the tedium of hotel stays and have a more authentic experience. Cooking at home for friends and family is something I'm very passionate about, and I look forward to sharing that with my guests.

name: Scott & Daria
about: We love living in Portland, in the center of the beautiful Pacific Northwest.  We live in a beautiful 1910 Craftsmen bungalow we have faithfully restored.  We love to travel, garden and be active in the outdoors. When we travel, we enjoy visiting historic properties, meandering in the oldest part of any town we visit and finding great local restaurants.  Before moving to Portland, we lived in the Netherlands for a couple of years and travelled throughout Europe.  As empty nesters, we now spoil our dog, Bella . We are really enjoying being hosts; there's nothing quite like sharing travel stories over a glass of wine or a cup of coffee.

name: Shilpi
about:
My favorite cuisine is Thai followed closely by Indian food.

My most favorite travel has been to Panama.

name: Tom
about: I was born, raised and educated on the West Coast.  I have spent my life surfing and skiing from Baja to Tofino BC, the Sierras, and the Rockies.  Now I do it with my wife and our two daughters.  Our girls attend a Mandarin immersion school and I speak passable Spanish.  We love to travel and love meeting people from all over the world.

name: Lise
about: Artist/art teacher/native area restoration volunteer

name: Lisa
about: I live in Oregon and love the outdoors!

name: Lauren
about:
I'm originally from Ohio and have been living in Portland for four years now and in this house for two years. My furry housemates include two cats, Misa and Dinah, and a Corgi names Gidget. 

I've been to most of the states in the US and have traveled to many parts of the world (North America, South America, Europe, and Australia). The next international trip I'd like to take would be to Scandinavia. 

Some favorite musical artists: SBTRKT, Totally Enormous Extinct Dinosaurs, Miike Snow, Zhu, Anna Lunoe, Maxxi Soundsystem, Disclosure, and Flume.

My goal when hosting is to bring joy to my guests through practicing thoughtfulness, mindfulness, and intentionality. I love to anticipate your needs and questions. I also enjoy making each stay a unique and personalized experience.

name: Adam
about: Hello!  My fiance and I are working professionals in Portland and are frequent travelers.  We love to both host and visit using AirBnB.  We enjoy getting to know our guests and sharing our favorite local spots.  We hope we can host you soon!

name: Gloria
about: I live in a lovely house in a pleasant neighborhood close to cultural activities, restaurants, and parks.  I enjoy gardening, hiking, and interacting with others.  I am an avid meditator.  When I have guests, I welcome them to use the entire house and patio and am available to provide information as they explore their Portland experience.

name: Angela
about:
Hi my name is Angela, my husband and I have a nice home in a quiet NE Portland Neighborhood. I own a hair Salon, passionate about doing hair, love hiking, spending time with family and friends definitely a people person. I spend a ton of time in the Gorge, sitting by beautiful waterfalls daydreaming about my next meal at one of our amazing restaurants.

One of the reasons why I started Airbnb is because I genuinely enjoy people. Learning, sharing, talking about all the things I love, our beautiful NW, the rivers, the Oregon coast, lakes, and mountains.

My husband enjoys the beer culture; bicycling and we both love the music.

name: Meghan
about: I work and play in the bicycle industry.

name: Joelle And James
about: We love our home, neighborhood, and city and enjoy sharing all three with travelers from near and far. James, originally from New York City, is a composer and music director and is well connected to the music and art community in Portland. Joelle, originally from Los Angeles, is a  kindergarten teacher. We've lived on our wonderful street since 1999 and can't think of a better place in Portland to be. We are both long-time vegans and have enjoyed exploring the world through our taste buds. As hosts, we strive to give our guests the privacy they desire while still being available to offer insider tips on the best places to eat, play, and explore in and around Portland.

name: Carson Emily
about: Artists, teachers, parents

name: Corporate And Vacation Suites
about: Providing short and long term stay vacation rental.

name: Sarah
about: Portland, OR

name: Kendra
about:
I love to travel, see new places and try new foods.  I live in Portland, OR but originally from the East Coast.  Portland has a lot to offer and I'm happy to share my experiences with guests.

I'm clean and tidy.

name: Emery
about: A man on the prowl for a challenge.  Cat enthusiast, amateur pianist, and budding entrepreneur.

name: Kathleen And Darin
about:
Kathleen is a teacher from Portland, OR and loves her cats, working, cooking, and traveling.
Darin also loves the cats, and has a background in Public Health with which he develops Wellness Plans. He also works for the City of Portland planting trees. They welcomed Charles, their first child, in November of 2015.
They have both lived in Portland for almost 2 decades and have been a part of growing the local biking community here. They love Oregon.

name: David
about:
Artist, illustrator, graphic designer, and photographer. My wife, Helen, and I teamed up to do mostly children’s pictures books with major publishers for the past 25 years and also self-publishing. You will see some of my work hanging on the walls.
We have lived in different parts of Portland since 1971. Two years ago we moved into this neighborhood which has a great community spirit. An added benefit of living here is having two of our three grandchildren living on the same block. 

We work out of our home so we are most often here to personally greet you and help with any questions or specific needs. 

Also our location has been convenient for some guests who have family near by, often just a short walk down the block or around the corner.

name: Jessica
about:
I am a south east coast transplant whose made Portland my home.  I love the Wilderness as much as the city, and am drawn to the town's maker culture, food culture, and easy pace.
I was bitten by a killer travel bug 9 years ago that still has a good hold on me, and I'm excited to give back as a Host!

name: Heather
about: We're from Michigan and have lived in Scotland, Amsterdam, Germany, Hong Kong and most recently Singapore.  Our passion for travel makes Airbnb a fun thing to be a part of.  We love Portland's weirdness and it's amazing beers and breweries. Our two crazy kids keep us an active household.  As hosts, we're happy to share a beer together if the timing works.

name: Terry
about: I've lived in Portland 11 years now and have very much enjoyed being an innkeeper.  The separate cottage is rented mostly to people who want a bit more privacy, private bathroom, etc. though the separate basement apartment has its own entrance, bathroom, etc.   I've lived in D.C., Boston, California and Oregon.  I've run a retail craft gallery, been a veterinarian assistant, concert promoter, D.J.  worked in the coffee industry and Innkeeper among other jobs.  I love playing hostess to folks wanting a great place to stay while visiting Portland.  This is a wonderfully quiet neighborhood but close to everything.  I am an avid kayaker, love movies, cooking, trying new restaurants, books, nature lover.
city: l live on the same property as the separate cottage and private basement apartment.  I've been hosting guests for 11 years.  This is a great neighborhood that's quiet yet close to everything you'd want.

name: Chris
about:
My philosophy: 
- You don’t have to live your life the way other people expect
- You can do good things for yourself and help other people at the same time

name: Darwin
about: I'm an instructor at a non-profit, and in my free time I enjoy soccer (Timbers!)  and playing music. Genuinely good guy, I get along with pretty much everyone.

name: Jay
about:
Jay has lived in Portland for decades and represents the city as Afar Magazine's local expert and editor of the online travel guide to the city. When you show up, you not only get a unique lodging experience, you have access to one of the best travel knowledge databases in the city. Jay's domestic & international travel writing has a healthy online following. He is an award winning writer/producer with credits in a variety of subject areas.

An accomplished climber, runner, cyclist, kayaker and telemark skier, he spends a fair amount of time in rain gear. He has traveled extensively around the NW including the summits of Mt Rainier, Hood, Shasta and the Three Sisters. His international rambling has taken him to Cuba, SE Asia, Republic of Georgia, Egypt, Slovenia, Costa Rica, and the usual haunts around western Europe. A recent jaunt to India and Bhutan is the basis for several upcoming travel guides and articles. 

A big Duck fan, Jay has collected a Bachelor's degree in broadcasting and journalism and a Master’s degree in instructional design from the University of Oregon in Eugene.

name: Seth
about:
I am a young professional and avid traveler. I work in government relations and co-own a bar in Portland, OR. I also run a nonprofit that builds elementary schools in Ghana, West Africa.

When I travel I spend most of my time out and about exploring. The majority of time I spend at a rental is mostly for sleeping purposes.

name: Emily
about:
We live in Portland, Oregon and have a happy kid named Jasper.  We love hosting people in our home and highlighting the best that Portland has to offer. We enjoy family adventures slightly off the beaten track, but not far out of town. 

We're easy-going, tidy and respectful.  We love the chance to stay in unique places and have had wonderful AirBnB experiences :)

name: David
about: Outdoorsy guy, born and raised in Portland.

name: Mishka
about:
Lover of all things circus, travel, art, and a connector of people.  I moved to Portland in 2011 with my daughter and it was instant love.  I love everything about this town and am so thrilled to be here.  We are friendly people and happy to help in any way we can.  I've had a varied background, from flying trapeze, software development, hurricane relief work, horse training, to DJing, and I love to meet new people and hear what they're all about.  

As a host, I love to help in any way, and hope to do anything I can to help your stay exceed your expectations!

My daughter, Chlöe, is 5, and she is friendly and kind.  She loves gymnastics and dance.  We have a big backyard, but when we are hosting guests, we tend to play in our front yard and porch to give you privacy.  Chlöe also loves to share her toys, so if you are bringing children, we will be sure to put together a little package of fun for them.  =)

name: Jimmy
about:
I am an independent traveller, musician, performer & producer.
Portland has been an amazing home to me for over 15 years.

name: John And Fran
about: Live in Portland, Oregon.

name: Corey
about: I am a 34 year old gay active, outdoorsy, friendly, funny, insurance agent for Farmers. We are Farmers... Wow, I feel like I am completing a dating profile. I am on AirBnB because I want to share my wonderful space with interesting travelers. I have always been outgoing and helpful and I think it's a great fit!

name: Peter
about:
Portland OR
College Professor
Artist

name: Matt And Jody
about: We're born and raised in the great Pacific wonderland! We've lived and worked in Portland for about 6 years and LOVE it. We're happy to show off our great city and make your stay as memorable as possible. We've traveled all over the world (Mexico, Croatia, Africa, Costa Rica, Germany) but are happy to call Portland home. We love our neighbors and we think we get the best of both worlds...urban living and a backyard!

name: Emily
about:
I'm a behavior therapist, writer and musician...and amateur gardener and remodeling junkie. I love working with kids and adults with learning and social cognitive disabilities and supporting their families on their tough road. 

I am married to a wonderful man, who is a faculty member at a local university and loves serving people. 

We have a dog and a cat who are truly best friends. They are very sweet together and will probably provide hours of entertainment for guests.

We could not live without great coffee, good friends, road bikes, books and the ability to travel. 

We're super flexible travelers. We love B&Bs because it gives us the opportunity to meet new people. We are also very respectful of people's homes, as we would hope for the same for those we host.

Feel free to contact me about any questions you might have if we request staying at your place. We want you to feel comfortable with us.

name: Eugenia
about:
I am an artist living in Portland Oregon. I received my M.F.A and taught college courses for 10 years. I create beautiful white on white paintings. I have done commissions for Tiffany's & Co. The Marriott, The Ritz Carlton in San Fransisco and the Tyson Center in D.C. and many others. I am have had museum  and gallery exhibitions and am collected all over the world. In 2013, I created Beaux Arts Contemporary (a gallery) to show case my art along with other artists to do national and international art fairs. I love to cook, travel,(I just got back from my first trip to Thailand and had the most amazing experience). I love new experiences, museums and meeting me people from all walks of life.
 website: (website hidden)
Cheers.
Eugenia Pardue

name: Alison
about:
Upstate New York native, athlete since birth, National Park enthusiasts and expert screen starer

I'm so excited to be in Portland, OR!  Living among the beauty of this city and its natural surroundings is a dream come true.  The Bird's Nest studio has brought me so much joy.  I strive to keep this space simple, spacious and as relaxing as possible. 

I love to host folks from out of town and help them plan their adventures.  Whether you're doing a craft brew biking tour around town, a hiking adventure out in the Columbia River Gorge, a visit to the coast or something else uniquely Portland (ever heard of the Naked Bike Ride?) I'm happy to give guidance.

name: Lydia
about: Eating my way through new and exciting places.

name: Casey & Berdell
about:
We are two women and two cats. The cats love sleeping, the women love Dragonboat racing, biking, dancing, movies, cruising and being with our grandchildren. We love eating out just about anywhere, including American, Thai, Italian, Middle Eastern, Northern Chinese, Mexican, French, Vietnamese and Seafood.

It's fun and exciting to meet new people. We welcome you, ask you what you want and honor whatever it is, whether it's a little conversation, where to go in Portland, or quietude. You are our main priority.

Our past guests ALL have been quite surprised of how quiet, clean and private their space has been. You will be delightfully pleased :)

Berdell is an artist specializing in watercolors and acrylics. Casey is a musician specializing in guitar, French horn, and choral music.

name: Alison & Tracy
about: We are from Portland, OR and Paragould, AR. We are a psychotherapist and an engineer with a two children under 4. We love food, spending time with our family and exploring the Pacific Northwest.

name: Jennifer
about: I love to hike, cook, garden, sew and travel!

name: Faith
about:
I am a Portland native and student at Portland State University. I enjoy local food, drinks and entertainment. I love Portland and exploring the new things the city has to offer.

I have been hosting with airbnb for over 4 years and enjoy introducing visitors to Portland. If you have any specific questions for me I'm always happy to make recommendations and explain the easiest and best ways to see the city. 

I welcome all guests to contact me, my apartments are very family friendly and can easily accommodate independent travelers as well as couples. I look forward to seeing you in Portland!

name: Rhea + Seth
about: I am an adventurous lady working toward social justice and traveling at every opportunity!  I spend my free time on my motorcycle, in the forest, and volunteering to help run a restorative justice program in a few different correctional institutions where I live.  Life is good!  I hope to someday travel the world by my motorcycle... ;) Some of my favorite places are Thailand, Panama, Rwanda and Uganda.  And of course all of the Pacific Northwest roads that my motorcycle has led me to!

name: Stephanie
about: I love where we live! Our neighborhood has so many of the things that make life beautiful. Great food, amazing bookstores, funky theatres, live music, an awesome selection of beer and wine, and to top it off - beautiful nature at Mt Tabor park. To me, family and friends are what make life worth living. We are so fortunate to live in a community that believes in working together and supporting each other. We look forward to sharing what we think is the best neighborhood in Portland with you.

name: Aviva & David
about: We are both native NY'ers who moved to Oregon 23 years ago with three young children.  We lived for years on a couple of wooded acres out in the 'burbs. With everyone all grown up and out on their own, we decided to go back to our urban roots and build a new home in one of Portland's hottest neighborhoods. As luck would have it, we found ourselves with a studio apartment above our detached garage. We've stayed in Airbnb's in the US and all over the world, from Croatia, to Amsterdam to Costa Rica to Berlin. After so many positive experiences, we knew exactly what it would take to be great hosts for our guests. We are huge foodies! Welcome to Portland, one of the best foodie towns in the US.  We'd love and appreciate your reviews for our studio apartment. We will do everything we can to help you love your accommodations and your visit to Portland. Fondly, Aviva and David.

name: Rachelle
about: Hi there, we are an active family that is usually on the go. I am a nurse and Jess is a PA. We love to travel and have selected a different country to explore on our vacation time every year for the past 15+ years. We have stayed in wonderful places and have always had great experiences with friendly, welcoming people.

name: Aarun Carter
about: We are traveling musicians!

name: Nico
about: I really love spending time outside. I enjoy mountain climbing, running, biking. I love to travel and spend time with friends and family. I am originally from Chile, but I have lived in the U.S. since 2010.

name: Derek And Jim
about: We call Portland home, but love to explore the world and meet new people.  We've been fortunate to travel to countries such as Turkey, Japan, Thailand, China, Argentina, Chile, Poland, Germany, France, Switzerland, Kenya, the UAE, Australia, and more through the years, and we know the needs of the business and leisure road warrior. Welcoming travelers into our home is truly a pleasure for us and we love hosting our fellow explorers with a unique Portland experience, yet all of the comforts you'd expect from an upscale hotel. See you soon in Portland & travel well!

name: Alex
about:
I am a self employed mother of two, originally from England. I have lived in America since 1988, mostly in Portland. I love to travel & before coming to America traveled to many countries in Europe & also a little in Asia.
I have lived in 6 states, including Hawaii & Tennessee, and travelled to about 35 others, as well as Canada, Mexico & Costa Rica.
When I'm not dreaming of traveling, I enjoy hiking, walking & running & relaxing with my friends. I love to read & last year installed a Little Free Library outside our house.

name: Justine
about:
Dear Airbnbers,

Born and raised in the Pacific Northwest by a big Italian family inspired my love of the outdoors,  people and good food. I have been lucky enough to travel with friends, and family and for work on rockin' adventures all across the globe. My favorite place to be is on the water skiing, paddling or sailing, or on an airplane en route to my next adventure. I love art, cooking, exercise, music and sipping coffee or a glass of wine with old and new friends!

name: Anna
about: My husband Jerardo and I are Oregon natives (Portland and Hood River). I'm an educator and he's a school counselor here in town. We love our neighborhood for its family friendly parks, easy walkability, and access to downtown. Living in Portland offers us lots of opportunities for hiking, biking, beach time, and skiing with our two active little ones, who are six and two years old. They keep us all in check! :)

name: Charles
about:
Fun loving family of four.  Portland natives.

We enjoy all of the outdoor activities the Pacific NW has to offer, hiking, swimming in the Washougal River, bike racing (especially cyclocross), triathlons.
Rebecca wins hers often and I am happy just to finish!

We also love to dine out and can steer you towards the best restaurants in town.  Portland has some of the most delicious in the world!

Currently, I am completing my Paramedic degree and am in the process of getting a job with Portland Fire and Rescue.

Rebecca works in healthcare and enjoys speaking on ways to improve healthcare delivery nationwide.

To balance out this busy lifestyle, our home is a haven.  We both love beautiful, warm, expansive and inviting spaces.  I hope this comes across in our home photos.

To top it all off, we have two amazing children who are very wise and mature for their years.

We look forward to meeting you!

Charles and Rebecca

name: Angela
about:
My husband, Erin, and daughter, Magnolia, and I moved to Portland, OR from Los Angeles in 2015 and we are so excited for this great life adventure. We love to explore the world, have done a lot of that independently and as a family - teaching our young daughter about different cultures and lifestyles is a passion of ours. We are loyal and respectful Air B&B users and also excited to list our own property here: our family home in NE  Portland has a separate one bedroom apartment on the bottom level for vacation rentals. 
A bit about me: I cannot begin to list my favorite foods and books, I feel like I eat and read way too much for that. We see live music as often as possible - my favorites: Jack White, Conor Oberst, M Ward. My husbands favorites: Grateful Dead, Phish, ALO. Our daughters favorites: Frozen. We proudly wave the Third Man flag (for me) and Phish flag (for him) outside our home and at some point you'll probably see our little one dressed like Elsa, carrying a tree branch and telling you to "Freeze".
"Try to be Someone on Whom Nothing is Lost" - Henry Miller

name: Sarah
about: I love to travel, do art projects, bake, and explore the local food scene with my husband and two sons.  We love living in the Buckman neighborhood because it is nestled between downtown, Belmont/Hawthorne, Burnside, and NE Portland.  Professionally, I divide my time between teaching animation, pursing the completion of many staggered projects, and completing my MAT in Elementary Education (almost done!).  We have a darling and feisty cat named Bandit and two chickens--Bertha and Geraldine-- in the backyard.

name: Elliott
about:
Hi,
I am a Wisconsinite transfer to the West Coast. I travel a lot so I like to host people at my apartment while I am away. I am a big believer in the Airbnb experience and the whole sharing economy. It makes sense to use things more efficiently and share them when you aren't using them yourself. As for me, I work in cleantech at a small startup. I love the quality of life and relaxed feel of Portland. I have been an Airbnb host now since early 2013 and have also stayed as an Airbnb guest a number of times. I formerly hosted many guests at my apartment in San Francisco. 

I like to host cool people who are excited to visit Portland, get away from the hotel experience, and get a taste for what living here is really like. I hope to host you soon and get to know you in the process.

name: Saphronialynn
about: I'm a bio chem student at PSU that lives with my 4 year old son and husband Randall. Professional cheese monger. I love making lists, watching murder mysteries and listening to riff raff. We are an easy going family with an advanced sense of humor, please try to keep up

name: Jennifer
about: Designer, traveler, lover of art, music, food, fun.

name: Jacob
about: I'm business professional that is very laid back and easy going. I moved to Portland  5 years ago and absolutely love it. I like to stay active and go out and enjoy what the city has to offer. Please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have any questions!

name: Laura
about:
Hola!  

My name is Laura Christine and I have a passion for buying, remodeling, staging and decorating entertainment vacation BEACH homes as a super host!

Here are my latest:

“Pacific Beach Mermaid” (Pacific Beach, San Diego, California)
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/4227110 

“La Jolla Skylark” (La Jolla, San Diego, California)
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/507903 

Newport Beach Bay Cliffs (Newport Beach, California)
Sold

“El Segundo Beach Entertainer” (El Segundo, Los Angeles, California)
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1718074  

"Mission Beach Jamaica" (Mission Beach, San Diego, California)
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/12150419

“Mission Beach Point Views” (Mission Beach, San Diego, California)
Coming Soon!

I'm super proud of my over 200 five-star reviews on Airbnb, VRBO/(SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN), TripAdvisor/(SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) and 25 other websites.  I'm always trying to enhance your holiday experience.  I love input as we act on it immediately!

My house coordinators inspect, stage and manage the home remodel staging, housekeeping, handyman, landscapers and special request services.

For help with the above homes, please reach out to my home coordinators:

San Diego: 
Jenelle
$(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)
 
Petra 
$(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) 

Melanie 
$(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

Los Angeles:  
Boris 
$(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

Portland:  
Leslie (twin sist(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)

I'm a e-commerce digital marketing executive/consultant and I live in my vacation rentals to improve the entertainment experience.

I'm super active and rent my homes in La Jolla, Pacific Beach, Newport Beach, El Segundo Beach/Manhattan Beach, California and Portland, Oregon to preferably vacation renters like you!

My Passions:
TRAVELING, VACATIONING, Beach volleyball, fitness, running, soccer, mountain biking, snowboarding, surfing, tennis, design and landscaping.

I would love to host you!  

Life is too short not to incorporate a vacation every chance you get.  Live it up with family and friends.

Cheers,
Laura

Laura
$(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) text/call (text fastest method)

name: Stuart
about: Surfer/Farmer/Writer/Director/Freelance kid who likes to travel and dance suuuuuuper hard to really good music.

name: Mary
about: Adventure Team Awesome!  Absolutely LOVE Portland.  I  am a great resource for local food and fun. I know a lot about the yoga community and where to get a great class.  I also love to travel and LOVE Mexico.

name: Cory
about: I grew up in Florida, but moved to Colorado to be closer to the mountains.  I enjoy gardening, cooking, and adventuring in the mountains. My wife is from California and loves to run, hike, and travel. We both enjoy meeting new people and exchanging stories with new friends.

name: Sarah
about:
Jonathan is a freelance illustrator and author; he works mainly in the comics industry and also does illustrations for corporate projects, advertising campaigns and periodicals. He has written and illustrated several books and is currently developing his next personal project. Jonathan loves the ocean and all creatures that live in it, but especially cephalopods. His favorite things include sushi, peaty scotch, Ingmar Bergman films, adventuring in his kayak, and sleeping in hammocks.

Sarah is a Marriage and Family Therapist in private practice. She enjoys cooking and baking for family and friends, traveling to new places, running, hiking, lindy hopping, and having new experiences with Jonathan and Dorothy.

Jonathan, Sarah and Dorothy live in Portland in their 100 year old Craftsman home, and enjoy walking and biking around their neighborhood and exploring Portland's great restaurants.

name: Tyler
about:
Hi, I'm Tyler! I live right above Caesar's Palace, and next door to us is the Truman house and the apartment. I work around the corner at Mississippi Studios - which the properties surround. I'm a musician, native Oregonian and I live with my pug Julius Caesar. We look forward to meeting all our guests from around the globe & making sure their stay is as memorable as possible! Cuddles with the pug can be arranged....

Feel free to reach out to us at any point if you have questions about the apartment and/or location.

name: Liz
about: I am a young single professional who travels a lot for work, so I thought I would put up my condo since I am often not here! I love Portland all it has to offer. I especially love where I live as I own a very active dog who loves walking along and playing in the river.

name: Emily
about: I am an accountant and a musician who lives part time in Portland, Oregon and part time in Oakland, California. I also travel often for various reasons, including music, work, and pleasure. While I am away from Portland, I offer my beautiful, loft-style apartment to Airbnb guests. I love to hike, camp, rock climb, run, surf, and bike. I love to play music, and my main instrument is the drums. I also write and record electronic music too. I love to learn new languages. I speak Portuguese and Spanish and am learning French.

name: Keith
about: I'm a high school counselor who has lived in Portland, OR, for the last 19 years.  I love to travel.  I'm an early to bed, early to rise kind of guy who enjoys walking the streets of a city in the early morning with a cup of coffee in my hand.

name: Charrese
about:
I love to travel and have been lucky enough to do a fair amount of it.  England, where I grew up, other parts of Europe, SE Asia (Vietnam, Thailand, Cambodia and Japan), N. Africa (Morocco and Egypt) and last year to Chile where I spent 9 days on the Futaleufu whitewater rafting and a week in Torres del Paines trekking - probably my most amazing experience yet.  I think Turkey is the friendliest country I have visited and France the most unfriendly.  I have also traveled around the U.S.  I think London is the best city on earth but also love San Fran, New York, New Orleans and Miami. I love hearing about other people's travels and adventures.

I compete on a Dragon Boat team for the Rose Festival held in June so my spring is spent in training, often in the pouring rain.  I love to raft, kayak, hike and garden.  I  have a dog called Tilly (after Tillamook Forest where I first took her camping) who is a mutt but mostly Australian Shepherd and Labrador.

I also love big city life with the bar and restaurant scenes and dancing to good electronic music.  I practice yoga, collect art and love to discuss politics and the state of this great nation.  Bill Maher is my favourite talk show host, John Oliver my favourite source of news ;) and I just love Shameless and Nurse Jackie. I watch movies regularly and read a lot.

I am lucky enough to work in the high tech industry down in the Bay Area so I get to travel down regularly and get my sun fixes during the mostly wet months from Oct to Jun in Portland.

My life motto:  "You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something sometime in your life" - Winston Churchill

name: Anesa
about: I study and live in Portland and am originally from Bosnia, Europe. I grew up in Germany and have lived in Tennessee and California prior to relocating to Portland 3 years ago. I have been a member of Airbnb since 2010. I love traveling to unfamiliar places and would like to have my own hostel one day. I participate in a few key traveling websites and am familiar with what it takes to be a good host and to be a good guest. Hope to meet you, host you and stay in your neighborhood :)

name: Jason
about:
I am an arborist living in Portland, Oregon. I focus on maintenance and restorative tree work, only felling a tree when it’s unavoidable. When this happens, I mill the wood and cure it for at least two years, eventually turning it into slab furniture for homes and offices. I’ve been in Portland for over 25 years, the beautiful Irvington neighborhood for 14, and I’m still discovering new places every day. I spend my free time hanging out with my daughter Perle, practicing yoga, and collecting vintage bicycles. 

My home is an historic Irvington building, framed in 1910 and modified into an 8-part split home under the housing demands of WWII. Built in the arts-and-crafts style with most of the original fixtures and oak floors, it’s beautiful in a simple way.

As a host, I’m more than ready to help in any way I can with info and supplies, but I’ll also leave you to enjoy the room with respect for your privacy. I’m easy to reach on my cell phone if anything comes up, and when I’m around the house I love to give recommendations of things to do.

name: Hayley
about: Hello! My name is Hayley, my sister and I own a small shop in NW Portland called Archibald Sisters. We specialize in custom fragrance and quirky gifts! When I am not working, I enjoy gardening, biking, and cooking!

name: William
about: Early 50s Gentleman, single, work at home property/estate manager. Ex restaurant/hotel employee, skilled at the art of quality hospitality service with my own unique style. Dedicated to making my AIR B&B venture a wonderful combination of value, comfort, elegance, and location.

name: Mike
about: I recently moved back to Portland from Austin, Texas. I have about two years of hosting experience in Austin, where I had an almost perfect rating on Airbnb in my previous condo. Having grown up here in Portland, I am enjoying all the great new restaurants that are within walking distance of my place.

name: Katie And Amir
about: We loved every minute of living in Portland, and still visit often.  We particularly love the abundant nature, parks, and the ability to walk to accomplish almost every basic necessity on foot.  We would often walk to our daughter's preschool to pick her up, get a coffee, some groceries, and walk home.  Who needs a gym membership when you've got Portland!?

name: Lydia
about: My name is Lydia Wastell and I am a Portland native. I love this city so much and it has been crazy watching it change over the past 25 years. I live above the basement apartment with my husband, Tim and our daughter, Frankie, who was born on May 11th, 2016. Tim is a full-time chef and I am a stay at home mom, now getting the privilege to host a Airbnb! We love watching weird new and old movies, listening to records and learning new things with and about our daughter.

name: Erik
about:
I was born in Denmark, raised in Canada and have lived in the US for 20 years. I am an active father of two teenagers. I have been renovating my 1901 Irvington home since 1997, and built the Carriage House  Studio on my property 10 years ago as a private sanctuary for my family. I love the outdoors lifestyle the Pacific NorthWest has to offer, and  the urban life of Portland, too.  There are so many great neighborhoods close-by.  I love to hike and bike in the summer and cross country ski in the winter.  Whenever I can find time from my busy schedule I relax by working on my art and Photography.  

The Carriage House is separate from my home, very private and cozy. You will probably not see me (very much) but I can often be found working on some project in the backyard, gardening or getting my bike ready for a ride.

name: Anna
about:
Hello! My name is Anna and my fiancé's name is Shea. We live in Portland about half of the year and spend the other half traveling and spending time with our family on the Oregon Coast. 

We purchased a swell 2 bedroom ranch last January and look forward to sharing our space with other travelers while we head off to the coast (where we both work in the summer).

I personally love planning my next adventure, eating great food, taking in the sun rays whenever I can catch them, and getting pampered (I'm a beauty travel writer and recently sold my organic facial studio...).

Shea has a black belt in Kung Fu, teaches surf lessons in the summer, and grew up on the small island of Hawaii. 

We enjoy all types of accommodations while traveling. Getting a little old for hostels, but still love meeting new people (in a less intense setting).

Motto: Quit talking about it and do it already!

name: Laura
about:
I am clean, organized &busy.  I love to bake so fresh cookies or a pie will probably be available.  I can't live with out coffee, red wine, dancing, traveling and entertaining.  I have a wonderful backyard and front porch for morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evening.  
I'm relaxed and positive! My motto is: Flexibility is the key!

name: Lorie
about:
After meeting in Boulder and moving to California, we visited Portland in 1999 and were smitten. We bought this house later that year. We have since been joined by 2 beautiful sons, 2 dogs and 3 ducks. We love Sellwood and have thoroughly enjoyed watching this Portland village change and grow over the past 17 years.

We just finished a year long construction on this downstairs 2 bedroom apartment and welcomed our first AirBnB guests. What a delightful experience!!! (The guests, not the construction!) We look forward to continuing to be inspired by all our guests with their spirit of travel as they explore our Sellwood village setting, the rest of Portland and the beautiful surrounding sites.

name: Isidore
about:
We love all things Portland and have lived in the neighborhood for over a decade and are pleased to share our neighborhood with you.

We rarely travel but when we do it normally involves great music, food, coffee, and craft beers.  We are busy and both work during the day.

name: John
about: I am married with five children ages spanning 15 years apart. We love the outdoors. Hiking, camping and backpacking are at the top of my list. Flying and boating are favorites as well.

name: Stephen
about: Hello! I am an ICU nurse who works hard and likes to take advantage of everything that Portland has to offer. I enjoy biking, trying out new bars/restaurants, traveling and exploring the outdoors. I am a relatively new to hosting, but look forward to sharing my knowledge of this wonderful city!

name: Amy
about:
Originally from New York, but love west coast living.  I prefer solo travel and adore SE Asia.  I am currently homesick for India.  Wine and cheese and fruit, please.

Nice to meet you.

name: Brian
about: I'm an indie video game developer.  I've visited 48 countries so far and love to travel!

name: Nancy  & Danny
