about: Hi!   We're Nancy and Danny.  I'm (Nancy) a former grade school teacher,  now working at the friendliest grocery store in town while Danny does something to do with TPS reports or something :).  Since we have 2 little ones, my husband Danny and I are not able to travel as much as we once did.  We love to live vicariously through travelers like yourselves, and help people explore the beautiful Northwest, and the city we LOVE!  Also, I like food, a lot.

name: Shannon
about: Chef. Adventurer. Gardener. Friend.

name: Mary
about: Like a lot of artists, I've done a number of different jobs to help support my career. I've been "on call" as an LMT 7 days a week for the last 20 years to the major hotels in Portland. Now, I am pursuing my lifelong dream of being an artist while being the Best Airbnb host I can be! My husband, Nolan, and I have been property managers before, but being hosts with Airbnb is so much better! It's like a new chapter for us, for which I am so incredibly grateful! I took a 2 week sketching trip to Italy in '06 which was one of the Best experiences of my entire life! Of course, we love to travel and look forward to going somewhere new one of these days! Nolan is a Portland native who works for an arts organization here (where we met in 1988) He loves photography, film and movies which he studied in high school and college, feeding and watching the backyard birds, going camping in Eastern Oregon when he gets time and reading or listening to audio books! Portland and the Pacific Northwest is our home and we'd love to help you enjoy your visit here if you choose to stay with us!

name: Terie & Aaron
about: My husband and I have lived in Portland for 20 years. We are both artists with a love of antiques and vintage, and would love to share our love of Portland with you.

name: Brian
about: Brian and Kimberley Yaeger have friends in the beer world across the country and are excited to welcome those on a "beercation" to one of the US's great Meccas of craft brewing. Brian is the author of "Oregon Breweries," a comprehensive guidebook and "Red, White, and Brew: An American Beer Odyssey" as well as contributor to several beer magazines and blogs. Ask to try some homebrew! Kimberley is known in beer circles as "Half Pint" and is the artistic--and tidy--half. Both take great pride in extending Northwest hospitality to like-minded travelers.

name: Leslie
about:
I recently relocated from NE to SW. The space listed on the site is my personal home, but I enjoy letting others have a comfortable place from which to explore. 

I love reading, writing, travel and photography.

name: Kim & Doug
about:
We are a married couple in our early 50s who enjoy cooking, cycling, gardening, woodworking, live music, and travel - both internationally and weekend road trips to the coast. We are long-term homeowners. As guests we are quiet and respectful. We enjoy exploring and are quite active, so we tend to be out and about most of the time. We have two dogs, an 8 year old Blue Heeler (aka Australian Cattle Dog) named Josie, and a 1 year old Red Heeler named Rocco, who sometimes travel with us. Both dogs are extremely smart, well-behaved, and 100% housebroken.

We are both musicians, so you may hear us playing music in the house from time to time. We also build industrial-farmhouse furniture, so can often be found in our workshop.

name: Douglas
about:
Hi, my name is Douglas!  Former attorney and history teacher who now founded and runs Portland Underground Grad School (pugspdx).  I've lived in a lot of places: Toronto, California, all over the East Coast, London, and there's no place I love more than Portland. I ride bikes, play soccer, and go on hikes.  At home, I read the New Yorker and the NY Times, along with diversions into science, geography, Eastern poetry, and financial market theory.  

Favorite restaurants: I have a lot.  I'm a foodie in a foodie town.  

I grew up in a restaurant family, so hospitality is in my blood.  I really like connecting people with place, so introducing guests to Portland, giving them a real sense of the city, is one of my favorite things to do.

name: John
about: From Portland, OR.  I am a 33 year old male who does enjoy new culture and traveling around the world, especially to coastal towns and historic cities! Very much into activities and witnessing or participating in new things, whether it is adventurous or tasting some different food I will always try it!

name: Emily
about:
Hello future hosts and guests!
I'm Emily, a travel junkie as well as an Airbnb host. I've been the owner of my home in Portland, OR since 2013 and have lived here for over a decade - so I have plenty of recommendations. Whether you're coming across my profile as a future guest or host - you should know that I am respectful, openminded and value great communication. Happy Travels!

name: Bader
about: 38 years old male single, enjoy working out both crossfit and the gym, always with my dog Daisy. I enjoy automobiles and  taking my car to the track.

name: Kim & Richard
about:
We are a couple, who loves art, education, city living and our share of pop-culture.

Our apartment is a small (500 sq. ft) modern one bedroom in a converted triplex. The building is a rough-around-the edges converted older home (1923). The apartment is on the second floor atop a tall enclosed staircase. This apartment has a narrow bathroom with a narrow standing shower stall and a fully equipped kitchen (with pans, dishes, silver ware, utensils, etc.). It's comfortable, quiet, has seven windows and in the heart of the historic and inviting Irvington neighborhood. The apartment is about a mile away from the Oregon Convention Center, close to public transit (buses, the street car, and MAX (light rail)), close to many restaurants and bars. The apartment is about three blocks away from a major grocery store (Safeway). It takes about 15 min. to get downtown by public transit and if you choose to walk about a 30-minute walk. It is located in inner NE Portland, which is extremely walkable and bikeable.

We are open to long-term tenants and have coin-operated washing and dryer machines for tenants that book for seven or more days. We are open to giving reduced rates to such tenants and tenants we have hosted prior. So if you are one of those people please let us know. 

No cleaning fee for this apartment (hurray!), so we do expect tenants to clean as they go and to take their shoes off when inside. If you have any questions please feel free to ask. Thank you for looking. 

Sorry street parking only, no pets, no smoking and no candles. Also we do not take reservations from third parties.

name: Brooke
about: I live in Portland, Oregon, and work in the music industry.  When I'm not doing that, I also play in an internationally touring band named Loch Lomond, as well as with a band of my own.

name: Norah
about: I am Norah. I like to exercise, listen to music and have a good time.

name: Stuart
about:
Hello! I'm Stuart. I'm a 24 year old homeowner loving life in Portland, Oregon. I spent most of my life in Idaho and am so thrilled to now be an Oregonian.

I love airbnb. It is one of the best websites/services/businesses that I have run across in recent memory. My airbnb spaces keep me pretty busy! My other work is running a software company that works with farmers' markets. I have the two best jobs I can imagine for this point in my life!

I love camping, fishing, hiking, general exploring, baseball, football, tennis, disc golf and business, to name a few things.

I work really, really hard in everything that I do and very much value having a chill, laid back atmosphere at home. Satisfaction of guests is the top priority above all else. I do anything and everything to ensure that each guest has a 5/5 star experience or better. :)

name: Mary Beth
about:
Female couple 
love people, love travel; love portland, esp. it's food & natural beauty!

name: Gabriela
about: I grew up in Uruguay but have been living in Portland since 2011. I speak Spanish and English and I love traveling.

name: Lisa
about: I am a recently retired teacher.  I enjoy people and love Airbnb as a way to earn additional income and meet interesting people from around the country and around the world.  I, too, love traveling.

name: Chrysalis
about: I'm currently a stay at home mom who enjoys the outdoors, travel, art and delicious food. Born and raised in Hawaii, I moved to San Diego for college and found my way up to Portland after graduation. I have done a lot of travel, including the majority of Europe, Canada, Mexico, SE Asia, New Zealand, Australia and a good bit of the United States. Though I've seen a lot, there are still many more places on my bucket list.

name: Juli
about:
I'm a mama of 3 and a part time employee of the Bureau of Transportation for the city of Portland in OR. I run the home and the activities while supporting my partner in his business, (URL HIDDEN)
I love connecting with my girlfriends, reading, and most recently I took up running. What I miss most about prekiddo life is travel. My partner and I often reminisce about the places we've been, from Africa to Southeast Asia to Central America and the US.

name: Jessica
about:
Hi! 
I'm Jessica, me and my husband live in Portland OR with our 2 little girls. I'm a former accountant turned gardener/stay at home mom and my husband works as a prop master on TV and commercials. 
We're experienced travelers that are easygoing and respectful, and we hope you will be so to. 

We're also non smokers, go to bed early, get up early and have no pets.

name: Carol
about: I love to travel and have had the great opportunity to visit many countries. I know it's the little things that can make the difference when you are away from home.... a good bed, nice linens, a welcoming atmosphere with a friendly, helpful host.  After a long trip, my garden is my sanctuary.  It is quiet and private and a great place to relax after a busy day.  I enjoy gardening, baking and creating a great meal with friends.  There is nothing better than cooking with fresh picked produce from my own garden.  If you are here in the summer, there is lot's to share.  I look forward to meeting you and exchanging travel stories.

name: Evolve Vacation Rental
about: Evolve Vacation Rental Network is redefining vacation rental management by eliminating hassle, guesswork and frustration for homeowners and travelers. Our team is available 7 days a week and we look forward to providing you with exceptional customer service during every interaction. Please tell us how we can help with your upcoming trip.

name: Deshna
about: I am a yoga instructor, author, post-partum doula, and I work for a non-profit, spiritual organization. I love to travel, write, read, walk, do yoga, dance, sing, cook, and meet new people. Natural living, gardening, organic whole foods, nature, music, and community are how I spend my time.

name: Jeanie & Taylor
about: We love to explore our favorite city and we are lucky to live here. From trying new restaurants, attending Portland events, and staying active on the trails, mountains and the city. Our goal is to add more pins to our world map with 40  between us but home is always here in Portland.

name: Molly
about: I am an artist and friend-maker.  I live with my wife and our cat and our dog.  And our chickens :)  We love to have interesting people in our lives, we love to cultivate the comfort and beauty of our home and share that with others.  And we ourselves love to travel, so we thought airbnb would be a fun option to try!

name: Carla
about:
Living as a Chef in Portland has allowed me to be involved in this community.  From the various bounty of the region, I am able to communicate how I see the world by using the rich resources that the Pacific North West has to offer. Growing up in California and traveling in several countries has exposed me to the cultural diversity of how food is expressed, and I take great joy and care in bringing that diversity to Portland.  

Most places I've traveled to were tropical.  Mexico, Costa Rica, Hawaii, Philippines, Australia and New Zealand to name a few.  But for me, cultural diversity starts in the good ole USofA.  The Mid-West to the South and up and down the Western Seaboard as well as choice places in the East Coast have all been a Culinary delight!  And I enjoy bringing those flavors to Portland in my teaching and my menus.

I have experienced many styles of traveling from camping, family stays, traditional B&B's, and luxury accommodations.  Those that stand out greatly are the stories of the people that I connected with while traveling. Those spaces made those stories possible.

My life motto is:  "Life is too short for sub-par food alone."  Go off and Explore!  Have adventures and meet as many people as possible.  And if you are very lucky, make a meal with them and connect through "talking story".

name: Robert
about: From the UK lived in Portland for 12 years. It's a great city with so much to offer and explore. I live here with my wife and 1 year old baby and believe that its a great place to visit work, explore and enjoy.  Please contact me if you have any questions or need further information.

name: Paul And Carmenza
about: Warm, friendly and fun couple. Paul is originally from Canada and Carmenza is originally from Colombia. We met in Portland and love living here. When we are not traveling or out enjoying festivals and the beautiful nature in this area, we like to relax our spacious and colorful back yard. We have an indoor cat Gia who is friendly - please let us know in advance about any pet allergies so that we can accommodate you.

name: Paul And Mary
about: Family of four from Portland, Oregon. Mary and Paul are entrepreneurs with an angel-funded start-up. Paul is an avid road cyclist. Mary enjoys straddling the home-maker/co-founder role. Two beautiful, smart daughters are Isabella, age 15, and Frankie (Francesca), age 10. We're pretty laid back and easy going. Love good food + good wine + good company and enjoying the Pacific Northwest.

name: Andrew
about:
I'm easy going, like a conversation.  My hobby and a passion is Argentine Tango.  Not far behind tango is making gardens happen--I'm a garden designer/builder.
Born and raised in Poland with a fine arts major.  Portland is my home now.

name: Mike
about:
Minded toward sustainable living and adventurous happy times outdoors.  Love travel.  Love good organic food, wines, beers, spirits.  Easy going and respectful with expectations of the same please!  Will happily chat it up with guests, or mind my own...

My intention is to make your trip a really great trip, and/or to be a really great guest - please feel free to read my reviews, as they will tell the same story.

Life is way too short, so great travel with great ethics goes a long ways toward a happy existence here.

Cheers! - MJ

name: Lindsey
about:
Hi there,
My husband and I are both Portland natives--which is almost the same as being a magical unicorn these days;) We love this city--and especially this neighborhood.

HISTORY:
I grew up in Eastmorland and realized that that is the only part of the world that I want to live in. We live r(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)ght outside of it--which is brilliant. My all time favorite thing to do is to walk down Reed College Place--it takes my breath away. 

PROFESSIONS:
I own a graphic design agency and love love love my job. My clients are amazing, my team is wicked talented and I get to learn and grown every single day.

My husband also runs a small business--he has an awesome pressure washing business. He cleans roofs, houses, decks, and sidewalks. He is super detail oriented.

AIR BNB:
We are a great team! I am the face of our air bnb and Jason is the brawn. 

I am having a blast with hosting our wonderful guests. It keeps me super social--I get to be helpful and make use of part of our house that would be vacant if you were not staying with us. 

PASSIONS:
Travel is my #1 passion. So having you travel here, kinda feeds that for me.
Fishing is Jason's. We have hundreds of pounds of salmon and halibut in our freezer. He's got skills!

Looking forward to hearing about you and your world!
Lindsey

name: Ron
about:
To appreciate this amazing life fully is a gift and my partner Suzi and I strive to do that in our own lives and practice.  We are parents of two wonderful young women and have lived in this home since 1993.  Among many other things, Suzi is a native Oregonian, graphic designer, mountaineer, rock climber and climb assistant with Mazamas, a Portland-based climbing group.  Ron grew up surfing and when he can fit it in he surfs, stand-up paddles and rides bikes on roads and trails and always enjoys walking our dog.  Ron is a member of the Zen Community of Oregon and attends Heart of Wisdom Zen temple in Portland, founded by teachers Hogen and Chozen Bays Roshi. 
We have designed our garden and studio bungalow to create the greatest opportunity for peace and enjoyment that we can afford and our goal is to share this with others as a way to deepen our own lives and our guests' appreciation of their visit to Portland, their staycation or meditation retreat and, indeed, this amazing life we all share together.   
(URL HIDDEN) A star at dawn,
(URL HIDDEN)bubble in a stream
(URL HIDDEN)flash of lightning in a summer cloud,
(URL HIDDEN)flickering lamp,
(URL HIDDEN) A phantom and a dream,
(URL HIDDEN) So is this fleeing world.
Verse of the Diamond Sutra(URL HIDDEN)

name: Deborah
about:
Hi!

Bay Area native proud to call Portland my home since 2004.

I have a beautiful, quiet, furnished large 4 BR house with hardwood floors in Portland. 

I love welcoming guests in my home and giving them information about Portland.

Non-smoker, and very little alcohol. I am a creative musician who also works with adults with mental illness.

name: Hunter
about:
Hi! 
**Please read ALL things in the listing! Most of your questions can be answered right here!**
I'm Hunter! Welcome to Portland! My girlfriend Stephanie and I would love to have you! We live upstairs and will be your onsite hosts, GPS, and if needed - local guides. I work in the music industry, and my girlfriend is a local artist. We have had lots of time to explore Portland and it's surrounding areas. We are very social so if you're also looking for stuff to do, we would be happy to show you around.

name: Maylene & Charity
about:
We met in Japan over 20 years ago and share a common passion for travel but haven't seen nearly enough of the world yet! 

Small business owners and entrepreneurial folk, we can be pretty busy but we're always available for questions and referrals.

In our free time you'll find us planning our next big adventure, binging on YouTube videos, stretched out on a yoga mat, or curled up with a good book.

name: Terri
about: I live in portland own a natural furinture store   Cotton cloud futon have loved air band b  have lots of kids and 6 grand kids

name: Shannon
about: I am an outgoing woman interested in new experiences and living life to the fullest. I am passionate about art, design, food, travel and deep, lasting friendships. I have a love for animals and have a Weimaraner that is my heart. I enjoy gardening, welding and international/art & documentary films. I have traveled to many places including Ireland, Scotland, England, France, The Netherlands, Germany, Prague, throughout the US and have the bug again to travel more in the near future like Asia and New Zealand. I look forward to meeting new people on this journey….

name: Gibran
about: I live with my wife in Portland, OR. We love this city and have been here for over a decade. We also love traveling and being in the great outdoors.

name: Jim & Lauren
about: We are two locals living in SE Portland for the past three years. This is one of our favorite cities in the world and we're happy to show you around the little-big city we call home.

name: Stefanie
about: We love to travel, watch soccer, and always enjoy a fine wine or single malt.  Whether you are a business person on an extended stay or just tourists coming to explore Oregon, we welcome you!

name: De & Toby
about:
De & Toby live in Portland, Oregon with our four chickens Whitey, Misfit, Big Baby & Mio.

We are both graduates of Prescott College with degrees in Sustainable Community Development and Toby is studying Leadership for Sustainability Education at Portland State University's Graduate School of Education.He is also working in education at KairosPDX Public Charter School as their Nutrition & Garden Coordinator. De works teaching creative movement to youth and at Douglas Farms on nearby Savie Island. 

We like to meet interesting people, take walks, ride our bikes, cook, travel and host people in our home through Airbnb!

We are laid back and friendly hosts who appreciate and reciprocate kindness.

Please let us know if you would like to know more about us.

name: Damaris-Mike
about:
Damaris and I are from NYC.  We moved to Portland in 2012.  Damaris is an actor who writes and produces her own shows.

I'm an avid cross-fitter... a software developer... white water rafting guide... i stared in a movie a few years ago that had a big long song and dance number where i wear a ridiculous costume.

Over the last decade and a half, I've worked on large scale art projects since 2001 at the Burning Man festival.

We have listings in NYC, Portland - and we help out our friend, a Mardi Gras Indian chief in New Orleans - see out New Orleans wish list.

name: Stephanie
about: I am a mother, veterinarian, acupuncturist, sometimes artist and general lover of life.  I always prefer a connection with people over technology and look forward to hearing about other people's adventures through hosting.

name: Roberto
about: Well traveled, educated, mature and adventurous gay man. I split my time between Portland, OR and Palm Springs.  Some of my favorite traveling activities include: cycling, body surfing, camping, exploring natural wonders, and historical sites.

name: Nathan
about: My name is Nathan Mills. My wife Heather and I usually travel together. I teach yoga and nutrition and my wife does massage and skin care. We live in Portland OR. We love to travel, dance tango, swing, and salsa. We have often been described by our travel hosts as the "best house guests they have ever had" and our landlords have described us as the best tenants that have ever had. We are new to air b&b (in 2014) and excited to explore it from the travel end and the hosting end. :)

name: Jason
about:
My name is Jason, and my fiance's name is Shobhna. Yes, that is a name that could be easily slaughtered... Feel free to call her Shob or Shobi... It's easier that way. 

My passion lies in sports and pushing myself and others to the limits... Having said that, I own an obstacle course racing company called The Inferno that now has over 2 years and 3, soon to be 4 events under it's belt. If you feel like getting a workout in I hold weekly workouts in Peninsula Park just down the road... You might find us out there one random day throwing, flipping and/or hitting tires with a sledge hammer. Since The Inferno is still in it's infancy and doesn't quite pay the bills just yet... I also daylight as the Marketing & Operations Manager for Spinlister in Portland. 

Shobi is my better half... Yup, that is super cheesy, but it's true. She puts up with all my crap and is fully supportive through it all. You will even find her our in the park throwing tires or down at our venue helping build obstacles for our races. Couldn't ask for anyone better! Oh... and she daylights as a Client Service Engineer in downtown.

name: Susan
about:
I'm a Mom of most lovable Noah, his dream to go to London has come true! - he'll do a college semester there this Fall.

I'm passionate about reading, art and design, and music.

Books for me is like a crowded airport runway with jets on line waiting for take off, piles waiting to be read. Loved "Please Understand Me: Character and Temperament Types" by David Keirsey, "Snoop" by Sam Gosling, "Looking Beyond the Ivy League" by Loren Pope, "Dinner at the Homesick Restaurant" and "The Accidental Tourist" by Anne Tyler.

Music: Aaron Copland (my favorite composer), Maurice Ravel (also my favorite composer), Johannes Brahms, Max Richter, Helen Jane, 2Cellos, the exceptional and enlightened band: Flobots, Wax Taylor, John Newman, Claude Debussy, Antonín Dvorak, Philip Glass, Edith Piaf, Enya, Zoe Keating, Linkin Park, Eminem, Rachel Portman, Julia Kent, Ludovico Einaudi, Hans Zimmer.

I feel Portland is an enlightened city with it's heart in the right place, and it has adorable old houses, and comical overlapping bridges, and Sperling Book of Reviews ranked it #1 for the best summers in the country, and then there's Powells Bookstore, our gem!

Here is a review I treasure left by an Airbnb Guest:

"While we wish we could have stayed forever, our time at Susan's was just super perfect. I'd like to state that Susan is an incredible character who exceeded our Host expectations and was so welcoming I thought I might actually be family. The place was private, neat and BEYOND charming; the kind that supersedes any trendy, minimalist loft and more so gives a cozy, staying-with-Auntie-over-the-summer-learning-to-paint-because-she's-a-lovely-artist-and-drinking-lemonade-everyday kind of vibe. It was genuine and felt almost nostalgic. Any how, we would just really like to publicly announce how much Susan's hospitality meant to us. We will be keeping Susan updated on our future travels to Portland. P.S. The bed is super comfy :)"

name: Josh
about: I'm a professional photographer and software developer who makes photography apps for the Mac, iPad, and iPhone. My main app is called Magic Window which includes time lapse views from all over the world. Much of my travel is to destinations to capture scenes for the app. I love places that have a balcony with a view!

name: Todd & Casey
about: Todd and Casey are a married couple of multi-disciplinary professional artists— a jazz drummer/abstract painter/photographer and a songwriter/actress/playwright. Casey is a Portland native and Todd has lived here for over 25 years. We are avid world travelers and and welcome international guests as well as friends from here in the States. We'll be just across the patio from you in the main house. You may see our spunky little black cat Tallulah in the window.

name: Wei
about: I have owned this house and been living in Portland since 2006.  I worked at a job for a couple decades required frequent international travel, which I love.  My most recent work travel took me to Guatemala, Ecuador and Colombia in 2014. In 2015, I went to Argentina to study Argentine folklore and tango.   They are amazing trips. In addition to travel, I love dancing, yoga, gymnastics, snowboarding, running, acro-yoga, rock climbing, hiking and the Spanish language. ¡ Sí! Hablo algo español!

name: Beau
about: Our family loves our neighborhood, city and our region.  You'll often find us in the Columbia River Gorge doing many outdoor things during every season, rain or shine.  We love the wonderful outdoor music venues in Oregon and tent camping by a lake or river.  Everything is so accessible from Portland!   We have a small child with a lot of energy so he keeps us on the move!  We also have a wonderful restaurant/bar which is a famous staple here in our neighborhood (almost twenty years in business).

name: Caitlin And Amanda
about:
We are avid bike commuters who long for more sunshiny days in Portland, Oregon. Amanda loves books, beer and playing rugby and works in a lab that studies tuberculosis. Caitlin can't live without running, hiking and red wine and works as a nurse on the night shift. We've been together for nearly seven years and had the pleasure of getting married in Caitlin's home state of Utah in December of 2013.
We've used Airbnb many times to travel since we love getting tips from local people, not just guidebooks. We've really enjoyed helping people find Portland's secrets and meeting people from all over the world. Though we have busy seeming schedules, we ensure all of our guests have what they need to enjoy all that Portland has to offer. So drop us a line and we'll meet up soon!

name: Jayme
about: I am a welder by trade and I build railcars and barges in Portland, Or. for a living. I also co-own a small massage and acupuncture studio (its work that keeps me working, lol) When traveling I lean towards escapes with warm weather or at least near the ocean. My motto, "Good times, always"!

name: Lauren
about:
My husband Shad and I moved to Portland six years ago and we just couldn't be happier in the beautiful Pacific Northwest. Originally from Kansas, we have always had a sense of adventure and love for travel and the outdoors. We have since established our roots here and bought a house in our dream neighborhood of Sunnyside a few years ago. Both Shad and I are Registered Nurses and work in the Operating Room at OHSU, the large research and university hospital. Our jobs provide us the flexibility to travel and we love meeting other travelers and immersing ourselves in different cultures- especially different cuisines! We enjoy hiking, music, cooking with friends, gardening, hanging with family, and walks through the neighborhood. We are a family of four- our baby boy Jon Henry and our elderly black lab George. 
We look forward to hosting guests and hope to provide them with a comfortable stay and the things we value having when we travel ourselves. We will kindly respect your privacy, and we are also happy to share a beer or local advice on the back patio if the occasion arises!

name: Joel
about:
I love to travel and want to provide a comfortable place for people to stay while they are in my beautiful city. I grew up in Portland then lived in Taiwan for a while. I am into photography, music, traveling, outdoors, languages.

I use a professional cleaning service to ensure top quality accommodations. We use all natural cleaning supplies. In an effort to keep it green, all electricity pumped into the house is renewable and all carbon from natural gas is offset with carbon credits.

name: Hayden
about: Hi Airbnb! My name is Hayden and I am a native to the Pacific Northwest. I grew up in Portland and recently graduated from Arizona State University with an accounting degree. I have had great experiences staying in Airbnb's and am looking forward to becoming a host.

name: Corey
about:
My wife and I are very excited to be residents of Portland, OR, our new home since relocating from Atlanta, GA in 2010 in search for a higher quality of life, new adventures and a good community!  

We are both young professionals - I'm a computer scientist and she's a CPA.  We are both very clean, responsible and respectful.  We enjoy traveling, cooking, outdoor activities, and meeting interesting new people.

name: Jeff & Béalleka
about: Hello! Jeff is a film studies and writing instructor at Portland Community College. Béalleka is a writer, cultural competency consultant and storyteller. We enjoy travel, music, food, hosting and community. In addition to sharing our home, we love cultivating exquisite adventures for visitors and ourselves. We're always eager to explore new cultures and places, and open to house swaps, too!

name: Lance
about:
Hi,

I am Lance. I love where I live. 

My house is an architectural and engineering marvel perched on a forest-like wooded hillside. It has unbelievable views of downtown Portland and of natural beauty. The house has floor to ceiling windows yet is completely private. Three pairs of vultures soar in front of the house throughout the summer over the Marquam Park Nature Reserve. The reserve is home to hawks, falcons, hummingbirds, raccoons, owls, and the odd coyote. 

Even on overcast days, it is still a very bright place to be. 

I am a manufacturer's rep, marketing to industry, from paper mills to potato chip plants. Seeing Cheetos being made is unexpectedly entertaining.  

I windsurf most of the summer in the Columbia Gorge and in the off season, I run the Marquam Trails by my house.

Oh yeah, and I like company.

name: Angela
about:
I am a massage therapist and a meditation teacher.  I enjoy beautifying home spaces and have a industrial hemp building project in the works.  

I enjoy hikes and traveling to magical places with fresh water and healthy lifestyles.  I lived on Kauai 8 years and my home reflects this with bamboo furniture and rich vibrant colors.  I love to dance and listen to sounds that move me.

name: Nolan
about:
Good day Airbnb-ers, My name is Nolan Griffiths. I have been living in the PNW ,Pacific Northwest, (Idaho, Washington, Oregon) the last three years. I am originally from Minnesota. I am a sports and outdoor enthusiast, obsessed with MN Vikings Football. Recently, since I moved to Oregon surfing has been a new hobby. If you have questions about the beaches in Oregon or Washington I may have answers for you. I also enjoy good food and beer. I can tell you which parts of the city to visit, watering holes to go to, and spots to feed the soul. Please send me a message if you have questions. 

Prost!

name: Durga
about: I'm a world traveler that happened to settle in Portland, OR to raise my kids and establish a spiritual counseling practice. I love cooking real food, photographing nature, and making beautiful things with crystals, glass and wood. I can't live without real conversations, the beach, and enough sleep. If I'm traveling with my husband and kids I like healthy activity, and if I'm traveling by myself or just my husband, I like to sleep late and drink really good decaf lattes made with coconut cream.

name: Amanda
about: My husband, David, and I got married last New Years Eve (best day ever). We enjoy cooking, traveling, and spending time with our Saint Bernard puppy.

name: Anna
about: Vegan west coast bird and proud mother of a blue heeler named Matilda and a rescue cat named Cassie.

name: Patti
about:
I love travel, good food, wine, dancing and living in the moment. Travel allows me to gain sense of place for the people who live there, both today and in the past.  Hiking in natural environment of the host country’s special places are usually the first draw to the places I visit. Exploring food and drink of my host country is high on my activity list. Discovering the Latin dance venues of my host country is recent interest of mine.

I am host because I enjoy hearing the stories of other travelers. I worked as a naturalist and tour guide in Alaska for several years. I met people from around the world and I miss those conversations. I want to hear your travel stories.

Airbnb offers more authentic travel experiences, and I want to help my guests find the special places, food or events that make travels to Portland a memorable highlight of their trip.

In the past, I traveled staying at boutique hotels, but Airbnb will be part of my next trip. My hope is that becoming a host will allow me to be world traveler and citizen in my next trip.

name: Ryan
about: I work as  a firefighter and my girlfriend Rowan (my most frequent travel companion) is a naturopathic physician.  We both enjoy travel and have traveled extensively both domestically and abroad.

name: Dana
about: Dana is your host at The Red Roost Guesthouse, along with her husband Eric and their three kids. We are an active, positive, progressive family that appreciates beauty, comfort, the arts, civic responsibility, and connection. Depending on which of us you find, you might find us singing or making art, drinking coffee from a french press, playing drums or drinking kombucha made by Eric, acting out Harry Potter movies, hanging on a trapeze, or just communing with the chickens. Dana's motto is "Take it easy, but take it." We can give you privacy or support your stay with a bit more care and connection. You are our guest.

name: Lee Ann
about: From Portland, Oregon (originally NY/Philadelphia) - love to travel around the around the world, and am raising my kids to be respectful global citizens.

name: Gunther & Stacey
about: We are a middle age couple with underage children who started our life over in Portland 2 years ago after many years on the East Coast. We have an electric bike business in the nearby St Johns neighborhood.  We love introducing visitors to our fun city.

name: Claudia And Alexei
about: Portland, OR

name: Catie
about:
From Ohio (don't judge), love Ohio - but love the Pacific Northwest more.  Jobs brought my husband, Caleb, and me to Portland in 2011 - now we couldn't imagine leaving.  
For fun we hang with our pup, hike/bike all around PDX, eat (and eat and eat), and travel as much as possible.
We aim to be super considerate and delightful guests when we rent and to provide a clean, rad home when we host.

name: Brooke
about:
Hi, I'm Brooke! I'm a food and travel blogger over on the blog Chocolate + Marrow, where I write, photograph, and develop recipes. 

Food is a huge part of the travel experience, one of the most important as far as I'm concerned. If you're staying in our Portland apartment, we've got you covered with loads of suggestions on where to eat and drink while you're here. We also leave magazines and guidebooks to help you plan all of your food stops. 

My husband and I are travel nerds. We'll travel just about anywhere, but some of our favorite destinations include northern Thailand, the islands of Belize, and New Orleans. I guess that last one isn't really a travel destination, though--we were both born and raised in the Big Easy so it's really more like going home ;) We love using AirBnB both to host people and also as travelers ourselves. It's such a great way to meet new people, swap stories, and experience a city like a local--we're excited you love it too! 

If our apartment sounds like a good fit, please reach out with any questions. We want to make sure your trip to Portland, whether with us or someone else, is as special as possible!

name: Dona
about: I am a semi-retired artist/designer. I love being creative, the arts, great food, travel, people, interesting conversation and laughter. I have always loved welcoming people into my home and look forward to opening my doors to you. MI casa es su casa!

name: Nancy
about: I'm an architecture professor interested in how designers think and how students learn. I've focused on how digital methods can open up creative possibilities, facilitate collaborations and improve decision-making. I like sharing what I love about design, University of Oregon, Portland and Eugene. I greatly enjoy travel and getting to know thoughtful people who share my interests (arts, bicycling, cooking, fiction).  American-born, I've lived in Hong Kong, Rome, Melbourne, Shanghai and love to travel.

name: Nancy
about:
I love Portland!  I have lived here my entire life.  I raised my two children in NE Portland.  I have two kitty cats, love dogs too, but lead a busy life and don't have the time to care for a dogie.  I am realtor, who loves helping my clients navigate most likely the largest transaction of their life.
I find cooking an art.  A good book and movie are a great way for me to relax.  I enjoy people and learning about their lives and experiences.
And of course being from the great NW, a trip to the gorge or beach or central Oregon fill my heart!

name: Kate
about: A family of 4.  We love hosting and enjoy the opportunity to meet new people.  We love our family, love our friends, and love Jesus.  We are both graduates from the University of Washington where we competed in track and field and studied business and geography.  We can't live without.....each other :)

name: Lori 'N Podji
about:
I purchased this amazing house the summer of 2012.  It is a fabulous home and I am so excited to open it up to AirBnB friends.  Hosting comes naturally as I have had many friends and family over.  Now I want to meet new folks from across the river to across the country and beyond!  

I enjoy traveling and prefer to stay with locals in my quest for adventures.  I feel  renting a room is a key way to keep the cost of traveling/ living abroad low, raise your level of security, have the amenities that allow you to live more self-sufficient and conveniently, have more personal privacy, all while becoming more embedded within the local community that you are visiting.

Lori is an avid hiker and has stood on the top of the highest peaks in the Pacific Northwest.  She just recently completed hiking all 148 hikes in the Douglas Lorain Afoot & Afield hiking book.  She is currently section hiking the Pacific Crest Trail thru Oregon and has close to 325 miles tromped off.  Lori has hiked most of the Columbia Gorge trails and a majority of the hikes in and around Mt. Hood.  She would love to show you a map of the hiking areas with every hike highlighted that she tromped.

Lori is an administrator at the middle school level.  She is a recovering Physical Education/Health teacher of 13 years before moving up to administration.  She absolutely loves her job and is excited to wake up every day knowing she is doing exactly what she is suppose to do.

I invite you to stay and enjoy Portland and Oregon and all it has to offer.

name: Maria And Oliver
about:
If you are thinking about tou stay in our place and are checking this site to know a little bit of your hosts, we very sorry to tell you that probably we won't be able to meet personaly. Oliver and I (Maria) have tempory moved to Mexico. 
My sister Lina will be your host. You can get to know her at this profile: https://www.airbnb.com/users/show/18153020

If you are wondering about wheter or not you should host us, then let me tell you a little bit of us. We have just recently moved to Mexico, and before that, we lived in Portland,OR for about four years,  I (Maria) am from Colombia, and Oliver is German-italian, born in Germany, but he has lived longer in Italy and soon longer in the USA than in Germany.
We are a fun couple, we love spending time with friends and family (when it is possible). We enjoy making new friends, getting to know people; we consider ourselves World Citizens and we highly value different cultures, foods, and lifestyles. Of course we love eating delicious food and traveling. :)

name: Casey & Eric
about:
We have been guests in over 30 countries and look forward to hosting travelers in our native country and adopted home in Portland.

Casey is a Bay Area transplant and likes birds, so she fits right into Portland.

Eric is a Wisconsin farmer's son who likes silly putty and cooking.

name: Hannah & Sam
about: Can't live without live music, good food and the outdoors. We're always up for an adventure!

name: Tom
about: I'm a retired Chemistry Professor and I am totally hooked on family genealogy, and maintaining my health through continuous aerobic exercise (cycling).  That is Leslie, my wife of 40 years, in the picture.  She lives here too and you may see her  if she is not working.

name: Gretchen & Taylor
about:
Owners, Taylor and Gretchen are avid travelers and always looking for an adventure. They spend a bit of time overlanding in Baja every year and are always ready to get away. In 2015, they started turning their dream into a reality, bringing Sportsmobile rentals to Portland, Oregon. Taylor and Gretchen want more people to be able to access the beauty of the Pacific Northwest. Both, intrigued and captivated by ‘the van life’, they spend as much time as they can touring around in their personal van. They tend to pack up every weekend and hit the road. Sometimes, gone for just the weekend and sometimes gone for longer. Either way they are happy to get out and experience something new. By starting ROAM, they hope that more people and families will get out and explore. Leave the chaos behind and go roam.

After exploring the gorgeous and little known areas of the PNW for years, we look forward to pointing you in the right direction and making your road trip adventure the best vacation you have ever had.

name: Dustin
about:
Perhaps the best way to describe myself succinctly is to list what motivates me:
- Academics and knowledge, particularly science
- Art and creativity, particularly music and photography
- Nature, particularly alpine camping
- Movement, particularly road cycling
- Laughter, particularly Coen Brothers' films
- Experience, particularly extemporaneous endeavors and travel
- Meeting people, particularly those with boundless ambition and imagination
- Health, particularly a plant-based diet and moderate wine consumption
- Writing, particularly writing the word particularly

I am a scientist investigating cellular and molecular mechanisms of nerve regeneration in the spinal cord and the heart; I have a small start-up company that brokers private-sourced funds to biomedical research laboratories; I lead the local band, "dKOTA" that plays the Portland area. We sound like Ryan Adams meets Radiohead meets Damien Rice.

name: Rosemary
about: I am a special education teacher in Portland. I am very active outdoors. I love to hike, backpack, do yoga and climb! I have a lovely roommate who also works in the school district and a 2 year old cat! Portland has been my home for over 8 years and I could never imagine moving away!

name: Jim
about: Martine and I have lived in Portland 30 years.  Marti does videography, and I consult for companies exporting.  We love to travel to Italy and France.

name: Todji And Gisele
about:
Todji and Gisele hold the intention of providing an excellent experience for their Airbnb guests!

Todji met Gisele in Rio De Janiero Brazil when he walked into her house.  

After knowing each other for three weeks, they went on a first date in Peru for one month,  driving through the Andes Mountains and canoeing in the Amazon. The following month they became engaged, and Todji then moved to Rio where they married in 2011. 

They moved back to Todji's house in Portland in 2012 to work as a team to produce bronze public art monuments for US cities, and for Gisele to study and teach yoga.  Sculptures that Todji created at the house now are in the sculpture garden for all to enjoy!

May all who arrive here be blessed with wind under their wings to achieve their highest potential on their soul's path!

name: Seth
about: Connecticut and I are both born and bred Portlanders. We both work for small family businesses. We have 3 children who all attend local public schools. We love that Portland is a great place to raise a family, that it is close to so many beautiful places and is attracting people from all over the world to its beautiful confines.

name: Chelsea
about: I'm an illustrator/designer. I've lived in many places in the US as well as in the Bahamas and South America, but have found a longterm home here in Portland Oregon. I love to travel near and far, and I hope to visit as many places as possible via plane, train, boat or automobile. Life is short, and so is this bio :)

name: Michael
about: My wife, Peg, and I have been Portland residents since 1978 and love this great city. We enjoy walking and biking our beautiful Mt. Tabor Neighborhood (we were married on the summit). We know what great AirBnB hospitality is like, having been AirBnB guests ourselves on our travels. We look forward to sharing our lodging and our beautiful city with guests.

name: Britt
about: Young, active professional. When I'm not working, I'm skiing, climbing mountains,  surfing or on the prowl for my next adventure.

name: Fortis & Katherine
about: Our house, Beit Shlomo, and our cannabis project, Hawthorne Sasson, are part of the Jewish congregation we run called Shalom Cascadia Jewish Minyan. We're also developing a 1.5 acre parcel of land into Sukkat Shalom Spiritual Retreat, just outside of Seattle.  Fortis is also a writer and a lawyer, and Katherine works in nonprofit management.  Between us, we have four children, ages 4 to 21. We both love yoga, home cooking, and a good box of red wine.

name: Allison
about: Athletic, slightly ridiculous, life - engaged, outgoing, living, traveling, laughing, photographing, community volunteering, nature loving, adventure having, art and love creating, High School Council member, Shakespearean theatre board member, hungry tummy feeding, real estate investment brokerage manager, all around good time maker and active YES! sayer.

name: Yvette
about: I've lived in Portland for a little over 5 years now and love it! I love meeting new people and discovering cool places to visit around Portland. When I'm not cooking for a group of friends or out with my pup you can probably find me at a yoga studio. Look forward to meeting you soon!

name: Kimberly
about: I am American and my husband is British and we recently moved back to the US after 8 glorious years in China.  We have 2 kids and a small dog.

name: Natasha
about: I am the "house-mom" of five adults cohabitating this grand house. I enjoy getting outside for a hike, and looking forward to having a garden this summer for the first time in years. I have visited Ecuador, Peru, China, Thailand, Cambodia, Germany, and Austria. And Canada and Mexico too. :) I also enjoy aerial arts, reading, and I am generally working on something crafty around the house.

name: Pete And Lee
about: We love to share Portland -

name: Adrian
about: My family and I have been creating and maintaining premier living spaces for over 25 years.  We are responsible, clean, and very stylish.  We are committed to providing our guest with the best experience as possible.

name: Brad & Becca
about:
We are a youngish married professional couple who have lived in Portland for about a dozen years.  Brad has traveled the world, and we are both thrilled to have the opportunity to make our home available to other adventurous wanderers.  Becca is a professionally-trained culinary hobbyist who makes a living as an accountant, and Brad loves his job as a high school teacher.  We're into good vittles, ample coffee, riding our bikes, taking in plays, movies, and comedy shows, getting together with friends, and spending time together in our beautiful home.

We're happy to spend social time with our guests, but we have no problem leaving them to their own devices and plans if that's how they've structured their visit.  We look forward to meeting you!

name: Samantha
about: From Pasadena, California

name: Steve
about: We are a family of 5 who just love the outdoors.  We will be spending the summer months taking a trip around the US (best history lesson for my kids right?).

name: Corinne
about: I am a world traveler who has lived in Portland for many years. I love meeting people and am full of suggestions for anyone visiting our popular destination.

name: Melanie
about: I'm one part crunchy hipster mama and one part frumpy bookkeeper. I am a natural hostess; it brings me joy to entertain, to cook and organize. I understand the meaning of it all when in the garden, in the woods, on the road or at the beach. I make a very kind cocktail and a perfect cup of coffee. But a good novel and a cup of tea might be all I need.

name: Michele
about: Hi there, we are Michele, Mike & Carly.  We've lived here in Portland for 24 years.  We love this place.  In our free time, we like to bike in town and hike around, we enjoy cooking, spending time with friends and just getting out and about in the city.  We love to see live music and live near a couple of great venues.  We dig our neighborhood, most anything we want to do is a quick walk or short drive away.  Mike's a general contractor who is remodeling Portland's older homes one by one.  Michele is a life & business coach, working with many of Portland's creative, independent professionals.  We love to travel, near and far whenever our daughter's school schedule allows. When we are around, we're happy tell you about our favorite spots, if you'd like personal suggestions.

name: Carly
about: Originally from Buffalo, NY. I love to travel, host dinner parties and make food from scratch. Oh and sometimes I do yoga, but mainly I just like to talk about how I sometimes do yoga.

name: Dafne
about:
Hello, 
I am a yoga teacher and author from Istabul, Turkey. I live part time in Portland and other times in Istanbul. When I travel I would love to have guests at my place. With my husband we made a beautiful home that we truly love and I hope you enjoy it too! I love novels, bicycles, travelling to unknown parts of the world and learning languages. See you soon!

name: Brad
about: I am an Oregonian, born and raised. I am the proud father to one (tabby). I'm a realtor at Living Room Realty, and manage business development at Living Room Property Management. When I'm not doing either of those things, I'm stuffing my face, drinking local beer and staying fit (lie). Portland is the perfect city for these vices, we get along just fine.

name: Anne
about:
I am a high school teacher so have more time summers than I do during the school year.  I have two children: one, who is 20 and in college and one who is 16 and in high school.




I was born in southern New Mexico on the border and was raised in northern New Mexico.  My childhood was rural and I showed horses, did 4-H and rode in the rodeo.  I moved to Oregon to attend prep school when I was 16 as the educational opportunities in my hometown were limited  I attended college in Colorado Springs but came to settle in Oregon afterwards.  I love to travel and see the world, but after 35 years in the Pacific Northwest, Portland is home.

"How we spend our days is, after all, how we spend our lives."  Annie Dillard

name: Cara
about: Professional couple who enjoy urban life with 2 simple cats. New York is too fast, Seattle too crowded, Portland is just right. Hosting out-of-town friends (and now strangers) is pure pleasure in this great town!

name: Tianshu
about:
I am a typical Portland transplant: came to visit 18 years ago and never left :) I am a mom of three. I love good food, exploring nature, art house movies, art of all forms, good books, interesting buildings .... all the wonderful things Portland has to offer. I hope you will have a great time in this city I love! 

I don't live on the premise so you will have a very private stay. But I make every effort to greet you upon your arrival and help you settle in. Otherwise, I am a phone call/text away, and I will always try my best to help make your stay comfortable and pleasant.

name: Stella
about:
I am many things: a Mom, a scientist (computational biology), a permaculture enthusiast, a meditator, a cook, etc.

My 20 y.o. son  Aaron and myself have been living in this awesome house for five years.  We both enjoy gardening, intellectual discussions, music, meditation retreats and recipes from Yotam Ottolenghi cook books.

For years I would use 'vacation rental by owners' while traveling, and now it got even better with airbnb.
It is so much more interesting and less expensive to stay in people homes, rather than in a generic lifeless hotels.  
I speak fluent Russian and Hebrew, in addition to English. And some Spanish.
We travel locally and internationally: Italy, Germany, Canada, Brazil, England, Jordan, multiple trips to Israel.    Aaron traveled in Peru, Egypt and Israel. We have hosted on airbnb for the past two summers - when we go on vacations.  Now in addition to the entire house which is only available when we are gone, we are also listing a separate room that will be available through the entire summer.

name: Chrissy
about:
My husband, Craig, and I have lived in this house for over 20 years. We've raised our 2  boys and  held many celebrations here.

I am a massage therapist and a writer and Craig is a geotechnical engineer.

We love to travel. So far we've been to England, Greece, Italy, and Egypt and all over the US. One of the wonderful things about AirBnB is that we get to hear about all the places our guests have been.

name: Laurent
about: We came out here to Portland from LA via NY and DC to help start up a business consultancy, we now also own a bottle shop/bar and beer carts nearby too. Love to walk and bike aimlessly, cook, eat and sleep(!) when not working.  Mostly chilling with a glass of wine or a beer, or dreaming of a trip faraway of some sort. I hope to get to 80 countries in the next 5 years (crazy dream!) and still be Scuba diving at 80 &;-) Have two teacup chihuahuas, they make us better people. Love it.

name: Stuart
about:
I live in Portland, Oregon and love to hike and be in nature. 

I have done lots of travel and have often experienced the best stays in non-hotels and family homes.  When I am not traveling, I enjoy exploring what Portland has to offer.  
  
Having enjoyed staying at people's homes, I decided to start hosting myself.  I put a lot of attention in making my place super cozy and beautiful.  I hope you will enjoy your stay and let me know if there is anything that will make your stay more comfortable.

name: White Spider
about:
I'm a guest manager for White Spider Rental Concierge, a Portland-based, full-service guest manager focused on helping our clients enjoy the perks of being an Airbnb host without the hassle of the everyday stress, and our guests have the most enjoyable vacation, ever. Our home owners get to relax, knowing they're in the hands of five-year Airbnb veterans and Super Hosts, and our guests can rest assured we are available 7-days a week, and have a response time of less than an hour - go ahead, try us! Our company is built upon trust, communication, commitment, attention to detail, and a big ol' dash of OCD for good measure. 

Looking for something in particular? Please feel free to message me, and I'm happy to help you find the right house. And, once here, I'm your concierge, and take great pleasure in doting on our amazing guests. 

We look forward to working with and/or hosting you! 

White Spider Rental Concierge

(URL HIDDEN)

name: Judy
about:
I'm Judy. I'm a retired recycling specialist and ACLU lobbyist. I love to do art, travel, cook, sing and to have guests. I'm quiet, adventurous and independent. I spend my time making music, art, walking around new places, quilting, reading, camping, bicycling, cooking and eating great food. I enjoy meeting new people and doing new things. I'm in a happy relationship. I speak Spanish and can get by in French.
Portland is a wonderful city and I enjoy helping people get to know it. But -- no smoking inside, no drugs, no partying.
If you are requesting a stay, please tell me a little about yourself.

name: Wayne
about: My wife, Carol, and I have just completed remodeling this log building from a barbershop (!) to a lovely lodge, so we are anxious to share it with others. We are both avid Seahawk fans, so we travel to most of the home games in Seattle during the fall [GO HAWKS!]. We also love to spend time at the coast crabbing, fishing, clamming and hiking.

name: Jeff
about:
Hello, I'm Jeff, an arts administrator and native Portland resident. My partner Frankie works in health administration. We are new to Airbnb but have rented the studio and exchanged homes with other travelers through other services for years.

We love sharing travel stories with guests and we're always happy to pass along our favorite restaurants, arts events and other great things to do in Portland. We enjoy wine tasting and craft beers, day hikes and backyard barbecues, the Blazers and the Timbers. We also love dogs but we are currently without one.

name: Gary
about:
Equal parts Frank Sinatra, "McGayver," and Ben Stiller ... got your attention?
I'm a renaissance man ... school teacher, behavioral health therapist, small business owner, gardener, building/thinker/crafter, and most passionate as an actor for 30 years.  I love my life and know that I'm a lucky guy!
I really enjoy meeting new people, visiting new entertainment venues and I am a self-proclaimed karaoke king.  I'm also an avid road trip, travel, get me to the ocean (river, lake, stream, pool!), bike, hike, diggin' in the dirt and throwing on a tux kind of guy.
My home is my castle!  I share it with my boyfriend Shawn who also takes care of our little "Inn."  My 2 pups, SeeBee & Mannie are my kids.  I'm also the caregiver for my father, a quiet and kind little guy also named Gary; this is really his 2nd chance at life.  
I take extreme pride in my home (but I'm partial) and we welcome everyone who visits with a "make yourself at home, relax & enjoy," invitation and a big smile.  I do love to talk, no offense when you gotta go!  We are both very genuine, caring, respectful, FUNNY, corny, and classy gentlemen with a goofy, unpredictable and even mildly devilish side.
With more than 300 bookings and and nearly 400 guests, YOU are welcome anytime!

My motto?  The only way to true happiness & freedom is doing the right thing not because you have to but because you want to!

name: Melissa
about: We are a welcoming, friendly, laid back family, that enjoys meeting people from all backgrounds and cultures. We love to joke and laugh, and enjoy spending time with our children, extended family, 3 pets; Flo our Lab, Digit & Percy our cats, as well as our cherished friends! Our favorite places to travel are the Oregon Coast, the Gorge, Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens, the Redwoods, MOAB, Arizona and Minnesota to visit family, and Belize. We couldn't live without each other, or great coffee, kombucha, our garden, lavendar, trees, bees, the local farmers markets, sunsets or rain. We strive always to be kind and to support our community and our precious planet.

name: Claire
about: Hello! I am Claire a clothing designer here in beautiful Portland. I have lived in this amazing city for almost ten years, with no plans of leaving anytime soon. I have a small home studio in my house but mostly work out of a shared creative space just a mile away.  I love being creative and collecting local art that you can see hung in my apartment. I reside upstairs from the studio so I am always close by to help. If a guest ever needs any suggestions, I love to share my knowledge of Portland area restaurants, shops and outdoor destinations.

name: Patti
about: Active g'ma of 9

name: Andrew
about: Avid Airbnb-er, as a host and traveler. Passion for food, art, design, travel, real estate, science, and food! I host one rental in Portland, OR and 3 rentals in Austin, TX.

name: Mellisa
about: Canadian born, Portland lover.

name: Mira
about: Curious adventurer with a love for all things creative, collaborative, and harmonious.

name: Heather
about:
I, of course, love travel and have traveled extensively. 
I've spent time backpacking through India and SE Asia (for an entire year) to motorcycling across Mongolia! Countries I've visited include: Iceland, Republic of Ireland, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, England, France, Belgium, The Netherlands, Spain, Switzerland, Italy, Greece, India, Nepal, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, Malaysia, Mongolia, Singapore, Indonesia, Mexico, and Argentina (as well as extensively traveled throughout the US and Canada.)

My travel style is flexible. I have 'roughed it' or 'vacationed well' while my husband’s style, is more oriented towards ‘vacationing well’.  
We are foodies and love everything from street food to Michelin star restaurants. We like wine and beer both and love to try new things.

My husband and I are both Geek loving Sci-Fi/Fantasy people. We play computer games and board games (favorite computer game: BioShock; favorite board game: Twilight Imperium), as well as watch / read a lot of Sci-Fi/Fantasy movies/books. 

We are always excited to meet new people and learn about different cultures. I hope you will stay with us! (And our cat Tybalt!)

name: Colleen
about:
Dan and I love living in Sellwood. It is a lovely family neighborhood with lots of restaurants, coffee shops, Springwater bike path, many antique stores and the Willamette River is just a mile from the house. Dan was born in Portland and I was born in Cape Town, South Africa.   Between the two of us we have 4 daughters. We also have a very cute Daschund named Roxy who is very friendly boy.  We really love meeting people and enjoy hosting guests in our home. We have had guests from other US states and countries such as Canada, France and England.  Dan and I love to travel, read, watch movies, kayaking, hiking and being with our family and friends. We look forward to hosting you for your stay in Portland.
We will do all we can to ensure you have a great stay.

name: Jessica
about: I'm a warm and friendly gal and happy to help however I can so you will  enjoy our place to the fullest and have a great Portland experience. I love being outdoors and have many interest from music shows to flamenco classes. I have great life and spend lots of my time with my friends and family who I adore. There is no place I'd rather be!

name: Landon
about: Laid-back, recent college grad. Fluent in Spanish and speak conversational French. World traveler. Hard worker. Respectful, zen, kind. Social butterfly.

name: Cynthia
about: I am a ceramic artist and I teach classes at Portland Community College. I spend my free time cooking, working in the yard, making things, and enjoying good wine, beer, and food. I've been in Portland for almost 20 years and living here suits me well! I love the food and drink scene here, and regularly go out to visit art galleries and live music.

name: Jeneen
about:
Oregon native. Small business owner. I've always enjoyed welcoming people into my home. I believe that traveling to new places and opening up to new experiences is essential to living life to it's fullest. 

I love food. a lot.

name: Larry
about: I was born and raised in Portland.  I love to hunt for wild mushrooms and occasionally go fishing for steelhead in the local streams.  In 1998 I started deconstructing the single story house my grandmother had owned, and then over the next five years, rebuilt it as a three-story.  I am self-employed as a licensed general contractor/handyman.  In my spare time I play classical guitar, and am learning how to tune pianos.

name: Stacey
about: Im Stacey, an artist and business owner in Portland OR, living most of the year in Portland, Oregon and part of the year in the Tuscan hilltown of Cortona, Italy. I  love to travel, meet new people and I love hosting people from all over the world.

name: Nick, Joe And Leila
about:
Hi I'm Joe and together with my wife Leila and brother Nick we can't wait to welcome you to our home!  

Leila and I just got married last year but have been together for about 5.  I'm originally from Portland, and Leila is from Singapore.  We love to travel the world - much like our Airbnb guests - but when we have our feet planted firmly on the ground, we are either in the house with you in Portland or at our place in sunny Singapore. My brother Nick lives full time in the Portland house and looks after the Airbnb room for us.  He'll be your friendly and accommodating host during your visit.

Nick is in his late 20s, and works as a full time barista in a local coffee shop in the same neighborhood as the house and is also an indie musician in his free time.  We all love Portland and Nick is the true expert, he'll be happy to give you guidance on everything from our amazing local neighborhood farmers market, to great local coffees, bars, music events, sightseeing, you name it!

name: Alex
about: (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN)/alexmichel

name: Angela
about:
I am an entrepreneur and mother of two amazing children. I lead an active and full life. I am blessed to lead such an amazing life!

My children and I travel to two new places each year and just began using AirBandB for travel accommodations. 

Food plays an amazing role in our lives, we eat predominately paleo and love shopping the local farmers markets and love to walk to all the wonderful restaurants in our lovely neighborhood. 

You will find me rather consistent as a guest and a host. I am considerate, reliable and consistent. 

My life motto is "Live and Love Whole-Heartedly!"

name: Johnna
about: Hello!  I've called the beautiful city of Portland home since 2000.  I grew up in equally as beautiful east Tennessee.  I spend my time sharing inspired meals with friends, walking in forests, riding horses, doing yoga, and going out to see people do cool creative things.  I'm pretty laid back in general and like walking slowly so that I can appreciate my surroundings, listening so that I can really get to know people, and paying attention to the subtle things.  I have the two cutest critters in the world and love sharing them with people. Looking forward to meeting you!

name: David
about: I am an artist, photographer, interior and web designer.  My partner Doug & I have personally designed, renovated, outfitted & furnished each of our properties with your ultimate comfort & enjoyment in mind. Look for other LiveLikeItsYours properties in Portland, Oregon Coast, Oregon Wine Country, Washington Wine Country, Los Angeles, Palm Springs & Seattle.  We are proud to offer over 35 vacation homes/flats & we've recently added a micro resort in Palm Springs called The Wesley Palm Springs & a 13 Suite historic Victorian Mansion called The Wesley Walla Walla.  We hope you'll come visit soon!

name: Wendy
about: Serious and fun (or  maybe seriously fun) marketing professional.  Well traveled (to 10+ international locations).  Have great network of friends, and have raised a smart, talented and beautiful daughter who's now in grad school.  Love all athletics (no interest in bungee jumping or extreme sports) especially golf and tennis.  Love reading (literature, not romance novels), and used to love camping. Will try just about anything once. Enjoy most everyone, especially those who have traveled and with a great sense of humor and adventure (and curiosity).   A bit of a foodie, enjoy great films, theatre, and a great single malt Scotch or sipping tequila (it feels like I'm writing an online dating resume).  My travel style is fairly casual - not an uptight or nervous person, and don't need a daily agenda.  Love an adventure.  Life mottos: "The answer's always no unless you ask." "Change is inevitable; growth is optional."

name: Kris
about: I'm originally from the North West; and just moved back to Portland after about 15 years of being out and about. I consider myself a home body most of the time, but when the travel bug bites, it bites me hard. Last time that happened I lived at a research base in Antarctica for a year :-)

name: Alleyn
about:
I live in the NW district close to the center of town because it is  easily accessible from almost anywhere in Portland. About 20 minutes from the airport. My great grandparents built homes in this neighborhood when it was first being developed and I have always loved this section of town. I moved to my present home in the Nob Hill district about 14 years ago.
I was an interior designer for many years and I also teach watercolor  at the local community center. 
I can't live without the ocean and the mountains each an hour and a half drive from here. I love the beautiful Columbia Gorge  (1/2 hour) and hiking in Forest Park (minutes away).
I enjoy people from all walks of life and love to travel when given the chance.

name: Scott
about: Married parents of two who enjoys outdoor activities, working around our house and making things. (From ceramics to beer) We love meeting new people, getting to know them and getting to know the world a little bit better through them.

name: Anne Weiss
about:
My partner Eric and I are kind, outgoing, friendly, helpful, artistic, outdoorsy, active, great cooks and gardeners and lovers of life! We have a big circle of friends and love music, dance, are interested in social and political issues and love to travel and enjoy meeting people from all over the world.
We are in the process of adopting a baby girl from Ethiopia, so we may be out of the country for part of your stay, or if you book for the future, we may have a little girl in the house!

name: Laurel
about: If it crosses my mind, I might want to do it.

name: Mariah And Yshai
about:
We are both Portland natives who absolutely love Portland, especially our  Northeast Portland neighborhood where we have lived for the past ten years. We have two young children and love to spend time outdoors, rain or shine.  For the last few years we have been foster parents to a wonderful teenage boy, but as our foster son has moved on we have been contemplating what to do with our bedroom/bathroom suite on the lower level of our house. Airbnb, seems like the perfect fit for us, allowing us to share our home and our wonderful neighborhood with others who want to experience this fantastic city. 

We recently took up biking as a family and anytime the weather is even remotely good, we look forward to opting for a bike commute rather than cars.  You will likely see us pulling our kids behind us on our bike trailer, to run errands or head out to one of the many wonderful parks in our neighborhood. We have really been enjoying discovering the many beautiful bike paths in the city.  The kids are very excited to host you in "the hotel" as they call it. While we often have family and friends over to play and for meals, our house is generally pretty low key, allowing you plenty of peace and quiet.  

We both work in private practice, sometimes out of our home and more often at our office in the Alphabet District in NW  Portland.

name: Dawn
about: I was born and raised in Portland.  I love to travel and also to host foreign students.  I speak Spanish and make coffee first thing every morning!  I'm an Elvis fan and love documentaries.

name: Tom
about:
We're so glad you're interested in staying with us! Our household of four in the pulse of Portland is a snapshot of family life in this terrific city. Our two children, ages 6 and 10, inject moments of silliness, laughter, and drama into an otherwise tranquil and serene environment. 

Our career paths reflect the cultural economy of Portland. Trained as a lawyer, I am an executive recruiter. I connect talented individuals with leadership roles in public service across the country. My wife Reba complements her naturopathic medical practice as a personal trainer. Our children attend a Spanish language immersion school embracing the reality of global interconnectedness. 

We've called Portland home for 17 years. We know it well, love sharing our experiences and observations, and learning from our guests. Our family travels enthusiastically. If the opportunity presents itself, we'll surely be asking you about your home base. It brings us happiness to help you make the best of your stay in our community.

name: Alfred
about:
H&W professionals, children completed University, global travelers.  Love to entertain friends from all over the world.  Enjoy music, movies, museums, gastronomy, sports and family.  Passionate about beautiful surroundings, lifelong learning, simple pleasures and cultural diversity.  

Favorite places:  Paris, Zermatt, Umbria, Rio @ Carnival!, Istanbul, Cotswolds, Yokohama, Xian, Chang Mai, Agra and Abergavenny Wales!

Cannot live without friends, playing guitar, planning next travel destination, great meals, dark chocolate and coffee!  Target goal:  Explore as many UNESCO world heritage sites as we can!

name: Lindy
about:
I’ve worked for social justice all my adult life – lesbian and gay rights, environmental reforms and criminal justice issues.  My desire for changing the world is not only my paid work but also my volunteer efforts – eliminating hunger, junior roller derby, racial justice and more.  

I’m a single mom who values creating a home that is welcoming.  I’m also a long time Portland resident who loves to share this amazing city and if interested, can definitely give you my highlights of what to see and do.

name: Tony And Alix
about:
Tony and I are a newly married couple living in NE portland. He works in Insurance and I am a full time student. In our spare time we love to catch a movie or try out new places to eat. We also enjoy biking around our neighborhood and spending time with our two french bulldogs Napoleon and Marie. 

We love hosting and meeting new people and also enjoy using AirBnB when we travel, so we have stocked our place with little things that we would like when we stay other places. We put a lot of love into our apartment to try to make it a home away from home. We love our neighborhood because there is so much to do and are happy to make suggestions on things to explore around here or other parts of Portland.

name: Kaila
about:
We are kaila and Matthew  married couple and we love to explore new places ! We don't party hard anymore we just enjoy beautiful cities and seeing what the local good and entertainment have to offer ! 

We also enjoyed our first experience using air Bnb while in Europe so much we decided to become hosts! 
We offer 2 rooms in our home with a shared bath, we are happy to talk about our home town of Portland and give you some insight and tell you about our favorite local spots! 

Kaila works for a local meat company called  Olympia Provisions , so keep an eye out you might find a yummy Meat treat in your room! 

Matthew is a at home recording engineer , that's right ! We have a recording studio in our basement , so there will be music in our home from time to time  , never before noon and never after 10pm.  

we are fun loving people who enjoy good food , conversation and movies. we are happy to share our home with you! 


We are hoping to see more the next few years before we decide to start a family .

name: Carol
about: I am a person that loves living in Portland, Oregon.  My joy is my family and my kitty, Oreo.  Things that I like to do are gardening, walking, camping, traveling and having friends over for dinner.  My travels have brought me to Europe, Africa, Central and South America and all around the USA.  It is so fun to make connections with great people from around the world.

name: Sari
about:
Hi here are a few fun facts about me.  I love coffee ice cream, but do not drink coffee,
I love to ride my bike on vacation, but do not ride to commute in Portland. I am a massage therapist working for 22 years. I love to receive massage just as much as I love being a massage therapist.

name: Skal
about: I want to welcome you to our city and am happy to host your stay.

name: Whiley
about: I am from Portland and after spending a brief 5 years stint in Chicago, I am back in the City of Roses that I love! I am a big traveller and love exploring new places, even if that means not leaving my neighborhood! I love biking and being outside, like most people who flock to this area of the country, and enjoy cooking and seeing live music.

name: Heidi And Marenda
about:
We are an adventure seeking, nature loving, kind couple that loves the idea of sharing our backyard space with friends, family and air bnb guests.  Marenda is an electrician by trade and Heidi is a high school counselor.  When not working, we can be found cooking, gardening, playing with our dogs, exploring Portland (despite the fact that Marenda grew up here and Heidi has lived her for 8 years), and adventuring through the Pacific Northwest.
