We enjoy our city and the surrounding area, so if you need any recommendations for places to see and things to do while visiting, don't hesitate to ask!

name: Alissa & Neal
about:
Alaska raised, Oregon based. My favorite things to do: be outside in the mountains, freedive in the ocean, and spend quality time with those I love. My favorite things to indulge in: fresh black coffee, goat cheese, and Oregon Pinot Noirs. 

Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Michelle
about: I am from Virginia and I am interested in music, art, history, and exploring.

name: Nell
about: Jeremy and I are two artists posing as an elevator mechanic and a mommy. I have a passion for paper and paint, making things by hand, the smell of the sea, and quiet time for yoga. We love to take our kids exploring in the mountains or by the ocean or to art galleries and museums. Life motto: Go lightly and be real.

name: Noah
about: The Backyard Cottage P-town is a project of Amy Atwood and Noah Greenwald.  Both Noah and Atwood work for the Center for Biological Diversity, an organization that fights to protect endangered species and their habitats.  They live nearby and love Portland and Oregon, including its mountains, forests, rivers and coastline.

name: Danna
about: Married with 3 kids, 2 cats and a snake.  Love to travel (once lived in France), meet people from other places, and eat ethnic food.  Managing 20+ vacation rentals keeps me out of trouble and mostly out of the travel scene too these days.  I love what I do though and am passionate about providing a great experience for guests that stay at our homes.

name: Jenny
about: Im from the midwest but have lived in Portland for going on 11 years and still love it. I can usually be found surfing on the coast and getting outdoors. I'm a very active person and I enjoy all the great activities Portland has to offer, including snowboarding, surfing, biking, you name it. I would love to make recommendations about what to do during your stay here. There are many things very close by. You won't be disappointed with the accommodations or the activities that are available to you.

name: Traci
about: I'm a single female recently  relocate to the Portland area. I have no children . I'm a vegan and love to cycle.

name: Barbara And Gary
about: I am from Portland, Family and friends are always at the top of the list, I was a professional chef, love all things food, hiking, biking, travel, wine, parties, art,  reading, yoga, tennis, gardening, our pet chickens, and music.

name: Moses
about: Laid back prefer nature tea at home good food

name: J Brooke
about: I'm a naturopathic doctor living in Portland, Oregon. I love the outdoors, travel, rock climbing, meditation and yoga.

name: Stacey
about: I suffer from a serious case of wanderlust, having traveled to over 30 countries .  I grew up in Portland - which makes me a bit of a magical creature in this city- and I love sharing all its quirks with visitors.

name: Kerry
about:
World traveler, former journalist and guidebook writer with longtime experience living abroad (Nepal, China, France) -- I welcome fellow travelers to this lovely corner of the U.S.! My own travel style is a mix of research and serendipity. Happy to share favorite restaurants and things to do in Portland, where I've lived since 1998. You'll be able to come and go as you please, and you'll have lots of privacy in the house.

2015 Note: I am back on the road in 2015 - spending time in Nepal, India, China, and Peru, for a start. I'll be in and out of Portland over the course of the year. In my absence, Mackenzie, my very capable house manager, will be taking care of you. Enjoy your stay!

name: John
about: I am a single gay male in my 40s.  I am a non-smoker and very clean.  I love to travel.  I love theatre.  Travel to NYC and London each year to see theatre.  Also enjoy travelling to Europe and Australia.  As a guest, I'm friendly but quiet. I'm a homeowner and I will respect your space. As a host, I'm mostly hands off but respond quickly to requests for info or assistance.

name: Aki
about: Hey there, :) I am a professional person. I love to travel, entertain, dance, exercise and make new friends. Traveling is my passion and I am always on the move. I have been using Airbnb since long time and love the idea. After a long day of site seeing you want the comfort of home. I just started doing airbnb hosting(Jun 2016). I do airbnb hosting when my family is not in town. Airbnb hosting is more than a business for me. I hope my place will give a homely feelings and comfort of home.

name: Natalie
about: I am a journalist, the mother of a border collie, a reader of books, aspiring bird-watcher. I jog and do yoga some days, and other days I sit on my  porch and drink beer with my pals.

name: Betty & Mary
about:
This house belongs to my 88 year old mother, Betty, who has been a creative force in Portland for over 65 years. She has lived here since 1949 and raised her children here with her husband Bill Mayther. She came from Duluth, Minnesota where her creative life was noted in a LIFE magazine spread when she was in college. She and Bill worked at the Linnton Community Center through the 60's and early 70's developing a nationally recognized arts program including employing many of Oregon's regional Artists like Ray Grimm, Kay Lee, Dan Stevens, Jerry Glenn, John Morrison, Tom and Michelle Earley, Dottie Fields, LaVerne Krause, Buzy Hughes so many more (if I missed you, call me and I'll add your name) 
In 1968, Betty was one of the founding principal team members who founded the Metropolitan Learning Center in NW Portland. This is an alternative free school for K-12 students in the Portland Public School system based on A.S. Neill's Summerhill where students engaged with all age groups, formed individual learning plans with parent and teacher guidance and were encouraged to find their own voice in a supportive and creative environment utilizing outside resources and other learning facilities and travel as part of the overall learning environment. The school has evolved over the years and still exists today.
After retiring from the school system, Betty received another Master degree from Pratt Institute in Art Therapy and went on to teach at PNCA, PSU, Lewis and Clark and many , many private workshops throughout the state as well as mentoring Art Therapy candidates from Marylhurst and PSU.

Betty loved to travel all over the world, meeting new people and sharing her ideas and expertise. From Mexico to India and all over the United States, she expanded her sphere world wide. She changed young lives, gave with a wide open heart and was, herself a gifted artist, exploring the inner and outer world with love and enthusiasm!

This cottage has been her studio, a home for her daughter Robin and her son William when he was little, a haven for young artists as their home and now a place where we welcome travelers from all over the world to help in paying for her care and the upkeep of her home. This home is on the historic registry as the Mayther-Coburn House in honor of her longstanding tenure and stewardship.

We thank you for considering staying with us and if you do, we hope you enjoy the little bit of history provided here!
Happy travels!
Share your heart!

Mary

name: David
about: I'm an easy-going guy, grew up in the Midwest but Portland has been home for about 13 years (2 stints). I take pleasure in the simple things in life: nature/camping, seeing/playing music, sports, good stories (in any medium), and being with my family and friends. Love to travel, especially off the beaten path. I've also lived in Argentina, Chicago, and Jackson, WY. Favorite travel book: Travels With Charley, by John Steinbeck.

name: Jennifer
about: On my resumé I say "Superior interpersonal, written, and spoken communication to effectively build relationships and rapport with all levels of coworkers, employees, and clients". In my personal life that translates into being motivated to maintain close relationships with my family and friends. I am a proud 6th generation Oregonian who married, James, a 4th generation Oregonian. We have lived in the Pacific NW all our lives and love raising our kids in this beautiful part of our world. In the past few years, we have traveled to Alaska, Canada, Amsterdam, Italy, and soon London (squee!). We look forward to continue exploring our amazing world.

name: Sarah
about: I like the hottest sauce, the darkest chocolate and I put way to much salt on everything. I like to dip my toes in water whenever possible. I accidentally decorated to match my cat. I really appreciate a good pen. I often work in the garden after dark. I never travel by the book. I bring rocks home from wherever I go.

name: Joanne
about:
Greetings from the Rose City! I'm a well-established and experienced airbnb host and a busy professional who thoroughly enjoys sharing my charming abode and making so many new connections with folks from all over the country and the world.   I am a full-time working professional who maintains an active lifestyle.  I enjoy both time alone and time with my guests sharing life stories and experiences, so I'm very adaptable to providing as much or as little contact as my guests might desire.  In 2015, I'll be sharing my home with my 24-yr old daughter, who is pursuing a second degree, but my guest room and bath will still be available.  (I disclose only because you may interact/cross paths with her during your visit.)
Like many Portlanders, I love the outdoors and most of my passions involve being outside, regardless of the weather.  I am a year-round bike commuter to my job downtown (5 miles one-way), love to hike and garden in the warmer months, and snow-shoe and XC ski in the winter months.  I am a music and movie lover as well.  I am a native Oregonian who returned to the state 16 years ago after living for over 20 years in New Mexico and the Washington, D.C. area.  My goal as a new host is to provide a comfortable, welcoming place for travelers who are just passing through Portland, those who like to stay and explore the city and nearby areas, and for visiting family members of other Portland residents.  I believe my reviews attest to a very positive experience, so I hope that you are only a stranger to me until we have the chance to meet!

name: Kristin
about: I grew up in Oregon, but after nearly 20 years of living in various cities around the world, my husband and I moved from England to the wonderful city of Portland to put down roots.  We have grown very fond of Portland; I'm so happy to be able to show it off to visitors and potential new residents! We love the local food & wine scene, amazing scenery, enormous musical variety, plethora of outdoor activities, and all the weird and wonderful things Portland has to offer.  We have always favored B&B's on our own travels, staying in all types across Europe, Asia and the US.  We are very happy to be able to use all these wonderful experiences (and learn from the bad one's!) for our own personal vacation rental. Welcome!

name: Carolyn
about:
I've been living in Portland for more than 30 years and love it.  The temperate climate give us a long growing season and the trees and flowers seem to bloom most of the year.  

I've rented property before, but never with AirB&B.  This is s me adventure for me.  I'm looking forward to it.

name: Jon
about: Easy going, active, runner, hiker, bicyclist, musician, traveler, and engineer.  I very much enjoy sharing my space, community and city with new people.  Helping people discover and love Portland like I do is a real passion.

name: Jess
about: Normal little lady who loves music, wine, and keeping things clean.

name: Joy
about:
I live in Portland, OR (USA) and love biking, running, eating, art and experiencing different cultures through travel. People are fascinating to me which makes traveling so much fun - I love learning about what people think, how they were raised and what influences them to live as they do. 

I am recently married and my travels will now likely include my wonderful husband Matt.  He works for a Renewable Energy company and is also a lover of travel, biking and good food. We are very respectful of peoples homes and are never rowdy or irresponsible.  We look forward to staying with you or hosting you through Air BNB in the future. 

Thanks!

name: Nicole
about:
Hi!  

I value adventures- big and small. 

As a traveler...I enjoy experiencing the energy of people and places- atop quiet volcano summits, in bustling neighborhoods, with people embracing love and compassion. When I'm not traveling, I am an occupational therapist at a non-profit for adults living with HIV. I often travel solo or with my partner Justin, who works as an architect and has been known to tour many countries by bicycle. 

As hosts...Justin and I enjoy meeting travelers and doing our best to help you feel comfortable. You will always be welcomed with open arms.  We provide a LGBTQ+ & PoC safe space.

"My favorite thing is to go where I've never been.”
- D.Arbus

name: Debbie
about:
I'm an avid traveler, and I love meeting other travelers!  I've lived in Germany, and traveled extensively in Europe and around the U.S.  

I also love living in Portland!  It is fun to show visitors around and give them some insider tips on my city.  If you enjoy hiking and diverse foods, we will have a lot to talk about!  I enjoy walking on the beach, especially the Oregon Coast and on the island of Hiddensee in the Baltic Sea.  The Columbia River Gorge and Mt. Tabor in Portland are my favorite hiking places.  Most frequently, though, you will find me working in my garden.  I specialize in native plants, and grow some fruit and veggies as well.

My profession is teaching at a university, which I enjoy very much.  I have a daughter who is almost finished with college.

name: Christina And Jeff
about: Caring and active young married couple who love Portland and the Pacific Northwest.

name: Alexander
about: I am a painter and a sailor that lives on the water. My life and my paintings reflect one another. I enjoy travelling, meeting people and adventure.

name: Kellie
about: I am a naturopathic doctor and acupuncturist. I have lived in Oregon since 1997 and I love hosting people in Portland. When I am not in clinic I like to see live music, enjoy the outdoors in the beautiful pacific northwest, and travel.

name: Naomi
about:
An Artistic heart and mind
Love for Culture. Food. Travel. Fashion. 
Chandeliers, homemade chiliquiles, french press coffee, kimono robes and champagne anytime.
Life should be simple and elegant.

name: Leah
about: We love to travel. We keep things clean and neat. I am originally from the Phillipines. I love movies and food and being a host!

name: Bryan & Hannah
about:
First thought in the morning: Coffee.
Last thought at night: Whisky.

name: Dan & Jackie
about:
While not Portland natives, we boast a combined 38 years living in Portland. Jackie hails from NYC and Dan from both Israel and the SF Bay Area. We both agree that Portland is our favorite city and one we are excited to call home. 

Portland is such a natural setting sometimes we even camp in the backyard with our five year old. We enjoy live music, cycling, cooking, playing games with friends, reading, and film. We like entertaining and feel that hospitality and service is essential to a happy life. 

Portland is an incredible city that continues to evolve faster than we can keep up. We look forward to helping you experience it, while continuing to discover it anew through your eyes.

name: Sydney
about: Howdy!  I am a native Oregonian and have lived in Portland for over 20 years (loving every minute of it!).  I bike and walk as much as possible, hang out in the local coffee shops, and at my favorite yoga studios. I am enthusiastic about Portland's amazing food scene and love the huge variety of artisan beverages Portland has become well known for (kambutcha, craft brewing, local hard ciders, local mead, as well as our craft distilleries.) I enjoy traveling with my family when I can and have really appreciate finding great spots to stay through Airbnb.  I hike weekly in Forest Park and (this being Portland) I am also a Urban Beekeeper.  I look forward to meeting you!

name: Kristen And Chris
about: Excited to begin hosting travelers in our new Big Little House. Kristen is a teacher by trade who is taking the year off to stay home with our wee one, and Chris works as an account director in branding/strategy. We love the outdoors, dance parties with our girls and eating out in Portland. Hope you find us both welcoming and gracious.

name: David
about: Native of the Pacific Northwest, I'm a Design/Builder, specializing in Japanese Traditional Carpentry and Old World natural building. I'm also licensed in 'Chado' the Japanese way of tea, which is my main stem of study within Japanese architecture. This recently completed unit is not a tea house but is an attempt to mix Japanese and a Western aesthetic through a common natural link. With the hope of sharing the beauty of Japanese woodworking to a wider range of people. I hope you enjoy!

name: Kelly
about: Educator, supporter of arts and civil rights

name: Justin And Sarah
about: Justin and Sarah are from Portland and have three kiddos. Justin has travelled moderately through the world and we love meeting new people. We know what makes us excited about travelling and want to help others enjoy their adventure.

name: Janie And Ginnie
about:
My partner Ginnie and I have lived in Portland for over 20 years and love all that Portland and the Northwest has to offer.  We both love the outdoors - whether it's skiing, surfing, sailing, hiking, biking or gardening, you can usually find us outside with our border collie, Sadie.  

We are so fortunate to have such rich bounty in this part of the country- the most amazing local produce, award winning wines, the freshest seafood, it's a foodie's paradise!   We would love to share our favorite spots, both in Portland and on the Oregon Coast.

When we are not adventuring around the Northwest, we love to travel to experience other cultures and beautiful parts of the world.

name: Andy
about: Businessman, Musician, Aspiring Cook, Home Renovator

name: Michael
about: I am a person who thrives on people.  I am a thoughtful person who practices meditation and appreciate others' thoughtfulness.  When I travel I like things that are new, but I also like a couple things that are familiar.  I love plants, pugs, travel meeting new people.  Welcome to my home.

name: Matthew
about: Matt currently runs his own business and is into yoga, meditation, gardening, cooking, random tree climbing, biking to nowhere, and reading.

name: Erica
about:
Rob Hemmerling and Erica Dagle are Portland natives. They have lived on the inner east side for the past 12 years and love the proximity to Portland's finest restaurants, local coffee shops, parks, boutiques, public transportation and specialty grocery stores. Rob is an owner of two local restaurants and Erica is the owner of a Portland based Real Estate company. They are passionate about being in the hospitality industry, love the character of older homes and enjoy making people happy.




In addition to their careers, they have a three year old son, Cole, who keeps them busy around the clock. They are excited to host you in this tastefully updated older home, to welcome you to their amazing City and to help connect you with local resources to make your stay most enjoyable.

name: Mary
about:
Love to travel, and love to meet new people.  That's is why I want to open my home to travelers around the world to come to Portland and enjoy my beautiful city.  
I have been involved with the Portland Chamber Orchestra in an administrative capacity for many years because of my love for music.

name: Mary
about:
I am a recent transplant to Portland (since June, 2014). I have used AirBnB several times, three times during my trek cross country to move here. All my experiences have been wonderful. I enjoy meeting new people, seeing new places and always treat my surroundings with respect. 
     My partner, Bob, and I started hosting in July 2015. We enjoy meeting folks from all over the world and helping them make the most during their Portland visit.

name: Ryan
about: Easy going, clean, 30 something who enjoys the opportunity to meet new people and explore Portland and the beautiful surrounding areas.  I have traveled extensively and always enjoy the opportunity to hear about other people's travels and adventures and to share my own.

name: Rachel
about: I live in Portland, Oregon. I am involved in art, music, design, gardening and community development. I love cooking at home and dining out. I have a son and we both enjoy riding bikes. Due to my own chemical sensitivities I use only unscented products in my apartment and in the laundry room of the building. Natural products with plant based essential oils are OK too. Reading books is one of my favorite activities. I feel extremely lucky to live within bike, bus, train or urban hiking distance to almost anywhere in the city. My son and I are both learning Spanish and we enjoy meeting people and sharing some of the fun and quirky parts of our neighborhood in North Portland.

name: Sally
about: Dancer, Designer, mother of 2 girls.  Laid back lover of the home.

name: Jackie
about:
Hi there,
I'm a long time (16 years) Portland resident.  I am an avid gardener, an artist/dancer/filmmaker and an aesthetic appreciator.  I'm tidy and thoughtful in my home environment.  I'm extroverted, but love to spend time by myself to unwind.  I'm excited to play ambassador to Portland visitors from near and far.

name: Ayleen
about:
I love exploring every nook and cranny of Oregon and accumulating interesting regional facts and lore. I also love to travel, adventure, meet people and eat regional foods - the more authentic the better!

I have always wanted to run a travel lodge and my Airbnb home is a way to share my love of Portland with guests - to help them see the real Portland from a local's perspective. I am quiet and respectful; I will definitely stay out of your way - but I'm always reachable if you have questions or just want to chat over a glass of wine/bourbon/local craft beer.

I am a photographer and a freelance marketer focusing on telling brand stories, which means I get to spend a lot of time interviewing inspiring people, taking photos and writing. I am also the Founder and Festival Director of Filmed by Bike, a film festival featuring events and the best bike movies from around the world.

I love riding my bike, I helped found much of Portland's bike culture, and touring a region by bike is my favorite ways to explore, experience and sink in.

name: Charlie
about: I love the outdoors and travelling.

name: Yascha & Ali
about:
Hi! 

We are one guy and one girl and two doggies and one baby enjoying life in the City of Roses. We are an easy-going, happy-go-lucky troupe excited to welcome you to our city. Yascha is a Portland realtor by day, and by night a baby-bath-giving, cocktail-making, tennis-playing guy who also loves music (ex-proprietor of a SE Portland music school + recording studio), thai takeout, and sleep. Ali spends her day working for an awesome local company, and off the clock enjoys brunching, cooking, a good glass of wine, pretending the family pets are well-trained, and filling her home with candles. 

We've lived in Portland through many seasons of life (including: new transplants who couldn't figure out why it was so rainy>> 2 single people ready to mingle >> newly-minted young couple interested in sleeping in, leisurely brunches, and afternoon cocktails>> newlyweds looking for dog-friendly activities and nicer restaurants>>not-as-young couple diving into child-friendly activities, good coffee, and kid-free date nights) and are ready to share what we've learned.

"if you can dream it, you can do it" is our family motto, and we look forward to hosting you!

name: Virginia
about: We are retired teachers, Craig in Spanish and French, Jin in Literature, Film, and Women's Studies.  Craig grew up in our house, and has cared for the garden since 1962.  Jin helped start the neighborhood farmers market (Sundays 10-2 between June & October.)  Two cats and a dog live with us.  We enjoy hosting visitors to the Northwest, and love introducing people to Portland.

name: Cindi
about: Randy and I like to host dinner parties for our friends, go to movies, and explore nearby locations in our Miata.  We used Airbnb when we went to Charleston, SC, loved the experience and want to extend that hospitality to others.

name: Sylvia
about: I am a semi-retired community college instructor that has lived in the Hawthorne District of Portland for 35 years.  I love to golf!

name: Tanya
about: Nationwide Corporate Housing Firm specializing in upscale, designer, unique Temporary Housing catering to the most discriminating clients.

name: Jacci
about:
I'm Jacci, and I live in the attached apartment next door, with my partner Dave, and our two corgi dogs (sometimes three dogs, when we have a  corgi mix foster).
We are clean and pretty quiet (you might get a barking acknowledgment next door when you arrive).  We both work, travel, and are on outings with the dogs frequently.
We want you to enjoy your time in Portland.  We are happy to offer as little or much guidance as you would like.  (if you are looking for hiking sites, kayaking sites/rentals, stand up paddle boarding sites/rentals,  and wineries, we would love to offer tons of advice).   
Our neighborhood is pretty quiet, but just a short distance away from the excitement.

name: Tina
about: Hi there! I'm a funny, quirky, friendly gal and I love travel! Especially in Europe, Paris and Hawaii. Wonderful people from Couchsurfing have hosted me in the past, and it was a really enjoyable experience. Come stay with me and let me host you!

name: Sharon
about:
It is my pleasure to host people new to Portland...I myself am here 8 years having escaped the crowded Los Angeles (Silver Lake/East Hollywood)
What a delight Portland is for those who seek a sparkling city with a relaxed conviviality that is so ubiquitous.  The 250 gardens in Portland combined with the upbeat friendliness of the people are so welcoming.  The city is voted best Bicycle city in the US and bike lanes and right of ways are obvious.  I am a photographer/artist of many years and I especially appreciate the flora and fauna.  I adore good films and we have some amazing theaters.  I am happy to share my knowledge and enthusiasm and what makes Portland such a great place to visit -and live. I also do auricular therapy  (ear reflexology which is most helpful for muscular issues.)  I have  entertained *half of the population of LA. -*ok that's a gross (URL HIDDEN) friends always want to know how I managed to move from my city -60 years there- to Portland, and after they visit, they know. I am a nature photographer so I can direct you  to some of the most beautiful places and events. We have an APP for that.....PDX pipeline.

name: Bart
about: Have lived in Portland for 12 years and am passionate about local food, yoga, hiking, biking, music, urban farming, film, and ecstatic dance.  I love sharing what I know about these pursuits and communities, and love connecting people with allies who can make their dreams come true.

name: Adriana
about: I'm an art director living in Portland, Oregon. Recently moved from Brooklyn, New York for a new gig. I love to travel and I love meeting new people, so airbnb is the perfect way for me to combine the two! I'm a major foodie, so ask me for recs!

name: Patrick
about: Hello!  I'm a circus performer currently on tour with Cirque du Soleil's Quidam.

name: Nathan
about: 42 year old, single dad spending what little free time reading and exploring nature in my own back yard...I occasionally get to travel to not-so-far away places...OLD...**Edit**

name: Jimmie
about:
I'm a dedicated friend, my family is my inspiration, and I'm a big lover. Being the big charismatic guy I am, I connect very well in person. I laugh at everything, and I'm serious when I need to be about things. I'm obsessed with reading Neil Gaimen novels and I listen to music while I read. Its a talent most don't have. =P Actually, I listen to music while I do everything. That being said, I love trading music with friends and exploring what talented people have to offer, I'll try everything once. I'm a casual boulder climber, and I love to walk everywhere. I don't like being in a rush to where I need to go, but I always show up on time. I have a bucket list of destinations in my life I want to full fill. 

Think that sums up a good portion of myself.

name: Nate & Everett
about:
You have chosen wisely! I'm a single dad to an amazing 9yr old boy. We both love to Paraglide, Ski, white water Raft, Bike, Hike, Camp, Kayak, play Soccer, Basketball, Scuba / Snorkel, and giant Zip Lines! I owned a brewery and restaurant and love to cook. What kid says their favorite food is a cucumber and loves the Opera? Mine!  

My son is a fluent Spanish immersion student, so we travel and he is becoming a world citizen. Our travels have taught us that not all hosts are the same. We host the way we would want; Clean, Safe, Private, and with a Super Comfy Bed. 

I can safely say we are outgoing, fun, and love adventure. We look forward to meeting you, learning something new and inspiring you to explore our amazing city and state.

name: Felicity & Michael
about: We are two working artists living in Portland, Oregon, USA.

name: Tabitha
about:
Young, healthy and active family. Our home is very musical and creative, filled with home made foods and lots of love. I love to travel, spent a year in Asia teaching English and have plans to travel to South America in the coming year. Some of my favorite trips have been backpacking through the Dominican Republic with my small baby and spending a week in Thailand. Jordan is a metal fabricator and recently spent 6 months on a motorcycle trip with a friend riding from Canada to Patagonia. You can see their travels on (URL HIDDEN) 
If you're interested in helping out in our garden you are more than welcome, and we have a shared back yard space with a fireplace that is great for summer nights and meeting new people.

name: Alana & Ryan
about:
Global travelers with two tiny travelers in tow, exploring the country and world one adventure at a time.  

With a home base in both Portland and SF, our hometowns and homes are our sanctuary, calm from the storm, and a place to relax and unwind.  Whether it's sipping wine in the Willamette or Napa Valley, hiking the trails around Mt Hood or Yosemite, eating the freshest and finest food in Portland or SF, or just sitting on the couch as a family eating popcorn and watching a movie...every day is an adventure and a memory created.  

Our homes are a reflection of our travel and love of this great big world of ours.  From the self taken photos on the wall, to the decor on the shelves, you will feel the global flair of our life of a travel.  Our style is contemporary yet comfortable,  creating a perfect environment for chic relaxation with all of the amenities of city life close by.

Our philosophy in life is to live life through experience; we hope our home will provide you with an experience that you will take with you long after your stay in our home is complete.

name: Naomi
about:
Portland, OR resident for 6 years.  Have lived all around the country and abroad.  Love having the spirit of travel in my home!
Professionally work to make environmentally and socially sustainable practices be economically sustainable.

name: Amy
about: Travel, technology, photography and sunshine.

name: Brandy
about: We're both partial to Oregon, having grown up here. Brandy loves knitting and other crafty pleasures; sweet treats; and exploring cities. Matt takes care of our chickens, loves making home a better place, and cooking. We remodeled the house during summer 2015; tearing everything down to the studs! Now we're ready to enjoy our home (while we're not traveling) and share it with you.

name: Dave & Silke
about:
Though we love travel and adventure, our home base has always been Portland.  But what an awesome place for a launching pad for camping, hiking, backpacking, bicycling, kayaking, rafting, snowboarding, kiteboarding - and who knows what's next!   Really, Portland has it all. 

Silke has been a Portlander since moving here from Germany in 1991.  She enjoys many hobbies, such as gardening, knitting, sewing, painting, snowshoeing and cross country skiing.  After trying on a few different careers, she started a property management company in the late 90's, which continues to thrive to this day. 

Dave grew up in Portland.  A software engineer for 19 years, he finally kicked that habit in 2005 in favor of working full time for the property management business.  Many people don't understand how a married couple can also be work and business partners.  But, really, we can't imagine it any other way - we've finally got our life set up almost exactly how we want it.   If only he could somehow figure out how to make a living as a musician.  

We're excited about meeting new people and sharing what we love about where we live.

name: Christopher
about:
I have a strong interest in sustainable, bikeable, walkable cities. I love Portland because so many people here share a vision for a human-scaled city. 
I don't use (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN), but would be pleased to meet you face to face :)

name: Pam
about: After completing college at UCLA, Pam spent many years living abroad before settling in Portland Oregon. She was drawn to Portland for it's land-use laws and sustainable lifestyle choices. She misses the sunshine from her youth, but the benefits of P-town overshadow all the rain!

name: Laura
about:
We are a family who loves Portland and all the adventures that the city has to offer!  We spend part of our time up in WA and are excited to share our home in Portland with you - please don't hesitate to let us know if you have any questions or requests, we'd love for you to enjoy Portland as much as we do.

Enjoy!

name: Mike
about: I am from Portland, Oregon.  I enjoy road biking, backpacking, cooking and literature.  I have been married to my lovely wife for 10 years and we have a 5 week old daughter who is absolutely perfect (I have thoroughly inspected her)!  My wife and I are passionate about social justice and serving marginalized people in our professions.  We are active and love nature.  We look forward to a respite from the raining days of Portland with a potential trip to Hawaii in February.  This would be my first trip to Hawaii.  My wife traveled to Kauai every summer with her grandparents as a child but hasn't returned in over 15 years.  Her grandfather is buried in Kauai.

name: Laura
about:
We have been in Portland for just over a decade and love what the Pacific Northwest has to offer. We love to make our home lovely and comfortable and keep you informed of all the great things in our city. I work in film and am also a professional massage therapist of thirteen years so you are welcome to book a massage with me during your stay. Just ask.

Cheers!

name: Missy
about: Portland-based, family-style.

name: Aaron & Laura
about:
My wife Laura and I are actually both from Ohio but it took joining the Peace Corps for us to meet! Since that time in 2002 we've been all over the world but returned to Portland to buy our home in 2012 because we couldn't imagine living anywhere else. 

We recently celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary and are excited that our son Oliver will be joined by a baby sister very soon. We love traveling, hiking, camping, fly fishing and just basically being outdoors in the Pacific Northwest! We built our cottage to share with other travelers and can't wait for you to experience the city. We really love it here and we hope you do too!

name: Kristen And Mahina
about:
I am a native Portlanders so am familiar with lots of fun places to see, My husband is a Professional Chef and we are foodies so can recommend great restaurants. We also love wine and can arrange some wine tastings. We both are avid golfers so would love to steer you to Portland's best courses. 

We love to travel to warm places - Mexico and Hawaii. Love being near the ocean and tropical feel. We have 3 four legged children, Mo-chocolate lab, Lizzy - collie mix and Stella - a 15 pound schipperke who runs the house. We both love to garden and spend a lot of time enjoying our yard. We love to entertain and would love to host people in our home!

name: Shane
about: From the mid-west originally, I have lived in many cities and use to visit Portland in the 90s, every time I said this is where I'm going to live when I'm ready to settle down. I have lived here since 2004 when I was presented a job opportunity. I have been in the coffee industry for almost 15 years. Love mid-century furniture and architecture style. Paul McCobb and Frank Lloyd Wright are amazing. I also have an instrumental studio music project on the side creating background music for film projects. Snowboarding in the winter, garden, rafting and biking in the summer with all the diversity that Portland has to offer.

name: Shana And Papi
about:
Shana: Northwest native/German who loves to bike all around the city & going out to see and play local music.

Papi: Mexican-American, aka Chicano, who drums in more than 20 bands all around the city & is always searching for the best undiscovered tacos.

name: Blair
about: Art, architecture and design bookstore owner and visual artist.

name: Jim
about: I am a retired biologist that worked for the federal government for 35 years in several locations throughout the U.S., most recently in Alaska. I moved to Portland six years ago and now call this home. I have many interests that tend to take advantage of the beautiful state I live in, including skiing, hiking, biking, and camping.

name: Zach
about: Originally from Eugene, OR and been in Portland for the last 5 years enjoying the food, culture and recreation that is everywhere here. I work in the solar/renewable energy field.  I rock climb, play ultimate frisbee, and enjoy woodworking and photography.  I have traveled extensively around the world.  Some of my favorite places are Thailand, South Africa and Colombia.  I look forward to hosting and connecting with folks on their travels!

name: Stephanie
about: I am a professional functional nutritionist and natural health educator.  I have three children and a husband and have lived in Portland, Oregon on and off since birth.

name: Susan
about:
I am an artist and a gardener. I love the neighborhood I live in and I walk everywhere. Exploring the amazing restaurants, shops and night spots plus the cultural life that Portland offers is wonderful. The Oregon Convention Center is close to my studio and the Portland Streetcar is a great way to travel to arrive there in a matter of minutes. I also enjoy riding the streetcar to the Pearl District.

I love animals and as a ceramic sculptor various creatures are my favorite subjects to sculpt. Walking my dog is a daily joy for me and affords me the opportunity to meet a lot of people in my community. Sharing my garden with a vast variety of birds is a treat too. Year round there are abundant varieties of birds visiting my garden.
Probably the most important thing that stands out about living in my neighborhood is the amazing people who also live here and the strong sense of community that exists here. I truly cherish being a part of this area of Portland. I walk in my neighborhood daily, rain or shine. I try to "shop local" and frequent most of the places that I highlighted on my guidebook on a regular basis.  
 I feel my listing has a lot to offer and I look forward to hosting and sharing my unique space and incredible neighborhood with all of my guests.

name: Rubyna
about: I live in Portland, OR in the lovely Mississippi district. I'm 36/f, outdoorsy, artsy, clean, and organized. I work as a Technology Project Manager professionally with a typical 9 to 5 schedule. Hopefully this brief gives you a sense of who I am, we can talk via phone to get further acquainted. Thanks!

name: Jenna
about:
I am an outgoing and friendly woman who loves to travel. I teach and manage a college ESL service learning and volunteer program for my school. I also love films, writing, and performance art, both in the audience and as an artist. I love puppets.

My life motto would be: Participate with Curiosity.

name: Susan
about:
I enjoy gardening and grow veggies year round. My husband and I also enjoy the music of Portland and would be willing to share our love of it with you. I am an Early Childhood Educator.Ken is a mobile Notary.and a former Uber driver. He can advise you on the best way to get around the area.  
During the summer and fall months, we volunteer with a program that harvests fruit that would go to waste. Most of the fruit goes to a food bank, but we also get to bring some home. During those months you might find fruit on the pouch that we are willing to share.I have lived in Portland my whole life and love the area.

name: Ken
about: I love to travel and this photo was  taken in Argentina. My Victorian house, Garden Apartment and Artist Studio apartment are on this site and I welcome fellow travelers. I have a regular yoga practice and can recommend local studios; also I can help with wine tours,tango studios, hiking, biking. dining and local sightseeing options. Se habla Espanol.

name: Maxine And Jonathan
about:
Maxine and Jonathan moved to Portland in 2008 from Upstate NY to start a new chapter in our lives.  We designed and built our home here, making sure we had plenty of room for our friends and family to stay when they visited.  We both work as designers though Jonathan wears many more hats.

We love to travel, hike, bike and walk in the beautiful outdoors surrounding us.  Maxine is a bit more of a homebody than Jonathan - she likes to work on her gardens, cook and read while Jonathan would take mountain biking or white water rafting any day of the week.  We have one son, an amazing rescue dog and a very long lived sweetheart of a cat.

name: Taizz
about: I'm starting a guesthouse for travelers who come to Portland for blues, brews, bicycling, rain gardens,dogs,coffee roasting,wellness, and community.

name: Michelle
about:
I am creative and active professional who spends my time outside of work exploring the great outdoors camping, hiking and traveling whenever possible. 

I love Portland for it's focus on fresh food, unique neighborhoods, small businesses and proximity to the beautiful Columbia River Gorge, Mt Hood and the ocean!

Ask me about great day trips from the city! Check out my latest explorations: (URL HIDDEN)

name: Amy
about:
I consider myself an Oregonian now, I've been here over 12 years which is longer than any other place I've lived.  Born in the East Coast, grew up in the Midwest.  I enjoy a good hike, bike ride, camping trip, river excursion, travel to some place I've never been, and a well prepared meal either at home or a nice local restaurant.  I have a 10 year old Lhasa Apso dog named Yoshi.  Yoshi is very mellow and likes to hang out in which ever room people are in.  

Sara moved here recently from Texas.  She enjoys exploring all the new things there are to find in/around Portland.  She loves to get out to nature and find those gems spots that not too many people know about.  She has a 1 year old Silver Lab named Lucy. Lucy is very well trained and behaved.  She loves to pick up her toys and carry them around to show them off and drop them at your feet with hopes that you will pick it up and toss it for her.  

The 4 of us are pretty mellow and enjoy learning of things to do and places to go.  Our house is very spacious with shared space but the majority of the basement area is tucked away and private to accommodate whatever your needs may be.

name: Brian
about: i can't live without portland. i love the outdoors, the people, the rain, the coffee, the food and especially mt hood and the coast. my wife and i purchased this home so we can enjoy portland more and more. our plan is to live here full time in the near future. we want to share portland with everyone. we believe it is an amazing city with so much to offer. we invite you to fall in love with portland.

name: Francine
about:
Quick witted business woman who keeps one lovely household. I've lived in Portland for over 40 years and can guide you through this fabulous city with ease. I'm a world traveller and have used airbandb several times in Europe. What a lovely experience to see the city through some local eyes.
I dance, sing, play well, do Yoga and Feldenkrais and hang out with my many friends. Not much for TV, but relish a good movie. My passion is gardening and my well-kept home is surrounded by lush landscaping. I adore the kitchen and shop mostly at the local Farmer's Markets.
I am always happy and ever grateful for such a cherished life. I am gregarious and out-going. Been in business for over 30 years and just beginning to think of travelling more and working less. Everyone who has ever stayed in my home knows it is an oasis. WELCOME TO PARADISE!

name: Heidi
about: Darmacrash

name: Stef
about: Jet Setter. Snowboarder. Puggle Owner. Tiny House Enthusiast. Tree Hugger. Bike Lover. Coffee Addict. ER Nurse Practitioner.

name: Mark
about:
I am a single family guy who loves to travel and does so often.  I grew up in So Cal, lived in Seattle, London,  New Jersey, and now Portland.  I am a foodie/wine lover, avid soccer player, Timbers season ticket holder, mountain biker, and I am digging this Airbnb opportunity to meet wonderful people from all over the world. Are you next? I would love for you to stay at my cozy place in the happening part of town.  You won't regret it.  

See you soon! 

Cheers,

Mark

name: Melanie
about: Originally from Nashville, TN, moved to Portland 3 years ago, and attending OHSU School of Medicine.

name: Dan
about: I'm an artist who loves to travel. I usually go to big cities to spend time looking at and thinking about art, but occasionally I take a real vacation somewhere quiet so I can read! My wife and I are excited to share our house and Portland recommendations with you, and we look forward to making your stay comfortable and fun.

name: Sharon
about: I'm an avid bike rider and DIYer... I love to sew, knit, cook, try new things and watch Ted talks.

name: Stephan + Jen
about:
Graphic designer, full time fun gal, builder of dreams and maker of matches. 

Engineer, book/music/movies/electronics lover, father, weirdo, zzz.

name: John And Darby
about:
Bike riding gardening knitting coffee roasting vinyl spinning people.

We also own a small bicycle, gear and vinyl record shop called RIVelo at the foot of the Tilikum Crossing Bridge in SE Portland. We are bicyclists and frequently travel the city on our bikes. Our northwest-inspired yard and patio is a passion and always a work in progress. Right now, we are experimenting with  potted fruit trees.  We roast our own coffee from green beans supplied by a local shop. We are vinyl LP fans, and the turntable in our basement has a supply of some of our favorites for you to enjoy while you are staying with us in the Knotty Grotto. The Beatles and Bob Dylan are some of our favorite artists.  
 
We love hosting in Portland and sincerely hope you will have a wonderful stay with us. Come visit us and explore our close-in NE Alberta Arts, Concordia and Woodlawn neighborhoods, which we can easily help you navigate with insider tips!

name: Aaron & Alicia (& Sylvia & Elijah)
about:
We're teachers, musicians and decent cooks.  We love coffee, hiking, travelling, reading, writing, and adventure.  (Sylvie's our toddler so she's mostly into dancing and swings right now, and Elijah is our little baby who is into sleeping and mobiles.)

Aaron's been in the Pacific Northwest for a long time - Alicia lived in Brooklyn NY for almost 15 years and before that, Western Massachusetts, Jerusalem, and Baltimore.  We both love Portland.

We've toured all over the world as musicians, separately and together:  Europe, Latin America, the Middle East, and across the US and Canada.  We've experienced such wonderful hospitality over our years of travels and love to share the same with you!
city: In an apartment above the house that we rent with Airbnb

name: Virginia
about: Real Estate agent, Designer, Educator, world traveler, foodie, arts patron and grandmother, I have lived in the Portland area for over 30 years. I love what the city and the greater Northwest have to offer. I can tell you about some of my favorite hikes, restaurants, boutiques, etc.  If you are considering moving to Portland, I am happy to show you neighborhoods and houses, and provide tips on maneuvering the wild and crazy Portland real estate market.

name: Erin
about: My name is Erin and I am from Portland, Oregon. I am an apparel designer by trade, and world traveler when work permits. I love to design, cook, and travel the world. I am easy going and love to meet new people.

name: Anna
about:
I'm a happy self employed person and recently became a mama for the first time to the most amazing little human that brings sparkles of joy and meaning to each day. 

I've had a wonderful career in the fashion industry and I am a healer as well. I love plants and people and animals and am super lucky to be part of a completely awesome family.

name: Peter
about: We are native Oregonians who spent 7 years overseas in Asia, based in Taiwan.  We returned to Oregon 6 years ago to resettle and raise our 3 children, ages 13, 10 & 7.  My son and I are avid whitewater kayakers and the whole family enjoys our vacation time in the forest, on the mountain or at the beach.

name: Larry
about: Dancer, social entrepreneur, and lover of cultural spelunking.

name: Martin
about:
I'm currently in graduate school for chiropractic medicine at University of Western States in Portland, OR. I've been involved in various aspects of healthcare for several years, but finally decided to pursue an advanced degree to share the gift of healing that I've experienced. Helping people is something I'm very passionate about. I also love to play tennis, ski, go out to eat or cook, sit by a fire, camp, enjoy good music (play a little guitar), watch tv/movies, and more. More importantly, I love to hang out with good friends... And always looking to meet new ones. 

I love spiritual adventure books like Way of the Peaceful Warrior, Celestine Prophecy and The Four Agreements. 

I would like to travel more, but school has been keeping me busy, so I'm working hard now to create opportunities so that I can visit new places and maybe practice medicine for humanitarian organizations someday.

I teach TaiChi and Qigong, so if you stay here, ask for a complimentary session :)

name: Jenni
about:
I am an avid traveler and like hosting to indulge my travel bug and curiosity about the world and its inhabitants while I'm tethered to my current location.

I work in high technology, and exclusively from a home office, so I am usually around the house, though busy. 

My main interests are in science and the culinary arts, and when the two meet, it's pure joy.  I dabble in the kitchen, trying (but typically failing) to re-create dishes I've enjoyed while traveling or at a local restaurant, and often have something to share if you stay at my place.

name: Peter
about: My wife and I have traveled around the world and love meeting new people and sharing stories over good food and wine.

name: Christine
about:
Hi there! I'm a born-and raised Portlander who absolutely loves this place. I'm a mom of 2 sweet girls, and we spend a lot of our time outside enjoying the beautiful City of Roses! My husband, Joel, is from another pretty cool place about an hour east of Portland (Hood River, OR) so we also like to making trips out that way to visit his large family (he's one of NINE kids!)

We love our "Airbnb Friends" as my 2-year old has come to call them...our little family is happy to help make your stay as great as possible!

name: Crystal And Ricardo
about: I am a Portland native and I love it here. Ricardo has been here since 2000. We love to travel too! I teach yoga, bartend at a lovely music venue, work at Trader Joes, and make candles. Ricardo works for an awesome environmental non profit.  We really enjoy camping and going to the coast, going on hikes, and riding our bikes. We love to watch movies, especially Wes Anderson, Quentin Tarantino, and The Coen Brothers. Portland has a lot of great coffee and beer, which we're passionate about, love to drink, and would be happy to give suggestions on!

name: Neal
about:
After working and living around the world, it is great to call Portland home. For fun you can typically find my wife and I either out enjoying a meal at one of Portland's many great culinary establishments, skiing Mt. Hood, or wine tasting in the Willamette Valley.

On our travels we've met so many great hosts and fellow travelers through AirBnb. We always dreamed of being able to provide a welcoming place so that we could pass on all the generosity that has been shown to us. We still love to travel but now look forward to having people from all over the world now bring their cultures and stories to us. We can't wait to help you discover the best of Portland!

name: Kim & Shawn
about: We love having friends over and created a space to accommodate that by recently remodeling our guest home. Since we love entertaining and traveling, we thought Airbnb would be a perfect way for us to utilize our extra space when its available. We're big beer and wine enthusiasts, love dining out, cooking and cherish our animals.

name: Satish
about: We travel a lot. Exploring cities around the country and abroad. We had very pleasant experience staying at various airbnb places. Hence we wanted to share our second home with the broader airbnb community.

name: Mandi
about:
I am a landscape designer and contractor who owns her own business in Portland, OR. I live with my husband, Steve, who works for the City of Portland, and we have a 5 year old daughter. 

Since we live in a city, we often travel to relax as a family and just have time together. We love staying in walkable neighborhoods where we can get a feel for what it would be like to live in the city/town we are visiting.

name: Sarah
about: I'm an avid camper, traveller and Minnesota Vikings fan. I've lived and worked in England, Japan, and India and am currently creating a website for camping. I live in Portland, Oregon with my wonderful husband, Kevin, and we have a sweet dog named Brandy who will lick you to death if you let her. :)

name: Benjamin & Jamie
about:
This is team Jamie and Ben, who would be your awesome hosts. Since both are so awesome, they both need an introduction.
Ben: Explorer, enthusiast and engineer at large. I used to utilize couchsurfing for my first steps of meeting and getting introduced to people and place, and have from that established myself a nice network of friends and family here in the US. 
I seem to have embarked pretty heavily on a career in research and academia, hence my days are quite defined by that, and exploring the wild, both outdoors and indoors (concerts, venues, restaurants, etc.) with my lovely better half. 
If not that, then I enjoy a good run, ski-trip, a good newspaper and a good read, certainly some really terrible action movies. 

Jamie: 
Is also pretty great, by being a very seasoned world-traveller, French teacher and entrepreneur and house plant extraordinaire. And so many other things she will only tell you when you are staying here. 

Update: We also welcomed our daughter Pauline in May of 2016! Such a joy!

name: Kevin
about:
I am a young professional that manages a branch for a local credit union. I was originally born in England and have since claimed Oregon as my home. I graduated from the University of Oregon in 2002 and moved to Portland to pursue my career in finance while enjoying living in the beautiful Pacific Northwest.

Being born abroad to an Irish father and an English mother, I have always enjoyed traveling the world, meeting new people, and seeking new experiences. My most recent excision was to Belize. I also love sports - especially football and soccer, live music, and the outdoors. I've come to know all the corners of the wonderful city of Portland and can help guide any traveler to great nightlife, hikes, live music, or whatever your likings may be.

name: Phil
about:
I aim to make your stay as I would want my own.  I fell in love with this fair city only 4 years ago, and have been an avid explorer and enjoyer of it and the area ever since. 

I'm not around much, but if I am, please feel free to engage me about anything.

name: Tiffany
about:
My love affair began in 1998. After traveling 27 states in 7 months, I knew I had found home as soon as I arrived in Portland, Oregon. It was fall and the leaves were crisp with color. That winter the snow covered the streets and I walked down the center of Broadway from my studio in the city. When spring arrived the cherry trees on the waterfront blossomed and filled the air with a fragrance I still look forward to annually. And then, summer arrived with its bounty and I was more than smitten. I could hike a mountain, float a river, raft rapids, bike wine country, climb a rock and still be home in time to get my heels on, catch a Broadway show and eat like royalty.

Since then, I have grown up enjoying all of that year round and sharing it with others. I have worked with some of the best dinner houses and wineries Oregon has to offer as a server, sommelier and event coordinator. Whenever guests asked me what else they should do on their visit I love writing up lists of places to visit, hikes to go on and how they can get on our rivers & take in a live performance. 

When I travel other cities my favorite thing to do is walk or bike them.  Many times with a vague idea of where I eventually wanted to end up, but always enjoying the journey of getting there with equal enthusiasm. My favorite day in Paris I spent walking, from Jardin du Luxemberg (where I drank a beer while watching a very serious bout of petanque) through neighborhoods of broken sidewalk uphill to Le Sacre Coure (where I ate cheese and chacuterie on the grass steps) down passed the carousel of Montmarte and down the hill to my apartment with a balcony where I sipped coffee as the sun rose and the bells of Eglise de la Trinite tolled. 

Now as a host on Airbnb I have enjoyed taking care of other peoples guests for years. I enjoyed it so much I now have my own company that solely focuses on Airbnb guests and host hospitality! Please let me entertain you and introduce you to my Portland guestrooms and homes!

name: Chris
about: I am a solar electric system engineer from Oregon, USA.

name: Joseph
about: I live in Portland, Oregon and teach Italian

name: Holly
about: Thanks for checking me out:) I've been lucky enough to be part of the Airbnb community for a long time in .com years. People who do best with the peer-to-peer stuff seem a little curious, positive, spontaneous and always intelligent and interesting. They tend to have playful spirits and strong connections to their kids. I'm lucky to have hosted so many inspiring people bringing positive energy into my space.

name: James
about: Trophy husband and father of 3 boys in North Portland. Creating and providing space for people to feel comfortable and at home is important to me and my family.

name: Daniel
about:
Whether in my home town or traveling, I like to get around by bike. Sometimes my kids ride on the back of my cargo bike, other times it's groceries or lumber. 

When I'm home I'm likely cooking or making something out of wood in my workshop.

name: Jocelyn
about: Ad lady by day, cat lady by night. Have yarn, will travel.

name: Larissa
about:
My husband, 2 children, doberman great dane, and I are all living the Portland dream. I love walks in the woods, morning coffee, hiding under the covers with my littles, long talks with good friends, and warm oceans. Since having small children I do not travel like I did in my 20s but there is a beautiful world out there and I look forward to seeing more. I love broadway classics and am proud my son can sing (and dance) along to most show tunes. I love genuinely good food of all kinds and am truly amazed at Portland's food scene. 

As travelers we are looking for a low key (kid friendly) genuine experience of  any kind. 

As hosts we want you to feel comfortable and plugged in to the local scene. 

Mottos: Love wins.

name: Katie And Ken
about: We moved to Portland 16 years ago and fell in love with the city. After living in various parts of the city, we feel very lucky to have settled in a neighborhood with awesome community and walkability.  We are a social worker and educator raising two active and outdoorsy boys. We love cooking, hiking and traveling.  We are very hands off as hosts but are always available to recommend some of the best kept secrets of Portland, especially all things outdoorsy!

name: Hanna
about:
Outgoing, hands-on, initiator, nerd, excited about possibilities, grounded, balanced.

Big animal lover, I have 1 dog and 1 cat- grew up and getting back into riding (English Dressage and Jumping).  Love to get my hands dirty, I may not have a green thumb but I sure do enjoy it.  Power tools are rad and I love to create.  Come stay at my renovation that was the culmination of all my hobbies- created most of the home on my own. *sigh*  Love it!

5 things I could not live without: Insulin, animals, memories, creativity and 46 chromosomes.  Or power tools.  They are a tie.

If I am a guest- I aim to prove I was raised with manners, humility and respect.  If I am a host I am to prove I was raised with manners, humility, and respect.  If I ever don't meet these characteristics please let me know and I will immediately give you my parent's numbers.  They are rad people and I hope I am following their footsteps while making my own print every day.

Lifetime moto: Be good, see good, do good, feel good, live good, give good, work hard, dance often, love wholly, sleep well, smile and repeat.

name: Megan
about: We are a professional couple with two school-age kids, all proud to be Oregonians. We love travel, the outdoors, family time, good food, our liberal lifestyle, and a dash of dorkiness. Can't wait to meet you!

name: Ken
about:
Hi there! I am Ken and my daughter is Gabi. We are a fun daddy daughter team. She is eight years old and lives with me 50% of the time. We recently built us a small house called an accessory living dwelling, which sits in back of this property. 

The house is very quaint, charming, and comfortable and reflects the history of craftsman in Portland.  I hope you like it as much as we do and return for many visits. 

We are new to Airbnb and hope to meet some incredible people. We both love to travel and have been to many places in the world. 

I am originally from Utah, but have been in Portland for almost fourteen years. Gabi was born in Vancouver, WA, but has one set of grandparents in Europe, which she visits occasionally. 

I love to explore new restaurants, breweries and explore the many great facets of Portland and the greater Northwest. 

The house has been professionally decorated to embrace the fabric of Portland.  Come start your journey and enjoy the many great facets that this city offers.

name: Lill
about:
I was born in Norway, raised inner city Chicago, and educated in Northern California. I moved my family from Santa Cruz to Portland in 1991. I have watched  Portland grow into an amazing urban center over the course of the past 23 years. We are vibrant, alive, and exemplary in nature. 
I have traveled to more than 30 countries and adore the adventure. As a designer and contractor, I love the modern, minimalist movement of architecture that this city wraps its arms around now. Come explore why I love North Portland and this specific location. Be prepared to be impressed!!

name: Rosy
about: I am from Portland OR where I work for the federal government. I enjoy running, cycling, hiking, the beach, food, and the arts. Any local secrets of things to see or experience would be great fun for me.

name: Elizabeth
about:
My husband and I love to travel and love the idea visiting places and staying in neighborhoods rather than in a traditional hotels and tourist traps. We love living in Portland for its proximity to nature, bigger city feel and great food options. We are creative, active people and love how much art, music and outdoor activities are available in this beautiful city. 

Between us we have many hobbies including: photography, playing music, sculpting, sewing, brewing (beer and kombucha), running, yoga, and bike riding. Together we love to hike, travel, and spend time with friends and family. 

Our style of hosting is to give you the space to feel comfortable and welcomed while letting you make the trip what you want. We are happy to help you personalize your trip or let you explore on your own. We will provide you with a clean, comfortable place to come home to and give you lots of suggestions of great things the city has to offer.

name: Peggy
about:
I'm passionate, friendly and a people pleasing kinda gal. My goal is to make you feel at home, comfortable and happy. I have been hosting for several years and love the hospitality industry. I offer lots of recommendations for sights, restaurants and unique Portland places. In addition I offer concierge services of grocery pickup, hitchhiking rides, and laundry.
In my former life I worked as a counselor in addictions and in retail sales at clothing boutiques.  I love clothes and shoes  :)
I have lived in Portland for 22 years and enjoy the outdoor activities the city and surrounding area offers. It is still a small town feel with lots to see and do. My computer tech b/f Ken and kitty Daisy share the home with me. 
I grew up in Woodland Hills, CA in a large Irish Catholic family. 
Interesting tidbits about me: I am best friends with my ex-husband and have had numerous interactions with celebrities. Katherine Ross and Michael J Fox to name a few. 
I am an avid fan of exercise i.e. hiking, walking, kayaking, gym workouts, tennis and golf. I love to read, solve crosswords and drink fabulous Oregon Pinot Noirs. 
I'm open and easy going; just glad to have you come and stay.

name: Meg
about:
I am passionate about learning, social justice, delicious food, reading, long distance running, massage, traveling as much as I can, and appreciating live music. 

My apartment is comfortable, colorful, and welcoming. I look forward to having laid back, positive, and curious people as guests. 

Hosting on Airbnb has been an incredible experience for me. I have met so many interesting and fabulous people and made many new friends through the experience.

name: Mona
about: I am a teacher living in Portland Oregon and love to go on long trips to California where I grew up.

name: Richard & Jacquie
about:
Jacquie and I have lived here in Sellwood for nearly 30 years and love this area.
We love to travel to Ecuador whenever we can. 
We love to get out and hear local music and dance to Salsa, Zydeco, Swing and other music.
We love to eat Lebanese food at Nicolas Restaurant, Sushi at Sushi Kata
or Tanis, Pho at Pho Hung, Pizza at Pizza roma of Pizzacato, late night eats at The Hotcake House, Breakfast at Bertis Lous or Fullers, etc...
We love movies at our local Moreland Theater

name: Daniel And Tessah
about: Daniel is a freelance Chinese-English translator/interpreter from Portland, OR. Tessah teaches Pilates and Exercise Rehabilitation.

name: Kate
about: Jason and I have been living in NE Portland since 2006. We have two school-aged  daughters. I work as a Nurse Midwife and Jason is a woodworker/furniture maker/artist.  We love our neighborhood. We spend our time together exploring Portland and the beautiful Northwest, hiking, berry picking and eating all kinds of bakery treats, especially donuts! We love bike riding, hiking in The Gorge, eating good food and drinking good IPA. Jason is a great cook- ask him about his homemade corn tortillas and pizza cooked in our pizza oven! We love mid century model style and architecture. I am a women's health, midwifery geek and can spend hours discussing this with anyone who will listen!

name: Kathleen
about: I have lived in Portland over 20 years and am still smitten.  I am a Motown girl and still have loyalty to Detroit but plan to enjoy and live in Portland for the rest of my life.  I relish the food/drink scene, listen to live music as often as I can and really appreciate that I can walk to most everything I need.  I am an avid cook, gardener and hiker.

name: Mark
about: I'm originally a Minnesotan.  I'm a surgeon, a scientist, and an educator.  I chose to live here in the Pacific NorthWest for all the awesome terrain and outdoor experiences, and here in Portland for the wonderful quality of life. I am looking forward to sharing my home and this experience with visitors and travelers.

name: Kristina
about: I enjoy the freedom of traveling and learning new cultures, both domestic and foreign. As an architecture student, I've studied cities and buildings all over the world and enjoy the experience of visiting such places firsthand rather than only seeing them in textbooks and powerpoint presentations!

name: Luisa
about:
Am self reliant and hardworking. I own a couple of small businesses, and I work for Multnomah County. My  friends and family are immensely important to me. Life is short, enjoy yourself, love abundantly.

One of my favorite sayings:

If you want to be loved, be lovable. 
      -Ovid 

Another favorite saying:

If you can talk . . .sing
If you can walk . . .dance

      -African proverb

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

name: Meshi
about: I am a professional choreographer, teacher, dancer and body worker. I have been living in Portland for nearly 20 years. I value community, friendship, and meaningful work. I love my home and I hope you do too. The dance I teach and choreograph is Butoh. Look it up it's rather odd, breath taking when done right, but odd none the less. I believe in working to follow ones dreams. Where there is a will there is a way.

name: Eric & Tara
about:
We are a family of 5 who love living in Portland. Eric and I have been married for 25 years and our 3 incredible sons live with us; our oldest two attend the local community college & work and our youngest is a junior in high school.  Eric and I went to college in Portland and came back to live here 15 years ago.  We have a mid-sized dog (Roxy) and a cat (Sophie) who are indoor/outdoors, but are not allowed in the guest room.

We both work from home.  Eric works for an international non-profit child sponsorship organization and travels often to South and Central America.  I work part-time for a book service company and also provide logistical consulting for professional authors/speakers/nonprofits.   

We are a busy, but quiet household. We thoroughly enjoy hosting people, books, movies, sports, laughing, Mexican food and Portland coffee!

Our hope is you will find our home a place of peace and comfort.

name: Elyse
about: I'm a poet, a writer, and a teacher. We built an addition to create an office for me and an apartment for family (mine and my husband Peenesh's) to stay in when they come visit our 5-year-old daughter.

name: Alison And Dan
about: Dan is in the lighting industry and he is originally from Chicago. Alison is a Clinical Hypnotherapist from Los Angeles. We instantly fell in love with Portland and consequently moved here with our two children in 2003.  We enjoy the beauty of our surrounding mountains, waterfalls and ocean, as well as the unique energy of this city. We ready to help in any way we can with information but we'll also leave you to enjoy your stay with respect for your privacy. Though we love to travel, we never get tired of this city and are happy to share it with you!

name: Derrick
about: The best thing about Portland is the people and we love being a part of it! We like just about everything and well, this city has just about everything. From amazing foodie options to the great outdoors, Portland is one of a kind and we have it all here. Our passion is our partnership and we enjoy anything the day throws our way. From the crisp city night life to the tranquil outdoors, we indulge in it all. Mountains? Hike em. Beaches? Got em. Bikes? Ride em. We take just as much pride in our city as we do our home. Cozy and clean, we are conveniently located to all of the above and we are so lucky to share.

name: Pamela
about:
My husband and I have lived in this beautiful four square house for 9 years.  Scott is a native Oregonian, I was born just outside of Boston. I spent the first half of my life on the East Coast, with a little time spent in LA.
Five things I can't live without: Mount Hood Vanilla tea,  my awesome camera, my wonderful children, my generous husband, and tuna salad with tarragon. 
I have a home office, so I am often available for suggestions and directions.

name: Claudia
about:
Since my early 20's  I've  enjoyed traveling the world staying in hostels because I really think it's a great way to expose yourself to the world. I feel so lucky that now I'm able to do the same for other travelers. I couldn't imagine doing this without my partner, Boone. Together we created this lovely space we call home now. We both love connecting with people, gardening, travel and outdoor adventures. There are still so many places left on our bucket list. Hope to meet you soon and learn from your experiences.
Boone will tell you more about himself later or when you meet him. Just ask him about book recommendations, politics or mustache waxes and you'll surely strike up an interesting conversation.

name: Danny
about:
Hi there, 
I work for myself from home as a spiritual life coach. I help other become empowered through coaching, classes and training. I am a Usui and Lightarian Reiki Master, Master Metatronia Therapist and hypnotherapist. I meditate often and am quite free spirited. I am working on writing books and reaching as many people with integrating the science behind healing. Im fun, silly, goofy and completley authentic. 
I love meeting people of all walks of life and welcome a good conversation anytime.

name: Isaac
about: Portland, New York, Santa Fe

name: Paul & Alisa
about: Paul and Alisa are originally from Los Angeles but moved to Portland in 2012.  We absolutely love our new hometown and want to share our enthusiasm with everyone who comes for a visit.  Paul is a physical therapist who loves the great outdoors and good beer (hence the move to Portland) and Alisa is an administrative assistant at Oregon Health Science University and a lover of all things Netflix.

name: Wayne
about: Artist

name: Bluebird
about:
We love hosting!  Our Guesthouse opened in 2006 and are excited to now partner with Airbnb.  I am a life-long traveler and always have appreciated finding kind and happy people wherever I go, and I know from first hand experience that hospitality can be the difference between a so-so experience and a wonderful one. 

When I opened the Bluebird Guesthouse it was a dream to get to provide a unique, comfortable space for others visiting Southeast Portland, and I modeled it after all the best aspects of my experiences along the way.  Hosting is our passion we really want you to have the best visit possible.

During the 1990's I lived in a ski town in Colorado and worked in hotels and vacation rentals while living the life of a snowboarder.  I don't get to the mountain quite as much anymore - these days as an urbanite I play soccer and bicycle - but I found my calling in innkeeping.  When I first moved to Portland I worked my way through college as a host at a traveler's hostel, and after graduating I ended up managing it for 6 years.  Now my wife, staff and I run 2 guesthouses in the Division / Clinton Neighborhood, and I hope you have a chance to stay with us!

~ Chris

name: Tracy
about: I am a true Oregonian and love all Portland has to offer.  People instantly fall for our quirky, art-loving, coffee sipping, get outdoors and play city.  Personally,  I love yoga, running, travel, and meditation. I found Airbnb on a visit to see my son who attends college near Boston.  I enjoyed the experience so much, I decided to become a host.

name: Diane
about:
My husband and I are very outgoing, we love adventures, work hard and take great pride in our yard, garden, and our family owned business.
   We are very outdoor oriented, we camp, fish, garden and hunt. We raise our own chickens for meat and fresh eggs. 
   We like to travel to Hawaii and Mexico.
   My husband loves his barbecue and spends as much time as he can perfecting his smoked meat. Myself I'm always after that perfect cup of coffee or that fine glass of wine.  I also love to bake.
   We look forward to hosting you in our home.  We have spent allot of time remodeling our apartment to make it comfortable and charming with your own private yard.  We look forward to meeting you.
   I grew up on the Oregon coast,  my husband was born and raised in the Portland area.  We take great pride in our home and surroundings.

name: Meryl
about: Project manager by day, house restorer by weekend. Passionate about DANCE and old buildings. Interested in stories. The more detail the better!

name: Diane
about: As a retired teacher, I have time to do some traveling as well as enjoy my home, pets, hobbies and good friends.

name: Kris
about: I am a yoga teacher and my husband Scott is a furniture maker. We moved from Milwaukee, Wisconsin to Portland in 2001. We love the Pacific Northwest and all that it has to offer including fantastic food and outdoor activities like hiking. My hosting style should make you feel welcome & the space is very clean and well cared for.

name: Michelle
about: We are a husband and wife team who love to travel and love designing houses.  Hence the start up of our business Encircle Design and Build.  We adore Portland and think its, if not the, then one of the best cities in the USA.  We are excited to share our home and neighborhood with you as it offers so much.  In the house there is a list of recommendations of what to do and see in PDX!

name: White Spider
about:
Hello! We are White Spider, a Portland-based, full-service rental concierge focused on helping our clients enjoy the perks of being an Airbnb host without the hassle of the everyday stress, and our guests have the most enjoyable vacation, ever. Our home owners get to relax, knowing they're in the hands of five-year Airbnb veterans and Super Hosts, and our guests can rest assured we are available 7-days a week, and have a response time of less than an hour - go ahead, try us!
