We've made the mistakes so you don't have to, and our company is built upon trust, communication, commitment, attention to detail, and a big ol' dash of OCD for good measure. 

Have a rental in the Portland area? Ready to become a host and don't know where to start? I can help, and it would be my pleasure to do so. 

We look forward to working with you! 

~ White Spider Rental Concierge

name: Judith
about: I am a Fashion Designer and Artist. I have worked as a Costume Designer at Club Med, and a Bike Messenger in Seattle. I love to explore far away places, especially France, Spain, and Mexico. Sometimes I work as an extra on TV productions filmed locally. I'm an avid reader, and I spend lots of time at Powells, Portland's premiere bookshop. My favorite subjects are art theft and art forgery. I volunteer as a tour guide at Portland Art Museum. I am happy to offer you suggestions of places to visit in Portland. I like to live my life as though I am living an adventure story!

name: Summer + Patrick
about:
S + P
Boss Lady + Industrial Design Engineer
Yogi + Foot Racer 
Vegetarians + Animal Lovers
Entrepreneurs + Inventors
Honest, hard-working, passionate
COMMUNITY.

name: Dao & Kyle
about: We are an artistic couple, Dao is an musician and author, and Kyle works for a cruise boat company that takes people out for trips on the rivers. We've lived in Portland for about 6 years and really love it here :)

name: Linda & Missy
about:
We live in Portland(ia) and love it! Linda owns 2 Italian restaurants and she bounces around between the two. Missy is an apothecary and mosaic glass artist whose work can be found in various Portland restaurants, shops and of course in our home. We love to make art, cook, bake, garden, car camp, see live music and play Texas Hold 'em. Life is pretty sweet:)  

We love the idea of connecting with people from all over the world through Airbnb. We are ready to host you and help you enjoy our great city. Please come and stay at our comfy home!

name: Marguerite
about: I moved to Portland, OR from North Carolina with plans to stay for a couple of years. Here I am 20 years later still loving the Pacific Northwest.

name: Trisha
about:
I am a down to earth, self-proclaimed health nut who can't get enough of the natural world and fresh organic food :)  I work as a Physician Assistant, but in my free time I step into my role as an urban farmer and outdoor enthusiast with my incredibly friendly and energetic dog, Andre (2-year old pit-mix) at my side.  Originally from Wisconsin, I was drawn to the mountains of Colorado for college and lived in Jackson, WY several years prior to migrating westward to Portland.  I used to live by the motto "live to ski" but this has since morphed into "live to garden."  I'm hoping 2015 will be the year of the bees.  
Love to travel, meet new people and engage in conversation, but some evenings are best spent curled up on the couch with a good book and cup of tea. 

p.s. GO BLAZERS!

name: Jodi
about:
Hi, I'm Jodi and am new to AirBNB as of May, 2016.  I' ve lived in Portland for 11.5 years and love it!  I like to travel and host people, and most recently went to Australia, New Zealand, Germany, and Switzerland!  In total, I have toured 26 countries and 47 US States.   I'd be happy to share all of my favorite Portland sites with you so you can have the best travel experience.

Jodi

name: Neal
about:
Hi there! 
Thanks for having a look and considering staying in my home. I travel a lot for work and find that the best experiences happen when I stay in a house in a cool neighborhood that is removed from, but close to, the downtown or commercial area of a city. I'm so lucky to have a home in an amazing area of Portland and look forward to sharing this place with guests. I personally think this is the ideal neighborhood for many reasons, including proximity: I'm a short walk from Alberta Arts, 15 minute bike ride to downtown, 15 minute bike ride to SE Hawthorne area, and a 10 minute drive to the airport. 

A few tips: Dalos Ethiopian restaurant is 15 blocks away and perhaps the best inexpensive meal in all of Portland. Try the burger at Grain & Gristle across the street. Take a walk to the Sabin Community Garden. Go see a movie at the Kennedy School. Get a piece of pie at Random Order. 

Enjoy your time in this beautiful city!

name: EmiLion
about: I am a lover, a healer, a helper. I love traveling as much as possible, getting my feet muddy, lying in the grass and singing at the top of my lungs. Laughing is what I do best. I am currently loving my job as an occupational therapist and work with the elderly population and give therapy in the home. I am creative and a designer at heart - you will notice when you check out my artsy apartment.

name: Kelsea
about: I am a 35 year old artist slash all the things.  I live in a walking neighborhood in inner Portland, take transit everywhere, and appreciate the unpredictable weather.  I have been in Oregon for almost 8 years.  I graduated from the University of Oregon with a BS in Art.  I make anything and everything on my free time, do yoga, enjoy crazy cleansing diets, love the positive affirmation movement, and have 27 plants in a 450 square foot apartment.  I love cats, I'm a vegetarian, and my favorite movie is Priscilla Queen of the Desert.

name: Hank
about: I am interested in making sure you have a wonderful stay in Portland!  No Bad Days!

name: Jen
about: Jen from Portland Oregon

name: Miranda
about:
Hi I'm Miranda! I'm originally from the California Bay Area but have called Portland my home for the past amazing two years. In my free time I love keeping up the glory days by playing a little indoor and sand volleyball around the community. I am also now a self-declared Foodie (how can you not be in Portland?!) and can't ever go back.

I love the AirBnB platform and have hosted with my previous roommate before at a different location and have had nothing but positive, respectful experiences.

I work for a social media tech platform and travel a lot which is why it makes sense to list my space! Lucky you :) I love our apartment!

name: Paul
about:
I work at home in my private hair studio, play piano and spend a lot of time with my animals and in my garden.  I live to travel and  I have been creating a garden oasis in the city that I share with travelers. The spaces are very modern and clean. I supply the bathroom with spa shampoo, conditioner and soap for sensitive skin, fluffy towels. The rooms have very comfortable beds with plenty of pillows. 
 I love to travel. eat out and meet new people.  I decided to make an ideal place to get away and not have to stay in a hotel.  A nice homey spot with a kitchen and washer/dryer in a garden setting near some of the newest restaurants and shops on Alberta St. and  only a short hop from the airport and into the city.   I live on a bicycle highway and The Kennedy school and New Season's market are a short walk.  There are so many  wonderful things to do by jumping off from this neighborhood.
One of the things that drew me here to the Northwest was having all the benefits of hiking with my dog in the Colombia River gorge and having some of the most beautiful beaches all just about an hour away.

name: Lucy
about: Hi, I am a Portlander via San Diego and New York. I am an artist (dancer/choreographer/painter) and enjoy the arts and culture, food and drink! I am open minded, clean and organized and enjoy travel and music.

name: Amanda & Sebastien
about: Sebastien and Amanda split their time between Portland, OR and Bordeaux, France. Amanda’s mother Karin lives next door to the Portland house and is the acting property manager. Karin will provide the keys and is your local contact. She is happy to answer any questions you may have (before 8 pm please!) and give recommendations, orientation, etc. Additionally, Amanda and Sebastien will be available by email, and we provide an ample collection of maps and information on things to do and see in Portland and greater Oregon.

name: Malika&Ian
about:
Very laid back, happy go lucky individuals, very personable just enjoying life.

5 Things we cannot live without: Food, Water, Air, Laughter and Love

name: Jack
about: retired banker, mentor at Washington State University College of Business, corporate treasurer of two not for profit organizations. Father of a Bellevue, WA firefighter and a Portland, OR Airbnb host. My wife and I enjoy traveling, much of it has been by cruise ships. We were in Rome during a student protest, skipped Greece because of riots, in Bulgaria after some protests, and  in Cairo just two weeks before the riots there. I suggest you don't go where we have been.  We have watched our son host over 400 guests in the Airbnb family from around the world.

name: Marshall
about: I'm a mid-western born professional that enjoys the Pacific NW for its natural beauty.  My hobbies include running, hiking, and driving the slow windy roads of this beautiful area, especially when those roads lead to a vineyard/tasting room.  I also routinely indulge in Portland's wonderful food and music scenes.  Though infatuated with the Pacific NW at the moment, I've been lucky enough to experience travel in several other parts of the world.

name: Brittany And Doug
about: We are a young professional couple living in Portland, Oregon in the beautiful Pacific Northwest.  Our jobs in renewable energy have offered us the opportunities to travel abroad and we have both enjoyed exploring many new places over the past couple years.  Hiking and the outdoors, spending time at the beach, cooking, traveling, and enjoying great food, beer, and wine are some of the ways we spend our free time.  When Doug is not on skis or his mountain bike he entertains himself with remodeling our 100-year old Portland Craftsman bungalow.  Brittany keeps busy with our vegetable garden between yoga sessions.

name: Ben & Anika
about:
We're two California natives, living and loving life in the Pacific North West! When we aren't hosting or traveling, we work in hospitality and real estate. We're both down-to-earth, friendly, laid back people, and that comes across in all we do. 

Have passport, will travel!

name: Scott And Gillian
about:
Scott: I moved to Portland in 1991 from Chicago where I grew up.  I have visited 40 countries and have lived and worked in Central Asia and Africa.  I love exploring the outdoors and Portland, especially its food and music. I have been a reporter, writer, teacher, election campaign manager and now work in public health.

Gillian:  I grew up in coastal Los Angeles and am happy to live now in the beautiful Northwest and to call Portland my home.  I lived 7 years over the mountains in the gorgeous mountain city of Bend, Oregon before moving to Portland. I have extensively traveled in Europe & Asia and was fortunate to spend a year abroad studying in Paris & Aix-en-Provence.  I love swimming, bike touring, walking and being in nature.  I enjoy helping people and currently work as a medical social worker.

I want to make your stay as fulfilling as possible.  Let me and Scott know how we can do that.

name: Jennifer
about:
Hello! I'm Jenny, a physical therapist living in Portland, Oregon. I've lived all over the world, and love hosting travelers from everywhere. 

As a host, I like to make people feel as comfortable as possible - whether that means telling you all about Portland's amazing food and hiking, or leaving you alone to rest and do your own thing. 

I really enjoy living in Portland, and I love helping to share this great city with visitors!

name: Polly
about: I moved here from the flatlands of the midwest in 1991 in order to seek a more diverse kind of beauty that surrounds Portland. I comes from a family of artists, designer, architects and urban planners, so it's only seemed natural that I would take all of these fields and turn them into a career designing and creating environments for theatre, animation, displays, events and landscapes.  I endeavor to insert creativity or adventure in every day, which is why when I'm not painting a giant unicorn (?!) or helping remodel an old school bus, I can be found out in nature on anything that will propel me: bike, horse, kayak, sailboat, sailboard, skis, her own two feet, or whatever else may be on hand. Bring it!

name: Julie
about: Portland, OR

name: Buff Medb
about:
Artist, Arts Educator, Appreciator, mom to a lovely, smart 15 year old daughter.

Crusader for Kindness, Well-spoken, out-spoken, hospitable.

NY transplant who never forgets her roots.

name: Mary Anne
about:
We are from Portland OR, and love to explore cities on foot. Parks, museums, street life are our big favorites.
We have been married for over 30 years and feel very lucky to continue to have a supportive and fun relationship. Our one son is an adult and we enjoy following his adventures and visiting him all over.

name: Kara And James
about:
We are hoping to share our love of the Northwest and make some new friends by opening our Oak Street home. We purchased the home for Kara's mother  but cold feet have kept Mom in California for now. It has been remodeled from the studs out and is perfect for a romantic getaway or a family road trip. I grew up in the area and Kara emigrated from California in the 90s. We live in SW Portland close by and our office is not too far off in Lake Oswego. Kara is a Family Medicine doctor in private practice and I help run her very busy clinic. She has been practicing in the community for over 17 years and I have been a mortgage banker for 18 years. I continue to do mortgages for longtime clients, family and friends. We have 2 boys (Go Yale and OSU!), cats, chickens and fish. We race bicycles, cross train in any way we can including kayaking, skiing, riking (a combo run/hike sport we created because hiking was just too slow much to the chagrin of our kids!). Kara is a photographer and also paints, makes jewelry and can't wait to get a pottery wheel someday. She supports local artists any way she can and is an avid collector of modern and vintage artwork. I am a woodworker and burgeoning chef. Kara recently sent me to a week of cooking boot camp at one of our local cooking schools and now there's no looking back. She really just wants me barefoot in the kitchen. We are avid herb and vegetable gardeners, love food, great wine, music and always look forward to helping guests with restaurant selections. We know the region well and have our favorite excursions and are available for guidance!
We have used airbnb and other rental web sites extensively for our travels in the US and all over Europe and hope our experiences help make yours a wonderful one! We are excited to share this lovely home with you!  James

name: Laurie
about:
Hi-I'm Laurie.  I retired this year after working 26 years in retail.  I love dancing, bowling, tennis and ping pong and spending time with my 3 beautiful grandchildren. I have been doing the books for my husband Mike's construction business for 25 years.  We enjoy old houses and classic cars, and taking our '67 Mercury convertible to the beach.

Hi I'm Mike.  I enjoy the above and build and remodel Craftsman style houses.  I built the one we live in. I am a humble one man operation.  I do almost all the work myself from the foundation to the roof (I love doing it).  I have done 9 new ones so far - 4 by myself. It can be done (even tilting up big walls) but it just takes longer.  It takes   about 12 - 14 months.  I also enjoy bicycling and ride regularly and lead  weekday evening Tuesday and Thursday workout rides. I have crossed the US by bike twice.  I like Portland micro beer also.

name: Jeanne
about: I am an ESL  teacher that likes to travel several times a year to foreign countries---especially the ones that my students are from.  My motto is, "Eat my way through Asia, dance my way through South America.  I have been very fortunate to be able to my own home to be able to trek around the globe, but now after numerous tenants and housemates, I am ready to start hosting other travelers from around the world. I enjoy playing soccer, cycling, dancing and cooking. I adore Lucy, my mini dachshund, and enjoy doing as much as I can with her. I am slowly turning my garage into a craftsman studio with the help of my longtime friend and contract manager, Rob. He will be available by phone for any maintenance issues while I'm at work or to answer any questions if I'm on vacation. He''ll also be feeding Lucy, watering plants, and yard  while I am away...

name: Kerri
about:
We are a very happy family of 4 who love to travel and who love to experience the architecture of old school buildings throughout the world.
We are thrilled to acquire and be able to share with visitors a piece of Portland History and our well furnished home.

name: Stephanie
about: I currently live in Portland, OR and work for Nike. I enjoy anything active including: running, tennis, swimming, skiing and i hope to surf.

name: Barbara
about: I am a long time Portlander, since 1968.  I love the people, the food, the recreation, the art and music, the nearby mountains and beaches.  I have traveled the world as a professional photographer since I finished college, but don't want to live anywhere else.  In my spare time I love to garden, read, watch films, knit, sing, hike, bike, kayak, cook and do yoga.

name: Ashley
about:
My husband Ouriel and I have two girls ages 6 and 3.  We are professionals, who love living in Portland.  I work as a nonprofit director in NE Portland, and Ouri works for a law firm downtown. We are available for Portland travel/restaurant tips and can also give you ideas about great bands to see while in town.  

We love to travel, and have most recently been to India, Nepal, Egypt, Israel, Hungary, Switzerland and Mexico, and would love to hear about your travels, too :)  We have had great experiences listing our house on Air BnB while traveling, and now we are excited to offer our remodeled onsite suite year round!

name: Petra
about: I am an artist that moved to Portland in 1993 and have loved living here ever since! You could also say I'm a Foodie and love exploring Portland's rich restaurant scene, let me know if you need a recommendation.

name: Laney & Brent
about: We are a fun loving couple with a passion for Music, Art, Architecture, Design, Food and nature.  Laney is an architect, designer, and artist. Brent is a musician, composer and also works in Advertising.  Brent moved from Portland to NYC 10 years ago and we recently relocated back to the Rose City and settled down into the vibrant, exciting and charming Alberta Arts District.  Portland is our home and we love exploring all of the wonders of the Pacific Northwest.  We are passionate about Portland and feel like it's about as perfect of a city as you can get.  With mountains, desert, the ocean, and waterfalls as our backdrop, we are happy to call this unique and beautiful city home!

name: Jacek
about: I've been living in Portland for the last 12 years and have been loving every minute of it. Such an exciting place to be.

name: Natasha
about: We just moved here from San Francisco with our two dogs, so far we love it! Portland is beautiful, green, full of parks, gardens, good eats, and good drinks! We are having constant adventures hiking and eating. We are both in the in the food industry, and have eaten our way through many countries. Travel inspires us, as were guessing it does you!

name: Katy And Dave
about: We are a friendly and adventurous married couple who have lived in Portland for the past 8 years.  We love going out to see live music, eating out at delicious Portland restaurants, drinking tasty craft beer and getting out in the great outdoors whenever possible.  We're excited to share our home with you and hope it serves as the perfect home base for exploring this beautiful city and the Pacific North West!

name: Sherry
about:
My husband and I are native Oregonians.  We love this City and our neighborhood. 
A retired social worker, I find staying involved in environmental and social issues is the most important thing to me.   At the same time, I like a balanced life too.  I enjoy time with friends, walks and hikes, movies, books on tape and travel.  My most memorable travels have been to Bolivia, Cuba, and most recently Eastern Canada.  If I had a motto it might be: “Every decision can be a celebration of the world you want”.

name: Colin + Sarah
about:
Oh hi there! We are Colin & Sarah!

We absolutely love hosting, traveling & the opportunity that airbnb gives for us to see the world, meet incredible people like you, and have unforgettable experiences. We've been hosting for three years! Our approach to hosting is all about good relationships, good design, and a love for life. We look forward to the chance to meet you :) send us a message if you have any questions!

Our last few years of travel include our month in Europe, weeks exploring North and South Island New Zealand, a cultural study of Israel, documentary shoots in Zimbabwe, Uganda, and India. A long awaited family safari in Kenya, and more shoots in Ireland, China, and Mexico, a road trip around Australia with a first time diving experience at the Great Barrier Reef, and a getaway to Cape Town, South Africa.

We have a heart for thoughtful questions, well-crafted coffee, life on the go, new places, and creativity. We are creatives & storytellers working in digital and analog mediums.

Hotel concierge's are let's face it, out of date, and don't really tell you more than you can find on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN). Friends help you know a city like the back of your hand, they help you find those places that will leave a mark on your heart. Let us stay in your place and we will surely be friends! Let us host you and you'll be back soon enough wanting to visit again! We love the airbnb community because it's a really special way to get to know a city.

name: Jerry
about:
I'm a happy person that likes to enjoy life. I grew up in London and love living in the US. Soccer skiing, golf and music are my favorite things.
I want guests to enjoy the beautiful location of the Villa and all that Portland has to offer.

name: Gillian
about:
I work as a mental health therapist in private practice.  After growing up in Los Angeles on the coast, I migrated to the beautiful North West, where Scott & I enjoy bike commuting, touring, camping and hiking.  We love to travel and have both lived abroad.

On my time off, I love hanging out with my cat Rupert, reading a book, swimming, or tooling around the city by bike or on foot.

name: Daniella And Jason
about: Portland, OR

name: Julia
about: I'm a Portland native who loves this city and how it's grown so gracefully. I so enjoy the variety of fantastic food available within a stones throw of any direction as well as all the unique shops, beautiful parks and landscapes.  My work has me traveling a lot so I enjoy being able to share my cozy home and this town with friends, family and visitors.

name: Jason And Krista
about:
Jason is a contractor, father, fanatic reader, activist, acrobat, dancer and world traveler.  He spent four consecutive years exploring the far reaches of the planet in his twenties and speaks three languages.  

Krista is currently completing a master's degree in Classical Chinese medicine.  Aside from being a full-time student, she is a step-mother, acrobat, culinary goddess, dancer, herbalist and avid gardener.  The US is the fourth country in which she has lived, with Canada being the first, where she was born and raised.  

We are in love with life as much as we are with each other.  We are passionate about our individual pursuits, co-raising our two beautiful children, playing partner acrobatics together and communing with nature as much as possible.  We lead very busy lives these days, and balance our hard work with plenty of play and luxurious self-care.  We have a keen interest in living a healthy lifestyle built around community and sustainability, and do our best to instill the same awareness in our kids.  We've covered much of the globe separately, and a little together, but never stop scheming about the places we want to travel to as a couple.  

We spent this past summer transforming a cute old house into the most charming home there ever was!  We are excited to share it with traveling guests now, and hope you love it as much as we do.

name: Marcus
about:
We listed our house for the first time in Feb. 2016.
I'm a native of the Pacific NW. Our family enjoys soccer, basketball, skiing, hiking, and trips to the beach!

name: Bryan
about: Windsurfer, Surfer.

name: ElizaBeth
about:
See that hat?! That's a signature look for me. I am a Milliner and Custom Clothier; a creative and artistic person with a love of life.  Add a touch of luxury and a bit of vintage to create a story about my history. I am sure at one time I lived in a small town in Italy in the late 1920's. We all love stories! 
Oregon feeds me with it's beautiful nature; a continual source of inspiration.
I have lived in Portland for 35 years, raised a family here and taught many students. Life is impermanence, so now  my place is a Home Boutique and Sewing studio and I LIVE here, too  Come see what's up, relax on the porch, or the atelier and let's share some stories.

name: Carla
about: Hello! I'm Carla, I live and work in the Portland music and crafts community. I'm a musician/painter who's building a work space/residence tiny house with my family. I love gardening and spending time with my family out doors. It's a pleasure to share my home and super fun neighborhood with visitors to Portland!

name: Elaine And Ryan
about: We are both designers ( Architect / Landscape Architect) and we are passionate about improving our home and surroundings, lively conversation, entertaining friends and family, and not taking ourselves too seriously. Favorite place we've traveled: Mumbai. Next up: Cuba or Myanmar.

name: Rich
about:
I'm just a steel town girl on a Saturday night. No, wait, that's not right. 

I grew up in south Florida and the Atlanta area, and moved to Portland from Dallas TX in 1996. 

I love Portland and am happy to help visitors plan their visit. But I also don't want to meddle. Many of you are perfectly capable of finding a great place to have dinner or figuring out which of 8 places within 2 miles will have juice boxes (all 8). 

And just in case we don't talk about either, there's a list of both nearby local restaurants and stores in the kitchen kept safe in page protectors.

When I started hosting I lived 4 miles away and I rarely saw any of my guests. Now I share a wall with my guests (separate residence still). I will do what I can to limit in-person interaction, but you might catch sight of me checking mail or walking dogs.

name: Kelly
about: My summers are spent going to outdoor concerts and glamping!  I love dark chocolate and delicious coffee.  Traveling is one of the things I like most, trying new foods and experiencing the culture is so fun.

name: Dee
about: Love to travel. I spend six months in Oregon and six months in Loreto, Mexico. Love learning Spanish, riding horses, volunteer work and spending time with my dog, friends and family.

name: Véronique Marise
about:
Bonjour .. 

Who I am is not easy to define within a few paragraphs. Let's see what I can come up with.  

I'm a first generation French lady then a New Yorker who has relocated to Portland, Oregon. GO YANKEES!! I love a healthy rivalry and recognize all teams talent. 

I'm an optimistic, my cup is always overflowing and I believe we must surround ourselves with positive energy and uplifting spirits. I do not like the words perfect or normal, they should be removed from all languages. 

I recognize challenges as opportunity for growth and know that our perspective and approaches makes the greatest differences. 

I own a thriving company, love water sports, snowboarding/skiing, rock climbing, traveling, dinner parties, wine and in general people. I have recently returned back to school to obtain my J.D. degree in business and malpractice law. 

My life's moto is: 
'Give without expecting a return, be honest despite circumstances and love without reserve. Take chances but never be foolish, believe in all but be aware. Keep your chin up and head high. Our greatest challenges are battling the we inside.' -- Véronique LaFont 

I look forward to meeting our next guests. 

à votre santé, 

Véronique M. LaFont 

'If you want to see the true measure of a {wo}man, watch how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.' -- J. K. Rowling

name: Ann
about:
Hello, my name is Ann. 
I teach middle school math, paddle dragon boats, love hiking and biking, play the cello and ukulele, and enjoy traveling. I have been lucky to travel to Europe with an orchestra, to China with a dragon boat team,  and to Australia, China, Martinique and Canada with students. I lived in Italy for two years while teaching in an international school. It was a fantastic experience!
You will adore the variety of shops and restaurants in Multnomah Village, just a short distance from my front door. My favorite shops are Annie Blooms book store and Thinker Toys children's shop. My go to restaurants are Journeys, a perfect place to sit outside and drink local beers, ciders, and wines while eating delicious tapas, and Verde Cucina, an excellent family owned Mexican restaurant where the soft tortillas are made fresh while you wait, and the marguerites are heavenly. 
Come and visit and let me share this perfect place with you!

name: Jennifer
about: My husband Jesse & I enjoy travel, the outdoors, working on our beautiful house and playing with our cute dog Fig!  We love Portland & we know you will too.

name: DeAngelo
about:
Fun Loving. Father. Artist. Producer. Teacher. Mentor. Awesome.

Portland Native in love with it's growth!

name: Cynthia
about: Hi, I'm Cynthia.  I've lived in Portland for the last 12 years and love it!  I've also lived in Manhattan, DC, Berkeley, and Santiago, Chile.  I work in tech and design, stay involved in my community, take lots of yoga, and frequent food carts.  I'm looking forward to have you as a guest in my home!

name: Mitch
about: Welcome aboard, folks. I'm the chief navigator for PDX Wheelhouse, a luxe in-home stay for university visitors at North Portland's beautiful green Columbia Park (coming 3Q 2015). I have a lively interest in science, Victorian history, the Transcendentalists, energy and the environment, democratic reforms, and, as guests will see, Art Deco architecture, and golden retrievers. Maybe I'm happiest when I'm in the presence of natural or artistic beauty. Or maybe when I'm in the presence of something funny.

name: Maureen
about: Hi, I am retired and have lived in Portland for 20 years. I love to garden and can recommend all the best public gardens in Portland. Despite the fact that I love to play in the dirt, I am also an urban gal who tries to keep up with all that Portland has to offer--from quirky neighborhoods, to the art world, music events, and the many great restaurants, or food carts, that our foodie culture nurtures. I love to travel, most recently in Thailand for 7 weeks, and appreciate other cultures. I speak enough Spanish to communicate the basics.

name: Places To Stay
about: We love to welcome people to PDX!

name: Rhonda
about: I love Airbnb! I've been both a host and a guest! So I appreciate leaving a place as clean or even better than I found it. I love to travel and stay in places that feel like home. Airbnb is an affordable and unique option to get a true experience of a place instead of staying in a stale-aired hotel!

name: Jindra
about:
I was born in the Czech Republic. I am married with out-of-the-house children. I enjoy making music (I sing and play violin), and I love to travel. I have been all over Europe and greatly desire to venture into other continents as well. I am passionate about food and enjoy trying different cuisines. Hiking is another one of my favorite activities. Our neighborhood is one of the most sought-after locations in Portland. Willamette River and three different parks are withing walking distance from our house, New Season grocery store is just a block away and so are multiple restaurants and coffee houses. The whole neighborhood is walk-able. We can bike to downtown and have bicycles available to our guests. Max station is 10 minutes away from our house for those who prefer public transportation. 
I am looking forward to meeting you!

name: Mikael
about:
I am a medical students at NCNM, Portland's Naturopathic medical school. We both get really pumped about medical philosophy, biking, and traveling abroad. Mikael also loves running really fast and working on his podcast

Anywhere in Europe will do, though. Mikael's favorite is Berlin. Very practical.

As for our airbnb style, we're pretty hands-off when hosting, and adventurous when staying with people. As hosts, we're very happy to share with you our local tips and opinions!

name: Allison
about: I'm single, professional, and 38.  I enjoy working on the house, getting outdoors often, and the great food and wine that Portland has to offer.  I am active and exercise daily including jogging and dragon boat racing.  I am pretty quiet during the week and am in and out on the weekends.  I read a lot as well as enjoy movies and an occasional TV series on Netflix. In the fall I'm pretty addicted to college football. I am flent in Spanish.

name: Jacqueline
about: I've lived in Portland since 1980 - a Texas transplant.  There's no place I would rather live! Life is all about connections.  Favorite quotes: "There is no instinct like that of the heart." Lord Byron. and “Follow what you love and it will take you where you want to be.”  Natalie Goldberg.

name: Stephen
about: I like to refer to myself as a Jack-of-All-Trades / Master of Science. (I have an M.S in Forest Ecology with a concentration in Geographical Information Systems and Social Ecology). I hail from the great state of Michigan but have been a New Yorker for more than 10 of the best years of my life.  I always try to help where I can and be supportive of people and ideas that are important to me. Since arriving here Ive participated in some interesting groups dealing with Spirituality, Philosophy, and Open Source Computing in order to research solutions to international strife. To pay the bills Ive worked as an assistant to an internationally known writer and celebrity of sorts, was a Survey Project Manager for a national consortium of construction magazines and did some municipal bonds analysis (but haven’t we all). I live very happily in Brooklyn Heights with his amazing wife Karen Tortora-Lee. I have interests in collective intelligence (and crowdsourcing), Appreciative Inquiry, scientific breakthroughs, touching stories about personal salvation through transformation, interesting art and how new web technologies (like The Shared Web and (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN)+) will one day save the world – one small step at a time. I hopes this inspires you to join me.

name: Lance
about: Hello, I'm Lance.  I generally travel with my family: me, my wife, my son and my daughter.  I/we like active stuff like sports and hiking.  We hope to follow the Golden Rule: treat others like we would want to be treated.  I recently built a second home on my property and am getting started renting it using Airbnb.  I think I'm a considerate owner and guest/renter.  With my construction/engineering experience, I have an interest in keeping things tidy and working efficiently.

name: Matie & Eric
about: Parents, vegetarian, animal lovers,  readers of books.

name: Lori
about:
I'm Lori, I live in Portland, Oregon, am a Bodyworker for 20 years doing Orthopedic/Injury/Cranial/Shamanic/Reiki Energy Work.  In my free time, if it's winter I am doing snow dances and going snowboarding as much as possible.  If it's spring/summer, I am playing in the dirt, appeasing the faeries in the yard and helping things grow or laying in one of my 4 hammocks to read.  In Summer/Fall, I try to get to the beach weekly to surf.  
The rest of the year, I cook fabulous meals for my friends as much as possible and travel to snowboard/surf/see friends and family, as much as possible.

name: Allison
about: HI! I am moving out of my apartment prematurely! This place is great, super convenient location, great open space. Let me know if you're interested

name: Stefan
about:
I'm a freelance animator, kayaker, gardener (in the process of blossoming), snowboarder, artist, and dog lover who moved to Portland from Brooklyn in 2006 to experience life in a different city that offered the same level of art, music, and food. And I got more than what I bargained for, because Portland has an energy and warmth that Brooklyn doesn't.

I've spent the last six years enjoying my house alone and then with roommates. But now the roommates have left, and the house feels too big for my dog and I. That's why I want to share it with people who are visiting this fair town!

name: TravisB
about: testtesttest

name: Sara
about: I enjoy running, spending time with my family and my 2 year old son, Finn, and I love to travel.  My husband and I recently returned from a 1-year sailing trip through the Bahamas on a 32-foot Oday.  We are both engineers, I work for Bonneville Power and my husband started his own structural business.  I also like to garden, cook, keep bees, local eats, and enjoy good coffee and a good micro-brew or bottle of wine.  We love visitors and meeting people from different places.  We love Portland and our neighborhood!

name: Celina
about: City girl who loves outdoor adventures: skiing, running, hiking, swimming, camping, and figuring out how to go everywhere by bicycle.

name: Hanne
about: Hi, I am Hanne.  I am from Denmark, but have lived in Portland, Oregon since 1995, and definitely consider it home by now.  Portland has a lot to offer.  In the summer I love to take advantage of being close to world-class hiking and in the winter Mt. Hood snowboarding is high on my list, but I also enjoy city life.  Tell me what you want to do while you are here and I will give you the inside scoop, including activities kids will enjoy.

name: Samuel And Celia
about: We are a Portland based couple that frequently travel for work as Archaeologists. We've lived in the Alberta Arts District of Portland since 2006 and have poured our hearts into our one and only little home/ abode on Alberta. It brings us great pleasure to share Casa del Sol and the neighborhood with others. Enjoy!

name: Ciera
about: Hello! I currently live in Portland, OR with my husband and our precious puppy, Kiva. I enjoy running, hiking, yoga, good beer, and sunshine!

name: Will
about:
Hey there! I love skateboarding, hanging out with my daughter, friends and all family!

You will love this apartment, it's very clean. I'm a fan of clean spaces, and this indeed is a clean space to spend your trip or just a few nights for any reason.

name: Jon
about: I have lived in Portland for almost 20 years.  I've written guidebooks about dining and shopping in Portland and many other cities.  I look forward to helping you explore Portland.

name: Garlynn
about: I enjoy regional planning and the interface between geography, land use and transportation -- that's my professional focus.  I'm also a vinyl DJ with a musical focus on a sonic excursion from funk, soul, disco and reggae through hip hop to house and beyond.  (You can hire me to play your party or other event!)  I'm into bicycles for everyday transportation, for pleasure and for achieving public policy goals like improving our built environment and achieving greenhouse gas reductions.  I dig gardens, backyard chickens, honeybee hives, green/living roofs and putting lids on freeways to turn that air space into public space or even private development.  I've been to Burning Man and was involved with running a night club/theme camp there for many years.  I also am into biodiesel Mercedes Benzes, and do all my own maintenance.  In fact, I seem to enjoy, and am actually fairly good at, turning a wrench...

name: Kristin
about: Hi, I'm a lover of travel and adventure and I hope to be able to share my home in Portland with people who are looking to experience our beautiful city.

name: Julia
about: Hello!   I am a bright young woman excited to travel, and looking for something more than just a hotel or motel, which can be very impersonal, and sometimes in weird locations, and sometimes very expensive. Usually I stay with a friend, or make a friend through organizations like Couchsurfing or Warmshowers, but sometimes its Air Bnb! I am from Maryland, and branching out from where I've landed in Portland, OR.  I enjoy hiking, sunsets, a good book, a cup of tea, live music,  bike rides, arts and crafts....

name: Marc
about: I am a husband and father of two active boys living with my family in Portland.

name: Alan
about:
We just had a tiny baby girl (on 10.10.10), and are loving our move back to LA after 8 years in NYC and a year in France.

I'm a graphic designer and my wife is an master baker. There might just be some of her amazing double chocolate-chip cookies with sea salt waiting for you when you arrive.

We only rent our place when we leave town because we love it and spend as much time as we can here—so if you see it available, grab it.

name: Katie
about: East coast native, now living in Portland, OR. I work in tech industry and I love taking advantage of all this city has to offer--great food, music, gorgeous outdoors and always something new and interesting to do and try.

name: Jimmy
about:
We love traveling, doing anything outside, and all things Portland. 
We'd love to share our home and city with you!

name: Brooke
about: I am Brooke, I've lived in Portland for 4 years and have loved every minute of it. My husband is Jack, he is from London, UK and we are newly wed. Jack is a musician and one of our favorite things to do in our city is finding live gigs. I am a makeup artist, a childhood dream that is now reality. We love our home and feel proud to show it off, as well as our neighborhood. We firmly believe that the best food is found in Portland. We love to travel and our dream destinations include the following: London (as often as possible), Nashville, Japan, New York and anywhere else that calls our name!

name: Brad
about: A native Oregonian, I went to school at Lewis & Clark College, have 3 boys, play the drums and like to travel.

name: Paul & Aimee
about:
Hi, we are Paul and Aimee, a married couple that loves the city of Portland, travel, and the great outdoors. We spend our weekends kayaking, hiking, and enjoying good food and brews. 

Paul is a recreational pilot and if you look up when you're outside you might just see him fly overhead. In the co-pilot seat Aimee is likely Instagramming the amazing views they fly over, as she has a slight addition to capturing beautiful sights in square frames.

We aspire to travel the world someday, and would love to hear your travel stories should we cross paths! We look forward to hosting you.

name: Alison
about: I am a vegan and artist working a 9-5 office job in employee benefits administration.

name: Courtney
about: Two Mississippians who have enjoyed exploring the Nortwest for the past year.  We hike, ski, and will probably be camping while you enjoy our Portland Home!

name: Kacy
about: We are a college professor and a radio producer in Portland, Oregon. We are avid readers, gardeners, hikers, bikers and swimmers.

name: Dana
about:
I have been an Airbnb guest many times and helped Airbnb host friends and now I'm ready to host my own Airbnb! I'm sociable but also respect introverts' need to recharge their batteries with solitude. 
I like to cook when I have people around. When I'm not working, I spend time with my horse, exercise, hang out with friends, and find out what's going on in the world. I like all kinds of music, movies, sports, Mexican food, and thrift shopping.
I am a staunch Earth lover and use carefully. My motto: recycle, repurpose, reuse.

name: Daria
about: I am a professional, I shared a home with my partner, Amy and our two teenage daughters, oh, and our crazy terrier, Blu. We love our community and would love for the world to experience the J.

name: Colby
about: I am a fun loving family man who enjoys spending time outdoors.  I really enjoy the summer months with my family in our backyard pool.

name: Modi
about:
Originally from DC, went to college in Boston, spent some time in New York City and Portland, and now I'm in Los Angeles. Outside of my 9-to-5, I also throw a music festival and other music-centric events with my college buddies on both coasts.

Excited to travel and indulge in the culture of every city that I hit.

name: Emily
about:
Hi! I am a born and raised Portland native who loves the vibe Portland offers. I love to exercise, drink a great latte, attend many Portland events, and did I mention I love a great latte?? 

I believe in working hard in life, that most things are privileges and to not take life for granted, it's simply too short to do so. Everything happens for a reason, whatever it may be, so find the lesson through the journey.

name: Joshua
about:
I'm a lawyer, have lived in Portland since 1984.  I grew up in Boston and Jakarta, and went to school at Reed and NYU. 

I’ve used AirBnB as a traveler, but am just starting to welcome people into our home, and my whole family is very excited about it. We are committed to making your stay in Portland really great. We’ve had several people stay with us through Couchsurfing, and it’s always been a great experience, and we are gung-ho about taking the next step and letting out our whole house when we’re away. 

When I travel, I mostly go for the food, but also really enjoy meeting new people who are different from me.  I get a kick out of immersing myself into a new and strange culture.

name: Zachary
about: My wife and I are professionals working in health and wellness. We love to take walks in the nearby rose garden, and make faces at our 3 month old daughter.

name: Amanda
about:
This past year I moved to Portland, Oregon from NYC with my boyfriend and dog. We are enjoying the bigger spaces and greener surroundings of the Pacific Northwest. 

We love to travel  and explore new places. So while we cherish our home, we equally love being on the move.   

Originally I am from Los Angeles, but have spent time living in the Bay Area, and New York. I work in advertising. And on the weekends, I enjoy cooking, hosting, and practicing yoga.

name: Ray
about: I am an avid art lover and FOODIE who loves to travel! I have lived in Colorado, Washington DC, New York City and now reside on the west coast in Portland, Oregon!

name: Jaime
about: Hi! My name is Jaime. I'm a student Midwife, a weaver, and a practitioner of Ayurvedic medicine. I love to cook and garden and read.  I'm a bit of a homebody, so my home is pretty cozy and comfortable. I have great records, great books, and everything you need to make yourself at home. I love hosting and making someone's stay special.

name: Colleen
about:
Born and raised in Seattle, I went to University of Oregon then decided to move to Portland 'for a few years' before moving home to Seattle.  I've been in love with Portland ever since.  It's got a little bit of everything - big city culture and easy access to the outdoors.  Plus, it's close to Seattle and my family's beach cabin on Puget Sound so I get to see them regularly.

A few years ago my life took a surprising turn when I met this incredible guy who just so happens to live in Lincoln, NE.  I never guessed we could make it work but now I'm living part time in Lincoln and part time in Portland.  

I love to travel myself and I love Portland so I'm excited for you to get a chance to travel to this fantastic city.  I'll do what I can to give you the info you need to make your visit a great one.

name: LeBrie
about:
I am an artist who can often be found gardening, riding my bike or playing backgammon, when not working in the studio. My boyfriend and I love to travel, and we rent our house out when we are away (profile photo taken in the world's largest ferris wheel in Tokyo, while airbnb guests stayed in our house). 

Our experience with airbnb has always been positive, as hosts and guests. We love sharing our home and making connections with like-minded folks around the world.

name: Rachel
about:
My personal true loves include: 
-Charlie, Periwinkle, Cornbread, & Kickstand
-traveling: France, Mexico, Argentina
-milk, chocolate, home grown tomatoes, Charlie's home made pizza w/pesto
-helping others
-pets and, in particular, dogs with behavior issues
-laughing as a workout
-Radiohead
-Harry Potter

Although we won't be here when you're staying, we hope you will make yourself at home. We will have another person available in town in case of an emergency and will be available by phone or email (depending on our whereabouts). We will also leave you some details about our house that you can peruse if something comes up or you have questions. 

I don't think any trip to Portland would be complete without a bike ride from our place to downtown across the Steel Bridge Pedestrian Bridge. Charlie & I became engaged there!

Our favorite places to hang out here include:
- Kennedy School for cheap movies and drinks
- Pip's for donuts and drinks
- The Bluffs Park for a sunset and bottle of wine
- Forest Park for a beautiful Portland hike in the city
- 4-4-2 for soccer games
- Ps & Qs Market in Dekum Triangle for lunch
- Alberta Street Pub for enjoying local microbrews on the greatest patio in town
- Crystal Ballroom or Doug Fir for live music

name: Pauly & Myra
about: Things we like: music, camping, breweries, supporting local businesses, happy hour, New Seasons Market, art shows at The Goodfoot, a cold beer in a hot shower, BBQing, live music, Cinema 21, bike rides, Hood River & the Columbia Gorge, DJ's, local art, recycling, cooking, spending time with family & friends, the Trail Blazers and summer days at the ocean or river.

name: Linsey
about:
My husband and I love doing life with our friends and enjoying all things that are well designed.  We love to create and to make memories.  As we travel for work we thought what better way to help others make memories in Portland than to share our home.  Robbie is a Footwear Design Director and I am a Florist, Graphic Designer, Materials Rep for textiles, and a stay at home mom of two sweet kids. Max (4yrs) and Maddie (1yr).    

We travel most often for business but love the occasional vacation with family as the schedule allows :) Our space is a successful blend of midcentury and modern.  It's warm, efficient, and set up for those who love to cook and enjoy the outdoors.  We live in the forest AND in the city, so if you like the comforts of a hotel or the wild outdoors we have you covered. A trail to forest park starts less than 500 yards from our front door and we are literally 5 min from  downtown Portland, just coast down the hill.

To sum us up, we love Jesus, family, design, movies, community, great food and drink, and the words that best describe us are peaceful, flexible, and motivated :)  Look forward to seeing you soon.

name: Kate
about: After living in San Francisco for a dozen years, I moved to Portland, Oregon.  I've become tolerant of the rain because i'm surrounded by love and sunshine with my husband and two adorable boys (though i'll always be a sunshine Cali girl!).

name: Nancy
about:
The thrill of riding a camel in the Sahara under a full moon, caving in Belize, and swing dancing on a quay on the Seine, are a few memorable adventures. Living in Spain and France also hold great memories.

I am a travel writer and an adventurer at heart.  Strolling the streets of Northwest Portland, eating well, and hanging out with friends are simple highlights of daily life in Portland..

name: Kyle
about: medical student, traveler

name: Shannon
about: I am a mom of a teenager, a dog, and two cats.  I work as a public elementary school teacher.  I practice yoga, cook yummy vegan food, listen to a lot of music, and adventure whenever I can.   Portland is an amazing place to live, and I am happy to provide a comfortable, clean space for people who are here to enjoy the city.

name: Marla
about: Portland, OR

name: Jean
about:
I am a writer (author of Air Burial, a novel), and work for an education non-profit. Travel is a passion and I've been fortunate to visit many countries. Favorite memories include being in Oaxaca, Mexico for the funeral of artist Rufino Tamayo (candles and colored sand); seeing elephants rush into a waterhole in Zimbabwe; catching a ride on a fishing boat up the coast of Thailand; and staying on an Indonesian coffee farm. My husband could investigate every stone of every Romanesque church in Burgundy, France - while I sit in a cafe and watch the world go by. 
We love Portland and our home, and are excited to share this great city with you. 
My motto is "always go to the party." It has worked well for me.

name: Season
about: I am a mother of two young boys, love to cook, garden, explore my new city and work on my new house.

name: Brent
about:
I'm a pretty easy-going, quiet, gay guy living in beautiful Portland. I love cooking  and eating good food and drinking good wine with friends.

I'm trying to create my dream job by being a part of the founding team of an upstart company called Kids for Recycling. To make money, I'm a server and a pretty avid Airbnb host for about a year now.

I've really enjoyed meeting a lot of interesting and friendly people hosting and look forward to meeting many more.

My motto? "It's never too late to be what you might have been" --George Elliot

name: Matt
about:
Hello! I live here with my wife, Kristin, and our two children, Claire and Samuel. 

We helped to build and design this home in 2002 and love it and the location. We put a lot of time into building it sustainably, using many reclaimed materials, passive solar, rainwater harvesting and many other green practices. The home is relatively new but has many unusual stories to tell. We also love to garden, cook and dine outside on the back patio.

Matt is a middle school social studies and Japanese teacher. Kristin is an administrative assistant at Mercy Corp. Claire is a student at Grant High School and Samuel a middle school student where Matt teaches.

We invite you to make full use of all the amenities our home has to offer or simply as a place to rest your head while you explore the local sites, cuisine and shopping.

name: Matthew
about: I live in Portland, Oregon where I practice Chinese Medicine, hike, cook and swim.  I'm clean, friendly, and professional.

name: Alex
about: AmeriCorps member, originally from St. Louis!

name: Nicole
about: Hi there! I'm a woman in her mid-thirties, west coast USA native and Oregonian since 2005, fisheries biologist by trade, and musician (bandcamp address: nikkiandthepathos). Hobbies include gardening, brewing wine, and picking mushrooms. Generally I am busy working during my days, but am happy to share a glass of wine and connect with a guest in the evening (or not if you have your own itinerary or I am busy....I'm flexible). I live with one roommate in his mid-thirties.

name: Kelli
about: I am a travel enthusiast who lives to explore and learn about different people and places. I value diversity and love immersing myself into anything new! I travel light, love the outdoors, hikes, bike riding, live music and of course, food.

name: Ruth
about: We are a family of four living in beautiful Portland, Oregon. Recently transplanted from the East Coast, we enjoy the natural beauty, urban quirkiness, and great food that Portland has to offer. We also love the arts and traveling internationally.

name: Lyndsay
about: We are both theatrical Production Managers, Stage Managers and Lighting Designers that work for a number of companies and productions both locally and internationally. Our beautiful little home is in the best neighborhood on earth and we are excited to be able to share it with others while we travel!

name: Joel And Sarah
about:
We love our home and we love Portland, we've been in our house for 2+ years and there's always a DIY project going on it seems :). We have two baby girls (let us know if you'd like kid's toys/books left out!) and a beloved black lab - Cooper.
Being outside, brewing (Joel), gardening, reading, traveling and friends are the things that we like best.

name: Matt
about: I'm  a single dog dad that enjoys road trips across the west coast, exploring the natural world, and producing music.

name: Sally
about:
64 year old single professional female.  I'm a full-time mental health practitioner  and art therapist with a large teaching university hospital, artist and gardener.  I'm fairly quiet but like to socialize; am a non smoker and love animals!

I can't live without chili peppers, beautiful sunsets, a good book to read, other creative people and animals.  I don't travel often and when I do I am happiest when I am there, not the travel itself.

When I'm a guest, I am quiet and respectful, like to be in healthy, calm, smoke free environments that are generally quiet and of course safe.  If I go to Mexico, I fly and use cabs and deluxe buses.  I sometimes play acoustic guitar (poorly), love to paint with watercolor and make one of a kind jewelry by hand construction. I like to swim and ride my bike.  At home I like to ride my Vespa on warm days! I am seeking some warmth in the coldest months in the Pacific Northwest for a week or two.

name: Lee
about: Originally from Wisconsin, but now my wife and I call Portland home. Love the Northwest and all it has to offer.

name: Craig
about: Mellow guy, guy, teacher, kind.

name: Billy
about: I'm originally from New York and moved to Portland for law school.  I'm now working with start up technology companies and travel often. Portland is one of the best small cities in the U.S. for creative and modern businesses.  The community maintains an eclectic spirit with an eye on the future and appreciation of the past.

name: Emily
about: Hi! We are Emily and Edgar, we have both lived in Portland for over ten years and Emily was a Concierge for years at a fancy downtown hotel so you have a personal travel guide at your disposal. We would love to tell you about our favorite spots to eat, hike, adventure and explore. Edgar is a an avid record collector and has a curated box of "suggested listening" records for you to enjoy during your stay.

name: Dana
about: NY native but currently live in Portland, OR

name: Aleina
about:
Hi everyone!

I am a graduate student in my fourth and final year studying classical Chinese herbal medicine and acupuncture. I currently offer therapeutic wellness services including Bowen Therapy and myofascial release. I love helping my clients restore and relax into a healthier, more integrated and balanced way of being in the world! Giving to others in a sustainable manner is a true source of joy.

Airbnb is wonderful. I enjoy meeting intellegent and fun people while learning about new cultures as both a traveler and host. I have traveled extensively in my young life and while I’m focused on studying and currently less nomadic, it’s great to have people arrive on my doorstep and bring the adventure of travel with them to share. 

Bon voyage!

name: Chris
about:
40ish;  travel semi-frequently, both for work and play.  An avid rock climber, I own a home in Portland, Oregon and have a beautiful baby boy Pax. I'm usually put up in hotels while I'm on the road for work, so I occasionally enjoy a break from that environment.

I'm a respectful guest, always recognizing that the space being shared with me belongs to my host.

name: Bradford
about:
I came to Portland over 6 years ago. I love the outdoors and the beautiful Oregon landscapes. I play disc golf , home , soccer , love camping and showing being outside. I'm also a musician as well and perform in Oregon and Washington. 
My family has relocated with me. We are now sharing our beautiful home with the air Bnb community. We welcome you to stay in our house and feel comfortable in our home stay from home. We are in southeast Portland centrally located to public transit , parks , trails , food pods , bakeries , breweries. Within 10 minutes of downtown, come explore the best Portland has to offer while making yourself comfortable within our private suite. You have your own bedroom , bathroom, living room and kitchen with fridge , toaster , electric stove and wok, coffee, sink and laundry facilities. We have a private entrance and a backyard oasis with gardens and fire pit.

name: Scott
about: Laid back, easy-going traveler & host. Along with my wife and fellow adventurer, I've lived abroad and traveled extensively through SE Asia, the Pacific and points between. While always happy to meet folks and have a backpacker, hostel or shared experience, we also appreciate the opportunity to end the day with some creature comforts and a place of our own. I'm an avid gardener and eater and love exploring a new place through its food and culture.

name: Max
about: We are designers & art directors based in Portland, Oregon. We love to travel & camp. We have a 8 year old son with a traditional Scandinavian name.

name: Ashley
about: I'm a naturopathic physician. I travel often for work. I love traveling, hiking, thai food, writing, and cats.

name: Sarah & Pat
about:
We appreciate a clean, quiet place to rest our heads when we travel, so we try to do the same for our guests. Trips for us normally include urban or rural hikes, culinary explorations, and absorbing local culture in any way we can. There's no better way to understand a place than to be in a local's home. As avid outdoors people we practice a 'leave no trace' ethos and treat our hosts property with care.  We hope our guests treat our home with the same respect.
We love hiking, backpacking, skiing, snowboarding, hockey, yoga, cooking, and eating. Ask us for tips on where to go in and around Portland. We're happy to share our favorite spots with you!

name: Mike
about:
Hi! I'm Mike.  I am the founder/owner of an IT services company.  My other interests are art history, traveling, (especially internationally), 50's modern houses, 70's BMW cars and Boston Red Sox baseball.  Come be our guests and enjoy the AMAZING city of Portland you've been hearing about.  We love meeting interesting people from all over the world. 

Some of our favorite trips have been to
Kyoto
Copenhagen
Paris
Berlin

The best part about returning from a trip back to Portland is the relatively low cost of living, the ease of getting around and the super delicious food options.

name: Claire
about: To see the world, things dangerous to come to, to see behind walls, draw closer, to find each other, and to feel. That is the purpose of life.

name: Karen
about: Portland native, love music, gardening, kayaking, great food & wine, reading + travel as often as possible. We are small business owners who love to share our beautiful city and all it has to offer!

name: Lily
about: Grad student living in Portland with my adventurous Momma. we have a four bedroom house and we're looking to share it!

name: Mike & Lydia
about:
Hi!  
We are Portland natives and love our city. Some of our favorite things to do in Portland are:  running the trails in Forest Park, walking our dog through Richmond, biking on the Eastside, hooping at Wallace Park, & grabbing dinner and drinks on SE Division. 

Aside from enjoying all the Portland has to offer, Lydia curates a Sangria blog, Mike watches tons of sports and we both work in advertising.

Feel free to hit us up for our top 10 things to do in Portland, hope you enjoy your stay!

name: Benjamin
about:
I'm the typical Portlander. I love to hike, explore nature, chill with my dog, drink good whiskey and eat great food. I've been traveling through the United States and Central America and excited to start exploring Europe soon.

My passions are art, my pup Dobby, and cooking delicious food with my housemates.

name: Brandi
about:
I'm a wandering soul.  I grew up in Bakersfield, California and moved to Los Angeles at the wee age of eighteen.  LA has been fantastic but once I got a taste of life abroad, I couldn't seem to stay put.  Now I am currently in Portland, Oregon.

I'm a Film school dropout.  I like spending my days reading, hiking, cooking, watching movies and hanging with good company.  I'd say I'm about 70% introvert and 30% extrovert.

I've done a fair amount of Couch surfing while traveling abroad and will say that it is, hands down, my favorite thing to do.  I love meeting new people and while I know Airbnb is different, I am very excited to try it out.

Living with me (in a nutshell):  I'm quiet, clean and respectful.

name: Jessica
about: We're from Portland, OR.  I'm a labor and delivery nurse and my husband is a auto mechanic.  We love to be outdoors - biking, running, hiking, kite surfing, etc.  We also love to explore new places and meet new people!  We are tidy and considerate guests :)

name: Sung
about: I'm a photographer in the Pacific NW. Specializing in weddings, portraits and school photos. My family and I love heading to the beach, rain or shine. I love traveling to Palm Springs and Santa Barbara to visit family and soak up some sun.

name: Alex
about: I'm a music and food lover who works with computers and electronics for both employment and creative, mostly musical, projects. I'm respectful and easy to get along with.

name: Mandee
about:
I live and love Portland. I am an active young professional living in Portlandia. 

My neighborhood is extremely walking friendly and I hardly ever drive. I love getting coffee across the street at Fehrenbacher Hof, or making it at home and enjoying it on my patio. There is a Yoga studio just down the street and you'll see runners and bikers all the time. My condo is just a short walk from the Portland Farmer's Market at PSU and the famous Rose Garden.

Pubs/Bars in Goose Hollow include The Goose Hollow Inn, The Leaky Roof Pub and Oscar Drake's. I love strolling through NW 23rd for shopping. Other hot spots nearby include Casa Del Matador on NW 23rd & Quimby or Sushi at San Sai on NW 23rd & Hoyt. It's rare for me to go a month without getting a glass of (email hidden) on NW 21st & Flanders or a martini at Bartini on NW 21st & Glison. If you book a stay with me, I will send you a list of all my favorite spots! 

While you stay at my condo, it's likely that I'm vacationing abroad. Lately, I've been traveling a lot for Weddings and Bachelorette parties in getaway cities! My condo is my home and I hope that you will treat it with as much care as you would your own. Thank you for making all of my trips possible by renting out my condo.

name: Lori
about: I'm from Portland, OR and loving, learning and living with mindfulness and integrity.

name: Sally
about: We moved to Portland a couple of years ago and are so excited to share this city with visitors. Welcome!

name: Nicole
about:
I love Portland! I moved here from northern CA a few years ago and since my arrival, I've taken every opportunity to explore this great city - both urban hot spots and wild nature places. I'm an avid hiker, backpacker, traveler, yogini, and gardener. I run long, full days between work, service, and play. I like to stay busy and engaged in life. There is so much to experience, do, learn and explore!

I enjoy the company of others and love my quiet spaces too. Perhaps I'll have the chance to meet you!

name: Richard
about:
67 years old, semi-retired, have an Ayurvedic Healing business:  (URL HIDDEN) and teach Yoga and Ayurveda in yoga centers and retreats.

Also Involved in Heart IQ training, have taken Relationship Mastery training and going to the new Heart IQ retreat Center in Amsterdam, January 2016.

I am passionate about Non Violent Communication (Marshall Rosenberg) and Sociocracy  (John Buck) and supporting a Green lifestyle, I own a Tesla, love it.

I have a house in Eastern Oregon and this Apartment in Portland.  I am new to Airbnb and just posting my apartment, my first venture with Airbnb.

name: Liz
about: From Denver Colorado. Attended the University of Colorado. Currently living in Portland, OR.

name: Larry & Paula
about:
As my wife and I plan for retirement  we decided to experiment with many different activities.  The advent of Airbnb provides the perfect platform as we shift into an "empty nester" lifestyle.  We've put countless hours and sweat equity into making our home clean, unique and comfortable.  We love and embrace innovation and contemporary thinking as it fuels our hobbies.  We love cycling, travel, dancing, fly fishing and most of all real jazz, classical and R&B music to name just a few.  We look forward to meeting new folks through the Airbnb experience as hosts and guests.  

5 things we can't live without?  Family, friends, peace, love and each other!  Favorite destination?  Savannah, Georgia.  Favorite music? Earth Wind and Fire, Take 6. Bruno Mars, Cannonball Adderley and the Portland Symphony.

name: Martha
about: Originally from New Orleans. Portland, Oregon has been home for 15 years. We make Oregon Pinot and import wines from top domaines in Burgundy and Champagne. I love running, cooking, vegetable gardening, food photography, and travel.

name: Myla
about: We moved to Portland together in 2003 and have been living in this home since 2009. We've got our hands full with 2 beautiful boys under the age of 4. We're both self-employed and love to travel whenever we have the chance. Last year took us through Central America in a van! (URL HIDDEN)

name: Casie
about: I love to travel, although my husband and I have not had the chance to do much of it, except to visit family, since our daughter was born in 2011.  Before that, we lived in London for a couple of years and got to see quite a bit of Europe.  Exploring our own huge, wonderful country is next on the list, and we're getting through it bit by bit.

name: Kate
about: An adventurer who loves to travel, bicycle, run, hike, read, drink coffee and wine and eat delicious food.

name: Hive Of Industry
about:
We’re Evan and Judith, a husband-and-wife team who's pretty good at keeping busy. We tackle a lot of things together—we tend a year-round vegetable garden that we eat from, are chipping away at fixing up a little cabin in the forest, and just like everyone else, spend a lot of time at work. When we're not doing those things, we've set our sights on visiting as many National Parks as possible.

See what we’re up to on Instagram (@hiveofindustry).

name: Alexis
about: I'm originally from San Francisco, but now living in Portland, Oregon. I'm a writer and a teacher, and my husband is a writer and an editor. I love reading, watching films, going to museums, eating good food, drinking wine and of course traveling!

name: Michael & Maxine
about: We are a married couple in our mid 30's. Both originally from the east coast, we've lived out west for the last eleven years. Previous adventures have taken us around the world and back, including a recent stint in San Francisco. We couldn't be happier to be returning to the Pacific Northwest! We share our home with a charming black lab by the name of Monkey. He'll be happy to greet you, if he's welcome.

name: Sean
about: Push yourself, be hard on yourself to accomplish your goals, not on what's happened in the past. Be true to your values, and always strive to better yourself and everything you do.

name: Sala
about: I am a food blogger and food photographer. I grew up in India, and moved to the US 10 years ago.

name: Trish
about: Hi Friends, We love being ambassadors for our city! I am originally from Canada and my husband and I have travelled a lot! By far our best trips were staying with friends or friends of friends in a neighborhood. We believe it is the best way to see a city and we enjoy helping our guests learn a little more about Portland too. Feel free to let us know what kind of experience you are looking for and we will be happy to help.

name: Christopher
about:
I'm a 52 year old man who was born in Hollywood California, grew up in New Orleans and Bavaria Germany and am living gracefully now in Portland Oregon.  Alright, I really don't want to sound arrogant, but I have luckily traveled to 5 Continents, over 30 countries (who knows now with all of the 'new countries' - seriously, I have NO clue anymore!!) and 45 of our 50 States (sans Vermont, New Hampshire, Maine, Rhode Island & Alaska) - yet sadly, as of 2012, have become permanently disabled. Now my 'Bucket List' is officially beginning!!!
Cheers...

name: Shinya
about:
Welcome! 
Living in Portland downtown, working in advertising agency.
Always happy to help you, when you come to Portland or Tokyo.

name: Amy
about:
a very easy going person that loves to laugh, cook, listening to music, outdoor activities and gardening. I'm one of those gym rats !  











I'm 5'2 Filipino Hawaiian, my passions are music like jazz, blues,raggae and the 80's. I work out 3 times a week and go hiking on weekends and go snowboarding during winter of which Im still (URL HIDDEN) other passions are cooking and gardenning. I got lots of friends and I'm easy to get along with..Athletic..

name: Kojo
about: We live in Portland, OR, but lived in Hawaii (North Shore) for 4 years before settling in Portland. I am a Chinese teacher and my wife is from Japan, which means our son is juggling 3 languages. Interests include traveling, cooking, (and eating good food), hiking, and other outdoor activities.

name: Martha
about:
Welcome! I'm a busy self-employed professional that enjoys outdoor adventures in this Pacific Northwest wonderland. I like listing my home on AirBnb when I'm away so others can enjoy this great launching spot for the Stumptown experience.
Enjoy your trip here!

name: Alan
about:
Hi! I am finally getting the chance to travel and am loving it. I grew up in the States. I am a web developer and help small businesses with digital marketing. I have a great set of friends in Portland, Oregon. I enjoy traveling, obviously, philosophy, tennis, snow skiing, chess, reading/writing, making music, working with kids, camping, and many other things. I'm a very clean and simple person when it comes to living. My purpose for this trip is to have a positive effect on each person I meet. And to learn about other cultures by building relationships.

My motto? Do unto others as you would have them do unto you!

name: Nina And Donald
about: My wife and I met while doing medical relief work in Indonesia in 2006. We now have two beautiful baby girls. We enjoy hiking, biking, gardening and just being outside as much as possible.

name: Alison
about: Alison, Portland OR

name: Julia
about: Originally from Pennsylvania, I developed an appreciation of culture at an early age. It has taken me around the globe to England, Spain, Syria, Cuba, Brazil, South Africa, Kenya, India, Malaysia, Hong Kong, China, and Japan. Now living in my adopted state of Oregon with my El Paso-born husband and our two young children, I enjoy cultural activities a little closer to home in the form of  supporting the local music and arts scene (thanks in part to my musician husband, Jacob), DIY-ing, biking, exploring the beautiful Northwest, and hosting family and friends.

name: Benedicta
about:
I am a Waldorf elementary school teacher.  I live on an organic farm with dairy goats, chickens and family.  I have 3 beautiful children and a musician for a husband.

I rarely travel because I don't like to fly.  I also don't like hotels where all you can smell on the sheets is bleach or fabric softener.  

I love good food and spend most of my money on supporting organic farms.

name: Lila
about: I hope to provide a comfortable and pleasant stay for those who wish to stay in our home.

name: Johanna
about: We are a family of four living and loving Portland.  We love to travel and almost always use airbnb to book our places to stay!  We have 2 cats that we miss when traveling and hope that our guests give them lots of love!

name: Phillip
about:
born and raised in SLC. Now going on 15 years here in portland. I own this home I'm inviting you in and have lived here for 8 years. LOVE it and it's location. it's very unique and special to me.

by day I maintain AppleComponents, a website I own, operate and built from the ground up. by night I'm a karaoke junkie who will soon be opening his own karaoke bar :)

outside of the day to day I travel whenever possible! whether it's touring or just vacationing, I try to get out as much as possible. been to south america, SE asia, europe, canada, and extensively throughout the US. my next big adventure will be going to africa, which I'm super excited for!

name: Simon
about: I grew up in Beaverton and now live in Portland. I try to live an active lifestyle. I enjoy hiking, running and traveling. I love playing sports and I am a big Blazers fan. I also enjoy trying new restaurants in Portland.

name: John
about: We're a young couple from Portland, OR and have lived here for almost 10 years. We're active and enjoy everything Oregon has to offer. We love to surf, camp, hike and hunt for mushrooms.

name: Debbie
about: Sequential thinker and planner.  Fun.  Sees what needs to be done and willing to do it.  I appreciate kindness and humor.  Love traveling and prefer to stay out of chain lodging.  Hard to name favorite trip but perhaps Greece?  Croatia?  Slovenia?  Vietnam?  See- it's hard!  Love cycling trips but dislike spin class.  Still playing raquetball.  Co-founder of the GLBT network at Nike back-in-the-day.

name: Debra
about: A fine wine sales professional. A mother of two almost adult children. A cyclist and Eco concerned parent. And wife. Tidy clean and compassionate.

name: Christiana
about:
Hi, My name is Christiana and I am an artist and traveler. I've been following my art studies around the world the last few years.  I love learning about different cultures, drinking copious amounts of coffee, painting, drawing, and meeting other interesting inhabitants of this big beautiful world of ours. 

 I'm in my late twenties, down to earth, clean, kind, and respectful.

name: Shawn
about:
I'm a Portland-based creative director, graphic designer and design educator. I received my BFA in graphic design from California College of the Arts in San Francisco before moving to Portland in 2007.

I'm also a father of a wonderful almost 7 year old.

name: Tressa
about:
Hello, I am an adventurous chef, educator and kind soul who really enjoys meeting people and hearing their stories. I love all things related to traditional foods and folklore. I prefer home-made and relish unique experiences. I love to read, hike, do yoga, SUP, sailing, forage for wild foods, snowboard, write, laugh, discover new scents, learn about new things and otherwise live moments to their fullest. I believe in being the change you want to see happening in the world and strive to be respectful, share and show compassion to all things

Favorite Cookbooks: Sloe Gin & Beeswax, the Pleasures of Slow Food, Aphrodite

Favorite Poets: Joy Harjo, Neruda, Mary Oliver, Mina Loy, Gluck, Whitman
